hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית בְּשָׁלֹשׁ דְּרָכִים, וְקוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בִּשְׁתֵּי דְרָכִים. נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף, בִּשְׁטָר, וּבְבִיאָה. בְּכֶסֶף: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים בְּדִינָר וּבְשָׁוֶה דִּינָר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בִּפְרוּטָה וּבְשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. וְכַמָּה הִיא פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשְּׁמֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי.
human_translation: A woman is acquired in three ways, and she acquires herself, in two ways. She is acquired through money, through a document, and through sexual intercourse. through money, Beit Shammai say with one dinar or with worth one dinar. And Beit Hillel say: with one peruta , or with worth one peruta . And how much is one peruta , one-eighth of the Italian issar ,
llm_translation: The woman is acquired in three ways, and acquires herself in two ways. She is acquired with money, with a document, and with intercourse. With money: Beit Shammai say with a dinar or with the value of a dinar, and Beit Hillel say: with the smallest coin and with the value of the smallest coin. And how much is the smallest coin? - One out of eight in the Italian asar.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בְּגֵט וּבְמִיתַת הַבַּעַל. הַיְּבָמָה נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה, וְקוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בַּחֲלִיצָה וּבְמִיתַת הַיָּבָם.
human_translation: And acquires herself through a bill of divorce or through the death of the husband. A woman whose husband, who had a brother, died childless [ yevama acquired through intercourse. And she acquires herself, through ḥalitza or through the death of the yavam .
llm_translation: And she acquires herself in a bill of divorce and in the death of the husband. The yevamah is acquired through intercourse, and she acquires herself in halitzah and in the death of the yavam.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָאִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית. מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּתָנֵי ״הָאִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּתָנֵי ״הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ״? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי כֶּסֶף,
human_translation: a woman acquired What is different here that teaches: A woman is acquired, and what is different there, which teaches: A man betroths, because he wanted to teach money,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Gemar ha'isha nikneit. Mai sh'na ha'ka d'tanei 'ha'isha nikneit', u'mai sh'na hatam d'tanei 'ha'ish mekadesh'? Mishum d'ka ba'i l'mitnei kesef." Translation: "The status of a woman is acquired. What is different here that it teaches 'the woman is acquired,' and what is different there that it teaches 'the man sanctifies'? Because it requires money to be given."

hebrew_text: וְכֶסֶף מְנָא לַן – גָּמַר ״קִיחָה״ ״קִיחָה״ מִשְּׂדֵה עֶפְרוֹן. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״נָתַתִּי כֶּסֶף הַשָּׂדֶה קַח מִמֶּנִּי״,
human_translation: And from where do we money? derived taking from taking the field of Ephron. It is written here, “When a man takes a woman” and it is written there, “I will give money for the field; take it from me”
llm_translation: "And silver is with us - he concluded 'purchase.' 'Purchase' from the field of Ephron. It is written here: 'When a man takes a wife,' and it is written there: 'I have given the money for the field, take it from me.'"

hebrew_text: וְקִיחָה אִיקְּרִי ״קִנְיָן״, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַשָּׂדֶה אֲשֶׁר קָנָה אַבְרָהָם״.
human_translation: And taking is called an acquisition as it is written “The field which Abraham acquired”
llm_translation: And the acquisition is called "kinyan," as it is written: "the field that Abraham bought."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, ״שָׂדוֹת בַּכֶּסֶף יִקְנוּ״, תָּנֵי ״הָאִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית״.
human_translation: Alternatively, “They shall acquire fields with money” he taught: A woman is acquired.
llm_translation: If they say, "Fields with money they shall acquire," it was taught: "The woman is acquired."

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנֵי הָתָם ״הָאִישׁ קוֹנֶה״! מֵעִיקָּרָא תָּנֵי לִישָּׁנָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּלְבַסּוֹף תָּנֵי לִישָּׁנָא דְרַבָּנַן, וּמַאי לִישָּׁנָא דְרַבָּנַן? – דְּאָסַר לַהּ אַכּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: But let teach there, A man acquires. Initially, taught the language of the Torah, And ultimately, it taught the language of the Sages. And what language of the Sages? that renders her forbidden to everyone like consecrated
llm_translation: And it is taught there, "the man acquires"! Initially it teaches for the repetition of the Torah, and in the end it teaches for the repetition of the Rabbis, and what is the repetition of the Rabbis? - That he prohibited her from eating regular food like consecrated items.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנֵי הָכָא ״הָאִישׁ קוֹנֶה״! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנָא סֵיפָא: ״וְקוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ״ בְּדִידַהּ, תְּנָא נָמֵי רֵישָׁא בְּדִידַהּ.
human_translation: And let it teach here, A man acquires. because wanted to teach the latter clause And she acquires herself, with regard to her. also taught with regard to her the first clause.
llm_translation: And it is taught here, "the man acquires"! Because it wants to teach the continuation: "and acquires herself" on her own, a Tanna also taught at the beginning on its own.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנֵי ״הָאִישׁ קוֹנֶה וּמַקְנֶה״! מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא מִיתַת הַבַּעַל, דְּלָאו אִיהוּ קָא מַקְנֵי – מִן שְׁמַיָּא הוּא דְּמַקְנִי לָהּ.
human_translation: But Let it teach: The man can acquire and transfer because there is the husband’s death, in it is not he who transfers it is from Heaven that is transferred to her.
llm_translation: "And it is taught: 'The husband acquires and transfers!' Because there is the death of the husband, for he is not the one acquiring – it is from heaven that he acquires for her."

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִי תְּנָא ״קוֹנֶה״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ – תְּנָא ״הָאִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית״, דְּמִדַּעְתָּהּ – אִין, שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ – לָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say If taught: acquires I would say even against her will, taught: The woman is acquired, that with her consent, yes, when without her consent, no,
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: If a Tanna says "acquires," I would say even against her will - a Tanna says "a woman is acquired," if with her knowledge - yes, if without her knowledge - no.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״שָׁלֹשׁ״? לִיתְנֵי ״שְׁלֹשָׁה״! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי ״דֶּרֶךְ״ וְ״דֶרֶךְ״ לְשׁוֹן נְקֵבָה הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּ לָהֶם אֶת הַדֶּרֶךְ יֵלְכוּ בָהּ״.
human_translation: And why does specifically teach: Three [ shalosh ] Let it teach: Three [ shelosha ] because it wants to teach way [ derekh ], and derekh is formulated feminine, as it is written: “And you shall show them the way [ derekh ] in which [ bah ] they must walk”
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And what is the reason that it teaches "three"? It should teach "three (masculine)"! Because it needs to teach "way" and "way" is a feminine language, as it is written: "And you shall instruct them in the way they shall go."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״בְּשִׁבְעָה דְּרָכִים בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הַזָּב״, נִיתְנֵי ״שֶׁבַע״! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי ״דֶּרֶךְ״, וְאַשְׁכְּחַן ״דֶּרֶךְ״ דְּאִיקְּרִי לְשׁוֹן זָכָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶחָד יֵצְאוּ אֵלֶיךָ וּבְשִׁבְעָה דְרָכִים יָנוּסוּ לְפָנֶיךָ״. אִי הָכִי, קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי! וְקַשְׁיָא נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: But that which is taught One examines a zav in seven [ shiva ] ways [ derakhim ], let it teach: Seven [ sheva ] because it wanted to teach: Derekh , and we find derekh is referred to masculine form, as it is written: “They shall come out against you one way [ derekh ], and shall flee before you seven [ shiva ] ways” If so, the verses contradict each other, And the mishnayot contradict each other,
llm_translation: And rather, this that it was taught: "In seven ways one examines the zav," it should have said "seven"! Because it wanted to teach "way," and we find "way" that specifically denotes the masculine gender, as it is written: "By one way they will come out to you, but by seven ways they will flee before you." If so, the verses contradict each other! And the Mishnahs also contradict each other!

hebrew_text: קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי לָא קַשְׁיָין: הָכָא, דִּבְתוֹרָה קָאֵי, וְתוֹרָה אִיקְּרִי לְשׁוֹן נְקֵבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״תּוֹרַת ה׳ תְּמִימָה מְשִׁיבַת נָפֶשׁ״ – כָּתַב לָהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן נְקֵבָה. הָתָם, דִּבְמִלְחָמָה קָאֵי, דְּדַרְכּוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ לַעֲשׂוֹת מִלְחָמָה וְאֵין דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה לַעֲשׂוֹת מִלְחָמָה – כָּתַב לָהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן זָכָר.
human_translation: The verses do not contradict each other. Here, is referring to the Torah, and Torah is referred to feminine form, as it is written: “The Torah of the Lord is perfect [ temima ], restoring the soul” writes: formulated feminine. There, that is referring to war, as it is the way of a man to wage war and it is not the way of a woman to wage war, writes formulated masculine.
llm_translation: The verses of Ahadadei are not difficult. Here, where it stands in the Torah, and Torah is called a feminine language, as it is written: "The Torah of the Lord is perfect, restoring the soul" - it was written in a feminine language. There, where it stands in matters of war, for it is the way of a man to engage in war, and it is not the way of a woman to engage in war - it was written in a masculine language.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין אַהֲדָדֵי לָא קַשְׁיָין: הָכָא, דִּלְגַבֵּי אִשָּׁה קָאֵי – קָתָנֵי לַהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן נְקֵבָה. הָתָם, דִּלְגַבֵּי אִישׁ קָאֵי, דְּדַרְכּוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ לִיבָּדֵק וְאֵין דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה לִיבָּדֵק, דְּהָא אִשָּׁה נָמֵי בְּאוֹנֶס מִיטַּמְּאָהּ – תָּנֵי לְשׁוֹן זָכָר.
human_translation: mishnayot do not contradict each other: Here, where it is referring to a woman, the mishna teaches formulated feminine. There, where it is referring to a man, as common for a man to undergo an examination but it is not common for a woman to undergo an examination, since, a woman is rendered impure even by circumstances beyond control, it taught formulated masculine.
llm_translation: Mishna: Adadei la kashyain. Haka, dilgabei isha ka'ei - katanai la bilsheon nekevah. Hatam, dilgabei ish ka'ei, de'darko shel ish libadek ve'ein darkaha shel isha libadek, deha isha namei be'ones mitma'ah - tanai leshon zachar. Translation: Mishna: They are not difficult to reconcile. Here, where it is regarding a woman - it teaches in the language of female. There, where it is regarding a man, since the way of a man is to inspect and the way of a woman is not to inspect, for a woman is also coerced, it teaches in the language of male.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא תָּנֵי ״שָׁלֹשׁ״ – מִשּׁוּם ״דְּרָכִים״? נִיתְנֵי ״דְּבָרִים״ וְנִיתְנֵי ״שְׁלֹשָׁה״! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי ״בִּיאָה״, וּבִיאָה אִיקְּרִי ״דֶּרֶךְ״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְדֶרֶךְ גֶּבֶר בְּעַלְמָה כֵּן דֶּרֶךְ אִשָּׁה מְנָאָפֶת״.
human_translation: What is the reason teaches: Three [ shalosh ], because Ways. But let it teach Matters, and let it teach three [ shelosha ], because it wanted to teach intercourse and intercourse is called a way as it is written: “And the way of a man with a young woman, so is the way of an adulterous woman”
llm_translation: What is the reason that it teaches "three" - because of "ways"? It could have taught "things" and it could have taught "three"! Because they established to teach "intercourse," and intercourse is called "way," as it is written: "And the way of a man with a maiden, so is the way of a woman who commits adultery."

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח ״בִּיאָה״, ״כֶּסֶף״ וּ״שְׁטָר״ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מִשּׁוּם ״בִּיאָה״.
human_translation: This works out well intercourse, what is there to say money and a document? Because intercourse,
llm_translation: This is the case of "bi'ah," "kesef," and "shetar," what is there to say? Because of "bi'ah."

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי אַטּוּ חֲדָא? הָנָךְ נָמֵי צוֹרֶךְ בִּיאָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And teach two due to one? These, too, are for the sake of sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: And he taught two, but is it not one? Here, it is necessary for intercourse they are.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה״, וְלֹא כָּתַב ״כִּי תִּלָּקַח אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ״? – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ לְחַזֵּר עַל אִשָּׁה וְאֵין דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה לְחַזֵּר עַל אִישׁ. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ אֲבֵידָה – מִי חוֹזֵר עַל מִי? בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה מְחַזֵּר עַל אֲבֵידָתוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: For what did the Torah say: “When a man takes a woman” and did not write: “When a woman is taken by a man? Because it is the way [ derekh ] of a man to pursue a woman, and it is not the way of a woman to pursue a man. a parable of a man who lost an item. Who searches for what? the owner of the lost item searches for his lost item,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This is the teaching of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: Why did the Torah say, "When a man takes a wife," and not write, "When a woman is taken by a man"? Because it is the way of a man to pursue a woman, but it is not the way of a woman to pursue a man. It is analogous to a person who lost an item - who pursues whom? The owner of the lost item pursues his lost item.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: ״בְּשִׁבְעָה דְּרָכִים בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הַזָּב״, לִיתְנֵי ״דְּבָרִים״! הָתָם הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּדַרְכָּא דְּמֵיכְלָא יַתִּירָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי לִידֵי זִיבָה, וְדַרְכָּא דְּמִישְׁתְּיָא יַתִּירָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי לִידֵי זִיבָה.
human_translation: But that which we learned One examines a zav in seven ways, Let it teach Matters. there teaches us this that it is the way of excessive eating to lead to ziva , and it is the way of excessive drinking to lead to ziva .
llm_translation: And this that we learned: "In seven ways one examines the zav," should it not teach "things"! There, it is teaching us that the way of eating more will lead to causing emissions, and the way of drinking more will lead to causing emissions.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: ״אֶתְרוֹג שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים״, לִיתְנֵי ״דְּבָרִים״! מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵינַן מִתְנֵי סֵיפָא: ״וְלַיָּרָק בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶחָד״. סֵיפָא נָמֵי, נִיתְנֵי ״דָּבָר״!
human_translation: And that which we learned an etrog correspond to a tree in three ways. Let it teach matters. Because it wants to teach in latter clause: And to a vegetable in one way, latter clause too, let teach: Matter,
llm_translation: And this that we learned: "An etrog is equal to a tree in three ways," it should teach "things"! Because we need to learn the end: "And for vegetables in one way." The end also, it should teach "a thing"!

hebrew_text: הָתָם הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּדַרְכֵּיהּ דְּאֶתְרוֹג כְּיָרָק – מָה יָרָק דַּרְכּוֹ לִיגְדַּל עַל כׇּל מַיִם וּבִשְׁעַת לְקִיטָתוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ, אַף אֶתְרוֹג דַּרְכּוֹ לִיגְדַּל עַל כׇּל מַיִם וּבִשְׁעַת לְקִיטָתוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ.
human_translation: There, teaches us this, that way an etrog like a vegetable: Just as it is the way of a vegetable to grow by all water, and its tithing is according to when it is harvested, so too, it is the way of an etrog to grow by all water, and its tithing is according to the time when it is harvested.
llm_translation: There, this is what we heard, that the way of a citron is like that of a vegetable - just as the vegetable's way is to grow over all waters, and at the time of its plucking, its fragrance increases, so too the citron's way is to grow over all waters, and at the time of its plucking, its fragrance increases.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: ״כּוֹי – יֵשׁ בּוֹ דְּרָכִים שָׁוֶה לַחַיָּה, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ דְּרָכִים שָׁוֶה לַבְּהֵמָה, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ דְּרָכִים שָׁוֶה לַחַיָּה וְלַבְּהֵמָה, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ דְּרָכִים שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה לֹא לַחַיָּה וְלֹא לַבְּהֵמָה״. נִיתְנֵי ״דְּבָרִים״! וְתוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: ״זוֹ אַחַת מִן הַדְּרָכִים שֶׁשָּׁווּ גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים לְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים״, נִיתְנֵי ״דְּבָרִים״!
human_translation: But that which we learned a koy , there are ways, in correspond to a non-domesticated animal and there are ways in correspond to a domesticated animal. And there are ways in correspond to a non-domesticated animal and a domesticated animal, and there are ways in correspond to neither a non-domesticated animal nor a domesticated animal. Let teach Matters. And furthermore, that which we learned This is one of the ways in which bills of divorce correspond to manumission, let teach Matters.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this that we learned: "A koi - it has ways similar to a wild animal, and it has ways similar to a domestic animal, and it has ways that are similar to both a wild animal and a domestic animal, and it has ways that are not similar to either a wild animal or a domestic animal." It was taught in "Devarim"! And come, this that we learned: "This is one of the ways that women's documents of manumission are similar," it was taught in "Devarim"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא פְּלוּגְתָּא תָּנֵי ״דְּרָכִים״, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא פְּלוּגְתָּא תָּנֵי ״דְּבָרִים״. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֶתְרוֹג שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן לְכׇל דָּבָר״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, anywhere that there is a distinction teaches Ways, And anywhere that there is no distinction it teaches Matters. is also precise as it teaches in the latter clause Rabbi Eliezer says: an etrog correspond to a tree with regard to every matter. Learn from
llm_translation: Rather, wherever there is a dispute, it teaches "ways," and wherever there is no dispute, it teaches "things." This is specifically stated in the latter part: "Rabbi Eliezer says: An etrog is equal to a tree in every respect." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מִנְיָינָא דְרֵישָׁא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי, מִנְיָינָא דְסֵיפָא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: the number in the first clause to exclude what? the number in the latter clause to exclude what?
llm_translation: The count of the first clause to exclude what, the count of the last clause to exclude what?

hebrew_text: מִנְיָינָא דְרֵישָׁא – לְמַעוֹטֵי חוּפָּה. וּלְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר חוּפָּה קוֹנָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר, לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: The number in the first clause to exclude canopy, And according to Rav Huna, who said: canopy acquires by an a fortiori to exclude what?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The count of the first - to exclude a fence. And according to Rav Huna, who said a fence acquires through a logical inference, to exclude what?

hebrew_text: לְמַעוֹטֵי חֲלִיפִין. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וְגָמַר ״קִיחָה״ ״קִיחָה״ מִשְּׂדֵה עֶפְרוֹן – מָה שָׂדֶה מִקַּנְיָא בַּחֲלִיפִין, אַף אִשָּׁה נָמֵי מִקַּנְיָא בַּחֲלִיפִין, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: to exclude exchange, enter your mind to say since derive taking from taking the field of Ephron, just as a field can be acquired through exchange, so too, a woman can be acquired through exchange. teaches us
llm_translation: Regarding the exchange of fields. Your mind has come to say, since it has completed "a field" "a field" from the field of Ephron - just as a field is included in exchanges, so too a woman is also included in exchanges, this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! חֲלִיפִין אִיתַנְהוּ בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְאִשָּׁה בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה
human_translation: And say so too, exchange is using less than the value of one peruta , and with less than the value of one peruta , a woman
llm_translation: And why not say thus: garments are given to them for less than the value of a perutah, and a woman for less than the value of a perutah.

hebrew_text: לָא מַקְנְיָא נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: does not render herself acquired
llm_translation: Not acquired his soul.

hebrew_text: מִנְיָינָא דְסֵיפָא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי – לְמַעוֹטֵי חֲלִיצָה. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תֵּיתֵי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיְּבָמָה, מָה יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט – יוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה, זוֹ, שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה? קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The number in the latter clause to exclude what? to exclude ḥalitza , enter your mind to say can be derived through an a fortiori from a yevama , Just as a yevama , who is not released through a bill of divorce, is released through ḥalitza , this who can be released through a bill of divorce, is it not logical that she can be released through ḥalitza ? teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The count of the latter clause to exclude what - to exclude halitzah. Is it your opinion that I say: Bring a fortiori argument from yibum, just as yibum, which does not go out with a bill of divorce - goes out with halitzah, this one, which goes out with a bill of divorce - is it not logical that it should go out with halitzah? This teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! אָמַר קְרָא: ״סֵפֶר כְּרִיתֻת״ – סֵפֶר כּוֹרְתָהּ, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר כּוֹרְתָהּ.
human_translation: And say so too, The verse states “A scroll of severance” A scroll, severs her and nothing else severs her
llm_translation: And why not say it like this! The verse says: "a bill of divorcement" - a bill that cuts her off, and there is no other matter that cuts her off.

hebrew_text: בְּכֶסֶף. מְנָא לַן? וְתוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: ״הָאָב זַכַּאי בְּבִתּוֹ בְּקִדּוּשֶׁיהָ, בְּכֶסֶף בִּשְׁטָר וּבְבִיאָה״, מְנָלַן דְּמִיקַּנְיָא בְּכֶסֶף, וְכֶסֶף דַּאֲבוּהּ הוּא?
human_translation: with money. From where do we And furthermore, that which we learned A father has authority his daughter with regard to her betrothal, through money, through a document, or through sexual intercourse, from where do we that is acquired with money, and money is her father’s?
llm_translation: In silver. From where do we derive this? And come, this that we learned: "If a father betroths his daughter with her consent, with silver, with a document, and with intercourse," from where do we derive that it is acquired with silver, and is it the father's silver?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם אֵין כָּסֶף״ – אֵין כֶּסֶף לְאָדוֹן זֶה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ כֶּסֶף לְאָדוֹן אַחֵר. וּמַאן נִיהוּ – אָב.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: that the verse states “Then shall she go out for nothing, without money” there is no money for this master, but there is money for a different master, And who is father.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: As the verse says, "And she shall go out for nothing, there is no money" - there is no money for this master, but there is money for another master. And who is the other? - A father.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְדִידַהּ! הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! אָבִיהָ מְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה״, וְאִיהִי שָׁקְלָה כַּסְפָּא?!
human_translation: But say to her? How can this? Her father receives her betrothal, as it is written: “I gave my daughter to this man” and she take the money?
llm_translation: And why not according to our view! Is it not so now?! Her father accepts her betrothal, as it is written: "I have given my daughter to this man," and she has taken the money?!

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי קְטַנָּה, דְּלֵית לַהּ יָד לְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשִׁין, אֲבָל נַעֲרָה, דְּאִית לַהּ יָד לְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשִׁין – תְּקַדֵּישׁ אִיהִי נַפְשָׁהּ וְתִשְׁקוֹל כַּסְפָּא! אָמַר קְרָא: ״בִּנְעֻרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״ – כׇּל שֶׁבַח נְעוּרִים לְאָבִיהָ.
human_translation: But say this applies a minor girl, as she does not have the power to receive betrothal. But a young woman, who does have the power to receive betrothal, let her betroth herself and take the money. the verse states: “Being in her youth, in her father’s house” Any profit youth to her father.
llm_translation: And why these matters of a minor girl, who does not have the capacity to accept betrothal, but a young woman, who does have the capacity to accept betrothal - let her sanctify herself and receive payment! The verse says: "In her youth, in her father's house" - all praise of youth is to her father.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה הַבַּת לָאָב? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִי יִמְכֹּר אִישׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְאָמָה״, מָה אָמָה מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְרַבָּהּ – אַף בַּת נָמֵי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְאָבִיהָ. תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״בִּנְעֻרֶיהָ בֵּית אָבִיהָ״!
human_translation: But that which Rav Huna says Rav says: From where that the earnings of a daughter, to father? As it is stated: “And if a man sells his daughter as a maidservant” Just as maidservant, her earnings to her master, so too, a daughter, her earnings to her father. Let him derive from “being in her youth, in her father’s house,”
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the daughter's actions are attributed to the father? As it is stated: "And if a man sells his daughter to be a maidservant," just as the maidservant's actions are attributed to her master – so too, the daughter's actions are attributed to her father. Let her go out from "her youth, from her father's house"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב. הָכִי נָמֵי, בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב. וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִינֵּיהּ – מָמוֹנָא מֵאִיסּוּרָא לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, that is written with regard to the nullification of vows, so too, is written with regard to the nullification of vows And if you would say: Let us derive from We do not derive monetary matters from ritual matters.
llm_translation: Rather, it is written regarding the annulment of vows. So it is indeed, it is written regarding the annulment of vows. And if you were to say we should derive from it - we do not derive monetary matters from matters of prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִקְּנָסָא – מָמוֹנָא מִקְּנָסָא לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from fines, We do not derive monetary matters from fines,
llm_translation: And if you say, "We should deduct from the fine - we do not deduct money from the fine."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִבּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם – שָׁאנֵי בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם דַּאֲבוּהּ שָׁיֵיךְ בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from humiliation and degradation humiliation and degradation different, as her father has an interest in them.
llm_translation: And if you will say, let us switch from "boshet" to "pegam" - the shame and blemish of his father is fitting for their disgrace.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּכִי קָא מְמַעֵט –
human_translation: Rather, it is reasonable that when excludes
llm_translation: Rather, it is logical that he is diminishing -

hebrew_text: יְצִיאָה דִּכְווֹתַהּ קָא מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: it excludes a departure like it,
llm_translation: The exit of its intestines is diminishing.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא דָּמְיָא הַאי יְצִיאָה לְהַאי יְצִיאָה, הָתָם נָפְקָא לַהּ מֵרְשׁוּת אָדוֹן לִגְמָרֵי, וְהָכָא אַכַּתִּי מִיחַסְּרָא מְסִירָה לְחוּפָּה! בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים מִיהָא נָפְקָא לַהּ מֵרְשׁוּתֵיהּ. דִּתְנַן: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה אָבִיהָ וּבַעְלָהּ מְפִירִין נְדָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: But this departure is not similar to that departure, there, she leaves the authority of the master entirely and here, she still lacks passing to the canopy. she leaves authority at least as the nullification of vows As we learned a betrothed young woman, her father and her husband nullify her vows,
llm_translation: The text: "And this is not comparable, this exit to that exit, there it went out from the domain of the master completely, and here it is only lacking a handbreadth! In the annulment of vows, it went out from her domain. As we learned: A betrothed maiden, her father and her husband annul her vows." I hope this translation is helpful to you.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הָא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם״ – אֵלּוּ יְמֵי בַּגְרוּת, ״אֵין כָּסֶף״ – אֵלּוּ יְמֵי נַעֲרוּת.
human_translation: But this “Then shall she go out for nothing” come for that But it is required for that which is taught As it is taught “Then shall she go out for nothing”; these are the days of adulthood, “Without money [ ein kasef ]”; these are the days of youth,
llm_translation: And this "and she shall go out for nothing," for this is the reason it came? This, for he wants to establish it according to the teaching, as it was taught: "and she shall go out for nothing" - these are the days of maturity, "there is no silver" - these are the days of youth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״אֵן כָּסֶף״. מַאי ״אֵין כָּסֶף״ – אֵין כֶּסֶף לְאָדוֹן זֶה אֲבָל יֵשׁ כֶּסֶף לְאָדוֹן אַחֵר, וּמַאן נִיהוּ – אָב.
human_translation: Ravina said: If so, let the verse say: En kasef , What Ein kasef ? There is no money for this master, but there is money for a different master. And who is he? father,
llm_translation: Ravina said: If so, let us say the verse "There is no silver." What is "There is no silver"? - There is no silver for this master, but there is silver for another master, and who is he? - Av.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּדָרְשִׁינַן הָכִי – דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״
human_translation: And from where one interprets homiletically this As it is taught “And she has no child,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive this? As it was taught: "And she has no offspring."

hebrew_text: – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זַרְעָהּ. זֶרַע זַרְעָהּ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״זֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״ – עַיֵּין לָהּ. וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא זֶרַע כָּשֵׁר. זֶרַע פָּסוּל מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״זֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״ – עַיֵּין לָהּ.
human_translation: I have only her children. From where her children’s children The verse states: “She has no [ ein lah ] child,” one examines her [ ayyein lah ] And I have only children unflawed From where children flawed The verse states: “She has no child,” one examines her,
llm_translation: I have nothing except its seed. From where is the seed of its seed? The Torah says, "It has no seed" - we examine it. And I have nothing except valid seed. From where is the invalid seed? The Torah says, "It has no seed" - we examine it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְזֶרַע זַרְעָהּ! זֶרַע זַרְעָהּ לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא, דִּבְנֵי בָנִים הֲרֵי הֵן כְּבָנִים. כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא – לְזֶרַע פָּסוּל.
human_translation: But you have derived her children’s children a verse was not necessary her children’s children, as children’s children are like children. when the verse was necessary, for children flawed
llm_translation: And this, she has produced seed for another! For the seed of another, a verse is not necessary, as the sons of sons are considered like sons. When a verse is necessary – it is for disqualified seed.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלֵיהּ דְּדָרֵישׁ הָכִי? אָמְרִי: כְּתִיב ״מֵאֵן בִּלְעָם״ וּ״מֵאֵן יְבָמִי״, דְּלָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ יוֹד. וְהָכָא, כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ יוֹד – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִדְרָשָׁא הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the tanna himself, from where does he that can expound this They say written: “Balaam refuses [ me’en ]” and “My yavam refuses [ me’en ]” in neither is a yod written. And here is written with a yod . Learn from it that comes an exposition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a Tanna taught: From where do we derive that one should expound thus? They said: It is written "from Bilaam" and "from Yevami," as it is not written with a vav. And here, it is written with a vav - infer from it that it is for expounding that it came.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ לְאָבִיהָ, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְאָבִיהָ. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ לְאָבִיהָ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא טָרְחָא בְּהוּ, אֲבָל מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ דְּקָא טָרְחָא בְּהוּ אֵימָא דִּידַהּ הָווּ.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write her betrothal, to her father, and it was necessary to write her earnings to her father, As, if the Merciful One had written her betrothal to her father, I would say because she did not toil for it But her earnings, for which she toiled, say they are hers.
llm_translation: And it is necessary to write her betrothal for her father, and it is necessary to write the work of her hands for her father. For if the Merciful One wrote her betrothal for her father, I would say it is because she did not trouble herself with it, but the work of her hands, in which she did trouble herself, I would say it is hers.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, דְּקָא מִתַּזְנָא מִינֵּיהּ, אֲבָל קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ דְּמֵעָלְמָא קָאָתֵי לַהּ אֵימָא דִּידַהּ הָווּ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us her earnings, that is sustained by him But her betrothal, which comes to her from an external say it is hers. necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear of the work of her hands, that she is committing adultery with heretics, but her betrothal from the world is valid, we say that her betrothal is valid.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם״ – אֵלּוּ יְמֵי בַּגְרוּת, ״אֵין כֶּסֶף״ – אֵלּוּ יְמֵי נַעֲרוּת. וְלִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא נַעֲרוּת, וְלָא בָּעֵי בַּגְרוּת!
human_translation: the itself: “Then shall she go out for nothing,” these are the days of adulthood; “without money,” these are the days of youth. And let the Merciful One write youth, and it would not be necessary adulthood.
llm_translation: Body: "And she shall go out for nothing" - these are the days of maturity, "there is no silver" - these are the days of youth. And to write, the Merciful One desires youth, and does not desire maturity!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: בָּא זֶה וְלִמֵּד עַל זֶה.
human_translation: Rabba says: This comes and teaches about that
llm_translation: Rabba said: "This one came and taught about this one."

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַתּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר. דְּתַנְיָא: ״תּוֹשָׁב״ – זֶה קָנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם, ״שָׂכִיר״ – זֶה קָנוּי קִנְיַן שָׁנִים.
human_translation: just as it is a tenant and a hired worker. As it is taught “A tenant”; this who has been acquired as a permanent acquisition, “A hired worker”; this acquired for an acquisition of years,
llm_translation: From the time he becomes a resident and a hired worker. As it was taught: "Resident" - this is a term for acquiring permanent ownership, "hired worker" - this is a term for acquiring temporary ownership.

hebrew_text: יֵאָמֵר ״תּוֹשָׁב״ וְלֹא יֵאָמֵר ״שָׂכִיר״, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: קָנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, קָנוּי קִנְיַן שָׁנִים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Let say “tenant” and let it not say “hired worker,” and I say: as a permanent acquisition does not partake not all the more so one who is acquired for an acquisition of years
llm_translation: It shall be said "resident" and not "hireling," and I say: An acquired acquisition does not eat, an acquired acquisition for two years, all the more so?

hebrew_text: אִילּוּ כֵּן, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: ״תּוֹשָׁב״ – זֶה קָנוּי קִנְיַן שָׁנִים. אֲבָל קְנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם – אוֹכֵל. בָּא ״שָׂכִיר״ וְלִימֵּד עַל ״תּוֹשָׁב״, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁקָּנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם – אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: If so, I would say: “A tenant”; this is one who was acquired for an acquisition of years, But one who was acquired as a permanent acquisition may partake “hired worker,” comes and teaches about “tenant,” that even if was acquired as a permanent acquisition he may not partake
llm_translation: If so, I would say: "Resident" - this is a nickname for acquiring years. But a nickname for acquiring eternity - he eats. A "hireling" came and taught regarding "resident," that even though the nickname for acquiring eternity - he does not eat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם תְּרֵי גוּפֵי נִינְהוּ, דְּכִי נָמֵי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״תּוֹשָׁב נִרְצָע לֹא יֹאכַל״ וַהֲדַר כְּתַב אִידַּךְ, הֲוָה שָׂכִיר מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Are comparable? There, are two bodies. as even if the Merciful One had written a pierced tenant may not partake and then wrote the other a hired worker is a matter be derived by an a fortiori a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Who is similar? There are two bodies there, for when the Merciful One said, "A resident alien shall not eat," and then He wrote the other matter, it was an easy matter that came with a leniency and a stringency, and the matter that came with a leniency and a stringency, He exerted and wrote a verse for it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא, חַד גּוּפָא הִיא – כִּי נָפְקָא לַהּ בְּנַעֲרוּת, בַּגְרוּת מַאי בָּעֲיָא גַּבֵּיהּ?
human_translation: But here, she is one body, Once she has left upon youth, what doing in his an adult?
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Rather, here, it is one entity - when it emerged in its youth, what does it require in maturity?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְבֶגֶר דְּאַיְלוֹנִית,
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: is necessary only for the adulthood of a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ].
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: It was only necessary for the sake of the "veger" of the aylonit.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: בְּנַעֲרוּת תִּיפּוֹק, בְּבַגְרוּת לָא תִּיפּוֹק, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say: She leaves when youth, when adulthood she does not leave. teaches us
llm_translation: I will go out with your opinion: in one's youth, it will come out, in one's old age, it will not come out, this is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? וּמָה סִימָנִין שֶׁאֵין מוֹצִיאִין מֵרְשׁוּת אָב – מוֹצִיאִין מֵרְשׁוּת אָדוֹן, בַּגְרוּת שֶׁמּוֹצִיאָה מֵרְשׁוּת אָב – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוֹצִיאָה מֵרְשׁוּת אָדוֹן?
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi objects to this: But is it not an a fortiori And if the signs puberty do not release from her father’s authority, they do release from the master’s authority; is it not logical that adulthood, which releases from her father’s authority, should release from master’s authority?
llm_translation: Challenges to him, Mar son of Rav Ashi: And is it not a fortiori? And what are the signs that one may not transfer from the domain of the father – one may transfer from the domain of the master, in the case of a pit that one may transfer from the domain of the father – it is not a valid argument that one may transfer from the domain of the master?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְעִיקַּר זְבִינָא דְאַיְלוֹנִית, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: דְּאַתְיָא סִימָנֵי נַעֲרוּת – הָוֵי זְבִינָא, דְּלָא אַתְיָא סִימָנֵי נַעֲרוּת – לָא הָוֵי זְבִינַהּ זְבִינָא,
human_translation: Rather, Mar bar Rav Ashi says: is necessary only with regard to the basic sale of an ailonit enter your mind to say that will show signs of a young woman, is sale, where will not show signs of a young woman, her sale is not sale.
llm_translation: Rather, said Mar bar Rav Ashi: It was only necessary for the main part of the dish of the aylonit. If your mind is at ease, I say: when signs of youthfulness come – it is a dish, when signs of youthfulness do not come – it is not a dish.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם כּוּ׳״.
human_translation: “Then shall she go out for nothing, teaches us
llm_translation: It is taught to us: "And she shall go out for nothing, as it is written."

hebrew_text: וּלְמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי, דְּאָמַר: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא, הָא אָמְרִינַן מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי – מְשַׁנִּינַן.
human_translation: And according to Mar bar Rav Ashi, who said: But is it not an a fortiori we say a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it That matter is no to resolve But when there is to resolve one resolves
llm_translation: And to Mar bar Rav Ashi, who said: And it is not a fortiori reasoning, for we say: a matter that can be derived through a fortiori reasoning, the verse had to exert itself and write it! Those matters, where there is no need for verbal distinction, we do not verbalize, but those matters where there is a need for verbal distinction – we verbalize.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵהָכָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה וּבְעָלָהּ וְהָיָה אִם לֹא תִמְצָא חֵן בְּעֵינָיו כִּי מָצָא בָהּ וְגוֹ׳״ – אֵין קִיחָה אֶלָּא בְּכֶסֶף. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״נָתַתִּי כֶּסֶף הַשָּׂדֶה קַח מִמֶּנִּי״.
human_translation: And a tanna cites from here, As it is taught “When a man takes a woman and engages in sexual intercourse with her, and it comes to pass, if she finds no favor in his eyes, because he has found in her, taking is only with money. And so it says: “I will give money for the field; take it from me”
llm_translation: And it was taught to her from here, as it is taught: "When a man takes a wife and possesses her, and it happens that she does not find favor in his eyes because he found in her, etc." - Acquisition is only with money. And so it says: "I have given you the money, take it from me."

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה – נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף, זוֹ, שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּקָּנֶה בְּכֶסֶף?
human_translation: But not inference, And if maidservant, who cannot be acquired through intercourse, can be acquired through money, is it not logical that this who can be acquired through intercourse can be acquired through money?
llm_translation: And isn't this the law: And how much is the Hebrew maidservant who is not acquired through intercourse - acquired with money, this, that is acquired through intercourse - is it not the law that she can be acquired with money?

hebrew_text: יְבָמָה תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה וְאֵינָהּ נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף! מָה לִיבָמָה, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין נִקְנֵית בִּשְׁטָר, תֹּאמַר בְּזוֹ, שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בִּשְׁטָר!
human_translation: A yevama proves as she is acquired through intercourse, and she cannot be acquired through money. What a yevama that cannot be acquired through a document. Will you say to this who can be acquired through a document
llm_translation: Yevamah tocheach, she'nikneit bevi'ah ve'einah nikneit bekasef! Mah livamah, she'ken ein nikneit bish'tar, tomer bezoh, she'nikneit bish'tar!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ״. הָא לְמָה לִי קְרָא, הָא אָתְיָא לַהּ! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּדִינָא פִּירְכָא.
human_translation: The verse states: “When a man takes Why do I a verse this It was derived Rav Ashi said: because one can say that refutation of the inference from the outset,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "When a man takes." Why do I need the verse? It comes to teach us! Rav Ashe said: Because there is something to say from the beginning of the judgment, a logical deduction is necessary.

hebrew_text: מֵהֵיכָא קָא מַיְיתֵית לַהּ – מֵאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה. מָה לְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה, שֶׁכֵּן יוֹצְאָה בְּכֶסֶף, תֹּאמַר בְּזוֹ, שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּכֶסֶף. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ״.
human_translation: From where do you derive from a Hebrew maidservant. What about a Hebrew maidservant is that released with money, Will you say this who cannot be released, through money? the verse states: “When a man takes.”
llm_translation: From where do you bring this? - From an Amah of Hebrew. What is an Amah of Hebrew? That it goes out with silver. You might say with gold, that it does not go out. The Talmud teaches: "When a man takes."

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כִּי יִקַּח״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: קִידּוּשִׁין דִּיהַב לַהּ בַּעַל – דִּידַהּ הָווּ, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם״.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write, “Then shall she go out for nothing,” and it was necessary to write: “When a man takes As, if the Merciful One had written “When he takes,” I would say: betrothal money that the husband gives her is hers. the Merciful One writes: “Then shall she go out for nothing,”
llm_translation: And it was necessary to write "and she shall go out freely," and it was necessary to write "when a man takes." For if the Merciful One had written "when he takes," I would have said: betrothals that he gave to her husband - they were hers, the Merciful One wrote "and she shall go out freely."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְיָצְאָה חִנָּם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הֵיכָא דְּיָהֲבָה לֵיהּ אִיהִי לְדִידֵיהּ וְקִידְּשַׁתּוּ – הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כִּי יִקַּח״ – וְלָא ״כִּי תִּקַּח״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written “Then shall she go out for nothing,” I would say where she gave him and betrothed him, it is betrothal, the Merciful One writes: “When he takes,” and not: When she takes,
llm_translation: If the Merciful One had written, "and she shall go out freely," I would have said: where she gave herself to him willingly and he sanctified her - they are considered sanctified. But the Merciful One wrote, "when he takes," and not "when she is taken."

hebrew_text: ״וּבְעָלָהּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה. וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵין נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף – נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה, זוֹ, שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה?
human_translation: “And engages in sexual intercourse with her” teaches that can be acquired through intercourse. not inference: And if a yevama , who cannot be acquired through money, can be acquired through intercourse, is it not logical that this who can be acquired through money, can be acquired through intercourse?
llm_translation: "AND HER HUSBAND" - TEACHES THAT SHE IS ACQUIRED THROUGH INTERCOURSE. BUT ISN'T THIS THE LAW: AND WHAT YEVAMAH IS NOT ACQUIRED WITH MONEY - IS ACQUIRED THROUGH INTERCOURSE, THIS ONE, THAT IS ACQUIRED WITH MONEY - IS IT NOT THE LAW THAT SHE IS ACQUIRED THROUGH INTERCOURSE?

hebrew_text: אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף וְאֵין נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה. מָה לְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה, שֶׁאֵין קִנְיָנָהּ לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת, תֹּאמַר בְּזוֹ, שֶׁקִּנְיָנָהּ לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת.
human_translation: a Hebrew maidservant proves as she is acquired through money and cannot be acquired through intercourse. What a Hebrew maidservant that her acquisition is not for the sake of marriage, Will you say with regard to this whose acquisition is for the sake of marriage?
llm_translation: A Hebrew maidservant proves, for she is acquired with money and not acquired through intercourse. What is the case of a Hebrew maidservant, whose acquisition is not for any form of marriage? You shall say with this, that her acquisition is for the purpose of marriage.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְעָלָהּ״. וּלְמָה לִי קְרָא, הָא אָתְיָא לַהּ! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּדִינָא פִּירְכָא: מֵהֵיכָא קָא מַיְיתֵית לַהּ – מִיְּבָמָה.
human_translation: The verse states: “And engages in sexual intercourse with her.” But why do I a verse It was derived Rav Ashi said: because it to say that refutation of the inference from the outset. From where do you derive From a yevama .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is taught in a Baraita: "And her husband." And why do I need the verse? It comes to teach us! Rav Ashe said: Because there is something to say from the beginning of the judgment: From where do you bring it to her - from Yibum.

hebrew_text: מָה לִיבָמָה, שֶׁכֵּן זְקוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת, תֹּאמַר בָּזוֹ, שֶׁאֵין זְקוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְעָלָהּ״.
human_translation: What a yevama is bound and stands Will you say with regard to this who is not bound and standing the verse states: “And engages in sexual intercourse with her.”
llm_translation: The text reads: "What is the case of Yibum, that it is so necessary and standing, you may say in this case, that it is not necessary and standing. The Talmud teaches: 'And her husband.'"

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאַף בִּשְׁטָר? וְדִין הוּא: וּמָה כֶּסֶף, שֶׁאֵין מוֹצִיא – מַכְנִיס, שְׁטָר, שֶׁמּוֹצִיא – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמַּכְנִיס?
human_translation: And from where even by a document? is a logical derivation, And if money, which does not release bring into is it not logical that a document, which releases can bring into
llm_translation: And from where do we know that even with a document? And it is a law: And what is the case with money, that one does not produce - he brings in a document, that one produces - it is not a case where he brings in a document?

hebrew_text: מָה לְכֶסֶף, שֶׁכֵּן פּוֹדִין בּוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי. תֹּאמַר שְׁטָר, שֶׁאֵין פּוֹדִין בּוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״!
human_translation: What money as one can redeem with it consecrated and second tithe. Will you say a document, with which one cannot redeem consecrated and second tithe? that it is written: “And he will give the money and it will be assured to him”
llm_translation: Silver, for so we redeem with it consecrated items and the second tithe. You might say a document, for with it we do not redeem consecrated items and the second tithe, as it is written: "And he shall give the silver, and it shall be his."

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצְאָה״ ״וְהָיְתָה״ – מַקִּישׁ הֲוָיָה לִיצִיאָה: מָה יְצִיאָה בִּשְׁטָר – אַף הֲוָיָה נָמֵי בִּשְׁטָר. וְאַקֵּישׁ נָמֵי, יְצִיאָה לַהֲוָיָה: מָה הֲוָיָה בַּכֶּסֶף – אַף יְצִיאָה בְּכֶסֶף!
human_translation: the verse states: “And she leaves and becomes juxtaposes becoming, to leaving, Just as leaving through a document, so too, becoming through a document. And let one also juxtapose leaving to becoming, Just as becoming is through money, so too, leaving through money.
llm_translation: The verse says: "and it shall go out" "and it shall be" - it compares being to going out: just as going out is with a document, so too being is also with a document. And it also compares, going out to being: just as being is with money, so too going out is with money!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: יֹאמְרוּ: כֶּסֶף מַכְנִיס, כֶּסֶף מוֹצִיא, סָנֵיגוֹר יֵעָשֶׂה קָטֵיגוֹר? אִי הָכִי, שְׁטָר נָמֵי יֹאמְרוּ: שְׁטָר מוֹצִיא, שְׁטָר מַכְנִיס, קָטֵיגוֹר יֵעָשֶׂה סָנֵיגוֹר?
human_translation: Abaye says: will say: Money brings in and money releases; an advocate [ saneigor ] become a prosecutor [ kateigor ]? If so, a document too, they will say: A document brings in and a document releases; a prosecutor become an advocate?
llm_translation: Abaye said: They should say, "Silver brings in, silver takes out, does a thornbush make a fence?" If so, with regard to a document, they should say: A document takes out, a document brings in, does a fence make a thornbush?

hebrew_text: מִילֵּי דְּהַאי שְׁטָרָא לְחוֹד וּמִילֵּי דְּהַאי שְׁטָרָא לְחוֹד. הָכָא נָמֵי, הַאי כַּסְפָּא לְחוֹד וְהַאי כַּסְפָּא לְחוֹד! טִיבְעָא מִיהָא חַד הוּא.
human_translation: The words of this document are discrete, and the words of this document are discrete, Here too, this money is discrete and this money is discrete, In any event, the coin is one,
llm_translation: Words of this document are distinct and words of this document are distinct. Here it is stated, this silver is distinct and this silver is distinct! The nature of it is one.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכָתַב לָהּ״ בִּכְתִיבָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, וְאֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בְּכֶסֶף. וְאֵימָא: בִּכְתִיבָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת – וְאֵינָהּ מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בִּכְתִיבָה! הָא כְּתִיב ״וְיָצְאָה״ ״וְהָיְתָה״ מַקִּישׁ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rava said: The verse states: “And he writes her is divorced through writing and she is not divorced through money. But say She is divorced through writing, and she is not betrothed through writing. written: “And she leaves and becomes” juxtaposes
llm_translation: Rava said: The verse says, "and he shall write her a bill of divorce" - in writing she becomes divorced, but she does not become divorced with money. And why not say: in writing she becomes divorced - and she does not become betrothed in writing! This is because the verse juxtaposes "and she shall leave" and "and she shall be," and so on.

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא קָאֵי בְּגֵירוּשִׁין מְמַעֵט גֵּירוּשִׁין, קָאֵי בְּגֵירוּשִׁין וּמְמַעֵט קִידּוּשִׁין?!
human_translation: And what did you see It stands to reason referring to divorce excludes divorce. referring to divorce and exclude betrothal?
llm_translation: And what did you see? He is standing in divorce, diminishing divorces, standing in divorces and diminishing betrothals?!

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְהַאי קְרָא לִדְרָשָׁא אַחֲרִינָא, שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת בְּכֶסֶף מְנָא לֵיהּ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״סֵפֶר כְּרִיתֻת״ – סֵפֶר כּוֹרְתָהּ, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר כּוֹרְתָהּ.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who derives a different exposition from this verse, from where does he that cannot be divorced through money? the verse states: “A scroll of severance,” A scroll, severs her and nothing else severs her
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, that he brought up this verse for another interpretation, that it does not divorce with money, what does it mean to him? The verse says: "a bill of divorcement" - a bill that cuts her off, and there is nothing else that cuts her off.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״כְּרִיתֻת״, מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְדָבָר הַכּוֹרֵת בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ,
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this severance”? require it for a matter that severs him from her.
llm_translation: The sages, this "keritut," what does it do to it? It requires it for a matter of cutting off between him and her.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן״, ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלְכִי לְבֵית אָבִיךְ לְעוֹלָם״ – אֵין זֶה כְּרִיתוּת. ״כָּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ – הֲרֵי זֶה כְּרִיתוּת.
human_translation: as it is taught This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will not drink wine, On the condition that you will never go to your father’s house, that is not severance, thirty days, that is severance.
llm_translation: As it was taught: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you do not drink wine," "on the condition that you do not go to your father's house forever" - this is not a divorce. "Thirty days" - this is a divorce.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? מִכָּרֵת כְּרִיתֻת קָא נָפְקָא לֵיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן? כָּרֵת כְּרִיתֻת לָא מַשְׁמַע לְהוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, he derives it from karet , keritut . And the other They do not interpret karet keritut .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? From the cutting of the vineyard he derived it. And the Rabbis? Cutting of the vineyard is not heard for them.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי! הֵי תֵּיתֵי? לָא לִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בִּשְׁטָר, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ – מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן הֲנָאָתָן מְרוּבָּה.
human_translation: one cannot be derived from another let one be derived from two which will be derived Let the Merciful One not write through a document, and derive from these What about these their benefit is great,
llm_translation: One from one does not come, give one from two! Give one? It is not written in the document, and give from here - what from here, for their benefit is greater.

hebrew_text: לָא נִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּבִיאָה, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ – מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן קִנְיָנָן מְרוּבֶּה.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One not write through sexual intercourse, and derive from these what about these their acquisition is great.
llm_translation: The Merciful One did not write in the Torah about intercourse, yet He gave from these – what is given from these, for thus their acquisition is greater.

hebrew_text: לָא נִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּכֶסֶף, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ – מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One not write through money, and derive from these what about these against her will.
llm_translation: The Merciful One is not written with silver, and from there it is given - what is given from there, so too they are given willingly.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא כֶּסֶף נָמֵי בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ, בְּאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה – בְּאִישׁוּת מִיהָא לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן.
human_translation: And if you would say money also against her will, of a Hebrew maidservant, In any event, with regard to marriage, we do not find
llm_translation: And if you will say, "The money is in the possession of its owner by force," in the Hebrew cubit - by means of a document, we do not find it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חוּפָּה קוֹנָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה כֶּסֶף שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל בִּתְרוּמָה – קוֹנֶה, חוּפָּה שֶׁמַּאֲכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּקְנֶה?
human_translation: Rav Huna says: canopy effects acquisition through an a fortiori If money, which does not enable to partake of teruma , effects acquisition is it not logical that canopy, which enables her to partake of teruma , should effect acquisition
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A courtyard acquires through a kal vachomer: And just as silver that does not feed on terumah acquires, a courtyard that feeds on terumah does not acquire?

hebrew_text: וְכֶסֶף אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל? וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹהֵן כִּי יִקְנֶה נֶפֶשׁ קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ״, וְהַאי ״קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ הוּא״.
human_translation: And does money not enable to partake of But didn’t Ulla say: By Torah law the daughter of a non-priest betrothed partake of teruma as it is stated: “But if a priest buy any soul, the acquisition of his money, and this is the acquisition of his money.
llm_translation: "And silver does not feed? But didn't Ulla say: A matter of Torah, an engaged daughter of Israel may eat from the terumah, as it is stated: 'And if a priest acquires a soul, his acquisition shall be his silver,' and this 'acquisition shall be his silver.'"

hebrew_text: וּמַה טַּעַם אָמְרוּ אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִמְזְגוּ לָהּ כּוֹס בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ וְתַשְׁקֶנּוּ לְאָחִיהָ וְלַאֲחוֹתָיהּ.
human_translation: And what is the reason said she may not partake decree lest they pour her a cup in her father’s house, and she give to her brothers and sisters to drink,
llm_translation: And what is the reason they said she does not eat - a decree lest they mix for her a cup in her father's house and she will give it to her brothers and sisters.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּרֵיךְ הָכִי: וּמָה כֶּסֶף שֶׁאֵינוֹ גּוֹמֵר – קוֹנֶה,
human_translation: Rather, he refutes as follows: If money, which does not complete effects acquisition
llm_translation: Rather, ask thus: And what silver that is not complete - acquires.

hebrew_text: חוּפָּה שֶׁגּוֹמֶרֶת – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּקְנֶה? מָה לְכֶסֶף, שֶׁכֵּן פּוֹדִין בּוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי. בִּיאָה תּוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: is it not logical that canopy, which completes can effect acquisition What about money is that as one can redeem with it consecrated and second tithe. sexual intercourse proves
llm_translation: A canopy that is complete - does not acquire? What about money, for thus redeem sanctified items and second tithe. Coitus will prove.

hebrew_text: מָה לְבִיאָה, שֶׁכֵּן קוֹנָה בִּיבָמָה. כֶּסֶף יוֹכִיחַ. וְחָזַר הַדִּין: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן: שֶׁקּוֹנִין בְּעָלְמָא וְקוֹנִין כָּאן, אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא חוּפָּה שֶׁקּוֹנָה בְּעָלְמָא, וְקוֹנָה כָּאן.
human_translation: What sexual intercourse that it effects acquisition of a yevama , Money proves And the derivation has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common denominator is that they generally effect acquisition, and they effect acquisition here, Likewise, I will bring canopy, which generally effects acquisition, and effect acquisition here.
llm_translation: What is levirate marriage, that one acquires through yibum. Silver will prove it. And the law returned: Not this view like that view, and not that view like this view, the common denominator between them: that they acquire in general and acquire here, so too I will bring a case of a chuppah that acquires in general, and acquires here.

hebrew_text: מָה לְצַד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן הֲנָאָתָן מְרוּבָּה. שְׁטָר יוֹכִיחַ. מָה לִשְׁטָר, שֶׁכֵּן מוֹצִיא בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. כֶּסֶף וּבִיאָה יוֹכִיחוּ.
human_translation: What the common denominator of that their benefit, is great? a document proves What a document is that it can release a Jewish woman Money and intercourse prove
llm_translation: What is the advantage of the similar cases among them, that their benefit is greater. A document proves ownership. What is the advantage of a document, that it enables one to take possession from a daughter of Israel. Money and marriage contract prove ownership.

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן: שֶׁקּוֹנִין בְּעָלְמָא וְקוֹנִין כָּאן – אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא חוּפָּה, שֶׁקּוֹנָה בְּעָלְמָא וְקוֹנָה כָּאן.
human_translation: And the derivation has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common denominator is that they generally effect acquisition and they effect acquisition here, Likewise, I will bring canopy, which generally effects acquisition, and effect acquisition here.
llm_translation: The judgment returned: not seen this like seen this, and not seen this like seen this, the equal side in them: that one acquires in the world and acquires here - I will also bring a proof, that one who acquires in the world acquires here.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ. וְרַב הוּנָא – כֶּסֶף מִיהָא בְּאִישׁוּת לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
human_translation: What the common denominator of that they are against her will? And Rav Huna In any event, with regard to marriage, we have not found money against her will.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the case of the equal portion in which they are equal by her will. And Rav Huna - silver from her property, I did not find by her will. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁתֵּי תְשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר. חֲדָא, דְּ״שָׁלֹשׁ״ תְּנַן וְ״אַרְבַּע״ לָא תְּנַן.
human_translation: Rava said: two refutations of matter, One that we learned three and we did not learn four
llm_translation: Rava said: Two answers in the matter. One, that "three" we teach and "four" we do not teach.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: כְּלוּם חוּפָּה גּוֹמֶרֶת אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי קִידּוּשִׁין, וְכִי גָּמְרִינַן חוּפָּה שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי קִידּוּשִׁין מֵחוּפָּה שֶׁעַל יְדֵי קִידּוּשִׁין?
human_translation: And furthermore, Doesn’t canopy complete only by betrothal, And can one derive canopy without betrothal from canopy that by betrothal?
llm_translation: And furthermore: completion of the marriage contract is only through the means of betrothal, and have we completed the marriage contract without betrothal from a marriage contract that is through betrothal?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הָא דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ ״שָׁלֹשׁ״ תְּנַן וְ״אַרְבַּע״ לָא תְּנַן – תַּנָּא מִילְּתָא דִּכְתִיבָא בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי, מִילְּתָא דְּלָא כְּתִיבָא בְּהֶדְיָא לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to that which you said, we learned three and we did not learn four tanna teaches a matter that is explicitly written does not teach a matter that is not explicitly written
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: This that you are saying "three" we teach, and "four" we do not teach - it teaches a matter that is written explicitly it teaches, a matter that is not written explicitly it does not teach.

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ ״כְּלוּם חוּפָּה גּוֹמֶרֶת אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי קִידּוּשִׁין״ – רַב הוּנָא נָמֵי הָכִי קָאָמַר: וּמָה כֶּסֶף שֶׁאֵינוֹ גּוֹמֵר אַחַר כֶּסֶף – קוֹנֶה, חוּפָּה שֶׁגּוֹמֶרֶת אַחַר כֶּסֶף – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתִּקְנֶה?
human_translation: And that which you said: Doesn’t canopy complete only by betrothal, this is also what Rav Huna is saying, If money, which does not complete after money, effects acquisition is it not logical that canopy, completes after money, should effect acquisition
llm_translation: "And she said, 'As if she completes the marriage through the act of sanctification' - Rav Huna also said thus: And what silver that does not complete after silver - acquires, a marriage that completes after silver - is it not the law that she acquires?"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד בְּכֶסֶף? נָתַן לָהּ כֶּסֶף אוֹ שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף, וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְאוֹרֶסֶת לִי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לִי לְאִינְתּוּ״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אֲבָל הִיא שֶׁנָּתְנָה, וְאָמְרָה הִיא: ״הֲרֵינִי מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לְךָ״, ״הֲרֵינִי מְאוֹרֶסֶת לְךָ״, ״הֲרֵינִי לְךָ לְאִינְתּוּ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught How through money? gave money or worth money, and said to her: You are hereby betrothed [ mekuddeshet ] to me, You are hereby betrothed [ me’oreset ] to me, You are to me as a wife, she is betrothed. But she who gave and she said: I am hereby betrothed [ mekuddeshet ] to you, I am hereby betrothed [ me’oreset ] to you, I am hereby to you as a wife, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: How is it with money? If he gave her money or something equal to money, and said to her: "Behold, you are consecrated to me," "Behold, you are betrothed to me," "Behold, you are mine for a wife" – she is consecrated. But if she gave the money, and said: "Behold, I am consecrated to you," "Behold, I am betrothed to you," "Behold, I am yours for a wife" – she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: טַעְמָא דְּנָתַן הוּא וְאָמַר הוּא, הָא נָתַן הוּא וְאָמְרָה הִיא – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֲבָל הִיא שֶׁנָּתְנָה לוֹ וְאָמְרָה הִיא – לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. טַעְמָא דְּנָתְנָה הִיא וְאָמְרָה הִיא, הָא נָתַן הוּא וְאָמְרָה הִיא – הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין!
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: that the reason he gave and he said he gave and she said she is not betrothed. say the latter clause But she who gave and she said: it is not betrothal. The reason she gave and she said he gave and she said this is betrothal.
llm_translation: Rav Papa strongly objects to her: The reason that if he gave and she said, it is not sanctified, is because he gave and she said. Say the latter part: But if she gave it to him and she said, it is not sanctified. The reason that if she gave it and she said, it is sanctified, is because he gave and she said - it is sanctified!

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא דַּוְקָא, סֵיפָא כְּדִי נַסְבַהּ. וְתָנֵי סֵיפָא מִילְּתָא דְּסָתְרָא לַהּ לְרֵישָׁא?
human_translation: The first clause exact, the latter clause cited for no reason, And teach the latter clause a matter that contradicts the first clause?
llm_translation: Beginning of the matter, end in order to clarify. And it was taught: the end is a matter that conceals for the beginning?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: נָתַן הוּא וְאָמַר הוּא – פְּשִׁיטָא דְּהָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. נָתַן הוּא וְאָמְרָה הִיא – נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁנָּתְנָה הִיא וְאָמְרָה הִיא, וְלָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: נָתַן הוּא וְאָמַר הוּא – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. נָתְנָה הִיא וְאָמְרָה הִיא – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. נָתַן הוּא וְאָמְרָה הִיא – סְפֵיקָא הִיא וְחָיְישִׁינַן מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, This is what is saying: he gave and he said is obvious that it is betrothal. he gave and she said it is considered as though she gave and she said and it is not betrothal. And if you wish, say he gave he said she is betrothed. she gave and she said she is not betrothed he gave and she said is uncertain, and by rabbinic law we are concerned
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rather, this is what he is saying: If he gave and she said - it is obvious that the betrothal is valid. If he gave and she said - it is not valid as if she had given and said, and they did not become betrothed. And if you wish, I can say: If he gave and he said - she is betrothed. If she gave and she said - she is not betrothed. If he gave and she said - it is a doubt, and we are concerned according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, נָתַן לָהּ כֶּסֶף וְשָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְאוֹרֶסֶת״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ (לִי) לְאִינְתּוּ״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״הֲרֵינִי אִישֵּׁךְ״, ״הֲרֵינִי בַּעְלֵיךְ״, ״הֲרֵינִי אֲרוּסֵיךְ״ – אֵין כָּאן בֵּית מֵיחוֹשׁ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: With regard to betrothal, he gave her money or worth money, and said to her: You are hereby betrothed [ mekuddeshet ], You are hereby betrothed [ me’oreset ], You are hereby as a wife, she is betrothed. I am hereby your man, I am hereby your husband, I am hereby your betrothed, there is no room for concern here.
llm_translation: Samuel said: In betrothal, he gave her money and an item of value, and said to her: "Behold, you are consecrated," "Behold, you are betrothed," "Behold, you are (to me) as a wife" – she is thereby consecrated. "Behold, I am your husband," "Behold, I am your master," "Behold, I am your betrothed" – there is no need for a formal document.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּגֵירוּשִׁין, נָתַן לָהּ וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. ״אֵינִי אִישֵּׁךְ״, ״אֵינִי בַּעְלֵיךְ״, ״אֵינִי אֲרוּסֵיךְ״ – אֵין כָּאן בֵּית מֵיחוֹשׁ.
human_translation: And similarly, with regard to divorce, gave and said to her: You are hereby sent away, You are hereby divorced, You are hereby permitted to any man, she is divorced. I am not your man, I am not your husband, I am not your betrothed, there is no room for concern,
llm_translation: And so in divorces, he gave to her and said to her: "Behold you are sent away," "Behold you are divorced," "Behold you are permitted to all men" - behold this one is divorced. "I am not your husband," "I am not your master," "I am not your betrothed" - there is no concern here for jealousy.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל יָדַיִם שֶׁאֵין מוֹכִיחוֹת, הָוְיָין יָדַיִם?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Is this to say that Shmuel holds ambiguous intimations, are intimations?
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye: To say that Shmuel holds that hands that do not prove, are they hands?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֱהֵא״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נָזִיר. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: וְדִילְמָא ״אֱהֵא בְּתַעֲנִית״ קָאָמַר? וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְהוּא שֶׁהָיָה נָזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו. טַעְמָא דִּנְזִיר עוֹבֵר לְפָנָיו, הָא לָאו הָכִי – לָא!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn one who says: I shall be, is a nazirite? And we discussed But perhaps to say: I will be in a fast? And Shmuel said this is when a nazirite was passing before him. The reason that a nazirite passes before him. if this not no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And we learned in a Mishnah: One who says "I shall be" - this one is a Nazirite. And we asked about it: Perhaps he meant "I shall be with fasting"? And Shmuel said, and he himself was a Nazirite, he transgresses before him. The reason a Nazirite transgresses before him, is it not so? No!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמַר ״לִי״. אִי הָכִי, מַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? הָנֵי
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where he said To me. If so, what is teaching us? These
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That he said "to me." If so, what is it teaching us? Those words.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנֵי בָּתְרָאֵי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הָכָא כְּתִיב ״כִּי יִקַּח״ – וְלֹא שֶׁיַּקַּח אֶת עַצְמוֹ. וְהָכָא כְּתִיב ״וְשִׁלְּחָהּ״ – וְלֹא שֶׁיְּשַׁלַּח אֶת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: last expressions what he teaches us. Here, written: “When takes and not that he takes himself And written here, “And sends her” and not that he sends himself
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches us: Here it is written "he shall take" - not that he should take himself. And here it is written "and he shall send her away" - not that he should send himself away.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ אִשְׁתִּי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ אֲרוּסָתִי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ קְנוּיָה לִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ שֶׁלִּי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ בִּרְשׁוּתִי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ זְקוּקָה לִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְלִיתְנִינְהוּ כּוּלְּהוּ כַּחֲדָא! תַּנָּא תְּלָת תְּלָת, שַׁמְעִינְהוּ וְגַרְסִינְהוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught You are hereby my wife, You are hereby my betrothed, You are hereby acquired to me, she is betrothed. You are hereby mine, You are hereby under my authority, You are hereby bound to me, she is betrothed. But let teach all of them together. The tanna heard them as two sets of three, and he taught them
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Behold, you are my wife," "Behold, you are my betrothed," "Behold, you are consecrated to me." - She is sanctified. "Behold, you are mine," "Behold, you are under my authority," "Behold, you are designated for me." - She is sanctified. And we do not teach all of them together! A Tanna taught: Three by three, hear them and repeat them.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״מְיוּחֶדֶת לִי״ מַהוּ? ״מְיוֹעֶדֶת לִי״ מַהוּ? ״עֶזְרָתִי״ מַהוּ? ״נֶגְדָּתִי״ מַהוּ? ״עֲצוּרָתִי״ מַהוּ? ״צַלְעָתִי״ מַהוּ? ״סְגוּרָתִי״ מַהוּ? ״תַּחְתַּי״ מַהוּ? ״תְּפוּשָׂתִי״ מַהוּ? ״לְקוּחָתִי״ מַהוּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before unique to me, what is designated to me, what is my helper, what is my counterpart, what is my gathered one, what is my rib, what is my closed one, what is beneath me, what is my seized one, what is my taken one, what is
llm_translation: He asked them: "What is 'meyuchedet li'? What is 'meyodedet li'? What is 'ezrati'? What is 'negdati'? What is 'atzurati'? What is 'tzalati'? What is 'segurati'? What is 'tachati'? What is 'tefusat'? What is 'lekuchati'?

hebrew_text: פְּשׁוֹט מִיהָא חֲדָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״לְקוּחָתִי״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִשּׁוּם ״שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה״.
human_translation: Resolve at least one as it is taught one who says my taken one, she is betrothed, because it is stated: “When a man takes a woman”
llm_translation: It is straightforward from this, as it is taught: One who says "for my betrothal" - behold, this one is sanctified, because it is stated "when a man takes a wife."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״חֲרוּפָתִי״ מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״חֲרוּפָתִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁכֵּן בִּיהוּדָה קוֹרִין לָאֲרוּסָה ״חֲרוּפָה״. וִיהוּדָה הָוְיָא רוּבָּא דְּעָלְמָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before my espoused one [ ḥarufati ], what is Come hear, as it is taught one who says: my espoused one, she is betrothed, as in Judea they call a betrothed woman a ḥarufa , an espoused woman. And is Judea most of the world?
llm_translation: He asked them: What is "charufati"? Come and hear, as it was taught: One who says "charufati" - she is betrothed, for so in Judea they call a betrothed woman "charufah." And was Judea the majority of the world?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: הָאוֹמֵר ״חֲרוּפָתִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִיא שִׁפְחָה נֶחֱרֶפֶת לְאִישׁ״. וְעוֹד, בִּיהוּדָה קוֹרִין לָאֲרוּסָה ״חֲרוּפָה״. וִיהוּדָה וְעוֹד לִקְרָא? אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: הָאוֹמֵר ״חֲרוּפָה״ בִּיהוּדָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁכֵּן בִּיהוּדָה קוֹרִין לָאֲרוּסָה ״חֲרוּפָה״.
human_translation: this is what is saying: one who says: my espoused one, she is betrothed, as it is stated: “Who is a maidservant espoused [ neḥerefet ] to a man” And furthermore, In Judea they call a betrothed woman a ḥarufa , an espoused woman. And Judea And furthermore, to a verse? Rather, this is what is saying: one who says: espoused, in Judea, she is betrothed, as in Judea they call a betrothed woman a ḥarufa , an espoused woman.
llm_translation: So it is stated: One who says "My betrothed" - she is sanctified, as it is said: "And she is a maidservant disgraced to a man." Furthermore, in Judea they call the betrothed "disgraced." And Judea, is it still called so in the Scripture? Rather, so it is stated: One who says "disgraced" in Judea - she is sanctified, for in Judea they call the betrothed "disgraced."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּשֶׁאֵין מְדַבֵּר עִמָּהּ עַל עִסְקֵי גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ – מְנָא יָדְעָה מַאי קָאָמַר לַהּ? וְאֶלָּא בִּמְדַבֵּר עִמָּהּ עַל עִסְקֵי גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָמַר לָהּ נָמֵי,
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say where he was not speaking with her about matters of her bill of divorce or her betrothal, from where does she know what he is saying to her? Rather, where he was speaking to her about matters of her bill of divorce and her betrothal. even though he did not say also
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? Perhaps when he is not speaking with her about the matters of her divorce and betrothal - from where does he know what he is saying to her? Rather, even when he is speaking with her about the matters of her divorce and betrothal - even though he did not say to her also.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הָיָה מְדַבֵּר עִם אִשָּׁה עַל עִסְקֵי גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, וְנָתַן לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ וְלֹא פֵּירֵשׁ – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: דַּיּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵשׁ. וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: As we learned one was speaking with a woman about matters of her bill of divorce or her betrothal, and he gave her a bill of divorce or her betrothal, but did not clarify Rabbi Yosei says: is sufficient for him, Rabbi Yehuda says: He is required to clarify And Rav Huna says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one was speaking with a woman regarding matters of her divorce and betrothal, and he gave her her divorce and betrothal but did not separate from her - Rabbi Yosei says: it is enough. Rabbi Yehuda says: he must separate. And Rav Huna said in the name of Shmuel: the halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לְעוֹלָם בִּמְדַבֵּר עִמָּהּ עַל עִסְקֵי גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, וְאִי דְּיָהֵיב לַהּ וְשָׁתֵיק הָכִי נָמֵי, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן דִּיהַב לַהּ וַאֲמַר לַהּ בְּהָנֵי לִישָּׁנֵי,
human_translation: say Actually, where he was speaking to her about matters of her bill of divorce and her betrothal, and if where he given her and been silent, so too With what are we dealing here? where he gave her and said to her of these expressions.
llm_translation: They said: Always in the wilderness speak with her regarding matters of her divorce and her betrothals, and if he gives to her and remains silent, thus it is said, here with what are we dealing that he gave to her and said to her in the presence of witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: הָנֵי לִישָּׁנֵי לְקִידּוּשֵׁי קָאָמַר לַהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא לִמְלָאכָה קָאָמַר לַהּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And this is the dilemma raised before These expressions, did he say them to her for betrothal, or perhaps he said to her for labor? shall stand
llm_translation: And thus he was asking him: Those for whom he is requesting, is he saying it for the purpose of sanctifying them, or perhaps he is saying it for the purpose of work? Let it stand undecided.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: הָיָה מְדַבֵּר עִם הָאִשָּׁה עַל עִיסְקֵי גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ, וְנָתַן לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ וְקִידּוּשֶׁיהָ וְלֹא פֵּירֵשׁ – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: דַּיּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ לְפָרֵשׁ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן.
