human_translation: the itself: he was speaking to the woman about matters of her bill of divorce or her betrothal, and he gave her bill of divorce or her betrothal to her and did not clarify Rabbi Yosei says: is sufficient for him. Rabbi Yehuda says: He is required to clarify. Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: And this that they were discussing the same issue
llm_translation: Body: He was speaking with the woman regarding matters of her divorce and betrothal, and he gave her her divorce and betrothal and did not separate - Rabbi Yosei says: it is enough. Rabbi Yehuda says: one must separate. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: and this is when they are dealing with that matter.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן. כְּתַנָּאֵי: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין עֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן.
human_translation: And likewise, Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: And this that they were discussing the same issue. like tanna’im Rabbi says: And this that they were discussing the same issue. Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Shimon says: despite that they were not discussing the same issue.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya: And he who is engaged in that matter. As the Tannaim: Rabbi says: And he who is engaged in that matter. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: Even though they are not engaged in that matter.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָאו דַּעֲסוּקִין בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן, מְנָא יָדְעָה מַאי קָאָמַר לַהּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מֵעִנְיָן לְעִנְיָן בְּאוֹתוֹ עִנְיָן.
human_translation: And if they were not discussing the same issue, from where does she know what he is saying to her? Abaye said: from topic to topic within the same topic.
llm_translation: "And if not that they are engaged in that matter, from where did she know what he was saying to her? Abaye said: From one matter to another matter in that matter."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּטִיב גִּיטִּין וְקִידּוּשִׁין לֹא יְהֵא לוֹ עֵסֶק עִמָּהֶם, אֲפִילּוּ לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Huna says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: But that Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Anyone who does not know the nature of bills of divorce and betrothals should have no dealings in them, even did not hear this that Rav Huna Shmuel says? said to him: Yes, is indeed so;
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei. Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: But isn't this that Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: Anyone who is not knowledgeable in the laws of divorce and betrothal should not involve himself with them, even if he has heard that Rav Huna said in the name of Shmuel? He said to him: No, it is indeed so.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּגֵירוּשִׁין, נָתַן לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְשׁוּלַּחַת״ ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״ – הֲרֵי הִיא מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. פְּשִׁיטָא נָתַן לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ, וְאָמַר לָהּ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ בַּת חוֹרִין״
human_translation: And similarly, with regard to divorce: gave her bill of divorce and said to her: You are hereby sent away, You are hereby divorced, You are hereby permitted to any man, she is divorced. is obvious gave her a bill of divorce and said to his wife: You are hereby a free woman,
llm_translation: And so in divorces, he gave her her bill of divorce and said to her: "Behold, you are free," "Behold, you are divorced," "Behold, you are permitted to any man" – behold, she is divorced. It is obvious, he gave her her bill of divorce, and said to his wife: "Behold, you are a free woman."

hebrew_text: – לֹא אָמַר וְלֹא כְּלוּם. אָמַר לָהּ לְשִׁפְחָתוֹ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״ – לֹא אָמַר וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: he has said nothing, said to his female slave You are hereby permitted to any man, he has not said anything.
llm_translation: He did not say, and not nothing. He said to his maidservant: "Behold, you are permitted to any man." He did not say, and not nothing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לְעַצְמְךָ״ מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן לִמְלָאכָה קָאָמַר לַהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא לִגְמָרֵי קָאָמַר לַהּ?
human_translation: said to his wife: You are hereby for yourself, what is Do we say he said to her only with regard to work? Or perhaps he said to her entirely,
llm_translation: He said to his wife: "Behold, you are to yourself." What is the ruling? Do we say he is speaking about work to her, or perhaps he meant to completely separate from her?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר: ״הֲרֵי אַתָּה בֶּן חוֹרִין״, ״הֲרֵי אַתָּה לְעַצְמְךָ״. הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי דִּקְנֵי לֵיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ, כִּי אָמַר לֵיהּ ״הֲרֵי אַתָּה לְעַצְמְךָ״ – לִגְמָרֵי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, אִשָּׁה דְּלָא קְנֵי לֵיהּ גּוּפַהּ, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come hear as it is taught The essence of a bill of manumission You are hereby a freeman, You are hereby for yourself. Now if a Canaanite slave, whose body belongs to when says to him: You are hereby for yourself, he said to him is entirely all the more so not that a wife, whose body is not owned
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come and hear, as it was taught: The body of a bill of divorce states, "Behold, you are free," "Behold, you are for yourself." Now, if a Canaanite slave acquires himself, when he says to him, "Behold, you are for yourself," he is completely acquiring him. If this is the case with a woman who does not acquire herself, how much more so?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר לְעַבְדּוֹ ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בְּךָ״ מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בְּךָ״ – לִגְמָרֵי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא לִמְלָאכָה קָאָמַר לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: one said to his slave: I have no business with you, what Do we say he said to him: I have no business with you, entirely, Or perhaps say to him with regard to labor?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: He said to his servant, "I have no business with you." What? Who said, "I have no business with you" - completely he said to him, or perhaps he was saying to him about work?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַב אָשֵׁי וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב חָנִין מָחוֹזָאָה לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמּוֹכֵר עַבְדּוֹ לְנׇכְרִי – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר מֵרַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Ḥanin from Meḥoza to Rav Ashi: Come hear: one who sells his slave to a gentile, is emancipated but requires a bill [ get ] of manumission from his first master.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Rav Ashi, and some say it was Rav Chanin from Mahoza to Rav Ashi: Come and hear: One who sells his slave to a non-Jew - he goes out to freedom, and he requires a bill of emancipation from his original master.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב עָלָיו אוֹנוֹ, אֲבָל כָּתַב עָלָיו אוֹנוֹ – זֶהוּ שִׁחְרוּרוֹ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי אוֹנוֹ? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁתִּבְרַח מִמֶּנּוּ – ״אֵין לִי עֵסֶק בְּךָ״.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says In what is this statement said? where he did not write a document [ ono ] for But he wrote a document for him, this is his emancipation. What are the circumstances document? Rav Sheshet said he writes to him: When you escape from him I have no business with you.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? - That he did not write his condition upon it, but if he wrote his condition upon it - this is his emancipation. What is the value of his condition? Rav Sheshet said: If he wrote for him: "When you escape from me - 'I have no business with you'."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוֶה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. בַּהֲנָאַת מִלְוֶה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן מִפְּנֵי הַעֲרָמַת רִבִּית.
human_translation: Abaye says: one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed. by the benefit of the loan, she is betrothed. But it is prohibited to do so, due to an artifice of interest,
llm_translation: Abaye said: One who sanctifies with a loan - it is not sanctified. For the benefit of a loan - it is sanctified, and it is forbidden to do so because of the prohibition of interest.

hebrew_text: הַאי הֲנָאַת מִלְוֶה, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאַזְקְפַהּ, דַּאֲמַר לַהּ אַרְבַּע בְּחַמְשָׁה – הָא רִבִּית מְעַלַּיְיתָא הוּא. וְעוֹד, הַיְינוּ מִלְוֶה!
human_translation: What is meant this The benefit of the loan? If we say that he established upon it he said to her four in five, this is full-fledged interest, And furthermore, This is a loan,
llm_translation: This benefit of a loan, how much is it worth? If you say that it is interest, for he said to her four in five - this is clearly usury. And furthermore, this is a loan!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַרְוַוח לַהּ זִימְנָא.
human_translation: No, necessary where he extended the time for her.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for I will come to her at the appointed time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: ״הֵילָךְ מָנֶה עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּחֲזִירֵהוּ לִי״ בְּמֶכֶר – לֹא קָנָה, בְּאִשָּׁה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, בְּפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן – אֵין בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי,
human_translation: Rava says: Here are one hundred dinars for you on the condition that you return them to me, of a purchase, he does not acquire with regard to a woman, she is not betrothed. for redemption of son, his son is not redeemed.
llm_translation: Rava said: "If one says, 'I hereby acquire this object on the condition that it will be returned to me,' in a sale - he has not acquired it; in marriage - she is not betrothed; in redeeming his son - his son is not redeemed."

hebrew_text: בִּתְרוּמָה – יָצָא יְדֵי נְתִינָה. וְאָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּכֹהֵן הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בְּבֵית הַגְּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: with regard to teruma , he has fulfilled giving. But it is prohibited to do this, because appears like a priest who assists at the threshing floor,
llm_translation: Tractate: B'trumah - Yatza yedei netinah. Ve'asur la'asot ken, mipnei she'nireh ke'kohen ham'sayeia b'veit hagranot. Translation: In the case of a contribution - the obligation of giving is fulfilled. And it is forbidden to do so, because it appears as if one is a priest assisting in the granary.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבַר רָבָא? אִי קָסָבַר מַתָּנָה עַל מְנָת לְהַחֲזִיר שְׁמָהּ מַתָּנָה – אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי, וְאִי קָסָבַר לֹא שְׁמָהּ מַתָּנָה – אֲפִילּוּ תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: What does Rava maintain? If he maintains a gift on the condition that it is returned is called a gift, even all And if he maintains is not called a gift, even teruma it not
llm_translation: What does Rava hold? If he holds that a gift given on condition to return it is considered a gift - even if all of them agree. And if he holds that it is not considered a gift - even a contribution, they do not agree.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר: מַתָּנָה עַל מְנָת לְהַחֲזִיר שְׁמָהּ מַתָּנָה! דְּאָמַר רָבָא: ״הֵילָךְ אֶתְרוֹג זֶה עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּחְזִירֵהוּ לִי״ – נְטָלוֹ וְהֶחְזִירוֹ – יָצָא. וְאִם לָאו – לֹא יָצָא!
human_translation: And furthermore, Rava is the one who says: A gift given on the condition that it is returned is called a gift. As Rava said Take this etrog on the condition that you return it to me, takes it, and returns it, he has fulfilled And if he does not he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: And furthermore, this is what Rava said: "A gift given on the condition of returning it, is not a gift!" For Rava said: "If one says, 'Go place this etrog on the condition that you return it to me,' and he took it and returned it - he has fulfilled his obligation. But if not - he has not fulfilled his obligation!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּכוּלְּהוּ קָנֵי לְבַר מֵאִשָּׁה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית בַּחֲלִיפִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחֶמְיָה לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא כְּווֹתָיךְ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: In all of these acquired, except for a woman, because a woman cannot be acquired by exchange. Rav Huna Mar, son of Rav Neḥemya, said to Rav Ashi: We say this in the name of Rava in accordance with your
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: With all of them, he acquires through a woman, because a woman is not acquired through substitutes. Rav Huna, son of Rav Nechemyah, said to Rav Ashe: This is what we say in the name of Rava: "As you are."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: ״תֵּן מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי
human_translation: Rava says Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so
llm_translation: Rava said: "Give a maneh to Ploni."

hebrew_text: וְאֶקַּדֵּשׁ לָךְ״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִדִּין עָרֵב. עָרֵב, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידֵיהּ – קָא מְשַׁעְבֵּיד נַפְשֵׁיהּ, הַאי אִיתְּתָא נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידַהּ – קָא מְשַׁעְבְּדָא וּמַקְנְיָא נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: and I will be betrothed to you she is betrothed, from halakha a guarantor. a guarantor, not he commits himself even though he receives no benefit, this woman too, even though she receives no benefit, she commits and transfers herself
llm_translation: "And I will sanctify for you" - sanctified, from the law of a guarantor. A guarantor, is it not so even though he does not receive benefit for himself - he is causing harm to himself, this woman also, even though she does not receive benefit for herself - she is causing harm and acquiring her own soul.

hebrew_text: ״הֵילָךְ מָנֶה וְהִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִפְלוֹנִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִדִּין עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי. עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קָא חָסֵר וְלָא מִידֵּי – קָא קָנֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ, הַאי גַּבְרָא נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קָא חָסֵר וְלָא מִידֵּי – קָא קָנֵי לַהּ לְהַאי אִיתְּתָא.
human_translation: Here are one hundred dinars for you, and become betrothed to so-and-so, she is betrothed, from halakha a Canaanite slave. a Canaanite slave, not he acquires himself even though he loses nothing this man too, even though he loses nothing he acquires this woman
llm_translation: "Go, count, and consecrate yourself to so-and-so" - she is consecrated, as a Canaanite slave. A Canaanite slave, even though he is not lacking anything and not from her - he acquires her for himself. This man too, even though he is not lacking anything and not from her - he acquires her for this woman.

hebrew_text: ״תֵּן מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי וְאֶקַּדֵּשׁ אֲנִי לוֹ״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִדִּין שְׁנֵיהֶם. עָרֵב, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידֵיהּ – קָא מְשַׁעְבֵּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ, הַאי אִיתְּתָא נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידַהּ – קָא מַקְנְיָא נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: Give one hundred dinars to so-and-so and I will be betrothed to him. she is betrothed, from halakha both of a guarantor, not he commits himself even though he receives no benefit? this woman too, even though she receives no benefit, she commits and transfers herself.
llm_translation: "Give a coin to so-and-so, and I will sanctify it for him" - she is sanctified, according to the law of both. If she refuses, even though she does not receive any benefit - she is serving her own interests, this woman is also the same, even though she does not receive any benefit - she is acquiring her own benefit.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? עָרֵב, הַאי דְּקָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ קָא חָסַר מָמוֹנָא, הַאי גַּבְרָא קָא קָנֵי לַהּ לְהַאי אִיתְּתָא וְלָא קָא חָסַר וְלָא מִידֵּי! עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי יוֹכִיחַ, דְּלָא קָא חָסַר מָמוֹנָא וְקָא קָנֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Are comparable? a guarantor, the one who acquires who loses money this man, acquires the woman and loses nothing a Canaanite slave can prove it, as he does not lose money and he acquires himself.
llm_translation: Who is similar? A guarantor, this one who is acquiring it, is lacking money, this man is acquiring her for this woman and is not lacking and not from anything! A Canaanite slave will prove, that he is not lacking money and is acquiring himself.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם הָךְ דְּקָא מַקְנֵי קָא קָנֵי, הָכָא הַאי אִיתְּתָא קָא מַקְנְיָא נַפְשַׁהּ וְלָא קָא קָנְיָא וְלָא מִידֵּי! עָרֵב יוֹכִיחַ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא קָא מָטֵי הֲנָאָה לִידֵיהּ מְשַׁעְבֵּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Are comparable? There, the one who transfers is the one who acquires Here, this woman transfers herself and she does not acquire anything. a guarantor can prove it, even though he receives no benefit commits himself,
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, that one is acquiring, he is acquiring a field, here, this woman is acquiring herself and not acquiring and not from him! Evening will prove, even though he is not acquiring benefit for himself, he is benefiting his soul.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: ״הֵילָךְ מָנֶה וְאֶקַּדֵּשׁ אֲנִי לָךְ״ מַהוּ? אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְמָר זוּטְרָא: אִם כֵּן, הָוֵה לֵיהּ נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת,
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: Here are one hundred dinars and I will be betrothed to you, what is Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Pappa: She is betrothed. Rav Ashi said to Mar Zutra: If so, this is property that serves as a guarantee is acquired with property that is not guaranteed.
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rava: "Behold, 'I will give you a dowry, and I will sanctify you' - what is the law?" Mar Zutra in the name of Rav Papa said: She is betrothed. Rav Ashe said to Mar Zutra: If so, then there would be properties that have heirs acquired together with properties that do not have heirs acquired together.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן אִיפְּכָא תְּנַן: נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת בְּכֶסֶף בִּשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״אַגַּב״? הָכָא בְּאָדָם חָשׁוּב עָסְקִינַן, דִּבְהָהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא מְקַבֵּל מַתָּנָה מִינַּהּ גָּמְרָה וּמַקְנְיָא לֵיהּ נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: But we learned the opposite Property that does not serve as a guarantee can be acquired with property that serves as a guarantee through money, through a document, or through possession said to Do you maintain that she by means of here we are dealing with an important man, as, due to the benefit that he accept a gift from her, she agrees to transfer herself
llm_translation: And we reverse it: We learned: Properties that have no heirs are acquired together with properties that have heirs, with money, with a document, and with possession! He said to him: Do you think she said "because of"? Here we are dealing with a person of importance, for the pleasure he receives from her, he completes the gift and acquires her for himself.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן מָמוֹנָא. וּצְרִיכָא,
human_translation: It was also stated in the name of Rava: And similarly, with regard to monetary matters, And necessary
llm_translation: It was stated similarly in the name of Rava: "And likewise regarding financial matters." And it is necessary.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן קִידּוּשִׁין, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָא אִיתְּתָא נִיחָא לַהּ בְּכׇל דְּהוּ כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״טָב לְמֵיתַב טַן דּוּ מִלְּמֵיתַב אַרְמְלוּ.״ אֲבָל מָמוֹנָא – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: As, had he taught us betrothal, because a woman is amenable with any in accordance with of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish said: It is better to sit two bodies, than to sit widow. But with regard to monetary matters, say not
llm_translation: If we were to hear about betrothals, it is because the woman finds favor in any case, as Reish Lakish expounded, for Reish Lakish said: "It is better to sit as two than to sit as one." But regarding money - I will say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן מָמוֹנָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתְיְהִיב לִמְחִילָּה, אֲבָל קִידּוּשִׁין, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if he had taught us monetary matters, because can be waived. But betrothal, say not it is necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear about money, because it was given willingly, but regarding betrothal, one might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי לְחֶצְיִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״חֶצְיֵיךְ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: מַאי שְׁנָא ״חֶצְיֵיךְ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״ דְּאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת – ״אִשָּׁה״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא וְלֹא חֲצִי אִשָּׁה, הָכִי נָמֵי – ״אִישׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא וְלֹא חֲצִי אִישׁ!
human_translation: Rava says Be betrothed to half of me, she is betrothed. Half of you is betrothed to me, she is not betrothed. Abaye said to Rava: What is different that Half of you is betrothed to me, she is not betrothed? the Merciful One states: “a woman,” and not half a woman? So too, the Merciful One states: “A man,” and not half a man.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Consecrate yourself to me for half of you" - she is sanctified. "Your halves are sanctified to me" - she is not sanctified. Abaye said to Rava: What is the difference between "your halves are sanctified to me" that she is not sanctified - "woman" the Merciful One said and not half a woman, similarly - "man" the Merciful One said and not half a man!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, אִיתְּתָא לְבֵי תְרֵי לָא חַזְיָא, אֶלָּא גַּבְרָא מִי לָא חֲזֵי לְבֵי תְרֵי? וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לַהּ – דְּאִי בָּעֵינָא לְמִינְסַב אַחֲרִיתִי – נָסֵיבְנָא.
human_translation: said to How can be compared? There, a woman is not eligible for two But isn’t a man eligible to two And this is what he is saying to her: If I wish to marry another I will marry
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it so now?! There, a woman does not see two, but a man does see two? And thus he said to her - that if I want to marry another - I will marry.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי לְרָבִינָא: וְנִיפְשְׁטוּ לַהּ קִידּוּשֵׁי בְּכוּלַּהּ! מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר: ״רַגְלָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ עוֹלָה״ – תְּהֵא כּוּלָּהּ עוֹלָה?
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: But let the betrothal spread through all of her, Isn’t it taught one says The leg of this is a burnt-offering, all of it is a burnt-offering,
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Zutra, son of Rav Mari, to Ravina: "And they should consecrate her entirely!" Who did not teach: One who says, "Her leg goes up," she should entirely go up?

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין כּוּלָּהּ עוֹלָה, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּמַקְדִּישׁ דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין הַנְּשָׁמָה תְּלוּיָה בּוֹ, אֲבָל מַקְדִּישׁ דָּבָר שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה תְּלוּיָה בּוֹ – הָוְיָא כּוּלָּהּ עוֹלָה.
human_translation: And even according to the one who says it is not entirely a burnt-offering, that statement where he consecrated not a matter upon which life depends. But one consecrates a matter upon which life depends, all of it is a burnt-offering.
llm_translation: And even according to the one who says it does not ascend in its entirety, these matters apply where one sanctifies something that the soul is not dependent on it, but if one sanctifies something that the soul is dependent on it - it ascends in its entirety.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם – בְּהֵמָה, הָכָא – דַּעַת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, animal, Here, another mind,
llm_translation: Who is similar? There - in an animal, here - a different opinion.

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּהֵמָה שֶׁל שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין, הִקְדִּישׁ חֶצְיָהּ וְחָזַר וּלְקָחָהּ וְהִקְדִּישָׁהּ – קְדוֹשָׁה, וְאֵינָהּ קְרֵיבָה,
human_translation: This is comparable only to that which Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an animal belongs to two partners, consecrated half of it and goes back and acquires and consecrates consecrated, But it may not be sacrificed,
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "This one, it is similar only to that which Rabbi Yochanan said: An animal that belongs to two partners, one sanctified half of it, then retracted, took it back, and sanctified it again - it is sanctified, yet it is not brought as an offering."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, וּתְמוּרָתָהּ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ.
human_translation: But, render a substitute. And its substitution is like it,
llm_translation: And making exchange, and its exchange like its equivalent.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת:
human_translation: learn from three
llm_translation: Hear from it three:

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִים,
human_translation: Conclude from it that living things can be deferred.
llm_translation: Hear from it, the species of living beings are rejected,

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דָּחוּי מֵעִיקָּרָא הָוֵי דָּחוּי, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ דִּחוּי בְּדָמִים.
human_translation: And learn from it that deferral at the outset, is deferral. And learn from it there is deferral with regard to monetary
llm_translation: And hear from it, if it is rejected from the outset, it is considered rejected; and hear from it, there is rejection in blood.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: ״חֶצְיֵיךְ בַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה, וְחֶצְיֵיךְ בַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה״ מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״חֲצִי פְרוּטָה״ – פַּסְקַהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא מוֹנֶה וְהוֹלֵךְ הוּא?
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: Half of you with half one peruta , and half of you with half one peruta , what is since he said to her: Half one peruta , he has divided Or perhaps he was counting
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: "Chezeykh b'chatzi prutah, v'chezeykh b'chatzi prutah" mah hu? Keivan de'amar lah "chatzi prutah" - paskah, o dilma moneh v'holekh hu?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר מוֹנֶה וְהוֹלֵךְ הוּא, ״חֶצְיֵיךְ בִּפְרוּטָה וְחֶצְיֵיךְ בִּפְרוּטָה״ מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לַהּ בִּפְרוּטָה וּפְרוּטָה – פַּסְקַהּ לְמִילְּתֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא כֹּל בְּיוֹמֵיהּ מוֹנֶה וְהוֹלֵךְ הוּא?
human_translation: if you say he were counting, Half of you with one peruta and half of you with one peruta , what is since he said to her: With one peruta and one peruta , he divided his statement Or perhaps anything on day is he were counting,
llm_translation: If you might say, "He is counting and walking," "half of it in detail and half of it in detail," what is it? Since he said to her in detail and in detail - has he concluded his words, or perhaps all his days he is counting and walking?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר כֹּל בְּיוֹמֵיהּ מוֹנֶה וְהוֹלֵךְ הוּא, ״חֶצְיֵיךְ בִּפְרוּטָה הַיּוֹם וְחֶצְיֵיךְ בִּפְרוּטָה לְמָחָר״ מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לַהּ לְמָחָר – פַּסְקַהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר לַהּ: ״קִדּוּשִׁין מַתְחֲלוּ מֵהָאִידָּנָא וּמִגְמָר לָא נִיגְמְרוּ עַד לִמְחַר״?
human_translation: if you say everything on day he were counting, Half of you with one peruta today, and half of you with one peruta tomorrow, what is since he said to her: Tomorrow, divided or perhaps this is what he is saying to her: The betrothal begins from now, and will not be completed until tomorrow.
llm_translation: If you will say, "All his days he counts and goes," "Half of you today and half of you tomorrow," what is it? Since he said to her "tomorrow," she is divorced, or perhaps he meant to say to her, "Engagements begin today and are not completed until tomorrow"?

hebrew_text: ״שְׁנֵי חֲצָיַיִךְ בִּפְרוּטָה״ מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי בְּחַד זִימְנָא קָאָמַר לַהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא אֵין אִשָּׁה מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת לַחֲצָאִין כְּלָל? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Your two halves with one peruta , what is Here, he certainly spoke to her at one time, or perhaps a woman may not be betrothed in halves at all. shall stand
llm_translation: "Two halves of you separately" what? Here certainly in one time he said to her, or perhaps a woman does not become betrothed to halves at all? It shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: ״שְׁתֵּי בְנוֹתֶיךָ לִשְׁנֵי בָנַי בִּפְרוּטָה״ מַהוּ? בָּתַר נוֹתֵן וּמְקַבֵּל אָזְלִינַן וְהָאִיכָּא מָמוֹנָא, אוֹ דִילְמָא בָּתַר דִּידְהוּ אָזְלִינַן וְהָא לֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rava raises dilemma. your two daughters to my two sons with one peruta , what is we follow the giver and recipient, and there is money Or perhaps we follow them, and there is not shall stand
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: "Shetei b'notecha lishnei banai bifrutah" mah? Batr noten u'mekabel azlinan veha'ikka mamona, o dilma batr didhu azlinan veha leikka? Teiku.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: ״בִּתְּךָ וּפָרָתְךָ בִּפְרוּטָה״ מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן בִּתְּךָ בַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה וּפָרָתְךָ בַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה, אוֹ דִילְמָא בִּתְּךָ בִּפְרוּטָה וּפָרָתְךָ בִּמְשִׁיכָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: your daughter and your cow with one peruta , what is Do we say Your daughter with half one peruta and your cow with half one peruta ? Or perhaps Your daughter with one peruta and your cow by pulling? shall stand
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Papa: "Your daughter and your cow in detail," what is it? Do we say your daughter in half a detail and your cow in half a detail, or perhaps your daughter in detail and your cow in dragging? It remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: ״בִּתְּךָ וְקַרְקָעֲךָ בִּפְרוּטָה״ מַהוּ? בִּתְּךָ בַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה וְקַרְקָעֲךָ בַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה, אוֹ דִילְמָא בִּתְּךָ בִּפְרוּטָה וְקַרְקָעֲךָ בַּחֲזָקָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: your daughter and your land with one peruta , what is Your daughter with half one peruta and your land with half one peruta ? Or perhaps Your daughter with one peruta and your land through taking possession? shall stand
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rav Ashi: "Your daughter and your land in detail," what is it? Your daughter in half a detail and your land in half a detail, or perhaps your daughter in detail and your land in possession? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאקַדֵּישׁ בְּשִׁירָאֵי, רַבָּה אָמַר: לָא צְרִיכִי שׁוּמָא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: צְרִיכִי שׁוּמָא. אִי דְּאָמַר לַהּ בְּכֹל דְּהוּ, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא צְרִיכִי שׁוּמָא.
human_translation: a certain man who betrothed with silk [ beshira’ei ] Rabba said: An appraisal not necessary, Rav Yosef said: An appraisal necessary, If he said to her by any amount, everyone agrees that not require appraisal,
llm_translation: That man who sanctified with songs, Rabba said: I do not need perhaps. Rav Yosef said: I need perhaps. If he said to her in all that he, the whole world does not argue that I do not need perhaps.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״חַמְשִׁין״ וְלָא שָׁווּ חַמְשִׁין – הָא לָא שָׁווּ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, דְּאָמַר ״חַמְשִׁין״ וְשָׁווּ חַמְשִׁין. רַבָּה אָמַר: לָא צְרִיכִי שׁוּמָא, דְּהָא שָׁווּ חַמְשִׁין. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: צְרִיכִי שׁוּמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתְּתָא לָא בְּקִיאָה בְּשׁוּמָא לָא סָמְכָה דַּעְתַּהּ.
human_translation: if he said to her fifty and they are not worth fifty they are not worth They disagree when he said fifty and they are worth fifty Rabba said: An appraisal not necessary as they are worth fifty Rav Yosef said: An appraisal necessary, because the woman is not an expert in appraisal she does not rely on
llm_translation: If one said to her "five" and they are not equal to five - behold, they are not equal. When they argue, for one said "five" and they are equal to five. Rabbah said: I do not need a perhaps, for behold, they are equal to five. Rav Yosef said: I need a perhaps, since since she is not knowledgeable in perhaps, she did not rely on her opinion.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי בְּכֹל דְּהוּ נָמֵי פְּלִיגִי. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכֶסֶף, מָה כֶּסֶף דְּקִיץ –
human_translation: There are who say even whatever disagree Rav Yosef said: worth money is like money Just as money is set,
llm_translation: There is one who says in all that they are arguing. Rav Yosef said: "Equal to silver, it is like silver. Just as silver is temporary -"

hebrew_text: אַף שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף נָמֵי דְּקִיץ.
human_translation: so too, worth money set,
llm_translation: Even equal silver is like a thorn.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״מִכֶּסֶף מִקְנָתוֹ״ – בְּכֶסֶף הוּא נִקְנֶה, וְאֵינוֹ נִקְנֶה בִּתְבוּאָה וְכֵלִים.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say As it is taught out of the money that he was bought for” He is acquired through money and he is not acquired through grain or vessels.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this to her, as it was taught: "From the money of his purchase" - with money he is acquired, and he is not acquired with produce and utensils.

hebrew_text: הַאי תְּבוּאָה וְכֵלִים הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא מַקְנוּ בְּהוּ כְּלָל, ״יָשִׁיב גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא – לְרַבּוֹת שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף כְּכֶסֶף;
human_translation: What are the circumstances these grains and vessels? If we say that cannot be acquired through them at all, the Merciful One states: “He shall give back the price of his redemption,” to include worth money as money.
llm_translation: This produce and vessels how much? If not bought with them in general, "he shall restore his redemption" said the Merciful One - to include equal value for equal value.

hebrew_text: וְאִי דְּלֵית בְּהוּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, מַאי אִירְיָא תְּבוּאָה וְכֵלִים, אֲפִילּוּ כֶּסֶף נָמֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאִית בְּהוּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא קַיְיצִי לָא?
human_translation: And if that they do not have the value of one peruta , why specifically grain and vessels? Even money Rather, is it not where do have the value of one peruta , but since they lack a set no,
llm_translation: And if it does not have a similar small part, what is the matter with produce and vessels, even real money! Rather, if it does have a similar small part, and since it does not rot, is it not so?

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בְּתוֹרַת כֶּסֶף הוּא נִקְנֶה, וְאֵין נִקְנֶה בְּתוֹרַת תְּבוּאָה וְכֵלִים, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ – חֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: And the other this is what he is saying: is acquired through the mode of money, and he is not acquired through the mode of grain or vessels. And what is this exchange.
llm_translation: And the other one, thus he said: With the law of money it is acquired, and it is not acquired with the law of produce and vessels, and what are they - exchanges.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר: פֵּירוֹת לָא עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם דְּלֵית בְּהוּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ ״מַאי אִירְיָא תְּבוּאָה, וְכֵלִים אֲפִילּוּ כֶּסֶף נָמֵי!״, לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר:
human_translation: but according to Rav Naḥman, who said produce cannot effect exchange, what can be said? Rather, Actually, do not have the value of one peruta . And as for that which you said: Why specifically grain and vessels; even money either, is speaking It is not necessary.
llm_translation: To Rav Nachman, who said: "I did not make an exchange for fruits, what can be said? Rather, it is because there is no equal value in it." And when you say, "What is the difference between produce and vessels, even if they are worth silver coins!" - he did not mean this.

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא כֶּסֶף, דְּאִי אִית בֵּיהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא, אֲבָל תְּבוּאָה וְכֵלִים, אֵימָא מִדִּמְקָרְבָא הֲנָאָתַיְיהוּ, גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It is not necessary money that if it has the value of one peruta , yes, if not, no, But grain and vessels, say that their benefit is available, decides and transfers himself teaches us
llm_translation: Not needed is silver, for if it contains a prutah - no, if not - no, but produce and vessels, say since they are close, he completes and acquires them, he is acquiring them for himself, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֵגֶל זֶה לְפִדְיוֹן בְּנִי״, ״טַלִּית זֹה לְפִדְיוֹן בְּנִי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. ״עֵגֶל זֶה בְּחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לְפִדְיוֹן בְּנִי״, ״טַלִּית זוֹ בְּחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים לְפִדְיוֹן בְּנִי״ – בְּנוֹ פָּדוּי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say As it is taught This calf for the redemption of my son, This cloak for the redemption of my son, he has said nothing. This calf of five sela for the redemption of my son, This cloak of five sela for the redemption of my son, his son is redeemed.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this to her, as it was taught: "This calf is for the redemption of my son," "This cloak is for the redemption of my son" - he did not say anything. "This calf with five sela for the redemption of my son," "This cloak with five sela for the redemption of my son" - his son is redeemed.

hebrew_text: הַאי פִּדְיוֹן, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא שָׁוֵי, כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ? אֶלָּא לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּשָׁוֵי, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא קַיְיצִי – לָא?
human_translation: What are the circumstances this redemption If we say that they are not worth is it in his Rather, is it not even though they are worth may not since their value is not set?
llm_translation: This redemption, how much is its value? Perhaps if it is not equal, all according to its kind? Rather, is it not even if it is not equal, and since it is not acquired - not?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא שָׁוֵי, וּכְגוֹן דְּקַבֵּיל כֹּהֵן עִילָּוֵיהּ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא שָׁקֵיל סוּדָרָא מִבֵּי פִּדְיוֹן הַבֵּן, אָמַר (לֵיהּ): לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים.
human_translation: No; actually, where is not worth and where the priest accepted upon himself This is like this which Rav Kahana, took a cloth [ sudara ] from the house the redemption of son. said to For me, I view five sela .
llm_translation: Not, forever, not equal, and as an example, not received, priest, his elevation. For this, Rav Kahana took a scarf from the redemption of the son, said (to him): "For me, see for me five stones."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן רַב כָּהֲנָא, דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא וּמִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ סוּדָרָא אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, אֲבָל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא – לָא. כִּי הָא דְּמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי זְבַן סוּדָרָא מֵאִימֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא מִקּוּבֵּי שָׁוֵי עַשְׂרָה בִּתְלֵיסַר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: We said only such as Rav Kahana, who is a great man and is required a cloth on his head. But everyone no, This is like this which Mar bar Rav Ashi bought a cloth from Rabba’s mother from Kovei for thirteen worth ten,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: We only said this in a case like Rav Kahana, for he is a great man and requires a head covering, but for everyone else - no. For example, when Mar bar Rav Ashe bought a head covering from the days of Rava, he paid ten for thirteen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״, וְנָתַן לָהּ דִּינָר – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיַשְׁלִים. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״מָנֶה״ וְיָהֵב לַהּ דִּינָר, כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לַהּ: ״עַל מְנָת״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, and he gave her dinar she is betrothed and he must complete What is the reason Since he said to her: one hundred dinars, and he gave her dinar, he is like one who said to her: on the condition
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "Be consecrated to me with a māneh," and he gave her a dinar - she is thereby consecrated, and he must fulfill his obligation. What is the reason? Since he said to her "māneh" and gave her a dinar, it is as if he said to her: "for the value of."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Huna says Rav says: anyone who states On the condition, it is stipulating from now.
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Anyone who says "al menat" is like saying "me'achshav."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״, וְהָיָה מוֹנֶה וְהוֹלֵךְ, וְרָצָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן לַחֲזוֹר אֲפִילּוּ בַּדִּינָר הָאַחֲרוֹן – הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: raises an objection Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, and he was counting one of them wanted to retract it is in the power even when the last
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was raised: "Be consecrated to me with a maneh," and he was counting and walking, and if one of them wanted to retract even with the last dinar - the permission is in his hand.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמַר ״בְּמָנֶה זֶה״. הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא ״בְּמָנֶה זֶה״, רֵישָׁא בְּמָנֶה סְתָם,
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where he says with this one hundred dinars. From the latter clause With this one hundred dinars, the first clause an unspecified one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That he said, "with this coin." Here, from the latter part, "with this coin," the beginning with a general coin.

hebrew_text: דְּקָא תָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמַר לָהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה זֶה״ וְנִמְצָא מָנֶה חָסֵר דִּינָר, אוֹ דִּינָר שֶׁל נְחֹשֶׁת – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. דִּינָר רַע – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיַחְלִיף.
human_translation: As it is taught in the latter clause he said Be betrothed to me with this one hundred dinars, and it was found to be one hundred dinars less a dinar, or a dinar of copper she is not betrothed. a flawed dinar, she is betrothed, and he must exchange
llm_translation: The text teaches in its conclusion: He said to her, "Be consecrated to me with this maneh," and if a maneh is found lacking a dinar, or a dinar of copper - she is not consecrated. A bad dinar - she is consecrated, and he shall exchange.

hebrew_text: לָא, רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא דְּאָמַר ״בְּמָנֶה זֶה״, וּפָרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ: רָצָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן לַחֲזוֹר, אֲפִילּוּ בְּדִינָר הָאַחֲרוֹן – הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ. כֵּיצַד – כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״בְּמָנֶה זוֹ״.
human_translation: No; first clause and the latter clause where he said: With this one hundred dinars, and is explaining one of them wishes to retract the it is in the power even when the last How so? where he said to her: With this one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: The beginning and the end that says "in this manner," and the commentators explain: If one of them wants to retract, even with the last coin - the authority is in his hands. How so - for example, if he said to her "in this manner."

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ רֵישָׁא בְּמָנֶה סְתָם, הַשְׁתָּא בְּמָנֶה סְתָם לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, ״בְּמָנֶה זֶה״ מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: And so too, it is reasonable as, if it enters your mind the first clause to an unspecified one hundred dinars, Now it is not a betrothal in an unspecified one hundred dinars, is necessary With this one hundred dinars?
llm_translation: And thus it is fitting to say, for if it enters your mind that initially it was in a specific quantity, now in a different quantity they were not sanctified, "with this quantity" is it necessary?

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא לָא אִירְיָא – תְּנָא סֵיפָא לְגַלּוֹיֵי רֵישָׁא, שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר רֵישָׁא ״בְּמָנֶה זֶה״, אֲבָל בְּמָנֶה סְתָם הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, תְּנָא סֵיפָא ״בְּמָנֶה זֶה״, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא בְּמָנֶה סְתָם, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: If it is due to that there is no argument, taught the latter clause to reveal the first clause. that you should not say that the first clause With this one hundred dinars, but in an unspecified one hundred dinars, it a betrothal. taught the latter clause: With this one hundred dinars, by inference that the first clause to an unspecified one hundred dinars, and even so it is not a betrothal.
llm_translation: If not for this reason, it would not be called - a Tanna taught the latter clause to reveal the former, that you should not say in the former "with this coin," but rather with an unspecified coin they were betrothed. A Tanna taught the latter clause "with this coin," to include the former in an unspecified coin, and even so, they were not betrothed.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מוֹנֶה וְהוֹלֵךְ שָׁאנֵי, דְּדַעְתַּהּ אַכּוּלֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: was counting is different. that she has the entirety in mind,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: One who counts and walks, both are forgotten.

hebrew_text: הַאי דִּינָר שֶׁל נְחֹשֶׁת, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּיָדְעָה בֵּיהּ – הָא סְבַרָה וְקַבִּלָה! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּיַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלַיהּ בְּלֵילְיָא, אִי נָמֵי דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח לַיהּ בֵּינֵי זוּזֵי.
human_translation: What are the circumstances of this copper dinar If she knows that it she knew and accepted No; necessary where he gave her at night Alternatively, it was found among dinars,
llm_translation: This dinar of copper, what are its laws? If she is familiar with it - she thought and accepted! It is not necessary, for she gives it to him to manage at night, or if she finds it between the coins.

hebrew_text: הַאי דִּינָר רַע הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא נָפֵיק – הַיְינוּ דִּינָר שֶׁל נְחֹשֶׁת! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן דְּנָפֵיק עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק.
human_translation: What are the circumstances of this flawed dinar, If it cannot be spent, this is a copper dinar, Rav Pappa said: where can be spent with difficulty,
llm_translation: This dinar, how much is it worth? If it does not come out - that is a dinar of copper! Rav Papa said: For example, if it comes out under duress.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָמַר לַהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״, וְהִנִּיחַ לָהּ מַשְׁכּוֹן עֲלֵיהֶ[ם] – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת,
human_translation: Rava says Rav Naḥman says: one said to Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, and he gave her collateral for she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: He said to her, "Be consecrated to me with a mohar," and he placed a dwelling for her - she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: מָנֶה אֵין כָּאן – מַשְׁכּוֹן אֵין כָּאן. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: קִידְּשָׁה בְּמַשְׁכּוֹן מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! הָתָם בְּמַשְׁכּוֹן דַּאֲחֵרִים וְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: There is no one hundred dinars here, there is no collateral here, Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman he betrothed her with collateral, she is betrothed. There, to collateral to other and in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak.
llm_translation: Portion there is not - dwelling place there is not. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: If she consecrated with a dwelling place, she is sanctified! There, with a dwelling place of others, as Rabbi Yitzchak said.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְךָ תִּהְיֶה צְדָקָה״ – אִם אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה, צְדָקָה מִנַּיִן? מִכָּאן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From where that a creditor acquires collateral, As it is stated: and it shall be righteousness to you” If does not acquire from where righteousness from here that a creditor acquires collateral
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we derive that a creditor who acquires collateral - as it is stated: "And righteousness will be credited to you" (Proverbs 3:4) - if he does not acquire it, from where does righteousness come? From here we learn that a creditor who acquires collateral.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי רַב הוּנָא בַּר אָבִין זְבוּן הָהִיא אַמְתָּא בִּפְרִיטֵי, לָא הֲווֹ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, אוֹתִיבוּ נְסָכָא עֲלֵיהּ. לְסוֹף אִיַּיקַּר אַמְתָּא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: פְּרִיטֵי אֵין כָּאן, נְסָכָא אֵין כָּאן.
human_translation: The sons of Rav Huna bar Avin bought a certain maidservant with perutot . They did not have they gave a piece of silver [ naskha ] for her Ultimately, maidservant increased They came before Rabbi Ami he said to them: There are no perutot here, there is no piece of silver here
llm_translation: Sons of Rav Huna son of Avin: Zevun that maidservant in Pritai, did not they have in their hands, they brought a libation for it. In the end, the maidservant became precious. They came before Rabbi Ammi, he said to them: "There are no Pritai here, there are no libations here."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״, נְטָלַתּוּ וּזְרָקַתּוּ לַיָּם אוֹ לָאוּר אוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר הָאָבֵד – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. הָא שְׁדֵיתִינְהוּ קַמֵּיהּ – הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין? הָא קָאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: שְׁקֵיל, לָא בָּעֵינָא!
human_translation: The Sages taught Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, she took it and threw it into the sea, or into the fire, or into anything that destroys, she is not betrothed. but threw the coins before him that is a betrothal. she is saying to him: Take I do not want
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Consecrate to Me with a coin," if one took it and threw it into the sea or into a fire or into anything that will cause it to be lost - it is not considered consecrated. If she showed it to him - were the consecrations made? She said to him: Take it, I do not want it!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָא אָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא שְׁדֵיתִינְהוּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּלָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, אֲבָל זְרָקַתּוּ לַיָּם אוֹ לָאוּר אֵימָא כֵּיוָן דְּמִיחַיְּיבָא בְּהוּ, קַדּוֹשֵׁי קַדִּישׁ נַפְשָׁהּ, וְהָא דְּקָא עָבְדָא הָכִי, סָבְרָא: אֶיבְדְּקֵיהּ לְהַאי גַּבְרָא אִי רַתְחָנָא הוּא אוֹ לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary she throws before him that it is not a betrothal, But she throws it into the sea or into the fire, say since she is obligated for she betrothed herself And as she did this she thought: I will test this man if he is an angry or not. teaches us
llm_translation: He does not require, he said: he does not require, I have thrown them before him that they were not sanctified, but if he threw it into the sea or into the fire, I would say since he is liable for it, he has sanctified his holy soul. And what he did was like this, he thought: I will check with this man whether he is a wizard or not, he is listening to us.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״ – ״תְּנֵם, לְאַבָּא וּלְאָבִיךָ״ – אֵינָהּ ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיְּקַבְּלוּם לִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, Give to father, to your father, she is not betrothed. on the condition that he accepts them for me, she is betrothed.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Consecrate yourself to Me with a coin" - "Give them, to your father and to your mother" - she is not consecrated. "On condition that they accept them for Me" - she is consecrated.

hebrew_text: תְּנָא אַבָּא לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחַ דְּרֵישָׁא, תְּנָא אָבִיךָ לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחַ דְּסֵיפָא.
human_translation: taught father, to convey the far-reaching nature of the first clause. taught your father, to convey the far-reaching nature of the latter clause.
llm_translation: The Tanna Abba to inform you the strength of the first clause, the Tanna your father to inform you the strength of the latter clause.

hebrew_text: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״ – ״תְּנֵם לִפְלוֹנִי״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיְּקַבְּלֵם לִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וּצְרִיכָא,
human_translation: Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, Give them to so-and-so, she is not betrothed. On the condition that he accepts them for me, she is betrothed. It is necessary
llm_translation: "Sanctify yourself to me with a coin" - "Give them to so-and-so" - she is not sanctified. "On the condition that he will accept them for me" - she is sanctified. And the conclusion is,

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן ״אַבָּא וְאָבִיךְ״, הָתָם הוּא דְּכִי אָמְרָה ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיְּקַבְּלוּם לִי״ – הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, דְּסָמְכָה דַּעְתַּהּ עִילָּ[וַ]יְהוּ, סָבְרָה: עָבְדִין לִי שְׁלִיחוּתַאי. אֲבָל פְּלוֹנִי – לָא,
human_translation: because if taught us Give to father, to your father, it is there, when she said: On the condition that accepts them for me, it is a betrothal, as she relies on them thinks: They will do my bidding for me But so-and-so, no,
llm_translation: If we were to hear "your father and your mother," there, that is when she said, "in order that they accept them for me" - they are considered married, for her mind was firmly established, she thought: they are acting as my agents. But so-and-so - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן פְּלוֹנִי, הָכָא הוּא דְּכִי אַמְרַהּ ״תְּנֵם לִפְלוֹנִי״ – לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, דְּלָא מְקָרְבָא דַּעְתַּהּ לְגַבֵּיהּ לְמִיתְּבֵהּ לֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנָה, אֲבָל ״אַבָּא וְאָבִיךְ״, דִּמְקָרְבָא דַּעְתַּהּ לְגַבַּיְיהוּ, אֵימָא בְּמַתָּנָה יַהֲבִיתֵיהּ נִיהֲלַיְיהוּ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us so-and-so, It is here, when she said: Give it to so-and-so, it is not a betrothal, she is not close to him giving him as a gift. But Give to father, to your father, to whom she is close, say she gave it to them as a gift, It was necessary
llm_translation: If we hear about a certain person, here is where it is said, "Give them to so-and-so" - the sanctifications were not valid, because her intention was not to give them to him as a gift, but "your father and mother," where her intention was to give them to them as a gift, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״ – ״תְּנֵם עַל גַּבֵּי סֶלַע״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְאִם הָיָה סֶלַע שֶׁלָּהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. בָּעֵי רַב בִּיבִי: סֶלַע שֶׁל שְׁנֵיהֶם, מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, Place them on a rock, she is not betrothed. And if rock was hers, she is betrothed. Rav Beivai raises a dilemma: rock was of both of them, what is shall stand
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Consecrate yourself to Me with a coin" - "Place them on the top of the rock" - it is not sanctified. And if it was her own rock - it is sanctified. Rav Beivi inquired: What if it is a rock belonging to both of them? The matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּכִכָּר״ – ״תְּנֵהוּ לְכֶלֶב״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְאִם הָיָה כֶּלֶב שֶׁלָּהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. בָּעֵי רַב מָרִי: כֶּלֶב רָץ אַחֲרֶיהָ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Be betrothed to me with a loaf Give it to a dog, she is not betrothed. And if dog was hers, she is betrothed. Rav Mari raises a dilemma: a dog chasing her what is
llm_translation: "Sanctify yourself to me with a coin" - "Give it to the dog" - she is not sanctified. And if it was her dog - she is sanctified. Rav Mari asked: If a dog runs after her, what is the law?

hebrew_text: בְּהָהוּא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא מַצְּלָה נַפְשָׁהּ מִינֵּיהּ גָּמְרָה וּמַקְנְיָא לֵיהּ נַפְשָׁהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא מָצֵי אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: ״מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא חַיּוֹבֵי מְחַיְּיבַתְּ לַאֲצוּלַן״? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: she commits herself and transfers herself through this benefit that by being rescued Or perhaps she can say to him: By Torah law you are required to rescue me, shall stand
llm_translation: In that case of pleasure, where she is saving her soul from him, she has completed and acquires her soul, or perhaps she finds and says to him: "From the Torah, are you obligated to save them?" It remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּכִכָּר״ – ״תְּנֵהוּ לְעָנִי״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, אֲפִילּוּ עָנִי הַסָּמוּךְ עָלֶיהָ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דִּמְחַיַּיבְנָא בֵּיהּ אֲנָא, הָכִי מְחַיְּיבַתְּ בֵּיהּ אַתְּ.
human_translation: Be betrothed to me with a loaf Give it to a poor person, she is not betrothed, even a poor person who is dependent upon her, What is the reason say to him: Just as I am required him, so too you are required him.
llm_translation: "Sanctify yourself to Me with a coin" - "Give it to the poor" - It does not sanctify, even if a poor person is dependent on it. What is the reason? She said to him: Just as I am obligated in it, so you are obligated in it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא מְזַבֵּין
human_translation: a certain man who was selling
llm_translation: That man who was slaughtering

hebrew_text: חוּמְרֵי פְּתַכְיָיתָא. אֲתַאי הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי חַד שׂוֹכָא״. אֲמַר לַהּ: ״אִי יָהֲבִינָא לִיךְ מִיקַּדְּשַׁתְּ לִי״? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״הַבָה מֵיהֲבָה״. אָמַר רַב חָמָא: כֹּל ״הַבָה מֵיהֲבָה״ לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: beads [ ḥumrei ] of glass [ petakhyata ]. A certain woman came said to him: Give me one string. He said to her: If I give you will you be betrothed to me She said to him: Give, give. Rav Ḥama said: Any Give, give, is nothing.
llm_translation: The matter of a persuasive woman. There was a certain woman who came, she said to him: "Give me a palm branch." He said to her: "If I give it to you, will you be consecrated to me?" She said to him: "Give it to me." Rav Ḥama said: Anything that is given freely is worth nothing.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא שָׁתֵי חַמְרָא בְּחָנוּתָא. אֲתַאי הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי חַד כָּסָא״. אֲמַר לַהּ: ״אִי יָהֵיבְנָא לִיךְ מִיקַּדְּשַׁתְּ לִי״? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״אַשְׁקוֹיֵי אַשְׁקְיַין״. אָמַר רַב חָמָא: כֹּל ״אַשְׁקוֹיֵי אַשְׁקְיַין״ לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: a certain man who was drinking wine in a store. A woman came said to him: Give me one cup He said to her: If I give you you be betrothed to me She said to him: Give to drink, give to me to drink. Rav Ḥama said any Give to drink, give to me to drink, is nothing,
llm_translation: That man who was drinking wine in the inn. Came that woman, she said to him: "Give me a cup." He said to her: "If I give you from the holy, will you drink?" She said to him: "I drink cups." Rav Ḥama said: All "I drink cups" is nothing.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא שָׁדֵי תַּמְרֵי מִדִּקְלָא. אֲתַאי הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״שְׁדִי לִי תַּרְתֵּי״! אֲמַר לַהּ: ״אִי שָׁדֵינָא לִיךְ מִיקַּדְּשַׁתְּ לִי״? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״שְׁדִי מִישְׁדָּא״. אָמַר רַב זְבִיד: כֹּל ״שְׁדִי מִישְׁדָּא״ לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: a certain man who was picking dates from a date tree. A certain woman came said to him: Throw me two. He said to her: If I throw to you you be betrothed to me She said to him: Throw, throw. Rav Zevid said: Any use Throw, throw, is nothing,
llm_translation: That man who was cutting dates from a palm tree. A certain woman came, she said to him: "Cut for me two!" He said to her: "If I cut for you, will you be consecrated to me?" She said to him: "Cut from the top." Rav Zevid said: Any "cut from the top" is nothing.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״הַב״, ״אַשְׁקִי״, ״וּשְׁדִי״, מַהוּ? – אָמַר רָבִינָא: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַב סַמָּא בַּר רַקְתָּא אָמַר: תָּגָא דְמַלְכָּא! אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְהִלְכְתָא: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Give, Give to drink, Throw, what is Ravina said: She is betrothed. Rav Sama bar Rakta said By the king’s crown! She is not betrothed. And the halakha she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The Gemara asked them: "Ha," "Ashki," "Ushdi," what is it? - Ravina said: consecrated. Rav Sama bar Rakta said: the crown of the king! It is not consecrated. And the halakha is: it is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: שִׁירָאֵי לָא צְרִיכִי שׁוּמָא. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: And the halakha silk appraisal not necessary And the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, And the halakha in accordance with Rava, Rav Naḥman said
llm_translation: The Halakha: The singing is not necessary. And the Halakha is like Rabbi Elazar, and the Halakha is like Rava. Rav Nachman said.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בִּשְׁטָר כֵּיצַד? כָּתַב לוֹ עַל הַנְּיָיר אוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְרוּטָה, ״בִּתְּךָ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״, ״בִּתְּךָ מְאוֹרֶסֶת לִי״, ״בִּתְּךָ לִי לְאִינְתּוּ״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: How is with a document? wrote for on paper or earthenware, despite that is not worth one peruta : Your daughter is betrothed [ mekuddeshet ] to me, Your daughter is betrothed [ me’oreset ] to me, Your daughter is to me as a wife, she is betrothed.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: In a document, how so? He wrote for him on paper or on pottery, even though it is not worth a prutah, "Your daughter is betrothed to me," "Your daughter is engaged to me," "Your daughter is to me as a wife" – she is thereby betrothed.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא בַּר מֶמֶל: הָא לָא דָּמֵי הַאי שְׁטָרָא לִשְׁטַר זְבִינֵי! הָתָם, מוֹכֵר כּוֹתֵב לוֹ ״שָׂדִי מְכוּרָה לָךְ״, הָכָא בַּעַל כּוֹתֵב ״בִּתְּךָ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira bar Memel objects to this But this document is not comparable to a bill of sale. There, seller writes to My field is sold to you. Here, husband, writes: Your daughter is betrothed to me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira bar Memel objected to him: Is this document similar to that document? There, the seller writes to him, "My field is sold to you," but here the husband writes, "Your daughter is betrothed to me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָתָם מֵעִנְיָינָא דִּקְרָא וְהָכָא מֵעִנְיָינָא דִּקְרָא. הָתָם כְּתִיב ״וּמָכַר מֵאֲחֻזָּתוֹ״ – בְּמוֹכֵר תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא, הָכָא כְּתִיב ״כִּי יִקַּח״ – בְּבַעַל תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: Rava said: There, from the context of the verse, and here, from the context of the verse. There, it is written: “And sells of his ancestral land” the Merciful One renders dependent on the seller. Here, it is written: “If takes the Merciful One renders dependent on the husband.
llm_translation: Rava said: There, regarding the matter of Scripture, and here, regarding the matter of Scripture. There, it is written "and he shall sell his possession" - the Merciful One depends on the seller, here it is written "when he acquires" - the Merciful One depends on the buyer.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״שָׂדוֹת בַּכֶּסֶף יִקְנוּ״! קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״יַקְנוּ״. מַאי טַעְמָא קָרֵית בֵּיהּ ״יַקְנוּ״ – מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״וּמָכַר״, הָכִי נָמֵי קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״כִּי יַקַּח״, דִּכְתִיב ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: There, it is also written: “Men shall buy [ yiknu ] fields for money” Read into [ yikkanu ]. What is the reason you read it yikkanu ; because it is written “And sells,” So too, read into [ ki yakiaḥ ], as it is written: “I gave my daughter to this man”
llm_translation: There, it is written "fields with silver they shall acquire"! It reads in it "they shall acquire". What is the reason it reads in it "they shall acquire" - because it is written "and he sold", thus it reads in it "when he acquires", as it is written "I have given my daughter to this man".

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא נִינְהוּ וְאַסְמְכִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן אַקְּרָאֵי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״וָאֶקַּח אֶת סֵפֶר הַמִּקְנָה״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: they are a halakha and the Sages based them on verses. And if you wish, say: There too, it is written “And I took the deed of purchase”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: They are a Halakha and the Rabbis support it with Scriptural verses. And if you wish, say: There, too, it is written, "And I took the deed of the purchase."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כָּתַב לוֹ עַל הַנְּיָיר אוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְרוּטָה, ״בִּתְּךָ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״, ״בִּתְּךָ מְאוֹרֶסֶת לִי״, ״בִּתְּךָ לִי לְאִינְתּוּ״, בֵּין עַל יְדֵי אָבִיהָ בֵּין עַל יְדֵי עַצְמָהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת מִדַּעְתּוֹ, וְהוּא שֶׁלֹּא בָּגְרָה.
human_translation: And Rava says Rav Naḥman says: wrote for him on paper or earthenware, despite that is not worth one peruta : Your daughter is betrothed [ mekuddeshet ] to me, Your daughter is betrothed [ me’oreset ] to me, Your daughter is to me as a wife, whether to her father or whether to her, she is betrothed with the consent And this that she has not reached her majority,
llm_translation: And Rava said, Rabbi Nachman said: If he wrote for him on paper or on pottery, even though it is not worth a prutah, "Your daughter is consecrated to me," "Your daughter is betrothed to me," "Your daughter is to me as a wife," whether by the hand of her father or by her own hand - she is consecrated by his knowledge, even if she has not reached maturity.

hebrew_text: כָּתַב לָהּ עַל הַנְּיָיר אוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְרוּטָה, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ לִי לְאִינְתּוּ״, ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְאוֹרֶסֶת לִי״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, בֵּין עַל יְדֵי אָבִיהָ, בֵּין עַל יְדֵי עַצְמָהּ, מִדַּעְתָּהּ, וְהוּא שֶׁבָּגְרָה.
human_translation: If he wrote for her on paper or earthenware, despite that is not worth one peruta : You are hereby betrothed [ mekuddeshet ] to me, You are hereby to me as a wife, You are hereby betrothed [ me’oreset ] to me, she is betrothed whether to her father to her, with her consent. And this is that she has reached her majority
llm_translation: He wrote for her on the paper or on the pottery, even though it is not worth a prutah, "Behold, you are sanctified to me," "Behold, you are betrothed to me," "Behold, you are married to me" - she is sanctified, whether by the hand of her father, or by her own hand, with her knowledge, and he is an adult.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: שְׁטַר אֵירוּסִין שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, מַהוּ? הֲוָיוֹת לִיצִיאוֹת מַקְּשִׁינַן, מָה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish raises a dilemma: a document of betrothal that was written not for her sake, what is we juxtapose modes of becoming to modes of leaving Just as
llm_translation: The request of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: A marriage contract that was written not for its intended purpose, what? We are concerned about possible complications. What?

hebrew_text: יְצִיאָה בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ – אַף הֲוָיָיה בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא הֲוָיוֹת לַהֲדָדֵי מַקְּשִׁינַן, מָה הֲוָיָיה דְכֶסֶף לָא בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ – אַף הֲוָיָיה דִשְׁטָר לָא בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ?
human_translation: we require leaving, for her sake, so too, we require becoming for her sake. Or perhaps we juxtapose modes of becoming to each other Just as we do not require becoming with money for her sake, so too, we do not require becoming with a document for her sake.
llm_translation: Outgoing for its own sake - even if outgoing for its own sake, or perhaps outgoing for the sake of Hadadei we are concerned, just as outgoing of money not for its own sake - even outgoing of a document not for its own sake?

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּבַעְיָא הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: הֲוָיָיה לִיצִיאָה מַקְּשִׁינַן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְיָצְאָה״ ״וְהָיְתָה״.
human_translation: After he raised the dilemma, then resolved it. We juxtapose becoming to leaving as the verse states: “And she departs and becomes”
llm_translation: After Be'aya asked, she then explained: We are concerned for its removal, as the verse states "and it shall go out" and "and it shall be."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: כְּתָבוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ, וְשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ – רָבָא וְרָבִינָא אָמְרִי: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא אָמְרִי: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידְהוּ וְאֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידִי. אֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידְהוּ – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָצְאָה״ ״וְהָיְתָה״ – מַקִּישׁ הֲוָיָיה לִיצִיאָה, מָה יְצִיאָה לִשְׁמָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ, אַף הֲוָיָיה נָמֵי לִשְׁמָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ.
human_translation: It was stated wrote for her sake but without her consent, Rava and Ravina say: She is betrothed. Rav Pappa and Rav Sherevya say: She is not betrothed. Rav Pappa said: I will say their reason and I will say my reason. I will state their reason, as it is written: “And she departs and becomes,” juxtaposes becoming to leaving Just as leaving for her own sake but without her consent, so too, becoming for her own sake and without her consent.
llm_translation: It was stated: If he wrote it for her sake, and without her knowledge - Rava and Ravina said: it is sanctified. Rav Pappa and Rav Sheravya said: it is not sanctified. Rav Pappa said: Let us consider the reasoning of each side, and let us consider my reasoning. Let us consider their reasoning - for it is written: "and she shall go out" "and she shall become" - he equates existence with going out, just as going out can be for her sake and without her knowledge, so too existence can also be for her sake and without her knowledge.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא טַעְמָא דִידִי: ״וְיָצְאָה״ ״וְהָיְתָה״ – מַקִּישׁ הֲוָיָיה לִיצִיאָה, מָה יְצִיאָה בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת מַקְנֶה, אַף הֲוָיָיה בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת מַקְנֶה.
human_translation: And I will say my reason: “And she departs and becomes.” juxtaposes becoming to leaving Just as leaving we require the consent of the one transferring so too, becoming we require the consent of the one transferring
llm_translation: And why not the reason according to me: "and she shall go out" "and she shall be" - it equates existence to going out, just as we require intent for acquisition, so too we require intent for existence.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין שְׁטָרֵי אֵירוּסִין וְנִשּׂוּאִין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת שְׁנֵיהֶן. מַאי לָאו שְׁטָרֵי אֵירוּסִין וְנִשּׂוּאִין מַמָּשׁ! לָא, שְׁטָרֵי פְּסִיקָתָא. וְכִדְרַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב,
human_translation: raises an objection One writes documents of betrothal and marriage only with the consent of both What, is not actual documents of betrothal and marriage, No, documents of stipulation, And in accordance with Rav Giddel Rav says.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: One does not write marriage contracts and divorce documents except with the consent of both parties. What, is it not actual marriage contracts and divorce documents? No, it is documents of cessation. And as Rav Gidel said, Rav...

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: ״כַּמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִנְךָ״? – ״כָּךְ וְכָךְ״, ״לְבִתְּךָ״? – ״כָּךְ וְכָךְ״, עָמְדוּ וְקִדְּשׁוּ – קָנוּ, הֵן הֵן הַדְּבָרִים הַנִּקְנִים בַּאֲמִירָה.
human_translation: As Rav Giddel says Rav says: How much are you giving to your son? Such and such, to your daughter? Such and such, they, arose and betrothed, they acquire These are the matters that are acquired through speech,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "De'amar Rav Gidel Amar Rav: 'Kama atah noten le'vincha?' - 'Kach ve'kach', 'le'bitcha?' - 'Kach ve'kach', amdu ve'kidshu - kanu, hen hen hadvarim haniknim ba'amira." English translation: "As Rav Gidel said in the name of Rav: 'How much do you give to your son?' - 'This and this', 'to your daughter?' - 'This and this', they stood and consecrated - they acquired, these are the things that are acquired through speech."

hebrew_text: וּבְבִיאָה. מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״בְּעֻלַת בַּעַל״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה לָהּ בַּעַל עַל יְדֵי בְעִילָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּעוּרָה זוֹ שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבִּי ״וּבְעָלָהּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה?
human_translation: through sexual intercourse. From where do we Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said the verse states: a married woman [ beulat ba’al ]” teaches that he becomes her husband [ ba’al ] by means of sexual intercourse [ be’ila ]. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abbahu, and some say Reish Lakish to Rabbi Yoḥanan: this taught by Rabbi unacceptable: and engages in sexual intercourse with her” teaches she can be acquired through intercourse.
llm_translation: In the matter of intercourse. From where do we derive this? Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: As the verse states "the act of her husband" - this teaches that she becomes a wife through intercourse. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abbahu, and some say it was Reish Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: Like a mirror that reflects. "And her husband" - this teaches that she is acquired through intercourse.

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא עַד דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ וַהֲדַר בָּעֵיל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: if from there, I would say unless he betroths and then engages in intercourse teaches us
llm_translation: From there, I would have said until he sanctifies and then engages in intercourse, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: אִם כֵּן, נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא בִּסְקִילָה, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel objects to this: if so, a betrothed young woman, the Merciful One states by stoning , how can you find
llm_translation: Challenges her Rabbi Abba bar Memel: If so, the betrothed maiden, as the Merciful One said in stoning, how do you forget her?

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאקַדֵּישׁ וַהֲדַר בְּעֵיל בְּעוּלָה הִיא, אִי דְּאקַדֵּישׁ וְלָא בְּעֵיל לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא! אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ אָרוּס שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: If where he betrothed and then engaged in sexual intercourse she is a non-virgin, If where he betrothed and did not engage in intercourse is nothing, The Rabbis said before Abaye: You find it where betrothed man engaged in intercourse with her in an atypical manner,
llm_translation: If he consecrated and then had intercourse, it is considered as if he consecrated and it is not considered as if he had intercourse at all! The sages said before Abaye: "You find her, for example, when a betrothed man came upon her not in the usual manner."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן אֶלָּא בְּאַחֵר, אֲבָל בַּעַל – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – עֲשָׂאָהּ בְּעוּלָה!
human_translation: Abaye said to Rabbi and the Rabbis disagree only with regard to another But husband, everyone agrees if he engages in intercourse in an atypical manner with her he has rendered her a non-virgin.
llm_translation: He said to them, Abaye: Until here they do not argue, Rabbi and the Rabbis, except in another case, but with regard to a husband - everyone agrees, if he came upon her not in the usual manner - he has made her a wife!

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: בָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים, וַעֲדַיִין הִיא בְּתוּלָה – כּוּלָּן בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר אֲנִי: הָרִאשׁוֹן בִּסְקִילָה, וְכוּלָּן בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: What is As it is taught ten men engaged in sexual intercourse with and she is still a virgin, they are all by stoning. Rabbi says: I say the first by stoning, but all by strangulation.
llm_translation: What is it? For it was taught: If ten men had relations with her, and she is still a virgin - all of them are liable to stoning. Rabbi says, I say: The first one is liable to stoning, and all of them to strangulation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּדְּשָׁהּ בִּשְׁטָר, הוֹאִיל וְגוֹמֵר וּמוֹצִיא, גּוֹמֵר וּמַכְנִיס.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said You find where he betrothed her with a document. since completely removes completely brings
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "She forgets her like one who betrothed her with a document, since he finishes and takes out, he finishes and brings in."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הַאי ״וּבְעָלָהּ״, מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ – זוֹ נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה, וְאֵין אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, do with this and engages in sexual intercourse with her” He requires that this can be acquired through intercourse, but a Hebrew maidservant cannot be acquired through intercourse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, this "uv'alah," what does he do with it? That one acquires it through intercourse, and a Hebrew maidservant is not acquired through intercourse.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא תֵּיתֵי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיבָמָה: וּמָה יְבָמָהּ שֶׁאֵין נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף, נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה, זוֹ, שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנִּקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה?
human_translation: enter your mind to say: Let be derived through an a fortiori from a yevama : Just as a yevama , who cannot be acquired through money can be acquired through intercourse, is it not logical that this who can be acquired through money, can be acquired through intercourse?
llm_translation: I ascend of your opinion, I say, it is logical and a fortiori from Yibum: And what is Yibum that is not acquired with money, it is acquired with intercourse, this one, that is acquired with money, is it not logical that it is acquired with intercourse?

hebrew_text: מָה לִיבָמָה, שֶׁכֵּן זְקוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִב ״אִם אַחֶרֶת יִקַּח לוֹ״, הִקִּישָׁהּ הַכָּתוּב לְאַחֶרֶת. מָה אַחֶרֶת מִיקַּנְיָא בְּבִיאָה – אַף אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה מִיקַּנְיָא בְּבִיאָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What about a yevama is that she is bound and standing enter your mind to say Since it is written “If he take himself another verse juxtaposes with another Just as another can be acquired through intercourse, so too, a Hebrew maidservant can be acquired through intercourse. Therefore, teaches us,
llm_translation: The text reads: "What is the status of Yibum, that it is so necessary and standing. Would you say: Since it is written 'if he takes another,' the verse compared her to another. Just as 'another' acquires through intercourse - so too, an Amah Hebrew acquires through intercourse, this is what the verse teaches us."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, הַאי סְבָרָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״וּבָעַל״, מַאי ״וּבְעָלָהּ״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And Rabbi from where does he this conclusion If so, let the Merciful One write And he engages in sexual intercourse. What “And he engages in sexual intercourse with her”? Learn two from it.
llm_translation: Rabbi, does this reasoning establish it for him? If so, let the Merciful One write "and her husband," what is "and her husband" - infer from it two.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא דְּאָמַר: בַּר אֲהִינָא אַסְבְּרַהּ לִי: ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה וּבְעָלָהּ״ – קִידּוּשִׁין הַמְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And according to Rava, who said: Bar Ahina explained this to me “When a man takes a woman and engages in sexual intercourse with her” betrothal that is given to consummation, is a betrothal, betrothal that is not given to consummation is not betrothal, what is there to say?
llm_translation: And for Rava who said: Bar Ahina reasoned to me: "When a man takes a woman and marries her" - Kiddushin that are designated for intercourse are Kiddushin, Kiddushin that are not designated for intercourse are not Kiddushin. What can be said about this?

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״אוֹ בְעָלָהּ״, מַאי ״וּבְעָלָהּ״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: If so, let the verse write: or engages in intercourse with her. What is “And engages in sexual intercourse with her”? learn from all
llm_translation: If so it is written in the verse "or her husband," what is "and her husband" - learn from it all of them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, הַאי ״בְּעֻלַת בַּעַל״, מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ – בַּעַל עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָהּ בְּעוּלָה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאֵין אַחֵר עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָהּ בְּעוּלָה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi what does he do with this a married woman [ beulat ba’al ]” requires this the husband renders her a non-virgin in intercourse in an atypical manner, but no other renders her a non-virgin in intercourse in an atypical manner.
llm_translation: Rabbi, this "Ba'alat Ba'al," what does he do with her? He requires her - the husband does her in a manner not customary, and another does her in a manner not customary.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי הַאי סְבָרָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: בָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים וַעֲדַיִין הִיא בְּתוּלָה – כּוּלָּם בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אוֹמֵר אֲנִי הָרִאשׁוֹן בִּסְקִילָה, וְכוּלָּם בְּחֶנֶק!
