human_translation: And does Rabbi accept this opinion? But isn’t it taught ten men engaged in intercourse with and she is still a virgin, they are all by stoning. Rabbi says: I say the first by stoning, but all by strangulation.
llm_translation: And who holds the opinion of Rabbi Hai Svara? And it was taught: Ten men came upon her and she is still a virgin - all of them by stoning. Rabbi says: I am the first to say stoning, and all of them by strangulation!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי לְעִנְיַן קְנָס דְּכוּלְּהוּ מְשַׁלְּמִי. מַאי שְׁנָא מִקְּטָלָא? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וּמֵת הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב עִמָּהּ לְבַדּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi concedes with regard to fine that they all pay what is different from death is different there, as the verse states: “Then the man only who lay with her shall die”
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi concedes regarding the matter of a penalty that they all pay. What is different about a murderer? It is different there, as the verse says: "But the man who lay with her alone shall die."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן הַאי ״לְבַדּוֹ״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, ״וּמֵתוּ גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שָׁוִין כְּאֶחָד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״וּמֵת הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב עִמָּהּ לְבַדּוֹ״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “only”? They require it for that which is taught “Then they shall both of them die” unless are equal, the statement of Rabbi Oshaya. Rabbi Yonatan says “Then the man only who lay with her shall die,”
llm_translation: The sages: What does the term "alone" do for it? They require it for what was taught in a Baraita: "And they shall both die" - until they are equal as one, the words of Rabbi Oshaya. Rabbi Yonatan says: "And the man who lay with her alone shall die."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הַאי סְבָרָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״בְּעוּלַת אִישׁ״, מַאי ״בְּעוּלַת בַּעַל״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, from where does he this conclusion If so, let the verse write: a beulat ish , What “ beulat ba’al ,” Learn two from it:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, does this opinion hold for him? If so, it is written in the verse "a woman married to a man," what is "a woman married to her husband" - infer from it two.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: תְּחִילַּת בִּיאָה קוֹנָה אוֹ סוֹף בִּיאָה קוֹנָה? נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁהֶעֱרָה בָּהּ, וּפָשְׁטָה יָדָהּ וְקִבְּלָה קִדּוּשִׁין מֵאַחֵר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the beginning of intercourse effect acquisition or the end of intercourse effect acquisition? practical difference where engaged in the initial stage of intercourse with her and she reached her hand out and accepted betrothal from another
llm_translation: He asked them: Does the beginning of intercourse acquire or the end of intercourse acquire? It was derived from her, for example, that she had an emission, and she spread her hand and received the betrothal from another.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל דְּקָא קָנֵי בְּתוּלָה בְּבִיאָה, מַאי? אָמַר אַמֵּימָר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כׇּל הַבּוֹעֵל – דַּעְתּוֹ עַל גְּמַר בִּיאָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, to a High Priest who acquires a virgin through sexual intercourse. What, Ameimar said in the name of Rava: Anyone who engages in sexual intercourse has the completion of intercourse in mind,
llm_translation: If so, for the High Priest who acquires virginity through intercourse, what? Amar Ameimar from the name of Rava: Anyone who engages - his intention is on completing the act of intercourse.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בִּיאָה נִשּׂוּאִין עוֹשָׂה, אוֹ אֵירוּסִין עוֹשָׂה? נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ – לְיוֹרְשָׁהּ,
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before sexual intercourse effect marriage or effect betrothal? The practical difference to inherit her.
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: Does betrothal through intercourse establish marriage, or does betrothal through engagement establish marriage? The conclusion was drawn - for inheritance.

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַמֵּא לָהּ, וּלְהָפֵר נְדָרֶיהָ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ נִשּׂוּאִין עוֹשָׂה – יוֹרְשָׁהּ וּמִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ וּמֵיפֵר נְדָרֶיהָ, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵירוּסִין עוֹשָׂה – אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ וְאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ וְאֵינוֹ מֵיפֵר נְדָרֶיהָ. מַאי?
human_translation: And to become ritually impure to her, And to nullify her vows If you say effects marriage, he inherits her, and he becomes impure to her, and he nullifies her vows And if you say it effects betrothal, he does not inherit her, and he does not become ritually impure to her, and he cannot nullify her vows What,
llm_translation: "And to defile her, and to annul her vows. If you say that betrothal effects marriage - he inherits her and defiles her and annuls her vows. And if you say that betrothal does not effect marriage - he does not inherit her and does not defile her and does not annul her vows. What is the law?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאָב זַכַּאי בְּבִתּוֹ בְּקִדּוּשֶׁיהָ בְּכֶסֶף בִּשְׁטָר וּבְבִיאָה, וְזַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, וּמְקַבֵּל אֶת גִּיטָּהּ, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ. נִישֵּׂאת – יָתֵר עָלָיו הַבַּעַל שֶׁאוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת בְּחַיֶּיהָ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear A father has authority his daughter with regard to her betrothal, through money, through a document, or through sexual intercourse. has a right to items she found, and to her earnings, and to the nullification of her vows, And he accepts her bill of divorce And he does not enjoy the profits during her lifetime. married, the husband has more than as he enjoys the profits during her lifetime.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Come and hear: The father is entitled to his daughter in her betrothal, in her marriage contract, and in her consummation, and he is entitled to her findings and the work of her hands, and in annulling her vows, and he receives her bill of divorce, and he does not eat the produce during her lifetime. If she is married, the husband has precedence over him in eating the produce during her lifetime.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי ״בִּיאָה״, וְקָתָנֵי ״נִישֵּׂאת״! כִּי קָתָנֵי ״נִישֵּׂאת״ – אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: teaches sexual intercourse, and teaches: married. When it teaches: married, to the other
llm_translation: It was taught: "Bi'ah," and it was taught: "Nise'et"! When it was taught: "Nise'et" – the other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תָּא שְׁמַע: בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בְּבִיאָה, וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ יָבָם – קְנָאָהּ, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וּמְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear three years and one day old can be betrothed through intercourse, and if yavam engaged in intercourse with her, he has acquired her. And one is liable with her, due to a married woman. And she renders one who engages in intercourse with her ritually impure
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear: A girl of three years and one day is betrothed through intercourse, and if her yavam has intercourse with her - he is zealous for her, and they are liable on account of her as a married woman, and she defiles her husband.

hebrew_text: לְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב תַּחְתּוֹן כְּעֶלְיוֹן,
human_translation: renders impure the object upon which he lies like the upper one.
llm_translation: To defile from lying beneath like above.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נִישֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִכׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה – מוּמָתִין עַל יָדָהּ, וְהִיא פְּטוּרָה. וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִן הַפְּסוּלִין – פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: And if she marries a priest she may partake of teruma And if one of those with whom sexual relations are forbidden by the Torah engages in intercourse with her, he is put to death due to her, and she is exempt And if someone of unfit engages in intercourse with her, he has disqualified her from the priesthood.
llm_translation: If she marries a Kohen - she eats Terumah, and if one of all the forbidden relationships in the Torah has relations with her - they are disqualified through her, and she is exempt. And if one of the disqualified relationships has relations with her - he disqualifies her from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי ״בִּיאָה״, וְקָתָנֵי ״נִישֵּׂאת״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי הָנֵי נִשּׂוּאִין דְּכֹהֵן נִינְהוּ – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: It is taught sexual intercourse, and it is taught she marries This is what said: If this is a marriage to a priest, she may partake of teruma .
llm_translation: It was taught: "Bi'ah," and it was taught: "Nise'et"! This is what it means to say: If they are married to priests - they may eat terumah.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וּכְבָר שָׁלַח יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בַּג בַּג אֵצֶל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה לִנְצִיבִין: שָׁמַעְתִּי עָלֶיךָ שֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה. שָׁלַח לוֹ: וְאַתָּה אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן? מוּחְזְקַנִי בְּךָ שֶׁאַתָּה בָּקִי בְּחַדְרֵי תוֹרָה, לִדְרוֹשׁ בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר אִי אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ?!
human_translation: Come hear And Yoḥanan ben Bag Bag already sent to Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira in Netzivin: I heard about you that you say the daughter of a non-priest betrothed may partake of teruma . sent to him: And do you not say so? I know about you that you are an expert in areas of Torah; do you not know how to teach based on an a fortiori
llm_translation: Come and hear: And Yochanan ben Bag Bag had already sent to Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira to the leaders: I heard about you that you say, "A betrothed daughter of Israel may eat terumah." He sent to him: "But do you not say so? I am confident in you that you are proficient in the chambers of Torah, to expound with leniency and stringency. Do you not know?!"

hebrew_text: וּמָה שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית, שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה – כַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה, זוֹ, שֶׁבִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁכַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה? אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה.
human_translation: If a Canaanite maidservant, whose sexual intercourse does not allow her to partake of teruma , her money, allows her to partake of teruma , is it not logical this whose sexual intercourse allows her to partake of teruma , her money allow her to partake of teruma ? But what can I do, as the Sages said: the daughter of a non-priest betrothed may not partake of teruma until she enters the canopy.
llm_translation: And what about a Canaanite maidservant, whose entrance does not feed her with terumah - her money feeds her with terumah, this one, whose entrance feeds her with terumah - is it not the law that her money feeds her with terumah? But what shall I do, for the sages have said: A betrothed daughter of Israel does not eat terumah until she enters the wedding canopy.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי בְּבִיאָה שֶׁעַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה, וְכֶסֶף שֶׁעַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה – בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ מֵיכָל אָכְלָה!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If of sexual intercourse by means of canopy, and money by means of canopy, in both she may partake of
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If through betrothal by way of marriage, and money through betrothal by way of marriage - in both cases, she may eat!"

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, בְּבִיאָה שֶׁעַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה, וְכֶסֶף שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה – הָכָא תַּרְתֵּי, וְהָכָא חֲדָא! אֶלָּא לָאו בְּבִיאָה שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה, וְכֶסֶף שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה.
human_translation: Or rather sexual intercourse by means of canopy, and money not by means of canopy. here, two and here, one Rather, is it not to sexual intercourse not by means of canopy and money not by means of canopy?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, in intercourse that is through marriage, and money that is not through marriage - here are two, and here is one! Rather, is it not in intercourse that is not through marriage, and money that is not through marriage. English translation:

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא נִשּׂוּאִין עוֹשָׂה – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דַּאֲלִימָא לַהּ בִּיאָה מִכֶּסֶף. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ קִדּוּשִׁין עוֹשָׂה, מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דִּפְשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דִּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Granted, if you say effects marriage, due to that is obvious to that sexual intercourse is stronger than money, But if you say effects betrothal, what is different here, that it is obvious to him and what is different here, that he is uncertain
llm_translation: If you say that when one says "I will marry" he is considered as having performed the act, it is obvious to him that he should pay her for intercourse. But if you say that when one says "I will sanctify" he is considered as having performed the act, what is the difference here that it is obvious to him, and what is the difference here that he is in doubt?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ בְּבִיאָה שֶׁעַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה וְכֶסֶף שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: ״הָכָא תַּרְתֵּי וְהָכָא חֲדָא״ – קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיהָא אִיתֵיהּ;
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Actually, I will say to you about sexual intercourse by means of canopy and money not by means of canopy. And that which you said Here two and here one In any event, there is a fortiori
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: Always say to you in regards to intercourse that is through marriage and money that is not through marriage. And you are saying: "Here are two and here is one" - an a fortiori argument can be made from here.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: וּמָה שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית, שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה אֲפִילּוּ עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה – כַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בְּלֹא חוּפָּה, זוֹ, שֶׁבִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה עַל יְדֵי חוּפָּה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁכַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה בְּלֹא חוּפָּה?
human_translation: And this is what sent him, If a Canaanite maidservant, whose intercourse does not allow her to partake of teruma , even by means of canopy, her money allows her to partake without canopy, is it not logical this whose intercourse allows her to partake of teruma by means of canopy, her money allow her to partake of teruma without canopy?
llm_translation: And so he sent to him: And what about a Canaanite maidservant, that her entrance does not feed her with terumah even through marriage - her money feeds her without marriage, this, that her entrance feeds her with terumah through marriage - is it not the case that her money does not feed her with terumah without marriage?

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה, מִשּׁוּם דְּעוּלָּא.
human_translation: But what can I do, as the Sages said: the daughter of a non-priest betrothed may not partake of teruma until she enters the canopy, due to by Ulla.
llm_translation: But what shall I do? For the sages have said: A betrothed Jewish woman does not eat of the terumah until she enters the wedding canopy, because of the suspicion.

hebrew_text: וּבֶן בַּג בַּג? גַּבֵּי שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית לָא שַׁיַּיר בְּקִנְיָנַהּ, הָכָא, שַׁיֵּיר בְּקִנְיָנַהּ.
human_translation: And ben Bag Bag With regard to a Canaanite maidservant does not leave out from her acquisition, Here, he leaves out of her acquisition,
llm_translation: Son of Bag Bag? Regarding a Canaanite maidservant, he does not leave her in her acquisition, here, he leaves her in her acquisition.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא – מִיפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּאָכְלָה, וּמִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּשְׁלַח לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said by Torah law, it is obvious to that may partake of And that he sent him by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Ravina said: From the Torah - it is clear that she ate, and it is from the Rabbis that he sent her.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: שָׁמַעְתִּי עָלֶיךָ שֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, וְלָא חָיְישַׁתְּ לְסִימְפּוֹן. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: וְאַתָּה אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן? מוּחְזְקַנִי בְּךָ שֶׁאַתָּה בָּקִי בְּחַדְרֵי תוֹרָה, לִדְרוֹשׁ בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר אִי אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ?!
human_translation: And this is that he sent to him: I heard about you that you say the daughter of a non-priest betrothed may partake of teruma , and we are not concerned about an annulling factor [ simfon ], sent to him: And do you not say this? I know about you that you are an expert in areas of Torah; do you not know how to teach based on an a fortiori
llm_translation: And so he sent to him: "I have heard about you that you say, 'An engaged daughter of Israel may eat terumah,' and you do not concern yourself with the simpon." He sent to him: "But do you not say so? It is established about you that you are proficient in the chambers of Torah, to expound with kal vachomer, do you not know?!"

hebrew_text: וּמָה שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה – כַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְסִימְפּוֹן, זוֹ שֶׁבִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁכַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְלֹא נֵיחוּשׁ לְסִימְפּוֹן? אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה
human_translation: If a Canaanite maidservant, whose intercourse does not allow her to partake of teruma , her money allows her to partake of teruma , and we are not concerned about simfon , is it not logical this whose intercourse allows her to partake of teruma , that her money allow her to partake of teruma and we should not be concerned about simfon ? But what can I do, as the Sages said: the daughter of a non-priest betrothed may not partake of teruma
llm_translation: And what about a Canaanite maidservant whose betrothal is not consummated - her money feeds her with terumah; we are not concerned about a suspicion of simpon. This is when her betrothal is consummated - it is not the same that her money feeds her with terumah, and we are not concerned about a suspicion of simpon? But what shall I do, for the sages have said: A betrothed daughter of Israel does not eat terumah.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה, מִשּׁוּם דְּעוּלָּא.
human_translation: until she enters the canopy, due to of Ulla,
llm_translation: Until she enters the wedding canopy, because of modesty.

hebrew_text: וּבֶן בַּג בַּג? סִימְפּוֹן, בַּעֲבָדִים לֵית לֵיהּ. אִי מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי הוּא – הָא קָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ. אִי מִשּׁוּם מוּמִין שֶׁבַּסֵּתֶר – מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? לִמְלָאכָה קָא בָעֵי לֵיהּ לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And ben Bag Bag, he does not accept simfon with regard to of slaves. if it is an exposed blemish he saw If due to hidden blemishes what difference does that make to him? He needs him for labor, he does not care
llm_translation: Son of Bag Bag? Symphon, does not have slaves. If blemishes that are in the open - he sees it. If blemishes that are hidden - what benefit does he have from them? He requires for work, not for his own benefit.

hebrew_text: נִמְצָא גַּנָּב אוֹ קוּבְיוּסְטוּס – הִגִּיעוֹ. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ, לִסְטִים מְזוּיָּין אוֹ (נִכְתַּב) [מוּכְתָּב] לַמַּלְכוּת? הָנְהוּ קָלָא אִית לְהוּ!
human_translation: is discovered a thief or a gambler [ kuvyustus ], it has come to him, What do you say? an armed bandit or sentenced by the government these generate publicity,
llm_translation: A thief or a Kubistus was found - they bring him. What do you say, are they designated for the kingdom or written for the kingdom? These are light, they have a voice!

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי, בֵּין לְמָר וּבֵין לְמָר לָא אָכְלָה, מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: Now, both according to Master, and according to Master, may not partake What, is between them?
llm_translation: From here, between Mar and between Mar she did not eat, what is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: קִיבֵּל, מָסַר, וְהָלַךְ.
human_translation: The between them accepted transferred or walked
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: he accepted, he transmitted, and he went.

hebrew_text: בְּכֶסֶף, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים בְּדִינָר וְכו׳. מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: שֶׁכֵּן אִשָּׁה מַקְפֶּדֶת עַל עַצְמָהּ, וְאֵין מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בְּפָחוֹת מִדִּינָר.
human_translation: with money, Beit Shammai say with one dinar, What is the reasoning of Beit Shammai? Rabbi Zeira says: that a woman is particular about herself and will not be betrothed with less than one dinar.
llm_translation: In silver, Beit Shammai say in a dinar, etc. What is the reason of Beit Shammai? Rabbi Zeira said: Because a woman is particular about herself, and does not become betrothed for less than a dinar.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, כְּגוֹן בְּנָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, דְּקָפְדָן אַנַּפְשַׁיְיהוּ, וְלָא מִקַּדְּשָׁן בְּפָחוֹת מִתַּרְקְבָא דְּדִינָרֵי, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאִי פָּשְׁטָה יָדָהּ וְקִבְּלָה חַד זוּזָא מֵאַחֵר, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא הָווּ קִדּוּשִׁין?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If that is so, with regard to Rabbi Yannai’s daughters, for example, who are particular about themselves and they will not be betrothed with less than three kav of dinars so too that if she reaches out her hand and accepts one dinar from another so too, is not a betrothal?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now on, for example, like the daughters of Rabbi Yannai, who were particular about themselves, and did not betroth themselves for less than the value of a dinar, so it is true that if she extended her hand and received one coin from another, is it not considered a betrothal?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּשְׁטָה יָדָהּ וְקִבְּלָהּ לָא קָאָמֵינָא, כִּי קָאָמֵינָא, דְּקַדְּשַׁהּ בְּלֵילְיָא, אִי נָמֵי דְּשַׁוִּיָה שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: said to I did not say she reached out her hand and accepted When I said where he betrothed her at night Alternatively, where she appointed an agent
llm_translation: He said to him: She spread out her hand and received it, I am not saying, when I am saying, that she sanctified it at night, or perhaps she appointed a messenger.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: טַעְמַיְהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כׇּל כֶּסֶף הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה – כֶּסֶף צוֹרִי, וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם – כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said The reasoning of Beit Shammai is in accordance with which Rav Yehuda Rav Asi says. As Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: Every money mentioned in the Torah is Tyrian coinage, And by rabbinic law provincial coinage.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The reasons of Beit Shammai are like those of Rav Yehudah said Rav Assi. For Rav Yehudah said Rav Assi: All silver mentioned in the Torah - Tyrian silver, and according to their words - currency silver.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כׇּל כֶּסֶף הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה – כֶּסֶף צוֹרִי, וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם – כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה. וּכְלָלָא הוּא?
human_translation: the itself. Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: Every money mentioned in the Torah is Tyrian coinage, and by rabbinic law provincial coinage. And is principle
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Yehudah said Rav Assi: all the silver mentioned in the Torah - Tyrian silver, and of their words - national silver. And is this a general principle?

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי טַעֲנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵלִים לִשְׁמֹר״, וּתְנַן: שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין, הַטַּעֲנָה – שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף, וְהַהוֹדָאָה – שָׁוֶה פְרוּטָה.
human_translation: But a claim that it is written: “If a man deliver to his neighbor money or vessels to guard And we learned The oath by the judges the claim two silver and the admission the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: Behold, a claim, as it is written: "When a man gives his neighbor money or articles to keep," and we learned: the oath of the claimants, the claim - two silver coins, and the admission - equivalent to a penny.

hebrew_text: הָתָם דּוּמְיָא דְּכֵלִים, מָה כֵּלִים שְׁנַיִם – אַף כֶּסֶף שְׁנַיִם, וּמָה כֶּסֶף דָּבָר חָשׁוּב – אַף כֵּלִים דָּבָר חָשׁוּב.
human_translation: There, similar to “vessels”: Just as “vessels” two, so too “money” two And just as money is a significant item, so too vessels a significant item.
llm_translation: There, similar to vessels, what vessels two - also silver two, and what silver a matter esteemed - also vessels a matter esteemed.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״, וּתְנַן: הַפּוֹרֵט סֶלַע מִמְּעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי! ״כֶּסֶף״ ״הַכֶּסֶף״ – רִיבָּה.
human_translation: But tithe, as it is written: “And bind up the money in your hand” And we learned one who exchanges of second-tithe money a sela , money, “the money.” serves as an amplification.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And behold, regarding Ma'aser, as it is written: "And you shall tighten the money in your hand," and we learned: One who separates a coin from coins of the second tithe! "Silver" "the silver" – a dispute.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְרוּטָה – מְחוּלָּל! הָתָם נָמֵי, ״כֶּסֶף״ ״כֶּסֶף״ יָלֵיף מִמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: But consecrated as it is written: “And he will give the money and it will be assured to him” And Shmuel says: consecrated worth one hundred dinars, which was redeemed for worth one peruta , it is redeemed. There too, he derives “money” “money” from tithes.
llm_translation: Behold the case of Hekdesh, as it is written: "And he shall give the money and it shall be restored to him," and Samuel said: Hekdesh is equivalent to a Maneh, for he has devalued it by a Perutah - it is devalued! There, too, it is stated, "money," "money" - it shall be inferred from Ma'aser.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי קִידּוּשֵׁי אִשָּׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה וּבְעָלָהּ״, וְגָמַר ״קִיחָה״ ״קִיחָה״ מִשְּׂדֵה עֶפְרוֹן, וּתְנַן: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בִּפְרוּטָה וּבְשָׁוֶה פְרוּטָה. נֵימָא רַב אַסִּי דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?!
human_translation: But the betrothal of a woman, as it is written: “When a man takes a woman and engages in sexual intercourse with her” and one derives “taking” “taking” from the field of Ephron. And we learned Beit Hillel say with one peruta or with worth one peruta . shall we say Rav Asi, stated in accordance with Beit Shammai?
llm_translation: And behold, the betrothals of a woman, as it is written: "When a man takes a wife and marries her," and it concludes "he took her" - he took her from the field of Ephron. And we learned: Beit Hillel says: specifically and inclusively. Should we say like Beit Shammai?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כׇּל כֶּסֶף קָצוּב הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה – כֶּסֶף צוֹרִי, וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם – כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה.
human_translation: Rather, If was stated, was stated like this: Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: Every set money stated in the Torah, Tyrian coinage, and by rabbinic law provincial coinage.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: Any designated silver mentioned in the Torah - Tyrian silver, and according to their words - provincial silver.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים שֶׁל בֵּן, שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל עֶבֶד, חֲמִשִּׁים שֶׁל אוֹנֶס וְשֶׁל מְפַתֶּה, מֵאָה שֶׁל מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – כּוּלָּם בְּשֶׁקֶל הַקּוֹדֶשׁ, בְּמָנֶה צוֹרִי!
human_translation: what is teaching us? learned five sela for son thirty for a slave, fifty by a rapist and by a seducer one hundred by a defamer all of these are in the sacred shekel, one hundred dinars in Tyrian
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We have learned: Five shekels of a son, thirty of a slave, fifty of one who commits rape or seduces, one hundred of one who slanders – all in the holy shekel, in Tyrian coinage!

hebrew_text: ״וְשֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם כֶּסֶף מְדִינָה״ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּלָא תְּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לַחֲבֵירוֹ – נוֹתֵן לוֹ סֶלַע. וְלָא תֵּימָא מַאי סֶלַע – אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי, אֶלָּא מַאי סֶלַע – פַּלְגָא דְזוּזָא, דַּעֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּקָרוּ לְפַלְגָא דְזוּזָא אִיסְתֵּירָא.
human_translation: It was necessary for And by rabbinic law provincial coinage, as we did not learn As it is taught one who strikes another must give him one sela And not say: What one sela ? four dinar. Rather, what one sela ? half a dinar, as people commonly call half a dinar sela [ isteira ].
llm_translation: "And regarding their words, 'silver of the province' is necessary for him, as we do not teach. For it was taught: One who strikes his fellow - he gives him a rock. And do not say, what is a rock - four zuz, rather what is a rock - half of a zuz, for people make a distinction between half of a zuz and a full zuz."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, כִּדְחִזְקִיָּה. דְּאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהֶפְדָּהּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמְּגָרַעַת מִפִּדְיוֹנָהּ, וְיוֹצְאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says The reasoning of Beit Shammai, in accordance with of Ḥizkiyya. As Ḥizkiyya says the verse states “Then he shall let her be redeemed” teaches that she can deduct from her redemption and leave
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Their taste, the school of Shammai, is like that of Hezekiah. For Hezekiah said: The verse states, "And she shall be redeemed" - this teaches that she is exempt from her redemption, and she may leave.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דִּיהַב לַהּ דִּינָר – הַיְינוּ דִּמְגָרְעָה וְאָזְלָה עַד פְּרוּטָה, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דִּיהַב לַהּ פְּרוּטָה, מִפְּרוּטָה מִי מְגָרְעָה? וְדִלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: הֵיכָא דִּיהַב לַהּ דִּינָר – תְּיגָרַע עַד פְּרוּטָה, הֵיכָא דִּיהַב לַהּ פְּרוּטָה – לָא תְּיגָרַע כְּלָל!
human_translation: Granted, if you say that he gave her one dinar, this is that she may continually deduct up to one peruta . But if you say that gave her one peruta she deduct from one peruta ? But perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying: where he gave her one dinar, she deducts up to one peruta ; a case where he gave her one peruta she cannot deduct at all.
llm_translation: If you say that when he gave her a dinar - that is when she subtracted and left until a pruta, but if you say that he gave her a pruta, from a pruta does she subtract? And perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying: Where he gave her a dinar - she shall subtract until a pruta, where he gave her a pruta - she shall not subtract at all!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ – דּוּמְיָא דְּיִיעוּד, מַה יִיעוּד, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִי בָּעֵי מְיַיעֵד וְאִי בָּעֵי לָא מְיַיעֵד, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא מָצֵי מְיַיעֵד – לָא הָווּ זְבִינָא זְבִינֵי, הָכִי נָמֵי כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא מָצְיָ[א] מְיגָרְעָא – לָא הָווּ זְבִינָא זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: cannot enter your mind, similar designation, Just as designation, although if he desires, he may designate and if he does not desire, he not designate anywhere that he cannot designate her sale is not sale, so too anywhere that she cannot deduct her sale is not sale.
llm_translation: Not gone up your mind - similar to destiny, what is destiny, just as if wants to appoint and if does not want to appoint, wherever does not find appointing - not have been sold, thus it is said wherever does not find - not have been bought.

hebrew_text: וְקִידּוּשֵׁי אִשָּׁה לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי נָפְקָא לְהוּ מֵאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה: מָה אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה בִּפְרוּטָה לָא מִקַּנְיָא, אַף אִשָּׁה בִּפְרוּטָה לָא מִיקַּדְּשָׁא.
human_translation: And according to Beit Shammai betrothal of a woman is derived from a Hebrew maidservant, Just as a Hebrew maidservant cannot be acquired with one peruta , so too a woman cannot be betrothed with one peruta .
llm_translation: "And the betrothal of a woman according to Beit Shammai is derived from an 'amah of the Hebrew measure. Just as an 'amah of the Hebrew measure specifically is not acquired, so too a woman specifically is not betrothed."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא פַּלְגָא דְּדִינָר, וְאֵימָא שְׁתֵּי פְּרוּטוֹת! כֵּיוָן דְּאַפִּיקְתֵּיהּ מִפְּרוּטָה – אוֹקְמַהּ אַדִּינָר.
human_translation: But say half a dinar, or say two perutot , Since excludes with one peruta , established at one dinar,
llm_translation: And why not half a dinar, and why not two prutot! Since you have taken it out from the pruta - it is established as a dinar.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי: שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּהֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: Rava said This is the reasoning of Beit Shammai, The daughters of Israel should not be like ownerless
llm_translation: Rava said: This is the reason of Beit Shammai: that the daughters of Israel should not be like abandoned property.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים בִּפְרוּטָה. סָבַר רַב יוֹסֵף לְמֵימַר: פְּרוּטָה כָּל דְּהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: כַּמָּה הִיא פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשְּׁמֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say with one peruta , Rav Yosef thought to say: One peruta any amount. Abaye said to him: But isn’t it taught with regard to How much is one peruta ? one-eighth of the Italian issar .
llm_translation: House of Hillel says specifically. Thought Rav Yosef to say: specifically all. Said to him Abaye: but it goes down small: how small is specifically - one out of eight in the Italian Isar.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה, אֲבָל הָכָא כְּדַחֲשִׁבָה לְהוּ לְאִינָשֵׁי – וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: שִׁיעֵר רַבִּי סִימַאי בְּדוֹרוֹ כַּמָּה הִיא פְּרוּטָה: אֶחָד מִשְּׁמֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי, וְכִי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא שִׁיעֲרוּ כַּמָּה הָוֵי פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשִּׁשָּׁה בְּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי!
human_translation: And if you would say: This statement only to the generation of Moses, but now, that which people consider As when Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Simai estimated in his generation: How much is one peruta ? one-eighth of the Italian issar . And when Ravin came he said Rabbi Dostai and Rabbi Yannai and Rabbi Oshaya estimated: How much is one peruta ? one-sixth of the Italian issar .
llm_translation: And if you will say: those matters in the generation of Moses, but here, as it seems to people - and when Rav Dimi came, he said: How great was the measure of Rabbi Simai in his generation? One out of eight in the city of Isar the Italian. And when Ravin came, he said: Rabbi Dostai, Rabbi Yannai, and Rabbi Oshaya estimated how great was the measure - one out of six in the city of Isar the Italian!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּתָנֵינָא: ״צֵא וַחֲשׁוֹב כַּמָּה פְּרוּטוֹת בִּשְׁנֵי סְלָעִים – יוֹתֵר מֵאַלְפַּיִם״ – הַשְׁתָּא אַלְפַּיִם לָא הָוְיָין, יָתֵר מֵאַלְפַּיִם קָרֵי לְהוּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ הַהוּא סָבָא: אֲנָא תְּנֵינָא לַהּ: ״קָרוֹב לְאַלְפַּיִם״. סוֹף סוֹף אַלְפָּא וַחֲמֵשׁ מְאָה וּתְלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא הוּא דְּהָוְיָין! כֵּיוָן דְּנָפְקָא לְהוּ מִפַּלְגָא – קָרוֹב לְאַלְפַּיִם קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to If so, this is which we learned Go and calculate how many perutot there are in two sela : More than two thousand. Now there are not two thousand, and you call them: More than two thousand? A certain old man said to them: I teach this Close to two thousand. Ultimately, is 1,536, Since it passes half it is called: Close to two thousand.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef: If so, this is what we learned: "Go out and calculate how many hairs are in two handfuls of hair - more than two thousand." Two thousand are not, more than two thousand is called to them? That elder said to them: I will teach him: "Close to two thousand." Ultimately, one thousand five hundred and thirty-six is what they are! Once they came out of the assembly - close to two thousand is called to them.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: שִׁיעֵר רַבִּי סִימַאי בְּדוֹרוֹ כַּמָּה הִיא פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשְּׁמֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי, וְכִי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: שִׁיעֲרוּ רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא כַּמָּה הִיא פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשִּׁשָּׁה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: נֵימָא, אַתְּ וְרָבִין בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי קָא מִיפַּלְגִיתוּ,
human_translation: the itself. When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Simai estimated in his generation: How much is one peruta ? one-eighth of the Italian issar . And when Ravin came he said Rabbi Dostai and Rabbi Yannai and Rabbi Oshaya estimated: How much is one peruta ? one-sixth of the Italian issar . Abaye said to Rav Dimi: Shall we say you and Ravin disagree with regard to the dispute between these tanna’im .
llm_translation: The body, when Rav Dimi came, he said: The measure of Rabbi Simai in his generation, how much is a prutah - one out of eight in the Italian asar, and when Ravin came, he said: Measure Rabbi Dostai, Rabbi Yannai, and Rabbi Oshaya, how much is a prutah - one out of six in the Italian asar. Abaye said to Rav Dimi: Let it be said, you and Ravin are in the dispute of those Tannaim.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: פְּרוּטָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים – אֶחָד מִשְּׁמֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי, שֵׁשׁ מָעָה כֶּסֶף – דִּינָר, מָעָה – שְׁנֵי פּוּנְדְּיוֹנִין, פּוּנְדְּיוֹן – שְׁנֵי אִיסָּרִין, אִיסָּר – שְׁנֵי מִסְמֵיסִים, מִסְמֵס – שְׁנֵי קוּנְטְרוֹנְקִין, קוּנְטְרֹנְק – שְׁתֵּי פְרוּטוֹת. נִמְצָא, פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשְּׁמֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי.
human_translation: As it is taught peruta mentioned by the Sages one-eighth of the Italian issar . Six silver ma’a dinar, ma’a two pundeyon . a pundeyon two issar , an issar two masmas . A masmas two konterank , konterank two perutot . finds one peruta one-eighth of the Italian issar .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A "Perutah" that the Sages spoke of - one of eight in the Italian Issar, six Ma'ah of silver - a Dinar, a Ma'ah - two Pundeyonin, a Pundeyon - two Issarim, an Issar - two Mismeisim, a Mismeis - two Kunturonkin, a Kunturon - two Prutot. It follows that a Perutah is one of eight in the Italian Issar.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה הַדְרֵסִין לְמָעָה, שְׁנֵי הַנְצִין לְהַדְרֵיס, שְׁנֵי שְׁמֵנִין לַהֲנֵץ, שְׁתֵּי פְרוּטוֹת לְשָׁמֵין, נִמְצָא, פְּרוּטָה – אֶחָד מִשִּׁשָּׁה בְּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי. לֵימָא דְּמָר אָמַר כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא וְרָבִין דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: three hadreis to a ma’a , two henetz to a hadreis , two shamin to a henetz , two perutot to a shamin . finds peruta one-sixth of the Italian issar . Shall we say that Master agrees with the first tanna , and Ravin, who said agrees with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel?
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Three drasins for a ma'ah, two netsin for a dris, two shemin for a netz, two prutot for a shamin. If a prutah is found, it is one out of six in the Italian asar. Let us say that Mar said like the first Tanna and Ravin said like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּין דִּידִי וּבֵין רָבִין אַלִּיבָּא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – דְּאִיַּקּוּר אִיסּוּרֵי, הָא – דְּזוּל אִיסּוּרֵי. הָא דְּאִיַּקּוּר אִיסּוּרֵי – קוּם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע בְּזוּזָא, הָא דְּזוּל – קוּם תְּלָתִין וּתְרֵין בְּזוּזָא.
human_translation: said to Both my and Ravin in accordance with the first tanna , and it not difficult. This when issar increased in value this when issar decreased in value. When issar increased in value, twenty-four stood at one dinar; when decreased in value, thirty-two stood at one dinar.
llm_translation: He said to him: Whether for me or for many, according to the opinion of the first Tanna, and it is not difficult: this - where they are strict, that - where they are lenient. This - where they are strict, get up twenty-four lashes with a whip, that - get up thirty-two lashes with a whip.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קִידְּשָׁהּ בִּתְמָרָה, אֲפִילּוּ עוֹמֵד כּוֹר תְּמָרִים בְּדִינָר – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת; חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה בְּמָדַי.
human_translation: Shmuel says: betrothed with a date, she is betrothed even a kor of dates is worth one dinar, we are concerned that perhaps it is worth one peruta in Media
llm_translation: Shmuel said: If she consecrated with a date-palm, even if a pile of date-pits stands in a dinar - she is sanctified; we are concerned that perhaps a perutah is equal to a ma'ah.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים בִּפְרוּטָה וּבְשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי, הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי סָפֵק.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn mishna Beit Hillel say: With one peruta or with worth one peruta , not difficult. This to betrothal certain. this to betrothal uncertain.
llm_translation: And behold, we learned: Beit Hillel say specifically and generally specifically! It is not difficult, this is regarding definite sanctifications, this is regarding uncertain sanctifications.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאקַדֵּישׁ בִּזְווֹדָא דְּאוּדְרֵי, יָתֵיב רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב וְקָא מְעַיֵּין בַּהּ, אִי אִית בַּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא. וְאִי לֵית בַּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לָא? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָיְישִׁינַן! לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי, הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי סָפֵק.
human_translation: a certain man who betrothed with a bundle of rags [ zavda de’urdei ]. Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya sat before Rav and examined if it had the value of one peruta . yes, and if not, no, And if it does not have the value of one peruta , not But didn’t Shmuel say we are concerned not difficult. This to betrothal certain, this to betrothal uncertain.
llm_translation: That man who consecrated with the wool of a ewe, Rav Shimi bar Chiya was sitting before Rav and examining it. If it has an equal defect - no, if not - no. And if it does not have an equal defect, is it not so? But Shmuel said: We are concerned! It is not difficult, this is in definite consecrations, this is in uncertain consecrations.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאקַדֵּישׁ בְּאַבְנָא דְכוּחְלָא, יָתֵיב רַב חִסְדָּא וְקָא מְשַׁעֵר לַיהּ, אִי אִית בַּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – אִין, וְאִי לָא – לָא. וְאִי לֵית בַּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לָא? וְהָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָיְישִׁינַן! רַב חִסְדָּא לָא סָבַר לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: a certain man who betrothed with a blue marble stone. Rav Ḥisda sat and estimated it If it was worth one peruta , yes, and if not, no, And if it does not have the value of one peruta , not But didn’t Shmuel say we are concerned Rav Ḥisda does not hold that of Shmuel,
llm_translation: That man who sanctified with a stone of the courtyard, Rav Ḥisdah was sitting and evaluating it. If it has a value of a prutah - no, and if not - no. And if it does not have a value of a prutah, is it not so? But Shmuel said: We are concerned! Rav Ḥisdah did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ אִימֵּיהּ: וְהָא הָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּקַדְּשַׁהּ הֲוָה בַּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! אֲמַר לַהּ: לָאו כָּל כְּמִינָּךְ דְּאָסְרַתְּ לַהּ אַבָּתְרָא.
human_translation: The mother of said to But on that day that he betrothed her it was worth one peruta . He said to It is not in your to render her forbidden to a later
llm_translation: She said to him: "But on that day when she sanctified herself, was there not a hairpin in it?" He said to her: "Not like your kind that you prohibited to her afterwards."

hebrew_text: לָאו הַיְינוּ דִּיהוּדִית דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, (דַּהֲוֵית) [דַּהֲוָה] לַהּ צַעַר לֵידָה, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: קַבֵּיל בִּיךְ אֲבוּךְ קִידּוּשֵׁי כִּי זוּטְרַתְּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: לָאו כָּל כְּמִינַּהּ דְּאִימָּךְ דְּאָסְרָה לִיךְ עִילָּוַאי.
human_translation: Is this not Yehudit, wife of Rabbi Ḥiyya, who would have painful childbirths She said to My mother told me: When you were young your father accepted betrothal on your behalf He said to her: It is not in your mother’s to render you forbidden to me,
llm_translation: Not the one who is the Judean woman from the household of Rabbi Chiya, (who) was experiencing labor pains, she said to him: My mother told me, "May your father accept upon you the sanctifications, for you are his only daughter." He said to her: Not every kind of your mother's is forbidden to you above.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב חִסְדָּא: אַמַּאי? הָא אִיכָּא סָהֲדִי בְּאִידִית, דְּיָדְעִי דִּבְהָהוּא יוֹמָא הֲוָה בַּיהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא לֵיתַנְהוּ קַמַּן.
human_translation: the Sages said to Rav Ḥisda: Why there are witnesses in Idit who know that on that day it had the value of one peruta . Now, in any event, they are not here,
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Ḥisda: What is the reason? Because there is testimony in the case, that they knew that on that day he was equal to a penny! Now, from now on, they do not give him anything.

hebrew_text: לָאו הַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: עֵידֶיהָ בְּצַד אַסְתָּן, וְתֵיאָסֵר?!
human_translation: Isn’t this of Rabbi Ḥanina? as Rabbi Ḥanina says: her witnesses in the north [ istan ], will she be forbidden?
llm_translation: Not the same as Rabbi Chanina, for Rabbi Chanina said: Its witnesses are on the side of the defendant, and it is still invalid?!

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא לָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ לְהָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. אִם הֵקֵילּוּ בִּשְׁבוּיָה, דִּמְנַוְּולָה נַפְשַׁהּ גַּבֵּי שַׁבַּאי, נָיקֵיל בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ?!
human_translation: Abaye and Rava do not hold with this of Rav Ḥisda If were lenient with regard to a captive woman, who makes herself appear repulsive before her captor shall we be lenient with regard to a married woman?
llm_translation: Abaye and Rava do not agree with the opinion of Rav Ḥisda. If they were lenient in captivity, would they be strict regarding a married woman?!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתְּאַר מֵהַהִיא מִשְׁפָּחָה בְּסוּרָא, וּפְרַשׁוּ רַבָּנַן מִינַּהּ. וְלָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּסְבִירָא לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּסְבִירָא לְהוּ כְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא.
human_translation: of the family remained in Sura, But the Sages avoided And it was not because they maintained, with Shmuel, Rather, because they held with Abaye and Rava,
llm_translation: A man married from that family in Sura, and the Rabbis separated him from her. And not because they thought that his name was Shmuel, but because they thought that his name was like Abbaye and Rava.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאקַדֵּישׁ בְּשׁוּטִיתָא דְאָסָא בְּשׁוּקָא, שַׁלְחַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר הוּנָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: כְּהַאי גַּוְונָא מַאי? שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: נַגְּדֵיהּ כְּרַב, וְאַצְרֵיךְ גִּיטָּא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: a certain man who betrothed with a myrtle branch in the marketplace. Rav Aḥa bar Huna sent before Rav Yosef: In a case like this, what sent to him: Flog him, in accordance with Rav, and require a bill of divorce, in accordance with Shmuel,
llm_translation: That man who consecrated with a whip of myrtle branches in the market, Rav Aḥa bar Huna sent for him to come before Rav Yosef: "What is the nature of this act?" He sent to him: "Oppose him like Rav, and require a document like Shmuel."

hebrew_text: דְּרַב מְנַגֵּיד עַל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּשׁוּקָא, וְעַל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּבִיאָה, וְעַל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּלָא שִׁידּוּכֵי.
human_translation: that Rav flog for betrothing in the marketplace, and for betrothing through sexual intercourse, And for betrothing without an arrangement [ shiddukhei ],
llm_translation: Rav M'nageid upon who sanctifies in the market, and upon who sanctifies through intercourse, and upon who sanctifies without betrothal.

hebrew_text: וְעַל דִּמְבַטֵּיל גִּיטָּא, וְעַל דְּמָסַר מוֹדָעָא אַגִּיטָּא, וְעַל דִּמְצַעַר שְׁלוּחָא דְרַבָּנַן, וְעַל דְּחָלָה שַׁמְתָּא עִילָּוֵיהּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין,
human_translation: And for nullifying a bill of divorce and for issuing a declaration a bill of divorce. And for tormenting a messenger of the Sages, And one who had an excommunication take effect on him for thirty days
llm_translation: And on that which he annulled the document of divorce, and on that which he handed over a known document of divorce, and on that which he interfered with the sending of the Rabbis, and on that which he was afraid for his reputation for thirty days.

hebrew_text: וְעַל חַתְנָא דְּדָיַיר בֵּי חֲמוּהּ. דְּדָיַיר – אִין, חָלֵיף – לָא?! וְהָא הָהוּא חַתְנָא דַּחֲלֵיף אַבָּבָא דְּבֵי חֲמוּהּ וְנַגְּדֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת! הָהוּא מֵידָם הֲוָת דָּיְימָא חֲמָתֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And a son-in-law who lives in his father-in-law’s house, who lives yes, passes by no, But a certain son-in-law who passed by the entrance of his father-in-law’s house and Rav Sheshet flogged him that there were suspicions [ dayma ] about him and his mother-in-law,
llm_translation: And regarding the son-in-law of the resident of the house of his father-in-law. Resident - yes, exchange - no?! But that son-in-law who exchanged the gate of the house of his father-in-law, and Rav Sheshet was against him! That one immediately his anger was kindled against him.

hebrew_text: נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: בְּכוּלְּהוּ, לָא מְנַגֵּיד רַב אֶלָּא עַל דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּבִיאָה בְּלָא שִׁידּוּכֵי. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשִׁידּוּכֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם פְּרִיצוּתָא.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: Rav would not flog in all of but for betrothing through sexual intercourse without arrangement. And there are who say: Even if an arrangement beforehand, also due to licentiousness,
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea said: In all cases, the master does not betroth a woman except through intercourse without witnesses. And there are those who say: Even with witnesses, it is also considered licentiousness.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּצִיפְּתָא דְאָסָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא לֵית בַּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ: תִּיקְדּוֹשׁ בְּאַרְבַּע זוּזֵי דְּאִית בַּהּ. שְׁקַלְתַּהּ וְאִישְׁתִּיקָא. אָמַר רָבָא: הָוֵה שְׁתִיקוּתָא דִּלְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת, וְכֹל שְׁתִיקוּתָא דִּלְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת, לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: a certain man who betrothed with a mat of myrtle branches. said to him: But it is not worth one peruta . He said to them: let her be betrothed with four dinars that are in took and was silent. Rava said: This is silence after money is given, and any silence after money is given is nothing.
llm_translation: That man who sanctified in the courtyard of Asa, they said to him: "But it does not contain a barleycorn's worth!" He said to them: "It contains four zuz." They weighed it and were silent. Rava said: Silence after the giving of money is considered as if it is nothing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר לָהּ: כִּנְסִי סֶלַע זוֹ בְּפִקָּדוֹן, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר לָהּ: הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בּוֹ. בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, לְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת, רָצְתָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, לֹא רָצְתָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I state As it is taught said to Take this sela as a deposit, and he went back and said to her: Be betrothed to me with it, at the time money given, she is betrothed. after money given, she wanted she is betrothed. she did not want she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her? As it was taught: He said to her: "Acquire this rock with a deposit," and then he returned and said to her: "Be consecrated to me with it." At the time of giving the money - she becomes consecrated, after giving the money, if she desires - she becomes consecrated, if she does not desire - she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״רָצְתָה״ וּמַאי ״לֹא רָצְתָה״? אִילֵימָא ״רָצְתָה״ – דְּאָמְרָה: ״אִין״, לֹא רָצְתָה דְּאָמְרָה: ״לָא״, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא,
human_translation: What She wanted, and what She did not want? If we say She wanted, that she said yes, She did not want, she said no, by inference the first clause
llm_translation: What is "desired" and what is "not desired"? If you say "desired" - because she said "no", not desired because she said "no", from the general principle of the beginning.

hebrew_text: כִּי אָמְרָה ״לָא״ נָמֵי הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין? אַמַּאי, וְהָא קָאָמְרָה ״לָא״! אֶלָּא לָאו: ״רָצְתָה״ – דְּאָמְרָה: ״אִין״, לֹא רָצְתָה – דְּאִישְׁתִּיקָה מִשְׁתָּקה. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שְׁתִיקָה דִּלְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת – וְלֹא כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: if said: No, it would also be betrothal. why she said: No. Rather, is it not She wanted, she said yes, She did not want, that she remained silent. And learn from this silence after money is given is nothing.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "When she said 'no,' were the betrothals valid? Why, and she said 'no'! Rather, not 'you wanted' - for she said 'no,' you did not want - she remained silent. And learn from it that silence after receiving money is not considered as if it were nothing."

hebrew_text: קָשׁוּ בָּהּ בְּפוּם נַהֲרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם בְּתוֹרַת פִּקָּדוֹן יַהֲבִינְהוּ נִיהֲלַהּ, סָבְרָה: אִי שָׁדֵינָא לְהוּ וּמִיתַּבְרִי – מְחַיַּיבְנָא בְּהוּ, הָכָא בְּתוֹרַת קִדּוּשִׁין יַהֲבִינְהוּ נִיהֲלַהּ, וְאִי אִיתָא דְּלָא נִיחָא לַהּ – (לִישְׁדִּינְהוּ)!
human_translation: In Pum Nahara they raised a difficulty against in the name of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: Is it comparable? There, he gave her as a deposit thinks: If I throw them and they break I will be obligated for them, here he gives them to her as betrothal And if it is so, that she is not amenable let her throw them
llm_translation: They debated it in the mouth of the river, in the name of Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: Who is similar? There, in the law of deposit, she gave it to him to manage, she thought: if it is beneficial for him and he prospers - we are obligated to him, here in the law of betrothal, she gave it to him to manage, and if it comes that it is not pleasing to her - (let her release him)!

hebrew_text: פָּרֵיךְ רַב אַחַאי: אַטּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נְשֵׁי דִּינָא גְּמִירִי? הָכִי נָמֵי סַבְרַהּ: אִי שָׁדֵינָא לְהוּ וּמִיתַּבְרִי מִיתְחַיַּיבְנָא בְּאַחְרָיוּתַיְיהוּ. שְׁלַחָה רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא: כְּהַאי גַּוְונָא מַאי? שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: אֲנַן לָא שְׁמִיעַ לַן הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אַתּוּן דִּשְׁמִיעַ לְכוּ – חוּשׁוּ לַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥai refutes Is that to say all women are learned halakha ? also, she thinks: If I throw them and they break I will be responsible for them. Rav Aḥa bar Rav, sent to Ravina: In a case like this, what sent to him: We did not hear this statement of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. You, who heard it, should be concerned about
llm_translation: Rav Ahai posed a question: Are all the women of the court experts? This is what he also thought: If we send them and they err, we will be liable for their actions. Rav Acha bar Rav was sent before Ravina: What is the proper conduct in this case? He sent back to him: We have not heard the teaching of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. You who have heard it - be cautious with it.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲוָה קָא מְזַבְּנָה וַורְשְׁכֵי, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא חֲטַף וַורְשְׁכָא מִינַּהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: הַבֵהּ נִיהֲלִי! אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי יָהֵיבְנָא לִיךְ מִיקַּדְּשַׁתְּ לִי? שְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ וְאִישְׁתִּיקָה. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: יְכֵולָה לְמֵימַר: אִין, שְׁקַלִי, וְדִידִי שְׁקַלִי.
human_translation: a certain woman who was selling belts. A certain man came snatched a belt [ varshekha ] from her. She said to him: Give to me. He said to her: If I give to you will you be betrothed to me? She took it and was silent, and Rav Naḥman said: She could say: Yes, I took I took my
llm_translation: That woman who was selling linen garments, a certain man came and snatched a linen garment from her. She said to him: "Return my garment!" He said to her: "If I give it back to you, will you marry me?" She took it and kept silent. And Rav Nachman said: She could have said, "No, take it, and mine take."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: קִידְּשָׁה בְּגָזֵל וּבְחָמָס, וּבִגְנֵיבָה, אוֹ שֶׁחָטַף סֶלַע מִיָּדָהּ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! הָתָם בִּדְשַׁדֵּיךְ.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman betrothed with by robbery; or by a forced transaction, or by theft; or if he grabbed a sela from her hand and betrothed her she is betrothed. There, he arranged
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Nachman: If she was consecrated with theft, robbery, or kidnapping, or if a boulder was snatched from her hand and consecrated - she is considered consecrated! There, in your fields.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין שַׁדֵּיךְ וּדְלָא שַׁדֵּיךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר לָהּ: ״כִּנְסִי סֶלַע זוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לִיכִי״ וְחָזַר וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בּוֹ״, בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת, רָצְתָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, לֹא רָצְתָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. לְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ רָצְתָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: And from where do you say that there is a difference where he arranged and where he had not arranged As it is taught said to Take this sela that I owe you, and he went back and said to her: Be betrothed to me with it, at the time the money was given she wanted she is betrothed; she did not want she is not betrothed. after money was given, even if she wanted she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: And who will say that we are different between your breasts and not your breasts, as it was taught: He said to her, "Gather for me this rock that I am obligated to you," and he went back and said to her, "Be consecrated to me with it," at the time of giving the money, if she wanted - she is consecrated, if she did not want - she is not consecrated. After giving the money, even if she wanted - she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״רָצְתָה״ וּמַאי ״לֹא רָצְתָה״? אִילֵימָא ״רָצְתָה״ – דְּאָמְרָה אִין, לֹא רָצְתָה – דְּאָמְרָה לָא, הָא אִישְׁתִּיקָה – הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. וְנִתְנֵי ״מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת״ סְתָם, כִּי הָתָם!
human_translation: What She wanted, and what She did not want? If we say She wanted, that she said yes, She did not want, she said no, she was silent it is betrothal. But let teach she is betrothed, without specification, as there
llm_translation: What is "desired" and what is "not desired"? If you say "desired" - because she said yes, not desired - because she said no, but she remained silent - the betrothal is valid. And it is taught: "Mekudeshet" in a general sense, for there it is!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״רָצְתָה״ – דְּאָמְרָה ״אִין״, ״לֹא רָצְתָה״ – דְּאִישְׁתִּיקָה, וְקָא תָנֵי דְּאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מַאי טַעְמָא? יְכֵולָה לְמֵימַר: אִין, שְׁקַלִי, וְדִידִי שְׁקַלִי.
human_translation: Rather, She wanted, she said yes, She did not want, that she remained silent. And taught that she is not betrothed. What is the reason she can say: Yes I took but I took my own
llm_translation: Rather: "She desired" - for she said "no," "she did not desire" - for she remained silent, and it is teaching that she is not betrothed. What is the reason? She could say: "No," take it, and my counterpart will take it.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא הָךְ דְּקִדְּשָׁהּ בְּגָזֵל וּבְחָמָס וּבִגְנֵיבָה אוֹ שֶׁחָטַף סֶלַע מִיָּדָהּ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא – דְּשַׁדֵּיךְ, הָא – דְּלָא שַׁדֵּיךְ.
human_translation: But this difficult that betrothed her with by robbery, or by a forced transaction, or by theft, or if he grabbed a sela from her hand and betrothed her she is betrothed. Rather, isn’t it conclude from it this where he arranged this where he did not arrange
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But is it not difficult? This woman who sanctified the stolen item through robbery, violence, or theft, or if a rock was thrown into her hand and she sanctified the item – she is sanctified! Rather, it is not a valid sanctification. This case – where you threw the rock, this case – where you did not throw the rock.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי, עֲיַילוּ רַבָּנַן לְנַקּוֹטִינְהוּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ הַהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שְׁמֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי מָנִי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין אִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – כָּךְ אֵין קַרְקַע נִקְנֵית בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָתַנְיָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין אִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – קַרְקַע נִקְנֵית בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה!
human_translation: When Rabbi Asi died, the Sages assembled to collect his statements, A certain of the Sages, and Rabbi Ya’akov was his name, said to them: This Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Mani said: Just as a woman cannot be acquired by less than the value of one peruta , so land cannot be acquired by less than the value of one peruta . They said to him: But isn’t it taught Although a woman cannot be acquired by less than the value of one peruta , land can be acquired by less than the value of one peruta ?
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Assi was at rest, the Rabbis went to gather for his eulogy. That certain one, a Rabbi, and Rabbi Yaakov was his name, said to them: Thus said Rabbi Assi in the name of Rabbi Mani: Just as a woman is not acquired for less than a perutah, so too land is not acquired for less than a perutah. They said to him: But it was taught: Even though a woman is not acquired for less than a perutah, land is acquired for less than a perutah!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא – בַּחֲלִיפִין, דְּתַנְיָא: קוֹנִין בִּכְלִי, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: said to them: When that is taught with regard to exchange, As it is taught One can acquire by a vessel, even though it is not worth one peruta .
llm_translation: He said to them: When it was taught there - in the case of exchanges, as it was taught: One acquires with a vessel, even though it does not have the value of a perutah.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר יָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּטִיב גִּיטִּין וְקִדּוּשִׁין לֹא יְהֵא לוֹ עֵסֶק עִמָּהֶן. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְקָשִׁין לְעוֹלָם יוֹתֵר מִדּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָלֹה וְכַחֵשׁ וְרָצֹחַ וְגָנֹב וְנָאֹף פָּרָצוּ וְדָמִים בְּדָמִים נָגָעוּ״.
human_translation: They then sat and said that which Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Anyone who does not know the nature of bills of divorce and betrothals should have no dealings in them, Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And are worse for the world than the generation of the flood, as it is stated: “Swearing and lying, and killing, and stealing, and committing adultery. They break all bounds, and blood touches blood”
llm_translation: The scholars sat and said, this that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Anyone who does not know the laws of divorce and betrothal should not engage with them. Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Difficult are the generations more than the generation of the Flood, as it is said: "For they have sown the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף: מוֹלְדִין בְּנִין מִנְּשֵׁי חַבְרֵיהוֹן חוֹבִין עַל חוֹבִין מוֹסִיפִין,
human_translation: From where may be inferred As Rav Yosef translated They give birth to children through the wives of others; they add sins upon sins.
llm_translation: What is the implication? As Rav Yosef translated: "Those who build from the property of their friends are liable to their friends, they add to the liability."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב ״עַל כֵּן תֶּאֱבַל הָאָרֶץ וְאֻמְלַל כׇּל יוֹשֵׁב בָּהּ בְּחַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה וּבְעוֹף הַשָּׁמָיִם וְגַם דְּגֵי הַיָּם יֵאָסֵפוּ וְגוֹ׳״, וְאִילּוּ בְּדוֹר הַמַּבּוּל לֹא נִגְזְרָה גְּזֵירָה עַל דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר בֶּחָרָבָה מֵתוּ״ – וְלֹא דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם. וְאִילּוּ הָכָא, אֲפִילּוּ דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם.
human_translation: And it is written “Therefore the land mourns and everyone who dwells there languishes, with the beasts of the field and the fowls of heaven, and the fishes of the sea are also taken away” whereas in the generation of the flood the decree was not imposed upon the fish in the sea, as it is stated: “Whatever was on dry land died” the fish in the sea did not But here, even the fish in the sea
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written, "Therefore the land shall mourn, and every one that dwelleth therein shall languish, with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven; yea, the fishes of the sea also shall be taken away." But in the generation of the Flood, a decree was not issued concerning the fish of the sea, as it is stated: "Everything that is in the dry land died" – but not the fish of the sea. And here, even the fish of the sea.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא עַד דְּעָבֵיד לְכוּלְּהוּ! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מִפְּנֵי אָלָה אָבְלָה הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: But say until they perform all of them, not enter your mind as it is written: “For because of swearing the land mourns”
llm_translation: And why not until he does for all of them! It is not as you think, as it is written: "Because the land is in mourning on account of the curse."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: אָלָה לְחוּד, וְהָנָךְ לְחוּדֵיהוֹן!
human_translation: But say oath is distinct, and these are distinct,
llm_translation: And why not? "Alah" for itself, and "hanach" for themselves!

hebrew_text: מִי כְּתִיב ״וּפָרָצוּ״? ״פָּרָצוּ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Is it written: And they break all bounds, is written: “They break all bounds,”
llm_translation: Who is it written "and they broke through"? "Broke through" is written.

hebrew_text: הֲדוּר יָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: הָא דִּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהֵבִיאָה חַטָּאתָהּ וּמֵתָה – יָבִיאוּ יוֹרְשִׁין עוֹלָתָהּ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְהוּא שֶׁהִפְרִישַׁתָּה מֵחַיִּים. אֲבָל לֹא הִפְרִישַׁתָּה מֵחַיִּים – לָא.
human_translation: They then sat and said that which we learned a woman who brought her sin-offering and died, the heirs bring her burnt-offering Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: And is when separated, in her lifetime. But had not separated it in her lifetime, no,
llm_translation: The scholars sat and said: The one we learned: The woman who brought her sin offering and died - her heirs bring her burnt offering. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: And this is when she had separated from life. But if she had not separated from life - no.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר שִׁיעְבּוּדָא לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף עַל גַּב שֶׁלֹּא הִפְרִישַׁתָּה מֵחַיִּים. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: שִׁיעְבּוּדָא הָוֵה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Apparently, maintains not liened by Torah law. Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even though she did not separate in her lifetime. Apparently, maintains liened by Torah law.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: He maintains that it is not a biblical prohibition. Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even though you did not separate it from the living. This indicates that he holds: It is a biblical prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְהָא פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מִלְוָה עַל פֶּה – אֵינָהּ גּוֹבָה מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁין וְלֹא מִן הַלָּקוֹחוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מִלְוָה עַל פֶּה – גּוֹבָה בֵּין מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁין, בֵּין מִן הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: But disagreed about once; As Rav and Shmuel both say: a loan by oral cannot collect from the heirs or from those who purchased And Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say: a loan by oral collect from the heirs and from those who purchased
llm_translation: And here they dispute in it one time, for Rav and Shmuel who both say: A loan on verbal agreement - it is not collected from the heirs nor from the buyers. And Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish who both say: A loan on verbal agreement - it is collected both from the heirs and from the buyers.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא – בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִלְוָה כְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה הִיא, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ – אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְהוּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: necessary as, if were stated about this with regard to this that Shmuel says because it is a loan that is not written in the Torah. But with regard to this say he concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan and to Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: The matter is, for if it is stated in this case - in that case it is said by Shmuel, because it is not a written loan in the Torah, but in this case - say that he agrees with Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא – בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּמִלְוָה כְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה כִּכְתוּבָה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמְיָא, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ – אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us about this Rabbi Yoḥanan says this a loan written in the Torah is like one written in a document. But with regard to this say he concedes to Shmuel necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear in this - in this is what Rabbi Yochanan is saying, that a loan written in the Torah is like a loan written in a document, but in that case - say it is conceded to Shmuel, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִילְכְתָא, מִלְוָה עַל פֶּה – גּוֹבֶה מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁין, וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִן הַלָּקוֹחוֹת. גּוֹבֶה מִן הַיּוֹרְשִׁין – שִׁיעְבּוּדָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִן הַלָּקוֹחוֹת – דְּלֵית לֵיהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said the halakha a loan by oral collect from the heirs but he cannot collect from those who purchased he can collect from the heirs liened by Torah law. But he cannot collect from those who purchased does not generate publicity,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The halacha is, a loan on verbal agreement - collected from heirs, but not collected from purchasers. Collected from heirs - it is a biblical obligation, and not collected from purchasers - as it does not have a lightness.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בְּגֵט וּבְמִיתַת הַבַּעַל. בִּשְׁלָמָא גֵּט, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתַב לָהּ סֵפֶר כְּרִיתֻת״.
human_translation: And acquires herself through a bill of divorce or through the death of the husband. Granted, a bill of divorce, as it is written “And he writes for her a scroll of severance,
llm_translation: And she acquires herself with a divorce and with the death of the husband. In the case of a divorce, it is understandable, as it is written: "And he shall write her a bill of divorcement."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִיתַת הַבַּעַל מְנָלַן? סְבָרָא הוּא: הוּא אַסְרַהּ וְהוּא שָׁרְתַהּ.
human_translation: But from where do we the death of the husband is logical reasoning: He, rendered her forbidden and he permitted her.
llm_translation: Rather, from the death of the husband where is it derived? It is a logical deduction: he prohibited her and he permitted her.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עֲרָיוֹת, דְּאָסַר לְהוּ וְלָא שָׁרֵי לְהוּ! אֶלָּא מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים – אֲסוּרָה, הָא יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים – מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: But those with whom relations are forbidden, as he renders forbidden to them, and does not permit to them Rather, from that the Merciful One states a yevama who does not have children is prohibited who has children is permitted
llm_translation: And this, the forbidden relationships, that it prohibited for him and not permitted for him! Rather, since the Merciful One said a yevamah who has no children - she is forbidden, but if she has children - she is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא: אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים – אֲסוּרָה לְעָלְמָא וְשַׁרְיָא לְיָבָם, וְיֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים – לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נָמֵי אֲסוּרָה! אֶלָּא, מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל – אֲסוּרָה, הָא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: But perhaps does not have children is forbidden to everyone and permitted to the yavam , and has children is forbidden to everyone also. Rather, from the Merciful One states a widow is forbidden to a High Priest. permitted to a common priest,
llm_translation: Perhaps: she has no sons - she is forbidden to the world and permissible to the levir, and she has sons - to everyone else in the world she is forbidden! Rather, since the Merciful One said a widow to a high priest is forbidden, but to a common priest she is permissible.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּלָאו, לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בַּעֲשֵׂה? הַאי עֲשֵׂה מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? אִי דְּאַהַנְיָא מִיתַת הַבַּעַל – תִּישְׁתְּרֵי לִגְמָרֵי, אִי דְּלָא אַהַנְיָא מִיתַת הַבַּעַל – תּוֹקְמַהּ בְּמִילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא!
human_translation: But perhaps to a High Priest by a prohibition, to everyone else by a positive mitzva. This positive mitzva, what is its purpose? If the death of the husband affects she should be entirely permitted, if the death of the husband does not affect she remains in her initial state
llm_translation: Perhaps for the High Priest without the red heifer, for everyone in the world it is by doing? This doing, what does it accomplish? If it is beneficial for the death of the husband - it is completely permitted, if it is not beneficial for the death of the husband - it stands in the way of the matter before us!

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא? אַפִּיקְתַּהּ מִמִּיתָה וְאוֹקֵימְתַּהּ עַל עֲשֵׂה, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַפְּסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁים,
human_translation: why not removed her from death and placed her in a positive mitzva, just as it is with consecrated that have been disqualified.
llm_translation: "Why not? You have removed it from its source of death and established it on a positive commandment, for it is considered disqualified items of the consecrated offerings."

hebrew_text: דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אִית בְּהוּ מְעִילָה, וַאֲסִירִי בְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה. פַּרְקִינְהוּ – מְעִילָה לֵית בְּהוּ, בְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה אֲסִירִי.
human_translation: that initially, they are subject misuse, And shearing labor is prohibited. one has redeemed them, misuse does not apply to them, shearing labor prohibited.
llm_translation: From the outset, there is a cloak, and it is prohibited with shearing and labor. We differentiate - there is no cloak, but shearing and labor are prohibited.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִדְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״פֶּן יָמוּת בַּמִּלְחָמָה וְאִישׁ אַחֵר יִקָּחֶנָּה״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: אֵימָא, מַאן אַחֵר – יָבָם!
human_translation: Rather, from that the verse states: “Lest he die in battle and another man take her” Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to this: say: Who is other a yavam .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, from what the verse says: "lest he die in battle, and another man take her." Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to this: Say, who is the other man - the brother-in-law!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁתֵּי תְּשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר: חֲדָא, דְּיָבָם לָא אִיקְּרִי אַחֵר. וְעוֹד: כְּתִיב: ״וּשְׂנֵאָהּ הָאִישׁ הָאַחֲרוֹן וְכָתַב לָהּ סֵפֶר כְּרִיתֻת״ ״אוֹ כִי יָמוּת הָאִישׁ הָאַחֲרוֹן״, וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ מִיתָה לְגֵירוּשִׁין – מָה גֵּירוּשִׁין שַׁרְיָא וְגוֹמֶרֶת, אַף מִיתָה שַׁרְיָא וְגוֹמֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said two refutations of statement: First, a yavam is not called “another,” And furthermore, it is written: “And the latter husband hates her, and writes her a scroll of severance and gives it in her hand and sends her out of his house, or if the latter husband dies” juxtaposes death to divorce: Just as divorce permits and completes so too, death permits and completes
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: There are two ways to understand this matter: One, that yibum is not called another. And furthermore, it is written: "And the latter husband who hates her and writes her a bill of divorce" or "or if the latter husband dies," and death is compared to divorce - just as divorce is final and complete, so too death is final and complete.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְּבָמָה נִקְנֵית בְּבִיאָה כּוּ׳. בְּבִיאָה מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא:
human_translation: And a yevama acquired through intercourse. From where do we through intercourse? The verse states:
llm_translation: The yevamah is acquired through intercourse, as it is stated: "Through intercourse." How do we know that she is acquired through intercourse? The verse states:

hebrew_text: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ וּלְקָחָהּ לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״. וְאֵימָא, לְכוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא כְּאִשָּׁה! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהוּ כֶּסֶף וּשְׁטָר גּוֹמְרִים בָּהּ, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַבִּיאָה גּוֹמֶרֶת בָּהּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ – בִּיאָה גּוֹמֶרֶת בָּהּ וְאֵין כֶּסֶף וּשְׁטָר גּוֹמְרִים בָּהּ.
human_translation: “Her brother-in-law will engage in sexual intercourse with her and take her to him as a wife, But say with regard to all matters like a wife, not enter your mind as it is taught might money and a document can complete in the manner that intercourse completes the verse states: “And perform levirate marriage with her” intercourse completes her but money or a document do not complete her
llm_translation: The Yevamah he shall come upon her and take her for himself as a wife. But perhaps, in all respects, like a wife! It is not as you think, for it was taught: Can silver and a document complete her, just as the manner in which he consummated her completes her? The teaching states: "And he shall perform yibum with her" – the consummation completes her, and silver and a document do not complete her.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מַאי ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״? דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ מְיַבֵּם. אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא: ״וְיִבֵּם״, מַאי ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: But say: What “And perform levirate marriage with her”? that he can perform levirate marriage without her consent, If so, let the verse say: And perform levirate marriage, What is “And perform levirate marriage with her”? Learn two from this:
llm_translation: And why? What is "and he shall marry her"? Because he shall marry her by force. If so, let us say: the verse says "and he shall marry," what is "and he shall marry her"? You learn two from it.

hebrew_text: בַּחֲלִיצָה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּית חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״ – כֵּיוָן שֶׁחָלַץ בָּהּ נַעַל, הוּתְּרָה לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: through ḥalitza . From where do we As it is written “And his name shall be called in Israel: The house of him who had his shoe removed” Once shoe is removed by her, she is permitted to all of Israel.
llm_translation: In the matter of chalitzah. From where do we derive it? As it is written: "And his name shall be called in Israel, the house of him that hath his shoe loosed" - once he has loosed her shoe, she is permitted to all of Israel.

hebrew_text: הַאי ״יִשְׂרָאֵל״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ – בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל נׇכְרִים! תְּרֵי ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ כְּתִיבִי.
human_translation: This “Israel,” does it come this It is required for that which is taught Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda: “in Israel” in a Jewish court, but not in a gentile court. “in Israel” is written twice
llm_translation: This "Israel," for this reason did it come? This one wants to say to him as it was taught by Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah: "In Israel" - in the court of Israel, and not in the court of non-Jews! Two "In Israel" are written.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִינוּ יוֹשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וּבָאתָה יְבָמָה לַחְלוֹץ, וְאָמַר לָנוּ: עֲנוּ כּוּלְּכֶם וְאִמְרוּ: ״חֲלוּץ הַנַּעַל, חֲלוּץ הַנַּעַל״. הָהוּא, מִ״וְּנִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ״ נָפְקָא.
