human_translation: But still, we require for that which is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Once we were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon and a yevama came to perform ḥalitza . And said to us All of you answer and say: The one whose shoe was removed, the one whose shoe was removed. That it is derived from: “And his name shall be called,”
llm_translation: And once from the students of the academy, Rabbi Yehuda said: "One time we were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon, and a yevamah came to perform chalitzah, and he said to us: 'All of you answer and say, "Remove the shoe, remove the shoe."' That one, whose name was 'V'Nikra Shmo,' went out.

hebrew_text: וּבְמִיתַת הַיָּבָם. מְנָלַן? קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁהִיא בְּחֶנֶק – מִיתַת הַבַּעַל מַתִּירָתָהּ, יְבָמָהּ שֶׁהִיא בְּלָאו – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: through the death of the yavam . From where do we an a fortiori If, a married woman, who is with strangulation, the death of her husband renders her permitted, it not all the more so a yevama , who is by prohibition,
llm_translation: In the case of the death of the yavam (levir), from where do we derive this? A fortiori reasoning: Just as the death of a woman whose husband is choking permits her to the yavam, a yevamah who is in a prohibited relationship – all the more so, is it not the same?

hebrew_text: מָה לְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁכֵּן יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט, תֹּאמַר בְּזוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט! הָא נָמֵי יוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: What about a married woman that she can leave through a bill of divorce you say with regard to this who does not leave through a bill of divorce? this also leaves through ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: What about a man's wife, that she goes out with a divorce document, she should say about this one that she does not go out with a divorce document! Indeed, she goes out with a release.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה לְאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁכֵּן אוֹסְרָהּ מַתִּירָהּ! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא נָמֵי אוֹסְרָהּ מַתִּירָהּ – יָבָם אוֹסְרָהּ, יָבָם שָׁרֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, What about a married woman that renders her forbidden renders her permitted Rav Ashi said: this as well, renders her forbidden renders her permitted: yavam renders her forbidden, yavam renders her permitted
llm_translation: Rather: What for a woman of a man that so her forbids permits! Said Rav Ashe: Here indeed forbids permits - a yavam forbids her, a yavam permits her.

hebrew_text: וּתְהֵא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ יוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט – יוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה, זוֹ, שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה? אָמַר קְרָא: ״סֵפֶר כְּרִיתֻת״ – סֵפֶר כּוֹרְתָהּ, וְאֵין דָּבָר אַחֵר כּוֹרְתָהּ.
human_translation: And let a married woman leave through ḥalitza , by an a fortiori If a yevama , who cannot leave through a bill of divorce, can leave through ḥalitza , is it not logical this who can leave through a bill of divorce, can leave through ḥalitza ? The verse states “A scroll of severance” a scroll, severs her and nothing else severs her
llm_translation: And let the wife of a man go out in chalitzah from a kal vachomer: And what yevamah that she does not go out with a get - she goes out with chalitzah, this, that she goes out with a get - is it not the law that she goes out with chalitzah? The verse says: "A book of cutting off" - a book of her being cut off, and there is nothing else but her being cut off.

hebrew_text: וּתְהֵא יְבָמָה יוֹצֵאת בְּגֵט מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁאֵין יוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה – יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט, זוֹ שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בַּחֲלִיצָה – אֵין דִּין שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כָּכָה״, וְ״כָכָה״ עִיכּוּבָא.
human_translation: And let a yevama leave through a bill of divorce, by an a fortiori If a married woman, who cannot leave through ḥalitza , can leave through a bill of divorce, is it not logical this who can leave through ḥalitza , can leave through a bill of divorce? The verse states: “So and “so” precludes
llm_translation: And let the yevamah go out with a get from a kal vachomer: And just as a married woman who does not go out with chalitzah - she goes out with a get, this one who goes out with chalitzah - is there not a law that she goes out with a get? The verse says: "So" and "so" is a restrictive clause.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא עִיכּוּבָא לָא דָּרְשִׁי קַל וָחוֹמֶר? וְהָא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים דִּכְתִיב: ״גּוֹרָל״, וְ״חוּקָּה״,
human_translation: And anywhere that there is precludes one cannot learn an a fortiori But there is Yom Kippur, as it is written: lot and: statute
llm_translation: And all where there is a liability, did you not expound a fortiori argument? But the Day of Atonement, as it is written: "lot" and "statute,"

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״ – הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: And it is taught and he shall offer it for a sin-offering” the lottery renders a sin-offering, a verbal designation does not render a sin-offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was made a sin offering" - the lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל, וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל – קִידֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם, מְקוֹם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם?
human_translation: as might not inference, Just as in a case in which a lottery does not effect the consecration a verbal designation does effect the consecration a case in which a lottery does effect the consecration is it not right that a verbal designation should effect the consecration
llm_translation: He is able, and isn't this the law: And what in a place where he did not sanctify the lot - he sanctified the Name, in a place where he sanctified the lot - is it not the law that he should sanctify the Name?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״ – הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת. וְטַעְמָא דְּמַעֲטֵיהּ קְרָא, הָא לָאו הָכִי דָּרְשִׁינַן קַל וָחוֹמֶר, אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״חוּקָּה״!
human_translation: the verse states “He shall offer it for a sin-offering” the lottery renders a sin-offering, but a verbal designation does not render a sin-offering. And the reason is that the verse excluded that if it were not so, one would learn an a fortiori even though it is written with regard to it “statute.”
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make atonement" - the lot makes atonement, and the Name does not make atonement. And the reason for the minimal scriptural mention is that we do not interpret it as a fortiori argument, even though it is written in it "a statute"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״לָהּ״, ״לָהּ״ – וְלֹא לִיבָמָהּ. וְאֵימָא ״לָהּ״ לִשְׁמָהּ!
human_translation: The verse states for her “For her” but not for a yevama . But say “for her” for her sake.
llm_translation: The verse said: "to her", "to her" - and not to her yibum. And why not say "to her" for her name!

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי ״לָהּ״ כְּתִיבִי. וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ חַד ״לָהּ״ לִשְׁמָהּ, וְאִידָּךְ ״לָהּ״ – וְלֹא לָהּ וְלַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ!
human_translation: “For her” is written twice And still, one “For her” is required for her sake, and the other “for her” and not for her and for another,
llm_translation: Two "lah" are written. And one is needed for itself "lah" for its own sake, and the other "lah" - not for itself and for its companion!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״נָעַל״ – נַעַל אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא – לָא.
human_translation: Rather, the verse states: shoe shoe, yes, something else, no,
llm_translation: Rather, the verse says: "na'al" - a shoe is not considered from another source - no.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״נָעַל״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״נַעֲלוֹ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא נַעֲלוֹ, נַעַל שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: But this “shoe,” does it come this? It is necessary for that which is taught his shoe” I have only his shoe From where shoe of any person
llm_translation: This "na'al" is thus the reason it came? This from where does it require? As it was taught: "his shoe" - I have only his shoe, how do I know the shoe of every man is included in it?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נַעַל״ ״נַעַל״ – רִיבָּה. אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״נַעֲלוֹ״? – נַעֲלוֹ הָרָאוּי לוֹ, פְּרָט לְגָדוֹל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לְהַלֵּךְ בּוֹ, פְּרָט לְקָטָן שֶׁאֵין חוֹפֶה אֶת רוֹב רַגְלוֹ, פְּרָט
human_translation: The verse states “shoe,” “shoe,” includes If so, what the verse states “his shoe,” his shoe that is fit for him, excluding large that he cannot walk in it, excluding small that it does not cover most of his foot, excluding
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Shoe, shoe" - dispute. If so, what does the Talmud teach by saying "his shoe"? - His fitting shoe, excluding the large one that he cannot walk in, excluding the small one that does not cover most of his foot, excluding...

hebrew_text: לִמְסוּלְיָם שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עָקֵב! אִם כֵּן נִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״נָעַל״, מַאי ״הַנָּעַל״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: sandals [ mesulayim ] that have no heels, If so, let the verse write “shoe.” What “the shoe”? Learn two from it.
llm_translation: Regarding a sandal that has no heel! If so, it should be written "shoe," what is "the shoe"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֶבֶד עִבְרִי נִקְנֶה בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר, וְקוֹנֶה עַצְמוֹ בְּשָׁנִים, וּבַיּוֹבֵל, וּבְגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף. יְתֵירָה עָלָיו אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה שֶׁקּוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בְּסִימָנִין. הַנִּרְצָע, נִקְנֶה בִּרְצִיעָה, וְקוֹנֶה אֶת עַצְמוֹ בַּיּוֹבֵל, וּבְמִיתַת הָאָדוֹן.
human_translation: A Hebrew slave acquired through money or through a document, and acquire himself, through years, or through the Jubilee or through the deduction of money. A Hebrew maidservant more than him, as she acquires herself through signs who is pierced acquired through piercing and acquires himself through the Jubilee or through death of the master.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A Hebrew slave is acquired with money and with a contract, and he acquires himself in years, in the Jubilee, and with the redemption of silver. An additional cubit of the Hebrew maidservant who acquires herself with signs. If he consents, he is acquired with a document, and he acquires himself in the Jubilee, and with the death of the master.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ עֶבֶד עִבְרִי נִקְנֶה בְּכֶסֶף. מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִכֶּסֶף מִקְנָתוֹ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּקְנֶה בְּכֶסֶף. אַשְׁכְּחַן עֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְנׇכְרִי, הוֹאִיל וְכׇל קִנְיָנוֹ בְּכֶסֶף,
human_translation: a Hebrew slave acquired through money. From where do we verse states: “Out of the money that he was bought for” teaches acquired through money. We found a Hebrew slave who is sold to a gentile since all of the acquisitions with money,
llm_translation: Gemara: A Hebrew slave is acquired with money. From where do we derive this? The verse states: "From the money of his purchase" - this teaches that he is acquired with money. We find a Hebrew slave who is sold to a non-Jew, since all his acquisitions are with money.

hebrew_text: נִמְכָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמְּגָרַעַת פִּדְיוֹנָהּ, וְיוֹצְאָה.
human_translation: from where do we sold to a Jew verse states: be redeemed” teaches deducts from her redemption. is emancipated.
llm_translation: Sold to Israel from where? The verse says: "And he shall redeem" - this teaches that it deducts its redemption, and it goes out.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה, הוֹאִיל וּמִיקַּדְּשָׁה בְּכֶסֶף – מִיקַּנְיָא בְּכֶסֶף, עֶבֶד עִבְרִי מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יִמָּכֵר לְךָ אָחִיךָ הָעִבְרִי אוֹ הָעִבְרִיָּה וַעֲבָדְךָ שֵׁשׁ שָׁנִים״ – מַקִּישׁ עִבְרִי לְעִבְרִיָּה.
human_translation: we found a Hebrew maidservant, since betrothed through money, acquired through money. From where do we a Hebrew slave verse states: “If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman is sold to you, and he shall serve you six years” juxtaposes a Hebrew man to a Hebrew woman,
llm_translation: I found a Hebrew maidservant, since she sanctifies with silver - she acquires with silver, from where do we learn an Hebrew slave? The verse says: "If your Hebrew brother or Hebrew sister is sold to you, he shall serve you for six years" - it equates Hebrew to Hebrewess.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין, הוֹאִיל וְנִמְכָּר בְּעַל כּוֹרְחוֹ, מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We found a slave who is sold by the court. since sold against his will. From where do we sells himself
llm_translation: I have found his sale in the court, since it was sold by the owner himself, where did he sell himself from?

hebrew_text: יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּיָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּלָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: derives “hired worker” “hired worker.” This works out well according to the one who “hired worker” “hired worker.” But according to the one who does not derive “hired worker” “hired worker,” what can be said?
llm_translation: The word "sakir" is repeated. It is preferable for one who repeats "sakir" to repeat "sakir," but for one who does not repeat "sakir" to not repeat "sakir," what can be said?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי תַשִּׂיג״ – מוּסָף עַל עִנְיָן רִאשׁוֹן, וְיִלְמַד עֶלְיוֹן מִתַּחְתּוֹן.
human_translation: verse states “And if becomes rich” add to the first matter, let the above case be derived from the case below
llm_translation: The verse says: "And if you reach" - an addition on the first matter, and the upper one should learn from the lower.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דְּלָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״? הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ נִמְכָּר לְשֵׁשׁ, וְיָתֵר עַל שֵׁשׁ, מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין – אֵינוֹ נִמְכָּר אֶלָּא לְשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: And who who does not derive “hired worker” “hired worker”? It is this tanna , as it is taught in sells himself is sold for six and more than six sold by the court is sold only for six
llm_translation: And who is the Tanna that does not differentiate between "sakir" and "sakir"? This Tanna, as it was taught: One who sells himself is sold for six, and more than six, if the court sold him - he is only sold for six.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין – נִרְצָע. מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ אֵין מַעֲנִיקִים לוֹ, מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין – מַעֲנִיקִים לוֹ. הַמּוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ אֵין רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית, מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין – רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית.
human_translation: One who sells himself may not be pierced sold by the court may be pierced sells himself is not granted sold by the court is granted one who sells himself, his master may not provide him a Canaanite maidservant sold by the court, his master may provide him a Canaanite maidservant.
llm_translation: The one who sells himself is not accepted, if the court sold him - he is accepted. The one who sells himself is not given a maidservant, if the court sold him - he is given a maidservant. The one who sells himself, his master does not give him a Canaanite maidservant, if the court sold him - his master gives him a Canaanite maidservant.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: זֶה וָזֶה אֵינוֹ נִמְכָּר אֶלָּא לְשֵׁשׁ, זֶה וָזֶה נִרְצָע, וָזֶה וָזֶה מַעֲנִיקִים לוֹ, וְזֶה וָזֶה רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא לָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says this and that sold for only six this and that pierced this and that are granted this and that his master may provide him a Canaanite maidservant. What, is it not they disagree with regard to this, that the first tanna does not derive “hired worker” “hired worker,” and Rabbi Elazar derives “hired worker” “hired worker”?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: This and this are only sold for six, this and this are rejected, and this and this are granted to him, and this and this his master gives him a Canaanite maidservant. What is the reason that they do not argue about this? Because the first Tanna does not repeat "hirer, hirer," and Rabbi Elazar repeats "hirer, hirer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב טָבְיוֹמֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָלֵיף ״שְׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, וְהָכָא בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּאָמַר מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ נִמְכָּר לְשֵׁשׁ וְיָתֵר עַל שֵׁשׁ? מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין: ״וַעֲבָדְךָ שֵׁשׁ שָׁנִים״ – זֶה, וְלֹא מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Tavyumei said in the name of Abaye: everyone derives “hired worker” “hired worker,” and here, they disagree about this verse. What is the reasoning the first tanna , who says sells himself is sold for six and more than six sold by the court, the Merciful One excludes and he shall serve you six years” this not sells himself.
llm_translation: Rav Tavyumei said in the name of Abbaye: In all the world, one may derive "sakir" "sakir," and here in this verse it is divided: What is the reason that the first tanna said, "One who sells himself is sold for six and more than six?" The Merciful One has limited his sale in the court: "And your servant shall serve six years" – this, and not one who sells himself.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ: ״וַעֲבָדְךָ״ – לְךָ, וְלֹא לְיוֹרֵשׁ.
human_translation: And the other, “And he shall serve you” for you and not for an heir
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: "and your servant" - to you, and not to the heir.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? ״וַעֲבָדְךָ״ אַחֲרִינָא כְּתִיב. וְאִידַּךְ? הַהוּא לְהַרְצָאַת אָדוֹן הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the other, “And he shall serve you,” written another And the other, that comes to appease the master.
llm_translation: The other one? "And your servant" is written elsewhere. And the other one? That one came to appease his master.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּאָמַר מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע? מִדְּמַיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין: ״וְרָצַע אֲדֹנָיו אֶת אׇזְנוֹ בַּמַּרְצֵעַ״ – אׇזְנוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְלֹא אׇזְנוֹ שֶׁל מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the first tanna , who says sells himself is not pierced from with regard to one sold by the court, the Merciful One excludes “And his master shall pierce his ear with an awl” His ear, and not the ear of sells himself.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna said, "One who sells himself is not appeased"? Because the Merciful One is displeased with the sale of himself by the court: "And his master shall bore his ear through with an awl" - his own ear, and not the ear of one who sells himself.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? הָהִיא – לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לִרְצִיעָה שֶׁהִיא בְּאֹזֶן יָמָנִית? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״אֹזֶן״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״אֹזֶן״. מָה לְהַלָּן יָמִין – אַף כָּאן יָמִין.
human_translation: And the other That comes for a verbal analogy. As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: From where piercing on the right ear? It is stated: Ear, here, and it is stated there, ear Just as there, right so too here, right
llm_translation: The other one? That is comparable to a decree that has come. As it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: From where do we derive the tearing that is in the right ear? It is stated here: "ear," and it is stated there: "ear." Just as there it is the right side, so too here it is the right side.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא ״אֹזֶן״, מַאי ״אׇזְנוֹ״?
human_translation: And the other if it is so let the verse say Ear, What “his ear”?
llm_translation: And the other opinion? If so, let him say the verse says "ear," what is "his ear"?

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: ״אׇזְנוֹ״ – וְלֹא אׇזְנָהּ. וְאִידַּךְ? נָפְקָא לַהּ מִ״וְּאִם יֹאמַר הָעֶבֶד״ – הָעֶבֶד וְלֹא אָמָה.
human_translation: And the other That is necessary “his ear” but not her ear. And the other He derives it from “But if the slave shall say” the slave but not a maidservant.
llm_translation: The other one? He responded to him: "His ear" - and not her ear. And the other one? It was derived for him from "if the servant says" - the servant and not the maidservant.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר כְּשֶׁהוּא עֶבֶד.
human_translation: And the other requires provided that he says when he is a slave.
llm_translation: And the other opinion? It requires of it: until he says "when he is a slave."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? מֵ״עֶבֶד״ ״הָעֶבֶד״ נָפְקָא. וְאִידַּךְ? ״עֶבֶד״ ״הָעֶבֶד״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And the other He derives from Slave, “the slave.” And the other does not learn Slave, “the slave.”
llm_translation: And the other opinion? From "eved" "ha'eved" is derived. And the other opinion? "Eved" "ha'eved" is not expounded.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּאָמַר מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ אֵין מַעֲנִיקִין לוֹ? מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין: ״הַעֲנֵיק תַּעֲנִיק לוֹ״ – לוֹ, וְלֹא לְמוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the first tanna , who says one does not grant to one who sells himself? With regard to one sold by the court, the Merciful One excludes “You shall give a severance gift to him” “To him” but not to one who sells himself.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught that when one sells himself, we do not grant him a reprieve? The Merciful One is stringent regarding the sale of himself by the court: "You shall surely grant him a reprieve" – to him, and not to the one who sells himself.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: לוֹ, וְלֹא לְיוֹרְשָׁיו. יוֹרְשָׁיו אַמַּאי לָא? ״שָׂכִיר״ קַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא, מָה שָׂכִיר פְּעוּלָּתוֹ לְיוֹרְשָׁיו – אַף הַאי פְּעוּלָּתוֹ לְיוֹרְשָׁיו! אֶלָּא: לוֹ, וְלֹא לְבַעַל חוֹבוֹ.
human_translation: And the other He requires that “To him” but not to his heirs. Why not to his heirs? the Merciful One calls “a hired worker.” Just as the labor of a hired worker to his heirs so too this his labor to his heirs Rather, “to him,” but not to creditor.
llm_translation: And the other one? He requires it for himself: for him, and not for his heirs. Why not for his heirs? "Hired worker" the Merciful One calls him, just as a hired worker's work belongs to his heirs - so too, this one's work belongs to his heirs! Rather: for him, and not for his creditor.

hebrew_text: מִדִּסְבִירָא לַן בְּעָלְמָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵרוֹ מָנֶה, וַחֲבֵרוֹ בַּחֲבֵרוֹ – מִנַּיִן שֶׁמּוֹצִיאִין מִזֶּה וְנוֹתְנִין לָזֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַאֲשֶׁר אָשַׁם לוֹ״.
human_translation: that we generally hold in accordance with Rabbi Natan, as it is taught Rabbi Natan says: From where that one who lends one hundred dinars to another, and the other to another, from where that appropriates from this one, and gives to that one, The verse states: “And he shall give it to him whom he has wronged”
llm_translation: From the explanation to us in the world like Rabbi Natan, as it was taught, Rabbi Natan said: From where do we know that one can appoint on behalf of his friend, and his friend on behalf of his friend - from where do we know that they can take from this one and give to that one? The Torah teaches: "And he shall give it to the one who is guilty of the guilt offering."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא ״לוֹ״ לְאַפּוֹקֵי. וְאִידַּךְ? בְּעָלְמָא נָמֵי לָא סְבִירָא לַן כְּרַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: “to him” comes to exclude And the other we generally do not hold in accordance with Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: He came "to him" to inquire. And the other? Generally, it is not plausible to us like Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּאָמַר מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ אֵין רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית? מַיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין: ״אִם אֲדֹנָיו יִתֶּן לוֹ אִשָּׁה״ – לוֹ, וְלֹא לְמוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ. וְאִידַּךְ? לוֹ – בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the first tanna , who says one sells himself his master does not provide him a Canaanite maidservant? With regard to one sold by the court, the Merciful One excludes “If his master give to him a wife” “to him” but not to one who sells himself. And the other “To him” against his will.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught that if a person sells himself, his master does not give him a Canaanite maidservant? The Merciful One limits it in the case of his sale by the court: "If his master gives him a wife" - to him, and not to one who sells himself. And the other opinion? To him - against his will.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? מִ״כִּי מִשְׁנֶה שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר״ נָפְקָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״כִּי מִשְׁנֶה שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר עֲבָדְךָ״ – שָׂכִיר אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵד אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, עֶבֶד עִבְרִי עוֹבֵד בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: And the other He derives from “For double of the hire of a hired worker As it is taught “For double of the hire of a hired worker he has served you,” a hired worker works only during the day, a Hebrew slave works both during the day and at night.
llm_translation: The other opinion? From "for he is a hired worker" it is derived, as it was taught: "For he is a hired worker with you" - a hired worker only works during the day, but a Hebrew slave works both during the day and at night.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תַעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁעֶבֶד עִבְרִי עוֹבֵד בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״כִּי טוֹב לוֹ עִמָּךְ״ – עִמְּךָ בַּמַּאֲכָל, עִמְּךָ בַּמִּשְׁתֶּה. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִכָּאן שֶׁרַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית.
human_translation: And can it enter your mind that a Hebrew slave works both during the day and at night? But isn’t it already stated: “Because he fares well with you” with you in food with you in drink? And Rabbi Yitzḥak says From here that his master may provide him a Canaanite maidservant
llm_translation: And if you think that a Hebrew slave works both by day and by night? But hasn't it already been said: "For it is good for him with you" - with you in eating, with you in drinking. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: From here it is derived that one should increase giving him a Canaanite maidservant.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ, אֲבָל בְּעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And the other if from there I would say: This matter applies with his consent; but against his will, I would say no, teaches us
llm_translation: And the other one? If from there, would have said those words from his own knowledge, but against his will, why not? He is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מַאן תַּנָּא דְּלָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״? הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשָׁב אֶל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״ אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: בַּמָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? אִי בְּמוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ – הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר!
human_translation: Rather, who is the tanna does not derive “hired worker” “hired worker”? It is this tanna , as it is taught and shall return to his own family Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: What is the verse speaking of If of one who sold himself is already stated:
llm_translation: Rather, who is the Tanna that does not derive "sakir" "sakir"? This Tanna, for it was taught: "And he shall return to his family, etc." Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: In what context does the verse speak? If about one who hires himself out - it has already been stated!

hebrew_text: אִי בְּנִרְצָע – הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר! הָא אֵין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּמְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים לִפְנֵי הַיּוֹבֵל, שֶׁהַיּוֹבֵל מוֹצִיאוֹ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, לְמָה לִי? נֵילַף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״!
human_translation: If of a pierced is already stated, the verse is speaking of nothing other sold by the court two or three years before the Jubilee that the Jubilee releases him And if enter your mind derives “hired worker” “hired worker,” why do I Let him derive “hired worker” “hired worker,”
llm_translation: If you say "in the case of a sale" - behold, it has already been stated! For the verse speaks only of his sale by the court, two or three years before the Jubilee, for the Jubilee releases him. And if you think to compare "hired worker" "hired worker," why do I need it? We should compare "hired worker" "hired worker"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, מוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ הוּא, דְּלָא עֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא, אֲבָל מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין, דַּעֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא, אֵימָא נִיקְנְסֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said Actually, derives “hired worker” “hired worker” and was necessary enter your mind to say one who sells himself, who did not commit a transgression, but one sold by the court, who did commit a transgression, say we should penalize him teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Always prefer "sakir" "sakir," and it is necessary. As your mind rises, I say, he hired himself, for he did not perform a prohibition, but if the court sold him, they performed a prohibition. Say, perhaps they should be liable, it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִי בְּנִרְצָע – הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר. מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשַׁבְתֶּם אִישׁ אֶל אֲחֻזָּתוֹ וְאִישׁ אֶל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״ בַּמָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? אִי בְּמוֹכֵר עַצְמוֹ – הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר!
human_translation: The Master said If about a pierced is already stated. What is As it is taught “And you shall return, each man to his land, and each man to his family” What is the verse speaking of? If of one who sells himself, is already stated:
llm_translation: Master said: If he is unwilling - behold, it is already stated. What is it? As it was taught: "And you shall return each man to his possession, and each man to his family, etc." What is the Scripture speaking about? If he is selling himself - behold, it is already stated!

hebrew_text: אִי בִּמְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין – הֲרֵי כְּבָר אָמוּר! הָא אֵין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּנִרְצַע שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים לִפְנֵי הַיּוֹבֵל, שֶׁהַיּוֹבֵל מוֹצִיאוֹ. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רָבָא בַּר שֵׁילָא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִישׁ״, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁנּוֹהֵג בָּאִישׁ וְאֵין נוֹהֵג בָּאִשָּׁה – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זוֹ רְצִיעָה.
human_translation: If of one who was sold by the court, is already stated: the verse is speaking of nothing other who is pierced two or three years before the Jubilee that the Jubilee releases him. From where may be inferred Rava bar Sheila said the verse states “man.” What matter applies to a man and does not apply to a woman? You must say this is piercing
llm_translation: If they sold it in court - behold, it is already stated! For the verse speaks only of that which is sold for two or three years before the Jubilee, as the Jubilee redeems it. What is the implication? Rava bar Sheilah said: The verse states "a man," what is a matter that is common with a man and not common with a woman - this is a courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב נִרְצָע. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְטַאי זִמְנֵיהּ, אֲבָל נִרְצָע, דִּמְטַאי זִמְנֵיהּ, אֵימָא נִיקְנְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write one sold by the court and it was necessary to write a pierced As, if informed us one who was sold by the court, because his time had not come But a pierced whose time had come say we should penalize him
llm_translation: And it is necessary to write his sale by the court, and it is necessary to write his consent. For if we were to say his sale by the court, because his time does not come, but his consent, since his time comes, we might say he should be compelled.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן נִרְצָע, מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲבַד לֵיהּ שֵׁשׁ, אֲבָל מְכָרוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין, דְּלָא עֲבַד לֵיהּ שֵׁשׁ, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if informed us pierced because he has served for six but one who was sold by the court, has not served for six say not it was necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say that he consented, because he did it willingly, but if the court sold him, as he did not do it willingly, we might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״וְשַׁבְתֶּם״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״לְעוֹלָם״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לְעוֹלָם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְעוֹלָם מַמָּשׁ, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְשַׁבְתֶּם״.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write “And you shall return, and it was necessary to write forever” As, if the Merciful One written “forever,” I would say actually forever, the Merciful One writes: “And you shall return.”
llm_translation: And it was necessary to write "and you shall return," and it was necessary to write "forever." For if the Merciful One had written "forever," I would have said forever literally. The Merciful One wrote "and you shall return."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְשַׁבְתֶּם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא עֲבַד שֵׁשׁ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דַּעֲבַד שֵׁשׁ לֹא יְהֵא סוֹפוֹ חָמוּר מִתְּחִלָּתוֹ, מָה תְּחִלָּתוֹ שֵׁשׁ – אַף סוֹפוֹ נָמֵי שֵׁשׁ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן: ״לְעוֹלָם״ – לְעוֹלָמוֹ שֶׁל יוֹבֵל.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One written “and you shall return,” I would say this statement applies where he did not serve six but where he did serve six His final should not be stricter than his initial Just as his initial six so too his final six teaches us “forever,” forever until the Jubilee
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "and you shall return," I would say: these matters, where they did not perform six, but where they did perform six, its end should not be more stringent than its beginning. Just as its beginning is six, so too its end is six. It teaches us: "forever" - the forever of the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאן תַּנָּא דְּלָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״? רַבִּי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Rather, who is the tanna does not derive “hired worker” “hired worker”? It is Rabbi as it is taught
llm_translation: Instead, who is the Tanna that does not derive "sakir" "sakir"? It is Rabbi Hiya, as it was taught:

hebrew_text: ״וְאִם לֹא יִגָּאֵל בְּאֵלֶּה״ רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּאֵלֶּה הוּא נִגְאָל, וְאֵין נִגְאָל בְּשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: “And if he is not redeemed by any of these, Rabbi says: He can be redeemed through these, and he is not redeemed after six
llm_translation: "And if he does not redeem it within these specified days," Rabbi says: He is redeemed within these specified days, and he is not redeemed within six days."

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא, וּמָה מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל בְּאֵלֶּה – נִגְאָל בְּשֵׁשׁ, זֶה, שֶׁנִּגְאָל בְּאֵלֶּה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנִּגְאָל בְּשֵׁשׁ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּאֵלֶּה״ – בְּאֵלֶּה הוּא נִגְאָל, וְאֵין נִגְאָל בְּשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: As I might have not inference: If one who cannot be redeemed by these is redeemed after six is it not logical this who can be redeemed by these can be redeemed after six the verse states “by any of these,” can be redeemed through these and he cannot be redeemed after six
llm_translation: Talmudic text: That he is able, and is it not the law, and what about one who is not redeemed with these - he is redeemed with six, this, that he is redeemed with these - is he not redeemed with six? The Talmud teaches: "with these" - with these he is redeemed, and he is not redeemed with six.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, אַמַּאי קָאָמַר ״וּמָה מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל בְּאֵלֶּה״? נֵילַף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind that derives “hired worker” “hired worker,” why say: If one who cannot be redeemed by these, Let him derive “hired worker” “hired worker.”
llm_translation: If your mind inclines to interpret "hired worker" as "hired worker," why does it say, "And what about someone who is not redeemed with these"? Interpret "hired worker" as "hired worker"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ – לָזֶה, וְלֹא לְאַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: actually does derive “hired worker” “hired worker,” and it is different here, as the verse states: may redeem him” for this and not for another
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Always prefer "sakir" "sakir," and different here where the verse says "yigalenno" - for this one, and not for another.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל בְּאֵלֶּה״ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: ״בְּאֵלֶּה״ – לְשִׁחְרוּר, בִּשְׁאָר כׇּל אָדָם – לְשִׁעְבּוּד. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״בְּאֵלֶּה״ – לְשִׁעְבּוּד, בִּשְׁאָר כׇּל אָדָם – לְשִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: And who is the tanna disagrees with Rabbi Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and Rabbi Akiva. As it is taught he is not redeemed by any of these” Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: “by any of these” to freedom, by anyone else to slavery. Rabbi Akiva says By these to slavery, by anyone else, to freedom.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is the Tanna that disputes with regard to the ruling of Rabbi? Rabbi Yosei the Galilean and Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught: 'He shall not redeem it' - Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: 'With these' - for freedom, with all other people - for servitude. Rabbi Akiva says: 'With these' - for servitude, with all other people - for freedom."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִם לֹא יִגָּאֵל בְּאֵלֶּה״ – אֶלָּא בְּאַחֵר – ״וְיָצָא בִּשְׁנַת הַיּוֹבֵל״. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם לֹא יִגָּאֵל״ – אֶלָּא – ״בְּאֵלֶּה״, ״וְיָצָא בִּשְׁנַת הַיּוֹבֵל״. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? מִידֵּי ״אֶלָּא בְּאֵלֶּה״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? The verse states “If he is not redeemed by any of these” but by another, “then he shall go out in the Jubilee Year,” And Rabbi Akiva says: “If he is not redeemed” only “by any of these,” “then he shall go out in the Jubilee Year,” And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili Is it written: Only by any of these?
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? The verse says: "If he is not redeemed by these" - rather by another - "and he shall go out in the year of Jubilee." And Rabbi Akiva says: "If he is not redeemed" - rather - "by these," "and he shall go out in the year of Jubilee." And Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? From where is it written "rather by these"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: ״אוֹ דֹדוֹ אוֹ בֶן דֹּדוֹ יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ – זוֹ גְּאוּלַּת קְרוֹבִים, ״אוֹ הִשִּׂיגָה יָדוֹ״ – זוֹ גְּאוּלַּת עַצְמוֹ, ״וְנִגְאָל״ – זוֹ גְּאוּלַּת אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Rather, they disagree with regard to this verse: “Either his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him”; this is the redemption by relatives. “Or if he becomes rich” this is redemption himself. “And he is redeemed”; this is redemption by other
llm_translation: Rather, in this verse he disputes: "Or his uncle or his cousin shall redeem him" - this is redemption by relatives, "or he himself is able to redeem it" - this is self-redemption, "and he shall be redeemed" - this is redemption by others.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: מִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ לְפָנָיו, שְׁדִי גְּאוּלַּת קְרוֹבִים אַגְּאוּלַּת עַצְמוֹ, מָה גְּאוּלַּת עַצְמוֹ לְשִׁחְרוּר – אַף גְּאוּלַּת קְרוֹבִים לְשִׁחְרוּר. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: מִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ לְאַחֲרָיו, שְׁדִי גְּאוּלַּת אֲחֵרִים אַגְּאוּלַּת עַצְמוֹ, מָה גְּאוּלַּת עַצְמוֹ לְשִׁחְרוּר – אַף גְּאוּלַּת אֲחֵרִים לְשִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili maintains: A verse is interpreted homiletically preceding it. cast, redemption by relatives to redemption by himself: Just as redemption by himself to freedom, so too, redemption by relatives to freedom. And Rabbi Akiva maintains a verse is interpreted homiletically after it. cast redemption by others to redemption by himself: Just as redemption by himself is to freedom, so too, redemption by others is to freedom,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili holds: The verse is expounded before Him, the redemption of close relatives is like one's own redemption. Just as one's own redemption leads to freedom, so too the redemption of close relatives leads to freedom. And Rabbi Akiva holds: The verse is expounded after Him, the redemption of others is like one's own redemption. Just as one's own redemption leads to freedom, so too the redemption of others leads to freedom.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״בְּאֵלֶּה״ לְמָה לִי? אִי לָאו ״בְּאֵלֶּה״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ בֵּין לְפָנָיו בֵּין לְאַחֲרָיו, וְהַכֹּל לְשִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: If so, why do I “by any of these,” If not “by any of these,” I would say a verse is interpreted homiletically preceding it as well as after it, and every to freedom.
llm_translation: So, "in these" why do I need? If not "in these" was I saying a verse interpreted between before it and after it, and all for liberation.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הֲדַר קוּשְׁיָא לְדוּכְתֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא, בִּסְבָרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי:
human_translation: If so, the difficulty has returned to its place, Rather, disagree with regard to reason.
llm_translation: If so, then a difficulty arises for his opinion. Rather, he disputes based on reasoning:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: מִסְתַּבְּרָא גְּאוּלַּת אֲחֵרִים לְשִׁיעְבּוּד, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לְשִׁחְרוּר, הֲווֹ מִימַּנְעִי וְלָא פָּרְקִי לֵיהּ. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: מִסְתַּבְּרָא גְּאוּלַּת קְרוֹבִים לְשִׁיעְבּוּד, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לְשִׁחְרוּר, כׇּל יוֹמָא וְיוֹמָא אֲזַל וּמְזַבֵּין נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili maintains: It stands to reason redemption by others to slavery, as, if you say to freedom, they will refrain and will not redeem him. And Rabbi Akiva maintains: It stands to reason redemption by relatives to slavery, as, if you say to freedom, each and every day he will go and sell himself
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili holds: The redemption of others is more plausible for servitude, for if you were to say for liberation, they would withhold and not release him. And Rabbi Akiva holds: The redemption of relatives is more plausible for servitude, for if you were to say for liberation, every day they would go and sell themselves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַכֹּל לְשִׁחְרוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and Rabbi Akiva, But the Rabbis say every to freedom.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean and Rabbi Akiva, but the sages say: everything is for freedom.

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי הִיא, דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְהַאי ״בְּאֵלֶּה״ לִדְרָשָׁה אַחֲרִינָא, וּמִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ בֵּין לְפָנָיו וּבֵין לְאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Who Rabbis? Rabbi who derives another exposition from this “by any of these,” And a verse is interpreted homiletically preceding it as well as after it.
llm_translation: Who is a sage? It is Rabbi, for he derives from it to this "in these" for another interpretation, and the verse is interpreted both before him and after him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, הַאי ״וְיָצָא בִּשְׁנַת הַיֹּבֵל״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְיָצָא בִּשְׁנַת הַיּוֹבֵל״
human_translation: And Rabbi what does he do with then he shall go out in the Jubilee Year” He requires for that which is taught “Then he shall go out in the Jubilee Year.”
llm_translation: Rabbi, this "and he shall go out in the year of the Jubilee," what does he do with it? He needs it for what was taught: "and he shall go out in the year of the Jubilee."

hebrew_text: – בְּנׇכְרִי שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ תַּחַת יָדֶךָ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּנׇכְרִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ תַּחַת יָדֶךָ? אָמַרְתָּ, וְכִי מָה אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ? הָא אֵין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּנׇכְרִי שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ תַּחַת יָדֶךָ.
human_translation: with regard to a gentile who is under your authority, Or only with regard to a gentile who is not under your authority. you say: But what can be done to him the verse must be speaking of nothing other a gentile who is under your authority.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: - If a non-Jew who is under your authority, or is it only a non-Jew who is not under your authority? You said, "And how is it possible to do to him?" The verse speaks only of a non-Jew who is under your authority.

hebrew_text: וּבִשְׁטָר. מְנָלַן? אָמַר עוּלָּא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִם אַחֶרֶת יִקַּח לוֹ״ – הִקִּישָׁהּ הַכָּתוּב לְאַחֶרֶת, מָה אַחֶרֶת מִקַּנְיָא בִּשְׁטָר – אַף אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה מִקַּנְיָא בִּשְׁטָר.
human_translation: or through a document. From where do we Ulla said: The verse states “If he takes himself another wife” The verse juxtaposes to another Just as another can be acquired through a document so too, a Hebrew maidservant can be acquired through a document.
llm_translation: And in a document. From where do we derive this? Ulla said: The verse states: "If he takes another wife" - the Scripture compared her to another. Just as another is acquired through a document, so too a Hebrew maidservant is acquired through a document.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׁטַר אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה אָדוֹן כּוֹתְבוֹ, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אָב כּוֹתְבוֹ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּאִיתְּמַר: שְׁטַר אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה, מִי כּוֹתְבוֹ? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אָדוֹן כּוֹתְבוֹ, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: אָב כּוֹתְבוֹ. הָנִיחָא לְרַב הוּנָא, אֶלָּא לְרַב חִסְדָּא מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says master writes the document Hebrew maidservant, But according the one who says father writes it, what can be said? As it was stated the document a Hebrew maidservant, who writes it? Rav Huna says: master writes it. Rav Ḥisda says: father writes it. This works out well according to Rav Huna, but according to Rav Ḥisda, what can be said?
llm_translation: The one who says: "The Hebrew bill of one cubit, the master writes it," rather the one who says: "The father writes it," what is there to say? For it was stated: The Hebrew bill of one cubit, who writes it? Rav Huna said: The master writes it, Rav Hisda said: The father writes it. If it is left to Rav Huna, rather to Rav Hisda, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תֵצֵא כְּצֵאת הָעֲבָדִים״ – אֲבָל נִקְנֵית הִיא כְּקִנְיַן עֲבָדִים. וּמַאי נִיהוּ – שְׁטָר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said The verse states “She shall not go out as the men slaves do” But she can be acquired in the acquisition of male slaves. And what is a document.
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: The verse states, "She shall not go out as the male servants go out" - but she is acquired like the acquisition of male servants. And what is the difference? A document.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: אֲבָל נִקְנֵית הִיא כְּקִנְיַן עֲבָדִים, וּמַאי נִיהוּ – חֲזָקָה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם״ – אוֹתָם בַּחֲזָקָה, וְלֹא אַחֵר בַּחֲזָקָה.
human_translation: But say But she can be acquired in the acquisition of male slaves, and what is possession. the verse states “And you shall bequeath them to your children after you” them, through possession, but other cannot through possession.
llm_translation: And why not? But if she is acquired like the acquisition of slaves, what is the difference? - It is a strong presumption! The verse says: "And you shall inherit them for your children after you" - them with a strong presumption, and not after with a strong presumption.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: אוֹתָם בִּשְׁטָר, וְלֹא אַחֵר בִּשְׁטָר! הָכְתִיב ״לֹא תֵצֵא כְּצֵאת הָעֲבָדִים״. וּמָה רָאִיתָ?
human_translation: But say they, through a document, but others cannot through a document. Isn’t it written: “She shall not go out as the men slaves do” what did you see
llm_translation: And why not those with a document, and not others with a document! It is written, "You shall not go out as the going out of the slaves." And what did you see?

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא, שְׁטָר הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן מוֹצִיאה בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אַדְּרַבָּה, חֲזָקָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן קוֹנָה בְּנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר! בְּאִישׁוּת מִיהַת לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן. אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְהָכִי אַהֲנִי ״אִם אַחֶרֶת״.
human_translation: It stands to reason a document should be included as release a Jewish woman, On the contrary, possession should be included, as it can effect acquisition of the property of a convert with regard to marriage, in any event, one does not find If you wish, say to that end, “if another,” is effective,
llm_translation: The document was, a document was for his creditors, for thus she brings out in the daughter of Israel. But Rabba, it was strong for his creditors, for thus he acquires in the property of a convert! In the ownership of his father, we do not find. If you wish, say: Therefore, it is beneficial "if another."

hebrew_text: וְרַב הוּנָא, הַאי ״לֹא תֵצֵא כְּצֵאת הָעֲבָדִים״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּרָאשֵׁי אֵבָרִים כְּעֶבֶד. וְרַב חִסְדָּא? אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״לֹא תֵּצֵא כָּעֲבָדִים״, מַאי ״כְּצֵאת הָעֲבָדִים״? – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And Rav Huna, what does he learn from this “She shall not go out as the men slaves do” He requires that that she is not released on to extremities like slave. And Rav Ḥisda, If so, let the verse write: She shall not go out as the men slaves. What “as the men slaves do”? Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: Rav Huna: What is the interpretation of the verse "lo teitzei k'tzeit ha'avodim"? That one should not go out with the tops of the limbs like a slave. And Rav Ḥisdah? If so, let it be written: "lo teitzei ka'avadim," what is "k'tzeit ha'avodim"? – Understand from it two things.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹנֶה אֶת עַצְמוֹ בְּשָׁנִים. דִּכְתִיב: ״שֵׁשׁ שָׁנִים יַעֲבֹד וּבַשְּׁבִעִת וְגוֹ׳״
human_translation: And can acquire himself after years As it is written: “Six years he shall labor; and in the seventh
llm_translation: And acquires himself in years. As it is written: "Six years he shall work, and in the seventh, etc."

hebrew_text: בַּיּוֹבֵל. דִּכְתִיב: ״עַד שְׁנַת הַיֹּבֵל יַעֲבֹד עִמָּךְ״.
human_translation: in the Jubilee as it is written: “He shall labor with you until the Jubilee Year”
llm_translation: The Jubilee. As it is written: "Until the year of the Jubilee he shall serve with you."

hebrew_text: בְּגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף. אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהׇפְדֵּה״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמְּגָרַעַ[ת] פִּדְיוֹנָהּ וְיוֹצְאָה. תָּנָא: וְקוֹנֶה אֶת עַצְמוֹ בְּכֶסֶף וּבְשָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר.
human_translation: through the deduction of money. Ḥizkiyya says that the verse states: “Then he shall let her be redeemed” teaches that deducts her redemption, and is emancipated. taught: And can acquire himself with money, with worth money, and with a document.
llm_translation: In a silver platter. Chizkiyah said: As the verse states: "And he shall redeem" - this teaches that she diminishes her redemption and leaves. It was taught: And he acquires himself with silver and with the value of silver and with a document.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כֶּסֶף, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִכֶּסֶף מִקְנָתוֹ״; שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף נָמֵי, ״יָשִׁיב גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, לְרַבּוֹת שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף כְּכֶסֶף; אֶלָּא הַאי שְׁטָר הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא אַדְּמֵיהּ, הַיְינוּ כֶּסֶף!
human_translation: Granted, money, as it is written: “Out of the money that he was bought for” also worth money, the Merciful One states: “He shall give back the price of his redemption” to include monetary value, like money. But this document what are the circumstances? If we say that wrote note for his own money, that is money.
llm_translation: In truth, silver, as it is written: "from the silver of his purchase"; similar silver is valuable, "he shall return his redemption" said the Merciful One, to include similar silver as actual silver; but how does this document have value? If you say that he wrote a document for him, that is like silver!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, שִׁיחְרוּר – שְׁטָר לְמָה לִי? לֵימָא לֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי תְרֵי: ״זִיל״, אִי נָמֵי בְּאַפֵּי בֵּי דִינָא: ״זִיל״. אָמַר רָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת עֶבֶד עִבְרִי גּוּפוֹ קָנוּי, וְהָרַב שֶׁמָּחַל עַל גִּרְעוֹנוֹ – אֵין גִּרְעוֹנוֹ מָחוּל.
human_translation: Rather, manumission Why do I a document Let him say in the presence of two Go Alternatively, before a court: Go Rava says: That is to say the body of a Hebrew slave is owned And a master who relinquishes his deduction, his deduction is not relinquished.
llm_translation: Rather, emancipation - why do I need a document? Let him say to him with two witnesses: "Go," either with two witnesses or with the court: "Go." Rava said: This means that a Hebrew slave's body is acquired, and if the master forgives his fine - his fine is not forgiven.

hebrew_text: יְתֵירָה עָלָיו, אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה קוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בְּמִיתַת הָאָב מֵרְשׁוּת אָדוֹן, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה סִימָנִין שֶׁאֵין מוֹצִיאִין מֵרְשׁוּת אָב – מוֹצִיאִין מֵרְשׁוּת אָדוֹן, מִיתָה שֶׁמּוֹצִיאָה מֵרְשׁוּת אָב – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוֹצִיאָה מֵרְשׁוּת אָדוֹן?
human_translation: a Hebrew maidservant has more than Reish Lakish says: A Hebrew maidservant acquires herself from the master’s authority through the death of father. through an a fortiori If signs which do not release her from father’s authority, release her from the master’s authority, is it not logical that death, which releases her from father’s authority, release her from master’s authority?
llm_translation: Excess upon him, cubit the Hebrew. Said Reish Lakish: Cubit the Hebrew acquires itself in the death of the father from the domain of the master, a fortiori: And what signs that do not remove from the domain of the father - they remove from the domain of the master, death that removes from the domain of the father - it is not a judgment that removes from the domain of the master?

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: יְתֵירָה עָלָיו אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה שֶׁקּוֹנָה אֶת עַצְמָהּ בְּסִימָנִין. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִיתְנֵי נָמֵי מִיתַת הָאָב! תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר.
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya raises an objection A Hebrew maidservant has more than as she acquires herself through signs And if it is so let teach also the death of the father. taught and omitted
llm_translation: Challenger: Rav Hoshaya raises an objection: An additional cubit of Hebrew measurement that acquires itself with signs. And if it is so, it is given from the death of the father! It was taught and left.

hebrew_text: מַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? שַׁיַּיר מִיתַת הָאָדוֹן. אִי מִשּׁוּם מִיתַת הָאָדוֹן, לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא הוּא, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא נָמֵי בְּאִישׁ – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: What did he omit that he omitted this? omitted the death of the master. If due to the death of the master, that is not an omission. that since there is also a man, does not teach
llm_translation: What is the leftover of this leftover? Leftover from the death of the master. If it is not because of the death of the master, it is not a leftover, for as long as there are others in the city, it is not considered abandoned.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא נִיתְנֵי! תַּנָּא דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה קָתָנֵי, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But Rather, let it teach tanna teaches a matter that has a set time, he does not teach a matter that does not have a set time,
llm_translation: But isn't it taught? A matter that has a set measure, it teaches; a matter that does not have a set measure - it does not teach.

hebrew_text: וְהָא סִימָנִין, דְּאֵין לָהֶם קִצְבָה, וְקָתָנֵי! אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: אֵין לָהֶם קִצְבָה לְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהֶם קִצְבָה
human_translation: But signs which do not have a set time, and it teaches Rav Safra says: have no maximum set time, but they do have a set time
llm_translation: And this is the sign, that they do not have a set time, and it is taught! Rav Safra said: They do not have a set time above, but they do have a set time.

hebrew_text: לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: minimum
llm_translation: Below.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים שֶׁהֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת – שׁוּמָא, מִבֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד עַד בֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד וְעוֹדָן בּוֹ – שׁוּמָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: סִימָן. בֶּן שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל סִימָן.
human_translation: As it is taught a nine-year-old who developed two hairs a mole. From nine years and one day until twelve years and one day, they are still on him a mole. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: a sign thirteen years and one day old everyone agrees a sign
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A child of nine years who grows two pubic hairs - perhaps, from the age of nine years and one day until the age of twelve years and one day and there is still in him - perhaps, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: a sign. A child of thirteen years and one day - the words of all are a sign.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַרְבָּעָה מַעֲנִיקִים לָהֶם, שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּאִישׁ, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בָּאִשָּׁה. וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר אַרְבָּעָה בְּאֶחָד, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין סִימָנִים בָּאִישׁ, וְאֵין רְצִיעָה בָּאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection: Rabbi Shimon says: four one grants them a severance gift. three to a man, and three to a woman, And you cannot say four for one because there is no signs for a man, and there is no piercing for a woman.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raised an objection: Rabbi Shimon says: Four cubits they must give them, three in a man, and three in a woman. And if you cannot say four in one, because there are no signs in a man, and there is no partition in a woman.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, נִיתְנֵי נָמֵי מִיתַת אָב! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי תַּנָּא וְשַׁיַּיר, וְהָא אַרְבָּעָה קָתָנֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא תַּנָּא דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה קָתָנֵי וְדָבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה לָא קָתָנֵי, וְהָא סִימָנִין, דְּאֵין לָהֶם קִצְבָה, וְקָתָנֵי!
human_translation: And if it is so let him teach also the death of the father. And if you would say, here too he taught and omitted he teaches: four And if you would say tanna teaches a matter that has a set time and does not teach a matter that does not have a set time, as signs which do not have a set time, and he teaches
llm_translation: And if it is stated, it is said in the name of the death of a father! And if you say here it is said in the name of a Mishna and it remains, but there are four authorities! And if you say a Mishna that has a fixed time is stated, and a Mishna that does not have a fixed time is not stated, but these are the signs that do not have a fixed time, and it is stated!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי כִּדְרַב סָפְרָא, וְהָאִיכָּא מִיתַת אָדוֹן, דְּאֵין לָהּ(ם) קִצְבָה, וְקָתָנֵי! מִיתַת אָדוֹן נָמֵי לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And if you would say here, too, in accordance Rav Safra, there is still the death of the master, does not have a set time, and taught The death of the master is not taught either,
llm_translation: And if you will say here it is similar to what Rav Safra said, but here there is the death of a master, who does not have a fixed time, and it is taught! The death of a master is also not taught.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, אַרְבָּעָה מַאי נִיהוּ? שָׁנִים, וְיוֹבֵל, וְיוֹבֵל שֶׁל רְצִיעָה, וְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה בְּסִימָנִים.
human_translation: But what are these four years and the Jubilee And the Jubilee after piercing and a Hebrew maidservant with signs
llm_translation: And rather, what are the four? Two, and Jubilee, and Jubilee of the courtyard, and a Hebrew cubit with marks.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר אַרְבָּעָה בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶם, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין סִימָנִים בָּאִישׁ וְאֵין רְצִיעָה בָּאִשָּׁה. וְאִם אִיתָא, בְּאִשָּׁה מִיהָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ אַרְבָּעָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as it teaches in the last clause: You cannot say four for one of them, because there is no signs for a man, and there is no piercing for a woman. And if it is so of a woman, at least, you find four Conclude from
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for it is taught in the latter clause: If you cannot say four of them in one of them, because there are no signs in a man and no tearing in a woman. And if it comes, in a woman she can remember four, learn from it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב עַמְרָם: וְאֵלּוּ מַעֲנִיקִים לָהֶם: הַיּוֹצֵא בְּשָׁנִים, וּבַיּוֹבֵל, וּבְמִיתַת הָאָדוֹן, וְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה בְּסִימָנִים. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִיתְנֵי נָמֵי מִיתַת אָב! וְכִי תֵּימָא תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר, וְהָא ״אֵלּוּ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: Rav Amram raises an objection And these to whom one grants a severance gift: One who leaves through years and in the Jubilee and through the death of the master, and a Hebrew maidservant by signs And if it is so let also teach the death of the father. And if you would say, here too, he taught and omitted he teaches: These,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Amram asked: And who are those who provide for them? Those who go out in the Sabbatical years, and in the Jubilee year, and in the death of the master, and a Hebrew maidservant with signs. And if you will say, "It is derived from the death of a father!" But if you say, "It is taught and left," and this, "And who are those," is what it teaches!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קִצְבָה קָתָנֵי, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה לָא קָתָנֵי, וְהָא סִימָנִין, דְּאֵין לָהֶם קִצְבָה וְקָתָנֵי. וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי כִּדְרַב סָפְרָא, הָאִיכָּא מִיתַת אָדוֹן! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: And if you would say tanna teaches a matter that has a set time and does not teach a matter that does not have a set time, but signs which do not have a set time, and he teaches And if you would say here too, in accordance Rav Safra there is the death of the master, does not have a set time, and he taught a conclusive refutation Reish Lakish. The refutation of Reish Lakish is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And if you will say: A matter that has a set time is taught, a matter that does not have a set time is not taught, and here are the signs, that they do not have a set time and are taught. And if you will say here it is like Rav Safra, there is the death of a master! The excellence of Reish Lakish! The excellence.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ קַל וָחוֹמֶר אָמַר! קַל וָחוֹמֶר פְּרִיכָא הוּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְסִימָנִין – שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּנָּה הַגּוּף, תֹּאמַר בְּמִיתַת אָב – שֶׁכֵּן לֹא נִשְׁתַּנָּה הַגּוּף.
human_translation: But Reish Lakish an a fortiori The a fortiori is refutable, because can be refuted What about signs that her body has changed, Will you say with regard to the death of the father, as body has not changed?
llm_translation: And this, Reish Lakish said: Kal vachomer! Kal vachomer is a refutation, because there is room to refute: Just as with signs - when the body has changed, you would say in the case of the death of a father - so too, when the body has not changed.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: עֶנֶק עֶבֶד עִבְרִי – לְעַצְמוֹ, וְעֶנֶק אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה – לְעַצְמָהּ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: עֶנֶק אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה וּמְצִיאָתָהּ – לְאָבִיהָ, וְאֵין לְרַבָּה אֶלָּא שְׂכַר בַּטָּלָה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: It is taught one The severance gift a Hebrew slave to himself, and the severance gift a Hebrew maidservant to herself. And it is taught another severance gift of a Hebrew maidservant and lost items to her father, and her master has only reimbursement for her lost time.
llm_translation: It was taught: The collar of a Hebrew slave - for himself, and the collar of a Hebrew maidservant - for herself. And it was taught in another Baraita: The collar of a Hebrew maidservant and its finding - belong to her father, and the master receives only compensation for the loss.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, הָא – דְּנָפְקָא בְּסִימָנִים, וְהָא – דְּנָפְקָא לַהּ בְּמִיתַת אָב!
human_translation: What, is it not this when she leaves through signs and this when she leaves through the death of the father.
llm_translation: What is the difference? This - that it came out with signs, and this - that it came out through the death of a father!

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי דְּנָפְקָא לַהּ בְּסִימָנִין, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְאָב, הָא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לְאָב.
human_translation: No, this and that who left through signs and it not difficult: This where there is a father this where there is no father,
llm_translation: Not, this and this that came out to it in signs, and not difficult: this that has a father, this that does not have a father.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא עֶנֶק אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה לְעַצְמָהּ – לְמַעוֹטֵי אַחִין, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם״ – אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם, וְלֹא בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם לִבְנֵיכֶם. מִכָּאן שֶׁאֵין אָדָם מוֹרִישׁ זְכוּת בִּתּוֹ לִבְנוֹ.
human_translation: Granted, severance gift of a Hebrew maidservant for herself, to exclude brothers. as it is taught “And you shall bequeath them to your children after you” they, to your sons, but your daughters not to your sons. From here that a person may not bequeath rights to his daughter to his son.
llm_translation: In peace, a cubit the Hebrew by itself - to exclude brothers, as it was taught: "And you shall cause them to inherit to your sons after you" - them to your sons, and not your daughters to your sons. From here it is derived that a person does not transfer the right of his daughter to his son.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עֶנֶק עֶבֶד עִבְרִי לְעַצְמוֹ – פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא לְמַאן? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: יוֹד קֶרֶת קָא חָזֵינָא הָכָא.
human_translation: But it is obvious the severance gift of a Hebrew slave is for himself. Rather, to whom Rav Yosef said: I see here yod city.
llm_translation: Rather, a Canaanite slave for himself - it is obvious! Rather, for whom? Rav Yosef said: "Yod Keret" I see here.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָא מַנִּי – תּוּטַאי הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא, תּוּטַאי אוֹמֵר: ״לוֹ״, וְלֹא לְבַעַל חוֹבוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said Rav Sheshet said like this: whose is this It is Tutai. As it is taught Tutai says: to him” but not to his creditor.
llm_translation: Abaye said: So said Rav Sheshet: This is a case of "tutai." As it was taught: Tutai says, "To him," and not to his creditor.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אֵלּוּ מַעֲנִיקִים לָהֶם: הַיּוֹצֵא בְּשָׁנִים, וּבַיּוֹבֵל, וּבְמִיתַת אָדוֹן, וְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה בְּסִימָנִין. אֲבָל בּוֹרֵחַ וְיוֹצֵא בְּגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף – אֵין מַעֲנִיקִים לוֹ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בּוֹרֵחַ – אֵין מַעֲנִיקִין לוֹ, וְיוֹצֵא בְּגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף – מַעֲנִיקִים לוֹ.
human_translation: the itself. And these to whom one grants a severance gift: One who leaves through years and in the Jubilee and through the death of the master, and a Hebrew maidservant by signs But one who flees or one who is released by deducting money, one does not grant a severance gift to him. Rabbi Meir says: one who flees, one does not grant a severance gift to him, but one who is released by deducting money, one does grant a severance gift to him.
llm_translation: The body, these are the ones who provide for them: one who goes out in years, and in the Jubilee, and in the death of the master, and a Hebrew maidservant with signs. But one who flees and goes out with a money pouch - they do not provide for him. Rabbi Meir says: one who flees - they do not provide for him, and one who goes out with a money pouch - they provide for him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַרְבָּעָה מַעֲנִיקִים לָהֶם, שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּאִישׁ וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בָּאִשָּׁה, וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר אַרְבָּעָה בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן לְפִי שֶׁאֵין סִימָנִין בָּאִישׁ וּרְצִיעָה בָּאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: four one grants them a severance gift. three to a man and three to a woman. And you cannot say four for one because there is no signs for a man, and there is no piercing for a woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Four types of supporters for them, three in a man and three in a woman, and you cannot say four in one of them because there are no signs in a man and a bruise in a woman.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ מַעֲנִיקִים אֶלָּא לַיּוֹצֵא בְּשֵׁשׁ, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת יוֹצֵא בַּיּוֹבֵל וּבְמִיתַת הָאָדוֹן וְאָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה בְּסִימָנִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ״ ״וְכִי תְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught: might one grants a severance gift only to who is released after six From where to include left in the Jubilee and through the death of the master, and a Hebrew maidservant through signs The verse states: send him,” “And when you send him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" For the Rabbis taught: "One might have thought that we only grant extensions to the produce of the sixth year. From where do we derive to include the produce of the Jubilee year, the death of the master, and the Hebrew maidservant with signs? The Torah teaches: 'You shall release him,' 'And when you release him.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה בּוֹרֵחַ וְיוֹצֵא בְּגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִי תְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ חׇפְשִׁי מֵעִמָּךְ״ – מִי שֶׁשִּׁילּוּחוֹ מֵעִמָּךְ, יָצָא בּוֹרֵחַ וְיוֹצֵא בְּגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף שֶׁאֵין שִׁילּוּחוֹ מֵעִמָּךְ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בּוֹרֵחַ אֵין מַעֲנִיקִין לוֹ, דְּאֵין שִׁילּוּחוֹ מֵעִמָּךְ, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא בְּגִרְעוֹן כֶּסֶף, שֶׁשִּׁילּוּחוֹ מֵעִמָּךְ.
human_translation: might that I include who flees and who is released through the deduction of money. the verse states: “And when you send him free from you” one who was sent from you excludes who flees and is released through the deduction of money, who are not sent away from you Rabbi Meir says: One does not grant a severance gift to who flees, as he is not sent away from you, But is released through the deduction of money, who is sent from you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Can I increase the one who flees and goes out with a purse of money? The Torah says: "And if you send him away free from you" - one whose sending away is from you, he may flee and go out with a purse of money, as his sending away is not from you. Rabbi Meir says: One who flees, we do not grant him, as his sending away is not from you, but one who goes out with a purse of money, as his sending away is from you.

hebrew_text: בּוֹרֵחַ – הַשְׁלָמָה בָּעֵי! דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְבוֹרֵחַ שֶׁחַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֵׁשׁ שָׁנִים יַעֲבֹד״.
human_translation: who flees required to complete As it is taught From where who flees that he is obligated to complete The verse states: “Six years he shall labor”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Boreach - hashlamah ba'ei! D'tanya: Minayin le'boreach shechayav le'hashlim - Talmud lomar: 'Shesh shanim ya'avor.'" English translation: "One who flees - restitution he requires! For it was taught: From where do we derive that one who flees is obligated to make restitution? The Talmud teaches: 'Six years he shall work.'"

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ חָלָה? – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבַשְּׁבִעִת יֵצֵא״?
human_translation: might even became sick the verse states: “And in the seventh he shall go out”
llm_translation: He could even eat it with bread? - The Talmud teaches: "And on the seventh day he shall go out."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּרַח וּפָגַע בּוֹ יוֹבֵל. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאַפֵּיק לֵיהּ יוֹבֵל, ״שִׁילּוּחוֹ מֵעִמָּךְ״ קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ, וְלָא נִיקְנְסֵיהּ, וְנַעֲנֵיק לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: With what are we dealing here? where he fled and the Jubilee arrived Lest you say: Since the Jubilee released him, he is considered sent away by you, and we should not penalize him but grant him the severance gift, teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, one who fled and encountered the Jubilee. What might you say? Since he brought out the Jubilee, we read in it, "Send him away from you," and he is not punished, and he is sent away, this is what we infer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ חָלָה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבַשְּׁבִעִת יֵצֵא״. אֲפִילּוּ חָלָה כׇּל שֵׁשׁ? וְהָתַנְיָא: חָלָה שָׁלֹשׁ וְעָבַד שָׁלֹשׁ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים, חָלָה כׇּל שֵׁשׁ – חַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה מַחַט.
human_translation: The Master said might even became sick the verse states: “And in the seventh he shall go out” even he was sick for all six But isn’t it taught he was sick three and served three he is not obligated to complete he was sick all six he is obligated to complete Rav Sheshet said: as performing needlework
llm_translation: Master said: Can even a sick person fulfill the obligation of eating matzah on Passover night? The Talmud teaches us: "And on the seventh day he shall go out." Can even a sick person fulfill the obligation of eating matzah for the entire six days of Passover? But it was taught: If one ate matzah for three days and then became sick for three days, he is not obligated to complete the mitzvah. If one ate matzah for the entire six days, he is obligated to complete the mitzvah! Rav Sheshet said: One who performs an action, it is as if he has made a cake.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא – אָמְרַתְּ: חָלָה שָׁלֹשׁ וְעָבַד שָׁלֹשׁ – אֵין חַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים. הָא אַרְבַּע – חַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: חָלָה כׇּל שֵׁשׁ – חַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים. הָא אַרְבַּע – אֵין חַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים! הָכִי קָאָמַר: חָלָה אַרְבַּע, נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁחָלָה כׇּל שֵׁשׁ וְחַיָּיב לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: This matter itself is difficult, you said he was sick for three and he served for three he is not obligated to complete This four he is obligated to complete say the last clause he was sick all six he is obligated to complete That four he is not obligated to complete this is what is saying: he was sick four he becomes as one who was sick for all six and he is required to complete
llm_translation: The matter is difficult - she said: if she missed three and observed three - she is not obligated to complete. But if she missed four - she is obligated to complete. Let us say the latter part: if she missed all six - she is obligated to complete. But if she missed four - she is not obligated to complete! This is what it means: if she missed four, it is considered as if she missed all six and she is obligated to complete.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כַּמָּה מַעֲנִיקִים לוֹ? חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים מִכׇּל מִין וָמִין, שֶׁהֵן חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה סְלָעִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשִׁים, כִּשְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל עֶבֶד. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: חֲמִשִּׁים, כַּחֲמִשִּׁים שֶׁבָּעֲרָכִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: How much does one grant a severance gift? five sela of each and every type which is fifteen sela . the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: thirty like the thirty of a slave Rabbi Shimon says: fifty like of valuations,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How much do they allocate to him? Five se'ah of every type and kind, which are fifteen se'ah, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Thirty, like thirty of a slave. Rabbi Shimon says: Fifty, like fifty of merchants.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים מִכׇּל מִין וָמִין, שֶׁהֵם חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה סְלָעִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מִנְיָנָא אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: מִיבְצָר הוּא דְּלָא (מְבַצַּר) [לִיבְצַר] לֵיהּ מֵהַאי מִנְיָנָא, וְאִי בָּצַר לֵיהּ מֵחַד מִינָא וְטָפֵי לֵיהּ מֵחַד מִינָא – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: The Master said five sela of each and every type, which is fifteen sela ; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Meir come to teach us count? teaches us this: not less than this number, but if he gives him less of one type and more of one type, we have no with it,
llm_translation: Master said: Five rocks of every kind, which are fifteen rocks, the words of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Meir, from where does he come to teach us this? This is what he teaches us: It is a fortress that does not fortify itself from this count, and if it fortifies itself from one kind and is weakened from another kind - we do not have it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? יָלֵיף ״רֵיקָם״ ״רֵיקָם״ מִבְּכוֹר. מָה לְהַלָּן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים – אַף כָּאן חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Meir? He derives “empty” “empty” with regard to a firstborn: Just as there, five sela , so too here, five sela .
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? He derives "empty" "empty" from "firstborn." Just as there (in the verse) there are five stones - so too here there are five stones.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא, חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים מִכּוּלְּהוּ! אִי כְּתִיב ״רֵיקָם״ לְבַסּוֹף, כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״רֵיקָם״ בְּרֵישָׁא, שְׁדִי ״רֵיקָם״ אַ״צֹּאן״, ״רֵיקָם״ אַ״גּוֹרֶן״, ״רֵיקָם״ אַ״יֶּקֶב״.
human_translation: But say five sela from all of If “empty” were written at the end as you said. now that “empty” is written before apply empty” to “flock,” “empty” to “threshing floor,” “empty” to “winepress.”
llm_translation: And why not, five stones from all of them! If it is written "empty" at the end, as you said. Now, when it is written "empty" at the beginning, it is necessary for "empty" for the sheep, "empty" for the threshing floor, "empty" for the winepress.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף ״רֵיקָם״ ״רֵיקָם״ מֵעוֹלַת רְאִיָּה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר בֵּרַכְךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And let us derive “empty” “empty” from the burnt-offering of appearance the verse states: “Of that with which the Lord your God has blessed you”
llm_translation: And it shall be exchanged, "Reikam," "Reikam," from the burnt offering of appearance! The verse says: "Which the Lord your God has blessed you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשִׁים כִּשְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל עֶבֶד. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? יָלֵיף ״נְתִינָה״ ״נְתִינָה״ מֵעֶבֶד. מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁלֹשִׁים – אַף כָּאן שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says thirty like the thirty for a slave. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? He derives giving, from giving slave Just as there, thirty so too here, thirty.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Thirty like thirty of a slave. What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? He derives "giving" "giving" from a slave. Just as there, thirty - so too here, thirty.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף ״נְתִינָה״ ״נְתִינָה״ מֵעֲרָכִין, מָה לְהַלָּן חֲמִשִּׁים – אַף כָּאן חֲמִשִּׁים!
human_translation: But let him derive “giving” “giving” from valuations Just as there, fifty so too here, fifty.
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Netinah," "Netinah" are arranged, just as there fifty there - so too here fifty!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא, דְּתָפַשְׂתָּה מְרוּבֶּה לֹא תָּפַשְׂתָּה, תָּפַשְׂתָּה מוּעָט תָּפַשְׂתָּה. וְעוֹד, עֶבֶד מֵעֶבֶד הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף.
human_translation: One that if you grasped too much, you did not grasp anything; if you grasped a bit, you grasped And furthermore, one should derive of a slave, from a slave,
llm_translation: One, that if you have seized the majority, you have not seized; if you have seized the minority, you have seized. And furthermore, a slave from a slave is considered like a full-fledged slave.
