llm_translation: And why not say it like this: Where one does two and adds four - he should do four and subtract two. If he did four and added two - he should do two according to his years?

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״אִם עוֹד רַבּוֹת שָׁנִים״, ״אִם מְעַט נִשְׁאַר שָׁנִים״, מַאי ״בַּשָּׁנִים״ – נִתְרַבָּה כַּסְפּוֹ בַּשָּׁנִים, ״מִכֶּסֶף מִקְנָתוֹ״ – נִתְמַעֵט כַּסְפּוֹ בַּשָּׁנִים ״כְּפִי שָׁנָיו״. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: דַּרְשִׁינְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְהָנֵי קְרָאֵי כְּסִינַי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse write: If there be yet many years, If there remain but few years. What “of the years”? his monetary increased over the years “out of the money that he was bought for,” his monetary decreased over the years “according to his years.” Rav Yosef said: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak interpreted these verses like Sinai.
llm_translation: If so, it is written in a verse: "If many years remain" (Leviticus 25:51), "if few years remain" (Leviticus 25:52). What is meant by "in the years"? - His money will increase in the years. "From the money of his purchase" (Leviticus 25:51) - his money will decrease in the years "according to the years." Rav Yosef said: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak expounded these verses in the towns of Kisini.

hebrew_text: (סִימַן: עֶבֶד, בַּיִת, חֲצָאִין, בַּיִת עֶבֶד, קְרוֹבִים). בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְנׇכְרִי, נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין, אוֹ אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין?
human_translation: a mnemonic Slave, house, partial, house, slave, relatives. Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: a Hebrew slave who is sold to a gentile, be partially redeemed, or can he not be partially redeemed?
llm_translation: Topic: Slave, House, Courtyards, Slave's House, Relatives. Rav Huna son of Chinena asked Rav Sheshet: If a Hebrew slave who was sold to a non-Jew is redeemed for Courtyards, is he redeemed for Courtyards or not?

hebrew_text: ״גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ ״גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ מִשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה גָּמַר: מָה שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין – אַף הַאי נָמֵי אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין, אוֹ דִילְמָא לְקוּלָּא אָמְרִינַן, לְחוּמְרָא לָא אָמְרִינַן?
human_translation: his redemption [ ge’ullato ]” derived from redeem it [ ge’ullato ]” just as an ancestral field cannot be partially redeemed, so too, this cannot be partially redeemed. Or perhaps we say to a leniency, we do not say to a stringency.
llm_translation: "His redemption," "his redemption," from a field of ancestral possession he concluded: Just as a field of ancestral possession is not redeemed in halves - so too this one is not redeemed in halves, or perhaps we say for leniency, do we not say for stringency?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אָמְרַתְּ הָתָם: ״נִמְכַּר״ – כּוּלּוֹ וְלֹא חֶצְיוֹ, הָכִי נָמֵי, ״נִגְאָל״ – כּוּלּוֹ וְלֹא חֶצְיוֹ.
human_translation: said to him: Didn’t you say there, all of him is sold but not part of him? So too, “he is redeemed” all of him and not part of him.
llm_translation: He said to him: Did you not say there: "sold" - all of it and not half of it, thus it is stated, "redeemed" - all of it and not half of it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְקוּלָּא וּלְחוּמְרָא. לְקוּלָּא: זַבְנֵיהּ בִּמְאָה, יְהַב לֵיהּ חַמְשִׁין, פַּלְגָא דְּדָמֵי, וְאַשְׁבַּח וְקָם עַל מָאתַן, אִי אָמְרַתְּ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין – יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מְאָה וְנָפֵיק, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין – יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מְאָה וְחַמְשִׁין וְנָפֵיק.
human_translation: Abaye said: If you say he is partially redeemed, you find of leniency and stringency. to a leniency purchased for one hundred gives him fifty, half of his value, and increased and stood at two hundred. If you say he can be partially redeemed gives him one hundred, and goes out, And if you say he cannot be partially redeemed, gives one hundred and fifty and goes out,
llm_translation: Abaye said: If you want to say he redeemed the courtyard, you forget to include both the lenient and stringent aspects. The lenient aspect: if he bought it for a hundred, he gives him fifty, half of the value, and he praises and rises in value to a hundred. If you say he redeemed the courtyard - he gives him a hundred and takes it out, and if you say he did not redeem the courtyard - he gives him a hundred and fifty and takes it out.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ נִתְרַבָּה כַּסְפּוֹ – ״מִכֶּסֶף מִקְנָתוֹ״! כְּגוֹן דְּאוֹקִיר וְזָל וְאוֹקִיר.
human_translation: But you said money his increased, “out of the money that he was bought for” where increased in value, and decreased and increased in value
llm_translation: And the saying: "His silver will increase" - "from the money of his acquisition"! For example, like Akir and Zal and Akir.

hebrew_text: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְחוּמְרָא: זַבְנֵיהּ בְּמָאתַן, יְהַיב מְאָה, פַּלְגֵי דִּדְמֵי, וְאִיכְּסִף וְקָם עַל מְאָה, אִי אָמְרַתְּ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין – יָהֵיב לֵיהּ חַמְשִׁין וְנָפֵיק, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵין נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין – הָנָךְ מְאָה פִּקָּדוֹן נִינְהוּ גַּבֵּיהּ, יָהֵיב לְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ וְנָפֵיק.
human_translation: you find to a stringency. purchased for two hundred gave one hundred, half of his value, and decreased and stood at one hundred. If you say he can be partially redeemed, gives fifty and goes out, And if you say he cannot be partially redeemed, these one hundred are a deposit with him. gives it to him and goes out.
llm_translation: She found a stringency: if her husband gave her a hundred zuz, she took half in cash, and he gave her the other half in silver or gold, and it amounted to a hundred. If you say she can redeem with half, he gave her fifty and she left. And if you say she cannot redeem with half, then the hundred is considered a deposit, he gave it to her to manage and she left.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַמּוֹכֵר בַּיִת בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה, נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין, אוֹ אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין? ״גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ ״גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ מִשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה גָּמַר: מָה שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה אֵינָהּ נִגְאֶלֶת לַחֲצָאִין – אַף הַאי נָמֵי אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין,
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet one who sells a house from among the houses of walled cities, be partially redeemed, or can it not be partially redeemed? derive “ ge’ullato ” “ ge’ullato ” from an ancestral field just as ancestral land cannot be partially redeemed, so too, this cannot be partially redeemed?
llm_translation: Requested text: Rav Huna son of Chinena asked Rav Sheshet: If one sells a house in walled cities, is it redeemed for half-shekels, or is it not redeemed for half-shekels? "His redemption" "His redemption" concludes from a field of possession: Just as a field of possession is not redeemed for half-shekels - so too this one is not redeemed for half-shekels.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא: הֵיכָא דְּגַלִּי – גַּלִּי, הֵיכָא דְּלָא גַּלִּי – לָא גַּלִּי?
human_translation: Or perhaps where revealed it revealed where did not reveal it did not reveal
llm_translation: Or perhaps: where it was revealed - it was revealed, where it was not revealed - it was not revealed?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִמִּדְרָשׁוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נִשְׁמַע, שֶׁלֹּוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם גָּאֹל יִגְאַל״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלֹּוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: said to him: From Rabbi Shimon’s interpretation one learns that one can borrow and redeem and can partially redeem As it is taught “And if he will redeem [ ga’ol yigal ] teaches that one can borrow and redeem and one can partially redeem
llm_translation: He said to him: From the exposition of Rabbi Shimon it is heard, "Shall redeem and redeemer and redeemer of halves," as it was taught: "If the redeemer shall surely redeem" - it teaches that "shall redeem and redeemer and redeemer of halves."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם, לְפִי שֶׁמָּצִינוּ בְּמוֹכֵר שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁאִם הִגִּיעַ יוֹבֵל וְלֹא נִגְאֲלָה – חוֹזֶרֶת לִבְעָלֶיהָ בַּיּוֹבֵל, הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ – שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason because we find with regard to one who sells his ancestral field that his power is enhanced, as, if the Jubilee arrives and it is not redeemed, returns to its owners in the Jubilee the power is diminished in he cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? Because we find in the case of one who sells an ancestral field that its strength wanes, that if the Jubilee arrives and it is not redeemed, it returns to its owners in the Jubilee year, its strength deteriorates - for he cannot lend and redeem and redeem in halves.

hebrew_text: מַקְדִּישׁ, שֶׁהוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁאִם הִגִּיעַ יוֹבֵל וְלֹא נִגְאֲלָה – יוֹצְאָה לְכֹהֲנִים בַּיּוֹבֵל, יִפָּה כֹּחוֹ – שֶׁלֹּוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: one consecrates his power is diminished, as, if the Jubilee arrives and he did not redeem it goes out of the priests in the Jubilee his power is enhanced that he may borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: Sanctifies, that diminishes his strength, that if the Jubilee arrives and she is not redeemed - she goes out to the priests in the Jubilee, his strength is good - the borrower and the redeemer and the redeemer of the halves.

hebrew_text: הַאי מוֹכֵר בַּיִת בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה נָמֵי, הוֹאִיל וְהוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁאִם מָלְאָה לוֹ שָׁנָה תְּמִימָה וְלֹא נִגְאֲלָה נֶחְלָט – יִפָּה כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁלֹּוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: this one who sells a house from among the houses of walled cities, since his power is also diminished, as, if a full year passes and has not been redeemed permanent his power enhanced in he may borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: This seller in houses in walled cities is trustworthy, since he strengthens his claim. If a full year passed and the property was not redeemed, his claim is established - his claim is strengthened, he may lend and redeem and redeem in halves.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״אִם גָּאֹל יִגְאַל״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלֹּוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: raised an objection to “And if he will redeem [ ga’ol yigal ] teaches that he may borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: "If the redeemer redeems" - teaches that the borrower, the redeemer, and the redeemer's redeemer are all liable for half.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל, וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה מוֹכֵר שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁאִם הִגִּיעַ יוֹבֵל וְלֹא נִגְאֲלָה חוֹזֶרֶת לִבְעָלֶיהָ בַּיּוֹבֵל – הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין, מַקְדִּישׁ, שֶׁהוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ, שֶׁאִם הִגִּיעַ יוֹבֵל וְלֹא נִגְאֲלָה יוֹצְאָה לְכֹהֲנִים בַּיּוֹבֵל – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁהוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ שֶׁאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין?
human_translation: As might not inference: Just as one who sells an ancestral field that his power is enhanced, as if the Jubilee arrives and it is not redeemed, it returns to its owners in the Jubilee his power is diminished that he cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem one who consecrates his power is diminished, for if the Jubilee arrives and it was not redeemed it goes out to the priests in the Jubilee is it not logical that his power is diminished that he cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: The one who is able, and isn't this the law: And what about one who sells an ancestral field that his strength fails, that if the Jubilee arrives and it is not redeemed, it returns to its owners in the Jubilee - his strength is weakened, for he has no lender, redeemer, or redeemer for the half, he sanctifies, for his strength is weakened, that if the Jubilee arrives and it is not redeemed, it goes out to the priests in the Jubilee - is it not the law that his strength is weakened, for he has no lender, redeemer, or redeemer for the half?

hebrew_text: מָה לְמוֹכֵר שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה, שֶׁכֵּן הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל מִיָּד, תֹּאמַר בְּמַקְדִּישׁ שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל מִיָּד.
human_translation: What about sells his ancestral field his power is diminished with regard to redeeming immediately, you say with regard to one who consecrates as his power is enhanced with regard to redeeming immediately?
llm_translation: What about a seller of ancestral land, that his strength is weakened to redeem immediately, you say in the case of a consecration that his strength is weakened to redeem immediately.

hebrew_text: מוֹכֵר בַּיִת בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל מִיָּד וְאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין! לָא קַשְׁיָא:
human_translation: sells a house from among houses of walled cities can prove as his power is enhanced with regard to redeeming immediately, he cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem not difficult.
llm_translation: A seller of a house in walled cities must prove that he has the ability to redeem immediately, and there is no lender, redeemer, or partial redeemer! This is not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא רַבָּנַן, הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: This the Rabbis, that Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: These are the Rabbis, these are Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין. לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבָּנַן, הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: is taught one One can borrow and redeem and partially redeem and is taught another One cannot borrow and redeem nor partially redeem. not difficult. This the Rabbis, that Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: One taught: A creditor, a redeemer, and a redeemer of halves. And it was taught in another place: A creditor, a redeemer, and a redeemer of halves do not have the same rights. This is not difficult: here it refers to the Rabbis, there it refers to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: חָרַשׁ חָבַשׁ זְמַן)
human_translation: a mnemonic Ḥeresh , ḥavash , zeman .
llm_translation: Chapter: Charash Chavash Zman

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְמוֹכֵר בַּיִת בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה – שֶׁכֵּן הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל לְעוֹלָם, תֹּאמַר בְּמַקְדִּישׁ – שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל לְעוֹלָם!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: can be refuted What one who sells a house among the houses of walled cities his power is diminished, to redeem forever, you say with regard to one who consecrates as his power is enhanced to redeem forever?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: Is there room to differentiate: What about someone who sells a house in walled cities - since he strengthens his ability to redeem forever, you should say the same about one who consecrates - that he strengthens his ability to redeem forever!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא סָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר נֶיהְדַּר דִּינָא, תֵּיתֵי בְּמָה הַצַּד: מוֹכֵר שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל לְעוֹלָם וְאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין. מָה לְמוֹכֵר שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה, שֶׁכֵּן הוֹרַע כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל מִיָּד. מוֹכֵר בַּיִת בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa Sava said to Rav Ashi: because it can be said the argument returns, Let be derived by the common factor one who sells an ancestral field can prove it, as his power is enhanced to redeem forever, and he cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem What one who sells an ancestral field is that his power is diminished to redeem immediately, one who sells a house from among houses of walled cities can prove
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha the Elder to Rav Ashi: Because there is to say a precious judgment, give with what to side: a seller of an ancestral field shall prove, that he has the strength to redeem forever, and there is no borrower, redeemer, and redeemer in halves. What for a seller of an ancestral field, for so he prepares his strength to redeem immediately. A seller of a house in walled cities shall prove.

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין, לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן – שֶׁנִּגְאָלִין, וְאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין, אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא מַקְדִּישׁ – שֶׁנִּגְאָל, וְאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: And the derivation has reverted aspect of this is not like the aspect of that Their common denominator is that they can be redeemed, and one cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem I will also bring one who consecrates that it may be redeemed, but one cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: The law has returned, not like this view is like that view, the equal side in both - that they are redeemed, and there is no lender and redeemer and redeemer for halves, so too I will bring from the case of consecration - that it is redeemed, and there is no lender and redeemer and redeemer for halves.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי לְרָבִינָא: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן – שֶׁכֵּן הוֹרַע כֹּחָם לִיגָּאֵל בְּשָׁנָה שְׁנִיָּה, תֹּאמַר בְּמַקְדִּישׁ שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל בְּשָׁנָה שְׁנִיָּה!
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: can be refuted What to their common denominator is that their power is diminished to redeem during the second year, you say with regard to one who consecrated as his power is enhanced to redeem in the second year?
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Zutra, son of Rav Mari, to Ravina: There is room to differentiate: What is the similarity between them – that their strength deteriorates to redeem in the second year, you should say regarding one who consecrates that he should improve his strength to redeem in the second year!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְנׇכְרִי יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁיִּפָּה כֹּחוֹ לִיגָּאֵל בְּשָׁנָה שְׁנִיָּה וְאֵין לֹוֶה וְגוֹאֵל וְגוֹאֵל לַחֲצָאִין.
human_translation: Ravina said to him because it can be said a Hebrew slave sold to a gentile can prove as his power enhanced to redeem in the second year, and he cannot borrow and redeem and partially redeem
llm_translation: He said to him, Ravina: because there is to say: Hebrew slave who sold to non-Jew shall prove, that he strengthen his power to redeem in second year and there is no lender and redeemer and redeemer for halves.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַמּוֹכֵר בַּיִת בְּבָתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה, נִגְאָל לִקְרוֹבִים אוֹ אֵין נִגְאָל לִקְרוֹבִים? ״גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ ״גְּאֻלָּתוֹ״ מִשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה גָּמַר: מָה שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה אֵינָהּ נִגְאֶלֶת לַחֲצָאִין וְנִגְאֶלֶת לִקְרוֹבִים – אַף הַאי נָמֵי אֵין נִגְאָל לַחֲצָאִין וְנִגְאָל לִקְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: one who sells a house from among the houses of walled cities, can be redeemed by relatives or can not be redeemed by relatives? derive “ ge’ullato ” “ ge’ullato ” from an ancestral field Just as an ancestral field cannot be partially redeemed and can be redeemed by relatives, so too, this also cannot be partially redeemed and it can be redeemed by relatives?
llm_translation: Requested text: Rav Huna the son of Chinena asked Rav Sheshet: If one sells a house in walled cities, is it redeemed to relatives or not redeemed to relatives? "His redemption" "His redemption" is concluded from ancestral field: Just as an ancestral field is not redeemed to outsiders but is redeemed to relatives - so too this one is not redeemed to outsiders but is redeemed to relatives.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא: כִּי כְּתִיבָא ״גְּאוּלָּה״ – בַּחֲצָאִין הוּא דִּכְתִיבָ[א], בִּקְרוֹבִים לָא כְּתִיבָ[א]? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל.
human_translation: Or perhaps, when ge’ula is written it is written with regard to partial is not written with regard to relatives. said to him: cannot be redeemed
llm_translation: Or perhaps: since it is written "redemption" - it is half of what is written, is it not written for those who are close? He said to him: he is not redeemed.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: ״בְּכֹל גְּאֻלָּה תִּתְּנוּ״ – לְרַבּוֹת בָּתִּים וְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. מַאי לָאו בָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה? לָא, בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים.
human_translation: raised an objection to in all you shall grant redemption to include houses and a Hebrew slave. What, is it not houses of walled cities, No, houses in open areas
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "In all redemption you shall give" - to include houses and Hebrew slaves. What, is it not referring to houses of walled cities? No, it refers to houses of courtyards.

hebrew_text: בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״עַל שְׂדֵה הָאָרֶץ יֵחָשֵׁב״! הָהוּא לְקוֹבְעוֹ חוֹבָה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: houses in open areas it is explicitly written: “Shall be reckoned with the field of the country” That to establish an obligation, and in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Houses of courtyards in Hedya, it is written in it: "Upon the field of the land it shall be accounted"! That one to establish an obligation, and not according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְגָאַל אֵת מִמְכַּר אָחִיו״ – רְשׁוּת. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר רְשׁוּת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חוֹבָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי לֹא יִהְיֶה לּוֹ גֹּאֵל״ – וְכִי יֵשׁ אָדָם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ גּוֹאֲלִים? אֶלָּא זֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לִיקַּח, שֶׁהָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: As it is taught “And he shall redeem that which his brother has sold” optional, you say optional or is it nothing other an obligation? The verse states “And if a man has no one to redeem it” But is there a man in Israel who does not have redeemers? Rather, one who has who does not want to purchase, as he has permission the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And he shall redeem his brother's sale" - optional. Do you say optional, or is it actually obligatory? The Talmud teaches us: "But if the man has no redeemer" - is there a man in Israel who has no redeemers? Rather, this refers to one who has a redeemer but does not wish to redeem, as the choice is in his hands. These are the words of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״וְגָאַל אֵת מִמְכַּר אָחִיו״ – חוֹבָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹבָה אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא רְשׁוּת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּכֹל... גְּאֻלָּה תִּתְּנוּ״ – הַכָּתוּב קְבָעוֹ חוֹבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says “And he shall redeem that which his brother has sold,” an obligation. you say an obligation, or is it only optional? The verse states: in all you shall grant redemption the verse established it as obligatory.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "And he shall redeem his brother's sale" - obligatory. Do you say obligatory or is it only permission? The Scripture states: "In all... redemption shall be given" - the Scripture established it as obligatory.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְרַבּוֹת בָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה – הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״בְּכֹל״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְרַבּוֹת בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים – מַאי ״בְּכֹל״? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rav Ashi, and some say Ravina to Rav Ashi: Granted, according to the one who says to include houses of walled cities, this is as it is written “in all.” But according to the one who says to include houses in open areas what “in all”? a difficulty.
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Ashi, and some say Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Granted according to the one who says to include walled cities - that is as it is written "in all," but according to the one who says to include courtyards - what is "in all"? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים? לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל הַגְּאוּלּוֹת שֶׁנִּגְאָלוֹת כַּסֵּדֶר הַזֶּה. מַאי לָאו בָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה, וְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי? לָא, בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים וּשְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to What the verse states: “May redeem him,” “may redeem him,” “may redeem him” three times? to include all redemptions, that they are redeemed in this order: What, is it not houses of walled cities and a Hebrew slave, No, houses in open areas and an ancestral field.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: What is the Talmud saying, "He shall redeem him," "He shall redeem him," "He shall redeem him" three times? To include all redemptions that were redeemed in this order. What, is it not referring to walled cities and a Hebrew slave? No, it is referring to courtyards and ancestral fields.

hebrew_text: בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים וּשְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב: ״עַל שְׂדֵה הָאָרֶץ יֵחָשֵׁב״! כִּדְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְקָרוֹב קָרוֹב קוֹדֵם, הָכִי נָמֵי לְקָרוֹב קָרוֹב קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: houses in open areas and an ancestral field written explicitly: “Shall be reckoned with the field of the country” as Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said, the closer earlier So too, the closer earlier
llm_translation: Houses of courtyards and a field of possession in Hadia, as it is written: "Upon the field of the land it shall be accounted"! As Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "To the close, the close takes precedence," thus it is stated, "To the close, the close takes precedence."

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק? אַהָא, דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נִגְאָל לִקְרוֹבִים אוֹ אֵינוֹ נִגְאָל לִקְרוֹבִים? אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי לָא תִּבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּאָמַר: מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִגְאָל בְּאֵלֶּה – נִגְאָל בְּשֵׁשׁ, אַלְמָא לָא מִיפְּרֵק.
human_translation: Where was of Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak stated? with regard to this as a dilemma was raised before a Hebrew slave sold to a Jew be redeemed by relatives or can he not be redeemed by relatives? According to Rabbi you should not raise the dilemma, as he says: One who is not redeemed by these is redeemed by six Evidently, cannot be redeemed
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Where is it stated that Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said? Here, that he asked them: If a Hebrew slave who is sold to a Jew is redeemed by relatives, is he redeemed by close relatives or not? According to Rabbi's opinion, it is not necessary for you, as he said: One who is not redeemed by these, is redeemed by six, which implies that it is not resolved.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מַאי? יָלְפִינַן ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, וְלָא דָּרְשִׁי ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״, אוֹ דִילְמָא ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ – לָזֶה וְלֹא לְאַחֵר?
human_translation: When you raise the dilemma, according to the Rabbis. What derive “hired worker” “hired worker” And one does not interpret homiletically “may redeem him” Or perhaps “may redeem him” to this and not to another
llm_translation: When you are in doubt, according to the opinion of the Rabbis, what is the law? We should interpret "sakir" as "sakir," and not interpret "yigalenno," or perhaps interpret "yigalenno" – for this one and not for another?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״בְּכֹל... גְּאוּלָּה תִּתְּנוּ״ – לְרַבּוֹת בָּתִּים וְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. מַאי לָאו בָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה וְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל? לָא, עֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְנׇכְרִי.
human_translation: Come hear in all you shall grant redemption to include houses and a Hebrew slave. What, is it not houses of walled cities and a Hebrew slave sold to a Jew? No, a Hebrew slave sold to a gentile.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'In all... redemption you shall give' – to include houses and Hebrew slaves. What is the reason that it does not include houses of walled cities and a Hebrew slave who is sold to a fellow Israelite? No, a Hebrew slave who is sold to a foreigner."

hebrew_text: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְנׇכְרִי בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״אוֹ דֹדוֹ אוֹ בֶן דֹּדוֹ יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״!
human_translation: explicitly written with regard to a Hebrew slave sold to a gentile: “Either his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him”
llm_translation: A Hebrew slave sold to a non-Jew with a document, it is written in it: "or his uncle or his cousin shall redeem him!"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לְקוֹבְעוֹ חוֹבָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: That to establish an obligation. And even according to Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: That one to his creditor obligation, and even to Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ ״יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים? לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל הַגְּאוּלּוֹת שֶׁנִּגְאָלוֹת כַּסֵּדֶר הַזֶּה. מַאי לָאו בָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה וְעֶבֶד עִבְרִי הַנִּמְכָּר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל? לָא, בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים וּשְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה. בָּתֵּי חֲצֵרִים בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״עַל שְׂדֵה הָאָרֶץ יֵחָשֵׁב״! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְקָרוֹב קָרוֹב קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: Come hear What the verse states: “May redeem him,” “may redeem him,” “may redeem him” three times? to include all redemptions, that they are redeemed in this order. What, is it not houses of walled cities and a Hebrew slave sold to a Jew, No, houses in open areas and an ancestral field. Concerning houses in open areas and an ancestral field, it is written explicitly: “Shall be reckoned with the field of the country” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: the closer earlier
llm_translation: Come and hear: What is the Talmud saying with "he shall redeem him," "he shall redeem him," "he shall redeem him" three times? To include all redemptions that were redeemed in this order. What about not houses of walled cities and a Hebrew slave who is sold to an Israelite? No, rather houses of courtyards and ancestral fields. Houses of courtyards, specifically, it is written about them: "It shall be reckoned to him from the field of his possession." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: One who is close, closer takes precedence.

hebrew_text: וְהַנִּרְצָע נִקְנֶה בִּרְצִיעָה. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָצַע אֲדֹנָיו אֶת אׇזְנוֹ בַּמַּרְצֵעַ וְגוֹ׳״
human_translation: And who is pierced is acquired through piercing his ear with an awl. as it is written: “And his master shall pierce his ear with an awl,
llm_translation: The "Nirza" is acquired through "Ratzi'ah." As it is written: "And his master shall bore his ear through with an awl."

hebrew_text: וְקוֹנֶה אֶת עַצְמוֹ בַּיּוֹבֵל וּבְמִיתַת הָאָדוֹן. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַעֲבָדוֹ״ – וְלֹא אֶת הַבֵּן וְלֹא אֶת הַבַּת. ״לְעֹלָם״ – לְעוֹלָמוֹ שֶׁל יוֹבֵל.
human_translation: acquires himself through the Jubilee and through the master’s death. as it is written: “And he shall serve him but not the son and not the daughter. “forever” to forever by the Jubilee
llm_translation: And he shall acquire himself in the Jubilee and in the death of the master. As it is written: "And his servant" - and not the son and not the daughter. "Forever" - for the Jubilee's eternity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַרְצֵעַ, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת הַסּוֹל וְהַסִּירָא וְהַמַּחַט וְהַמַּקְדֵּחַ וְהַמַּכְתֵּב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ – לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּקַּח בַּיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “an awl” I have only with an awl. From where a sharp thorn [ sol ], a thorn [ sira ], a needle, an auger, and a stylus The verse states: “And you shall take to include any implement that can be taken in the hand. the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Marzea" - I only have "marzea," how do I know to include the shovel, the pitchfork, the hoe, the pickaxe, and the writing tool? The verse teaches: "And you shall take" - to include anything taken by hand, the words of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: מָה מַרְצֵעַ מְיוּחָד שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת – אַף כֹּל שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״הַמַּרְצֵעַ״ – לְהָבִיא הַמַּרְצֵעַ הַגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rabbi says: Just as an awl is unique of metal, so too any of metal Alternatively, the awl,” to include the large awl
llm_translation: Rabbi says: What is the unique chisel of metal - so too all of metal. Another explanation: "the chisel" - to bring the large chisel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: יוּדָן בְּרִיבִּי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ: כְּשֶׁהֵן רוֹצְעִים אֵין רוֹצְעִים אֶלָּא בַּמִּילְתָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי כֹּהֵן נִרְצָע, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּעַל מוּם. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: בְּמִילְּתָא הֵם רוֹצְעִים – הֵיאַךְ עֶבֶד עִבְרִי כֹּהֵן יֵעָשֶׂה בַּעַל מוּם? הָא אֵין נִרְצָע אֶלָּא בְּגוֹבַהּ שֶׁל אֹזֶן. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Yudan the Distinguished would teach When they pierce, they pierce only the earlobe. And the Rabbis say: a Hebrew slave a priest is not pierced because renders him blemished And if you say they pierce earlobe, how does a Hebrew slave a priest become blemished he is pierced only on the upper part of the ear With regard to what do disagree?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Yudan, son of Ribbi, used to expound: When they are willing, they are willing only with the matter. And the sages say: A Hebrew slave who is a kohen cannot be willing, because he becomes blemished. And if you say: They are willing with the matter - how can a Hebrew slave who is a kohen become blemished? Rather, he can only become blemished in the height of the ear. With what do they disagree?

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי דָּרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ – כָּלַל. ״מַרְצֵעַ״ – פָּרַט. ״בְּאׇזְנוֹ וּבַדֶּלֶת״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת, אַף כֹּל שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi expounds generalizations and details. “and you shall take” a generalization “An awl” a detail, “Through his ear and into the door” it then generalized a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail: Just as the explicit detail of metal, so too, any of metal.
llm_translation: Rabbi Darish expounded generalizations and specifics: "And you shall take" - a generalization. "A nail" - a specification. "In his ear and in the door" - he repeated and generalized. Generalization, specification, and generalization, you do not judge except according to the nature of the specification. Just as the specification of metal is explicit, so too, all of metal.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ – רִיבָּה. ״מַרְצֵעַ״ – מִיעֵט. ״בְּאׇזְנוֹ וּבַדֶּלֶת״ – חָזַר וְרִיבָּה. רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה, רִיבָּה הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei expounds amplifications and restrictions. “and you shall take” amplifies, “an awl” restricts. “through his ear and into the door,” it then amplifies again. amplifies, restricts, and amplifies, it has amplified everything
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei expounded on the terms of increase and decrease: "And you shall take" - increase. "He shall scrape" - decrease. "In his ear and at the door" - he returned and increased. Increase and decrease and increase, increase takes precedence.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי – רַבִּי כֹּל מִילֵּי, מַאי מַיעֵט – מַיעֵט סַם.
human_translation: What has it amplified, It has amplified everything What has it restricted a corrosive substance.
llm_translation: What is "Rabbi"? - Rabbi encompasses everything. What is "mayeit"? - Mayeit is poison.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״הַמַּרְצֵעַ״ – לְהָבִיא מַרְצֵעַ הַגָּדוֹל. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא: ״הַיָּרֵךְ״ – הַמְיוּמֶּנֶת שֶׁבַּיָּרֵךְ, הָכָא נָמֵי: ״הַמַּרְצֵעַ״ – מְיוּחָד שֶׁבַּמַּרְצְעִין.
human_translation: The Master said “The awl,” to include the large awl From where may be inferred as Rava said the thigh” the most important [ meyummenet ] the thigh. Here too, “the awl” a special awl.
llm_translation: The Master said: "Hamartzea" - to bring the large hammer. What is the implication? As Rava said: "Hayarech" - the designated one in the thigh, here too it is stated: "Hamartzea" - the designated one in the hammers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, יוּדָן בְּרִיבִּי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ: כְּשֶׁהֵן רוֹצְעִין, אֵין רוֹצְעִין אֶלָּא בְּמִילְתָא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי כֹּהֵן נִרְצָע מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּעַל מוּם. וְיֵעָשֶׂה בַּעַל מוּם! אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְשָׁב אֶל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ״ – לְמוּחְזָק שֶׁבְּמִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Yudan the Distinguished would teach: When they pierce they pierce only the earlobe. And the Rabbis say: A Hebrew slave a priest is not pierced because renders him blemished. And be rendered blemished Rabba bar Rav Sheila says: The verse states “And he shall return to his own family” to his status in his family.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Yudan son of Ribbi used to expound: When they are pleased, they are only pleased with a matter, and the sages say: A Hebrew slave, a priest, is not pleased because he has become blemished. And he should become blemished! Rabbah son of Rav Sheilah said: The verse says, "And he shall return to his family" - to the strongest in his family.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי כֹּהֵן, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּמְסוֹר לוֹ רַבּוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית? חִידּוּשׁ הוּא, לָא שְׁנָא כֹּהֲנִים וְלָא שְׁנָא יִשְׂרָאֵל,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a Hebrew slave a priest, what is for his master to provide him a Canaanite maidservant is novelty, it is no different priests and no different an Israelite?
llm_translation: He asked them: A Hebrew slave who is a priest, what is the law if his master gives him a Canaanite maidservant? This is a novelty, it is not different for priests nor for Israelites.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא: שָׁאנֵי כֹּהֲנִים הוֹאִיל וְרִיבָּה בָּהֶן הַכָּתוּב מִצְוֹת יְתֵירוֹת? רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אָסוּר.
human_translation: Or perhaps priests is different since the Torah includes additional mitzvot for them, Rav said: It is permitted and Shmuel said it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Or perhaps: the priests are different since the Scripture multiplied additional commandments for them? Rav said: permitted, and Shmuel said: forbidden.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַב עָנָן: כִּי הֲוֵיתוּ בֵּי מָר שְׁמוּאֵל, בְּאִיסְקוּמְדְּרֵי אִיטַּלְּלִיתוּ? מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תֵּימְרוּ לֵיהּ מֵהָא: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי כֹּהֵן נִרְצָע מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּעַל מוּם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rav Anan: When you were in the house of Mar Shmuel you play with tokens [ iskumadri ]? What is the reason you do not say to him from that And the Rabbis say: A Hebrew slave a priest is not pierced because renders him blemished.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Rav Anan: When you were in the house of Mar Shmuel, in the city of Ittalelitu? What is the reason that you did not say to him from this: "And the sages say: A Hebrew slave who is a kohen is not accepted because he has a blemish."

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר אֵין רַבּוֹ מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית, תִּיפּוֹק לִי דְּבָעֵינָא: ״אָהַבְתִּי אֶת אֲדֹנִי אֶת אִשְׁתִּי וְאֶת בָּנָי״ וְלֵיכָּא, תּוּ לָא מִידִּי.
human_translation: And if you say if his master cannot provide him a Canaanite maidservant, could be derived as I require “I love my master, my wife, and my children” and cannot nothing more
llm_translation: And if you say, "His master does not give him a Canaanite maidservant," respond to me with what I say: "I have loved my master, my wife, and my children," and there is no escape, it is not from me.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כֹּהֵן, מַהוּ בִּיפַת תּוֹאַר? חִידּוּשׁ הוּא, לָא שְׁנָא כֹּהֵן וְלָא שְׁנָא יִשְׂרָאֵל, אוֹ דִילְמָא שָׁאנֵי כֹּהֲנִים, הוֹאִיל וְרִיבָּה בָּהֶן מִצְוֹת יְתֵרוֹת? רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אָסוּר.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before them: What is for a priest with a beautiful woman is a novelty is no different a priest and no different an Israelite, Or perhaps priests is different, since includes additional mitzvot for them? Rav said: permitted, and Shmuel said: prohibited.
llm_translation: He asked them: A priest, what is the law regarding physical appearance? It is a novelty, it is not different for a priest or for an Israelite, or perhaps it is different for priests, since they have more additional commandments? Rav said: Permitted, and Shmuel said: Forbidden.

hebrew_text: בְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּשְׁרֵי, דְּלֹא דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד יֵצֶר הָרָע.
human_translation: With regard to the first act of sexual intercourse everyone agrees that as the Torah spoke only in response to the evil inclination,
llm_translation: In the first coming, all the world does not argue that it is permitted, for the Torah only spoke against the evil inclination.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּבִיאָה שְׁנִיָּה, רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אָסוּר. רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר, הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתְּרַיא – אִישְׁתְּרַי. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אָסוּר, דְּהָא הָוְיָא לַהּ גִּיּוֹרֶת, וְגִיּוֹרֶת לְכֹהֵן לָא חַזְיָא.
human_translation: When they disagree with regard to the second act of sexual intercourse. Rav said permitted, and Shmuel said prohibited. Rav said permitted: Since permitted permitted And Shmuel said prohibited, as she is a convert, and a convert is not fit to a priest.
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding a second marriage, Rav said: permitted, and Shmuel said: forbidden. Rav said: permitted, since she can become permitted - she becomes permitted. And Shmuel said: forbidden, because she would be considered a convert, and a convert cannot marry a Kohen.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּבִיאָה שְׁנִיָּה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דַּאֲסִירָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ גִּיּוֹרֶת. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, רַב אָמַר: מוּתָּר, דְּהָא לֹא דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד יֵצֶר הָרָע, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אָסוּר, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינָא בַּיהּ: ״וַהֲבֵאתָהּ אֶל תּוֹךְ בֵּיתֶךָ״ – קָרֵינָא בַּיהּ: ״וְרָאִיתָ בַּשִּׁבְיָה״. כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָרֵינָא בַּיהּ: ״וַהֲבֵאתָהּ אֶל תּוֹךְ בֵּיתֶךָ״ – לָא קָרֵינָא בַּיהּ: ״וְרָאִיתָ בַּשִּׁבְיָה״.
human_translation: There are who say With regard to the second act of intercourse everyone agrees that it is prohibited, as she is a convert, When they disagree with regard to the first act of intercourse. Rav said permitted, as the Torah spoke only in response to the evil inclination. And Shmuel said it is prohibited, any that one can read with regard to it: “Then you shall bring her home to your house” one read with regard to “And see among the captives any that one cannot read with regard to it: “Then you shall bring her home to your house,” one does not read with regard to it: “And sees among the captives,”
llm_translation: There are some who say: In the case of a second marriage, everyone agrees that it is prohibited, as it would be considered adultery. When they disagree is in the case of a first marriage. Rav said: It is permitted, for the Torah only spoke against the evil inclination, and Shmuel said: It is forbidden. Wherever we read: "And you bring her into your house" - we read in it: "And you see her in captivity." Wherever we do not read: "And you bring her into your house" - we do not read in it: "And you see her in captivity."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְרָאִיתָ בַּשִּׁבְיָה״ – בִּשְׁעַת שִׁבְיָהּ. ״אֵשֶׁת״ – וַאֲפִילּוּ אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. ״יְפַת תּוֹאַר״ – לֹא דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד יֵצֶר הָרָע. מוּטָב שֶׁיֹּאכְלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשַׂר
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And sees among the captives,” when she is a captive. “a woman” even a married woman. “a beautiful woman” the Torah spoke only in response to the evil inclination, It is preferable for Jews to eat the meat
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And you will see in captivity" - at the time of her captivity. "A woman" - even a married woman. "Of beautiful form" - The Torah only spoke in response to the evil inclination. It is better for the children of Israel to eat meat.

hebrew_text: תְּמוּתוֹת שְׁחוּטוֹת, וְאַל יֹאכְלוּ בְּשַׂר תְּמוּתוֹת נְבֵילוֹת. ״וְחָשַׁקְתָּ״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ נָאָה. ״בָּהּ״ – וְלֹא בָּהּ וּבַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: of dying animals slaughtered, and let them not eat the meat of dying animals carcasses. “And you have a desire even if she is not pretty, “for her” but not her and another
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "T'mutos shechutos, ve'al yokhlu basar t'mutos neveilos. 'Vechashakta' – af al pi she'einah na'ah. 'Bah' – ve'lo bah u'vachavertasah." Translation: "Slaughtered animals, and they shall not eat the flesh of slaughtered carcasses. 'And you shall desire' – even though it is not pleasing. 'In it' – not in it, but in its companion."

hebrew_text: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ – לִיקּוּחִין יֵשׁ לְךָ בָּהּ. ״לְךָ לְאִשָּׁה״ – שֶׁלֹּא יִקַּח שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, אַחַת לוֹ וְאַחַת לְאָבִיו, אַחַת לוֹ וְאַחַת לִבְנוֹ. ״וַהֲבֵאתָהּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלֹּא יִלְחָצֶנָּה בַּמִּלְחָמָה.
human_translation: “and would take her” You have take her, “To you as a wife” that he may not take two women, one for him and one for his father, one for him and one for his son. “Then you shall bring her teaches that he should not pressure her during the war,
llm_translation: "V'lakachta" - for acquisition you have in it. "L'cha l'isha" - that he should not take two women, one for himself and one for his father, one for himself and one for his son. "V'haveita" - teaches that he should not pressure her into intimacy during wartime.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִם אָמֹר יֹאמַר״ – עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר וְיִשְׁנֶה. אָמַר בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ וְלֹא אָמַר בְּסוֹף שֵׁשׁ – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא אֵצֵא חׇפְשִׁי״ – עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר בִּשְׁעַת יְצִיאָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “But if shall say [ amor yomar ]: unless he says and repeats he said at the beginning six but he did not say at the end of six he is not pierced, as it is stated: “I will not go out free,” unless he says when he leaves.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "If he says he will say" - until he actually says and repeats. If he said at the beginning of the sixth hour and did not say at the end of the sixth hour, he is not exempt, as it is stated: "I will not go out free" - until he says at the time of departure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר בְּסוֹף שֵׁשׁ וְלֹא אָמַר בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם אָמֹר יֹאמַר הָעֶבֶד״ – עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר כְּשֶׁהוּא עֶבֶד.
human_translation: he said at the end of six but did not say at the beginning of six not pierced, as it is stated: “If the slave shall say [ amor yomar ],” unless he states while he is a slave.
llm_translation: He said at the end of six and did not say at the beginning of six - it is not accepted, as it is stated: "If he says, 'The servant will say'" - until he says it when he is a servant.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אָמַר בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ וְלֹא אָמַר בְּסוֹף שֵׁשׁ – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא אֵצֵא חׇפְשִׁי״. מַאי אִירְיָא, מִ״לֹּא אֵצֵא חׇפְשִׁי״? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּבָעֵינַן: ״אָהַבְתִּי אֶת אֲדֹנִי אֶת אִשְׁתִּי וְאֶת בָּנָי״ וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: The Master said he said at the beginning of six and he did not say at the end of six he is not pierced, as it is stated: “I will not go out free.” Why specifically from “I will not go out free”? Let him derive that we require “I love my master, my wife, and my children” and cannot
llm_translation: Master said: He said at the beginning six and not at the end six - it is not accepted, as it is stated: "I will not go out free." What is the meaning of "I will not go out free"? Let him bring proof that we need: "I have loved my master, my wife, and my children," and there is none!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, אָמַר בְּסוֹף שֵׁשׁ וְלֹא אָמַר בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הָעֶבֶד״. אַטּוּ סוֹף שֵׁשׁ לָאו עֶבֶד הוּא? אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי בִּתְחִילַּת שֵׁשׁ – בִּתְחִילַּת פְּרוּטָה אַחֲרוֹנָה. וּמַאי בְּסוֹף שֵׁשׁ – בְּסוֹף פְּרוּטָה אַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: And furthermore, he said at the end of six but did not say at the beginning of six not pierced, as it is stated “the slave.” Is that to say he is not a slave at the end of six Rava said: What At the beginning of six? to the beginning of last peruta , And what At the end of six? At the end of last peruta .
llm_translation: And come, he said at the end of six and did not say at the beginning of six, it is not accepted, as it is stated "the servant." Is it then that at the end of six he is not a servant? Rava said: What is meant by at the beginning of six - at the beginning of the last detail. And what is meant by at the end of six - at the end of the last detail.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים, וּלְרַבּוֹ אֵין אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אֲהֵבְךָ וְאֶת בֵּיתֶךָ״. לְרַבּוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים וְלוֹ אֵין אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָהַבְתִּי אֶת אֲדֹנִי אֶת אִשְׁתִּי וְאֶת בָּנָי״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: has a wife and children and his master does not have a wife and children, he is not pierced, as it is stated: “Because he loves you and your house” his master has a wife and children and he does not have a wife and children, he is not pierced, as it is stated: “I love my master, my wife, and my children”
llm_translation: The sages taught: If he has a wife and children, and his master does not have a wife and children - he is not satisfied, as it is stated: "For I love you and your household." If his master has a wife and children and he does not have a wife and children - he is not satisfied, as it is stated: "I have loved my master, my wife, and my children."

hebrew_text: הוּא אוֹהֵב אֶת רַבּוֹ וְרַבּוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹהֲבוֹ – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי טוֹב לוֹ עִמָּךְ״. רַבּוֹ אוֹהֲבוֹ וְהוּא אֵינוֹ אוֹהֵב אֶת רַבּוֹ – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אֲהֵבְךָ״. הוּא חוֹלֶה וְרַבּוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹלֶה – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי טוֹב לוֹ עִמָּךְ״. רַבּוֹ חוֹלֶה וְהוּא אֵינוֹ חוֹלֶה – אֵינוֹ נִרְצָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עִמָּךְ״.
human_translation: he loves his master but his master does not love him, he is not pierced, as it is stated: “Because he fares well with you” his master loves him but he does not love his master, he is not pierced, as it is stated: “Because he loves you.” he is ill and his master is not ill, he is not pierced, as it is stated: “Because he fares well with you,” his master is ill and he is not ill, he is not pierced, as it is stated “with you,”
llm_translation: He who loves his teacher and his teacher does not love him - he is not accepted, as it is stated: "for it is good for him with you." His teacher loves him and he does not love his teacher - he is not accepted, as it is stated: "for he loves you." If he is sick and his teacher is not sick - he is not accepted, as it is stated: "for it is good for him with you." If his teacher is sick and he is not sick - he is not accepted, as it is stated: "with you."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁנֵיהֶם חוֹלִין, מַאי? ״עִמָּךְ״ בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא ״כִּי טוֹב לוֹ עִמָּךְ״ בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא לֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye raised a dilemma: both of them are ill, what Do we require “with you,” and that is here, Or perhaps we require “because he fares well with you,” and that is not here, shall stand
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rav Bibi son of Abbaye: Both of them are ill, what is the reason? "With you" we require - but there is a case, or perhaps "when it is good for him with you" we require - but there is no case? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי טוֹב לוֹ עִמָּךְ״ – עִמְּךָ בַּמַּאֲכָל, עִמְּךָ בַּמִּשְׁתֶּה. שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אַתָּה אוֹכֵל פַּת נְקִיָּה וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פַּת קִיבָּר, אַתָּה שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן יָשָׁן וְהוּא שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן חָדָשׁ, אַתָּה יָשֵׁן עַל גַּבֵּי מוֹכִין וְהוּא יָשֵׁן עַל גַּבֵּי תֶּבֶן. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: כׇּל הַקּוֹנֶה עֶבֶד עִבְרִי – כְּקוֹנֶה אָדוֹן לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “Because he fares well with you,” with you, in food, with you in drink. that there shall not which you eat fine bread and he eats inferior bread, you drink aged wine and he drinks new wine. you sleep on soft sheets and he sleeps on straw. From here stated: Anyone who acquires a Hebrew slave like one who acquires a master for himself,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "For it is better for him with you" - with you in eating, with you in drinking. So that you should not eat fine bread while he eats coarse bread, you drink old wine while he drinks new wine, you sleep on a cushion while he sleeps on straw. From here they said: Whoever acquires a Hebrew slave - it is as if he has acquired a master for himself.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְיָצָא מֵעִמָּךְ הוּא וּבָנָיו עִמּוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִם הוּא נִמְכָּר – בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו מִי נִמְכָּרִים? מִכָּאן שֶׁרַבּוֹ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת בָּנָיו. כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אִם בַּעַל אִשָּׁה הוּא וְיָצְאָה אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִם הוּא נִמְכָּר – אִשְׁתּוֹ מִי נִמְכְּרָה? מִכָּאן שֶׁרַבּוֹ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Then he shall go out from you, he and his children with him” Rabbi Shimon said: if he is sold, are his sons and daughters sold? from here his master is obligated to sustenance for his children, You say something similar “If he is married then his wife shall go out with him” Rabbi Shimon said: If he is sold, is his wife sold? from here that his master is obligated to sustenance for his wife.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And he shall go out with his children with him," Rabbi Shimon said: If he is sold, who are his sons and daughters sold to? From here we learn that a husband is obligated to provide for the sustenance of his children. Similarly, in a similar matter you may say: "If he is a married man and his wife goes out with him," Rabbi Shimon said: If he is sold, who is his wife sold to? From here we learn that a husband is obligated to provide for the sustenance of his wife.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן בָּנָיו, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא בְּנֵי מֶיעְבַּד וּמֵיכַל נִינְהוּ. אֲבָל אִשְׁתּוֹ, דְּבַת מֵיכַל וּמֶיעְבַּד הִיא, אֵימָא תַּעֲבֵיד וְתֵיכוֹל.
human_translation: And it is necessary as if it taught us children, because they are not fit to work and eat. But his wife, who can eat and work, say she should work and eat
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we hear about his sons, because they are not his own sons and they are from another, but his wife, who is from him and from another, she may do and eat.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אִשְׁתּוֹ, דְּלָאו דִּירְכַּהּ לְהַדּוֹרֵי, אֲבָל בָּנָיו, דְּדִירְכַּיְיהוּ לְהַדּוֹרֵי, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us his wife, since it is not her manner to circulate But his children, since it is their manner to circulate say no, necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say his wife, for she did not turn to the generation, but his sons, for they turned to the generation, we might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן:
human_translation: The Sages taught:
llm_translation: The sages taught:

hebrew_text: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״אׇזְנוֹ בַּדֶּלֶת״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: יִדְקוֹר כְּנֶגֶד אׇזְנוֹ בַּדֶּלֶת. דֶּלֶת – אִין, אׇזְנוֹ – לָא. וְאֹזֶן לָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְרָצַע אֲדֹנָיו אֶת אׇזְנוֹ בַּמַּרְצֵעַ״!
human_translation: Had stated: His ear to the door, I would say: He should pierce, opposite his ear, into the door the door, yes, his ear no, But his ear not But isn’t it written: “And his master shall pierce his ear with an awl”
llm_translation: If it were stated "his ear at the door," I would say: his ear should be pierced opposite the door. Door - no, his ear - yes. But his ear? But it is written: "And his master shall pierce his ear with an awl!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר יִרְצָעֶנָּה לָאֹזֶן מֵאַבָּרַאי וְיַנִּיחֶנָּה עַל הַדֶּלֶת, וְיִדְקוֹר כְּנֶגֶד אׇזְנוֹ בַּדֶּלֶת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּאׇזְנוֹ וּבַדֶּלֶת״ – הָא כֵּיצַד? דּוֹקֵר וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֵצֶל דֶּלֶת.
human_translation: Rather, I would say should pierce his ear outside, and he should place it on the door, and he should pierce opposite his ear on the door. the verse states: through his ear and into the door” How so? He bores through until he reaches the door.
llm_translation: Rather: I would say, let it be pierced through the ear from my limbs, and let it be placed upon the door, and let it be pierced opposite his ear in the door, as the Talmud says: "In his ear and in the door" - how so? One pierces and walks until reaching the door.

hebrew_text: ״דֶּלֶת״ – שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי: בֵּין עֲקוּרָה בֵּין שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲקוּרָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מְזוּזָה״ – מָה מְזוּזָה מְעוּמָּד – אַף דֶּלֶת נָמֵי מְעוּמָּד.
human_translation: “door,” I derive whether detached whether it is not detached. the verse states: doorpost” Just as a doorpost is upright so too, a door upright
llm_translation: "Door" - I hear: whether it is crooked or not crooked, the Torah says: "door" - just as a mezuzah is upright, so too a door is upright.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה כְּמִין חוֹמֶר: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה אֹזֶן מִכׇּל אֵבָרִים שֶׁבַּגּוּף? אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֹזֶן שֶׁשָּׁמְעָה קוֹלִי עַל הַר סִינַי בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַרְתִּי: ״כִּי לִי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדִים״ – וְלֹא עֲבָדִים לַעֲבָדִים, וְהָלַךְ זֶה וְקָנָה אָדוֹן לְעַצְמוֹ – יֵרָצַע.
human_translation: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai would expound this verse as a type of decorative wreath [ ḥomer ], Why is the ear different from all the other limbs in the body, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: ear heard My voice on Mount Sinai when I said: “For to Me the children of Israel are slaves” And not slaves to slaves. And this went and acquired a master for himself. let be pierced.
llm_translation: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai was expounding this verse like a type of hammer: How is the ear different from all the other organs in the body? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: The ear that heard My voice on Mount Sinai when I said, "For the children of Israel are My servants" - not servants to servants, and this one went and acquired a master for himself - let it be pierced.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ אֶת הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה כְּמִין חוֹמֶר: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה דֶּלֶת וּמְזוּזָה מִכׇּל כֵּלִים שֶׁבַּבַּיִת? אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: דֶּלֶת וּמְזוּזָה שֶׁהָיוּ עֵדִים בְּמִצְרַיִם בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁפָּסַחְתִּי עַל הַמַּשְׁקוֹף וְעַל שְׁתֵּי הַמְּזוּזוֹת, וְאָמַרְתִּי: ״כִּי לִי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדִים״ – וְלֹא עֲבָדִים לַעֲבָדִים, וְהוֹצֵאתִים מֵעַבְדוּת לְחֵירוּת, וְהָלַךְ זֶה וְקָנָה אָדוֹן לְעַצְמוֹ – יֵרָצַע בִּפְנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi would expound this verse as a type of decorative wreath: Why are the door and a doorpost different from all other objects in the house, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: The door and the doorpost were witnesses in Egypt when I passed over the lintel and over the two doorposts and I said: “For to Me the children of Israel are slaves,” and not slaves to slaves. And I delivered them from slavery to freedom, and this went and acquired a master for himself. let him be pierced before them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi would expound this verse as a type of strictness: How is a door and a doorpost different from all the vessels in the house? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: The door and the doorpost were witnesses in Egypt when I passed over the lintel and the two doorposts, and I said, "For the children of Israel are My servants" - not servants to servants, but I took them out from servitude to freedom, and this one went and acquired a master for himself - he shall have his ear pierced before them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי נִקְנֶה בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה, וְקוֹנֶה אֶת עַצְמוֹ בְּכֶסֶף עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, וּבִשְׁטָר עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּכֶסֶף עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ וּבִשְׁטָר עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הַכֶּסֶף מִשֶּׁל אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: A Canaanite slave is acquired by money, by a document, or by taking possession And he can acquire himself, by money by others, and by a bill by himself. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: by money by himself, and by a bill by others, provided that the money belongs to others,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A Canaanite slave is acquired with money, a contract, and through physical possession. And he acquires himself with money through others, and with a contract through himself, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: With money through himself, and with a contract through others, but only if the money is his own.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם לָרֶשֶׁת אֲחֻזָּה״ – הִקִּישָׁן הַכָּתוּב לִשְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה. מָה שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה נִקְנֶה בְּכֶסֶף, בִּשְׁטָר, וּבַחֲזָקָה – אַף עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי נִקְנֶה בְּכֶסֶף בִּשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה.
human_translation: From where do we As it is written “And you shall bequeath them to your children as an ancestral inheritance” The verse juxtaposes to an ancestral field: Just as an ancestral field can be acquired by money, by a document, or by taking possession so too, a Canaanite slave can be acquired by money, by a document, or by taking possession
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And you shall inherit them for your children after you, to inherit a possession" - the Torah equated them to a field of inheritance. Just as a field of inheritance is acquired with money, a document, and possession, so too a Canaanite slave is acquired with money, a document, and possession.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה חוֹזֶרֶת לַבְּעָלִים בַּיּוֹבֵל – אַף עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי חוֹזֵר לַבְּעָלִים בַּיּוֹבֵל? – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְעֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ״.
human_translation: If Just as an ancestral field returns to its owners in the Jubilee so too a Canaanite slave returns to his owners in the Jubilee the verse states: “Of them you may take your slaves forever”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a field of possession returns to the owners in the Jubilee year - does a Canaanite slave also return to the owners in the Jubilee year? - The Talmud teaches: "You shall work with them forever."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אַף בַּחֲלִיפִין. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן? מִילְּתָא דְּלֵיתַהּ בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין – קָתָנֵי, מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתַהּ בִּמְטַלְטְלִין – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: taught also by exchange, And the tanna of our teaches modes which are not of movable property, not teach modes which are of movable property,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: Even with exchanges. And our Mishna? A matter that does not involve shaking – it teaches, a matter that does involve shaking – it does not teach.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי נִקְנֶה בִּמְשִׁיכָה. כֵּיצַד? תְּקָפוֹ וּבָא אֶצְלוֹ – קְנָאוֹ. קְרָאוֹ וּבָא אֶצְלוֹ – לֹא קְנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: A Canaanite slave can be acquired by pulling, How took him by force and came to him, he has acquired him. called him and he came to him he has not acquired him.
llm_translation: Samuel said: A Canaanite slave is acquired through money. How so? If one surrounds him and comes to him - he is acquired. If one calls him and comes to him - he is not acquired.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְתַנָּא דִּידַן, מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתַהּ בְּמִטַּלְטְלֵי – לָא קָתָנֵי, דְּלֵיתַהּ בְּמִטַּלְטְלֵי – קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא לְתַנָּא בָּרָא, נִיתְנֵי מְשִׁיכָה! כִּי קָתָנֵי, מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתַהּ בֵּין בִּמְקַרְקְעֵי בֵּין בְּמִטַּלְטְלִי, מְשִׁיכָה דִּבְמִטַּלְטְלִי אִיתָא, בִּמְקַרְקְעִי לֵיתַהּ – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the tanna of our he not teach modes that are of movable property; teaches modes that are not of movable property. But according to the tanna of the baraita , let him teach pulling When he teaches modes that are both land and movable property. He does not teach pulling, which is of movable property is not of land.
llm_translation: In truth, according to our Mishna, a matter that exists in movable objects - it does not teach; a matter that does not exist in movable objects - it teaches. Rather, according to the son of a Mishnaic sage, the concept of "pulling" is given! For when it teaches, a matter that exists whether in the ground or in movable objects, the concept of "pulling" is applicable in movable objects, but in the ground where it does not exist - it does not teach.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? תְּקָפוֹ וּבָא אֶצְלוֹ – קְנָאוֹ, קְרָאוֹ וּבָא אֶצְלוֹ – לֹא קְנָאוֹ. וּקְרָאוֹ לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד בִּמְסִירָה? אֲחָזָהּ בְּטַלְפָּהּ, בִּשְׂעָרָהּ, בָּאוּכָּף שֶׁעָלֶיהָ, בִּשְׁלִיף שֶׁעָלֶיהָ, בִּפְרוּמְבְּיָא שֶׁבְּפִיהָ וּבְזוֹג שֶׁבְּצַוָּארָהּ – קְנָאָהּ.
human_translation: How took him by force and he came to him, acquired him. he called him and he came to him, not acquired him. And not he called him? But isn’t it taught How through passing? he grabbed it by its hoof, by its hair, by the saddle on it, by the load [ shalif ] on it, by the bit [ bifrumbiya ] in its mouth, by the bell on its neck, he has acquired it.
llm_translation: How so? If he surrounded her and came to her - he is jealous, if he called her and came to her - he is not jealous. And if he did not call her? And it was taught: How so in the case of handing her over? He held onto her kerchief, her hair, the strap of her sandal, the lacing of her sandal, the fringe of her garment at her mouth, and the clasp at her neck - he is jealous.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד בִּמְשִׁיכָה? קוֹרֵא לָהּ וְהִיא בָּאָה, אוֹ שֶׁהִכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל וְרָצְתָה לְפָנָיו, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָקְרָה יָד וָרֶגֶל – קְנָאָהּ. רַבִּי אַסִּי וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי אַחָא אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁתְּהַלֵּךְ לְפָנָיו מְלֹא קוֹמָתָהּ.
human_translation: How by pulling? he calls it and it comes, or he hits it with a stick and it runs before him, once it lifts a foreleg and a hind leg acquires it. Rabbi Asi, and some say Rabbi Aḥa, says: until it walks its full height in the presence of
llm_translation: How is seduction performed? He calls her and she comes, or he strikes her with a stick and she runs before him. Once she has uprooted her hand and her foot - his jealousy. Rabbi Assi and some say Rabbi Acha said to her: Until she walks before him her full height.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: בְּהֵמָה אַדַּעְתָּא דְמָרַהּ אָזְלָה, עֶבֶד אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָזֵיל. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: עֶבֶד קָטָן כִּבְהֵמָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: say An animal walks by the will of its owner, a slave walks by his own will. Rav Ashi said: A slave who is a minor is considered like an animal.
llm_translation: They said: In the case of an animal, once its mind is made up, its body follows. Rav Ashi said: A young slave is like an animal.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד בַּחֲזָקָה? הִתִּיר לוֹ מִנְעָלוֹ, אוֹ הוֹלִיךְ כֵּלָיו אַחֲרָיו לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ, הִפְשִׁיטוֹ, הִרְחִיצוֹ, סָכוֹ, גֵּרְדוֹ, הִלְבִּישׁוֹ הִנְעִילוֹ, הִגְבִּיהוֹ – קְנָאוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא תְּהֵא חֲזָקָה גְּדוֹלָה מֵהַגְבָּהָה, שֶׁהַגְבָּהָה קוֹנָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: The Sages taught How through possession? removes shoe, carries his garments after him to the bathhouse, undresses him, bathes him, anoints him, scrubs dresses him, puts on his shoes, or lifts him, acquires him. Rabbi Shimon says: possession should not be considered greater than lifting, as lifting acquires in any situation. What is saying
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How is it done with strength? He permitted him to remove his shoe, or he followed him to the bathhouse, undressed him, washed him, dried him, anointed him, combed his hair, dressed him, and put his shoe on him - this is zeal. Rabbi Shimon said: Let not zeal be greater than wisdom, for wisdom acquires zeal in every place. What is he saying?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הִגְבִּיהוֹ הוּא לְרַבּוֹ – קְנָאוֹ, הִגְבִּיהוֹ רַבּוֹ לוֹ – לֹא קְנָאוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא תְּהֵא חֲזָקָה גְּדוֹלָה מֵהַגְבָּהָה, שֶׁהַגְבָּהָה קוֹנָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says lifts his master, acquires him, his master lifts does not acquire him, Rabbi Shimon says: possession should not be greater than lifting, as lifting acquires in any situation.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: If he elevated himself to his master - he is zealous, if his master elevated him to himself - he is not zealous. Rabbi Shimon said: Let there not be a strong presumption greater than elevation, for elevation acquires in every place.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: הִגְבִּיהוֹ הוּא לְרַבּוֹ – קְנָאוֹ, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית תִּקָּנֶה בְּבִיאָה? כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן: זֶה נֶהֱנֶה וְזֶה מִצְטַעֵר, הָכָא: זֶה נֶהֱנֶה וְזֶה נֶהֱנֶה הוּא.
human_translation: Now that you said lifts his master, acquires him, If that is so, let a Canaanite maidservant be acquired by sexual intercourse When we say this benefits and that suffers. Here, it is this benefits and this benefits.
llm_translation: The question was raised: If he raised him for his teacher - he is zealous, but from now on, can a Canaanite maidservant be acquired through intercourse? For we say: This one benefits and this one suffers, here: This one benefits and this one benefits.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַב אַחַיי [בַּר אַדָּא] דְּמִן אַחָא: מַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּלָאו הֲנָאָה אִית לְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ? וְעוֹד: ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ כְּתִיב, הִקִּישה הַכָּתוּב כְּדַרְכָּהּ לְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: in an atypical manner, what can be said? Rav Aḥai bar Adda of Aḥa said: Who will tell us, that there is no benefit for both of them, And furthermore, it is written: “Lyings with a woman” the verse compares typical to an atypical manner.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "If not in its usual manner, what can be said? Rav Aḥai son of Adda said in the name of Aḥa: Who can say to us that they do not derive pleasure from it? Furthermore, 'the ways of a woman' is written, the verse equates her to her usual manner."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִנְדּוּאָה גֵּר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ יוֹרְשִׁין הֲוָה. חֲלַשׁ, עָל מָר זוּטְרָא לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ, חַזְיֵיהּ דְּתָקֵיף לֵיהּ עָלְמָא טוּבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְעַבְדֵיהּ: שְׁלוֹף לִי מְסָנַאי וְאַמְטִינְהוּ לְבֵיתָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי גָּדוֹל הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda from India was a convert who had no heirs. he became ill Mar Zutra entered to ask saw that his condition intensified, said to slave: Remove my shoes and take them to my house. There are who say was an adult man,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah Hindua, a convert who has no heirs, was weak. On a certain mountain, he found a purse full of coins, and he saw that the world was good for him. He said to his servant: "Take the purse and bring it to the house." Some say he was a great man.

hebrew_text: זֶה פֵּירַשׁ לְמִיתָה, וְזֶה פֵּירַשׁ לְחַיִּים.
human_translation: this departed to death, and that departed to life
llm_translation: This one explained for death, and this one explained for life.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי קָטָן הֲוָה, וּדְלָא כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, דְּתַנְיָא: גֵּר שֶׁמֵּת וּבִזְבְּזוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל נְכָסָיו, וְהָיוּ בָּהֶן עֲבָדִים, בֵּין גְּדוֹלִים בֵּין קְטַנִּים – קָנוּ עַצְמָן בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלִים – קָנוּ עַצְמָן בְּנֵי חוֹרִין, קְטַנִּים – כׇּל הַמַּחְזִיק בָּהֶן זָכָה בָּהֶן.
human_translation: And there are who say was a minor, and not in accordance with Abba Shaul. As it is taught a convert who dies and Jews plundered his property, and among were slaves, whether adults or minors, they acquire themselves freemen, Abba Shaul says: Adult acquire themselves freemen. minor anyone who takes possession of them acquires them.
llm_translation: There is one who says: the minor was considered, but not like Abba Saul, as it was taught: A convert who died and his property was wasted by Israel, and there were slaves among them, whether adults or minors - they acquired themselves as free men. Abba Saul says: adults - they acquired themselves as free men, minors - anyone who holds onto them has acquired them.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹנֶה עַצְמוֹ בְּכֶסֶף כּוּ׳ בְּכֶסֶף עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים. אִין, אֲבָל לֹא עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ, מִכְּדֵי שְׁמַעְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר: חוֹב הוּא לְעֶבֶד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִיַּד רַבּוֹ לְחֵירוּת. וּתְנֵינָא: זָכִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: by money, with money by others, yes, but not by himself. With what are we dealing? If we say without his consent, After all, we have heard Rabbi Meir who says: It is against the slave’s interest to leave his master’s authority for freedom, and we learned One can act in a person’s interest in his absence, but one can act against a person’s interest only in his presence.
llm_translation: And acquiring oneself with money, yes with money, through the agency of others. No, but not through one's own agency. With what are we dealing? If you say it is without his knowledge, it is as we have heard from Rabbi Meir who said: A slave is obligated to go free from his master. And it was taught: One can acquire for a person not in his presence, but one cannot obligate him except in his presence.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא מִדַּעְתּוֹ, וְהָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן: עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים – אִין, עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ – לָא. אַלְמָא אֵין קִנְיָן לְעֶבֶד בְּלֹא רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, is obvious with his consent, and teaches us this: by others, yes, by himself, no, Evidently, a slave has no acquisition without his master.
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious from his own knowledge, and this is what is implied: through others - no, through himself - yes. This implies that a slave cannot acquire without his master.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בִּשְׁטָר עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ – אִין, עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים – לָא. וְאִי מִדַּעְתּוֹ, עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים אַמַּאי לָא?
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause by a bill by himself. by himself, yes, by others, no, And if with consent, why not by others?
llm_translation: If so, say the latter: with a document by his own hand. By his own hand - yes, by the hand of others - no. And if it is from his knowledge, why not by the hand of others?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַאי עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ – אַף עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּגִיטּוֹ וְיָדוֹ בָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְהָא לָא תָּנֵי הָכִי, דְּתַנְיָא: בִּשְׁטָר עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר!
human_translation: And if you would say What by himself? he can also by himself, and this teaches us this, his bill and his ability come simultaneously. But did not teach this as it is taught by a bill by himself, but not by others; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And if you will say: What does "by himself" mean? - even by himself. And this is what it implies to us: that his gitt and his hand come together as one, and it does not teach like this, as it was taught: in a document by himself and not by others, the words of Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ, וְשָׁאנֵי כֶּסֶף, הוֹאִיל וְקָנֵי לֵיהּ בְּעַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ – מַקְנֵי לֵיהּ בְּעַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, without consent, and money is different: Since it acquires him against his will acquires him for himself against his will.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always without his knowledge, and as for money, since he acquired it with the consent of his wife - he acquires it with the consent of his wife.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שְׁטָר נָמֵי! הַאי שְׁטָרָא לְחוֹד וְהַאי שְׁטָרָא לְחוֹד.
human_translation: If so, also a document This document is discrete, and this document is discrete,
llm_translation: If so, a valid document! This document for one and this document for one.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, הַאי כַּסְפָּא לְחוֹד וְהַאי כַּסְפָּא לְחוֹד? טִיבְעָא מִיהָא חַד הוּא.
human_translation: Here too, this money is discrete and this money is discrete, In any event, the coin is one,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here it is stated: This silver is for this purpose, and this silver is for this purpose? The nature of each one is distinct.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כֶּסֶף – קַבָּלַת רַבּוֹ גָּרְמָה לוֹ, שְׁטָר – קַבָּלַת אֲחֵרִים גָּרְמָה לוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said money, his master’s receipt causes him a document, receipt by others causes him
llm_translation: Rava said: "Silver - acceptance of his master caused it for him, a document - acceptance of others caused it for him."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּכֶסֶף עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. בְּכֶסֶף עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ – אִין, עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים – לָא. אַמַּאי? נְהִי נָמֵי דְּשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ, מִכְּדֵי שְׁמַעְנָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: זְכוּת הוּא שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִתַּחַת יָד רַבּוֹ לְחֵירוּת, וּתְנֵינָא: זָכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו, וְאֵין חָבִין לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: by money by himself. By money by himself, yes, by others, no, Why Although indeed without consent, after all, we heard that the Rabbis say: It is in interest to go out from the master’s authority to freedom. And we learned One can act in a person’s interest in his absence, but one can act against a person’s interest only in his presence.
llm_translation: The sages say: "With money by his own hand. With money by his own hand - yes, by the hand of others - no. Why? Because even though it is without his knowledge, since we have heard from the Rabbis who say: 'It is a merit for one to go out from under the hand of his master to freedom.' And it was taught: 'One can acquire for a person not in his presence, but one cannot obligate him except in his presence.'"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַאי עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ – אַף עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּיֵשׁ קִנְיָן לְעֶבֶד בְּלֹא רַבּוֹ – אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בִּשְׁטָר עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים – וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּגִיטּוֹ וְיָדוֹ בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד?
human_translation: And if you would say: What By money by himself? even by himself, and it teaches us that a slave has an acquisition without his master. If so, say the latter clause by a bill by others. but not by himself. And we maintain his bill and his ability to acquire come simultaneously.
llm_translation: And if you will say: What does "by his own hand" mean? - Even by his own hand, and it is implied to us that there is acquisition for a slave without his master. If so, say the latter part: with a document by the hand of others - and not by his own hand, and this fulfills for us that his gift and his hand come together as one?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַאי עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים – אַף עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּזְכוּת הוּא לְעֶבֶד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִיַּד רַבּוֹ לְחֵירוּת, אִי הָכִי, נְעָרְבִינְהוּ וְנִיתְנִינְהוּ: בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר בֵּין עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים בֵּין עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: And if you would say: What by others? even by others, and teaches us this: it is in a slave’s interest to go out from the master’s authority to freedom. If so, let us combine them and teach them by money and by a bill whether by others whether by himself.
llm_translation: And if you will say: What is the law regarding through the agency of others - even through the agency of others, and this is what it implies to us, that it is a merit for a slave to go out from the hand of his master to freedom, if so, let us mix them and give them: with money and with a document, whether through the agency of others or through his own agency!
