hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בְּכֶסֶף – בֵּין עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים בֵּין עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, בִּשְׁטָר – עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף בִּשְׁטָר עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. וְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בַּדָּבָר.
human_translation: Rather, by money, whether by others whether by himself. of a bill by others but not by himself. And is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: also with a bill by others but not by himself. And three disputes with regard to the matter.
llm_translation: Rather: with money - whether through others or through oneself, with a document - through others and not through oneself. And Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even with a document, through others and not through oneself. And there are three disputes on this matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר – גָּמַר ״לָהּ״ ״לָהּ״ מֵאִשָּׁה: מָה אִשָּׁה עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא גֵּט לִרְשׁוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ, אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא גֵּט לִרְשׁוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? He derives “to her [ lah ],” from “for her [ lah ],” a wife: Just as a woman until moves bill of divorce to a domain that is not his, so too, a slave unless moves bill to a domain that is not his.
llm_translation: Rabba said: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar's statement? He learned "laha" "laha" from a woman: Just as a woman is considered a woman until she issues a divorce to someone else's possession, so too a slave is considered a slave until he issues a document of manumission to someone else's possession.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבָּה:
human_translation: Rabba raises a dilemma:
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ba'ei Ravah:

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי מַהוּ שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גִּיטּוֹ מִיָּד רַבּוֹ? כֵּיוָן דְּגָמַר ״לָהּ״ ״לָהּ״ מֵאִשָּׁה, כְּאִשָּׁה,
human_translation: According to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, a Canaanite slave, what is that can appoint an agent to accept his bill from the hand of his master? since derives “ lah ” “ lah ” from a woman, like a woman
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, a Canaanite slave, what should a messenger do to receive his bill of divorce from his master's hand? Once he has completed "for her," "for her" from a woman, like a woman.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא אִשָּׁה דְּאִיהִי מָצֵי מְקַבֶּלֶת גִּיטָּהּ – שָׁלִיחַ נָמֵי מָצֵי מְשַׁוְּיָא. עֶבֶד דְּאִיהוּ לָא מְקַבֵּל גִּיטֵּיהּ – שָׁלִיחַ נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי מְשַׁוֵּי. בָּתַר דְּבַעְיָא הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: ״לָהּ״ ״לָהּ״ מֵאִשָּׁה, כְּאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Or perhaps, a woman, as she can accept her bill of divorce she can also appoint an agent, a slave as he cannot accept his bill he cannot appoint an agent either. After raising the dilemma, subsequently resolved it: “ lah ” “ lah ” from a woman, like a woman
llm_translation: Or perhaps a woman who is found accepting her get - the agent is considered valid. But a slave who is not found accepting his get - the agent is not considered valid. After she asks for it again, she spreads it out: "to her" "to her" from a woman, like a woman.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָנֵי כָּהֲנֵי שְׁלוּחֵי דְרַחֲמָנָא נִינְהוּ. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן נִינְהוּ, מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דַּאֲנַן לָא מָצֵינַן עָבְדִינַן וְאִינְהוּ מָצֵי עָבְדִי?
human_translation: But that which Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says These priests are the agents of the Merciful One, As if it enters your mind they are our agents, is there anything that we cannot do but can do
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: those priests emissaries of the Merciful they are. For if it were to occur to you that our emissaries they are, who would be at hand for us, that we do not find, we do and they find?

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָא עַבְדָּא, דְּאִיהוּ לָא מָצֵי מְקַבֵּל גִּיטֵּיהּ וּשְׁלִיחַ מָצֵי מְשַׁוֵּי!
human_translation: But not But a slave, who is unable to accept his bill himself, and he can appoint an agent
llm_translation: And not so?! But the slave, for he cannot receive his bill of divorce, and the agent can receive it for him!

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא שָׁיְכִי בְּתוֹרַת קׇרְבָּנוֹת כְּלָל, עֶבֶד שָׁיֵיךְ בְּגִיטִּין. דְּתַנְיָא: נִרְאִין הַדְּבָרִים שֶׁהָעֶבֶד מְקַבֵּל גִּיטּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ מִיַּד רַבּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא מִיַּד רַבּוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And is not so. an Israelite is not involved in the halakhot of offerings at all, a slave is involved in bills as it is taught It seems that a slave can accept the bill of another from the hand of the master of other But cannot from the hand of his own master,
llm_translation: And not this, Israel not able in law of sacrifices at all, slave able in divorces. As it was taught: It appears the matter that the slave receives his fellow's divorce from the hand of his fellow's master, but not from his own master's hand.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הַכֶּסֶף מִשֶּׁל אֲחֵרִים. נֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: אֵין קִנְיָן לְעֶבֶד בְּלֹא רַבּוֹ, וְאֵין קִנְיָן לְאִשָּׁה בְּלֹא בַּעְלָהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ קִנְיָן לְעֶבֶד בְּלֹא רַבּוֹ, וְיֵשׁ קִנְיָן לְאִשָּׁה בְּלֹא בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: provided that the money belongs to others. Shall we say they disagree with regard to this that Rabbi Meir maintains: There is no acquisition for a slave without his master, And there is no acquisition for a woman without her husband. And the Rabbis maintain: There is acquisition for a slave without his master, and there is acquisition for a woman without her husband.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And only if the money belongs to others. It was stated in this case: Rabbi Meir holds: A slave cannot acquire without his master, and a woman cannot acquire without her husband. And the Rabbis hold: A slave can acquire without his master, and a woman can acquire without her husband."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין קִנְיָן לְעֶבֶד בְּלֹא רַבּוֹ, וְאֵין קִנְיָן לְאִשָּׁה בְּלֹא בַּעְלָהּ. וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאַקְנִי לֵיהּ אַחֵר מָנֶה, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לְרַבָּךְ רְשׁוּת בּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabba said Rav Sheshet said: Everyone agrees there is no acquisition for a slave without his master, and there is no acquisition for a woman without her husband, and with what are we dealing here? which another transferred one hundred dinars to and said to him: on the condition that your master has no rights to it.
llm_translation: Rabba said in the name of Rav Sheshet: In all the world, there is no acquisition for a slave without his master, and there is no acquisition for a woman without her husband. And here, what are we dealing with? That he acquires it with a different coin, and he says to him: "On the condition that your master has no authority over it."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כִּי אָמַר לֵיהּ ״קְנִי״ – קָנֵי עֶבֶד וְקָנֵי רַבֵּיהּ. וְכִי אָמַר לֵיהּ ״עַל מְנָת״ – לֹא כְּלוּם קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ ״עַל מְנָת״ – אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ תְּנָאֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir maintains when said to Acquire slave acquires his master acquires And when he said to him: On the condition he has said nothing to him, And the Rabbis maintain since he said to him: On the condition, his condition is effective
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: When he said to him "acquire," he acquires a slave and acquires his master. And when he said to him "on condition," he did not say anything. And the Rabbis hold: Since he said to him "on condition," his conditions are effective.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: כֹּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּקָנֵי עֶבֶד וְקָנֵי רַבֵּיהּ, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דְּאַקְנִי לֵיהּ אַחֵר מָנֶה וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתֵּצֵא בּוֹ לְחֵירוּת״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: a case like this, everyone agrees that slave acquires and his master acquires And with what are we dealing here, where another transferred one hundred dinars to him and said to him: On the condition that you are emancipated with it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: All when this case of all the world do not argue that he acquires a slave and acquires his master, and here we are dealing with what? For example, if he acquires from him a hundred and says to him, "On the condition that you will go out with it to freedom."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כִּי אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״קְנִי״ – קָנֵי עֶבֶד וְקָנֵי רַבֵּיהּ. וְכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״עַל מְנָת״ – לֹא כְּלוּם קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי הָא לָא קָא מַקְנֵי לֵיהּ, דְּהָא לָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֶלָּא ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתֵּצֵא בּוֹ לְחֵירוּת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir maintains when he said to him: Acquire slave acquires and his master acquires And when he said to him: On the condition, he has said nothing to him. And the Rabbis maintain: He not transfer to as he said to him only: On the condition that you are emancipated with it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: When he said to him "k'ni" - he acquires a slave and he acquires his master. And when he said to him "al mnat" - he did not say anything to him. And the Rabbis hold: According to his opinion also, he is not acquiring him, for he did not say to him except "al mnat that he should go out to freedom."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַדְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וּרְמִי דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: And raises a contradiction of Rabbi Meir and of Rabbi Meir, and raises a contradiction between the Rabbis the Rabbis. As it is taught
llm_translation: And Remi of Rabbi Meir to Rabbi Meir, and Remi of Rabbanan to Rabbanan, as it was taught:

hebrew_text: אֵין אִשָּׁה פּוֹדָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בְּלֹא חוֹמֶשׁ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִשָּׁה פּוֹדָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בְּלֹא חוֹמֶשׁ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּזוּזֵי דְבַעַל, וּמַעֲשֵׂר דְּבַעַל – שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ דְּבַעַל קָא עָבְדָה?!
human_translation: A woman may not redeem second tithe without one-fifth Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Meir: A woman may redeem second tithe without one-fifth. What are the circumstances? If we say with husband’s money, and the tithe to husband, she acts the agency of husband.
llm_translation: A woman does not redeem the second tithe without the addition of a fifth. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A woman redeems the second tithe without the addition of a fifth. How so? If we say with the husband's coins, and the tithe belongs to the husband – is it the husband's agent who is acting?!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בְּזוּזֵי דִידַהּ וּמַעֲשֵׂר דִּידֵיהּ – ״אִישׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא אִשָּׁה!
human_translation: But rather, to her money and his tithe. the Merciful One states: a man but not a woman
llm_translation: "And rather with our coins and our tithes - 'man' the Merciful One said, and not 'woman'!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא, דְּאַקְנִי לַהּ אַחֵר מָנֶה, וַאֲמַר לַהּ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּפְדִּי בּוֹ אֶת הַמַּעֲשֵׂר״, וְאִיפְּכָא שְׁמַעְנָא לְהוּ!
human_translation: Rather, is it not a case like this Where another transferred one hundred dinars to her, and said to her: on the condition that you redeem tithe with it? And we heard them opposite
llm_translation: Rather, is it not because of this case, that I acquire for her a maneh, and I say to her: "On the condition that you redeem with it the tithe," and the matter is thus clarified to them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵיפוֹךְ. רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וְהָכָא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר דַּאֲתָא מִבֵּי נָשָׁא עָסְקִינַן, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂר מָמוֹן הֶקְדֵּשׁ הוּא, וְלָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ בַּעַל.
human_translation: Abaye said: Reverse Rava said: Actually do not reverse and here, with regard to tithes, we are dealing with tithe she received from her father’s house And Rabbi Meir to his reasoning, as he says: Tithe is property Temple and the husband does not acquire it,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Turn it over. Rava said: Always do not turn it over, and here in the case of the tithe that comes from the house of a woman we are dealing with, and Rabbi Meir according to his reasoning, for he said: The tithe is consecrated money, and the owner does not acquire it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאָמְרִי: מָמוֹן הֶדְיוֹט הוּא, וְקָנֵי לֵיהּ בַּעַל, הִילְכָּךְ שְׁלִיחוּתָא דְבַעַל קָעָבְדָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis to their reasoning, as they say: Tithe is common, property. And husband acquires it Therefore, she performs the agency of husband
llm_translation: The Sages according to their reasoning, for they say: It is the money of a commoner, and the owner acquires it, therefore the agency of the owner is esteemed.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: יוֹצֵא בְּשֵׁן וָעַיִן וְרָאשֵׁי אֵבָרִים שֶׁאֵינָן חוֹזְרִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא שֵׁן וָעַיִן – כְּתִיבִי. אֶלָּא רָאשֵׁי אֵבָרִים מְנָלַן? דּוּמְיָא דְשֵׁן וָעַיִן, מָה שֵׁן וָעַיִן מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִין – אַף כֹּל מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִין.
human_translation: taught: is emancipated through a tooth and an eye and extremities that do not regenerate Granted, a tooth and an eye, written, But from where do we extremities similar to a tooth and an eye: Just as a tooth and an eye exposed, blemishes that do not regenerate, so too, all blemishes exposed and that do not regenerate.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who goes out with a tooth, an eye, and the tops of limbs that do not regenerate. With regard to a tooth and an eye - it is written. But where are the tops of limbs derived from? They are similar to a tooth and an eye, just as a tooth and an eye are visible blemishes and do not regenerate, so too, all visible blemishes do not regenerate.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא נִיהְווֹ שֵׁן וָעַיִן כִּשְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין! צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״שֵׁן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ
human_translation: But say a tooth and an eye are like two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach necessary As, if the Merciful One had written tooth, I would say even
llm_translation: And why not say that "tooth" and "eye" are like two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach! The Gemara asks: It is necessary, as if the Merciful One had written "tooth," I would say that even

hebrew_text: שֵׁן דְּחָלָב, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עַיִן״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עַיִן״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מָה עַיִן שֶׁנִּבְרָא עִמּוֹ – אַף כֹּל שֶׁנִּבְרָא עִמּוֹ, אֲבָל שֵׁן – לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: a milk tooth, the Merciful One writes “eye,” And if the Merciful One had written “eye,” I would say just as an eye was created with him so too, anything that was created with him But a tooth, not it is necessary
llm_translation: Tooth of milk, as it is written: "eye." And if it were written "eye," I would say just as the eye that was created with him - so too everything was created with him, but the tooth - no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״כִּי יַכֶּה״ – כָּלַל, ״שֵׁן וָעַיִן״ – פָּרַט. כְּלָל וּפְרָט, אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁבַּפְּרָט. שֵׁן וָעַיִן – אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא – לָא!
human_translation: But say “If smites” a generalization; “a tooth” and “an eye” a detail. a generalization and a detail, the generalization includes only what is in the detail. a tooth and an eye are not other matters.
llm_translation: And why? "If he strikes" - a generalization, "tooth and eye" - a specification. Generalization and specification, in the generalization there is only what is in the specification. Tooth and eye - no, from other things - no!

hebrew_text: ״לַחׇפְשִׁי יְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט, מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ מוּם שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִים – אַף כֹּל מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִין.
human_translation: “To freedom shall he send him” it then generalized a generalization and a detail and a generalization. you may deduce only similar to the detail: Just as the explicit detail an exposed blemish does not regenerate so too, any exposed blemishes and that do not regenerate
llm_translation: "To freedom he shall send him" - he returned and included. General, specific, and general. If you judge, only like the specific, just as the specific is explicit, a blemish that is in the open and does not return - so too, all blemishes that are in the open and do not return.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וּבָטֵל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר – אַף כֹּל מוּמִין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּבָטֵל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ. אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: תָּלַשׁ בִּזְקָנוֹ וְדִילְדֵּל בּוֹ עֶצֶם – עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶם לְחֵירוּת! ״לַחׇפְשִׁי יְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ״ – רִיבּוּיָא הוּא.
human_translation: If Just as with the explicit details, exposed blemishes and is prevented from its function and does not regenerate, so too, all exposed blemishes that do not regenerate and is prevented from its function. Why, is it taught pulled out his beard and dislocated a bone in the slave is emancipated by means of “To freedom shall he send him” is an amplification,
llm_translation: If what is the detail explicit - blemishes that are in the open and ceased from his work and does not return - also all blemishes that are in the open and do not return and ceased from his work. Why is it taught: "He shall pierce his ear with an awl, and he shall serve him forever" - a slave goes out with them to freedom! "To freedom he shall send him" - it is a compound expression.

hebrew_text: וְאִי רִיבּוּיָא הוּא, אֲפִילּוּ הִכָּהוּ עַל יָדוֹ וְצָמְתָה וְסוֹפָהּ לַחְזוֹר נָמֵי, אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: הִכָּהוּ עַל יָדוֹ וְצָמְתָה וְסוֹפָהּ לַחְזוֹר – אֵין עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהּ לְחֵירוּת? אִם כֵּן, שֵׁן וָעַיִן מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: But if it is an amplification, also even if he struck him on his hand and it withered, but would eventually regenerate. Why, is it taught he struck him on his hand and withered but will eventually regenerate, the slave is not emancipated by means of If so, what tooth and eye serve?
llm_translation: If it is a ribbuyah, even if he struck him on his hand and she became barren and returned, why is it taught: he struck him on his hand and she became barren and returned - is the slave not freed by it? If so, what benefit does a tooth or an eye bring to him?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוּלָּם, עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶם לְחֵירוּת, וְצָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: With regard to any of the slave is emancipated by means of and requires a bill of manumission the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Meir says: He does not require Rabbi Eliezer says: He requires Rabbi Tarfon says: He does not require Rabbi Akiva says: He requires
llm_translation: The Sages taught: In all of them, a slave goes out with them to freedom, and requires a bill of emancipation, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Meir says: It is not necessary. Rabbi Eliezer says: It is necessary. Rabbi Tarfon says: It is not necessary. Rabbi Akiva says: It is necessary.

hebrew_text: הַמַּכְרִיעִים לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בְּשֵׁן וָעַיִן, שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה זִכְּתָה לוֹ, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בִּשְׁאָר אֵבָרִים, הוֹאִיל וּקְנַס חֲכָמִים הוּא. קְנָס הוּא?! קְרָאֵי קָא דָרְשִׁינַן! אֶלָּא: הוֹאִיל וּמִדְרַשׁ חֲכָמִים הוּא.
human_translation: Those who decide before the Sages say Rabbi Tarfon’s statement appears with regard to a tooth and an eye, since the Torah benefitted him. And Rabbi Akiva’s statement with regard to other limbs, since it is a rabbinic penalty. Is it penalty? We interpret verses, Rather, since it is a rabbinic interpretation
llm_translation: Those who argue before the sages say: The words of Rabbi Tarfon are seen in tooth and eye, for the Torah has acquitted him, and the words of Rabbi Akiva in the other limbs, since it is a penalty imposed by the sages. A penalty?! It is the verses that we expound! Rather, since it is the interpretation of the sages.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? יָלֵיף ״שִׁילּוּחַ״ ״שִׁילּוּחַ״ מֵאִשָּׁה. מָה אִשָּׁה בִּשְׁטָר – אַף עֶבֶד נָמֵי בִּשְׁטָר. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי כְּתַב ״חׇפְשִׁי״ לְבַסּוֹף – כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתַב ״לַחׇפְשִׁי יְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ״ – הֲוָה לֵיהּ חׇפְשִׁי מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? He derives Sending away, Sending away, from a woman. Just as a woman by a document, so too, a slave also by a document. And Rabbi Meir if “freedom” was written at the end as you said, Now that it is written “to freedom shall he send him,” he is free from the beginning,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? He derives "shiluach" from "shiluach" of a woman. Just as a woman in a bill of divorce - so too a slave is considered in a bill of divorce. And Rabbi Meir: If he wrote "free" at the end - as you said. Now, if he wrote "he shall send him free" - he was free from the beginning.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִכָּהוּ עַל עֵינוֹ וְסִמְּאָהּ, עַל אׇזְנוֹ וְחֵרְשָׁהּ – עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת. נֶגֶד עֵינוֹ וְאֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה, כְּנֶגֶד אׇזְנוֹ וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ – אֵין עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת. אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְמֵימְרָא דְּקָלָא לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא?
human_translation: The Sages taught struck on his eye and blinded him, on his ear and deafened him, the slave is emancipated by means of these near his eye and he does not see, near his ear and he does not hear, the slave is not emancipated by means of these Rav Shemen said to Rav Ashi: Is this to say that a sound is nothing?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one struck his slave on the eye and blinded it, or on the ear and deafened it, the slave goes out free. If he struck him opposite his eye and he cannot see, or opposite his ear and he cannot hear, the slave does not go out free. Rav Shemen said to Rav Ashi: Is it not a case of "from a light thing" that it is not considered anything?

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: תַּרְנְגוֹל שֶׁהוֹשִׁיט רֹאשׁוֹ לַאֲוִיר כְּלִי זְכוּכִית, וְתָקַע בּוֹ וּשְׁבָרוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם נֶזֶק שָׁלֵם. וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב: סוּס שֶׁצָּנַף וַחֲמוֹר שֶׁנָּעַר, וְשָׁבְרוּ כֵּלִים בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת – מְשַׁלְּמִים חֲצִי נֶזֶק.
human_translation: But didn’t Rami bar Yeḥezkel teach a rooster that stuck its head into the airspace of a glass vessel and crowed into it and broke it, pays the full damage And Rav Yosef said Rav’s study hall say: a horse that neighed or a donkey that brayed and they broke vessels in the house, pay half the damage.
llm_translation: The Gemara taught: Rami bar Yeḥezkel raised a contradiction: A rooster that stretches out its head into the air like a glass vessel, and one strikes it and breaks it, he pays full damages. And Rav Yosef said, the Sages of the school of Rav say: If a horse kicks and a donkey bites, and they break vessels inside the house, they pay half damages.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי אָדָם, דְּכֵיוָן דְּבַר דַּעַת הוּא – אִיהוּ מְיבַעֵית נַפְשֵׁיהּ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַמַּבְעִית אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ – פָּטוּר מִדִּינֵי אָדָם וְחַיָּיב בְּדִינֵי שָׁמַיִם. כֵּיצַד? תָּקַע בְּאׇזְנוֹ וְחֵרְשׁוֹ – פָּטוּר, אֲחָזָהוּ וְתָקַע בְּאׇזְנוֹ וְחֵרְשׁוֹ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: said to him: A person is different, as, since he is competent it is he who frightened himself. As it is taught One who frightens another exempt according to human laws but liable according to the laws of Heaven. How so? one shouted into ear and deafened him, exempt. he held him and shouted into his ear and deafened him, liable
llm_translation: He said to him: "The case of a person is different, for since it involves a matter of understanding, he brings it upon himself." As it was taught: "One who brings harm to his fellow is exempt from human courts but liable in heavenly courts. How so? If he clapped his hand over his fellow's ear and deafened him - he is exempt; if he grasped him and then clapped his hand over his ear and deafened him - he is liable."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִכָּהוּ עַל עֵינוֹ וְכָהֲתָה, עַל שִׁינּוֹ וְנָדְדָה, אִם יָכוֹל לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן עַכְשָׁיו – אֵין עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת, וְאִם לָאו – עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת. תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה עֵינוֹ כְּהוּיָה וְסִמְּאָהּ, שִׁינּוֹ נְדוּדָה וְהִפִּילָהּ, אִם יָכוֹל לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן כְּבָר – עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught struck him on his eye and weakened on his tooth and loosened it, if he can use now, slave is not emancipated by means of them. And if no slave is emancipated by means of them. It is taught another where eye was weak and blinded it tooth was loose and knocked it out, if he able to use them before slave is emancipated by means of them, and if not, slave is not emancipated by means of them.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one struck his slave on the eye and blinded it, or on the tooth and knocked it out, if he can still make use of them now - the slave does not go out with them to freedom. But if not - the slave goes out with them to freedom. Another teaching: If his eye was already blind and darkened, his tooth was already knocked out and fallen, if he can still make use of them - the slave goes out with them to freedom, but if not - the slave does not go out with them to freedom.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נְהוֹרָא בְּרִיָּא וְהַשְׁתָּא נְהוֹרָא כְּחִישָׁא. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי נְהוֹרָא כְּחִישָׁא – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And necessary as, if taught us this first because at the outset vision was strong and now vision is weak. But here, where his vision was also weak at the outset, say not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear this before us, because initially the light of the creature was bright and now the light is dim. But here, because initially the light was also dim, say it is not so.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּסַמְּיַהּ לִגְמָרֵי, אֲבָל הָתָם, דְּלָא סַמְּיַהּ לִגְמָרֵי אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us this because he blinded entirely. But there, he did not blind entirely say no, necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear this, because it is a complete forgery, but there, where it is not a complete forgery, we might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה רַבּוֹ רוֹפֵא, וְאָמַר לוֹ לִכְחוֹל לוֹ עֵינוֹ וְסִמְּאָהּ, לַחְתּוֹר לוֹ שִׁינּוֹ וְהִפִּילָהּ – שִׂיחֵק בָּאָדוֹן, וְיָצָא לְחֵירוּת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: ״וְשִׁחֲתָהּ״ – עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּין לְשַׁחֲתָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught where his master was a doctor and said to him to paint his eye and blinded it to drill his tooth, and knocked it out, laughs at the master and is emancipated. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says and destroys it, unless intends to destroy it.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If his teacher was a doctor, and he said to him, "Go anoint your eye and put medicine on it," and he went and dug out his tooth and caused it to fall out - he has mocked the master, and he may go free. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "And he shall destroy it" - until he intends to destroy it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״וְשִׁחֲתָהּ״, מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי שֶׁהוֹשִׁיט יָדוֹ לִמְעֵי שִׁפְחָתוֹ וְסִימֵּא עוּבָּר שֶׁבְּמֵעֶיהָ – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְשִׁחֲתָהּ״ – עַד שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין לְשַׁחֲתָהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “and destroys it”? They require for that which is taught Rabbi Elazar says where stuck his hand into the womb of his maidservant and he blinded the fetus in her womb, he is exempt What is the reason As the verse states “and destroys it,” unless he intends to destroy
llm_translation: The sages, this "and he destroys it," what does he do with it? They asked them according to what was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: If he extended his hand to the fetus of his maidservant and it turned into a limb in her womb - he is exempt. What is the reason? As the verse says: "And he destroys it" - until he intends to destroy it.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? מִ״וְשִׁחֵת״ ״שִׁחֲתָהּ״ נָפְקָא. וְאִידַּךְ? ״שִׁחֵת״ ״שִׁחֲתָהּ״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And the other derived from And destroys, “destroys it.” And the other They do not expound “destroys” “destroys it,”
llm_translation: The other one? From "and he destroyed" "he destroyed" it came out. And the other one? "He destroyed" "he destroyed" is not expounded.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה עֵינוֹ סְמוּיָה, וַחֲטָטָהּ – עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת. מַאי טַעְמָא? מְחוּסָּר אֵבֶר הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: where eye was blind and removed it slave is emancipated by means of What is the reason He is lacking a limb,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: If one's eye was covered, and he peered out - a slave may go out with them for freedom. What is the reason? It is considered a lacking limb.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: תַּמּוּת וְזַכְרוּת בִּבְהֵמָה, וְאֵין תַּמּוּת וְזַכְרוּת בְּעוֹפוֹת.
human_translation: And the tanna taught: unblemished status, and male status to animal but unblemished status and male status not to bird
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Death and memory in a beast, and there is no death and memory in birds.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יָבְשָׁה גַּפָּהּ, נִקְטְעָה רַגְלָהּ, נֶחְטְטָה עֵינָהּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִן הָעוֹף״ – וְלֹא כׇּל הָעוֹף.
human_translation: might whose wing is dried, leg is severed, eye was removed, the verse states: from birds” but not all birds.
llm_translation: Could a dry tree, its trunk be severed, its root be uprooted? The Talmud teaches: "From the bird" - not all birds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: הָיְתָה לוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav says: had
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: "He had"

hebrew_text: יְתֶרֶת, וַחֲתָכָהּ – עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵירוּת. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּסְפֶּרֶת עַל גַּב הַיָּד.
human_translation: an extra and severed it, slave is emancipated by means of Rav Huna says: And this when can be counted along the back of the hand,
llm_translation: Yeteret, vachatakhah - eved yotze bahen lecheirut. Amar Rav Huna: vehu she'nispert al gav hayad. Yeteret and its cutting - a slave goes out with them to freedom. Rav Huna said: And this is when it is counted on the back of the hand.

hebrew_text: סָבֵי דְנָזוֹנְיָא לָא אֲתוֹ לְפִירְקֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא: זִיל צַנְּעִינְהוּ. אֲזַל אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן לְפִירְקָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי נֵיתֵי? דִּבְעֵינַן מִינֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא וְלָא פְּשַׁט לַן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי בְּעֵיתוּ מִינַּאי מִידֵּי וְלָא פָּשֵׁיטְנָא לְכוּ?
human_translation: The Elders of Nezonya did not come to Rav Ḥisda’s lecture. said to Rav Hamnuna: Go ostracize them [ tzaninhu ] went said to What is the reason that the rabbis did not come to the lecture? They said to him: Why should we come, as we asked him a matter and he did not resolve it for us. said to them: Have you asked me anything that I did not resolve for you?
llm_translation: Elders of Nazonaya did not come to the study hall of Rav Ḥisda, he said to Rav Hamnuna: Go and invite them. He went and said to them: Why did the Rabbis not come to the study hall? They said to him: Why should we come? We need his words and he does not explain to us. He said to them: Did you want words from me and I did not explain to you?

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ: עֶבֶד שֶׁסֵּרְסוֹ רַבּוֹ בַּבֵּצִים, מַהוּ? כְּמוּם שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה שְׁמָךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַמְנוּנָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָאו הַמְנוּנָא, אֶלָּא קַרְנוּנָא.
human_translation: They raised dilemma before him: a slave whose master castrates his testicles, what is Is that considered an exposed blemish or not? was not available to They said to him: What is your name? He said to them: Hamnuna. They said to him not Hamnuna, rather, Karnuna,
llm_translation: He asked of him: A slave whose master castrated him with a piece of glass, what is the ruling? Is it considered a visible blemish or not? It was not in his hands. They said to him: What is your name? He said to them: Hamnuna. They said to him: Not Hamnuna, but Karnuna.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַתְנִיתָא בְּעוֹ מִינָּךְ. דִּתְנַן: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה רָאשֵׁי אֵבָרִים שֶׁבָּאָדָם כּוּלָּם אֵין מְטַמְּאִין מִשּׁוּם מִחְיָה,
human_translation: came before Rav Ḥisda said to him: They raised before you a dilemma a baraita , As we learned twenty-four extremities in a person, none of which can become ritually impure due to unaffected skin.
llm_translation: He came before Rav Ḥisda. He said to him: Your Mishnah is according to your opinion. As we learned in a Mishnah: Twenty-four primary limbs in a person, all of them do not convey impurity due to a living creature.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵם: רָאשֵׁי אֶצְבָּעוֹת יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, וְרָאשֵׁי אׇזְנַיִם, וְרֹאשׁ הַחוֹטֶם, וְרֹאשׁ הַגְּוִיָּיה וְרָאשֵׁי דַדִּים שֶׁבָּאִשָּׁה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף שֶׁבָּאִישׁ. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: בְּכוּלָּם עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶם לְחֵירוּת. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַף הַסֵּירוּס. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: אַף הַלָּשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And these are The extremities of the fingers and toes, and the extremities of the ears, and the extremity of the nose, and the extremity of the penis, and the extremities of the nipples of a woman. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even of a man And it is taught in that regard A slave is emancipated for all of them. Rabbi says: Also, the castration Ben Azzai says: The tongue also
llm_translation: These are the principal parts: the tips of the fingers of the hands and feet, the tips of the ears, the tip of the nose, the tip of the foreskin, and the tips of the breasts of a woman. Rabbi Yehuda says: also included are those of a man. And it was taught about it: in all of them a slave goes out with them to freedom. Rabbi says: also the eunuch. Ben Azzai says: also the tongue.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר אַף הַסֵּירוּס. סֵירוּס דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא סֵירוּס דְּגִיד, הַיְינוּ גְּוִיָּיה. אֶלָּא לָאו: סֵירוּס דְּבֵיצִים?
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi says: Also castration. Castration of what? If we say castration of penis, this is a penis. Rather, is it not castration of the testicles?
llm_translation: Master said: Rabbi says also the eunuch. What is the eunuch? If you say the eunuch of a rooster, that is its castration. Rather, is it not the eunuch of eggs?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר אַף הַסֵּירוּס. וְרַבִּי, לָשׁוֹן לָא? וּרְמִינְהוּ: הֲרֵי מִי שֶׁהָיָה מַזֶּה וְנִתְּזָה הַזָּאָה עַל פִּיו, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: הִיזָּה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא הִיזָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi says: Also castration, And Rabbi tongue not And raises a contradiction where one was sprinkling and a sprinkling landed on his mouth, Rabbi says: He has sprinkled, And the Rabbis say: He has not sprinkled,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: Even the sirus. And Rabbi, is it a language? And they raised an objection: What about one who was defiled and the impurity dripped onto his mouth, Rabbi says: He should spit it out. And the sages say: He should not spit it out.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו עַל לְשׁוֹנוֹ? לֹא, עַל שְׂפָתָיו. עַל שְׂפָתָיו פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא זִימְנָא דְּחָלֵים שִׂפְוָתֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What, is it not on his tongue, No, on his lips. on his lips, isn’t it obvious lest you say times, he closes his lips teaches us
llm_translation: What is meant by "not on his tongue"? No, on his lips. On his lips is obvious! Lest you say, at a time when his lips are chapped, he is not heard by us.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: עַל לְשׁוֹנוֹ! וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: וְשֶׁנִּיטַּל רוֹב הַלָּשׁוֹן, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: רוֹב הַמְדַבֵּר שֶׁבִּלְשׁוֹנוֹ!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught on his tongue And it is further taught that most of his tongue was removed, Rabbi says: most of the part of his tongue he uses for speaking
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: "On his tongue!" And furthermore it was taught: "And if most of the language is removed, Rabbi says: Most of the speaker in his language!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: סֵירוּס, וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא לָשׁוֹן. בֶּן עַזַּאי אָמַר: לָשׁוֹן, אֲבָל סֵירוּס – לָא. וּמַאי ״אַף״? אַקַּמַּיְיתָא. אִי הָכִי, נַקְדְּמַהּ דְּבֶן עַזַּאי בְּרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi says: Castration and it is not necessary tongue Ben Azzai says: tongue but castration not. And what Also, to the first If so, of ben Azzai should be first,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi says: "Sirus," and not "Lashon." Ben Azzai says: "Lashon," but not "Sirus." And what is "af"? It is a rebuttal. If so, let Ben Azzai's statement be placed first!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא שַׁמְעַהּ לִדְרַבִּי וְקַבְעַהּ, וְשַׁמְעַהּ לִדְבֶן עַזַּאי וְתַנְיַ[הּ], וּמִשְׁנָה לֹא זָזָה מִמְּקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: tanna heard Rabbi and set it and he heard ben Azzai and taught And a mishna does not move from its place.
llm_translation: A Sage taught it to Rabbi, and she established it, and she heard it from the son of Azzai and repeated it, and she did not move from her place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּלָשׁוֹן לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה דְּגָלוּי הוּא אֵצֶל הַשֶּׁרֶץ. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בּוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהַאי נָמֵי בַּר נְגִיעָה הוּא.
human_translation: Ulla says: All concede with regard to a tongue in the matter of ritual impurity it is exposed with respect to a dead creeping animal What is the reason The Merciful One states: “Whom he touches” and this can also touch.
llm_translation: Ula said: Everyone agrees in the language of impurity that it is revealed in the case of a creeping thing. What is the reason? "That touches it," the Merciful One said, and this is indeed a case of direct contact.

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן טְבִילָה – כְּטָמוּן דָּמֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא: ״וְרָחַץ בְּשָׂרוֹ בְּמַיִם״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, מָה בְּשָׂרוֹ מֵאַבָּרַאי – אַף כֹּל מֵאַבָּרַאי.
human_translation: to the matter of immersion is considered concealed, What is the reason The Merciful One states: “And he shall immerse his flesh in water” Just as his flesh is on the outside, so too everything on the outside,
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of immersion - like hidden blood. What is the reason? "And he shall wash his flesh with water" - the Merciful One said, just as his flesh is from his limbs - so too all of his limbs.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן הַזָּאָה. רַבִּי מְדַמֵּי לַהּ לְטוּמְאָה, וְרַבָּנַן מְדַמּוּ לַהּ לִטְבִילָה.
human_translation: They disagreed only to the matter of sprinkling. Rabbi compares to impurity, and the Rabbis compare it to immersion,
llm_translation: They only argued regarding the matter of the coin. Rabbi likens it to impurity, and the Rabbis liken it to immersion.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא וְגוֹ׳״ רַבִּי סָבַר: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי וְחִטְּאוֹ״,
human_translation: And two of them disagree with regard to this verse: “And the pure person shall sprinkle upon the impure person Rabbi maintains “And the pure person shall sprinkle upon the impure person on the third day and on the seventh day, and he shall purify him.”
llm_translation: And their dispute in this verse is as follows: "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean, etc." Rabbi holds: "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day, and he shall be purified."

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״וְחִטְּאוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְרָחַץ בַּמַּיִם״.
human_translation: the Rabbis maintain “And he shall purify him on the seventh day and he shall wash his clothes and immerse in water.”
llm_translation: The sages hold: "And he shall defile himself on the seventh day, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, נְדַמְּיַיהּ לְטוּמְאָה? טׇהֳרָה מִטׇּהֳרָהּ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף. וְרַבִּי, נְדַמְּיַיהּ לִטְבִילָה? ״וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו״ – הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis as well, let us compare to impurity. One should derive purification from purification. And Rabbi let us compare to immersion. “and he shall wash his clothes” concludes that matter,
llm_translation: The sages, is it comparable to impurity? Purity from its purity was for him to say. And Rabbi, is it comparable to immersion? "And wash his clothes" - interrupted the matter.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי לְעִנְיַן טְבִילָה כְּטָמוּן דָּמֵי? וְהָאָמַר רָבִין אָמַר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשִׁפְחָה שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי שֶׁטָּבְלָה, וְעָלְתָה וְנִמְצָא עֶצֶם בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ, וְהִצְרִיכָהּ רַבִּי טְבִילָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: But Rabbi maintain to the matter of immersion is considered concealed? But doesn’t Ravin say Rav Adda says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: an incident involving a maidservant of the household of Rabbi who immersed and she ascended and a bone was found between her teeth, and Rabbi required her another immersion?
llm_translation: And Rabbi thought regarding the matter of immersion like hidden blood? And Rabin said in the name of Rav Ada who said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident with a maidservant of the house of Rabbi who immersed, and she came up and a bone was found between her teeth, and Rabbi required her to have another immersion.

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּבִיאַת מַיִם לָא בָּעֵינַן, מְקוֹם הָרָאוּי לָבוֹא בּוֹ מַיִם בָּעֵינַן,
human_translation: granted that we do not require immersion in water, we require a place fit for water to enter.
llm_translation: We do not require a wellspring of water, we require a place suitable for water to enter it.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי זֵירָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לְבִילָּה – אֵין בִּילָּה מְעַכֶּבֶת בּוֹ. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְבִילָּה – בִּילָּה מְעַכֶּבֶת בּוֹ.
human_translation: in accordance with that Rabbi Zeira. As Rabbi Zeira says any suitable for mingling mingling is not indispensable for it. But any not suitable for mingling, mingling is indispensable for it,
llm_translation: As Rabbi Zeira said: Rabbi Zeira said: Anyone fit for intercourse - intercourse does not impede him. And one who is not fit for intercourse - intercourse impedes him.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״וּמָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת וְנָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ – כּוּלָּן בַּבֵּיצִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: like tanna’im . “That whose stones are bruised, or crushed, or torn, or cut All are to testicles; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ketanna'ei: 'Uma'ukh ve-khatut ve-natukh ve-kharut' – kul'an ba-beitzim, divrei Rabbi Yehuda." English translation: "The Tannaim taught: 'Crushed, ground, peeled, and cut' – all of these are considered as being done with eggs, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: בַּבֵּיצִים וְלֹא בַּגִּיד? אֶלָּא: כּוּלָּן אַף בַּבֵּיצִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּם בַּגִּיד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״מָעוּךְ וְכָתוּת״ – אַף בַּבֵּיצִים, ״נָתוּק וְכָרוּת״ – בְּגִיד – אִין, בְּבֵיצִים – לָא.
human_translation: to the testicles and not to the penis? Rather, All of to the testicles also; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: All of them to the penis. Rabbi Yosei states “Bruised or crushed” to the testicles also. “broken or cut” on the penis, yes, on the testicles, no,
llm_translation: In eggs and not in the sinew? Rather, all of them even in eggs, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: all of them in the sinew. Rabbi Yosei says: "ma'uch and katush" - even in eggs, "natuk and karut" - in the sinew - no, in eggs - yes.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה נִקְנֵית בִּמְסִירָה, וְהַדַּקָּה בְּהַגְבָּהָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה נִקְנֵית בִּמְשִׁיכָה.
human_translation: A large domesticated animal is acquired by passing, And a small by lifting. the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: A small domesticated animal can be acquired by pulling
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An animal of large stature is acquired through handing over, and one of small stature through lifting up. These are the words of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Eliezer. The Sages say: An animal of small stature is acquired through pulling.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דָּרֵשׁ רַב בְּקִימְחוֹנְיָא: בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה נִקְנֵית בִּמְשִׁיכָה. אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְתַלְמִידֵי דְּרַב, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי אָמַר רַב בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה נִקְנֵית בִּמְשִׁיכָה? וְהָאֲנַן בִּמְסִירָה תְּנַן! וְרַב נָמֵי בִּמְסִירָה אָמַר, הֲדַר בֵּיהּ מֵהַהִיא? הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זוֹ וְזוֹ נִקְנֵית בִּמְשִׁיכָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: זוֹ וְזוֹ בְּהַגְבָּהָה.
human_translation: Rav taught in Kimḥonya: A large domesticated animal is acquired by pulling. Shmuel found Rav’s students said to them: Did Rav say that a large domesticated animal is acquired by pulling? But didn’t we learn by passing? And also Rav say by passing. he retract that he states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught And the Rabbis say: Both are acquired by pulling. Rabbi Shimon says: Both by lifting.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav expounded in Kimechonya: An expensive animal is acquired through pulling. Shmuel found this teaching to the disciples of Rav, he said to them: Who said that an expensive animal is acquired through pulling? But we learned through handing over! And Rav himself said through handing over, did he retract from that? This is what he said, as it was taught in a Baraita: And the Sages say: Both this and that are acquired through pulling. Rabbi Shimon says: Both this and that are acquired through lifting up.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, פִּיל לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּמֶּה יִקָּנֶה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בַּחֲלִיפִין. אִי נָמֵי בְּשׂוֹכֵר אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to If that is so, by what can an elephant be acquired, according to Rabbi Shimon? Abaye said to him: by the exchange, Alternatively, by renting its place
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Yosef: Rather from now, an elephant to Rabbi Shimon with what will he acquire? Said to him Abaye: With exchanges. Or also by renting out his place.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: מֵבִיא אַרְבָּעָה כֵּלִים וּמַנִּיחָן תַּחַת רַגְלָיו. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר – קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּסִימְטָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says brings four vessels and places them under feet, you learn from buyer’s vessels, are in the seller’s domain, the buyer acquires with what are we dealing here? in an alley [ simta ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: One brings four vessels and places them beneath his feet. Did you hear from it: his vessel that the buyer takes with the seller's permission - did the buyer acquire it? Here we are dealing with what? With a simta.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: בַּחֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: Alternatively, by bundles of vines.
llm_translation: Statement: "Iy namei: b'chaviley z'morot." Translation: "If he sleeps: in bundles of branches."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת – נִקְנִין בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה. שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת – אֵין נִקְנִין אֶלָּא בִּמְשִׁיכָה. נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה,
human_translation: Property that serves as a guarantee, can be acquired by money, by a document, or by possession that does not serve as a guarantee, can be acquired only by pulling. Property that does not serve as a guarantee can be acquired with property that serves as a guarantee by money, by a document, or by possession
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Properties that have heirs - are acquired with money, with a document, and with possession. Properties that do not have heirs - can only be acquired through pulling. Properties that do not have heirs can be acquired together with properties that have heirs with money, with a document, and with possession.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹקְקִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת לִישָּׁבַע עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And binds the property that serves as a guarantee, to take an oath concerning
llm_translation: And they appraise the assets that have inheritance to swear on them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּכֶסֶף מְנָלַן? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא: ״שָׂדוֹת בַּכֶּסֶף יִקְנוּ״. וְאֵימָא עַד דְּאִיכָּא שְׁטָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתוֹב בַּסֵּפֶר וְחָתוֹם״! אִי כְּתִיב ״יִקְנוּ״ לְבַסּוֹף – כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״יִקְנוּ״ מֵעִיקָּרָא, כֶּסֶף – קָנֵי, שְׁטָר – רְאָיָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: From where do we by money? Ḥizkiyya said the verse states: “They shall acquire fields with money” But say unless there is a document as it is written “And write a document and sign” If it were written: They shall acquire at the end as you said, Now that it is written “they shall acquire” at the beginning money effects acquisition document is merely a proof.
llm_translation: Gemar in silver wherefrom? Said Hezekiah: Said Scripture: "Fields with silver they shall acquire." But why not until there is a document, as it is written: "And it shall be written in a scroll and sealed"! If it is written "they shall acquire" at the end – as you said, now that it is written "they shall acquire" from the outset, silver – acquires, a document – merely evidence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין אֶת הַשְּׁטָר, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין אֶת הַשְּׁטָר – לֹא קָנָה. וְאִי פָּרֵישׁ – פָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: Rav says: They taught only in a place where they do not write documents; but in a place where they write documents one does not acquire And if he specified he has specified
llm_translation: Rav said: They only taught this in a place where they do not write the document, but in a place where they write the document - he did not acquire. And if he separated - he separated.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין כִּי זָבֵין אַרְעָא, אָמַר: אִי בָּעֵינָא בְּכַסְפָּא – אִיקְנֵי, אִי בָּעֵינָא בִּשְׁטָרָא – אִיקְנֵי. אִי בָּעֵינָא בְּכַסְפָּא – אִיקְנֵי, דְּאִי בָּעֵיתוּ לְמִיהְדַּר, לָא מָצִיתוּ הָדְרִיתוּ. וְאִי בָּעֵינָא בִּשְׁטָרָא – אִיקְנֵי, דְּאִי בָּעֵינָא לְמִיהְדַּר, הָדַרְנָא בִּי.
human_translation: like that which Rav Idi bar Avin When purchasing land, would say: If I wish by money, I will acquire if I wish by a document, I will acquire If I wish by money, I will acquire as, if you wish to retract you cannot retract And if I wish by a document, I will acquire as, if I wish to retract I can retract
llm_translation: The matter of Rav Idi bar Avin regarding the sale of land, he said: If I want with money - I will acquire, if I want with a document - I will acquire. If I want with money - I will acquire, for if they wanted to beautify, they did not beautify. And if I want with a document - I will acquire, for if they wanted to beautify, they beautified for me.

hebrew_text: וּבִשְׁטָר. מְנָלַן? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכָתוֹב בַּסֵּפֶר וְחָתוֹם וְהָעֵד עֵדִים״, וְהָאָמְרַתְּ שְׁטָר רְאָיָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא! אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא, ״וָאֶקַּח אֶת סֵפֶר הַמִּקְנָה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטַר מַתָּנָה, אֲבָל בְּמֶכֶר לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן לוֹ דָּמִים.
human_translation: by a document. From where do we If we say because it is written: “And write in a document and sign, and witnesses shall testify” but didn’t you say is merely a document of proof? Rather, from here: “And I took the deed of purchase” Shmuel said: taught only of a deed of a gift. But with regard to a sale, it does not effect acquisition until gives money.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in a document. From where do we derive this? If you wish, it can be derived from the fact that it is written: "And it is written in the scroll, sealed, and witnessed by witnesses," and the statement that a document is merely a form of evidence! Rather, it is derived from here: "And I took the deed of the purchase." Shmuel said: They only taught this regarding a gift document, but in a sale, one does not acquire until he gives money.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא: בִּשְׁטָר כֵּיצַד? כָּתַב לוֹ עַל הַנְּיָיר אוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶם שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, ״שָׂדִי מְכוּרָה לָךְ״, ״שָׂדִי נְתוּנָה לְךָ״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְכוּרָה וּנְתוּנָה. הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: בְּמוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ מִפְּנֵי רָעָתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raises an objection How by a document? wrote for him on paper or earthenware, even though is not worth one peruta : My field is sold to you, My field is given to you it is thereby sold or given. raised the objection and he resolved it: who sells his field due to its poor
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: With a document, how so? If he wrote it on paper or on pottery, even though they do not contain the value of a perutah, "my field is sold to you," "my field is given to you" – this constitutes a sale and a gift. He raises an objection against it and he resolves it: In the case of one who sells his field because of his wife's evil inclination.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בְּמַתָּנָה בִּיקֵּשׁ לִיתְּנָהּ לוֹ, וְלָמָּה כָּתַב לוֹ לְשׁוֹן מֶכֶר – כְּדֵי לְיַפּוֹת אֶת כּוֹחוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: of a gift wished to give And why does he write for him language of a sale? He does it in order to enhance his power.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: In a gift, he sought to give it to him, and why did he write the language of sale - in order to enhance his power.

hebrew_text: וּבַחֲזָקָה. מְנָלַן? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּשְׁבוּ בְּעָרֵיכֶם אֲשֶׁר תְּפַשְׂתֶּם״, בַּמֶּה תְּפַשְׂתֶּם – בִּישִׁיבָה. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״וִירִשְׁתֶּם אֹתָהּ וִישַׁבְתֶּם בָּהּ״, בַּמֶּה יְרַשְׁתֶּם – בִּישִׁיבָה.
human_translation: by possession From where do we Ḥizkiyya said the verse states: “And dwell in your cities that you have taken” In what have you taken by dwelling, the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “And you shall possess it and dwell there” How have you possessed by dwelling
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And with strength. From where do we derive this? Chizkiyah said: The verse says, 'And you shall dwell in your cities that I have given you,' in what manner have you been given? - Through sitting. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: 'And you shall inherit it and dwell in it,' in what manner have you inherited? - Through sitting."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת אֵין נִקְנִין אֶלָּא בִּמְשִׁיכָה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר לַעֲמִיתֶךָ אוֹ קָנֹה מִיַּד עֲמִיתֶךָ״ – דָּבָר הַנִּקְנֶה מִיָּד לְיָד.
human_translation: that does not serve as a guarantee can be acquired only by pulling. From where do we As it is written: “And if you sell any item to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor’s hand” an item that is acquired from hand to hand,
llm_translation: "And they have no inheritance, they are acquired only through pulling. From where do we derive this? As it is written: 'And if you sell anything to your neighbor or acquire from your neighbor's hand' - a matter that is acquired hand to hand."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? תַּנָּא תַּקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says by Torah law money effects acquisition what can be said? tanna teaches a rabbinic ordinance,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan who said: "Words of Torah acquire," what is there to say? A Tanna taught: The enactment of the Rabbis is small.

hebrew_text: נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיִּתֵּן לָהֶם אֲבִיהֶם מַתָּנוֹת וְגוֹ׳ עִם עָרֵי מְצֻרוֹת בִּיהוּדָה״.
human_translation: property that does not serve as a guarantee, From where is this matter Ḥizkiyya said the verse states: “And their father gave them gifts, with fortified cities in Judah”
llm_translation: Properties that have no heirs. Enjoyable things? Hezekiah said: As the verse says: "And their father gave them many gifts, along with cities of refuge in Judah."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים, אוֹ לָא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תָּא שְׁמַע: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: קַרְקַע כׇּל שֶׁהוּא חַיֶּיבֶת בַּפֵּאָה, וּבַבִּכּוּרִים,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before we require piled or not? Rav Yosef said: Come hear Rabbi Akiva says: any amount of land is obligated in pe’a and in first fruits,
llm_translation: The question was asked: Do we require a congregation or not? Rav Yosef said: Come and hear: Rabbi Akiva says: Any ground that is obligated in Pe'ah and in first fruits,

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתּוֹב עָלֶיהָ פְּרוֹסְבּוּל, וְלִקְנוֹת עִמָּהּ נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים, כׇּל שֶׁהוּא לְמַאי חֲזֵי?
human_translation: and can write a document that prevents the Sabbatical Year from abrogating an outstanding debt [ prosbol ] for it and can acquire property that does not serve as a guarantee with it. And if you say we require piled for what is of any size fit?
llm_translation: To write upon it a prosbul, and to acquire with her properties that have no succession. And if you say we require a public, what does he see for?

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּומַאּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר בִּיסְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּעַץ בָּהּ מַחַט. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: קְבַסְתַּן! אִיכְּפַל תַּנָּא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן מַחַט? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּלָא תְּלָה בָּהּ מַרְגָּנִיתָא דְּשָׁוְויָא אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Bisna interpreted it before Rav Yosef For example, if one stuck a needle Rav Yosef said to him: You disgust me [ kevastan ]. Did the tanna go to all that trouble just to teach us a needle Rav Ashi said: Who shall say to us he did not hang a pearl worth one thousand dinars on
llm_translation: The interpreter, Rav Shmuel bar Bisna, stood before Rav Yosef and said: For example, if a needle was stuck in it. Rav Yosef said to him: You are mistaken! How can the Mishnah teach us about a needle? Rav Ashe said: Who should say to us that it did not hang a pearl worth a thousand gold coins in it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּמָדוֹנִי אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ מִטַּלְטְלִין הַרְבֵּה, וּבִיקֵּשׁ לִיתְּנָם בְּמַתָּנָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה עַד שֶׁיַּקְנֵם עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. מָה עָשָׂה? הָלַךְ וְלָקַח בֵּית סֶלַע סָמוּךְ לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְאָמַר: ״צְפוֹנִי זֶה לִפְלוֹנִי, וְעִמּוֹ מֵאָה צֹאן וּמֵאָה חָבִיּוֹת״, וָמֵת, וְקִיְּימוּ אֶת דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: Come hear, Rabbi Elazar said: an incident involving a certain Madonite Madoni ] who was in Jerusalem, as he had a great deal movable property and wished to give it as a gift. said to him: has no remedy but to transfer them by means of land. What did he do? He went and acquired a beit sela , near Jerusalem and said: This northern to so-and-so, and with it one hundred sheep and one hundred barrels. And died, and fulfilled his statement
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Elazar said: There was an incident with a certain creditor in Jerusalem who had many promissory notes, and he sought to transfer them as a gift. They said to him: He does not have a valid acquisition until he acquires them upon land. What did he do? He went and took a rock in the vicinity of Jerusalem, and said: "This is a deposit for so-and-so, along with him are one hundred sheep and one hundred barrels of wine," and he died, and his words were upheld.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים בָּהּ, בֵּית סֶלַע לְמַאי חֲזֵי? מִי סָבְרַתְּ בֵּית סֶלַע, סֶלַע מַמָּשׁ? מַאי סֶלַע – דִּנְפִישׁ טוּבָא. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ סֶלַע – דִּקְשֵׁי כְּסֶלַע.
human_translation: And if you say we require piled upon it, for what is a beit sela fit? Do you maintain a beit sela actually a sela what sela ? that very large why did they call it sela ? that hard as rock [ sela ].
llm_translation: "If you say we require public gatherings in it, for what purpose do we see the House of Rock? Who thinks the House of Rock is an actual rock? What is a rock? - A very good stone. And why is it called a rock? Because it is as hard as a rock."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁחָלָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם – כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: בָּרִיא הָיָה – כְּרַבָּנַן,
human_translation: Come hear as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: an incident involving a certain person who became sick in Jerusalem, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, And some say he was healthy, in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident with a certain man who fell ill in Jerusalem - like Rabbi Eliezer. And some say: he was healthy - like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ מִטַּלְטְלִין הַרְבֵּה וּבִיקֵּשׁ לִיתְּנָם בְּמַתָּנָה, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה עַד שֶׁיַּקְנֵם עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. מָה עָשָׂה? הָלַךְ וְלָקַח בֵּית רוֹבַע סָמוּךְ לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְאָמַר: ״טֶפַח עַל טֶפַח לִפְלוֹנִי וְעִמּוֹ מֵאָה צֹאן וּמֵאָה חָבִיּוֹת״, וָמֵת, וְקִיְּימוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת דְּבָרָיו. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים, טֶפַח עַל טֶפַח לְמַאי חֲזֵי?
human_translation: had a great deal movable property and he wished to give it as a gift. said to him: has no remedy but to transfer by means of land. What did he do? He went and acquired a beit rova near Jerusalem and said: This square handbreadth to so-and-so, and with it one hundred sheep and one hundred barrels. And he died, and the Sages fulfilled his statement. And if you say we require piled for what is a square handbreadth fit?
llm_translation: The text: "That he had many movable properties and sought to transfer them as a gift, they said to him: He does not acquire them until he acquires them upon the ground. What did he do? He went and took a house in the vicinity of Jerusalem, and said: 'A handbreadth upon a handbreadth to so-and-so, along with him a hundred sheep and a hundred barrels,' and he died, and the sages upheld his words. And if you say we require a public declaration, what is the significance of 'a handbreadth upon a handbreadth'?"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, לִדְמֵי. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מֵאָה צֹאן וּמֵאָה חָבִיּוֹת מַמָּשׁ, נַיקְנִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with money, So too, it is reasonable As, if it enters your mind an actual one hundred sheep and one hundred barrels, let him transfer them to through exchange.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? With blood. This is what is meant: if it were to enter your mind that a hundred sheep and a hundred actual barrels of wine were stolen, one should acquire them back with substitutes.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, לִדְמֵי? נַיקְנִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בִּמְשִׁיכָה! אֶלָּא: דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לִמְקַבֵּל מַתָּנָה. הָכִי נָמֵי, דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לִמְקַבֵּל מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: Rather, what to money, Let him transfer it through pulling. Rather, that the recipient of this gift was not So too, that the recipient of the gift was not
llm_translation: And rather what, for what? We acquire it through pulling! Rather: because he does not want to receive a gift. So it is said, because he does not want to receive a gift.

hebrew_text: וְנִיזְכִּינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ אַגַּב אַחֵר? לָא סָמְכָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ, סָבַר שָׁמֵיט וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ.
human_translation: But let him transfer it to him by means of another did not rely feared seize it and consume it
llm_translation: And they were careful with him because of another? His opinion did not rely, he thought he would release and feed them.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי ״אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה״? הָכִי קָאָמַר: לְמַאי דְּלָא סָמְכָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ – אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה עַד שֶׁיַּקְנֵם עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע.
human_translation: Rather, what He has no remedy? this is what saying with that he does not rely has no remedy but to transfer by means of land.
llm_translation: And rather what "he has no acquisition"? Thus he is saying: for what his mind did not rely on - he has no acquisition until he acquires them upon the ground.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּזְקֵנִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּאִים בִּסְפִינָה, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַזְּקֵנִים: עִישּׂוּר שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לָמוֹד
human_translation: Come hear an incident involving Rabban Gamliel and Elders who were traveling on a ship. Rabban Gamliel said to the Elders: One-tenth that I will measure out in the future
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was an incident involving Rabban Gamliel and elders who were coming on a ship. Rabban Gamliel said to the elders: "The Isur that I am destined to learn."

hebrew_text: נָתוּן לוֹ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ, וּמְקוֹמוֹ מוּשְׂכָּר לוֹ. וְעִישּׂוּר אַחֵר שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לָמוֹד נָתוּן לוֹ לַעֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּזְכֶּה בּוֹ לַעֲנִיִּים, וּמְקוֹמוֹ מוּשְׂכָּר לוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים בַּהּ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לַיטְרְחִינְהוּ.
human_translation: is given to Yehoshua and the place is rented to him And another tenth that I will measure out in the future is given to Akiva ben Yosef so that he will acquire it on behalf of the poor, and its place is rented to him. learn from here we require piled on It is different there, so as not to trouble
llm_translation: Given to him to Yehoshua, and his place is rented to him. And another gift that I am destined to learn, given to Akiva ben Yosef, in order that he may merit the poor, and his place is rented to him. Listen to this from it, we require publicizing it! It is different there, so that they will not be discouraged.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רָבָא בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: שְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת הֵן: ״זְכוּ בְּשָׂדֶה זוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי וְכִתְבוּ לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁטָר״ – חוֹזֵר בַּשְּׁטָר, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר בַּשָּׂדֶה. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּכְתְּבוּ לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁטָר״ – חוֹזֵר בֵּין בַּשְּׁטָר בֵּין בַּשָּׂדֶה.
human_translation: Come hear as Rava bar Yitzḥak says Rav says: There are two documents. Acquire this field for so-and-so and write the document for him he can retract with regard to the document. But he cannot retract with regard to the field, on the condition that you write him a document, he can retract both with regard to the document and with regard to the field,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rava son of Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: There are two documents: "Acquire this field for so-and-so and write for him the document" - he returns with the document, but does not return with the field. "On the condition that you write for him the document" - he returns whether with the document or with the field.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁטָרוֹת הֵן. תְּרֵי – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן, אִידַּךְ: אִם קָדַם מוֹכֵר וְכָתַב לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁטָר, כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: כּוֹתְבִים שְׁטָר לַמּוֹכֵר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹקֵחַ עִמּוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֶחְזִיק עִמּוֹ בַּקַּרְקַע – נִקְנָה שְׁטָר בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav Huna There are three documents. Two those that we said, the other If the seller first wrote him the document, as we learned write a deed for the seller even if the purchaser is not with him once takes possession of the land from him, the document is acquired wherever it is,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin said, Rav Huna said: There are three types of documents. Two - as we said, and the other: If the seller preceded and wrote a document for him, like that which we learned: One writes a document for the seller even though he does not take it with him. Once he has acquired land with it - the document is valid everywhere he is.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָא בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים בַּהּ! שָׁאנֵי שְׁטָר דְּאַפְסֵירָא דְאַרְעָא הוּא.
human_translation: learn from we do not require piled on it, A document is different, as it is the bridle of the land.
llm_translation: Listen, we do not require a congregation for it! This is different from a document that diminishes the land.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: זוֹ הִיא שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אַחְרָיוּת בְּכֶסֶף בִּשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָא בָּעֵינַן צְבוּרִים בָּהּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But it was taught concerning this This is what we learned Property that does not serve as a guarantee can be acquired with property that serves as a guarantee by money, by a document, or by possession learn from we do not require piled on learn from
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: This is what we learned: Assets that have no succession can be acquired together with assets that do have succession, with money, with a document, and with possession! Learn from it: We do not require the consent of the public in this matter, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִי בָּעֵינַן ״אַגַּב״ אוֹ לָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּקָתָנֵי כֹּל הָנֵי, וְלָא קָתָנֵי אַגַּב. וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, ״קְנִי״ מִי קָתָנֵי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Do we require by means of or not? Come hear, as teach all these and do not teach By means of. And according to your reasoning, is it taught Acquire
llm_translation: He asked them: Do we require "agav" or not? Come and hear, for it was taught all these, and it did not teach "agav." And according to your reasoning, does it teach "k'ni"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, עַד דְּאָמַר ״קְנִי״? הָכָא נָמֵי, עַד דַּאֲמַר ״אַגַּב״. וְהִלְכְתָא: צְבוּרִים – לָא בָּעֵינַן, ״אַגַּב״ וּ״קְנִי״ – בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Rather, unless he says: Acquire Here too, unless he says: By means of. And the halakha we do not require piled we require by means of and Acquire
llm_translation: Rather, until he said "k'ni"? Here too, until he said "agav." And the halakha: we do not require pairs, "agav" and "k'ni" - we require.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׂדֶה בְּמֶכֶר וּמְטַלְטְלִין בְּמַתָּנָה מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: עִישּׂוּר שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לָמוֹד, נָתוּן לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ וּמְקוֹמוֹ מוּשְׂכָּר לוֹ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ!
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a field in a sale and movable property as a gift, what is Come hear One-tenth that I will measure out in the future is given to Yehoshua, and its place is rented to him. Learn from this
llm_translation: He asked them: A field in a sale and movable property in a gift, what is the law? Come and hear: A gift that I am destined to learn, given to Joshua and its place is rented to him, hear from it!

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׂדֶה לְאֶחָד, וּמְטַלְטְלִין לְאַחֵר מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: עִישּׂוּר שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לָמוֹד נָתוּן לַעֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּזְכֶּה בּוֹ לַעֲנִיִּים וּמְקוֹמוֹ מוּשְׂכָּר לוֹ.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before a field to one and movable property to another, what is Come hear One-tenth that I will measure out in the future is given to Akiva ben Yosef so that he will acquire it on behalf of the poor, and its place is rented to him.
llm_translation: The Gemara asked: If one designates a field for one person, and then transfers it to another, what is the law? Come and hear: A gift that I am destined to learn, was given to Akiva ben Yosef, so that he may merit through it the poor, and its place will be rewarded to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״מוּשְׂכָּר״ – מוּשְׂכָּר לְמַעֲשֵׂר. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּיַד עֲנִיִּים הֲוָה.
human_translation: What Rented, rented for tithe. And if you wish, say Rabbi Akiva is different, he was like the hand of the poor.
llm_translation: "What is 'muskar' - muskar for ma'aser. And if you wish, say: It is different with Rabbi Akiva, for he was a poor man's hand."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּתַן דְּמֵי כוּלָּן, אֲבָל לֹא נָתַן דְּמֵי כוּלָּן – לֹא קָנָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rava says: taught only when he gives all the money But he did not give the money all he acquires only corresponding to the money
llm_translation: Rava said: They only taught that when he gave all their value, but if he did not give all their value - he did not acquire except corresponding to his coins.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: יָפֶה כֹּחַ הַכֶּסֶף מִכֹּחַ הַשְּׁטָר, וְכֹחַ הַשְּׁטָר מִכֹּחַ הַכֶּסֶף. יָפֶה כֹּחַ הַכֶּסֶף – שֶׁהַכֶּסֶף פּוֹדִין בּוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּשְׁטָר. וְיָפֶה כֹּחַ הַשְּׁטָר – שֶׁהַשְּׁטָר מוֹצִיא בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּכֶסֶף.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava: The power of money is greater than the power of a document and the power of a document than the power of money The power of money is greater that money redeem consecrated property and second tithe, which is not with a document. And the power of a document is greater as a document releases a Jewish woman, which is not with money.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: The power of silver is preferable to the power of a promissory note, and the power of a promissory note is preferable to the power of silver. The power of silver is preferable - for with silver, one can redeem consecrated items and the second tithe, which is not the case with a promissory note. And the power of a promissory note is preferable - for a promissory note can effect a divorce for a daughter of Israel, which is not the case with silver.

hebrew_text: וְיָפֶה כֹּחַ שְׁנֵיהֶם מִכֹּחַ חֲזָקָה, וְכֹחַ חֲזָקָה מִכֹּחַ שְׁנֵיהֶם. יָפֶה כֹּחַ שְׁנֵיהֶם – שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם קוֹנִים בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּחֲזָקָה. יָפֶה כֹּחַ חֲזָקָה – שֶׁחֲזָקָה מָכַר לוֹ עֶשֶׂר שָׂדוֹת בְּעֶשֶׂר מְדִינוֹת, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בְּאַחַת מֵהֶם – קְנָאָם כּוּלָּם.
human_translation: And the power of each, is greater than taking possession, and the power of taking possession is greater than each of them. power of each of them is greater as each of them effects acquisition of a Hebrew slave, which is not for taking possession The power of taking possession is greater as taking possession, sold ten fields in ten countries, once takes possession of one of he acquires all of them.
llm_translation: And the strength of both of them is more than the strength of one, and the strength of one is more than the strength of both of them. The strength of both of them - that both of them acquire an Hebrew slave, which is not the case with the strength. The strength of one - that he sold to him ten fields in ten provinces, once he acquired one of them - he acquires all of them.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁנָּתַן לוֹ דְּמֵי כוּלָּן, אֲבָל לֹא נָתַן לוֹ דְּמֵי כוּלָּן – לֹא קָנָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד מְעוֹתָיו. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מָכַר לוֹ עֶשֶׂר שָׂדוֹת בְּעֶשֶׂר מְדִינוֹת, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן – קָנָה אֶת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? when he gave him money for all But he did not give him money for all of it, he acquires only corresponding to money he supports Shmuel, as Shmuel says: one sold ten fields in ten countries, once he takes possession of one of them he acquires all of them.
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? - That he was given the money for all of them, but he was not given the money for all of them - he only acquires against his coins. This supports Shmuel, for Shmuel said: If he sold him ten fields in ten provinces, once he took hold of one of them - he acquires all of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: תֵּדַע, שֶׁאִילּוּ מָסַר לוֹ עֶשֶׂר בְּהֵמוֹת בְּאַפְסָר אֶחָד וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״קְנֵי״ – מִי לָא קָנֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם אִיגּוּדוֹ בְּיָדוֹ, הָכָא אֵין אִיגּוּדוֹ בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: Know as, if he handed him ten animals with one bridle [ afsar ] and said to him: Acquire doesn’t he acquire said to Is it comparable? There, its bond, is in his hand. Here, its bond is not in his hand.
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: Know that if one were to give him ten animals for sale, lacking one, and he said to him, "Acquire," who has acquired? He said to him: Who is similar? There, his bundle is in his hand, here, his bundle is not in his hand.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: תֵּדַע דְּלָא קָנֵי, אִילּוּ מָסַר לוֹ עֶשֶׂר בְּהֵמוֹת בְּאַפְסָר אֶחָד וְאָמַר לוֹ ״זוֹ קְנֵי״ – מִי קָנֵי?
human_translation: There are who say Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: Know that he does not acquire if one passed to him ten animals with one bridle and said to him: Acquire this one, does he acquire
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: Know that he did not acquire, if he gave him ten animals for one coin and said to him, "This one acquires" - who acquires?

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם גּוּפִים מוּחְלָקִים, הָכָא סַדָּנָא דְאַרְעָא חַד הוּא.
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, separate entities, Here, the mass of the earth is one.
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, bodies are divided, here, the foundation of the earth is one.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹקְקִים אֶת הַנְּכָסִים וְכוּ׳. אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִנַּיִן לְגִלְגּוּל שְׁבוּעָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה?
human_translation: And binds the property Ulla says: From where from the Torah that the extension of an oath,
llm_translation: "And they are assessing the assets, etc." Ulla said: From where do we derive the concept of the cycle of seven years from the Torah?

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״, וּתְנַן: עַל מָה הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״אָמֵן אָמֵן״? ״אָמֵן״ עַל הָאָלָה, ״אָמֵן״ עַל ״הַשְּׁבוּעָה״. ״אָמֵן״ אִם מֵאִישׁ זֶה, ״אָמֵן״ אִם מֵאִישׁ אַחֵר. ״אָמֵן״ שֶׁלֹּא סָטִיתִי אֲרוּסָה וּנְשׂוּאָה וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה.
human_translation: As it is stated “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen” and we learned Concerning what does she say Amen, amen? amen on the curse, amen on the oath, Amen with this man amen with another man. Amen that I did not stray betrothed nor married, nor as a widow waiting for my yavam nor married
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And the woman shall say, 'Amen, Amen,'" and we learned in a Mishnah: For what is she saying "Amen, Amen"? "Amen" for the curse, "Amen" for the oath. "Amen" if from this man, "Amen" if from another man. "Amen" that I have not strayed, whether betrothed, married, awaiting levirate marriage, or married.

hebrew_text: הַאי אֲרוּסָה הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקַנִּי לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, וְקָא מַשְׁקֵי לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, וְהָתְנַן אֲרוּסָה וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם לֹא שׁוֹתוֹת וְלֹא נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָּה, מַאי טַעְמָא – ״תַּחַת אִישֵׁךְ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this betrothed woman?
