If we say that he warned her when she was betrothed, and he gives her to drink when she is betrothed, but didn’t we learn a betrothed woman and a widow waiting for her yavam they neither drink nor collect marriage contracts. What is the reason The Merciful One states under your husband” and not
llm_translation: This betrothed woman, what is the status of her blood-money? If you say that he acquired her when she was betrothed, and he gives her to drink while she is betrothed, and we learned: A betrothed woman who is also a yevamah, they do not give her to drink nor do they perform the levirate marriage with her as it is written, what is the reason? "Instead of your husband" the Merciful One said, and there is none.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקַנִּי לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, וְנִסְתְּרָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, וְקָא מַשְׁקֵי לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא נְשׂוּאָה,
human_translation: Rather, that he warned her when she was betrothed, and she secluded herself when she was betrothed, and he gave her to drink when she was married.
llm_translation: Rather, he acquires her when she is betrothed, and she is hidden when she is betrothed, and he is giving her to drink when she is married.

hebrew_text: מִי בָּדְקִי לַהּ מַיָּא? ״וְנִקָּה הָאִישׁ מֵעָוֹן״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָאִישׁ מְנוּקֶּה מֵעָוֹן – מַיִם בּוֹדְקִים אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֵין אִישׁ מְנוּקֶּה מֵעָוֹן – אֵין הַמַּיִם בּוֹדְקִים אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: does the water examine her the Merciful One state: “And the man shall be clear from iniquity” When the man is clear from iniquity, the water examines his wife; the man is not clear from iniquity the water does not examine his wife.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who checks her waters? "And the man shall be clear from iniquity" - the Merciful One said, when the man is clear from iniquity, they check his wife with water; when the man is not clear from iniquity, they do not check his wife with water.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי גִלְגּוּל!
human_translation: Rather, by means of an extension.
llm_translation: Rather, through reincarnation!

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן סוֹטָה, דְּאִיסּוּרָא, מָמוֹנָא מְנָלַן? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה סוֹטָה
human_translation: We found a sota , which a prohibition. From where do we monetary The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught a fortiori And just as a sota ,
llm_translation: I found a Sotah, that the prohibition, money from where? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: a fortiori argument: And what is a Sotah

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה לְהִתָּבַע בְּעֵד אֶחָד – מְגַלְגְּלִין, מָמוֹן, שֶׁנִּיתָּן לְהִתָּבַע בְּעֵד אֶחָד – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמְגַלְגְּלִין?
human_translation: where cannot be imposed by one witness, one can extend is it not logical money, where can be imposed by one witness, one can extend
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That which is not given to be claimed by one witness - Megalgelin, money, that which is given to be claimed by one witness - is it not the law that we Megalgelin?"

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן בְּוַדַּאי, סָפֵק מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We found in a definite From where do we uncertain
llm_translation: We have found in the case of Vidai, where is the doubt from?

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֶמְרָה שְׁבוּעָה בַּחוּץ, וְנֶאֶמְרָה שְׁבוּעָה בִּפְנִים. מָה שְׁבוּעָה הָאֲמוּרָה בִּפְנִים – עָשָׂה בָּהּ סָפֵק כְּוַדַּאי, אַף שְׁבוּעָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּחוּץ – עָשָׂה בָּהּ סָפֵק כְּוַדַּאי.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: The Torah states an external oath, and it states an internal oath, Just as with regard to an oath stated inside rendered uncertainty like certainty, so too, with regard to an oath stated outside rendered uncertainty like certainty,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: A vow is stated outside the Temple, and a vow is stated inside the Temple. Just as the vow that is stated inside the Temple – if one made it with uncertainty, it is certainly valid, so too the vow that is stated outside the Temple – if one made it with uncertainty, it is certainly valid.

hebrew_text: עַד הֵיכָן גִּלְגּוּל שְׁבוּעָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״הִישָּׁבַע לִי שֶׁאֵין עַבְדִּי אַתָּה״.
human_translation: Until where extension of an oath Rav Yehuda said Rav said: that can say to Take an oath to me that you are not my slave.
llm_translation: Until where is the cycle of oaths? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: For he said to him, "Swear to me that you are not my servant."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שַׁמּוֹתֵי מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ! דְּתַנְיָא: הַקּוֹרֵא לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״עֶבֶד״ – יְהֵא בְּנִידּוּי. ״מַמְזֵר״ – סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים. ״רָשָׁע״ – יוֹרֵד עִמּוֹ לְחַיָּיו!
human_translation: ostracizes one as it is taught One who calls another a slave shall be ostracized. a mamzer incurs the forty a wicked person harass him his life.
llm_translation: That one, we designate his names for him! As it was taught: One who calls his fellow "slave" - should be excommunicated. "Mamzer" - absorbs the forty. "Wicked" - descends with him to his life!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הִישָּׁבַע לִי שֶׁלֹּא נִמְכַּרְתָּ לִי בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. הַאי טַעַנְתָּא מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא, מָמוֹנָא אִית לֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ! רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי גּוּפוֹ קָנוּי.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Take an oath to me that you were not sold to me as a Hebrew slave. is a proper claim there is money to him Rava to his reasoning, as Rava says: The Hebrew slave himself is acquired
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "He who swears to me that you were not sold to me as a Hebrew slave." This claim is superior, for he has money to pay with! Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said: "A Hebrew slave is acquired by his body."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ קַרְקַע! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: קַרְקַע הוּא דְּעָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי דִּמְזַבְּנִי בְּצִינְעָא, אִם אִיתָא דְּזַבֵּין – לֵית לֵיהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: If so, this is land, lest you say: It is land that people are likely to sell privately, if it is so that sold not publicity,
llm_translation: If so, that is the same as the ground! What might you say: It is the ground that people walk on that is sold in the market, if it comes to be sold - it does not have a voice.

hebrew_text: הַאי, אִם אִיתָא דְּזַבֵּין – קָלָא אִית לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: this if it is so that he purchased publicity. teaches us
llm_translation: This, if it comes that they sell - a voice there is to it, it is teaching to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַנַּעֲשֶׂה דָּמִים בְּאַחֵר, כֵּיוָן שֶׁזָּכָה זֶה – נִתְחַיֵּיב זֶה בַּחֲלִיפָיו. כֵּיצַד? הֶחְלִיף שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר, כֵּיוָן שֶׁזָּכָה זֶה – נִתְחַיֵּיב זֶה בַּחֲלִיפָיו.
human_translation: all used as monetary for another once one acquires this is obligated exchanged for it. How so? one exchanges an ox for a cow, or a donkey for an ox, once this acquires is obligated exchanged for it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anyone who causes blood to be shed in another, once this one has acquired the animal, this one is liable for its replacement. How so? If one exchanged an ox for a cow or a donkey for an ox, once this one has acquired the animal, this one is liable for its replacement.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ חֲלִיפִין מַאי נִיהוּ? – מַטְבֵּעַ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הַנִּישּׁוֹם דָּמִים בְּאַחֵר,
human_translation: What is exchange a coin, learn from a coin can effect exchange, Rav Yehuda said: this is what is saying: all that appraised as monetary for another
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemar chalifin, mai nihu?" - Matbea, shema minah: Matbea na'aseh chalifin? Amar Rav Yehuda: Hakhi ka'amar: Kol hanishom damim be'acher.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁזָּכָה זֶה נִתְחַיֵּיב בַּחֲלִיפִין. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: כֵּיצַד? הֶחְלִיף שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: once one acquires this is obligated exchanged for it. is also precise, as it teaches How so? one exchanges an ox for a cow, or a donkey for an ox, Learn from
llm_translation: Once he has merited, this one is obligated in the exchange. Precisely stated, as it is taught: How so? He exchanged an ox for a cow or a donkey for an ox. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּמַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין, מַאי כֵּיצַד? הָכִי קָאָמַר: פֵּירוֹת נָמֵי עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין. כֵּיצַד? הֶחְלִיף בְּשַׂר שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ בְּשַׂר חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר, כֵּיוָן שֶׁזָּכָה זֶה נִתְחַיֵּיב בַּחֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: And to what entered our minds initially, that a coin effects exchange, what How so, this is what is saying: produce can also effect exchange. How so? one exchanged meat of an ox for a cow, or meat of a donkey for an ox, once this acquires is obligated exchanged
llm_translation: And for what purpose do we bring forth knowledge from the outset that an exchange is made? What is the manner? This is what he is saying: Fruits also perform exchanges. How so? He exchanged the flesh of an ox for that of a cow, or the flesh of a donkey for that of an ox. Once one has acquired, he becomes liable for the exchange.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, דְּאָמַר: פֵּירוֹת עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין. אֶלָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן דְּאָמַר: פֵּירוֹת לָא עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to Rav Sheshet, who says: Produce effects exchange, But according to Rav Naḥman, who says: Produce does not effect exchange, what can be said?
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hanicha to Rav Sheshet, who said: My produce is exchangeable. Rather, according to Rav Nachman who said: My produce is not exchangeable, what can be said?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יֵשׁ דָּמִים שֶׁהֵן כַּחֲלִיפִין, כֵּיצַד? הֶחְלִיף דְּמֵי שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ דְּמֵי חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר.
human_translation: this is what is saying: There is money that is like an exchange. How so? one exchanged the monetary of an ox for a cow, or the monetary of a donkey for an ox,
llm_translation: So it is stated: There are bloods that are like substitutions, how so? He exchanged the blood of an ox for that of a cow, or the blood of a donkey for that of an ox.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת. וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ מְשִׁיכָה קוֹנָה? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״נִשְׂרְפוּ חִיטֶּיךָ בָּעֲלִיָּיה״.
human_translation: What is the reason holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: By Torah law money effects acquisition, And what is reason said pulling acquires decree lest say to Your wheat was burned in the loft.
llm_translation: What is the reason? He holds like Rabbi Yochanan, who said: A matter of Torah, money acquires. And why did they say that pulling acquires? A decree lest one say to him: "Your wheat burned in the granary."

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא דִשְׁכִיחָ[א] גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן, מִילְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָ[א] לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: a common occurrence, the Sages issued a decree, an uncommon occurrence, the Sages did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: The matter that is common known, the Rabbis decreed upon it; the matter that is not common known, the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמַר: מְשִׁיכָה מְפוֹרֶשֶׁת מִן הַתּוֹרָה, הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת דְּאָמַר פֵּירוֹת עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, מְתָרֵץ כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: And according to Reish Lakish, who says pulling explicitly in the Torah? This works out well if holds in accordance with Rav Sheshet, who says produce effects exchange. explain in accordance with Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: And to Reish Lakish who said: Explicit drawing from the Torah, leave it, if he thinks like Rav Sheshet who said fruits are substitutes, he resolves like Rav Sheshet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב נַחְמָן דְּאָמַר פֵּירוֹת לָא עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, וּמַטְבֵּעַ לָא קָנֵי, בְּמַאי מוֹקֵי לַהּ? עַל כֻּרְחָךְ, כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But if he holds in accordance with Rav Naḥman, who says produce does not effect exchange and a coin does not effect acquisition in what does he establish Perforce holds in accordance with Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: Rather, if he thinks like Rav Nachman who said: "He did not make exchanges for produce, and he did not acquire coins, with what does he sustain her? Against her will, like Rav Sheshet thinks."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רְשׁוּת הַגָּבוֹהַּ בְּכֶסֶף, וּרְשׁוּת הַהֶדְיוֹט בַּחֲזָקָה. אֲמִירָתוֹ לְגָבוֹהַּ – כִּמְסִירָתוֹ לְהֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: The authority of the Temple by money And the authority, of a commoner hedyot is by possession. one’s declaration to the Most High, is equivalent to transferring to a common person,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Reshus HaGavohah (the domain of the elevated) with money, and Reshus HaHedyot (the domain of the commoner) with possession. His statement regarding the elevated - like his statement regarding the commoner.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד רְשׁוּת הַגָּבוֹהַּ בְּכֶסֶף? גִּיזְבָּר שֶׁנָּתַן מָעוֹת בִּבְהֵמָה, אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֵמָה בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם – קָנָה. וּבַהֶדְיוֹט – לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁיִּמְשׁוֹךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught How does the authority of the Temple by money? treasurer who gives coins for an animal, even animal is at the end of the world, he acquires it And with regard to a commoner, he does not acquire until he pulls
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How is ownership acquired with money? A coin that is given for an animal, even for an animal at the end of the world - acquires. And with ordinary people - does not acquire until it is drawn out.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד אֲמִירָתוֹ לַגָּבוֹהַּ כִּמְסִירָתוֹ לַהֶדְיוֹט? הָאוֹמֵר ״שׁוֹר זֶה עוֹלָה״, ״בַּיִת זֶה הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, אֲפִילּוּ בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם – קָנָה. בַּהֶדְיוֹט – לֹא קָנָה
human_translation: How is one’s declaration to the Most High equivalent to transferring to a common person? one who says: This ox is a burnt-offering, This house is consecrated acquires even at the end of the world. with regard to a commoner, he does not acquire
llm_translation: How is his statement to the expert like his statement to the layman? One who says, "This ox is consecrated," "This house is holy," even at the end of the world - he has acquired. To the layman - he has not acquired.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁיִּמְשׁוֹךְ וְיַחְזִיק. מְשָׁכוֹ בְּמָנֶה וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לִפְדּוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁעָמַד בְּמָאתַיִם – נוֹתֵן מָאתַיִם. מַאי טַעְמָא – ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״.
human_translation: until he pulls or takes possession pulled with one hundred dinars, and he did not manage to redeem it before stood at two hundred gives two hundred What is the reason He will give the money and it will be assured to him
llm_translation: Until he pulls and holds. He pulled with a hundred and did not manage to redeem him until he stood at two hundred - he gives two hundred. What is the reason? "And he gave the silver and he arose for him."

hebrew_text: מְשָׁכוֹ בְּמָאתַיִם, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לִפְדּוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁעָמַד בְּמָנֶה – נוֹתֵן מָאתַיִם. מַאי טַעְמָא – לֹא יְהֵא כֹּחַ הֶדְיוֹט חָמוּר מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: pulled two hundred and he did not manage to redeem it before stood at one hundred dinars, gives two hundred What is the reason The power of a commoner should not be greater than consecrated
llm_translation: He pulled it two hundred, and did not manage to redeem it until he stood at a hundred - he gives two hundred. What is the reason? - The power of the layman should not be more stringent than that of the Temple.

hebrew_text: פְּדָאוֹ בְּמָאתַיִם, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְמוֹשְׁכוֹ עַד שֶׁעָמַד בְּמָנֶה – נוֹתֵן מָאתַיִם, מַאי טַעְמָא – ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״. פְּדָאוֹ בְּמָנֶה וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְמוֹשְׁכוֹ עַד שֶׁעָמַד בְּמָאתַיִם – מַה שֶּׁפָּדָה פָּדוּי, וְאֵין נוֹתֵן אֶלָּא מָנֶה.
human_translation: redeemed it two hundred but he did not manage to pull it before stood at one hundred dinars, he gives two hundred What is the reason? He will give the money and it will be assured to him, he redeemed it at one hundred dinars and did not manage to pull it before it stood at two hundred what he redeemed is redeemed, and he gives only one hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Redemption with two hundred, and did not suffice to delay him until he stood in a hundred - he gives two hundred, what is the reason - "and he gave the silver and he stood for him." Redemption with a hundred and did not suffice to delay him until he stood in two hundred - that which he redeemed is redeemed, and one only gives a hundred.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? הָכִי נָמֵי נֵימָא: לֹא יְהֵא כֹּחַ הֶדְיוֹט חָמוּר מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ?
human_translation: Why So too, let us say: The power of a commoner should not be greater than consecrated
llm_translation: "Why? Thus it is said: Should the power of a layman not be more stringent than that of a priest?"

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ הֶדְיוֹט לָאו בְּמִי שֶׁפָּרַע קָאֵי?
human_translation: Is that to say a commoner not of: He Who exacted payment
llm_translation: Now, the layman, is he not standing on the one who has transgressed?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל מִצְוֹת הַבֵּן עַל הָאָב אֲנָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. וְכׇל מִצְוֹת הָאָב עַל הַבֵּן – אֶחָד אֲנָשִׁים וְאֶחָד נָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין. וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – אֲנָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – אֶחָד הָאֲנָשִׁים וְאֶחָד הַנָּשִׁים חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: all mitzvot of a son with regard to father, men are obligated and women are exempt. And all mitzvot of a father with regard to his son, both men and women are obligated all positive, time-bound mitzvot, men are obligated and women are exempt. And all positive mitzvot that are not time bound, both men and women are obligated
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All the commandments that a son is obligated in towards his father, men are obligated and women are exempt. And all the commandments that a father is obligated in towards his son – both men and women are obligated. And all positive time-bound commandments – men are obligated and women are exempt. And all positive non-time-bound commandments – both men and women are obligated.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מִצְוֹת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, בֵּין שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – אֶחָד הָאֲנָשִׁים וְאֶחָד הַנָּשִׁים חַיָּיבִין, חוּץ מִ״בַּל תַּקִּיף״ וּ״בַל תַּשְׁחִית״, וּ״בַל תִּטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים״.
human_translation: And all prohibitions, whether time-bound whether not time-bound, both men and women are obligated except for Do not round and: Do not destroy and Do not contract ritual impurity from a corpse
llm_translation: And all commandments not to do, whether the time caused it or the time did not cause it - one for men and one for women are obligated, except for "do not round off" and "do not destroy" and "do not become impure for the dead."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״כׇּל מִצְוֹת הַבֵּן עַל הָאָב״? אִילֵּימָא כׇּל מִצְוֹת דְּמִיחַיַּיב בְּרָא לְמִיעְבַּד לְאַבָּא, נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״אִישׁ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִישׁ, אִשָּׁה מִנַּיִן? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ אִמּוֹ וְאָבִיו תִּירָאוּ״, הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם!
human_translation: What All mitzvot of a son with regard to father? If we say all mitzvot that the son is obligated to perform with regard to father, women exempt But isn’t it taught “A man I have only a man From where a woman When it says “A man shall fear [ tira’u ] his mother and his father” there are two here,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "All the commandments that a son is obligated in towards his father"? Perhaps all the commandments that if he transgresses, the father is liable, women are exempt? But it was taught: "A man" - I have only a man, from where do I know that a woman is also included? When it says: "A man shall fear his mother and his father," here are two!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל מִצְוֹת הַבֵּן הַמּוּטָּלוֹת עַל הָאָב לַעֲשׂוֹת לִבְנוֹ – אֲנָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is what is saying: all mitzvot of a son that are incumbent upon father to perform for his son, men are obligated and women are exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Thus he said: All commandments of the son that are dependent upon the father to do for his son - men are obligated and women are exempt.

hebrew_text: תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאָב חַיָּיב בִּבְנוֹ לְמוּלוֹ, וְלִפְדוֹתוֹ, וּלְלַמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה, וּלְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה, וּלְלַמְּדוֹ אוּמָּנוּת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף לַהֲשִׁיטוֹ בַּמַּיִם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְלַמֵּד אֶת בְּנוֹ אוּמָּנוּת – מְלַמְּדוֹ לִיסְטוּת. לִיסְטוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא: כְּאִילּוּ מְלַמְּדוֹ לִיסְטוּת.
human_translation: we learn that which the Sages taught A father is obligated with regard to his son to circumcise him, and to redeem him and to teach him Torah, and to marry him to a woman, and to teach him a trade. And some say: also to teach to swim. Rabbi Yehuda says: Any who does not teach his son a trade teaches him banditry [ listut ]. enter your mind banditry? Rather, as though he teaches him banditry.
llm_translation: We have learned in that which the Rabbis taught: The father is obligated regarding his son to circumcise him, and to redeem him, and to teach him Torah, and to marry him off, and to teach him a trade. And some say: Also to teach him to swim. Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who does not teach his son a trade is teaching him to be a thief. Is it your opinion that he is teaching him to be a thief? Rather, it is as if he is teaching him to be a thief.

hebrew_text: ״לְמוּלוֹ״ מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּמׇל אַבְרָהָם אֶת יִצְחָק בְּנוֹ״. וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא מַהְלֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ מִיחַיְּיבִי בֵּי דִינָא לְמִימְהֲלֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִמּוֹל לָכֶם כׇּל זָכָר״. וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא מַהְלוּהּ בֵּי דִינָא מִיחַיַּיב אִיהוּ לְמִימְהַל נַפְשֵׁיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָרֵל זָכָר אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִמּוֹל אֶת בְּשַׂר עׇרְלָתוֹ וְנִכְרְתָה״.
human_translation: to circumcise From where do we as it is written: “And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac” And where one’s father did not circumcise him the court is obligated to circumcise him, as it is written: “Every male among you shall be circumcised” And where the court did not circumcise him is obligated to circumcise himself as it is written: “And the uncircumcised male, who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, shall be cut off
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "L'mulo" menalan? Dichtiv: "Vayamal Avraham et Yitzchak b'no." V'heicha d'lamahlei avuh mihayvei bei dinah l'mimhaleih, dichtiv: "Himol lakhem kol zachar." V'heicha d'lamahluhu bei dinah mihayyavei ihu l'mimhahel nafsheih, dichtiv: "V'arel zachar asher lo yimol et basar orlato v'nichreta." English translation: "For his circumcision, from where do we derive it? As it is written: 'And Abraham circumcised his son Isaac.' And in a case where his father did not circumcise him, the court is obligated to circumcise him, as it is written: 'He shall be circumcised, every male among you.' And in a case where the court did not circumcise him, he is obligated to circumcise himself, as it is written: 'And an uncircumcised male who does not circumcise the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off.'"

hebrew_text: אִיהִי מְנָלַן דְּלָא מִיחַיְּיבָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה אֹתוֹ אֱלֹהִים״ – אוֹתוֹ וְלֹא אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: From where do we that is not obligated As it is written: as God commanded him” him, and not her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Where do we derive that she is not obligated? As it is written: "As God commanded him" - him and not her.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן מִיָּד, לְדוֹרוֹת מְנָלַן? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צַו״ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא זֵירוּז, מִיָּד וּלְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: We found immediately, from where do we for generations? The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught any place where it is stated: “Command,” it is nothing other galvanization immediately and for generations.
llm_translation: I found it immediately, for generations where is it from? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Any place where it says, "command," it is only an expression of haste, immediately and for generations.

hebrew_text: זֵירוּז, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְצַו אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְחַזְּקֵהוּ וְאַמְּצֵהוּ״. מִיָּד וּלְדוֹרוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ וָהָלְאָה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶם״
human_translation: a galvanization? As it is written: “And command Joshua, and encourage him and strengthen him” immediately and for generations? As it is written: “From the day that the Lord commanded and onward throughout your generations”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Zeiruz, dikhtiv: "Ve-tzav et Yehoshua ve-chazkehu ve-amtzeihu." Miyad u-ledorot, dikhtiv: "Min ha-yom asher tzivah Hashem va-hale'ah le-doroteikhem." English translation: Zeiruz, as it is written: "And command Joshua, and strengthen him, and encourage him." Immediately and for generations, as it is written: "From the day that the Lord commanded and onward for your generations."

hebrew_text: לִפְדּוֹתוֹ. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּפְדֶּה״. וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא פַּרְקֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ מִיחַיַּיב אִיהוּ לְמִפְרְקֵיהּ דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּפְדֶּה״ ״תִּפָּדֶה״.
human_translation: to redeem From where do we as it is written: “All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem” And where father does not redeem him he is obligated to redeem as it is written: “You shall redeem [ pado tifde ]”
llm_translation: Redemption. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "Every firstborn of your sons you shall redeem." And in a case where the father did not redeem him, he is obligated to redeem him, as it is written: "You shall redeem" - with a repetition of the word "redeem."

hebrew_text: וְאִיהִי מְנָלַן דְּלָא מִיפַּקְדָה? דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּיפָּדֶה״ ״תִּפְדֶּה״, כֹּל שֶׁמְּצֻוֶּוה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ – מְצֻוֶּוה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת אֲחֵרִים, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ – אֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה לִפְדּוֹת אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: And from where do we that is not commanded As it is written: “You shall redeem [ tifde ]” You shall be redeemed [ tippadeh ]. whoever is commanded to redeem himself is commanded to redeem others, and whoever is not commanded to redeem himself is not commanded to redeem others.
llm_translation: And where do we derive that one is not obligated to redeem himself? For it is written: "He shall surely redeem" "He shall redeem," anyone who is commanded to redeem himself – is commanded to redeem others, and anyone who is not commanded to redeem himself – is not commanded to redeem others.

hebrew_text: וְאִיהִי מְנָלַן דְּלָא מִיחַיְּיבָא לְמִיפְרַק נַפְשַׁהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּפְדֶּה״ ״תִּיפָּדֶה״, כֹּל שֶׁאֲחֵרִים מְצֻוִּוים לִפְדּוֹתוֹ – מְצֻוֶּוה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין אֲחֵרִים מְצֻוִּוים לִפְדּוֹתוֹ – אֵין מְצֻוֶּוה לִפְדּוֹת אֶת עַצְמוֹ. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין אֲחֵרִים מְצֻוִּוין לִפְדּוֹתָהּ? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כׇּל בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּפְדֶּה״ – בָּנֶיךָ וְלֹא בְּנוֹתֶיךָ.
human_translation: And from where do we that she is not obligated to redeem herself? as it is written: “You shall redeem [ tifde ],” You shall be redeemed [ tippadeh ]. any whom others are commanded to redeem is commanded to redeem himself, and any whom others are not commanded to redeem is not commanded to redeem himself. And from where that others are not commanded to redeem As the verse states: “All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem” your sons and not your daughters.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where do we know that one is not obligated to endanger oneself to save another? As it is written: "You shall redeem" "You shall surely redeem," anyone for whom others are commanded to redeem him - he is commanded to redeem himself, and anyone for whom others are not commanded to redeem him - he is not commanded to redeem himself. And from where do we know that others are not commanded to redeem her? As the verse states: "Every firstborn of your sons you shall redeem" - your sons and not your daughters.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא לִפְדּוֹת וּבְנוֹ לִפְדּוֹת – הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּנוֹ קוֹדְמוֹ. שֶׁזֶּה מִצְוָתוֹ עַל אָבִיו, וְזֶה מִצְוַת בְּנוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught: to redeem himself and to redeem his son, he takes precedence over his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: His son takes precedence over him. that this mitzva his upon his father, And that mitzva of his son applies to him
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If both he and his son are in need of redemption, he takes precedence over his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: His son takes precedence over him. Because this is his father's obligation, and this is his son's obligation upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הַכֹּל מוֹדִין
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: Everyone agrees
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: "Everyone agrees..."

hebrew_text: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים – הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִצְוָה דְגוּפֵיהּ עֲדִיפָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא חָמֵשׁ מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים וְחָמֵשׁ בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: anywhere that there are only five sela he, takes precedence over his son. What is the reason? his own mitzva is preferable When they disagree where there is five liened and five unsold
llm_translation: In every place where there are only five stones - it takes precedence over the building. What is the reason? Because a mitzvah that is inherent is superior. When do they dispute? In a place where there are five slaves and five free men.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: מִלְוָה (דִּכְתִיב) [הַכְּתוּבָה] בַּתּוֹרָה כִּכְתוּבָה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמְיָא, בְּהָנֵי חָמֵשׁ פָּרֵיק לִבְרֵיהּ וְאָזֵיל כֹּהֵן וְטָרֵיף לֵיהּ לְחָמֵשׁ מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda maintains a loan that is written in the Torah, considered as though it is written in a document, with these five he redeems his son, and priest goes and repossesses five liened for his
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: lending (as it is written) in the scripture in the Torah is like lending in a document of money, with regard to five shekels, he separates from it and the priest goes and collects from him five servitudes for himself.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מִלְוָה דִּכְתִיב בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָאו כִּכְתוּבָה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמְיָא, וְהִילְכָּךְ מִצְוָה דְגוּפֵיהּ עֲדִיף.
human_translation: And the Rabbis maintain: A loan that is written in the Torah is not considered as though it is written in a document, And therefore his own mitzva is preferable,
llm_translation: The Sages hold: A loan that is written in the Torah is not like one that is written in a promissory note, and therefore the mitzvah itself is preferable.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לִפְדּוֹת אֶת בְּנוֹ וְלַעֲלוֹת לָרֶגֶל – פּוֹדֶה אֶת בְּנוֹ וְאַחַר כָּךְ עוֹלֶה לָרֶגֶל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹלֶה לָרֶגֶל, וְאַחַר כָּךְ פּוֹדֶה אֶת בְּנוֹ. שֶׁזּוֹ מִצְוָה עוֹבֶרֶת, וְזוֹ מִצְוָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹבֶרֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: to redeem his son and to ascend to the pilgrimage Festival, he redeems his son and then ascends on the pilgrimage Festival. Rabbi Yehuda says: He ascends on the pilgrimage Festival and then redeems his son. that this a mitzva passes, and this, a mitzva not pass,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "To redeem his son and then go up for the pilgrimage" - he redeems his son and afterwards goes up for the pilgrimage. Rabbi Yehuda says: He goes up for the pilgrimage, and afterwards redeems his son. Because this is a time-bound commandment, and that is a commandment that is not time-bound.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, כִּדְקָאָמַר טַעְמָא. אֶלָּא רַבָּנַן מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כׇּל בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּפְדֶּה״, וַהֲדַר: ״לֹא יֵרָאוּ פָנַי רֵיקָם״.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehuda, as he stated his reasoning, But what is the reasoning of the Rabbis, that the verse states: “All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem” and then “And none shall appear before me empty,”
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yehuda, as it says, "reason." But the Rabbis, what is their reason? As the verse says, "Every firstborn of your sons you shall redeem," and then it says, "they shall not appear before Me empty-handed."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם הָיוּ לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה בָּנִים מֵחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב לִפְדּוֹת כּוּלָּן – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כֹּל בְּכוֹר בָּנֶיךָ תִּפְדֶּה״. פְּשִׁיטָא, בְּפֶטֶר רֶחֶם תְּלָא רַחֲמָנָא!
human_translation: The Sages taught: From where that if one had five sons, from five women, he is obligated to redeem them all? The verse states: “All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem” Isn’t obvious the Merciful One made dependent upon the opening of the womb,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From where do we know that if a man has five sons from five women, he is obligated to redeem all of them? The Talmud teaches: "Every firstborn of your sons you shall redeem." It is obvious, the Merciful One should have mercy on the womb!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נֵילַף בְּכוֹר בְּכוֹר מִנַּחֲלָה, מָה לְהַלָּן ״רֵאשִׁית אֹנוֹ״, אַף כָּאן ״רֵאשִׁית אוֹנוֹ״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say we should derive “firstborn” “firstborn” from inheritance: Just as there, “The first fruit of his strength” so too here, first fruit of his strength, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? We learn from "first of his strength" there, so too here "first of his strength," it teaches us.

hebrew_text: לְלַמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלִמַּדְתֶּם אֹתָם אֶת בְּנֵיכֶם״. וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא אַגְמְרֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ מִיחַיַּיב אִיהוּ לְמִיגְמַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּלְמַדְתֶּם״.
human_translation: to teach Torah. From where do we As it is written: “And you shall teach them [ velimadtem ] to your sons” And where his father did not teach him he is obligated to teach himself, as it is written, And you shall study [ ulmadtem ].
llm_translation: To teach him Torah. From where? As it is written: "And you shall teach them to your children." And in a case where his father did not teach him, he himself is obligated to learn, as it is written: "And you shall learn."

hebrew_text: אִיהִי מְנָלַן דְּלָא מִיחַיְּיבָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלִימַּדְתֶּם״ ״וּלְמַדְתֶּם״, כֹּל שֶׁמְּצֻוֶּוה לִלְמוֹד – מְצֻוֶּוה לְלַמֵּד, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה לִלְמוֹד – אֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה לְלַמֵּד.
human_translation: From where do we that is not obligated As it is written: “And you shall teach [ velimadtem ],” And you shall study [ ulmadtem ]. whoever is commanded to study is commanded to teach, and whoever is not commanded to study is not commanded to teach.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Where do we derive that one is not obligated? As it is written: "And you shall teach" "and you shall learn," anyone who is commanded to learn is commanded to teach, and anyone who is not commanded to learn is not commanded to teach.

hebrew_text: וְאִיהִי מְנָלַן דְּלָא מִיחַיְּיבָה לְמֵילַף נַפְשַׁהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלִימַּדְתֶּם״ ״וּלְמַדְתֶּם״, כֹּל שֶׁאֲחֵרִים מְצֻוִּוין לְלַמְּדוֹ – מְצֻוֶּוה לְלַמֵּד אֶת עַצְמוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין אֲחֵרִים מְצֻוִּוין לְלַמְּדוֹ – אֵין מְצֻוֶּוה לְלַמֵּד אֶת עַצְמוֹ. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין אֲחֵרִים מְצֻוִּוין לְלַמְּדָהּ? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלִמַּדְתֶּם אֹתָם אֶת בְּנֵיכֶם״ אֶת בְּנֵיכֶם, וְלֹא בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם.
human_translation: And from where do we that she is not obligated to teach herself? As it is written: “And you shall teach [ velimadtem ],” And you shall study [ ulmadtem ], whoever others are commanded to teach is commanded to teach himself, and whoever others are not commanded to teach is not commanded to teach himself. And from where that others are not commanded to teach As the verse states: “And you shall teach them to your sons” Your sons and not your daughters.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where do we derive that a woman is not obligated in the teaching of Torah for herself? For it is written: "And you shall teach" "and you shall learn," anyone for whom others are commanded to teach him - he is commanded to teach himself, and anyone for whom others are not commanded to teach him - he is not commanded to teach himself. And from where do we derive that others are not commanded to teach her? For the verse states: "And you shall teach them to your sons" to your sons, and not to your daughters.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא לִלְמוֹד וּבְנוֹ לִלְמוֹד – הוּא קוֹדֵם לִבְנוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם בְּנוֹ זָרִיז וּמְמוּלָּח וְתַלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ – בְּנוֹ קוֹדְמוֹ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב שַׁדְּרֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. כִּי אֲתָא חַזְיֵיהּ דְּלָא הֲוָה מִיחַדְּדָן שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא עֲדִיפָא מִינָּךְ, תּוּב אַתְּ, דְּאֵיזִיל אֲנָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one to study and his son to study, he takes precedence over his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: If his son is diligent and sharp, and his study will endure, his son takes precedence over him. like that which Rav Ya’akov, son of Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, whose father sent him to Abaye When came saw that his studies were not sharp, said to I am preferable to you, you sit so that I can go
llm_translation: The sages taught: He himself to learn and his son to learn - he takes precedence over his son. Rabbi Yehuda says: If his son is diligent and sharp, and his learning is established in his hand - his son takes precedence. For this is like the case of Rav Yaakov, the son of Rav Acha bar Yaakov, whose father sent him to Abaye. When he came, Abaye saw that his name was not well-known. He said to him: I am superior to you, return, for I am going.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע אַבָּיֵי דְּקָא הֲוָה אָתֵי. הֲוָה הָהוּא מַזִּיק בֵּי רַבָּנַן דְּאַבָּיֵי, דְּכִי הֲווֹ עָיְילִי בִּתְרֵין אֲפִילּוּ בִּימָמָא הֲווֹ מִיתַּזְּקִי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא לִיתֵּיב לֵיהּ אִינָשׁ אוּשְׁפִּיזָא, אֶפְשָׁר דְּמִתְרְחִישׁ נִיסָּא.
human_translation: Abaye heard was coming. There was a certain demon in the study hall of Abaye, that when two enter they would be harmed, even during the day. said to Do not give lodging [ ushpiza ] perhaps a miracle will occur
llm_translation: Listen, Abaye was coming. That person was causing damage in the house of the sages of Abaye, for when they would go in pairs, even during the day, they would be harmed. He said to them: "A person should not sit in a negligent manner, perhaps a miracle will occur."

hebrew_text: עָל, בָּת בְּהָהוּא בֵּי רַבָּנַן. אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּתַנִּינָא דְּשִׁבְעָה רֵישְׁווֹתֵיהּ. כֹּל כְּרִיעָה דִּכְרַע נְתַר חַד רֵישֵׁיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ לִמְחַר: אִי לָא אִיתְרְחִישׁ נִיסָּא סַכֵּינְתִּין.
human_translation: he entered and spent the night in that study hall the Sages. appeared to him like a serpent seven heads. every bow he bowed one heads fell off, next day said to If a miracle had not occurred, you would have placed me in danger.
llm_translation: Upon, the daughter of Behahu, of the house of the sages. It appeared to him like a reptile with seven heads. Every bowing that he bowed, one head was removed. He said to them: If the miracle of my knives does not happen tomorrow.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה וְלִישָּׂא אִשָּׁה – יִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִשָּׂא אִשָּׁה. וְאִם אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ בְּלֹא אִשָּׁה – יִשָּׂא אִשָּׁה וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה, נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: to study Torah or to marry a woman, He should study Torah and afterward marry a woman. And if it is impossible for him without a wife, he should marry a woman and then study Torah. Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha marry a woman and afterward study Torah.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: To learn Torah and then marry a woman - let him learn Torah and afterwards marry a woman. And if it is impossible for him without a woman - let him marry a woman and afterwards learn Torah. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Halakha, one should marry a woman and afterwards learn Torah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: רֵיחַיִים בְּצַוָּארוֹ וְיַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה?! וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא – לַן, וְהָא – לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a millstone from his neck, he engage in Torah And do not disagree; this is for us and that is for them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Perfumes on his neck and he should engage in Torah?! And do not argue: this - for us, and that - for them."

hebrew_text: מִשְׁתַּבַּח לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב הוּנָא בִּדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא דְּאָדָם גָּדוֹל הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁיָּבֹא לְיָדְךָ – הֲבִיאֵהוּ לְיָדִי. כִּי אֲתָא חַזְיֵיהּ דְּלָא פָּרֵיס סוּדָרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא פָּרֵיסַתְּ סוּדָרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלָא נְסֵיבְנָא. אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ לְאַפֵּיהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי דְּלָא חָזֵית לְהוּ לְאַפַּי עַד דְּנָסְבַתְּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda would praise Rav Hamnuna to Rav Huna that he is a great man. said to him: When he comes to you, send him to me. When came saw that he did not cover a cloth, said to him: What is the reason you do not cover with a cloth? said to him: that I am not married, turned his face away from him he said to him: See that you do not see my face until you marry.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Ḥisdah praised Rav Huna in the name of Rav Hamnuna, saying: He is a great man. He said to him: When it comes into your hand, bring it to me. When he came, he saw that he had not spread a sheet. He said to him: Why did you not spread a sheet? He said to him: Because we are not married. He turned away from him. He said to him: See that you do not see me until you are married.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה וְלֹא נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה – כׇּל יָמָיו בַּעֲבֵירָה. בַּעֲבֵירָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כָּל יָמָיו בְּהִרְהוּר עֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna to his reasoning, as he says: twenty years old and has not married a woman, all of his days in sin enter your mind in sin Rather, say All of his days in thoughts of sin,
llm_translation: Rav Huna according to his reasoning said: A man who is twenty years old and has not married a woman - all his days in sin. In sin, is it your opinion?! Rather say: all his days in thoughts of sin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: עַד עֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה יוֹשֵׁב הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּמְצַפֶּה לָאָדָם מָתַי יִשָּׂא אִשָּׁה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ עֶשְׂרִים וְלֹא נָשָׂא, אוֹמֵר: תִּיפַּח עַצְמוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rava said, and similarly, the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Until twenty years the Holy One, Blessed be He, sits and waits for a man, When will he marry a woman? Once he reaches twenty and has not married, He says: Let his bones swell,
llm_translation: Rava said, and similarly it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Until twenty years, the Holy One, blessed be He, sits and waits for a person - when will he take a wife. Once he reaches twenty and has not married, He says: "Let his bones be scattered."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַאי דַּעֲדִיפְנָא מֵחַבְרַאי, דִּנְסֵיבְנָא בְּשִׁיתְּסַר, וְאִי הֲוָה נָסֵיבְנָא בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: that I am superior to my colleagues because I married sixteen, and if I would have married at fourteen,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This one who is preferred over my colleagues, for we were married at sixteen, and if we had married at fourteen.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְשָׂטָן: גִּירָא בְּעֵינָיךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַבִּי נָתָן בַּר אַמֵּי: אַדִּידָךְ עַל צַוְּארֵי דִּבְרָיךְ. מִשִּׁיתְּסַר וְעַד עֶשְׂרִים וְתַרְתֵּי וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: מִתַּמְנֵי סְרֵי עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: I would say to the Satan: An arrow in your eye, Rava said to Rabbi Natan bar Ami: While your hand is still on your son’s neck, From sixteen until twenty-two, and some say from eighteen until twenty-four.
llm_translation: I would say to the Satan: "A blade in your eyes." Rava said to Rabbi Natan bar Ammi: "Your witness is upon the back of your words." From six and until twenty-two and they said to him: "From six to twenty-four."

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״חֲנֹךְ לַנַּעַר עַל פִּי דַרְכּוֹ״, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: מִשִּׁיתְּסַר וְעַד עֶשְׂרִים וְתַרְתֵּין, וְחַד אָמַר: מִתַּמְנֵי סְרֵי וְעַד עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה.
human_translation: like tanna’im , “Train a child in the way that he should go” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One said from sixteen until twenty-two, and one said from eighteen until twenty-four.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Sages taught: "Educate the youth according to his way." Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nechemiah, one said: from the age of six until twenty-two, and one said: from the age of eight until twenty-four.

hebrew_text: עַד הֵיכָן חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת בְּנוֹ תּוֹרָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן זְבוּלוּן בֶּן דָּן, שֶׁלִּימְּדוֹ אֲבִי אָבִיו מִקְרָא וּמִשְׁנָה וְתַלְמוּד הֲלָכוֹת וְאַגָּדוֹת. מֵיתִיבִי: לִמְּדוֹ מִקְרָא – אֵין מְלַמְּדוֹ מִשְׁנָה, וְאָמַר רָבָא: מִקְרָא – זוֹ תּוֹרָה!
human_translation: To what is a person obligated to teach his son Torah? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: for example, Zevulun ben Dan, whose father’s father taught him Bible, Mishna, Talmud, halakhot , and aggadot . The Gemara raises an objection taught Bible, not teach him Mishna. And Rava said Bible is Torah,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How far is a person obligated to teach his son Torah? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Like Zevulun the son of Dan, whose father's father taught him Scripture, Mishnah, Talmud, laws, and legends. The question was raised: If he taught him Scripture - he does not teach him Mishnah. And Rava said: Scripture - this is Torah!

hebrew_text: כִּזְבוּלוּן בֶּן דָּן, וְלֹא כִּזְבוּלוּן בֶּן דָּן. כִּזְבוּלוּן בֶּן דָּן – שֶׁלִּמְּדוֹ אֲבִי אָבִיו, וְלֹא כִּזְבוּלוּן בֶּן דָּן, דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם מִקְרָא מִשְׁנָה וְתַלְמוּד הֲלָכוֹת וְאַגָּדוֹת, וְאִילּוּ הָכָא – מִקְרָא לְבַד.
human_translation: like Zevulun ben Dan was taught but not like Zevulun ben Dan like Zevulun ben Dan that his father’s father taught him; but not like Zevulun ben Dan, as there Bible, Mishna, Talmud, halakhot , and aggadot , while here, Bible alone.
llm_translation: Zebulun son of Dan, and not Zebulun son of Dan. Zebulun son of Dan - who his father's father taught him, and not like Zebulun son of Dan, for there, Scripture, Mishnah, and Talmud, laws and aggadot, but here, Scripture alone.

hebrew_text: וַאֲבִי אָבִיו מִי מִיחַיַּיב? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְלִמַּדְתֶּם אֹתָם אֶת בְּנֵיכֶם״ – וְלֹא בְּנֵי בְנֵיכֶם. וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: שֶׁכׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בְּנוֹ תּוֹרָה – מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ לִמְּדוֹ לוֹ וְלִבְנוֹ וּלְבֶן בְּנוֹ, עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת!
human_translation: But is one’s father’s father obligated But isn’t it taught “And you shall teach them to your sons” But not your sons’ sons? And how do I realize, “But make them known to your sons and to your sons’ sons” to say to you whoever teaches his son Torah, the verse ascribes him as though he taught him, and his son, and his son’s son, until the end of all generations.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And his father's father, who is obligated? And it was taught: "And you shall teach them to your sons" - and not to your sons' sons. And how do I fulfill: "And you shall make them known to your sons and to your sons' sons," to tell you: that anyone who teaches his son Torah - the Scripture credits him as if he taught it to him, and to his son, and to his son's son, until the end of all generations!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלִמַּדְתֶּם אֹתָם אֶת בְּנֵיכֶם״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּנֵיכֶם, בְּנֵי בְנֵיכֶם מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ״. אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּנֵיכֶם״ – בְּנֵיכֶם וְלֹא בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם.
human_translation: stated in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught “And you shall teach them to your sons” I have only your sons. From where do your sons’ sons? The verse states: “But make them known to your sons and to your sons’ sons.” If so, what the verse states: “Your sons” Your sons, but not your daughters.
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna taught: "And you shall teach them to your sons" - I have only your sons, how do I know your grandsons? The Scripture teaches to say: "And you shall make them known to your sons and to your grandsons." If so, why does the Scripture say: "Your sons" - your sons and not your daughters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בֶּן בְּנוֹ תּוֹרָה מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ קִבְּלָהּ מֵהַר סִינַי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״יוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹקֶיךָ בְּחֹרֵב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Anyone who teaches his son’s son Torah, the verse ascribes him as though he received it from Mount Sinai, as it is stated: “But make them known to your sons and to your sons’ sons,” and juxtaposed to it “The day when you stood before the Lord your God in Horeb”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who teaches his grandson Torah, the Scripture considers it as if he received it from Mount Sinai, as it is stated: "And you shall make known to your children and your children's children," and it is juxtaposed with: "The day you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי דְּשָׁדֵי דִּיסְנָא אַרֵישֵׁיהּ וְקָא מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי זוּטַר מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ״ וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״יוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹקֶיךָ בְּחֹרֵב״? מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לָא טָעֵים אוּמְצָא עַד דְּמַקְרֵי לְיָנוֹקָא וּמוֹסְפֵיהּ. רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא לָא טָעֵים אוּמְצָא עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי לְיָנוֹקָא לְבֵית מִדְרְשָׁא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba encountered Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, that he had placed covering on his head and brought child to the synagogue said to him: What all this Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said to him: Is it insignificant, that which is written: “But make them known to your sons,” and juxtaposed to it “The day when you stood before the Lord your God in Horeb”? From this onward, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba would not taste meat [ umtza ], before he had read to child and added to Rabba bar Rav Huna would not taste meat before he had brought child to the study hall.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba found Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi who was sitting and teaching Torah to children in the synagogue. He said to him: What are you doing here? He replied: Is it not written, "And you shall teach them diligently to your children," and adjacent to it is written, "The day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb"? From here and onwards, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba did not leave him until he finished teaching the children. Rabbah bar Rav Huna did not leave him until he brought the children to the study hall.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְשִׁנַּנְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ״ – אַל תִּקְרֵי ״וְשִׁנַּנְתָּם״, אֶלָּא ״וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּם״.
human_translation: Rav Safra says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: What which is written: “And you shall teach them diligently [ veshinnantam ] to your sons” Do not read “ veshinnantam ,” Rather, veshillashtam ,
llm_translation: Rav Safrā said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: What is the meaning of what is written, "And you shall teach them diligently to your children"? Do not read it as "and you shall teach them diligently," rather "and you shall make them into three parts."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם יְשַׁלֵּשׁ אָדָם שְׁנוֹתָיו: שְׁלִישׁ בַּמִּקְרָא, שְׁלִישׁ בַּמִּשְׁנָה, שְׁלִישׁ בַּתַּלְמוּד. מִי יוֹדֵעַ כַּמָּה חָיֵי? לָא צְרִיכָא לְיוֹמֵי.
human_translation: a person should always divide his years into three A third for Bible, a third for Mishna, and a third for Talmud. Who knows the length of his life, No, necessary for days,
llm_translation: Forever one should divide his years: a third in the Scripture, a third in the Mishnah, a third in the Talmud. Who knows how many years? Not necessary for the days.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ נִקְרְאוּ רִאשׁוֹנִים ״סוֹפְרִים״, שֶׁהָיוּ סוֹפְרִים כׇּל הָאוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: וָא״ו דְּ״גָחוֹן״– חֶצְיָין שֶׁל אוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה. ״דָּרֹשׁ דָּרַשׁ״ – חֶצְיָין שֶׁל תֵּיבוֹת. ״וְהִתְגַּלָּח״ – שֶׁל פְּסוּקִים. ״יְכַרְסְמֶנָּה חֲזִיר מִיָּעַר״ – עַיִ״ן דְּיַעַר חֶצְיָין שֶׁל תְּהִלִּים. ״וְהוּא רַחוּם יְכַפֵּר עָוֹן״ – חֶצְיוֹ דִּפְסוּקִים.
human_translation: Therefore, first were called: Those who count [ soferim ], they would count all the letters in the Torah, as they would say vav “belly [ gaḥon ]” is the midpoint of the letters in a Torah scroll. “Diligently inquired [ darosh darash ]” are the midpoint of the words “Then he shall be shaven” of verses. “The boar out of the wood [ miya’ar ] ravages it” the ayin in [ ya’ar ] midpoint of Psalms, “But He, being full of compassion, forgives iniquity” is the midpoint verses
llm_translation: Therefore, the early scribes were called "Soferim," because they would count all the letters in the Torah, saying: "Vav of 'Gachon' - half letters of the Torah scroll. 'Darosh Darash' - half letters of the words. 'Ve'hithgallach' - of the verses. 'Yecharsemenah chazir miya'ar' - Ayin of 'Ya'ar' half letters of Psalms. 'Ve'hu rachum yechaper avon' - its half of the verses.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: וָא״ו ״דְּגָחוֹן״, מֵהַאי גִּיסָא אוֹ מֵהַאי גִּיסָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נֵיתֵי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְנִימְנִינְהוּ, מִי לָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וּמְנָאוּם? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִינְהוּ בְּקִיאִי בַּחֲסֵירוֹת וִיתֵרוֹת, אֲנַן לָא בְּקִיאִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises a dilemma: vav of “belly [ gaḥon ]” to this side or to this side? said to him: Let us bring a Torah scroll and count Didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say They did not move from there until they brought a Torah scroll and counted said to them: They experts deficient and plene We are not experts
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Yosef: And what is the case of "Degachon," from this side or from that side? They said to him: Let us take a Torah scroll and count them. Did not Rabba bar bar Chana say: They did not move from there until they brought a Torah scroll and counted them? He said to them: They are experts in deficiencies and excesses, but we are not experts.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וְהִתְגַּלָּח״, מֵהַאי גִּיסָא אוֹ מֵהַאי גִּיסָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פְּסוּקֵי מִיהָא לַיְתוֹ לִימְנִינְהוּ! בִּפְסוּקֵי נָמֵי לָא בְּקִיאִינַן, דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא, אָמַר: בְּמַעְרְבָא פָּסְקִי לֵיהּ לְהַאי קְרָא לִתְלָתָא פְּסוּקֵי: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי בָּא אֵלֶיךָ בְּעַב הֶעָנָן״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises a dilemma: “then he shall be shaven,” to this side or to this side? Abaye said to him: we can at least bring to count the verses. We are not experts about verses either, as when Rav Aḥa bar Adda came he said: In the West, they divide this verse into three verses: “And the Lord said to Moses, behold I come to you in a thick cloud,
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Yosef: "And he shall shave," from this verse or from that verse? Abaye said to him: Let us establish it from its own verses! For we are not proficient in other verses, as when Rav Acha bar Adda came, he said: In the west, they established for him this verse with three verses: "And Hashem said to Moshe, behold, I am coming to you in the thickness of the cloud."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמֵשֶׁת אֲלָפִים וּשְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת וּשְׁמוֹנִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה פְּסוּקִים הָווּ פְּסוּקֵי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, יָתֵר עָלָיו תְּהִלִּים שְׁמוֹנָה, חָסֵר מִמֶּנּוּ דִּבְרֵי הַיָּמִים שְׁמוֹנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Five thousand eight hundred and eighty-eight verses are the verses in a Torah scroll. Psalms has eight more than that, Chronicles eight fewer than that.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Five thousand eight hundred and eighty-eight verses were in the Torah, in addition to them are eighty Psalms, and lacking from them are eight verses of the Chronicles.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשִׁנַּנְתָּם״, שֶׁיְּהוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מְחוּדָּדִים בְּפִיךְ, שֶׁאִם יִשְׁאַל לְךָ אָדָם דָּבָר אַל תְּגַמְגֵּם וְתֹאמַר לוֹ, אֶלָּא אֱמוֹר לוֹ מִיָּד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And you shall teach them diligently [ veshinnantam ]” that matters of Torah should be sharp in your mouth, that if a person asks you something, do not stutter and say to him. Rather, answer him immediately, as it is stated:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall teach them," that the words of Torah should be sharp in your mouth, so that if someone asks you a matter, do not stutter and say to him, but rather tell him immediately, as it is stated:

hebrew_text: ״אֱמֹר לַחׇכְמָה אֲחֹתִי אָתְּ וְגוֹ׳״ וְאוֹמֵר: ״קׇשְׁרֵם עַל אֶצְבְּעֹתֶיךָ כׇּתְבֵם עַל לוּחַ לִבֶּךָ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״כְּחִצִּים בְּיַד גִּבּוֹר כֵּן בְּנֵי הַנְּעוּרִים״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״חִצֵּי גִבּוֹר שְׁנוּנִים״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״חִצֶּיךָ שְׁנוּנִים עַמִּים תַּחְתֶּיךָ יִפְּלוּ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר מִלֵּא אֶת אַשְׁפָּתוֹ מֵהֶם לֹא יֵבֹשׁוּ כִּי יְדַבְּרוּ אֶת אוֹיְבִים בַּשָּׁעַר״.
human_translation: “Say to wisdom: You are my sister, And it states: “Bind them upon your fingers, you shall write them upon the tablet of your heart” And it states: “As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of one’s youth” And it states: “Sharp arrows of the mighty” And it states: “Your arrows are sharp, the peoples fall under you” And it states: “Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them; they shall not be put to shame when they speak with their enemies in the gate”
llm_translation: Say to wisdom, "You are my sister," and say: "Bind them on your fingers, write them on the tablet of your heart." And say: "Like arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of youth." And say: "Arrows of a warrior are sharpened." And say: "Your arrows are sharp; peoples will fall under you." And say: "Blessed is the man who fills his quiver with them; they shall not be put to shame when they speak with their enemies in the gate."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֶת אוֹיְבִים בַּשָּׁעַר״? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אֲפִילּוּ הָאָב וּבְנוֹ, הָרַב וְתַלְמִידוֹ שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה בַּשָּׁעַר אֶחָד – נַעֲשִׂים אוֹיְבִים זֶה אֶת זֶה. וְאֵינָם זָזִים מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁנַּעֲשִׂים אוֹהֲבִים זֶה אֶת זֶה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת וָהֵב בְּסוּפָה״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״בְּסוּפָה״ אֶלָּא ״בְּסוֹפָהּ״.
human_translation: What “enemies in the gate” Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: Even a father and his son, a rabbi and his student, who are engaged in Torah in one gate become enemies with each other But they do not leave there until they love each other, as it is stated Vahev in Suphah [ beSufa ], do not read “in Suphah [ beSufa ]”; rather, “at its end [ besofa ],”
llm_translation: What is "enemies at the gate"? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: Even a father and his son, a teacher and his student who engage in Torah study at the same gate - they become enemies to one another. And they do not move from there until they become friends to one another, as it is stated: "The fire and the wood are in a bundle" (Proverbs 26:21), do not read it as "in a bundle" but rather "in its end."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשַׂמְתֶּם״ – סַם תָּם, נִמְשְׁלָה תּוֹרָה כְּסַם חַיִּים. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁהִכָּה אֶת בְּנוֹ מַכָּה גְּדוֹלָה וְהִנִּיחַ לוֹ רְטִיָּה עַל מַכָּתוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהָרְטִיָּה זוֹ עַל מַכָּתְךָ אֱכוֹל מַה שֶּׁהֲנָאָתֶךָ, וּשְׁתֵה מַה שֶּׁהֲנָאָתֶךָ, וּרְחוֹץ בֵּין בְּחַמִּין בֵּין בְּצוֹנֵן וְאֵין אַתָּה מִתְיָירֵא. וְאִם אַתָּה מַעֲבִירָהּ הֲרֵי הִיא מַעֲלָה נוֹמֵי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And you shall place [ vesamtem ] sam tam , a perfect elixir. The Torah is compared to an elixir of life. a parable that A person hit his son with a strong blow and placed a bandage on his wound. And he said to him: My son, as long as this bandage is on your wound eat what you enjoy and drink what you enjoy, and bathe in either hot water or cold water, and you do not need to be afraid, But if you take it off, will become gangrenous.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And you shall place" - place pure spice, the Torah is compared to the spice of life. It is analogous to a person who struck his son a great blow and placed a bandage on his wound, and said to him: My son, as long as this bandage is on your wound, eat what is beneficial to you, drink what is beneficial to you, and bathe in hot or cold water, and you need not fear. But if you remove it, it will cause festering.

hebrew_text: כָּךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אָמַר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בָּנַי, בָּרָאתִי יֵצֶר הָרָע וּבָרָאתִי לוֹ תּוֹרָה תַּבְלִין. וְאִם אַתֶּם עוֹסְקִים בַּתּוֹרָה – אֵין אַתֶּם נִמְסָרִים בְּיָדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלוֹא אִם תֵּיטִיב שְׂאֵת״,
human_translation: So the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Israel: My children, I created an evil inclination, and I created Torah as its antidote. If you are engaged in Torah you will not be given over into the hand as it is stated: “If you do well, shall it not be lifted up?”
llm_translation: So said the Holy One, blessed be He, to the children of Israel: My sons, I created the evil inclination and I created for it the Torah as a spice. And if you engage in the Torah, you are not delivered into its hand, as it is said: "If you do well, will you not be accepted?"

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין אַתֶּם עוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה – אַתֶּם נִמְסָרִים בְּיָדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַפֶּתַח חַטָּאת רֹבֵץ״, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁכׇּל מַשָּׂאוֹ וּמַתָּנוֹ בְּךָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵלֶיךָ תְּשׁוּקָתוֹ״. וְאִם אַתָּה רוֹצֶה אַתָּה מוֹשֵׁל בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה תִּמְשׇׁל בּוֹ״.
human_translation: And if you do not engage in Torah you are given over to its power, as it is stated: “Sin crouches at the door” Moreover, all deliberations concerning you, as it is stated “And to you is its desire.” And if you wish you shall rule over it, as it is stated “But you may rule over it”
llm_translation: If you are not engaged in Torah study - you are delivered into his hand, as it is said: "At the entrance sin crouches." Moreover, all his burden and exchange is upon you, as it is said: "And to you shall be his desire." But if you desire, you will rule over him, as it is said: "And you shall rule over him."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קָשֶׁה יֵצֶר הָרָע, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ יוֹצְרוֹ קְרָאוֹ רַע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יֵצֶר לֵב הָאָדָם רַע מִנְּעֻרָיו״. אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: יִצְרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מִתְחַדֵּשׁ עָלָיו בְּכׇל יוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַק רַע כׇּל הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: difficult is the evil inclination that even its Creator calls it evil, as it is stated: “For the inclination of a man’s heart is evil from his youth” Rav Yitzḥak says: A person’s inclination renews itself to him every day, as it is stated: only evil all day [ kol hayyom ]”
llm_translation: The sages taught: The evil inclination is strong, for even though its creator called it evil, as it is stated: "For the inclination of man's heart is evil from his youth." Rav Yitzchak said: The inclination of man renews upon him every day, as it is stated: "Only evil all day long."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לֵוִי: יִצְרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו בְּכׇל יוֹם וּמְבַקֵּשׁ הֲמִיתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צוֹפֶה רָשָׁע לַצַּדִּיק וּמְבַקֵּשׁ לַהֲמִיתוֹ״, וְאִלְמָלֵא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עוֹזְרוֹ אֵין יָכוֹל לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים לֹא יַעַזְבֶנּוּ בְיָדוֹ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Levi says: A person’s inclination overpowers him every day, and seeks to kill him, as it is stated: “The wicked watches the righteous and seeks to slay him” And if not the Holy One, Blessed be He, assists he could not it, as it is stated: “The Lord will not leave him in his hand”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Shimon ben Levi: The inclination of a person overpowers him every day and seeks to kill him, as it is stated: "The wicked watches for the righteous and seeks to kill him." And if not for the Holy One, blessed be He, helping him, he would not be able, as it is stated: "God will not abandon him in his hand."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּנִי אִם פָּגַע בְּךָ מְנֻוּוֹל זֶה – מׇשְׁכֵהוּ לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. אִם אֶבֶן הוּא – נִימּוֹחַ, וְאִם בַּרְזֶל הוּא – מִתְפּוֹצֵץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלוֹא כֹה דְבָרִי כָּאֵשׁ נְאֻם ה׳ וּכְפַטִּישׁ יְפֹצֵץ סָלַע״. אִם אֶבֶן הוּא – נִימּוֹחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹי כׇּל צָמֵא לְכוּ לַמַּיִם״ וְאוֹמֵר: ״אֲבָנִים שָׁחֲקוּ מַיִם״.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: My son, if this wretched one, encounters you, pull it into the study hall, If it is a stone melt, and if it is iron break, as it is stated “Is not My word like fire, says the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?” If it is a stone melt, as it is stated “Ho, everyone who thirsts, come for water” and it states: “The water wears the stones”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: "My son, if a stubborn person encounters you, draw him to the study hall. If he is like a stone, wear him down; and if he is like iron, shatter him, as it is stated: 'Is not My word like fire, says the Lord, and like a hammer that shatters rock?' If he is like a stone, wear him down, as it is stated: 'Ho, everyone who is thirsty, go to the water,' and it also says: 'Water wears away stones.'"

hebrew_text: לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״קְחוּ נָשִׁים וְהוֹלִידוּ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת וּקְחוּ לִבְנֵיכֶם נָשִׁים וְאֶת בְּנוֹתֵיכֶם תְּנוּ לַאֲנָשִׁים״.
human_translation: to marry a woman. From where do we As it is written: “Take wives and bear sons and daughters, and take wives for your sons and give your daughters to men”
llm_translation: To marry him a woman. From where? As it is written: "Take wives and have sons and daughters, and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to men."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּנוֹ – בְּיָדוֹ, אֶלָּא בִּתּוֹ – בְּיָדוֹ הִיא? הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: נִיתֵּן לַהּ מִידֵּי וְ[נַ]לְבְּשַׁיהּ וּנְכַסְּיַיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דִּ[לְ]קִפְצוּ עֲלַהּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Granted his son, in his power, But his daughter, is in his power? This is what saying to them give her something and he should dress and cover her so that men will leap to her.
llm_translation: In peace, with his son - in his hand, but with his daughter - in his hand she is? Thus he said to them: Give it to her from your hand and dress her and adorn her, so that people will not leap upon her.

hebrew_text: לְלַמְּדוֹ אוּמָּנוּת. מְנָלַן? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״רְאֵה חַיִּים עִם אִשָּׁה אֲשֶׁר אָהַבְתָּ״. אִם ״אִשָּׁה״ מַמָּשׁ הִיא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחַיָּיב לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה – כָּךְ חַיָּיב לְלַמְּדוֹ אוּמָּנוּת. אִם תּוֹרָה הִיא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחַיָּיב לְלַמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה – כָּךְ חַיָּיב לְלַמְּדוֹ אוּמָּנוּת.
human_translation: to teach a trade. From where do we Ḥizkiyya said: As the verse states: “Enjoy life with the wife whom you love” If it an actual woman, Just as is obligated to marry to a woman, so too, he is obligated to teach him a trade, And if it is the Torah, Just as he is obligated to teach him Torah, so too, he is obligated to teach him a trade.
llm_translation: To teach him a trade. From where do we derive this? Chizkiyah said: As the verse states, "See life with the woman whom you love." If "woman" is meant literally, just as one is obligated to marry a woman, so too is one obligated to teach him a trade. If it refers to Torah, just as one is obligated to teach him Torah, so too is one obligated to teach him a trade.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים אַף לַהֲשִׁיטוֹ בַּנָּהָר. מַאי טַעְמָא? חַיּוּתֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: And some say also to teach to swim in a river. What is the reason It is his life,
llm_translation: And some say, even to throw him into the river. What is the reason? It is his life.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְלַמְּדוֹ אוּמָּנוּת – מְלַמְּדוֹ לִיסְטוּת. לִיסְטוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ! אֶלָּא, כְּאִילּוּ מְלַמְּדוֹ לִיסְטוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Any who does not teach a trade teaches him banditry. enter your mind banditry? Rather, as though he taught him banditry.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who does not teach him a trade - teaches him to be a thief. To be a thief, is it your opinion! Rather, as if he taught him to be a thief.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַגְמְרֵיהּ עִיסְקָא.
human_translation: What is between There is between them where teaches him business.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that he concluded the matter.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאָב עַל הַבֵּן וְכוּ׳. מַאי כׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאָב עַל הַבֵּן? אִילֵּימָא כֹּל מִצְוָתָא דְּמִיחַיַּיב אַבָּא לְמִיעְבַּד לִבְרֵיהּ נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת – וְהָתַנְיָא: הָאָב חַיָּיב בִּבְנוֹ לְמוּלוֹ וְלִפְדוֹתוֹ. אָבִיו – אֵין, אִמּוֹ – לֹא!
human_translation: all mitzvot of a father with regard to his son, What All mitzvot of a father with regard to his son? If we say all of the mitzvot that a father is required to perform for his son, women obligated But isn’t it taught A father is obligated with regard to his son to circumcise him, and to redeem him? his father, yes, his mother, no,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: All the commandments of the father upon the son, etc. What is meant by "all the commandments of the father upon the son"? If you say, all the commandments that the father is obligated to fulfill for his son, women are also obligated – and it was taught: The father is obligated to circumcise and redeem his son. His father – no, his mother – no!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאָב הַמּוּטָּלֹת עַל הַבֵּן לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָבִיו, אֶחָד אֲנָשִׁים וְאֶחָד נָשִׁים חַיָּיבִין. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִישׁ, אִשָּׁה מִנַּיִן? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״תִּירָאוּ״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is what is saying: each mitzva the father that is incumbent upon the son to perform for his father, both men and women are obligated We learned this, as the Sages taught “A man I have only a man from where a woman When it says “A man shall fear [ tira’u ] his mother and his father” there are two here,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, thus he said: All the commandments of the father that are obligatory upon the son to do for his father, whether men or women are obligated. We learned in a Mishnah that the Rabbis taught: "man" - I only have a man, where is a woman derived from? When it says "you shall fear" - here are two.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִישׁ״? – אִישׁ סִיפֵּק בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת, אִשָּׁה אֵין סִיפֵּק בְּיָדָהּ לַעֲשׂוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרְשׁוּת אֲחֵרִים עָלֶיהָ. אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב: נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, שְׁנֵיהֶם שָׁוִים.
human_translation: If so, what the verse states: “Man”? a man, in his power to perform a woman, not in her power to perform because she is under the authority of another Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav says: is divorced, both of them, equal
llm_translation: "If so, what does the Talmud mean by 'man'? - A man has the ability in his hand to do, a woman does not have the ability in her hand to do, because the ownership of others is upon her. Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav: If she was divorced, they are both equal."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נֶאֱמַר: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת אָבִיךָ וְאֶת אִמֶּךָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת ה׳ מֵהוֹנֶךָ״, הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב כִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם לִכְבוֹד הַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught it is stated: “Honor your father and your mother” and it is stated: “Honor the Lord with your wealth” the verse equates the honor of one’s father and mother to the honor of the Omnipresent,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: It is stated: "Honor your father and your mother," and it is stated: "Honor the Lord from your wealth." The Torah equated the honor due to father and mother with the honor due to the Omnipresent.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ אִמּוֹ וְאָבִיו תִּירָאוּ״, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תִּירָא וְאֹתוֹ תַעֲבֹד״, הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב מוֹרָאַת אָב וָאֵם לְמוֹרָאַת הַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: it is stated: “A man shall fear his mother and his father” and it is stated: “You shall fear the Lord your God and Him you shall serve” The verse equates the fear of one’s father and mother to the fear of the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: It is stated: "Each man his mother and his father you shall fear," and it is stated: "The Lord your God you shall fear and Him you shall serve," the Scripture equated the fear of a father and mother to the fear of the Omnipresent.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר: ״מְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מוֹת יוּמָת״, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יְקַלֵּל אֱלֹהָיו וְנָשָׂא חֶטְאוֹ״, הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב בִּרְכַּת אָב וָאֵם לְבִרְכַּת הַמָּקוֹם. אֲבָל בְּהַכָּאָה וַדַּאי אִי אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: it is stated: “He who curses his father or his mother shall be put to death” and it is stated: “Whoever curses his God shall bear his sin” The verse equates the blessing, of father and mother to the blessing of the Omnipresent. But with regard to striking, it is certainly not possible
llm_translation: It is stated: "One who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death," and it is stated: "A man who curses his God shall bear his sin," the Scripture equated the blessing of father and mother to the blessing of the Omnipresent. However, in the case of striking, it is certainly impossible.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּדִין, שֶׁשְּׁלָשְׁתָּן שׁוּתָּפִין בּוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוּתָּפִין הֵן בָּאָדָם: הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, וְאָבִיו, וְאִמּוֹ. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָדָם מְכַבֵּד אֶת אָבִיו וְאֶת אִמּוֹ אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עֲלֵיהֶם כְּאִילּוּ דַּרְתִּי בֵּינֵיהֶם, וְכִבְּדוּנִי.
human_translation: And so a logical derivation, as the three of them are partners in his the Sages taught: There are three partners in a person: The Holy One, Blessed be He, and his father and his mother. When a person honors his father and mother, the Holy One, Blessed be He, says: I ascribe to them as if I dwelt between them and they honor Me
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so in judgment, that the three of them are partners in it. The Rabbis taught: There are three partners in a person: the Holy One, blessed be He, his father, and his mother. When a person honors his father and his mother, the Holy One, blessed be He, says: I consider it as if I dwelt among them, and they honored Me.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שֶׁבֵּן מְכַבֵּד אֶת אִמּוֹ יוֹתֵר מֵאָבִיו, מִפְּנֵי
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: It is revealed and known before the One Who spoke and the world came into being that a son honors his mother more than his father, because
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: It is revealed and known before the One who spoke and the world came into being, that a son honors his mother more than his father, because

hebrew_text: שֶׁמְּשַׁדַּלְתּוֹ בִּדְבָרִים, לְפִיכָךְ הִקְדִּים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כִּיבּוּד אָב לְכִיבּוּד אֵם. וְגָלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שֶׁהַבֵּן מִתְיָירֵא מֵאָבִיו יוֹתֵר מֵאִמּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּלַמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה, לְפִיכָךְ הִקְדִּים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹרָא הָאֵם לְמוֹרָא הָאָב.
human_translation: she persuades him with statements Therefore, the Holy One, Blessed be He, preceded the honor father before honor mother. it is revealed and known before the One Who spoke and the world came into being that a son fears his father more than his mother, because teaches him Torah, Therefore, the Holy One, Blessed be He, preceded fear of the mother before fear of the father.
llm_translation: The one who is diligent in matters, therefore the Holy One, blessed be He, prioritized honoring the father over honoring the mother. And it is revealed and known before Whom it is evident that He who spoke and the world came into being, that a son is more fearful of his father than his mother, because he teaches him Torah. Therefore, the Holy One, blessed be He, prioritized the awe of the mother over the awe of the father.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָדָם מְצַעֵר אֶת אָבִיו וְאֶת אִמּוֹ אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: יָפֶה עָשִׂיתִי שֶׁלֹּא דַּרְתִּי בֵּינֵיהֶם, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵי דַּרְתִּי בֵּינֵיהֶם, צִיעֲרוּנִי. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר – כְּאִילּוּ דּוֹחֵק רַגְלֵי שְׁכִינָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ הַשָּׁמַיִם כִּסְאִי וְהָאָרֶץ הֲדֹם רַגְלָי״.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: When a person causes his father and mother suffering, the Holy One, Blessed be He, says: I did well in not dwelling among them, for if I had dwelled among them they would have caused Me suffering Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Anyone who transgresses in private, it is as though he is pushing away the feet of the Divine Presence, As it is stated: “So says the Lord: The heaven is My throne and the earth is My footstool”
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: When a person causes distress to his father and his mother, the Holy One, blessed be He, says: "I have done well by not dwelling among them, for if I had dwelt among them, they would have distressed Me." Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who commits a sin in secret is as though he pushes away the feet of the Divine Presence, as it is stated: "So says the Lord: The heavens are My throne, and the earth is My footstool."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיְּהַלֵּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְלֹא כׇל הָאָרֶץ כְּבוֹדוֹ״. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לָא מְסַגֵּי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בְּגִילּוּי הָרֹאשׁ. אָמַר: שְׁכִינָה לְמַעְלָה מֵרָאשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: prohibited for a person to walk four cubits with an upright posture, as it is stated: “The entire world is full of His glory” Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, would not walk four cubits with an uncovered head. He said: The Divine Presence is above my head,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is forbidden for a person to walk four cubits in an upright posture, as it is stated: "The whole earth is full of His glory." Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, did not walk four cubits with his head uncovered. He said: The Divine Presence is above the heads.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל בֶּן אַלְמָנָה אַחַת אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אַבָּא אוֹמֵר: ״הַשְׁקֵינִי מַיִם״ וְאִימָּא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״הַשְׁקֵינִי מַיִם״, אֵיזֶה מֵהֶם קוֹדֵם? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַנַּח כְּבוֹד אִמְּךָ וַעֲשֵׂה כְּבוֹד אָבִיךָ, שֶׁאַתָּה וְאִמְּךָ חַיָּיבִים בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיךָ. בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר לוֹ כָּךְ.
human_translation: The son of one widow asked Rabbi Eliezer: father says Give me water to drink, and mother says Give me water to drink, which of them first? said to him: Set the honor of your mother, and perform the honor of your father, as you and your mother are obligated in the honor of your father. He came before Rabbi Yehoshua and said this to him.
llm_translation: A widow's son asked Rabbi Eliezer: Abba says, "Honor your father and your mother," and Imma says, "Honor your father and your mother," which one precedes?
