He said to him: Let the honor of your mother be as the honor of your father, for you and your mother are obligated in the honor of your father. He came before Rabbi Yehoshua and said to him thus.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, נִתְגָּרְשָׁה מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִבֵּין רִיסֵי עֵינֶיךָ נִיכָּר שֶׁבֶּן אַלְמָנָה אַתָּה. הַטֵּל לָהֶן מַיִם בְּסֵפֶל וְקַעְקֵעַ לָהֶן כְּתַרְנְגוֹלִין.
human_translation: said to him: My teacher, is divorced, what is said to him: From your eyelashes, it is evident that you are the son of a widow, Pour water for them into a pitcher and squawk at them as chickens.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi, she was divorced, what is the law? He said to him: From between the hairs of your eyes it is recognizable that you are a son of a widow. Pour water for them in a basin and sprinkle for them like roosters.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ עוּלָּא רַבָּה אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹדוּךָ ה׳ כׇּל מַלְכֵי אָרֶץ כִּי שָׁמְעוּ אִמְרֵי פִיךָ״ – ״מַאֲמַר פִּיךָ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי פִיךָ״ – בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא ״אָנֹכִי״ וְ״לֹא יִהְיֶה לְךָ״, אֲמַרוּ אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם: לִכְבוֹד עַצְמוֹ הוּא דּוֹרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Ulla the Great interpreted homiletically at the entrance to the house of the Nasi . What which is written: “All the kings of the earth shall give You thanks, O Lord, for they have heard the words of Your mouth” is not stated: The word of Your mouth, Rather, “The words of Your mouth,” When the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: “I am and, “You shall have no the nations of the world said: He teaches for His own honor,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ulla of the Great House of the Exilarch expounded: What is the meaning of what is written: "The kings of the earth will praise You, O Lord, when they hear the words of Your mouth" (Psalms 138:4)? It does not say "the word of Your mouth," but rather "the words of Your mouth" – at the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said "I" and "You shall have no other gods before Me," the nations of the world said: It is for His own glory that He seeks.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת אָבִיךָ וְאֶת אִמֶּךָ״ חָזְרוּ וְהוֹדוּ לְמַאֲמָרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת. רָבָא אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״רֹאשׁ דְּבָרְךָ אֱמֶת״ – ״רֹאשׁ דְּבָרְךָ״ וְלֹא ״סוֹף דְּבָרְךָ״? אֶלָּא מִסּוֹף דְּבָרְךָ נִיכָּר שֶׁרֹאשׁ דְּבָרְךָ אֱמֶת.
human_translation: Once He said: “Honor your father and your mother” they returned and conceded of the first statements, Rava said: from here: “The beginning of Your word is truth” the beginning of Your word but not the end of Your word? Rather, from the end of Your word it is apparent that the beginning of Your word is truth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Since it says: "Honor your father and your mother," they returned and acknowledged the earlier statements. Rava said: From here: "The beginning of your word is truth" - "the beginning of your word" and not "the end of your word"? Rather, from the end of your word it is recognized that the beginning of your word is truth.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב עוּלָּא: עַד הֵיכָן כִּיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם? אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וּרְאוּ מָה עָשָׂה נׇכְרִי אֶחָד בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן, וְדָמָא בֶּן נְתִינָה שְׁמוֹ. פַּעַם אַחַת בִּקְּשׁוּ חֲכָמִים פְּרַקְמַטְיָא בְּשִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא שָׂכָר, וְהָיָה מַפְתֵּחַ מוּנָּח תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָבִיו, וְלֹא צִיעֲרוֹ.
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Ulla: How far honoring one’s father and mother? said to them: Go and see what one gentile did in Ashkelon, and his name was Dama ben Netina. Once the Sages sought merchandise [ perakmatya ] for six hundred thousand profit, but the key was placed under his father’s head, And not disturb
llm_translation: Inquired from him Rav Ula: Until where is the honor due to father and mother? He said to them: Go out and see what one gentile did in Ashkelon, and his name was Dama ben Netina. Once the Sages sought to purchase pearls for sixty myriads of denarii, and the key was placed beneath the pillow of his father, and he did not disturb him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עַד הֵיכָן כִּיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם? אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וּרְאוּ מָה עָשָׂה נׇכְרִי אֶחָד לְאָבִיו בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן, וְדָמָא בֶּן נְתִינָה שְׁמוֹ. בִּקְּשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ חֲכָמִים אֲבָנִים לָאֵפוֹד בְּשִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא שָׂכָר, וְרַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי בִּשְׁמוֹנִים רִיבּוֹא, וְהָיָה מַפְתֵּחַ מוּנָּח תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָבִיו, וְלֹא צִיעֲרוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: How far of honoring one’s father and mother? said to them: Go and see what one gentile did for his father in Ashkelon, and name was Dama ben Netina. the Sages wished stones from him for the ephod for six hundred thousand profit, and Rav Kahana taught eight hundred thousand And the key was placed under his father’s head, and he not disturb him.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They asked Rabbi Eliezer, "Until what point is honoring father and mother required?" He said to them, "Go and see what one non-Jew did to his father in Ashkelon, and his name was Dama ben Netina. The Sages sought from him precious stones for the ephod for sixty myriads of denarii, and Rav Kahana offered for eighty myriads, and he had the key placed under his father's pillow, and he did not disturb him."

hebrew_text: לְשָׁנָה הָאַחֶרֶת נָתַן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שְׂכָרוֹ, שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה לוֹ פָּרָה אֲדֻמָּה בְּעֶדְרוֹ. נִכְנְסוּ חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶצְלוֹ, אָמַר לָהֶם: יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי בָּכֶם שֶׁאִם אֲנִי מְבַקֵּשׁ מִכֶּם כׇּל מָמוֹן שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם אַתֶּם נוֹתְנִין לִי, אֶלָּא אֵין אֲנִי מְבַקֵּשׁ מִכֶּם אֶלָּא אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן שֶׁהִפְסַדְתִּי בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹד אַבָּא.
human_translation: The next year the Holy One, Blessed be He, gave his reward, as a red heifer was born in his herd, the Sages of Israel came to him he said to them: I know, you, that if I ask for all the money in the world you give to me. But I ask only that money that I lost due to honor of Father.
llm_translation: In the following year, the Holy One, blessed be He, gave his reward, as a red heifer was born in his flock. The sages of Israel entered to him, and he said to them: "I know about you that if I were to ask of you all the wealth in the world, you would give it to me. However, I am not asking of you anything except for that wealth which I have lost for the honor of my father."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: וּמָה מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה – כָּךְ, מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: גָּדוֹל מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina says: And if one who is not commanded and he performs this all the more so commanded and performs As Rabbi Ḥanina says: Greater is commanded and performs than one who is not commanded and performs
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: And what about one who is not commanded and does it - it is thus, compared to one who is commanded and does - how much more so. For Rabbi Chanina said: Greater is one who is commanded and does than one who is not commanded and does.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאן דַּהֲוָה אָמַר לִי הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: סוֹמֵא פָּטוּר מִן הַמִּצְוֹת – עָבֵידְנָא יוֹמָא טָבָא לְרַבָּנַן, דְּהָא לָא מִיפְּקִידְנָא וְהָא עָבֵידְנָא. הַשְׁתָּא דְּשַׁמְעִיתַהּ לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: גָּדוֹל מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה יוֹתֵר מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה, אַדְּרַבָּה: מַאן דְּאָמַר לִי דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה עָבֵידְנָא יוֹמָא טָבָא לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef, said: At first I would say: someone would tell me halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says: A blind person is exempt from the mitzvot, I would make a festive day for the rabbis, as I am not commanded and yet I perform Now that I have heard that which Rabbi Ḥanina says: Greater is commanded and performs than one who is not commanded and performs on the contrary: someone would tell me halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, I would make a festive day for the rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Initially, I used to say: Whoever tells me that the halakha is like Rabbi Yehudah who says, "A blind person is exempt from mitzvot," I would make a feast for the Rabbis, for I would not be held accountable, and he would. Now that you have heard what Rabbi Chanina said: "Greater is one who is commanded and fulfills than one who is not commanded and fulfills," to the contrary: Whoever tells me that the halakha is not like Rabbi Yehudah, I will make a feast for the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיָה לָבוּשׁ סִירְקוֹן שֶׁל זָהָב, וְהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בֵּין גְּדוֹלֵי רוֹמִי. וּבָאתָה אִמּוֹ וּקְרָעַתּוּ מִמֶּנּוּ, וְטָפְחָה לוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וְיָרְקָה לוֹ בְּפָנָיו, וְלֹא הִכְלִימָהּ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: Once was wearing a fine cloak [ sirkon ] of gold, and was sitting among the nobles Rome. And his mother came to him and tore from him and smacked him on the head and spat in his face, and he did not embarrass her.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "Once there was a circus performer's garment made of gold, and he was sitting among the great men of Rome. His mother came and tore it from him, slapped him on the head, spat in his face, and he did not shame her."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי אֲבִימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: יֵשׁ מַאֲכִיל לְאָבִיו פַּסְיוֹנֵי וְטוֹרְדוֹ מִן הָעוֹלָם, וְיֵשׁ מַטְחִינוֹ בָּרֵיחַיִם
human_translation: Avimi, son of Rabbi Abbahu, taught: There is who feeds his father pheasant [ pasyonei ] and causes him to be removed from the World, and there is who makes him grind with a millstone,
llm_translation: It was taught by Avimi, son of Rabbi Avahu: There are those who feed their father delicacies and remove him from the world, and there are those who appease him with barley bread.

hebrew_text: וּמְבִיאוֹ לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: brings him to the life of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: And bring him to the life of the world to come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כְּגוֹן אֲבִימִי בְּרִי קִיֵּים מִצְוַת כִּיבּוּד. חַמְשָׁה בְּנֵי סְמִיכִי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לַאֲבִימִי בְּחַיֵּי אָבִיו, וְכִי הֲוָה אֲתָא רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, קָרֵי אַבָּבָא, רָהֵיט וְאָזֵיל וּפָתַח לֵיהּ וְאָמַר: אִין, אִין, עַד דְּמָטֵאי הָתָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: such as Avimi, my son, fulfilled the mitzva of honoring Avimi had five sons during his father’s lifetime ordained And when Rabbi Abbahu, came and called at the gate would run and go to open for him. And before he arrived there, he say: Yes, yes,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: For example, Avimi son of Kiyayim fulfilled the commandment of honoring his father. There were five students of the semikha who were to Avimi during the lifetime of his father. When Rabbi Avahu came, he called him "Father," he ran, went, opened for him, and said: "No, no, until you come there."

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא. אַדְּאַיְיתִי לֵיהּ נַמְנֵם. גָּחֵין קָאֵי עֲלֵיהּ עַד דְּאִיתְּעַר. אִיסְתַּיַּיעָא מִילְּתֵיהּ וּדְרַשׁ אֲבִימִי ״מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף״.
human_translation: One day said to Give me water to drink. Before he brought him dozed off. bent over stood over him until awoke. aided him, and interpreting “A song to Asaph”
llm_translation: One day he said to him: "Give me water." When he brought it to him, he dozed off. A roof beam was leaning over him until he woke up. He found solace in his words and expounded: "A Psalm of Asaph."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר אֲבוּהּ לְאַבָּיֵי: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא, דְּעַד דְּאָתֵינָא מִבֵּי רַב אַבָּא מְדַלֵּי לִי כָּסָא וְאִמָּא מָזְגָה לִי, הֵיכִי אֶיעֱבֵיד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵאִמָּךְ קַבֵּיל, וּמֵאֲבוּךְ לָא תְּקַבֵּל דְּכֵיוָן דְּבַר תּוֹרָה הוּא חָלְשָׁה דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov bar Avuh said to Abaye: such as I, before I return from the study hall my father brings me a cup and my mother pours for me, how should I act? said to him: Accept from your mother, but do not accept it from your father, as, since he is a Torah scholar he will be disheartened
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yaakov son of Avuh to Abbaye: For example, I, as long as I come from the house of Rav Abba, a chair is brought to me and my mother pours me a cup, what should I do? He said to him: Receive from your mother, but do not receive from your father, for since it is a matter of Torah, his opinion is weak.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא אִמָּא דְּכֹל אֵימַת דַּהֲוָת בָּעֲיָא לְמֵיסֵק לְפוּרְיָא גָּחִין וּסְלִיק לַהּ, וְכֹל אֵימַת דֵּהוָת נָחִית, נֶחְתַּת עֲלוּיָה. אֲתָא וְקָא מִשְׁתַּבַּח בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. אָמְרֵי לֵיהּ: עֲדָיִין לֹא הִגַּעְתָּ לַחֲצִי כִּיבּוּד. כְּלוּם זָרְקָה אַרְנָקִי בְּפָנֶיךָ לַיָּם וְלֹא הִכְלַמְתָּהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon had a certain mother, that whenever she wished to ascend into bed he would bend over and her to ascend, and whenever she wished to descend she would descend onto him. He came and praised study hall They said to him: You still have not reached even half of honor Has she threw a purse into the sea in front of you, and you did not embarrass her?
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon had a certain mother, whenever she wanted to go out to the marketplace, she would go out and come back, and whenever she would come back, she would praise the study hall. They said to her: "You have not yet reached half of honor. If a purse full of money were thrown in your face and you did not feel ashamed, would you not be ashamed?"

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף כִּי הֲוָה שָׁמַע קָל כַּרְעָא דְאִמֵּיהּ, אָמַר: אֵיקוּם מִקַּמֵּי שְׁכִינָה דְּאָתְיָא. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁלֹּא חֲמָאָן. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּי עִבְּרַתּוּ אִמּוֹ – מֵת אָבִיו, יְלָדַתּוּ – מֵתָה אִמּוֹ. וְכֵן אַבָּיֵי. אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם! הָהִיא מְרַבְּיָנְתֵּיהּ הֲוַאי.
human_translation: When Rav Yosef heard his mother’s footsteps, he say: I will stand before the arriving Divine Presence. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Fortunate is one who never saw Rabbi Yoḥanan When his mother was pregnant with him, his father died; she gave birth to him, his mother died. And the same Abaye. Is that so, But didn’t Abaye say My mother told me? That was his foster mother,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, when he heard the voice of his mother's footsteps, said: "Arise for the arrival of the Divine Presence." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Fortunate is one who was not suspected." Rabbi Yochanan, when he angered his mother - his father died, when he upset his wife - his mother died. And so too Abaye. Is it not so? But didn't Abaye say: "My mother told me!" That one was his stepmother.

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא אִמָּא זְקֵינָה. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: בָּעֲיָנָא תַּכְשִׁיטִין. עֲבַד לַהּ. בָּעֲיָנָא גַּבְרָא: נְיעַיֵּין לָךְ. בָּעֲיָנָא גַּבְרָא דְּשַׁפִּיר כְּוָתָךְ, שַׁבְקַהּ וַאֲזַל לְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Asi had an elderly mother. She said to him: I want jewelry, he made for her. I want a man I will seek for you. I want a husband who is as handsome as you. he left her and went to Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: Rav Assi had that certain old mother. She said to him: I need ornaments. He made for her. A man said to her: I will bring you ornaments. A man who was handsome like you, he left and went to the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע דְּקָא אָזְלָה אַבָּתְרֵיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לָצֵאת מֵאֶרֶץ לְחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָסוּר. לִקְרַאת אִמָּא מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. אִתָּרַח פּוּרְתָּא, הֲדַר אֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַסִּי, נִתְרַצֵּיתָ לָצֵאת – הַמָּקוֹם יַחֲזִירְךָ לְשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: heard that she was following him He came before Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: What is leaving Eretz outside of Eretz said to him: prohibited. to greet mother, what is said to him: I do not know. waited a little then came said to him: Asi, you are determined to leave. the Omnipresent return you in peace,
llm_translation: Hear that she went after him. Came before Rabbi Yochanan, said to him: What about going from one land to another land? He said to him: Forbidden. What about going to meet one's mother? He said to him: I do not know. He went out, he returned. He said to him: Go, you have been permitted to go - the place will bring you back in peace.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם, דִּלְמָא מִירְתָּח רָתַח? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמַר לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַמָּקוֹם יַחֲזִירְךָ לְשָׁלוֹם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאִם אִיתָא דְּרָתַח – לָא הֲוָה מְבָרֵךְ לֵךְ. אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי שְׁמַע לַאֲרוֹנַאּ דְּקָאָתֵי. אָמַר: אִי יְדַעִי לָא נְפַקִי.
human_translation: came before Rabbi Elazar, He said to God forbid, perhaps is angry said to him: What did he say to you? said to him: the Omnipresent return you in peace. said to him: If it is so that he was angry, he would not have blessed you. In the meantime, heard that her coffin was coming, He said: Had I known I would not have left,
llm_translation: He came before Rabbi Elazar. He said to him: "Peace be upon you, perhaps you have become angry?" He said to him: "What did he say to you?" He said to him: "May the Omnipresent return you to peace." He said to him: "And if he comes back angry - would he not have blessed you." Meanwhile, he heard the sound of a chest coming. He said: "If I had known, I would not have gone out."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְכַבְּדוֹ בְּחַיָּיו, וּמְכַבְּדוֹ בְּמוֹתוֹ. בְּחַיָּיו כֵּיצַד? הַנִּשְׁמָע בִּדְבַר אָבִיו לְמָקוֹם, לֹא יֹאמַר: ״שַׁלְּחוּנִי בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי״, ״מַהֲרוּנִי בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי״, ״פִּטְרוּנִי בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי״. אֶלָּא כּוּלְּהוּ: ״בִּשְׁבִיל אַבָּא״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One honors in his life and honors him in his death. How in his life? One who goes to a place on the command of his father should not say Send me on my own behalf, Hurry up on my own behalf, Allow me take leave on my own behalf. Rather, all on Father’s behalf,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Honor him in his lifetime, and honor him in his death. How do you honor him in his lifetime? If he hears his father say to him, "Go to a certain place," he should not say, "Send me for my own sake," "Hurry me for my own sake," "Release me for my own sake." Rather, all of them: "For the sake of my father."

hebrew_text: בְּמוֹתוֹ כֵּיצַד? הָיָה אוֹמֵר דָּבָר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּיו, לֹא יֹאמַר: ״כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא״, אֶלָּא: ״כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא מָרִי, הֲרֵינִי כַּפָּרַת מִשְׁכָּבוֹ״. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי תּוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אוֹמֵר: ״זִכְרוֹנוֹ לִבְרָכָה לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא״.
human_translation: How in his death? he says a matter he heard from his mouth, he should not say: So said Father. Rather, So said Father, my teacher, may I be an atonement for his resting And this applies within twelve months From this onward he says: May his memory be for a blessing, for the life of the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: In his death, how so? He would say a matter heard from his mouth, he should not say, "Thus said my father," rather: "Thus said my father, my teacher, behold I am as an atonement of his resting place." And these matters for twelve months, from here onward he should say: "May his memory be for a blessing for the life of the world to come."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חָכָם – מְשַׁנֶּה שֵׁם אָבִיו וְשֵׁם רַבּוֹ. תּוּרְגְּמָן – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁנֶּה לֹא שֵׁם אָבִיו וְלֹא שֵׁם רַבּוֹ. אֲבוּהּ דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא אֲבוּהּ דִּמְתוּרְגְּמָן – אַטּוּ תּוּרְגְּמָן לָאו בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא?
human_translation: The Sages taught: A Sage change the name of his father, And name of his teacher. The disseminator, changes neither the name of his father nor the name of his teacher. whose father If we say the father of the disseminator, is that to say the disseminator is not obligated
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A wise person - he repeats the name of his father and the name of his teacher. An interpreter - he does not repeat either the name of his father or the name of his teacher. Whose father is he? If you say the father of the interpreter - but is the interpreter not obligated to honor his father?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: שֵׁם אָבִיו שֶׁל חָכָם, וְשֵׁם רַבּוֹ שֶׁל חָכָם. כִּי הָא דְּמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי כִּי הֲוָה דָּרֵישׁ בְּפִירְקָא, אִיהוּ אָמַר: אַבָּא מָרִי, וְאָמוֹרֵיהּ אָמַר: הָכִי אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: name of the Sage’s father and the name of the Sage’s teacher. like that which Mar bar Rav Ashi when he would teach at his regular lecture he would say: my father, my teacher; and his disseminator say: So said Rav Ashi.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The name of the father of a sage, and the name of the teacher of a sage. For this is like what Mar son of Rav Ashi, when he would expound in the study hall, he would say: "My father, my teacher," and his mother would say: "So said Rav Ashi."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ מוֹרָא וְאֵיזֶהוּ כִּיבּוּד? מוֹרָא – לֹא עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, וְלֹא יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, וְלֹא סוֹתֵר אֶת דְּבָרָיו, וְלֹא מַכְרִיעוֹ. כִּיבּוּד – מַאֲכִיל וּמַשְׁקֶה, מַלְבִּישׁ וּמְכַסֶּה, מַכְנִיס וּמוֹצִיא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: What is fear and what is honor? Fear One may not stand in his place, and may not sit in his place, and may not contradict his statements and he may not choose sides honor? He gives food and drink, dresses and covers brings in and takes out
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: What is fear (mora) and what is honor (kavod)? Fear - not standing in his place, and not sitting in his place, and not contradicting his words, and not deciding for him. Honor - feeding and giving drink, clothing and covering, bringing in and taking out.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ:
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before
llm_translation: He asked them:

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁל מִי? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: מִשֶּׁל בֵּן. רַב נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: מִשֶּׁל אָב. אוֹרוֹ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב יִרְמְיָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לִבְרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִרְמְיָה, כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשֶּׁל אָב.
human_translation: From whose Rav Yehuda says: From of the son. Rav Natan bar Oshaya said: From of the father. The Sages gave ruling to Rav Yirmeya, and some say to the son of Rav Yirmeya: like the one who says from of the father.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Whose parable? Rav Yehudah said: The parable of a son. Rav Natan bar Oshaya said: The parable of a father. The sages illuminated it for Rav Yirmeya, and they said to him in the name of the son of Rav Yirmeya, as one who says the parable of a father.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: נֶאֱמַר: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת אָבִיךָ וְאֶת אִמֶּךָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״כַּבֵּד אֶת ה׳ מֵהוֹנֶךָ״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּחֶסְרוֹן כִּיס, אַף כָּאן בְּחֶסְרוֹן כִּיס. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁל אָב, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? לְבִיטּוּל מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection It is stated: “Honor your father and your mother” and it is stated: “Honor the Lord with your wealth” Just as there through monetary loss, so too here through monetary loss. And if you say from the father, what difference to to neglect of work.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was raised: It is stated: "Honor your father and your mother," and it is stated: "Honor the Lord from your wealth." Just as there, with a loss of money, so too here, with a loss of money. And if you say, from the analogy of the father, what practical difference does it make to him? For the cessation of work.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי אַחִים, שְׁנֵי שׁוּתָּפִין הָאָב וּבְנוֹ, הָרַב וְתַלְמִידוֹ – פּוֹדִין זֶה לָזֶה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וּמַאֲכִילִין זֶה לָזֶה מַעְשַׂר עָנִי.
human_translation: Come hear Two brothers, two partners a father and son, a rabbi and his student, may redeem second tithe for each other And they may feed each other poor man’s tithe.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two brothers, two partners, the father and his son, the teacher and his student - they redeem one from the other with the second tithe, and they feed one another with the tithe for the poor.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁל בֵּן, נִמְצָא זֶה פּוֹרֵעַ חוֹבוֹ מִשֶּׁל עֲנִיִּים! – לָא צְרִיכָא, לְהַעְדָּפָה.
human_translation: And if you say from of the son, finds this repays his obligation from of the poor, No, necessary to surplus
llm_translation: "If you say it is a parable of a son, this one is found to be neglecting his obligation towards the poor! - It is unnecessary, for the sake of preference."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: תָּבֹא מְאֵירָה לְמִי שֶׁמַּאֲכִיל אֶת אָבִיו מַעְשַׂר עָנִי. וְאִי לְהַעְדָּפָה, מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ?! אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי זִילָא בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: If so, that which is taught with regard to Rabbi Yehuda says: May a curse come upon one who feeds his father poor man’s tithe. And if with regard to a surplus, what difference is there? Even so, it is a disrespectful matter
llm_translation: So it is, that is what is taught regarding the statement: Rabbi Yehuda said: "A woman should come to one who feeds his father from the tithe of the poor. And if for preference, what difference does it make? Even so, go and learn from it."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר עַד הֵיכָן כִּיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם? אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּטּוֹל אַרְנָקִי וְיִזְרְקֶנּוּ לַיָּם בְּפָנָיו וְאֵינוֹ מַכְלִימוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁל אָב, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? בְּרָאוּי לְיוֹרְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear: They asked Rabbi Eliezer how far honoring father and mother. said to them: Such that takes a purse and throw it into the sea in front of and does not embarrass him. And if you say from of the father, what difference to to fit to inherit him.
llm_translation: Come and hear: They asked Rabbi Eliezer, "Until what point must one honor their father and mother?" He said to them: "To the extent that he should take his wallet and throw it into the sea before them, and not embarrass them. And if you say, 'What benefit does he derive from honoring his father?' It is fitting for his inheritance."

hebrew_text: וְכִי הָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא. דְּרַב הוּנָא קְרַע שִׁירָאֵי בְּאַנְפֵּי רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ. אָמַר: אֵיזִיל אִיחְזֵי אִי רָתַח אִי לָא רָתַח. וְדִלְמָא רָתַח וְקָעָבַר אַ״לִּפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשֹׁל״! דְּמָחֵיל לֵיהּ לִיקָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And this is as Rabba bar Rav Huna, when Rav Huna tore silk garments in front of his son Rabba. said I will go see if he becomes angry or does not become angry, But perhaps would become angry violate “Nor put a stumbling block before the blind” where forgone his honor
llm_translation: And this is similar to that which Rabba bar Rav Huna. Rav Huna tore the garments of Rabba his son. He said: "Shall I go and see if it is boiling or not boiling?" Perhaps it is boiling, and he will transgress the prohibition, "You shall not place a stumbling block before the blind"! He was lenient with him.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָעָבַר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּשְׁחִית״! דַּעֲבַד לֵיהּ בְּפוּמְבְּיָינֵי. וְדִילְמָא מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא רָתַח? דְּעָבֵד לֵיהּ בִּשְׁעַת רִיתְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: But he violates the prohibition: Do not destroy that made at the seam, Perhaps due to that the son did not become angry, He did this when angry
llm_translation: And this case of a grave, is it not prohibited due to "do not destroy"! He did it with mere pebbles. And perhaps because of this it does not boil the prohibition? He did it at the time of its boiling.

hebrew_text: מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְחֶזְקֵאל לְרָמִי בְּרֵיהּ: הַנִּשְׂרָפִים בַּנִּסְקָלִים, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִדּוֹנוּ בִּסְקִילָה, שֶׁהַשְּׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Yeḥezkel taught his son Rami: burned with stoned Rabbi Shimon says: are judged with stoning, as the burning is more severe.
llm_translation: He would teach him, Rav Yechzekel to Rami his son: Those burned with the stoning, Rabbi Shimon says: They are judged with stoning, for burning is severe.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ: אַבָּא, לָא תַּיתְנְיֵיהּ הָכִי. מַאי אִירְיָא שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, תִּיפּוֹק לִי דְּרוּבָּא נִסְקָלִים נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא הָכִי אַיתְנְיֵיהּ: הַנִּסְקָלִים בַּנִּשְׂרָפִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son, said to him: Father, do not teach this way, why specifically burning is more severe Let him derive that the majority are stoned. Rather, I will teach it this who are stoned with who are burned,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah his son: Abba, do not give it like this. What is the matter? Burning is severe, let it come out to me that they are stoned! Rather, give it like this: The stoned ones are among the burned ones.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים יִדּוֹנוּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, שֶׁהַסְּקִילָה חֲמוּרָה. מַאי אִירְיָא דִּסְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה? תִּיפּוֹק לִי דְּרוּבָּא נִשְׂרָפִים נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: said to him: If so, say the latter clause And the Rabbis say they should be judged with burning, as the stoning is more severe. why specifically stoning is more severe? Let him derive that the majority are burned,
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, let me say the conclusion: And the sages say they are judged by burning, for stoning is severe. What is the meaning of severe stoning? Come out to me, for they are burned in a pit!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם רַבָּנַן הוּא דְּקָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה – לָא, סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: said to him: there the Rabbis are saying to Rabbi Shimon That which you said, burning is more severe, not stoning is more severe.
llm_translation: He said to him: There, the Rabbis are the ones who are saying to Rabbi Shimon: When you say "severe burning" - no, it is severe stoning.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, לָא תֵּימָא לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּךְ הָכִי. דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו עוֹבֵר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ ״אַבָּא עָבַרְתָּ עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה״, אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אַבָּא כָּךְ כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה״. ״כָּךְ כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה״ – צַעוֹרֵי קָא מְצַעַר לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אַבָּא, מִקְרָא כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה כָּךְ״.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: Big-toothed do not speak to your father like that, As it is taught one’s father was transgressing a Torah matter, he should not say to him Father, you transgressed a Torah matter. Rather, he should say to him: Father, so it is written in the Torah. This is written in the Torah, he will cause him suffering. Rather, say to him: Father, this verse is written in the Torah,
llm_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: "Shinana, do not say to him like this to your father." As it was taught: If his father transgressed the words of the Torah, one should not say to him, "Father, you transgressed the words of the Torah," but rather say to him, "Father, this is what is written in the Torah." "This is what is written in the Torah" – it causes him distress! Rather, one should say to him, "Father, this is how the verse is written in the Torah."

hebrew_text: אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַתְיָא אוֹמֵר: אַבָּא אוֹמֵר: ״הַשְׁקֵינִי מַיִם״, וּמִצְוָה לַעֲשׂוֹת – מַנִּיחַ אֲנִי כְּבוֹד אַבָּא, וְעוֹשֶׂה אֶת הַמִּצְוָה. שֶׁאֲנִי וְאַבָּא חַיָּיבִים בַּמִּצְוָה. אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם אֶפְשָׁר לַמִּצְוָה לֵיעָשׂוֹת עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים – תֵּיעָשֶׂה עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, וְיֵלֵךְ הוּא בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו. אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: הֲלָכָה כְּאִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Elazar ben Matya says: father says: Give me water, and a mitzva to perform I set aside the honor of my father and perform the mitzva, as my father and I are obligated in the mitzva. Isi ben Yehuda says: If it is possible for mitzva to be performed by others, let it be performed by others, and he should go to the honor his father, Rav Mattana says: halakha is in accordance with Isi ben Yehuda.
llm_translation: Elazar ben Matya says: Abba says, "Give me water," and it is a commandment to do so - I place the honor of my father before me, and I fulfill the commandment. For both I and my father are obligated in the commandment. Issi ben Yehuda says: If it is possible for the commandment to be done by others - let it be done by others, and he shall go in the honor of his father. Rav Matna said: The halakha is in accordance with Issi ben Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָאָב שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל. הָרַב שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – אֵין כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Sheila says Rav Mattana says Rav Ḥisda says: a father who forgoes his honor, his honor is forgone, a rabbi who forgoes his honor, his honor is not forgone.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Sheilah said in the name of Rav Matna who said in the name of Rav Chisda: If a father forgives his honor - his honor is forgiven. If a teacher forgives his honor - his honor is not forgiven.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ הָרַב שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַה׳ הֹלֵךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם יוֹמָם״. אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עָלְמָא דִּילֵיהּ הוּא, וְתוֹרָה דִּילֵיהּ הִיא – מָחֵיל לֵיהּ לִיקָרֵיהּ,
human_translation: And Rav Yosef says: Even a rabbi who forgoes his honor, his honor is forgone, as it is stated: “And the Lord went before them by day” Rava said: How can be compared? There, the Holy One, Blessed be He, the world is His and the Torah is His, forgo His honor.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Even if a person forgives his honor - his honor is forgiven. As it is stated: "And the Lord went before them by day." Rava said: Is it so now?! There, the Holy One, blessed be He, is His world, and the Torah is His - He forgives for His honor.

hebrew_text: הָכָא תּוֹרָה דִּילֵיהּ הִיא?! הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: אִין, תּוֹרָה דִּילֵיהּ הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְתוֹרָתוֹ יֶהְגֶּה יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה״.
human_translation: here, is it his Torah, Rava then said: Yes, it is his Torah, as it is written: and in his Torah he meditates day and night”
llm_translation: Here is the Torah of his own?! Then Rava said: No, it is his own Torah, as it is written: "And he shall meditate on his Torah day and night."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא רָבָא מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי הִלּוּלָא דִּבְרֵיהּ וְדַל לֵיהּ כָּסָא לְרַב פָּפָּא וּלְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְקָמוּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ. לְרַב מָרִי וּלְרַב פִּנְחָס בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, וְלָא קָמוּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ. אִיקְּפַד וַאֲמַר: הָנוּ רַבָּנַן רַבָּנַן, וְהָנוּ רַבָּנַן לָאו רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Is that so? But Rava served drinks at his son’s wedding celebration, and he poured a cup for Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, and they stood before him for Rav Mari and Rav Pineḥas, son of Rav Ḥisda, they did not stand before him. became angry and said: these Sages, Sages, and those Sages, not Sages?
llm_translation: I?! But Rava would pour wine for the members of the Hillel household, and he would give a cup to Rav Papa and to Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua, and they would rise before him. To Rav Mari and to Rav Pinchas, the son of Rav Chisda, and they would not rise before him. He became upset and said: Are these scholars scholars, and those scholars not scholars?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, רַב פָּפָּא הֲוָה מַשְׁקֵי בֵּי הִלּוּלָא דְּאַבָּא מָר בְּרֵיהּ וְדַלִּי לֵיהּ כָּסָא לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה וְלָא קָם מִקַּמֵּיהּ וְאִיקְּפַד! אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי – הִידּוּר מֶיעְבַּד לֵיהּ בָּעוּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rav Pappa was serving drinks at the wedding celebration [ hillula ] of Abba Mar, his son, and he poured a cup for Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, and he did not stand before him, and became angry. even so, required to perform reverence,
llm_translation: And so, Rav Papa was drinking at the house of Hillel the son of Abba the Master, and he poured a cup for Rabbi Yitzchak the son of Rav Yehuda, but he did not rise before him, and he became angry! Even so - the honor was fulfilled for him in that place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הָרַב שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל, נָשִׂיא שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – אֵין כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל. מֵיתִיבִי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי צָדוֹק שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין בְּבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל עוֹמֵד וּמַשְׁקֶה עֲלֵיהֶם. נָתַן הַכּוֹס לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְלֹא נְטָלוֹ, נְתָנוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְקִיבְּלוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה זֶה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ? אָנוּ יוֹשְׁבִין וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּרִיבִּי עוֹמֵד וּמַשְׁקֶה עָלֵינוּ?!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even according to the one who says a rabbi forgoes honor him, his honor is forgone, a Nasi forgoes honor him, his honor is not forgone. The Gemara raises an objection: an incident involving Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Tzadok, who were reclining at the wedding of Rabban Gamliel’s son. And Rabban Gamliel, was standing over them and serving them drinks. He gave the cup to Rabbi Eliezer and he would not accept it; he gave it to Rabbi Yehoshua and he accepted it. Rabbi Eliezer said to him: What is this, Yehoshua? We sit and the esteemed Rabban Gamliel stands over us and serves us drinks?
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Even according to the one who says, "One who forgives his honor, his honor is forgiven," if a prince forgives his honor, his honor is not forgiven. It was raised: It once happened with Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Tzadok who were reclining in the house of feasting of Rabban Gamliel's son, and Rabban Gamliel was standing and serving them. He gave the cup to Rabbi Eliezer, and he did not take it; he gave it to Rabbi Yehoshua, and he accepted it. Rabbi Eliezer said to him: What is this, Yehoshua? We are sitting, and Rabban Gamliel is standing and serving us?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָצִינוּ גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ, אַבְרָהָם גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ – וְשִׁמֵּשׁ. אַבְרָהָם גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר הָיָה, וְכָתוּב בּוֹ: ״וְהוּא עָמַד עֲלֵיהֶם״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמְרוּ: כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת נִדְמוּ לוֹ – לֹא נִדְמוּ לוֹ אֶלָּא לְעַרְבִיִּים. וְאָנוּ, לֹא יְהֵא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּרִיבִּי עוֹמֵד וּמַשְׁקֶה עָלֵינוּ?!
human_translation: said to him: We found greater than him who served Abraham greater than him and he served Abraham was the greatest of generation and it is written about him: “And he stood over them And lest you say: appeared to him as ministering angels, they appeared to him only as Arabs. And should not the esteemed Rabban Gamliel stand over us and serve us drinks?
llm_translation: He said to him: We found one greater than him who served, Abraham was greater than him - and served. Abraham was the greatest of his generation, and it is written about him: "And he stood over them." And lest you say: Like ministering angels they appeared to him - they did not appear to him except as Arabs. And we, shall Rabban Gamliel son of Rabbi stand and serve us?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי צָדוֹק: עַד מָתַי אַתֶּם מַנִּיחִים כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם וְאַתֶּם עוֹסְקִים בִּכְבוֹד הַבְּרִיּוֹת? הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵשִׁיב רוּחוֹת, וּמַעֲלֶה נְשִׂיאִים, וּמוֹרִיד מָטָר, וּמַצְמִיחַ אֲדָמָה, וְעוֹרֵךְ שׁוּלְחָן לִפְנֵי כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְאָנוּ לֹא יְהֵא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּרִיבִּי עוֹמֵד וּמַשְׁקֶה עָלֵינוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Tzadok said to them: For how long will you ignore the honor to the Omnipresent, and deal with the honor of people? the Holy One, Blessed be He, makes winds blow, and raises clouds, and brings rain, and causes earth to sprout, and sets a table before each and every And should not the esteemed Rabban Gamliel stand over us and serve us drinks?
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Tzadok: Until when are you leaving the honor of the Omnipresent and you are engaging in the honor of creatures? The Holy One, blessed be He, makes the winds blow, raises leaders, brings down rain, causes the earth to produce, sets a table before each and every one, and shall we not have Rabban Gamliel the son of Rabbi standing and providing for us?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: נָשִׂיא שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל, מֶלֶךְ שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – אֵין כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׂוֹם תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ״ – שֶׁתְּהֵא אֵימָתוֹ עָלֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated as follows: Rav Ashi said: Even according to the one who says a Nasi forgoes honor him, his honor is forgone, a king forgoes honor him, his honor is not forgone. As it is stated: “You shall set a king over you” that his fear should be upon you.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Ashi said: Even according to the one who says, "A prince who forgives his honor - his honor is forgiven, a king who forgives his honor - his honor is not forgiven," as it is stated: "You shall surely set a king over you" - that his fear shall be upon you.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מִפְּנֵי שֵׂיבָה תָּקוּם״ – יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ מִפְּנֵי זָקֵן אַשְׁמַאי? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָקֵן״, וְאֵין זָקֵן אֶלָּא חָכָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶסְפָה לִּי שִׁבְעִים אִישׁ מִזִּקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: אֵין זָקֵן אֶלָּא מִי שֶׁקָּנָה חׇכְמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ קָנָנִי רֵאשִׁית דַּרְכּוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Before the hoary head you shall stand might before a simple [ ashmai ] elder. the verse states: “elder,” and an “elder” nothing other a wise man, as it is stated: “Gather unto Me seventy men of the Elders of Israel, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: An “elder [ zaken ]” nothing other one who has acquired wisdom. as it is stated “The Lord acquired me [ kanani ] at the beginning of His way”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Because of gray hair you shall rise" - Could this even be referring to Ashmai the Elder? The verse teaches: "Elder," and an Elder is none other than a Sage, as it is stated: "Gather for Me seventy men from the Elders of Israel." Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: An Elder is only one who has acquired wisdom, as it is stated: "The Lord acquired me as the beginning of His way."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יַעֲמוֹד מִפָּנָיו מִמָּקוֹם רָחוֹק? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ״ – לֹא אָמַרְתִּי קִימָה אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ הִידּוּר.
human_translation: might one must stand before from a distance. the verse states: “You shall stand and you shall revere” I said stand only in a place where there is reverence.
llm_translation: He is able to stand before Him from a distant place? Scripture teaches: "Arise and adorn yourself" - I did not say standing except in a place where there is adornment.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהַדְּרֶנּוּ בְּמָמוֹן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ״ – מָה קִימָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס, אַף הִידּוּר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס. יָכוֹל יַעֲמוֹד מִפָּנָיו מִבֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּמִבֵּית הַמֶּרְחָץ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ״ – לֹא אָמַרְתִּי קִימָה אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ הִידּוּר.
human_translation: might he should revere him through money, the verse states: “You shall stand and you shall revere.” Just as standing includes no monetary loss, so too, reverence that includes no monetary loss. might one should stand before him in the lavatory or in the bathhouse. the verse states: “You shall stand and you shall revere,” I said standing only in a place where there is reverence.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Can one adorn him with money? The Torah says: "You shall rise and adorn" - just as rising does not involve a loss of money, so too adornment that does not involve a loss of money. Can one stand before him from the bathroom and from the bathhouse? The Torah says: "You shall rise and adorn" - I only said rising in a place where there is adornment.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יַעֲצִים עֵינָיו כְּמִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָהוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תָּקוּם... וְיָרֵאתָ״ – דָּבָר הַמָּסוּר לַלֵּב נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ: ״וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: might one may close his eyes like one who does not see the verse states: you shall stand and you shall fear With regard to matter given over to the heart, it is stated: “And you shall fear your God.”
llm_translation: One might have thought that he should close his eyes as if he had not seen it? The verse teaches: "Arise... and fear" - a matter that is entrusted to the heart is stated about it: "and you shall fear your God."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְזָקֵן שֶׁלֹּא יַטְרִיחַ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָקֵן וְיָרֵאתָ״. אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״מִפְּנֵי שֵׂיבָה תָּקוּם״ – אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל שֵׂיבָה בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From where an elder should not trouble The verse states: an elder, and you shall fear Isi ben Yehuda says “Before the hoary head you shall stand,” even any hoary head is included
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From where do we derive that an elder should not be burdened? The Torah teaches us: "You shall rise before the aged." Issi ben Yehuda says: "Because of gray hair you shall rise" - even if it is only one white hair.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ יַנִּיק וְחַכִּים. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: יַנִּיק וְחַכִּים – לָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ יַנִּיק וְחַכִּים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili is the first tanna , There is between them young and wise. The first tanna maintains: young and wise not Rabbi Yosei HaGelili maintains: even young and wise.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, was he the first Tanna? There is a difference between them: Yannik and wise. The first Tanna holds: Yannik and wise - no, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean holds: Even yannik and wise.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי? אָמַר לָךְ: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כִּדְקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא – אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״מִפְּנֵי שֵׂיבָה זָקֵן תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ״, מַאי שְׁנָא דְּפַלְגִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא – לְמֵימַר: דְּהַאי לָאו הַאי, וְהַאי לָאו הַאי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֲפִילּוּ יַנִּיק וְחַכִּים.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? He said to you if it enters your mind as the first tanna says, if so, let the Merciful One write: Before the hoary head of an elder you shall stand and you shall revere. What is the difference that the Merciful One separates them? to say that this is not that and that is not this Learn from even young and wise
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? He said to you: If your opinion is as the first Tanna said - if so, the Merciful One should have written: "Because of gray hair you shall rise up and honor." What is the difference that the Merciful One made between them? To say: because this is not that, and that is not this. Learn from it that even if one is young and wise.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִיסְמַךְ ״זָקֵן״ ״וְיָרֵאתָ״. וְתַנָּא קַמָּא מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כִּדְקָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי – אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא:
human_translation: And the first tanna because wants to juxtapose “elder” “and you shall fear,” And what is the reasoning of the first tanna ? if it enters your mind as Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says, let the Merciful One write:
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna, because it requires "old" and "you shall fear." And it was taught in the first Tanna, what is the reason? If it enters your mind as Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said - if so, it should have been written by the Merciful One:

hebrew_text: ״מִפְּנֵי שֵׂיבָה תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ, תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ פְּנֵי זָקֵן״ וּמִדְּלָא כְּתַב הָכִי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חַד הוּא.
human_translation: Before the hoary head of an elder you shall stand and revere; you shall stand and revere the face of an elder. From that did not write this learn from it one
llm_translation: "Because of gray hair you shall rise, and you shall honor, you shall rise and you shall honor the face of an elder." And since he did not write thus, infer from it that it is one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל יְהַדְּרֶנּוּ בְּמָמוֹן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תָּקוּם וְהָדַרְתָּ״ – מָה קִימָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס – אַף הִידּוּר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס. וְקִימָה לֵית בַּהּ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס? מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּקָא נָקֵיב מַרְגָּנִיתָא, אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי קָאֵים מִקַּמֵּיהּ וּבָטֵיל מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ!
human_translation: The Master said might he should revere him through money, the verse states: “You shall stand and you shall revere” Just as standing includes no monetary loss, so too, reverence that includes no monetary loss. And standing include no monetary loss Are we not dealing where he was piercing pearls, and in the meantime he must stand and neglect his work,
llm_translation: Master said: Is it possible to adorn him with money? Scripture says: "Arise and adorn yourself" - just as she arose without any lack of a purse, so too adornment without any lack of a purse. And is there no lack of a purse in it? Are we not dealing with a perforated coin? Nevertheless, he stands before him and is exempt from his work!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אַקֵּישׁ קִימָה לְהִידּוּר. מָה הִידּוּר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ בִּיטּוּל – אַף קִימָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ בִּיטּוּל. וְאַקֵּישׁ נָמֵי הִידּוּר לְקִימָה, מָה קִימָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס – אַף הִידּוּר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: אֵין בַּעֲלֵי אוּמָּנִיּוֹת רַשָּׁאִין לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בִּמְלַאכְתָּם.
human_translation: Rather, juxtaposes standing to reverence: Just as reverence does not include neglect so too, standing does not include neglect And also juxtaposes reverence to standing: Just as standing includes no monetary loss, so too, reverence that includes no monetary loss. From here stated: Craftsmen are not permitted to stand before Torah scholars when they are engaged in their work.
llm_translation: Rather: we establish the case of Hidur as analogous to Kimah. Just as Hidur, which does not involve nullification, so too Kimah, which does not involve nullification. And we establish the case of Hidur as analogous to Kimah. Just as Kimah, which does not involve a lack of a purse, so too Hidur, which does not involve a lack of a purse. From here they said: Artisans are not permitted to stand before scholars when they are engaged in their work.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל בַּעֲלֵי אוּמָּנִיּוֹת עוֹמְדִים מִפְּנֵיהֶם, וְשׁוֹאֲלִים בִּשְׁלוֹמָם, וְאוֹמְרִים לָהֶם: אַחֵינוּ אַנְשֵׁי מָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי בּוֹאֲכֶם לְשָׁלוֹם! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵיהֶם עוֹמְדִים, מִפְּנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵין עוֹמְדִים.
human_translation: And not But didn’t we learn all craftsmen stand before them, and greet them, and say to them: Our brothers from such and such a place, welcome! Rabbi Yoḥanan says: they stood before they would not stand before Torah scholars.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not? And we learned: All owners of trades stand up before them, and inquire about their well-being, and say to them: Our brothers, men of such and such a place, come in peace! Rabbi Yochanan said: They stand up before them, but not before Torah scholars.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין: בּוֹא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבָה מִצְוָה בִּשְׁעָתָהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי מִפְּנֵיהֶם עוֹמְדִים, מִפְּנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵין עוֹמְדִים. וְדִלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִם כֵּן, אַתָּה מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin says: Come and see how beloved is a mitzva in its time, as stood before those they did not stand before Torah scholars. perhaps it is different there, if so, and you will cause them to stumble in the future.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: Come and see how beloved a mitzvah is at its time, for they stand up because of it, but not because of Torah scholars. And perhaps it is different there, for if so, you are causing them to stumble in the future.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל יַעֲמוֹד מִפָּנָיו מִבֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּמִבֵּית הַמֶּרְחָץ. וְלָא? וְהָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא הֲוָה יָתֵיב בֵּי מַסְחוּתָא וְחָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי, וְלָא קָם מִקַּמֵּיהּ וְאִיקְּפַד, וַאֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ: שְׁנֵי חוּמָּשִׁים שָׁנִיתִי לוֹ בְּסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים, וְלֹא עָמַד מִפָּנַי!
human_translation: The Master said might one should stand before in the lavatory or in the bathhouse; And not But Rabbi Ḥiyya was sitting a bathhouse and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi passed by, and he did not stand before him. And became angry and went and said to his father, I taught two five of the book of Psalms, and he did not stand before me.
llm_translation: Master said: Can he stand before Him from the house of the seat and from the house of the bathhouse. And no? But Rabbi Ḥiyya was sitting in the house of the tannery, and he wrapped himself and went, Rabbi Shim'on son of Rabbi went, and he did not rise before him and he became angry, and he came and said to his father: I repeated two fifths to him in the book of Psalms, and he did not stand before me!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: בַּר קַפָּרָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הֲוָה יָתֵיב בֵּי מַסְחוּתָא. עָל וְאָזֵיל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי וְלָא קָם מִקַּמֵּיהּ, וְאִיקְּפַד, וַאֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ: שְׁנֵי שְׁלִישֵׁי שְׁלִישׁ שָׁנִיתִי לוֹ בְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים – וְלֹא עָמַד מִפָּנַי! וְאָמַר לוֹ: שֶׁמָּא בָּהֶן יוֹשֵׁב וּמְהַרְהֵר.
human_translation: And furthermore, bar Kappara, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Rabbi Yosei, was sitting in a bathhouse. Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi entered and passed by, and he did not stand before him. became angry and went and said to his father: I taught him two nine of Torat Kohanim , and he did not stand before me. And said to Perhaps he was sitting and contemplating
llm_translation: And it was: Bar Kapara, and they said to him: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rabbi Yosei, was sitting in the study hall. He went out and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi did not rise before him, and he became angry, and he came and said to his father: I repeated to him two thirds of a third that I learned in the Torah of the priests - and he did not stand before me! And he said to him: Perhaps someone among them is sitting and pondering.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּבָהֶן יוֹשֵׁב וּמְהַרְהֵר, הָא לָאו הָכִי לָא!
human_translation: the reason that he was sitting and pondering if that were not so, not
llm_translation: The reason of their conversation he sits and contemplates, this is not so!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּבָתֵּי גַּוָּאֵי, הָא בְּבָתֵּי בָּרָאֵי.
human_translation: not difficult: This to the inner rooms, That to the outer rooms,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in the houses of the wealthy, and here in the houses of the poor.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּכׇל מָקוֹם מוּתָּר לְהַרְהֵר חוּץ מִבֵּית הַמֶּרְחָץ וּמִבֵּית הַכִּסֵּא. דִּילְמָא לְאוּנְסֵיהּ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One is permitted to contemplate everywhere, except for the bathhouse and the lavatory. Perhaps one beyond his control is different;
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In every place it is permitted to contemplate, except for from the bathhouse and from the toilet. Perhaps his mind will be diverted.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יַעֲצִים עֵינָיו כְּמִי שֶׁלֹּא רָאָהוּ. אַטּוּ בְּרַשִּׁיעֵי עָסְקִינַן?
human_translation: might one may close his eyes like one who does not see Is that to say we are dealing with wicked people
llm_translation: He could close his eyes as if he did not see him. Are we dealing with wicked people?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: יָכוֹל יַעֲצִים עֵינָיו מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִימְטְיֵהּ זְמַן חִיּוּבָא, דְּכִי מְטָא זְמַן חִיּוּבָא הָא לָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ דְּקָאֵים מִקַּמֵּיהּ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תָּקוּם וְיָרֵאתָ״.
human_translation: Rather, might one may close his eyes before the obligation arrives, that when the obligation arrive he will not see him, that to stand before him. the verse states: “You shall stand…and you shall fear,”
llm_translation: Rather: Can he close his eyes from before that he finishes the time of obligation, for when the time of obligation arrives, behold, he does not see that he is standing before it, as the Scripture says: "Arise and fear."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אֵיזוֹהִי קִימָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ הִידּוּר – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּרַבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּבְהָק, אֲבָל בְּרַבּוֹ הַמּוּבְהָק – מְלֹא עֵינָיו.
human_translation: taught: What is standing that indicates reverence? You must say four cubits Abaye said: We said only with regard to who is not his primary teacher; but for his primary teacher within his range of vision,
llm_translation: Mishnah: What is the constellation in which there is a cluster? - One should say this is four cubits. Abaye said: We only said this regarding a master who is not distinguished, but regarding a distinguished master - his eyes are full.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי מִכִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי לֵיהּ לְאוּדְנֵיהּ דְּחַמְרָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָתֵי, הֲוָה קָאֵים. אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה רְכִיב חֲמָרָא וְקָא מְסַגֵּי אַגּוּדָּא דִּנְהַר סַגְיָא, יָתֵיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא וְרַבָּנַן בְּאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא וְלָא קָמוּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְלָאו רַב מוּבְהָק אֲנָא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתִּין.
human_translation: Abaye would stand as soon as he saw the ear of Rav Yosef’s donkey coming Abaye was riding a donkey along the bank of the Sagya River. Rav Mesharshiyya and rabbis were sitting on the other bank and they did not stand before him. said to them: Am I not primary teacher? They said to him: That not our minds,
llm_translation: Abbaye, when he saw the donkey of Rav Yosef coming, was standing. Abbaye was riding a donkey and was passing by the bank of the river Sagya. Rav Mesharshaya was sitting, and the Rabbis were on the other side, and they did not stand up before him. He said to them: "Am I not a distinguished Rabbi?" They said to him: "We do not know."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְזָקֵן שֶׁלֹּא יַטְרִיחַ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָקֵן וְיָרֵאתָ״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן דְּאִי מַקֵּיף – חָיֵי. אַבָּיֵי מַקֵּיף, רַבִּי זֵירָא מַקֵּיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From where an elder should not trouble The verse states: an elder, and you shall fear Abaye said: We have a tradition that if circumnavigates will live Abaye circumnavigate Rabbi Zeira circumnavigate
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From where do we derive that an elder should not be burdened? The Talmud teaches: "You shall honor the elder." Abaye said: We have learned that if one honors, he will live. Abaye honors, Rabbi Zeira honors.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִדִּיפְתִּי, חֲלַף הָהוּא גַּבְרָא קַמֵּיהּ וְלָא מִיכַּסֵּי רֵישָׁא. אָמַר: כַּמָּה חֲצִיף הָא גַּבְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא מִמָּתָא מַחְסֵיָא נִיהוּ, דְּגִיסִי בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Ravina was sitting before Rabbi Yirmeya of Difti, a certain man passed before him and did not cover his head. said: How rude is this man, said to him: Perhaps he is from Mata Meḥasya, where rabbis are common
llm_translation: Ravina was sitting in front of Rabbi Yirmeya from Difti, that man passed by him and did not cover his head. He said: "How impudent is this man." He said to him: "Perhaps they are from the lower class, for the Rabbis are strict with them."

hebrew_text: אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״מִפְּנֵי שֵׂיבָה תָּקוּם״ – וַאֲפִילּוּ כׇּל שֵׂיבָה בַּמַּשְׁמָע. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּאִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה קָאֵי מִקַּמֵּי סָבֵי דְאַרְמָאֵי. אָמַר: כַּמָּה הַרְפַּתְקֵי עֲדוֹ עֲלַיְיהוּ דְּהָנֵי. רָבָא מֵיקָם לָא קָאֵי, הִידּוּר עָבֵד לְהוּ.
human_translation: Isi ben Yehuda says “Before the hoary head you shall stand,” even anyone of hoary head is included, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: halakha in accordance with Isi ben Yehuda. Rabbi Yoḥanan would stand before Aramean, elders. He said: How many experiences [ harpatkei ] have occurred to these Rava would not stand before them, he displayed reverence to them.
llm_translation: Isi son of Judah says: "Because of old age, one should rise" - even for any old person in the study hall. Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is like Isi son of Judah. Rabbi Yochanan was standing before the elders of the Arameans. He said: How many puzzles did they pose to him. Rava did not stand up, he just nodded to them.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי יָהֵיב יְדָא לְסָבֵי. רָבָא מְשַׁדַּר שְׁלוּחֵיהּ. רַב נַחְמָן מְשַׁדַּר גּוֹזָאֵי. אָמַר: אִי לָאו תּוֹרָה כַּמָּה נַחְמָן בַּר אַבָּא אִיכָּא בְּשׁוּקָא?
human_translation: Abaye would extend a hand to elders Rava would send his agent Rav Naḥman would send officers [ goza’ei ], He said: If not for the Torah, how many Naḥman bar Abba would there be in the marketplace?
llm_translation: Abaye gave a gift to his hosts. Rava sent his emissaries. Rav Nachman sent dates. He said: If not for the Torah, how many Nachman sons of Abba would there be in the marketplace?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַיְיבוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי:
human_translation: Rabbi Aivu says Rabbi Yannai says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ayyivu, said Rabbi Yannai:

hebrew_text: אֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַשַּׁאי לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי רַבּוֹ אֶלָּא שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִהְיֶה כְּבוֹדוֹ מְרוּבֶּה מִכְּבוֹד שָׁמַיִם. מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְזָקֵן שֶׁלֹּא יַטְרִיחַ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זָקֵן וְיָרֵאתָ״.
human_translation: A Torah scholar is permitted to stand before his teacher only in the morning and evening, so that honor should not be greater than the honor of Heaven, raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From where an elder should not trouble The verse states: “An elder, and you shall fear”
llm_translation: A student of wisdom is not permitted to stand up before his teacher except in the morning and evening, so that his honor should not exceed the honor of Heaven. The objection was raised: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From where do we know that an elder should not be burdened? The Scripture teaches: "You shall rise before the aged and show deference to the old."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בִּלְבַד, אַמַּאי לָא נִיטְרַח? חִיּוּבָא הוּא! אֶלָּא לָאו כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא! לָא, לְעוֹלָם שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בִּלְבַד, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי כַּמָּה דְּאֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ – לָא נִיטְרַח.
human_translation: And if you say only morning and evening, why should not trouble is an obligation Rather, not that any during the day? No; actually only the morning and evening, and even so, as much as it is possible for he should not trouble
llm_translation: If you say Shacharit and Ma'ariv alone, why is it not sufficient? It is an obligation! Rather, not the entire day! No, indeed, Shacharit and Ma'ariv alone, and even so, as much as he can manage - it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁאֵין עוֹמֵד מִפְּנֵי רַבּוֹ נִקְרָא רָשָׁע, וְאֵינוֹ מַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים, וְתַלְמוּדוֹ מִשְׁתַּכֵּחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְטוֹב לֹא יִהְיֶה לָרָשָׁע וְלֹא יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים כַּצֵּל אֲשֶׁר אֵינֶנּוּ יָרֵא מִלִּפְנֵי הָאֱלֹהִים״, מוֹרָא זוֹ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַהוּ – כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ״ – הֲרֵי מוֹרָא זוֹ קִימָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Any Torah scholar who does not stand before his teacher is called wicked, and he will not live a long life, and his studies will be forgotten, as it is stated: “But it shall not be well for the wicked, neither shall he prolong his days, which are as a shadow, because he does not fear before [ millifnei ] God” This fear I do not know what it is. When states: and you shall fear your God” that this fear is standing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Every Torah scholar who does not stand up before his teacher is called wicked, does not live long, and his Torah knowledge is forgotten, as it is stated: "And it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he prolong his days, which are as a shadow; because he feareth not God" (Ecclesiastes 8:13). I do not know what is meant by this fear, but when it says, "And you shall fear your God," behold, this fear is established.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מוֹרָאַת רִבִּית וּמוֹרָאַת מִשְׁקָלוֹת! רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״פְּנֵי״ ״פְּנֵי״ גָּמַר.
human_translation: But say fear of interest or fear of weights Rabbi Elazar derives “ penei ” and “ penei ,”
llm_translation: "And why not both reverence and awe! Rabbi Elazar: 'Face' 'Face' he concluded."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּנוֹ וְהוּא רַבּוֹ, מַהוּ לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי אָבִיו? תָּא שְׁמַע, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, קוּם מִקַּמֵּי אֲבוּךְ. שָׁאנֵי רַב יְחֶזְקֵאל דְּבַעַל מַעֲשִׂים הֲוָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ מָר שְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי קָאֵים מִקַּמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them: son and his teacher, what is stand before his father? Come hear, as Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: Big-toothed stand before your father. Rav Yeḥezkel, is different, as he was a man of deeds, even Mar Shmuel would stand before him.
llm_translation: He asked them: If a person is his son and also his teacher, what is the law regarding standing up before him? Come and hear, for Shmuel said to Rav Yehudah: "Shinana, rise before your father." This is different from Rav Yechezkel who was a man of deeds, for even the master Shmuel also stood up before him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: זִימְנִין דְּאָתֵי מֵאֲחוֹרַי, קוּם אַתְּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ וְלָא תֵּיחוּשׁ לִיקָרָא דִידִי.
human_translation: Rather, what is saying this is what said to him: Sometimes comes from behind me you should stand before him and do not be concerned about my honor.
llm_translation: Rather, what is he saying to him? This is what he is saying to him: Sometimes when it comes from behind, you should stand up from your place and not pay attention to my precious vineyard.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּנוֹ וְהוּא רַבּוֹ, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּעֲמוֹד אָבִיו מִפָּנָיו? תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אֲנִי אֵינִי כְּדַי לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי בְנִי, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד בֵּית נָשִׂיא.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before them, son and his teacher, what is to the father stand before Come hear, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: It is not appropriate for me to stand before my son But due to the honor of the household of the Nasi
llm_translation: He asked them: If one's son is also his teacher, should the father rise before him? Come and hear what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: I am not worthy to rise before my son, but it is out of respect for the dignity of the household of the prince.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דַּאֲנָא רַבֵּיהּ, הָא אִיהוּ רַבַּאי – קָאֵימְנָא מִקַּמֵּיהּ! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲנִי אֵינִי כְּדַי לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי בְנִי וַאֲפִילּוּ הוּא רַבַּאי, דְּהָא אֲנָא אֲבוּהּ, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד בֵּית נָשִׂיא.
human_translation: the reason that I am his teacher he were my teacher I would stand before him. This is what is saying: It is not appropriate for me to stand before my son, even he my teacher, as I am his father. But due to the honor of the household of the Nasi
llm_translation: Reason of I his teacher, this he my teacher - standing from before him! Thus saying: I not enough to stand because of my son and even he my teacher, for I his father, rather for honor of house of president.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רָכוּב כִּמְהַלֵּךְ דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תָּא שְׁמַע: טָמֵא יוֹשֵׁב תַּחַת הָאִילָן, וְטָהוֹר עוֹמֵד – טָמֵא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them: riding like walking, or not Abaye said: Come hear ritually impure is sitting under a tree, and a pure is standing impure.
llm_translation: The question was asked: Does riding count as walking or not? Abaye said: Come and hear: "The impure one sits beneath the tree, while the pure one stands - the impure one."

hebrew_text: טָמֵא עוֹמֵד תַּחַת הָאִילָן וְטָהוֹר יוֹשֵׁב – טָהוֹר, וְאִם יָשַׁב הַטָּמֵא – הַטָּהוֹר טָמֵא.
human_translation: impure is standing under the tree and the pure is sitting pure. But if the impure sat the pure impure.
llm_translation: Impure standing under the tree and pure sitting - pure, and if the impure one sat - the pure one becomes impure.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּאֶבֶן הַמְנוּגַּעַת. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר כֹּהֵן: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת רָכוּב כִּמְהַלֵּךְ דָּמֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And the same with regard to a stone afflicted sore And Rav Naḥman bar Kohen says: That is to say riding is like walking, Conclude from it
llm_translation: And so too with a stone that is touched. And Rav Nachman bar Kokheh said: This means that it is considered as if it were moving, listen to its kind.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה? רַבִּי חִלְקִיָּה וְרַבִּי סִימוֹן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרִי: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, מִפְּנֵי לוֹמְדֶיהָ עוֹמְדִים – מִפָּנֶיהָ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them: What is to stand before a Torah scroll? Rabbi Ḥilkiya and Rabbi Simon and Rabbi Elazar say an a fortiori one stands before those who study not all the more so before
llm_translation: The question was asked: What is the reason for standing up in front of the Torah scroll? Rabbi Chilkiyah, Rabbi Simon, and Rabbi Elazar said: It is a simple logical inference - for the students who stand up for it, how much more so should we stand up in its presence?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אִלְעַי וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר זַבְדִּי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי. חָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר אַבָּא, וְקָמוּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲדָא – דְּאַתּוּן חַכִּימֵי וַאֲנָא חָבֵר. וְעוֹד, כְּלוּם תּוֹרָה עוֹמֶדֶת מִפְּנֵי לוֹמְדֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elai and Rabbi Ya’akov bar Zavdi were sitting Rabbi Shimon bar Abba passed before them and they stood before him. said to them: One that you are scholars and I an associate, And furthermore, does the Torah stand before those who study it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Ilai and Rabbi Yaakov bar Zavdi were sitting. Rabbi Shimon bar Abba came and they stood before him. He said to them: "One - you are wise and I am a colleague. Furthermore, Torah stands still for its learners."

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַשַּׁאי לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי רַבּוֹ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה. לָיֵיט עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: A Torah scholar may not stand before his teacher when he is studying Torah, Abaye cursed
llm_translation: He thought like Rabbi Elazar. For Rabbi Elazar said: A Torah scholar is not permitted to stand up before his teacher when he is engaged in Torah study. Abaye objected to this.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִבִּיטוּ אַחֲרֵי מֹשֶׁה עַד בֹּאוֹ הָאֹהֱלָה״, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא. חַד אָמַר לִגְנַאי, וְחַד אָמַר לְשֶׁבַח. מַאן דְּאָמַר לִגְנַאי – כִּדְאִיתָא. מַאן דְּאָמַר לְשֶׁבַח, אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה:
human_translation: “And they looked after Moses until he was gone into the tent” Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa One said unfavorably, and one said favorably. The one who said unfavorably as it is The one who said favorably Ḥizkiyya says.
llm_translation: "And they looked after Moses until he entered the tent," Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha. One said for disgrace, and one said for praise. The one who said for disgrace - as it is stated. The one who said for praise, Hezekiah said:

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לִי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבְדִּימִי דְּמִן חֵיפָא: חָכָם עוֹבֵר – עוֹמֵד מִלְּפָנָיו אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת – יוֹשֵׁב. אַב בֵּית דִּין עוֹבֵר – עוֹמֵד מִלְּפָנָיו מְלֹא עֵינָיו, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת יוֹשֵׁב. נָשִׂיא עוֹבֵר – עוֹמֵד מִלְּפָנָיו מְלֹא עֵינָיו, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב עַד שֶׁיֵּשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִבִּיטוּ אַחֲרֵי מֹשֶׁה עַד בֹּאוֹ הָאֹהֱלָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Abbahu, said to me Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Avdimi of Haifa says: scholar passing, one stands before him four cubits and once he passes four cubits he sits. president of the court passing, one stands before him within his range of vision. And once he passes four cubits he sits. Nasi passing, one stands before him within his range of vision, and he does not sit until sits in his place, as it is stated: “And they looked after Moses until he was gone into the tent,”
llm_translation: He said to me, Rabbi Chanina, son of Rabbi Avahu, said Rabbi Avahu, said Rabbi Avdimi from Haifa: A wise person who passes by - one must stand four cubits away from him, and once he has passed four cubits, one may sit. A judge who passes by - one must stand before him until he is out of sight, and once he has passed four cubits, one may sit. A prince who passes by - one must stand before him until he takes his seat, as it is stated: "And they looked after Moses until he entered the tent."

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזוֹהִי מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – סוּכָּה, וְלוּלָב, שׁוֹפָר, וְצִיצִית,
human_translation: all positive, time-bound mitzvot. The Sages taught: What is a positive, time-bound mitzva? a sukka , and lulav , shofar And ritual fringes,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Every positive commandment that is time-bound, etc. The Rabbis taught: What is a positive commandment that is time-bound? - Sukkah, Lulav, Shofar, and Tzitzit.

hebrew_text: וּתְפִילִּין.
human_translation: And phylacteries
llm_translation: And tefillin.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹהִי מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – מְזוּזָה, מַעֲקֶה, אֲבֵידָה, וְשִׁילּוּחַ הַקֵּן.
human_translation: And what is a positive mitzva that is not time bound? a mezuza a parapet a lost item and the release the nest,
llm_translation: And which positive commandment is not time-bound that its neglect causes a sin? - Mezuzah, fence, lost object, and sending away the mother bird.

hebrew_text: וּכְלָלָא הוּא? הֲרֵי מַצָּה, שִׂמְחָה, הַקְהֵל, דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא, וְנָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת! וְתוּ: וַהֲרֵי תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, וּפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן דְּלָאו מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ הוּא – וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת!
human_translation: But is principle? there are matza rejoicing assembly And a positive, time-bound mitzva, and women are obligated And furthermore, But there are Torah study procreation and redemption of the firstborn is not a positive, time-bound mitzva, and women are exempt
llm_translation: It is a principle? Behold, matzah, joy, congregation, a positive commandment that is time-bound, and women are obligated! And furthermore: Behold, Torah study, procreation, redemption of the firstborn which is not a time-bound positive commandment - and women are exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין לְמֵדִין מִן הַכְּלָלוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״חוּץ״,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One does not learn from general statements, even in a place where it says: Except,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One does not learn from general principles, even in a place where it is stated "outside."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: בַּכֹּל מְעָרְבִין וּמִשְׁתַּתְּפִין חוּץ מִן הַמַּיִם וּמֶלַח, וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָאִיכָּא כְּמֵהִין וּפִטְרִיּוֹת! אֶלָּא אֵין לְמֵדִין מִן הַכְּלָלוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״חוּץ״.
human_translation: as we learned One can establish a joining and one can merge with all except for water and salt. and Is there nothing else But there are truffles and mushrooms, Rather, conclude from this one may not learn from general statements, even in a place where it says: Except.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: In all cases, one may combine and participate together, except for water and salt. And is there not a case of kemeihin and pitriyot? Rather, we do not learn from generalizations, even in a case where it is stated "outside."

hebrew_text: וּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת מְנָלַן? – גָּמַר מִתְּפִילִּין, מַה תְּפִילִּין נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת – אַף כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. וּתְפִילִּין? – גָּמַר לַהּ מִתַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה, מָה תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת – אַף תְּפִילִּין נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת.
human_translation: From where do we women are exempt from positive, time-bound mitzvot? derived from phylacteries: Just as women are exempt from phylacteries, so too, women are exempt from all positive, time-bound mitzvot. And phylacteries is derived from Torah study: Just as women are exempt from Torah study, so too women are exempt from phylacteries,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding a positive commandment that is time-bound, from where do we know that women are exempt? – It is derived from Tefillin. Just as women are exempt from Tefillin, so too are they exempt from all positive commandments that are time-bound. And Tefillin? – It is derived for her from Torah study. Just as women are exempt from Torah study, so too are they exempt from Tefillin.

hebrew_text: וְנַקֵּישׁ תְּפִילִּין לִמְזוּזָה! תְּפִילִּין לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה אִיתַּקּוּשׁ, בֵּין בְּפָרָשָׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה בֵּין בְּפָרָשָׁה שְׁנִיָּה, תְּפִילִּין לִמְזוּזָה בְּפָרָשָׁה שְׁנִיָּה לָא אִיתַּקּוּשׁ.
human_translation: And let us and juxtapose phylacteries to mezuza , Phylacteries are juxtaposed to Torah study both the first paragraph and in the second paragraph phylacteries are not juxtaposed to mezuza in the second paragraph.
llm_translation: And one should be strict with tefillin for a mezuzah! Tefillin for Torah study are holy, whether in the first portion or in the second portion, tefillin for a mezuzah in the second portion are not holy.

hebrew_text: וְנַקֵּישׁ מְזוּזָה לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יִרְבּוּ יְמֵיכֶם״, גַּבְרֵי בָּעוּ חַיֵּי, נְשֵׁי לָא בָּעוּ חַיֵּי?!
human_translation: But let us juxtapose mezuza to Torah study could not enter your mind, as it is written “That your days may be multiplied” men need life women do not need life?
llm_translation: "And one should affix a mezuzah to the study of Torah! It is not as you think, for it is written: 'So that your days may be multiplied,' men desire life, women do not desire life?!"

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי סוּכָּה דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ, דִּכְתִיב ״בַּסֻּכֹּת תֵּשְׁבוּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא הָאֶזְרָח לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַנָּשִׁים, הָא לָאו הָכִי נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת!
human_translation: But there is a sukka , which is a positive, time-bound mitzva, as it is written: “In sukkot you shall reside seven days” the reason that the Merciful One writes the homeborn to exclude the women if that was not so, women obligated.
llm_translation: Behold, a sukkah of a positive commandment that its time causes it, as it is written "You shall dwell in sukkot for seven days," the reason that the Merciful One wrote it is to exempt women, but are not women obligated thus!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל דִּכְתִיב ״בַּסֻּכֹּת תֵּשְׁבוּ״ – ״תֵּשְׁבוּ״ כְּעֵין תָּדוּרוּ: מָה דִּירָה אִישׁ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ – אַף סוּכָּה אִישׁ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: was necessary it might enter your mind to say since it is written: reside as you dwell Just as a man and his wife a residence, so too, a man and his wife sukka .
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is necessary, for if your mind had not come to say: Since it is written "You shall dwell in booths" - "dwell" like a permanent residence: just as a man and his wife have a dwelling - so too a man and his wife have a sukkah.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר:
human_translation: And Rava said:
llm_translation: And Rava said:
