hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: נֵילַף ״חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר״ ״חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר״ מֵחַג הַמַּצּוֹת, מָה לְהַלָּן נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת – אַף כָּאן נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: necessary it might enter your mind to say: Derive fifteenth from fifteenth festival of Passover” just as there women are obligated so too here, women are obligated. was necessary
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind desires, I say: we learn "fifteen" "fifteen" from the Festival of Matzot, just as there women are obligated - so too here women are obligated, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי רְאִיָּה, דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ, וְטַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״זְכוּרְךָ״ – לְהוֹצִיא הַנָּשִׁים, הָא לָאו הָכִי נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת!
human_translation: But there is appearance, which is a positive, time-bound mitzva. And the reason that the Merciful One writes, your males to exclude women. if that were not so, women obligated.
llm_translation: Behold, the sight, that the positive commandment which its time caused, and the reason that the Merciful One wrote "your male" - to exempt women, but not so, women are obligated!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: נֵילַף ״רְאִיָּה״ ״רְאִיָּה״ מֵהַקְהֵל.
human_translation: was necessary it might enter your mind to say: Derive appearance, from appearance assembly,
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has thought: we derive "seeing" "seeing" from the congregation.

hebrew_text: וְאַדְּיָלְפִינַן מִתְּפִילִּין לִפְטוּרָא, נֵילַף מִשִּׂמְחָה לְחִיּוּבָא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִשָּׁה בַּעֲלָהּ מְשַׂמְּחָהּ.
human_translation: But before deriving from phylacteries, to exempt derive from rejoicing to obligate Abaye said: a woman is rendered joyful by her husband,
llm_translation: We should separate from wearing Tefillin for exemption, we should separate from joy for obligation! Abaye said: A woman, her husband rejoices her.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בִּשְׁרוּיָה אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: What can be said a widow, to with whom she is present,
llm_translation: Widow what is there to say? In his proximity.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מֵהַקְהֵל! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה מַצָּה וְהַקְהֵל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד – אֵין מְלַמְּדִים.
human_translation: But derive from assembly, because matza and assembly are two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And we will differentiate from the congregation! Because it is unleavened bread and the congregation are two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one - we do not teach.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּפִילִּין וּרְאִיָּה נָמֵי שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד – וְאֵין מְלַמְּדִים! צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא תְּפִילִּין וְלָא כְּתַב רְאִיָּה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: נֵילַף רְאִיָּה רְאִיָּה מֵהַקְהֵל.
human_translation: If so, phylacteries and appearance also two verses that come as one, and not teach are necessary, As, if the Merciful One had written phylacteries and had not written appearance, I would say: Derive appearance from appearance assembly.
llm_translation: So it is, "Tefillin and seeing," also two Scriptures that come as one - and they do not teach! It is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote "tefillin" and did not write "seeing," I would say: we derive seeing from seeing from the assembly.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא רְאִיָּה וְלָא כְּתַב תְּפִילִּין, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אַקֵּישׁ תְּפִילִּין לִמְזוּזָה, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written appearance, and had not written phylacteries, I would say: I will compare phylacteries to mezuza , necessary
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "seeing" and did not write "phylacteries," I would say: He equated phylacteries to mezuzah, necessary.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַצָּה וְהַקְהֵל נָמֵי צְרִיכִי! לְמַאי צְרִיכִי? בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הַקְהֵל וְלָא כְּתַב מַצָּה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: נֵילַף ״חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר״ ״חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר״ מֵחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת.
human_translation: If so, matza and assembly also necessary, For what necessary? Granted, if the Merciful One had written assembly but had not written matza , I would say: Derive fifteenth fifteenth
llm_translation: So, if that's the case, matzah and hakhel are both necessary! What are they necessary for? If you say that if the Merciful One wrote hakhel and did not write matzah, I would say: we derive "fifteen" "fifteen" from the Festival of Sukkot.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא נִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא מַצָּה, וְלָא בָּעֵי הַקְהֵל, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: טְפָלִים חַיָּיבִים, נָשִׁים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! הִילְכָּךְ, הָוֵה לְהוּ שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְאֵין מְלַמְּדִים.
human_translation: But let the Merciful One write matza , and it not necessary assembly, and I say children are obligated women not all the more so Therefore, two verses that come as one, and not teach
llm_translation: The Merciful One wrote "matzah," and not "b'ei hakehil," and I say: infants are obligated, women all the more so?! Therefore, let there be two Scriptures coming as one, and not teaching.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מְלַמְּדִין, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְלַמְּדִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says do not teach But according to the one who says do teach what can be said?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He left it for the one who says we do not teach, but for the one who says we do teach, what can be said?"

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת מְנָלַן? דְּיָלֵיף מִמּוֹרָא, מָה מוֹרָא נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת – אַף כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת.
human_translation: And furthermore, From where do we women are obligated in positive mitzvot that are not time bound? that derives from fearing Just as women are obligated fear so too, women are obligated in every positive mitzva that is not time bound.
llm_translation: And come: positive commandment that not the time caused women obligated from where? Derive from fear, what fear women obligated - also all positive commandment that not the time caused women obligated.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִתַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה! – מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה וּפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִים.
human_translation: But derive from Torah study: because Torah study and procreation are two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And we shall separate from the study of Torah! - because it is considered to him study of Torah and procreation, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא, דְּאָמַר: עַל שְׁנֵיהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְבָרֶךְ אֹתָם אֱלֹהִים פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ״ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה וּפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, who says with regard to both of them, states: “And God blessed them, Be fruitful and multiply, what can be said? because Torah study and the redemption of the firstborn son, are two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, who said: Regarding both of them, he says: "And God blessed them, be fruitful and multiply." What can be said about this? Because it is a teaching of Torah and the redemption of the firstborn, two Scriptures that come together as one, and any two Scriptures that come together as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא נָמֵי, נִיהְווֹ פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה וּמוֹרָא שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד וְאֵין מְלַמְּדִין! צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא מוֹרָא, וְלָא כְּתַב פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: ״וְכִבְשֻׁהָ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא – אִישׁ דְּדַרְכּוֹ לְכַבֵּשׁ – אִין, אִשָּׁה דְּאֵין דַּרְכָּהּ לְכַבֵּשׁ – לָא.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka as well, let procreation, and fear be two verses that come as one and not teach are necessary. As, if the Merciful One had written fear and had not written procreation, I would say the Merciful One states: and conquer it” As the manner of a man to conquer, yes, as it is not the manner of a woman to conquer, not
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, they called him, were given fruitfulness and multiplication and awe, two Scriptures that come as one and do not teach! It is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote awe, and did not write fruitfulness and multiplication, I would say: "And subdue her" the Merciful One said - a man whose way is to subdue - yes, a woman whose way is not to subdue - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה וְלֹא כְּתַב מוֹרָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אִישׁ דְּסִיפֵּק בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת – אִין, אִשָּׁה דְּאֵין סִיפֵּק בְּיָדָהּ לַעֲשׂוֹת – לָא, וְכֵיוָן דְּאֵין סִיפֵּק בְּיָדָהּ לַעֲשׂוֹת לֹא תִּתְחַיֵּיב כְּלָל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had written procreation, and had not written fear I would say: a man, as in his power to perform yes, a woman, as not in her power to perform not And as not in her power to perform should not be obligated at all necessary
llm_translation: And if he wrote "periyah u'rebiyah" and did not write "morah," I would say: A man who has the ability to fulfill - yes, a woman who does not have the ability to fulfill - no. And since she does not have the ability to fulfill, she is not liable at all. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְלַמְּדִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רָבָא: פַּפּוּנָאֵי יָדְעִי לַהּ לְטַעְמָא דְּהָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says two verses that come as one do not teach But according to the one who says do teach what can be said? Rava said: of Pafunya know the reason for this matter.
llm_translation: The one who says that two Scriptures that come together do not teach, but the one who says they do teach, what can be said? Rava said: The sages knew the reason for this matter.

hebrew_text: וּמַנּוּ – רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָיָה לְךָ לְאוֹת עַל יָדְךָ וּלְזִכָּרוֹן בֵּין עֵינֶיךָ לְמַעַן תִּהְיֶה תּוֹרַת ה׳ בְּפִיךָ״ – הוּקְּשָׁה כָּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ לִתְפִילִּין, מָה תְּפִילִּין מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ, וְנָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת – אַף כׇּל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. וּמִדְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת, מִכְּלָל דְּמִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת.
human_translation: And who is Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, The verse states “And it shall be a sign for you on your arm and for a memorial between your eyes, that the Torah of the Lord may be in your mouth” the entire Torah is juxtaposed to phylacteries: Just as phylacteries is a positive, time-bound mitzva and women are exempt so too are women exempt every positive, time-bound mitzva And from the fact women are exempt from positive, time-bound mitzva, by inference women are obligated in positive mitzva that is not time bound.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Umanu - Rav Acha bar Yaakov: Amar kra: 'Ve'hayah lecha le'ot al yadcha u'lezikaron bein einecha lemaan tihyeh torat Hashem beficha' - Huksheh kol haTorah kullah litfillin, mah tefillin mitzvat aseh shehazman geramah, ve'nashim peturot - af kol mitzvat aseh shehazman geramah - nashim peturot. Umidmitzvat aseh shehazman geramah - nashim peturot, miklal de'mitzvat aseh shelo hazman geramah - nashim chayavot." English translation: "And they taught - Rav Acha son of Yaakov said: The verse states: 'And it shall be for you a sign upon your hand and a remembrance between your eyes, so that the Torah of Hashem may be in your mouth' - The entire Torah is equated to tefillin, just as tefillin is a time-bound positive commandment, and women are exempt - so too, every time-bound positive commandment - women are exempt. And from the category of time-bound positive commandments - women are exempt, from the general principle of positive commandments that are not time-bound - women are obligated."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּפִילִּין מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּפִילִּין מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר תְּפִילִּין מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְסָבַר לַהּ שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says phylacteries a positive, time-bound mitzva. But according to the one who says phylacteries a positive mitzva that is not time bound, what can be said? Who did you hear who said phylacteries a positive mitzva that is not time bound? Rabbi Meir, and he holds verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: The one who says that tefillin is a positive commandment dependent on time, what can he say? But the one who says that tefillin is a positive commandment not dependent on time, what is there to say? Who heard him say that tefillin is a positive commandment not dependent on time? - Rabbi Meir. And he holds that two verses that come together are like one, and any two verses that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד מְלַמְּדִין, וּתְפִילִּין מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁלֹּא הַזְּמַן גְּרָמָהּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵאי מַצָּה, שִׂמְחָה, וְהַקְהֵל שְׁלֹשָׁה כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yehuda, who says two verses that come as one do teach and phylacteries is a positive mitzva that is not time bound, what can be said? because matza , rejoicing, and assembly are three verses that come as one, and three verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yehuda who said: Two Scriptures that come together teach as one, and Tefillin, a positive commandment not dependent on time, what is there to say? Because it was matzah, joy, and congregation, three Scriptures that come together teach as one, and three Scriptures that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה כִּי יַעֲשׂוּ מִכׇּל חַטֹּאת הָאָדָם״ – הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ לְכׇל עוֹנָשִׁים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And all prohibitions, From where are these matters Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The verse states “When a man or woman shall commit any sin that a person commits” The verse equates a woman to a man with regard to all punishments in the Torah,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And all negative commandments, etc." Who are the attendants of the words? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and so did the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The verse states: "If a man or a woman commits any of the sins of mankind" - the Scripture equated a woman to a man in all punishments in the Torah.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר תָּנָא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר תָּשִׂים לִפְנֵיהֶם״ – הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ לְכׇל דִּינִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה תָּנָא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהֵמִית אִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה״ – הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ לְכׇל מִיתוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Eliezer taught The verse states: which you shall set before them” verse equates a woman to a man to all judgments in the Torah, The school of Ḥizkiyya taught: The verse states, “And killed a man or woman” the verse equates a woman to a man, to all deaths in the Torah,
llm_translation: In the academy of Rabbi Eliezer it was taught: The verse states, "Which they shall set before them" - the Scripture equated a woman to a man in all matters of the Torah. In the academy of Chizkiyah it was taught: The verse states, "And he shall kill a man or a woman" - the Scripture equated a woman to a man in all capital punishments of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, מִשּׁוּם כַּפָּרָה חָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלַהּ, אֲבָל דִּינִין, אֵימָא: אִישׁ, דְּבַר מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן – אִין, אִשָּׁה – לָא.
human_translation: And necessary As, if had taught us this first the Merciful One has pity on her due to atonement, But judgments, I say a man, who conducts negotiations, yes, a woman, no,
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we were to hear this before us, due to atonement, may the Merciful One have mercy upon it, but regarding judgments, one might say: a man, with give and take - yes, a woman - no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְועִינַן הָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּחַיּוּתַהּ הִיא, אֲבָל כּוֹפֶר אֵימָא:
human_translation: And if had taught us this because is her livelihood. But ransom I say:
llm_translation: And if we were to hear this, because it is a matter of her livelihood, but as for denying, why?

hebrew_text: אִישׁ, דְּבַר מִצְוֹת – אִין, אִשָּׁה – לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא אִיבּוּד נְשָׁמָה חָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלַהּ, אֲבָל הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי – אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: a man, who is commanded in mitzvot, yes, a woman, no, And If taught us this because there is the loss of life the Merciful One has pity on her But those two I say no, necessary
llm_translation: A man, matter of commandments - yes, a woman - no. And if we should say this: because there is the joining of the soul, may the Merciful One have mercy on it, but with two - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִ״בַּל תַּקִּיף״ וּ״בַל תַּשְׁחִית״ כּוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא ״בַּל תִּטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים״, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱמֹר אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ – בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן. אֶלָּא ״בַּל תַּקִּיף״ וּ״בַל תַּשְׁחִית״ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: except for Do not round and: Do not destroy Granted, Do not contract ritual impurity from a corpse, as it is written: “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, the sons of Aaron, but not the daughters of Aaron. But from where do we Do not round and: Do not destroy
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Outside of 'Do not profane' and 'Do not destroy' - where is it derived? Granted, 'Do not become impure for the dead,' as it is written: 'Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron' - the sons of Aaron, and not the daughters of Aaron. But 'Do not profane' and 'Do not destroy,' from where are they derived?" English translation:

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַקִּפוּ פְּאַת רֹאשְׁכֶם וְלֹא תַשְׁחִית אֵת פְּאַת זְקָנֶךָ״ – כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּהַשְׁחָתָה יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּהַקָּפָה. וְהָנֵי נְשֵׁי, הוֹאִיל וְלָא אִיתַנְהוּ בְּהַשְׁחָתָה, לֵיתַנְהוּ בְּהַקָּפָה.
human_translation: as it is written: “You shall not round the corners of your head and you shall not destroy the corners of your beard” anyone who is in destroying is in rounding And since these women are not in destroying, they are not in rounding
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "You shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shall you mar the corners of your beard" - whoever is included in the prohibition of marring is included in the prohibition of rounding. And these women, since they are not included in the prohibition of marring, they are included in the prohibition of rounding.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּלָא אִיתַנְהוּ בְּהַשְׁחָתָה? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא: דְּהָא לָא אִית לְהוּ זָקָן. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תַקִּפוּ פְּאַת רֹאשְׁכֶם וְלֹא תַשְׁחִית אֵת פְּאַת זְקָנֶךָ״,
human_translation: And from where do we that are not in destroying If you wish, propose reason, as do not have a beard. And if you wish, cite a verse as the verse states: “You shall not round the corners of your head [ roshekhem ] and you shall not destroy the corners of your beard [ zekanekha ]”
llm_translation: And from where do we know that they do not bury them in a pit? If you wish, say reasoning: because they do not have a beard. And if you wish, say scripture: as scripture says: "You shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shall you mar the corners of your beard."

hebrew_text: מִדְּשַׁנִּי קְרָא בְּדִיבּוּרֵיהּ, דְּאִם כֵּן נִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״פְּאַת זְקַנְכֶם״. מַאי ״זְקָנֶךָ״ – זְקָנֶךָ, וְלֹא זְקַן אִשְׁתְּךָ.
human_translation: From that the verse changed its language, if so, let the Merciful One write: corners of your beards [ zekanekhem ], What your beard [ zekanekha ],” Your beard but not your wife’s beard.
llm_translation: From where do we derive this? Because the Merciful One stated it in His words, as it is written: "The corner of your beard." What is meant by "your beard"? - Your beard, and not the beard of your wife.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: זְקַן אִשָּׁה, וְהַסָּרִיס שֶׁהֶעֱלוּ שֵׂעָר – הֲרֵי הֵן כְּזָקָן לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם. מַאי לָאו לְהַשְׁחָתָה?
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught The beard of a woman and a eunuch, if they grow hair, are considered like a beard for all matters. What, is it not to destroying?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And no? And it was taught: An old woman, and a eunuch who has grown hair - they are considered like an old man in all matters. What is the reason? Is it not for disgrace?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְהַשְׁחָתָה לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, דְּיָלֵיף ״פְּאַת״ ״פְּאַת״ מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, מָה לְהַלָּן נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת – אַף כָּאן נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: You cannot say to destroying, as it is derived “the corners “the corners from the sons of Aaron: Just as there, women are exempt so too here, women are exempt.
llm_translation: Abaye said: "For destruction, you did not find an exemption." You said, "to differentiate 'corner' 'corner' from the sons of Aaron, just as there women are exempt there - so too here women are exempt."

hebrew_text: וְאִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּכִי כְּתִיב ״בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ – אַכּוּלֵּיהּ עִנְיָנָא כְּתִיב, נִישְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִינֵּיהּ וְתֵיתֵי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: וּמָה כֹּהֲנִים שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶם הַכָּתוּב מִצְוֹת יְתֵירוֹת – ״בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ – וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן, יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: But if we maintain that when writes: “The sons of Aaron” is written with regard to the entire manner let the verse, be silent about And could be derived through an a fortiori I say And if priests, for whom the verse includes additional mitzvot, the sons of Aaron and not the daughters of Aaron, not all the more so Israelites,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you would think that since it is written "sons of Aaron" - the matter is written off, the verse is removed from its context and a fortiori reasoning is applied, but I say: And what about the priests for whom the Torah has imposed additional commandments - "sons of Aaron" - and not daughters of Aaron, all the more so Israel?

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן.
human_translation: Were it not for verbal analogy, I would say concluded that matter.
llm_translation: If it is not a decree, it is similar, I would say: The matter was interrupted.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נֵימָא הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן! וְאִי מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ״, יָכוֹל גִּילְּחוֹ בְּמִסְפָּרַיִים יִהְיֶה חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַשְׁחִית״.
human_translation: now too, let us say concluded that matter, And if due to verbal analogy is necessary for that which is taught “Neither shall they shave off might would be liable he shaved his with scissors. the verse states, “And you shall not destroy
llm_translation: The matter was interrupted! And if it is because of a similar decree, let him learn from what is taught: "They shall not shave," can it be that if he shaves with scissors he will be liable? The Talmud teaches: "You shall not destroy."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לִקְּטוֹ בְּמַלְקֵט וּבְרָהִיטְנֵי יְהֵא חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ״. הָא כֵּיצַד? גִּילּוּחַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ הַשְׁחָתָה, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה תַּעַר.
human_translation: might if he extracted with tweezers, or planes [ uvirhitni ], he should be liable The verse states: “Neither shall they shave off How these shaving that involves destruction. You must say is a razor.
llm_translation: He is able to gather with a gatherer and with a rake, should he be liable? The Talmud teaches: "Do not shave." How so? Shaving that involves destruction, consider it a razor.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, נִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״אֶת שֶׁבִּזְקָנֶךָ״, מַאי ״פְּאַת זְקָנֶךָ״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: If so let the verse write: That which is of your beard. What “the corners of your beard”? Conclude two from it,
llm_translation: If so, it should be written in the verse: "Your elders," what is "the corner of your elders" - infer from it two.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: זְקַן הָאִשָּׁה וְהַסָּרִיס שֶׁהֶעֱלוּ שֵׂעָר הֲרֵי הֵן כְּזָקָן לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶם, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: לְטוּמְאַת נְגָעִים.
human_translation: But that which is taught The beard of a woman and a eunuch, if they grew hair, are considered like a beard for all matters, with regard to what halakha Mar Zutra says: with regard to ritual impurity from leprosy.
llm_translation: And rather this that it was taught: An old woman and a eunuch who grew hair, behold they are like an old person in all matters, for what halakha? Mar Zutra said: For the impurity of skin afflictions.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאַת נְגָעִים בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיבָא, ״וְאִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה כִּי יִהְיֶה בוֹ נָגַע בְּרֹאשׁ אוֹ בְזָקָן״! אֶלָּא אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: לְטׇהֳרַת נְגָעִים.
human_translation: ritual impurity from leprosy, it is written explicitly: “And when a man or woman has a plague upon the head or upon the beard” Rather, Mar Zutra says: to ritual purification from leprosy,
llm_translation: Impurity of skin afflictions in the hand is written, "And when a man or woman has a plague upon the head or the beard"! Rather, Mar Zutra said: for the purification of skin afflictions.

hebrew_text: טׇהֳרַת נְגָעִים נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא, כֵּיוָן דְּבַת טוּמְאָה הִיא – בַּת טׇהֳרָה הִיא! אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא לִצְדָדִים כְּתִיב: ״אִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה כִּי יִהְיֶה בוֹ נָגַע בְּרֹאשׁ״, ״אוֹ בְזָקָן״ – הֲדַר אֲתָאן לְאִישׁ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: ritual purification from leprosy it is also obvious: Since impurity applies to purity applies to her. was necessary it might enter your mind to say is written disjunctively, “And when a man or woman has a plague upon the head,” “Or upon the beard,” we have come back to a man teaches us
llm_translation: The purification of skin afflictions is logical, for since it is a matter of impurity - it is a matter of purity! It was necessary, for I might have thought to incline towards the sides, as it is written: "When a man or woman has a sore on the head," "or on the beard" - it comes back to the man, indicating to us.

hebrew_text: אִיסִי תָּנֵי: אַף ״בַּל יִקְרְחוּ״ – נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּאִיסִי דְּדָרֵישׁ הָכִי? ״בָּנִים אַתֶּם לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם לֹא תִתְגֹּדְדוּ וְלֹא תָשִׂימוּ קׇרְחָה בֵּין עֵינֵיכֶם לָמֵת. כִּי עַם קָדוֹשׁ אַתָּה לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, בָּנִים וְלֹא בָּנוֹת – לְקׇרְחָה.
human_translation: Isi taught Women are also exempt Do not make baldness What is the reason of Isi? that he teaches as follows: “You are the sons of the Lord your God; you shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead. For you are a holy people to the Lord your God” sons and not daughters, to baldness,
llm_translation: Isi taught: Even "Bal Yikrechu" - women are exempt. What is the reason for Isi's interpretation? "You are children to the Lord your God, you shall not gash yourselves and you shall not place a bald spot between your eyes for the dead. For you are a holy people to the Lord your God," children and not daughters - for baldness.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לְקׇרְחָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לִגְדִידָה? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי עַם קָדוֹשׁ אַתָּה לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״ – הֲרֵי גְּדִידָה אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים בָּנִים וְלֹא בָּנוֹת – לְקׇרְחָה.
human_translation: you say to baldness, or is it only to cutting, when it states: “For you are a holy people to the Lord your God,” is stated cutting, How do I realize sons and not daughters? to baldness.
llm_translation: You say to Korach, or is it only to Gididah? When he says, "For you are a holy people to the Lord your God" - behold, Gididah is said, for what am I fulfilling with sons and not with daughters - to Korach.

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַגְּדִידָה וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַקׇּרְחָה? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת הַגְּדִידָה, שֶׁיֶּשְׁנָהּ בִּמְקוֹם הַשֵּׂעָר וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם שֵׂעָר, וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי אֶת הַקׇּרְחָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֵׂעָר.
human_translation: And what did you see to include cutting and to exclude baldness? I include cutting, as it is in a place of hair and not in a place of hair; and I exclude baldness, as it only in a place of hair.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include the sinew and to exclude the membrane? I include the sinew, for it changes in place of hair and not in a place of hair, and I exclude the membrane, which is only in a place of hair.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: בָּנִים וְלֹא בָּנוֹת – בֵּין לְקׇרְחָה בֵּין לִגְדִידָה, וְכִי כְּתִב: ״כִּי עַם קָדוֹשׁ אַתָּה לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, בִּשְׂרִיטָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב! קָסָבַר אִיסִי שְׂרִיטָה וּגְדִידָה
human_translation: But say sons and not daughters both to baldness and to cutting, and when writes: “For you are a holy people to the Lord your God,” that is written with regard to scoring Isi maintains scoring and cutting
llm_translation: And why? Sons and not daughters - whether for the hairline or for the forehead. And did it write: "For you are a holy people to the Lord your God," it is written in regard to a scratch! Issi holds that a scratch and a forehead.

hebrew_text: אַחַת הִיא.
human_translation: are one
llm_translation: One it is.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּאִיסִי, דְּגָמַר ״קׇרְחָה״ ״קׇרְחָה״ מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, מָה לְהַלָּן נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת – אַף כָּאן נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said this is the reason of Isi As he learns baldness from baldness the sons of Aaron. Just as there, women are exempt, so too here, women are exempt.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: This is the reason of Issi, who interpreted "baldness" as referring to the sons of Aharon. Just as there women are exempt, so too here women are exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּכִי כְּתִיב קְרָא, בְּכוּלֵּי עִנְיָינָא הוּא דִּכְתִיב, נִשְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִינֵּיהּ וְתֵיתֵי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: וּמָה כֹּהֲנִים שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶם הַכָּתוּב מִצְוֹת יְתֵירוֹת – ״בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ – וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן, יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: But if we maintain that when writes: is written with regard to the entire matter let the verse be silent about And could be derived through an a fortiori I say If priests, for whom the verse includes additional mitzvot, the sons of Aaron and not the daughters of Aaron, not all the more so Israelites,
llm_translation: And if it seems to us that since it is written in the verse, it is a general matter that is written, the verse is removed from its context and a fortiori reasoning is applied, and I say: And what about the priests for whom the Scripture has specified additional commandments - "sons of Aaron" - and not daughters of Aaron, Israel all the more so?

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן.
human_translation: were it not for verbal analogy I would say concluded that matter,
llm_translation: If it is not a decree, it is similar, I would say: He interrupted the matter.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נֵימָא הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן, וְאִי מִשּׁוּם גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה – מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יִקְרְחוּ״, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ קָרַח אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ קְרָחוֹת לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְחָה״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: now too, let us say concluded that matter, And if due to verbal analogy is necessary for that which is taught “They shall not make baldness [ yikreḥu might even one made four or five baldness he would be obligated only one the verse also states “ korḥa ,” to render him liable for each and every one
llm_translation: At that time, the matter was interrupted, and if it is due to a similar decree - he should learn it from the Mishnah: "They shall not shave," could it be that even if one shaves four or five times, he should only be liable for one? The teaching states: "He shall shave" - to obligate for each and every one.

hebrew_text: ״בְּרֹאשָׁם״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תִתְגֹּדְדוּ וְלֹא תָשִׂימוּ קׇרְחָה בֵּין עֵינֵיכֶם לָמֵת״, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל בֵּין הָעֵינַיִם, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת כָּל הָרֹאשׁ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּרֹאשָׁם״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ כְּבֵין הָעֵינַיִם.
human_translation: What the verse states: “Upon their head” Because it is stated: “You shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead” might he is obligated only for between the eyes. From where to include the entire head the verse states “upon their head,” to render liable on head like between the eyes.
llm_translation: "In their heads" - What is the Talmud coming to teach? Because it is stated: "You shall not gash yourselves, and you shall not place baldness between your eyes for the dead." Could I say that one is only liable for between the eyes? From where do we derive to include the entire head? The Talmud comes to teach: "In their heads" - to obligate for the head as for between the eyes.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא כֹּהֲנִים, שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶם הַכָּתוּב מִצְוֹת יְתֵירוֹת, יִשְׂרָאֵל מְנָלַן? – נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״קׇרְחָה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״קׇרְחָה״, מָה כָּאן חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל קׇרְחָה וְקׇרְחָה, וְחַיָּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ כְּבֵין הָעֵינַיִם – אַף לְהַלָּן חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל קׇרְחָה וְקׇרְחָה, וְחַיָּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ כְּבֵין הָעֵינַיִם.
human_translation: And I have only priests, for whom the verse includes additional mitzvot; from where do we Israelite, It is stated here, “baldness,” and it is stated there, “baldness.” Just as here, one is obligated for each and every bald spot, and one is obligated for the entire head like between the eyes, so too there, one is obligated for each and every bald spot, and one is obligated for the entire head like between the eyes.
llm_translation: "And I have only Kohanim, for the Torah imposed upon them additional commandments, where do the Israelites come in? - It is stated here: 'Korach,' and it is stated elsewhere: 'Korach.' Just as here one is liable for every bald patch and bald patch, and one is liable for the head between the eyes, so too elsewhere one is liable for every bald patch and bald patch, and one is liable for the head between the eyes."

hebrew_text: וּמָה לְהַלָּן עַל מֵת, אַף כָּאן עַל מֵת. אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״קֹרַח״, מַאי ״קׇרְחָה״ – שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And just as there, over dead, so too here, over dead, If so let the verse be written bald [ keraḥ ]. What “baldness [ korḥa ]”? Conclude two from it,
llm_translation: And what is written there regarding a dead person, so too here regarding a dead person. If so, the verse is written "Korach," what is "Korcha" - you have heard two from it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּאִיסִי, דְּיָלֵיף ״בֵּין עֵינֵיכֶם״ מִתְּפִילִּין, מָה לְהַלָּן נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת, אַף כָּאן נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת. וְרָבָא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּאַבַּיֵּי? ״קֹרַח״ ״קׇרְחָה״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said this is Isi’s reason, as he derives “between your eyes” from phylacteries, Just as there, women are exempt, so too here, women are exempt. And what is the reason Rava did not state as Abaye? does not learn keraḥ korḥa ,
llm_translation: Rava said: This is the reason of Issi, that he infers "between your eyes" from phylacteries, just as there women are exempt, so too here women are exempt. And why did Rava not say like Abbaye? "Korah" does not sound like "Korah" to him.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא? אָמַר לָךְ: תְּפִילִּין גּוּפַיְיהוּ מֵהָכָא גָּמַר לַהּ: מָה לְהַלָּן מְקוֹם שֶׁעוֹשִׂים קׇרְחָה, בְּגוֹבַהּה שֶׁל רֹאשׁ, אַף כָּאן מְקוֹם הַנָּחָה בְּגוֹבַהּ הָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: And what is the reason Abaye did not state as Rava? said to you: Phylacteries themselves are derived from here, Just as there, a place where baldness is formed, on the upper part of the head so too, the place donned is on the upper part of the head.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Abbaye, what is the reason he did not say like Rava? He said to you: Their Tefillin themselves from here he concluded for him: Just as there, a place where they make a knot, at the height of the head, so too here, a place of resting at the height of the head.

hebrew_text: וּבֵין לְאַבָּיֵי וּבֵין לְרָבָא, הַאי ״בָּנִים אַתֶּם״, מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״בָּנִים אַתֶּם לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאַתֶּם נוֹהֲגִים מִנְהַג בָּנִים – אַתֶּם קְרוּיִם בָּנִים, אֵין אַתֶּם נוֹהֲגִים מִנְהַג בָּנִים – אֵין אַתֶּם קְרוּיִם בָּנִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And both Abaye and Rava, what do they derive from this “You are the sons This is necessary for that which is taught “You are the sons to the Lord your God,” when you act like sons you are called sons, you do not act like sons you are not called sons. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Between Abbaye and Rava, regarding the verse "You are children," what did he expound in it? He expounded it in accordance with what was taught in a Baraita: "You are children to the Lord your God," when you conduct yourselves in the manner of children - you are called children, when you do not conduct yourselves in the manner of children - you are not called children. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ אַתֶּם קְרוּיִם בָּנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּנִים סְכָלִים הֵמָּה״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״בָּנִים לֹא אֵמֻן בָּם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״זֶרַע מְרֵעִים בָּנִים מַשְׁחִיתִים״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר לָהֶם לֹא עַמִּי אַתֶּם יֵאָמֵר לָהֶם בְּנֵי אֵל חָי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir says: Either way you are called sons, as it is stated: “They are foolish sons” And it states: “Sons in whom there is no faithfulness” And it states: “A seed of evildoers, sons who deal corruptly” And it states: “And it shall come to pass that, instead of what was said to them: You are not My people, it shall be said to them: Sons of the living God”
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: "Both this and that you are called sons, as it is said: 'They are foolish sons,' and it says: 'Children in whom is no faith,' and it says: 'A seed of evildoers, children that deal corruptly,' and it says: 'And it shall be at the place where it was said to them: You are not My people, it shall be said to them: Sons of the living God.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: סְכָלֵי הוּא דְּמִקְּרוּ בְּנֵי, כִּי לֵית בְּהוּ הֵימָנוּתַיְיהוּ לָא מִיקְּרוּ בְּנֵי – תָּא שְׁמַע, וְאוֹמֵר: ״בָּנִים לֹא אֵמֻן בָּם״,
human_translation: Why And it states? And if you would say: foolish they are called sons, when they do not have faithfulness they are not called sons; come hear And states: “Sons in whom there is no faithfulness.”
llm_translation: What is "and he says"? And if you say: They are fools who are called sons, for they do not have faith in them, they are not called sons - come and hear, and he says: "Children in whom there is no faith."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כִּי לֵית בְּהוּ הֵימָנוּתָא הוּא דְּמִיקְּרוּ בָּנִים, כִּי פָּלְחוּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָא מִיקְּרוּ בָּנִים – תָּא שְׁמַע, וְאוֹמֵר: ״זֶרַע מְרֵעִים בָּנִים מַשְׁחִיתִים״. וְכִי תֵּימָא: ״בָּנִים מַשְׁחִיתִים״ הוּא דְּמִיקְּרוּ, בְּנֵי מְעַלְּיָיא לָא מִיקְּרוּ – תָּא שְׁמַע, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר לָהֶם לֹא עַמִּי אַתֶּם יֵאָמֵר לָהֶם בְּנֵי אֵל חָי״.
human_translation: And if you would say: It is when they do not have faithfulness that they are called sons, when worship idols they are not called sons come hear: And states: “A seed of evildoers, sons who deal corruptly,” And if you would say they are called “sons who deal corruptly,” they are no called full-fledged sons come hear: And verse states: “And it shall come to pass that, instead of what was said to them: You are not My people, it shall be said to them: Sons of the living God.”
llm_translation: And if you will say: Since there is no faithfulness in them, they are not called sons, for they have turned to idolatry, they are not called sons - come and hear, and it says: "A seed of evildoers, sons who are corrupt." And if you will say: "Sons who are corrupt" are the ones who are called, sons of transgressors are not called - come and hear, and it says: "And it shall be in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not My people,' it shall be said to them, 'Sons of the living God.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ , הַסְּמִיכוֹת, וְהַתְּנוּפוֹת, וְהַהַגָּשׁוֹת, וְהַקְּמִיצוֹת, וְהַ[הַ]קְטָרוֹת, וְהַמְּלִיקוֹת, וְהַקַּבָּלוֹת, וְהַזָּאוֹת – נוֹהֲגִים בַּאֲנָשִׁים וְלֹא בְּנָשִׁים, חוּץ מִמִּנְחַת סוֹטָה וּנְזִירָה שֶׁהֵן מְנִיפוֹת.
human_translation: the placing hands and the waving and the bringing near and the removal of a handful and the burning and the pinching and the collecting and the sprinkling apply to men and not to women. except for the meal-offering of a sota , and a nazirite woman, which wave.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The offerings brought near, the wave offerings, the meal offerings, the handfuls, the incense offerings, the libations, the frankincense, the handfuls taken, and the sprinklings - these are performed by men and not by women, except for the meal offering of the suspected adulteress and the Nazirite, as they are waved.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ סְמִיכוֹת. דִּכְתִיב: ״דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל... וְסָמַךְ״ – בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכִים, וְאֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכוֹת.
human_translation: placing hands As it is written: “Speak to the sons of Israel…and he shall place the sons of Israel place hands but the daughters of Israel do not place hands.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar 'Semichot.' Dikhtiv: 'Daber el benei Yisrael... ve-samakh' – benei Yisrael somkhim, ve-ein b'not Yisrael somkhot." English translation: "The completion of 'semichot.' As it is written: 'Speak to the children of Israel... and lean' – the sons of Israel lean, and the daughters of Israel do not lean."

hebrew_text: תְּנוּפוֹת. ״דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל... וְהֵנִיף״ – בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מְנִיפִין, וְאֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל מְנִיפוֹת.
human_translation: waving “Speak to the sons of Israel…and he shall wave” the sons of Israel wave, but the daughters of Israel do not wave.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tenufot. "Daber el bnei Yisrael... vehenif" - bnei Yisrael menifin, ve'ein bnot Yisrael menifot. English translation: Wavings. "Speak to the children of Israel... and he shall wave" - the sons of Israel wave, and the daughters of Israel do not wave.

hebrew_text: הַגָּשׁוֹת. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזֹאת תּוֹרַת הַמִּנְחָה... הַקְרֵב אֹתָהּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ – בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: bringing near, as it is written: “And this is the law of the meal-offering: The sons of Aaron shall bring it near” the sons of Aaron but not the daughters of Aaron.
llm_translation: Offerings. As it is written: "And this is the law of the meal offering... the sons of Aaron shall offer it" - the sons of Aaron, and not the daughters of Aaron.

hebrew_text: קְמִיצוֹת. דִּכְתִיב: ״וֶהֱבִיאָהּ אֶל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְקָמַץ״ – בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: the removal of a handful, as it is written: “And he shall bring it to the sons of Aaron, and he shall remove a handful” the sons of Aaron but not the daughters of Aaron.
llm_translation: Kemitzot. Dikhtiv: "vehevi'ah el bnei Aharon ve'kamatz" - bnei Aharon, ve'lo bnot Aharon.

hebrew_text: הַקְטָרוֹת. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִקְטִירוּ אֹתוֹ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ – בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: burning as it is written: “And the sons of Aaron shall burn it” the sons of Aaron but not the daughters of Aaron.
llm_translation: The incense. As it is written: "And the sons of Aaron shall burn it" - the sons of Aaron, and not the daughters of Aaron.

hebrew_text: הַמְּלִיקוֹת. דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמָלַק... וְהִקְטִיר״, אִיתַּקַּשׁ מְלִיקָה לְהַקְטָרָה.
human_translation: pinching, as it is written: “And he shall pinch…and he shall burn” juxtaposes killing to burning,
llm_translation: The sprinklings. As it is written: "And he shall sprinkle... and burn," the sprinkling is compared to burning.

hebrew_text: הַקַּבָּלוֹת. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִקְרִיבוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״, וְאָמַר מָר:
human_translation: receiving, as it is written: “And the sons of Aaron shall present And the Master said
llm_translation: The measurements. As it is written: "And the sons of Aaron shall offer," and the Master said:

hebrew_text: ״וְהִקְרִיבוּ״ – זוֹ קַבָּלַת הַדָּם.
human_translation: “And shall present,” this is collecting the blood.
llm_translation: "And they shall bring near" - this is the receiving of the blood.

hebrew_text: וְהַזָּאוֹת. הַזָּאָה דְּהֵיכָא? אִי דְּפָרָה, ״אֶלְעָזָר״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ. אִי דְּפָנִים, ״הַכֹּהֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ. אֶלָּא הַזָּאָה דְּבֶן עוֹף,
human_translation: sprinkling: To which sprinkling If of heifer, “Elazar” is written with regard to that If to inside “The anointed priest” is written with regard to that Rather, sprinkling of a bird
llm_translation: The text: "And the bird. Where is the bird? If it is a cow, 'Eleazar' is written in it. If it is inside, 'the anointed priest' is written in it. Rather, the bird of the son of a bird,"

hebrew_text: דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִבֶּן צֹאן. וּמָה בֶּן צֹאן שֶׁלֹּא קָבַע לוֹ כֹּהֵן לִשְׁחִיטָתוֹ – קָבַע לוֹ כֹּהֵן לְהַזָּאָתוֹ, בֶּן עוֹף שֶׁקָּבַע לוֹ כֹּהֵן לִמְלִיקָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּקְבַּע לוֹ לְהַזָּאָתוֹ?
human_translation: that this is derived through an a fortiori from a sheep If a sheep which did not establish a priest for its slaughter, established a priest for its sprinkling, is it not logical a bird which established a priest for its pinching, established a priest for its sprinkling?
llm_translation: It was derived from a fortiori reasoning from a sheep. And just as a sheep that a Kohen did not designate for its slaughter - if he designates it for its sprinkling, a bird that a Kohen designates for its wringing - is it not logical that it should be designated for its sprinkling?

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִמִּנְחַת סוֹטָה וּנְזִירָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּדָרֵיהּ: לָא תֵּיתֵיב אַכַּרְעָךְ עַד דְּאָמְרַתְּ לִי לְהָא שְׁמַעְתְּתָא: מִנַּיִן לְמִנְחַת סוֹטָה שֶׁטְּעוּנָה תְּנוּפָה? מְנָלַן?! בְּגוּפַהּ כְּתִיב: ״וְהֵנִיף אֶת הַמִּנְחָה״! אֶלָּא: תְּנוּפָה בִּבְעָלִים מְנָלַן?
human_translation: except for the meal-offering of a sota and a nazirite woman, Rabbi Elazar said to Rabbi Yoshiya of his generation, Do not sit down until you explain this statement to me; from where that the meal-offering of a sota requires waving? From where do we It is written in itself: “And he shall wave the meal-offering” Rather, From where do we waving by the owners?
llm_translation: Outside of the meal offering of a suspected adulteress and a Nazirite vow. Rabbi Elazar said to Rabbi Yoshiyah who was sitting before him: "Do not sit down until you tell me this teaching: From where do we derive that the meal offering of a suspected adulteress requires waving? Where is it derived from?! It is written in its context: 'And he shall wave the meal offering'! Rather, where do we derive that waving is required for owners?"

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״יָד״ ״יָד״ מִשְּׁלָמִים. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן מִיַּד הָאִשָּׁה״ וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יָדָיו תְּבִיאֶנָּה״.
human_translation: is derived “hand” from “hand” a peace-offering. It is written here, “And the priest shall take from the woman’s hand and it is written there: “His own hands shall bring
llm_translation: The Gemara: "Yad" "Yad" from what they pay. It is written here: "And the kohen shall take from the woman's hand," and it is written there: "His hands shall bring it."

hebrew_text: מָה כָּאן כֹּהֵן – אַף לְהַלָּן כֹּהֵן, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעָלִים – אַף כָּאן בְּעָלִים. הָא כֵּיצַד? כֹּהֵן מַכְנִיס יָדוֹ תַּחַת יָד בְּעָלִים וּמֵנִיף.
human_translation: Just as here, a priest so too there, a priest just as there, owner so too here, owner How so? priest places his hand under the hand of the owner and waves
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "What here priest - also there priest, what there owners - also here owners. He how? Priest inserts his hand under hand owners and waves."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן סוֹטָה, נְזִירָה מְנָלַן? אָתְיָא: ״כַּף״ ״כַּף״ מִסּוֹטָה.
human_translation: We found a sota ; from where do we a nazirite woman It is derived “palm” from “palm” a sota .
llm_translation: We find Sotah, where is Nazir from? It was taught: "Kaf, kaf" from Sotah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁהִיא תְּלוּיָה בָּאָרֶץ – אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ תְּלוּיָה בָּאָרֶץ – נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ,
human_translation: Any mitzva that is dependent on the land [ aretz ] applies only in Eretz and that is not dependent on the land applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: It was taught: Any commandment that is dependent on the land – is only practiced in the land, and one that is not dependent on the land – is practiced both in the land and outside the land.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הָעׇרְלָה וְכִלְאַיִם. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַף הֶחָדָשׁ.
human_translation: apart from orla and diverse kinds, Rabbi Eliezer says: even new crop
llm_translation: Outside of the foreskin and testicles. Rabbi Eliezer says: Also the new moon.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי תְּלוּיָה וּמַאי שֶׁאֵינָהּ תְּלוּיָה? אִילֵימָא תְּלוּיָה – דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״בִּיאָה״, וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ תְּלוּיָה – דְּלָא כְּתִיב בַּהּ ״בִּיאָה״, וַהֲרֵי תְּפִילִּין וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, דִּכְתִיב בָּהֶן ״בִּיאָה״, וְנוֹהֲגִין בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ!
human_translation: What dependent and what that are not dependent If we say dependent where it is written with regard to it: Coming and that is not dependent which Coming, is not written with regard to it, But aren’t there phylacteries and the firstborn donkey, in which states: Bringing, and apply both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, what is considered dependent and what is not considered dependent? If you say it is dependent - because it is written in it "bi'ah" (coming), and if it is not dependent - because it is not written in it "bi'ah." And behold, tefillin and the firstborn donkey, for it is written in them "bi'ah," and they are practiced both in the land and outside the land!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁהִיא חוֹבַת הַגּוּף – נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ, חוֹבַת קַרְקַע – אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is what is saying: Any mitzva that is an obligation of the body, applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz an obligation of the land, applies only in Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Thus he said: Every commandment that is an obligation of the body - is practiced whether in the land or outside the land, an obligation of the ground - is practiced only in the land.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֵלֶּה הַחֻקִּים״ – אֵלּוּ הַמִּדְרָשׁוֹת. ״וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִים״ – אֵלּוּ הַדִּינִים. ״אֲשֶׁר תִּשְׁמְרוּן״ – זוֹ מִשְׁנָה. ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ – זוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “these are the statutes” these are the expositions “and the ordinances,” these are laws. “that you shall observe,” this is study “to do,” this is action,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" For the Rabbis taught: "'These are the statutes' – these are the homiletical interpretations. 'And the ordinances' – these are the laws. 'Which you shall observe' – this is the Mishnah. 'To perform' – this is the action."

hebrew_text: ״בָּאָרֶץ״ – יָכוֹל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת כּוּלָּן לֹא יְהוּ נוֹהֲגִים אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל הַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר אַתֶּם חַיִּים עַל הָאֲדָמָה״. אִי כׇּל הַיָּמִים, יָכוֹל יְהוּ נוֹהֲגִים בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בָּאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: “in the land [ ba’aretz ],” might all mitzvot apply only in Eretz the verse states “all the days that you live upon the earth,” if “all the days,” might should apply both in Eretz and outside of Eretz the verse states “in the land.”
llm_translation: "In the land" - Can all the commandments all of them not be practiced except in the land? The verse teaches: "All the days that you live on the earth." If all the days, can they be practiced both in the land and outside the land? The verse teaches: "In the land."

hebrew_text: אַחַר שֶׁרִיבָּה הַכָּתוּב וּמִיעֵט – צֵא וּלְמַד מִמַּה שֶּׁאָמוּר בָּעִנְיָן: ״אַבֵּד תְּאַבְּדוּן אֶת כׇּל הַמְּקֹמוֹת אֲשֶׁר עָבְדוּ שָׁם וְגוֹ׳״ – מָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה מְיוּחֶדֶת, שֶׁהִיא חוֹבַת הַגּוּף, וְנוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – אַף כֹּל שֶׁהִיא חוֹבַת הַגּוּף נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Once the verse includes and excludes Go and learn from what is stated with regard to issue “You shall destroy all the places where served Just as idol worship is distinct that it is an obligation of the body, and it applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz so too, any that is an obligation of the body applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: After the verse has decreed and limited - go out and learn from what is said on the matter: "You shall utterly destroy all the places where they served their gods" - what is a unique foreign worship, which is an obligation of the body, and is practiced both in the land and outside the land - so too, any obligation of the body is practiced both in the land and outside the land.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הָעׇרְלָה וְהַכִּלְאַיִם. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְקוּלָּא פְּלִיג אוֹ לְחוּמְרָא פְּלִיג?
human_translation: apart from orla and diverse kinds. A dilemma was raised before them: Rabbi Eliezer disagree leniently or he disagree stringently?
llm_translation: Outside of the foreskin and the testicles. It was asked of them: Rabbi Eliezer, does he argue leniently or stringently?

hebrew_text: לְחוּמְרָא פְּלִיג, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא: חוּץ מִן הָעׇרְלָה וּמִן הַכִּלְאַיִם, דְּהִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לָהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר חוֹבַת קַרְקַע הִיא. אֲבָל חָדָשׁ, בָּאָרֶץ – אִין, בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – לָא.
human_translation: disagrees stringently, and this is what the first tanna is saying: apart from orla and diverse kinds, as we learned this halakha through a tradition Although one could say is an obligation of the land But new crop, yes, in Eretz outside of Eretz no,
llm_translation: The matter of dispute is as follows, and thus it was taught in the first Tanna: Except for the foreskin and the testicles, for the tradition is established regarding them, even though one might argue that it is a matter of real estate. But for a new planting, in the land – one is liable, in the outer area of the land – one is not liable.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? ״מוֹשָׁב״ – לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: What is the reason dwelling indicates after inheritance and settlement
llm_translation: What is the reason? "Settlement" - implies after inheritance and dwelling.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר: אַף חָדָשׁ נוֹהֵג בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״מוֹשָׁב״ – בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתֶּם יוֹשְׁבִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer comes to say: Even new crop applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz What is the reason dwelling wherever you dwell.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer came to say: Also, a new vessel is used both in the land and outside the land. What is the reason? "Dwelling" - in every place that you dwell.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא לְקוּלָּא פְּלִיג, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא: חוּץ מִן הָעׇרְלָה וְהַכִּלְאַיִם, דְּהִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן חָדָשׁ, דְּ״מוֹשָׁב״ – כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתֶּם יוֹשְׁבִים מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Or perhaps disagrees leniently, and this is what the first tanna is saying: apart from orla and diverse kinds, as we learned this halakha through tradition, and all the more so new crop, as dwelling indicates wherever you dwell.
llm_translation: Or perhaps to be lenient he disputes, and thus it says: A first tanna: Except for uncircumcision and forbidden mixtures, as the tradition is established for it, and all the more so for something new, as "dwelling" - any place where you are sitting, listen.

hebrew_text: וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר: חָדָשׁ אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ, דְּ״מוֹשָׁב״ – לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה מַשְׁמַע. וּמַאי ״אַף״ – אַקַּמַּיְיתָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer comes to say: new crop applies only in Eretz as dwelling indicates after inheritance and settlement And what Even, to the first
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer came to say: "New produce is only customary in the land, as it is stated, 'like a dwelling' - after inheritance and settlement is implied. And what is 'also' - it is an additional measure."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר – רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: לְלַמֶּדְךָ, שֶׁכׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״מוֹשָׁב״ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Come hear which Abaye said: Who tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Eliezer? It is Rabbi Yishmael. As it is taught to teach you that wherever dwelling is stated, only after inheritance and settlement the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Abaye said: Who is the Tanna that disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer? It is Rabbi Yishmael. As it was taught: To teach you that every place where it is stated "dwelling" is nothing but after inheritance and settlement, the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הֲרֵי שַׁבָּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״, וְנוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ! אָמַר לוֹ: שַׁבָּת קַל וָחוֹמֶר אָתְיָא, מָה מִצְוֹת קַלּוֹת נוֹהֲגוֹת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – שַׁבָּת חֲמִירָא לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: Shabbat, in which it is stated: dwellings” and applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz said to Shabbat is derived through a fortiori If less stringent mitzvot apply both in Eretz and outside of Eretz not all the more so Shabbat, a stringent
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: Behold the Sabbath, as it is stated in it "dwellings," and it is observed both on the land and outside the land! He said to him: The Sabbath is an a fortiori argument, if easy commandments are observed both on the land and outside the land - the Sabbath, which is stringent, all the more so?

hebrew_text: מִדְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר – רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְחוּמְרָא פְּלִיג, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: From that Abaye said: Who is the tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Yishmael, conclude from Rabbi Eliezer disagrees stringently, Conclude from
llm_translation: From the statement of Abbaye: Who is the Tanna that disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer? - Rabbi Ishmael. Learn from it that Rabbi Eliezer disputes for stringency, learn from it.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אַהֵיכָא קָאֵי? אַנְּסָכִים. בִּנְסָכִים
human_translation: Now, where does Rabbi Yishmael stand, to libations, With regard to libations
llm_translation: From where does Rabbi Yishmael derive this ruling? In the case of libations. With libations.

hebrew_text: בִּיאָה וּמוֹשָׁב כְּתִיב בְּהוּ?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בִּיאָה וּמוֹשָׁב אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Coming, and Dwelling, are written: this is what is saying: This teaches that wherever coming and dwelling are stated, only after inheritance and settlement the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Bi'ah u'moshav ketiv behu?! Hachi ka'amar: lelamed shekol makom she'ne'emar bi'ah u'moshav einu ela le'achar yerusha viyeshiva, divrei Rabbi Yishmael." English translation: "Intercourse and dwelling is written in it?! This is what he is saying: to teach that every place where it is stated 'intercourse' and 'dwelling' is only after inheritance and settlement, the words of Rabbi Yishmael."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הֲרֵי שַׁבָּת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״, וְאָמַר לוֹ: שַׁבָּת קַל וָחוֹמֶר הִיא, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אֲנָא בִּיאָה וּמוֹשָׁב קָאָמֵינָא! חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, חֲדָא – דַּאֲנָא בִּיאָה וּמוֹשָׁב קָאָמֵינָא. וְעוֹד: דְּקָא אָמְרַתְּ הֲרֵי שַׁבָּת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ – שַׁבָּת קַל וָחוֹמֶר הִיא.
human_translation: If so, Rabbi Akiva said to him: Shabbat in which it is stated “dwellings,” and said to him: Shabbat is derived through an a fortiori let say to I say coming and dwelling states one and another One that I say coming and dwelling And another that which you say Shabbat, in which it is stated “dwellings,” Shabbat is derived through an a fortiori
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, Rabbi Akiva said to him: Behold, the Sabbath that it is said about it "dwellings," and he said to him: Sabbath is a logical inference, let him say to him: I am speaking of coming and dwelling! One and furthermore he said to him, one - that I am speaking of coming and dwelling. And furthermore, that you said, "Behold, the Sabbath that it is said about it 'dwellings' - Sabbath is a logical inference."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּקֵירְבוּ נְסָכִים בַּמִּדְבָּר קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: לָא קֵירְבוּ נְסָכִים בַּמִּדְבָּר. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: קֵירְבוּ נְסָכִים בַּמִּדְבָּר.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? They disagree sacrificed libations in the wilderness. Rabbi Yishmael maintains: They did not sacrifice libations in the wilderness, And Rabbi Akiva maintains: They did sacrifice libations in the wilderness.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? With regard to offering libations in the wilderness. Rabbi Yishmael holds: They did not offer libations in the wilderness. And Rabbi Akiva holds: They did offer libations in the wilderness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מַפֵּיק מֵאִידַּךְ תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Abaye said: This tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, diverges from another tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Abaye said: This Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael derives it from the following Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶמְרוּ בִּיאוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם, וּפָרַט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה, אַף כֹּל לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה.
human_translation: as tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Since coming are mentioned in the Torah without specifying and the verse specified in one of after inheritance and settlement so too, wherever after inheritance and settlement.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'tana d'bei Rabbi Yishmael: Ho'il v'ne'emru biyot baTorah setam, u'parat lecha haktuv b'echad mehen le'achar yerusha viyeshiva, af kol le'achar yerusha viyeshiva." English translation: "It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Since the entrances in the Torah are stated generally, and the Scripture specified one of them for you after inheritance and settlement, so too all after inheritance and settlement."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה מֶלֶךְ וּבִיכּוּרִים שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: And other because there is a king first fruits, two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And the other opinion is, because he is a king and firstfruits, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא מֶלֶךְ וְלָא כְּתַב בִּיכּוּרִים, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בִּיכּוּרִים, דְּקָא מִיתְהֲנֵי – לְאַלְתַּר. וְאִי כְּתַב בִּיכּוּרִים וְלָא כְּתַב מֶלֶךְ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מֶלֶךְ, דְּדַרְכּוֹ לְכַבֵּשׁ – לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: And the other are necessary, As, if the Merciful One written a king, and had not written first fruits, I would say: first fruits, since one benefits immediately And had written first fruits and had not written a king, I would say the manner of a king to conquer, immediately,
llm_translation: And the other opinion is necessary, for if the Merciful One had written "king" and not written "firstborns," I would say: "firstborns," for they are enjoying - immediately. And if He had written "firstborns" and not written "king," I would say: "king," for his way is to conquer - immediately.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא מֶלֶךְ וְלָא בָּעֵי בִּיכּוּרִים, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: וּמָה מֶלֶךְ, דִּלְכַבֵּשׁ לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה, בִּיכּוּרִים – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: And the other, Let the Merciful One write a king, and it would not be required first fruits, I would say: And if a king, whose to conquer after inheritance and settlement, first fruits not all the more so
llm_translation: The other opinion is: It is written "Merciful King" and not "in need of investigations." And I say: And what is the meaning of "King," who is able to conquer after inheriting and settling, investigations - all the more so not necessary?

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: אִי כְּתַב הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַחַלָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And the other, If written this I would say just as it is with regard to ḥalla , teaches us
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: if he wrote thus, I would say: since he was sick, he is informing us.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ חוֹבַת הַגּוּף נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, ״מוֹשָׁב״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי שַׁבָּת, לְמָה לִי? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּבְעִנְיָנָא דְמוֹעֲדוֹת כְּתִיבָא, תִּיבְּעֵי קִידּוּשׁ כִּי מוֹעֲדוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And now that you said an obligation of the body applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz why do I “dwelling” that the Merciful One writes with regard to Shabbat It was necessary it might enter your mind to say: Since was written in the context of the Festivals, it should require sanctification like the Festivals, teaches us
llm_translation: At this time, as you said, the obligation of the body applies whether in the Land of Israel or outside the Land. "Dwelling" that the Merciful One wrote regarding Shabbat, why do I need it? It is necessary, for with your reasoning I say: Since in the matter of appointed times it is written, it requires sanctification because of its appointed times, this is what it teaches us.

hebrew_text: ״מוֹשָׁב״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי חֵלֶב וָדָם, לְמָה לִי? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּבְעִנְיָנָא דְקׇרְבָּנוֹת כְּתִיבִי, בִּזְמַן דְּאִיכָּא קׇרְבָּן, נִיתְּסַר חֵלֶב וָדָם, בִּזְמַן דְּלֵיכָּא קׇרְבָּן – לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I dwelling, which the Merciful One writes with regard to fat and blood It was necessary it might enter your mind to say: Since are written in the context of the offerings, when there is an offering fat and blood are forbidden when there is no offering, not teaches us
llm_translation: "The 'dwelling' that the Merciful One wrote regarding fat and blood, why do I need it? It is necessary, for I might have thought: Since in the matter of sacrifices it is written, when there is a sacrifice, fat and blood are removed, when there is no sacrifice - no, it teaches us."

hebrew_text: ״מוֹשָׁב״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי מַצָּה וּמָרוֹר, לְמָה לִי? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״עַל מַצּוֹת וּמְרֹרִים יֹאכְלֻהוּ״, בִּזְמַן דְּאִיכָּא פֶּסַח – אִין, בִּזְמַן דְּלֵיכָּא פֶּסַח – לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I dwelling, which the Merciful One writes with regard to matza and bitter herbs, It was necessary it might enter your mind to say since it is written: “They shall eat with matza and bitter herbs” when there is a Paschal offering, yes, when there is no Paschal offering, no teaches us
llm_translation: "The term 'sitting' that the Merciful One wrote regarding matzah and maror, why do I need it? It is necessary, for I might have thought that since it is written, 'They shall eat it with matzot and bitter herbs,' when there is Pesach – yes, when there is no Pesach – no, it teaches us."

hebrew_text: ״בִּיאָה״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי תְּפִילִּין וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, לְמָה לִי? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: עֲשֵׂה מִצְוָה זוֹ, שֶׁבִּשְׁבִילָהּ תִּיכָּנֵס לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Why do I coming, which the Merciful One writes with regard to phylacteries and the firstborn donkey, That verse is necessary for that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Perform this mitzva on account of which enter Eretz
llm_translation: "Bi'ah" that the Merciful One wrote regarding Tefillin and the redemption of a donkey, why do I need it? That one should say to him according to the teaching of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Perform this commandment, so that through it you may enter the land.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״מוֹשָׁב״ – כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתֶּם יוֹשְׁבִים מַשְׁמַע, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וַיֹּאכְלוּ מֵעֲבוּר הָאָרֶץ מִמׇּחֳרַת הַפֶּסַח״ – מִמָּחֳרַת הַפֶּסַח אֲכוּל, מֵעִיקָּרָא – לָא אֲכוּל. אַלְמָא
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says dwelling indicates wherever you dwell, this that it is written “And they ate the produce of the land on the morrow after the Passover” on the day after the Passover ate initially, did not eat Apparently,
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "dwelling" - every place that you are sitting, hear. That is as it is written "and they ate from the produce of the land on the day after the Passover" - on the day after the Passover one may eat, from the outset - one may not eat. This implies...

hebrew_text: אַקְרוּב עוֹמֶר וַהֲדַר אֲכוּל.
human_translation: they sacrificed the omer and afterward eat.
llm_translation: Bring close the omer and then eat.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְאַחַר יְרוּשָּׁה וִישִׁיבָה, נֵיכוֹל לְאַלְתַּר! לָא הֲווֹ צְרִיכִי,
human_translation: But according to the one who says after inheritance and settlement let eat immediately. They did not need
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who said for after inheritance and settlement, it is possible to quickly conclude! It was not necessary.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אָכְלוּ אֶת הַמָּן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה עַד בֹּאָם אֶל אֶרֶץ נוֹשָׁבֶת, אֶת הַמָּן אָכְלוּ עַד בֹּאָם אֶל קְצֵה אֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן״. אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר ״עַד בֹּאָם אֶל אֶרֶץ נוֹשָׁבֶת״, שֶׁכְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״אֶל קְצֵה אֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן״. וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר ״אֶל קְצֵה אֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן״, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״עַד בֹּאָם אֶל אֶרֶץ נוֹשָׁבֶת״. הָא כֵּיצַד? בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת מֹשֶׁה וּפָסַק מָן מִלֵּירֵד, וְהָיוּ מִסְתַּפְּקִין מִמָּן שֶׁבִּכְלֵיהֶם עַד שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּנִיסָן.
human_translation: as it is written: “And the children of Israel ate the manna forty years until they came to a settled land; they ate the manna until they came to the borders of the land of Canaan” One cannot say “until they came to a settled land,” as it is already stated: “To the borders of the land of Canaan,” And one cannot say “to the borders of the land of Canaan,” as it is already stated: “Until they came to a settled land.” How these Moses died on the seventh of Adar and the manna ceased falling, and they ate the manna that was in their vessels until the sixteenth of Nisan,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written, "And the children of Israel ate the manna forty years until they came to an inhabited land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan." It is impossible to say "until they came to an inhabited land," as it is already stated "to the border of the land of Canaan." And it is impossible to say "to the border of the land of Canaan," for it is already stated: "until they came to an inhabited land." How so? On the seventh of Adar, Moses died, and the manna ceased from descending, and they were uncertain about the manna in their vessels until the sixteenth of Nissan.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אָכְלוּ אֶת הַמָּן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה״. וְכִי אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה אָכְלוּ? וַהֲלֹא אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה חָסֵר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם אָכְלוּ! אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: עוּגוֹת שֶׁהוֹצִיאוּ מִמִּצְרַיִם, טָעֲמוּ בָּהֶם טַעַם מָן.
human_translation: It is taught another “And the children of Israel ate the manna forty years” But did they eat forty years? But didn’t they eat forty years less thirty days? Rather, this to tell you they tasted the taste of manna cakes that they took out from Egypt
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And the children of Israel ate the manna for forty years." Did they indeed eat for forty years? But were they not lacking thirty days of forty years! Rather, to tell you: Cakes that they brought out from Egypt, they tasted in them the taste of manna.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת מֹשֶׁה, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלַד. מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם מֹשֶׁה עֶבֶד ה׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּבְכּוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת מֹשֶׁה בְּעַרְבֹת מוֹאָב שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי מוֹת מֹשֶׁה עֶבֶד ה׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״מֹשֶׁה עַבְדִּי מֵת וְעַתָּה קוּם עֲבֹר״
human_translation: It is taught another Moses died on the seventh of Adar, and he was born on the seventh of Adar. From where that died on the seventh of Adar? As it is stated: “So Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there” and it is written: “And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days” And it is written: “Now it came to pass after the death of Moses, the servant of the Lord” and it is written: “Moses, My servant, is dead; now arise, cross
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The seventh of Adar is the day Moses died, and the seventh of Adar is the day he was born. From where do we derive that Moses died on the seventh of Adar? As it is stated: "And Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there." And it is also written: "And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days." And it is further written: "And it came to pass after the death of Moses, the servant of the Lord." And it is written: "My servant Moses is dead, now arise."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״עִבְרוּ בְּקֶרֶב הַמַּחֲנֶה וְצַוּוּ אֶת הָעָם לֵאמֹר הָכִינוּ לָכֶם צֵדָה כִּי בְּעוֹד שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים תַּעַבְרוּ אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן״ וּכְתִיב: ״וְהָעָם עָלוּ מִן הַיַּרְדֵּן בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן״, צֵא מֵהֶן שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים לְמַפְרֵעַ, הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁבְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת מֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: And it is written: “Pass through the midst of the camp and command the people, saying: Prepare your victuals, for within three days you are to cross the Jordan” And it is written: “And the people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month” Subtract retroactively from the last thirty-three days, learn that Moses died on the seventh of Adar.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "Pass through the midst of the camp and command the people, saying, 'Prepare yourselves provisions, for within three days you are to cross this Jordan.'" And it is written: "And the people went up out of the Jordan on the tenth of the first month." Deduct from them thirty-three days for rebellion, thus you learn that Moses died on the seventh of Adar.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵהֶם בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה אָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם לֹא אוּכַל עוֹד לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יוֹשֵׁב וּמְמַלֵּא שְׁנוֹתֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם וּמֵחֹדֶשׁ לְחֹדֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״.
human_translation: And from where Moses was born on the seventh of Adar? as it is stated: “And he said to them, I am one hundred and twenty years old today; I can no more go out and come in” As no the verse to state “today,” What the verse states “today”? This teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, sits and completes the years of the righteous from day to day and from month to month, as it is stated: “The number of your days I will fulfill”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we know that Moses was born on the seventh of Adar? As it is stated: "And he said to them, 'I am one hundred and twenty years old today; I can no longer go out and come in.'" (Deuteronomy 31:2) Since the Torah did not need to state "today," what does it teach by stating "today"? It teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, fills the years of the righteous from day to day and from month to month, as it is stated: "I will fulfill the number of your days."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּכְנִיסָתָן לָאָרֶץ, וְנוֹהֲגוֹת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: The Jewish people were commanded three mitzvot upon entering Eretz and apply both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: Three commandments were commanded to the children of Israel upon their entry into the land, and they apply whether inside the land or outside the land.

hebrew_text: וְהוּא הַדִּין שֶׁיִּנְהֲגוּ, וּמָה חָדָשׁ, שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאֵין אִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, וְיֵשׁ הֶיתֵּר לְאִיסּוּרוֹ, נוֹהֵג בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ –
human_translation: And it is logical, that should apply If new crop, whose prohibition is not a permanent prohibition, and whose prohibition is not a prohibition against benefit, and there is dissolution for its prohibition, applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: And the same law applies, and what is new, that its prohibition is an eternal prohibition, and its prohibition is not a prohibition of benefit, and there is permission for its prohibition, it is practiced whether in the land or outside the land –

hebrew_text: כִּלְאַיִם, שֶׁאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, וְאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, וְאֵין הֶיתֵּר לְאִיסּוּרָן – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּנְהֲגוּ בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ? וְהוּא הַדִּין לְעׇרְלָה בִּשְׁתַּיִם.
