human_translation: diverse kinds, whose prohibition is a permanent prohibition, and whose prohibition is a prohibition against benefit, and there is no dissolution for its prohibition, is it not logical that it should apply both in Eretz and outside of Eretz And the same is true of orla with regard to two
llm_translation: Biklayim, she'isuran isur olam, ve'isuran isur hana'ah, ve'ein heter le'isuran - einu din sheyin'hagu bein ba'aretz bein bechutzah la'aretz? Ve'hu hadin le'orlah bishtayim.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁנִּצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל קוֹדֶם כְּנִיסָתָן לָאָרֶץ – נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. לְאַחַר כְּנִיסָתָן לָאָרֶץ – אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ, חוּץ מִן הַשְׁמָטַת כְּסָפִים וְשִׁילּוּחַ עֲבָדִים, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּצְטַוּוּ עֲלֵיהֶם לְאַחַר כְּנִיסָתָן לָאָרֶץ – נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Any mitzva that the Jewish people were commanded before entering Eretz applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz after they entered Eretz applies only in Eretz except for abrogation of monetary and emancipation of slaves Even though were commanded with regard to these after their entry into Eretz apply both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Mitzvah that commanded Israel before their entry to the land - practiced whether in the land or outside the land. After their entry to the land - practiced only in the land, except for the release of debts and the sending away of slaves, for even though they were commanded regarding them after their entry to the land - practiced whether in the land or outside the land.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁמָטַת כְּסָפִים חוֹבַת הַגּוּף הִיא!
human_translation: The abrogation of monetary is an obligation of the body.
llm_translation: The release of money is an obligation of the body!

hebrew_text: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְכִדְתַנְיָא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הַשְּׁמִטָּה שָׁמוֹט״ – בִּשְׁתֵּי שְׁמִיטוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר: אַחַת שְׁמִיטַּת קַרְקַע, וְאַחַת שְׁמִיטַּת כְּסָפִים. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט קַרְקַע – אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט כְּסָפִים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט קַרְקַע – אִי אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט כְּסָפִים.
human_translation: It is necessary only for that which is taught As it is taught Rabbi says: “And this is the manner of the abrogation: He shall abrogate” The verse speaks of two abrogation: One the release of land and one abrogation of monetary At a time when you release land, you abrogate monetary at a time when you do not release land, you do not abrogate monetary
llm_translation: Not needed except for the purpose of teaching. As it was taught: Rabbi says, "And this is the matter of the Shemittah release." - In two Shemittah cycles the Scripture speaks: one is the Shemittah of the land, and one is the Shemittah of money. When you release the land - you release the money, when you do not release the land - you do not release the money.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט קַרְקַע – אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט כְּסָפִים, וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט קַרְקַע – אֵין אַתָּה מְשַׁמֵּט כְּסָפִים! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי קָרָא שְׁמִטָּה לַה׳״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: But say In a place you release land, you abrogate monetary and in a place you do not release land, you do not abrogate monetary the verse states: “Because the Lord’s abrogation has been proclaimed” in any case,
llm_translation: And why? In a place where you are releasing the land - you release coins, and in a place where you are not releasing the land - you do not release coins! The Talmud teaches: "For the land is Mine; for you are strangers and sojourners with Me."

hebrew_text: שִׁילּוּחַ עֲבָדִים חוֹבַת הַגּוּף הִיא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״וּקְרָאתֶם דְּרוֹר בָּאָרֶץ״, בָּאָרֶץ – אִין, בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – לָא, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The emancipation of slaves is an obligation of the body, it might enter your mind to say: Since it is written: “And proclaim liberty throughout the land “Throughout the land,” yes, outside of Eretz no, the verse states “It shall be a Jubilee” in any case,
llm_translation: The sending away of slaves is an obligation of the body! It is obvious in your opinion: Since it is written "And you shall proclaim release in the land," in the land - yes, outside the land - no, the Torah teaches: "It is a Jubilee" - from any place.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בָּאָרֶץ״? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַדְּרוֹר נוֹהֵג בָּאָרֶץ – נוֹהֵג בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, אֵין דְּרוֹר נוֹהֵג בָּאָרֶץ – אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: If so, what the verse states: “Throughout the land”? When the liberty applies in Eretz applies outside of Eretz the liberty does not apply in Eretz it does not apply outside Eretz
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud mean by "in the land"? When freedom is practiced in the land - it is practiced outside the land; if freedom is not practiced in the land - it is not practiced outside the land.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הֶחָדָשׁ אָסוּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, עׇרְלָה הֲלָכָה, וְהַכִּלְאַיִם מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים. מַאי הֲלָכָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הִלְכְתָא מְדִינָה. עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: We learned there The new crop is forbidden by Torah law everywhere; orla a halakha , and diverse kinds by rabbinic law. What halakha , Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: local halakha , Ulla Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: We learned there: The new moon is prohibited by the Torah everywhere, circumcision is a halakha, and kilayim is from the words of the scribes. What is the halakha? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A law of the land. Ulla said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A law to Moses from Sinai.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא לְרַב יְהוּדָה: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי – הַיְינוּ דְּשָׁנֵי לַן בֵּין סְפֵק עׇרְלָה לִסְפֵק כִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: Ulla said to Rav Yehuda: Granted, according to my as I say a halakha to Moses from Sinai, this is why we distinguish between orla uncertain, and diverse kinds uncertain,
llm_translation: He said to him Ulai to Rav Yehudah: "Granted according to my opinion, for I hold the principle that the halacha was given to Moses at Sinai - that is why we differentiate between a doubt of foreskin and a doubt of mixed species."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: סְפֵק עׇרְלָה, בָּאָרֶץ – אָסוּר, בְּסוּרְיָא – מוּתָּר. בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵחַ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִרְאֶנּוּ לוֹקֵט.
human_translation: as we learned orla uncertain is forbidden in Eretz it is permitted in Syria Outside of Eretz go down and purchase provided that does not see him gather
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Uncertain circumcision status, in the land - forbidden, in Suria - permitted. Outside of the land one may descend and take, as long as he does not appear to be gathering.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי כִלְאַיִם תְּנַן: כֶּרֶם הַנָּטוּעַ יָרָק, וְיָרָק נִמְכָּר חוּצָה לוֹ, בָּאָרֶץ – אָסוּר, בְּסוּרְיָא – מוּתָּר,
human_translation: Nevertheless, we learned with regard to diverse kinds a vineyard has vegetables planted in it, and vegetables being sold outside in Eretz forbidden. In Syria permitted.
llm_translation: And regarding kilayim we learned: A vineyard planted with vegetables, and the vegetables are sold outside to him, in the land - it is forbidden, in Syria - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵט. וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִלְקוֹט בַּיָּד.
human_translation: Outside of Eretz goes down and gathers provided that does not gather by hand,
llm_translation: In the outside of the land - one may pick and gather. But only that he not gather in his hand.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ
human_translation: But according to your
llm_translation: Rather, according to our view.

hebrew_text: נִיתְנֵי אוֹ: ״זֶה וָזֶה יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵחַ״, אוֹ: ״זֶה וָזֶה יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵט״! הָאָמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב עָנָן: תְּנִי אוֹ: ״זֶה וָזֶה יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵחַ״ אוֹ: ״זֶה וָזֶה יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵט״. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ לְקוּלָּא: ״זֶה וָזֶה יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵט, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִלְקוֹט בַּיָּד״.
human_translation: let teach either both this and that one may go down and purchase or both this and that one may go down and gather Didn’t Shmuel say to Rav Anan teach it either both this and that one may go down and purchase or both this and that one may go down and gather Mar, son of Rabbana, taught this lenient both this and that one may go down and gather provided that he does not gather with hand.
llm_translation: It was taught: "This and this descends and takes," or: "This and this descends and gathers!" When Shmuel said to Rav Anan: Teach it as: "This and this descends and takes," or: "This and this descends and gathers." Mar, son of Ravina, taught him in a loud voice: "This and this descends and gathers, as long as it does not gather in the hand."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לֵוִי לִשְׁמוּאֵל: אַרְיוֹךְ, סַפֵּק לִי, וַאֲנָא אֵיכוֹל. רַב אַוְיָא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב חָנָן מְסַפְּקוּ סַפּוֹקֵי לַהֲדָדֵי. אָמְרִי חֲרִיפֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא: אֵין עׇרְלָה בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Levi said to Shmuel: Aryokh, supply me and I will eat Rav Avya and Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan would supply for each other, The sharp of Pumbedita said: orla does not outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Levi said to Samuel: "Aryokh, give me a doubt, and I will eat." Rav Avya and Rabbah bar Rav Hanan doubted the doubts to Hadadei. The sharp ones of Pumbedita said: "There is no uncircumcised person in the land."

hebrew_text: שַׁלְחַהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: סְתוֹם סְפֵיקָהּ, וְאַבֵּד וַדָּאַהּ, וְהַכְרֵז עַל פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁטְּעוּנִים גְּנִיזָה. וְכׇל הָאוֹמֵר אֵין עׇרְלָה בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – לֹא יְהֵא לוֹ נִין וָנֶכֶד, ״מַשְׁלִיךְ חֶבֶל בְּגוֹרָל בִּקְהַל ה׳״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda sent to Rabbi Yoḥanan Rabbi Yoḥanan sent him Conceal, uncertain and destroy, certain; and with regard to produce of declare that it requires interment, And whoever says no orla outside of Eretz will have neither a child nor a grandchild “who shall cast the line by lot in the congregation of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah sent a message before Rabbi Yochanan. He sent to him: Seal her doubt, and lose her certainty, and proclaim concerning their fruits that are laden for genizah. And anyone who says there is no uncircumcised produce in the Land - he shall not have offspring and descendants, "He casts a lot into the lap, but the decision is wholly from the Lord" (Proverbs 16:33).

hebrew_text: וְאִינְהוּ כְּמַאן סַבְרוּהָ? כִּי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹרְמַסְקִית, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל: אֵין עׇרְלָה בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: And in accordance with whose do hold in accordance with that which is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Durmaska, who said in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, who said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer the Great: orla not outside of Eretz
llm_translation: They are like whom do they hold? For this that it was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Dormaskit, who said in the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, who said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer the Great: "There is no uncircumcision in the Land."

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַף הֶחָדָשׁ! תְּנִי: ״חָדָשׁ״.
human_translation: But not But didn’t we learn Rabbi Eliezer says: Even new crop, teach new crop,
llm_translation: And no? But we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says: Also the new! Teach: "new."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עׇרְלָה בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: וְהָתַנְיָא: סְפֵק עׇרְלָה בָּאָרֶץ – אָסוּר, בְּסוּרְיָא – מוּתָּר, בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – יוֹרֵד וְלוֹקֵט! ״אֶשְׁתּוֹמַם כְּשָׁעָה חֲדָה״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימָא כָּךְ נֶאֶמְרָה: סְפֵיקָהּ מוּתָּר, וַדָּאָהּ אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Orla outside of Eretz a halakha to Moses from Sinai. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: But isn’t it taught orla uncertain, in Eretz forbidden, in Syria permitted, outside of Eretz one goes down and gathers “was dismayed for a while” said to him: Say it is stated like this, uncertain permitted, and certain forbidden.
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Uncircumcised produce outside the land is subject to the law of Moses from Sinai. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Assi: But isn't it taught: Uncertain uncircumcised produce in the land is forbidden, in Suria it is permitted, outside the land one may go down and gather! "It was astonished for a brief moment" he said to him: Say that it was stated thus: Its uncertainty is permitted, but its certainty is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לוֹקִין עַל הַכִּלְאַיִם דְּבַר תּוֹרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: הַכִּלְאַיִם מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים! לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם, כָּאן בְּהַרְכָּבַת הָאִילָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: are flogged for diverse kinds by Torah law. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: But didn’t we learn diverse kinds by rabbinic law not difficult. here to diverse kinds in a vineyard, there, to grafting of a tree
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One is lashed for forbidden mixtures of Torah law. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: But didn't we learn: Mixtures are from the words of the Scribes! It is not difficult - here it is referring to mixtures of a vineyard, and here it is referring to grafting a tree.

hebrew_text: כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: ״אֶת חֻקֹּתַי תִּשְׁמֹרוּ״ – חוּקִּים שֶׁחָקַקְתִּי לְךָ כְּבָר, ״בְּהֶמְתְּךָ לֹא תַרְבִּיעַ כִּלְאַיִם שָׂדְךָ לֹא תִזְרַע״
human_translation: in accordance with of Shmuel. As Shmuel says: “You shall keep My statutes” statutes that I have already instituted for you “You shall not let your cattle gender with a diverse kind; you shall not sow your field
llm_translation: As Samuel said: "You shall observe My statutes" - statutes that I have decreed for you already, "You shall not crossbreed your livestock, your field you shall not sow with mixed seeds."

hebrew_text: – מָה בְּהֶמְתְּךָ בְּהַרְבָּעָה, אַף שָׂדְךָ בְּהַרְכָּבָה. וּמָה בְּהֶמְתְּךָ נוֹהֵג בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, אַף שָׂדְךָ נוֹהֵג בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: just as your animal to mating so too, your field to grafting just as your animal applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz so too, your field applies both in Eretz and outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: - "What in your animal in the stable, so too your field in the wagon. And what in your animal walks both in the land and outside the land, so too your field walks both in the land and outside the land."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָכְתִיב: ״שָׂדְךָ״! הָהוּא לְמַעוֹטֵי זְרָעִים שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “Your field,” That to exclude seeds, outside of Eretz
llm_translation: And rather it is written: "Your field"! That excludes the seeds that are outside the land.

hebrew_text: רַב חָנָן וְרַב עָנָן הֲווֹ שָׁקְלִי וְאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא. חַזְיוּהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא זָרַע זְרָעִים בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נֵיתֵי מָר נְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא חָוְורִיתוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan and Rav Anan were going on a road they saw a certain man planting seeds together. said to Let the Master come ostracize him, said to him: are not understood by you.
llm_translation: Rav Hanan and Rav Anan were walking on the road. They saw a certain man who was scattering seeds haphazardly. He said to him: "Master, let your soul be at ease." He replied: "They are not afraid."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, חַזְיוּהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא זָרַע חִטֵּי וּשְׂעָרֵי בֵּי גוּפְנֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נֵיתֵי מָר נְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא צָהֲרִיתוּ, לָא קַיְימָא לַן כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיִּזְרַע חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְחַרְצָן בְּמַפּוֹלֶת יָד?!
human_translation: And furthermore, they saw a certain man who was planting wheat and barley between grapevines. said to Let the Master come ostracize him. He said to him: not clear to you. Don’t we hold in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya, who says: until he sows wheat, and barley, and seed with a single hand motion,
llm_translation: And come, see that man who sows wheat and barley in his body hair. He said to him: "Give me your soul." He said to him: "They did not shine, they did not establish for us like Rabbi Yoshiyah who said: Until one sows wheat, barley, and lentils in the palm of his hand?!"

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף מְעָרֵב בִּיזְרָנֵי וְזָרַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: הַכִּלְאַיִם מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם, כָּאן בְּכִלְאֵי זְרָעִים. כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם דְּבָאָרֶץ אֲסוּרִים בַּהֲנָאָה – בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ נָמֵי גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. כִּלְאֵי זְרָעִים דְּבָאָרֶץ לָא אֲסִירִי בַּהֲנָאָה – בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ נָמֵי לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef mixing seeds and planting Abaye said to him: But didn’t we learn diverse kinds by rabbinic law? said to him: not difficult, here, to diverse kinds in a vineyard, there, diverse kinds of seeds. diverse kinds in a vineyard, which in Eretz is prohibited with regard to benefit, the Sages issued a decree outside of Eretz diverse kinds of seeds, which in Eretz is not prohibited with regard to benefit, the Sages did not issue a decree them outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Yosef mixed Kil'ayim of vineyards and seeds. Abaye said to him: But didn't we learn: Kil'ayim is from the words of the Sages! He said to him: It is not difficult - here regarding Kil'ayim of vineyards, here regarding Kil'ayim of seeds. Kil'ayim of vineyards, which are in the land, are forbidden for benefit - the Sages decreed them in the courtyard. Kil'ayim of seeds, which are in the land, are not forbidden for benefit - the Sages did not decree them in the courtyard.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָאו מִלְּתָא הִיא דְּאָמְרִי, דְּרַב זָרַע גִּינְּתָא דְּבֵי רַב מְשָׁארֵי מְשָׁארֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא – לָאו מִשּׁוּם עֵירוּב עֵירוּבֵי כִלְאַיִם? אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן
human_translation: Rav Yosef then said: The matter that I said, is not Rav planted the garden the study hall in rows [ mesharei ] What is the reason not because mixtures of diverse kinds? Abaye said to him: Granted, if he taught us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Rav Yosef: Lav milta hi de'amar, de'Rav Zara Ginata de'Bei Rav mesharei mesharei, mai ta'ama - lav mishum eiruv eiruvei kilayim? Amar lei Abaye: Bishlama i ashmeinan. English translation: Hadr said Rav Yosef: It is not a matter that they said, that Rav Zara, the gardener of the house of Rav, may sow, may sow. What is the reason - is it not because of the mixing of diverse kinds? Abaye said to him: We indeed hear.

hebrew_text: אַרְבַּע עַל אַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת הָעֲרוּגָה וְאַחַת בָּאֶמְצַע – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם נוֹי. וְאִי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם טִרְחָא דְּשַׁמָּעָא הִיא.
human_translation: four along the four sides of the garden bed and one in the middle, well. But here, due to beautification, Alternatively, is due to the trouble the attendant.
llm_translation: Four on four sides the sukkah and one in the middle - beautiful. Rather here, because of beauty. And if you wish, because it is a burden to hear.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת – מְטִיבִין לוֹ, וּמַאֲרִיכִין לוֹ יָמָיו, וְנוֹחֵל אֶת הָאָרֶץ. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת – אֵין מְטִיבִין לוֹ, וְאֵין מַאֲרִיכִין לוֹ יָמָיו, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹחֵל אֶת הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Anyone who performs one mitzva has goodness bestowed upon him, his life is lengthened, and he inherits the land, And anyone who does not perform one mitzva does not have goodness bestowed upon him, his life is not lengthened, and he does not inherit the land
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anyone who performs one mitzvah - they benefit him, and lengthen his days, and he inherits the land. And anyone who does not perform one mitzvah - they do not benefit him, and do not lengthen his days, and he does not inherit the land.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהִי: אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָדָם אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהַקֶּרֶן קַיֶּימֶת לוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, אֵלּוּ הֵן: כִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְהַכְנָסַת אוֹרְחִים, וַהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּם.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction These matters that a person enjoys their profits in this world, and the principal remains for him for the World-to-Come, they are: Honoring one’s father and mother, acts of loving kindness, hospitality guests, and bringing peace between one person and another; and Torah study is equal to all of them.
llm_translation: Gemara: And it was raised as a dilemma: These are the things that a person eats their fruits in this world and the principle remains for him in the world to come, these are they: honoring father and mother, acts of loving-kindness, hospitality to guests, bringing peace between a person and their fellow, and the study of Torah which is equivalent to them all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת יְתֵירָה עַל זְכִיּוֹתָיו מְטִיבִים לוֹ, וְדוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ. מִכְּלָל דְּהָנָךְ אֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲדָא נָמֵי? אָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: לוֹמַר שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה שְׁקוּלָה – מַכְרַעַת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is what is saying: Anyone who performs one mitzva in addition to his merits, has goodness bestowed upon him and is compared to one who fulfills the entire Torah. by inference that those even for one Rav Shemaya said: to say that if were equal tilts
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Thus was he saying: Anyone who performs one mitzvah, they benefit him extra merits, and he is likened to one who fulfills the entire Torah. From the inference of that, even with one alone? Rav Shemaya said: To say that if it was weighed - it would tip the scales.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת יְתֵירָה עַל זְכִיּוֹתָיו מְטִיבִין לוֹ? וּרְמִינְהוּ: כֹּל שֶׁזְּכִיּוֹתָיו מְרוּבִּין מֵעֲוֹנוֹתָיו – מְרִיעִין לוֹ, וְדוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁשָּׂרַף כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ וְלֹא שִׁיֵּיר מִמֶּנָּה אֲפִילּוּ אוֹת אַחַת. וְכֹל שֶׁעֲוֹנוֹתָיו מְרוּבִּין מִזְּכִיּוֹתָיו – מְטִיבִין לוֹ, וְדוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁקִּיֵּים כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ וְלֹא חִיסֵּר אוֹת אַחַת מִמֶּנָּה!
human_translation: And anyone who performs one mitzva in addition to his merits have goodness bestowed upon him raises a contradiction Anyone whose merits are greater than his sins is punished with suffering And he appears like one who burned the entire Torah without leaving even one letter remaining of it. anyone whose sins are greater than his merits has goodness bestowed upon him and he appears like one who has fulfilled the entire Torah without lacking even one letter of it.
llm_translation: And all who do one mitzvah, extra upon his merits they benefit him? And ask: All that his merits are more than his sins - they benefit him, and is like one who burned the entire Torah and did not leave from it even one letter. And all that his sins are more than his merits - they benefit him, and is like one who fulfilled the entire Torah and did not omit even one letter from it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַתְנִיתִין דְּעָבְדִין לֵיהּ יוֹם טָב וָיוֹם בִּישׁ. רָבָא אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב הִיא, דְּאָמַר: שְׂכַר מִצְוָה בְּהַאי עָלְמָא לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said: the mishna that he has one good day and one bad day. Rava said whose is this It is Rabbi Ya’akov, who says: There is no reward a mitzva in this world,
llm_translation: Abaye said: The Mishnah that they would do for him a good day and a bad day. Rava said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yaakov, as he said: "The reward of a mitzvah in this world, you do not have."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֵין לָךְ כׇּל מִצְוָה וּמִצְוָה שֶׁכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁמַּתַּן שְׂכָרָהּ בְּצִדָּהּ שֶׁאֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים תְּלוּיָה בָּהּ. בְּכִיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם כְּתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יַאֲרִיכֻן יָמֶיךָ וּלְמַעַן יִיטַב לָךְ״, בְּשִׁילּוּחַ הַקֵּן כְּתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יִיטַב לָךְ וְהַאֲרַכְתָּ יָמִים״.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Ya’akov says: There is not a single mitzva written in the Torah whose reward alongside it, which is not dependent on the resurrection of the dead, With regard to honoring one’s father and mother it is written: “That your days may be long, and that it may go well with you” With regard to dispatch the nest it is written: “That it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yaakov says: You have no commandment in the Torah whose reward is given to it alongside it, for the resurrection of the dead is not dependent on it. Concerning honoring father and mother it is written: "that your days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with you." Concerning sending away the mother bird it is written: "that it may go well with you and you may prolong your days."

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ אָבִיו: עֲלֵה לַבִּירָה וְהָבֵא לִי גּוֹזָלוֹת, וְעָלָה לַבִּירָה וְשִׁלַּח אֶת הָאֵם וְנָטַל אֶת הַבָּנִים וּבַחֲזִירָתוֹ נָפַל וָמֵת – הֵיכָן טוֹבַת יָמָיו שֶׁל זֶה, וְהֵיכָן אֲרִיכוּת יָמָיו שֶׁל זֶה? אֶלָּא: ״לְמַעַן יִיטַב לָךְ״ – לְעוֹלָם שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ טוֹב, ״וּלְמַעַן יַאֲרִיכֻן יָמֶיךָ״ – לְעוֹלָם שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ אָרוֹךְ.
human_translation: there was whose father said to him: Climb to the building and fetch me chicks. And he climbed to the building and dispatched the mother and took the young, but upon his return he fell and died. Where is the goodness of the days of this one, and where is the length of days of this one? Rather, “that it may be well with you” in the world where all is well, and “that your days may be long” to the world that is entirely long.
llm_translation: Behold, if his father said to him: "Go up to the attic and bring me the young birds," and he went up to the attic, sent away the mother, took the young birds, and on his way down he fell and died - where is the goodness of his days, and where is the length of his days? Rather, "that it may be well with thee" - his entire portion is good, "and that thou mayest prolong thy days" - his entire portion is long.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה? רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב מַעֲשֶׂה חֲזָא. וְדִלְמָא מְהַרְהֵר בַּעֲבֵירָה הֲוָה? מַחְשָׁבָה רָעָה אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְצָרְפָהּ לְמַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: But perhaps this never occurred? Rabbi Ya’akov saw an incident But perhaps was contemplating sin the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not link a bad thought to an action,
llm_translation: Perhaps it was not so? Rabbi Yaakov saw a deed. And perhaps he was contemplating a transgression? Evil thought, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not join it to action.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מְהַרְהֵר בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הֲוָה, וּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן תְּפֹשׂ אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּלִבָּם״?! אִיהוּ נָמֵי הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שְׂכַר מִצְוָה בְּהַאי עָלְמָא, אַמַּאי לָא אַגִּין מִצְוֹת עֲלֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֵיתֵי לִידֵי הִרְהוּר?
human_translation: But perhaps he was contemplating idol worship and it is written “So I may take the house of Israel in their own heart” was saying this as well: If it enters your mind reward for a mitzva in this world, why didn’t mitzvot protect him so that he should not come to contemplate
llm_translation: And perhaps he was contemplating foreign worship, and it is written: "In order to catch the house of Israel in their hearts"?! He also said thus: If it enters your mind that the reward for a commandment in this world, why do we not perform commandments upon it, so that it does not lead to contemplation?

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֵין נִזּוֹקִין! הָתָם בַּהֲלִיכָתָן שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm? There, on their way is different,
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Elazar said: Messengers of a commandment are not harmed! There, in their journey, it is different.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֵינָן נִזּוֹקִין לֹא בַּהֲלִיכָתָן וְלֹא בַּחֲזִירָתָן! סוּלָּם רָעוּעַ הֲוָה, דִּקְבִיעַ הֶיזֵּיקָא, וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּקְבִיעַ הֶיזֵּיקָא לָא סָמְכִינַן אַנִּיסָּא. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵיךְ אֵלֵךְ וְשָׁמַע שָׁאוּל וַהֲרָגָנִי״.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm, neither on their way nor when they are returning was a rickety ladder, the danger was established; and anywhere that the danger is established one may not rely on a miracle, as it is written “And Samuel said: How will I go, and Saul will hear and kill me;
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Elazar said: Messengers of a commandment are not harmed neither in their going nor in their returning! A shaky ladder was, for a fixed one is the damage, and anywhere that a fixed one is the damage, we do not rely on a miracle. As it is written: "And Samuel said, 'How can I go? If Saul hears, he will kill me.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִילְמָלֵי דַּרְשֵׁיהּ אַחֵר לְהַאי קְרָא כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה – לָא חֲטָא. וְאַחֵר מַאי הוּא? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא חֲזָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Had Aḥer, interpreted this verse: homiletically, as Rabbi Ya’akov, son of his daughter, not have sinned. And what Aḥer There are who say he saw a case like this,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: If others would interpret this verse like Rabbi Yaakov the son of his daughter - he did not sin. And what is the meaning of "he did not sin"? There are those who say: For this quality he saw.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לִישָּׁנָא דְּחוּצְפִּית הַמְתוּרְגְּמָן חֲזָא דַּהֲוָה גָּרַיר לֵיהּ דָּבָר אַחֵר. אֲמַר: פֶּה שֶׁהֵפִיק מַרְגָּלִיּוֹת יְלַחֵךְ עָפָר?! נְפַק חֲטָא.
human_translation: And there are who say he saw the tongue of Ḥutzpit the disseminator dragged by something else, He said: Shall a mouth that produced pearls lap dirt? he went out sinned.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: In the case of the impudent interpreter, see that he was dragging in another matter. He said: "A mouth that spouts out maggots should be filled with dust?!" He went out sinning.

hebrew_text: רָמֵי רַב טוֹבִי בַּר רַב קִיסְנָא לְרָבָא: תְּנַן כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת מְטִיבִין לוֹ: עָשָׂה – אִין, לֹא עָשָׂה – לָא. וּרְמִינְהִי: יָשַׁב וְלֹא עָבַר עֲבֵירָה – נוֹתְנִים לוֹ שָׂכָר כְּעוֹשֶׂה מִצְוָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא דְּבַר עֲבֵירָה לְיָדוֹ וְנִיצּוֹל הֵימֶנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Tuvi bar Rav Kisna raises a contradiction to Rava We learned anyone who performs one mitzva has goodness bestowed upon him. performed mitzva, yes, did not perform no, raises a contradiction one sits and does not transgress, he receives a reward as one who performs a mitzva, said to him: There, where a sinful act presents itself and he is saved from it.
llm_translation: Ramei son of Rav Tovi said to Rava: We learned: Anyone who performs one mitzvah, they benefit him; he did - yes, he did not - no. And we raised a dilemma: If one sat and did not commit a transgression - do we give him reward as one who performs a mitzvah? He said to him: There, for example, if a matter of transgression came into his hand and he refrained from it.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפֵּי תְּבַעְתֵּיהּ הָהִיא מַטְרוֹנִיתָא. אֲמַר מִלְּתָא וּמַלִּי נַפְשֵׁיהּ שִׁיחְנָא וְכִיבָא, עֲבַדָה הִיא מִילְּתָא וְאִיתַּסִּי. עֲרַק, טְשָׁא בְּהָהוּא בֵּי בָנֵי דְּכִי הֲווֹ עָיְילִין בִּתְרֵין אֲפִילּוּ בִּימָמָא הֲווֹ מִיתַּזְּקִי. לִמְחַר אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: מַאן נַטְרָךְ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׁנֵי
human_translation: like Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi, who was enticed by a certain noblewoman [ matronita ] He said a formula and was covered with boils and scabs She performed an act and he was healed. He fled and hid in a bathhouse that when two people entered even during the day they would be harmed. The next day the Sages said to him: Who protected you said to them: two
llm_translation: The case of Rabbi Chanina bar Pappai, his wife demanded a certain matronita. He said a word and his soul departed, he became ill and died. The matter was done and it was found. He went, he sat in the house of the sons of, for they were engaged in two, even in the daytime they were in danger. The next day the Rabbis said to him: Who watched over you? He said to them: Two.

hebrew_text: נוֹשְׂאֵי קֵיסָר שְׁמָרוּנִי כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שֶׁמָּא דְּבַר עֶרְוָה בָּא לְיָדְךָ וְנִיצַּלְתָּ הֵימֶנּוּ, דִּתְנֵינָא: כׇּל הַבָּא דְּבַר עֶרְוָה לְיָדוֹ וְנִיצַּל הֵימֶנּוּ – עוֹשִׂין לוֹ נֵס. ״גִּבֹּרֵי כֹחַ עֹשֵׂי דְבָרוֹ לִשְׁמֹעַ בְּקוֹל דְּבָרוֹ״ – כְּגוֹן רַבִּי צָדוֹק וַחֲבֵירָיו.
human_translation: soldiers [ nosei keisar ] guarded me all night. They said to him: Perhaps a matter of forbidden intercourse presented itself to you and you were saved from it, As we learned: anyone whom a matter of forbidden intercourse presented itself to him and he was saved from it, a miracle is performed for him. “Mighty in strength who fulfill His word, hearkening to the voice of His word” such as Rabbi Tzadok and his colleagues.
llm_translation: The bearers of Caesar kept watch over me all night. They said to him: Perhaps a matter of impropriety comes into your hand and you will be saved from it, as we have learned: If a matter of impropriety comes into one's hand and he is saved from it - a miracle is performed for him. "Mighty heroes who do His bidding, obedient to the sound of His word" - such as Rabbi Zadok and his colleagues.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי צָדוֹק תְּבַעְתֵּיהּ הָהִיא מַטְרוֹנִיתָא, אֲמַר לַהּ: חֲלַשׁ לִי לִיבַּאי וְלָא מָצֵינָא, אִיכָּא מִידֵּי לְמֵיכַל? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא דָּבָר טָמֵא. אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דְּעָבֵיד הָא – אָכֵול הָא. שְׁגַרַת תַּנּוּרָא, קָא מַנְּחָא לֵיהּ. סָלֵיק וְיָתֵיב בְּגַוֵּיהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לַהּ: דְּעָבֵיד הָא – נָפֵיל בְּהָא. אַמְרַהּ לֵיהּ: אִי יָדְעִי כּוּלֵּי הַאי – לָא צַעַרְתָּיךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Tzadok was enticed by a certain noblewoman He said to her: My heart is weak and I am incapable there something to eat She said to him: There is something non-kosher. He said to her: What difference is there? who performs such eats such She lit the oven placed in it He climbed and sat in She said to him: What this? He said to her: performs this falls into this, She said to him: If I had known so I would not have you anguish.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tzadok demanded from her that matronitah, he said to her: "My heart is weak for my husband and I cannot find, is there something from the hands to eat?" She said to him: "There is a matter of impurity." He said to her: "What comes out of it? This one does – eat this one." He sent her a shovel of the oven. He went out and sat in his body. She said to him: "What is this?" He said to her: "This one does – fall into this one." She said to him: "If you knew all this – I would not have distressed you."

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא הֲוָה קָמְזַבֵּין דִּיקּוּלֵי, תְּבַעְתֵּיהּ הָהִיא מַטְרוֹנִיתָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: אֵיזִיל אֱיקַשֵּׁיט נַפְשַׁאי, סָלֵיק וְקָנָפֵיל מֵאִיגָּרָא לְאַרְעָא. אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ קַבְּלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטְרַחְתַּן אַרְבַּע מְאָה פַּרְסֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי גְּרַם לִי, לָאו עַנְיוּתָא? יְהַב לֵיהּ שִׁיפָא דְּדִינָרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana would sell palm leaves He was enticed by a certain noblewoman He said to her: go and adorn myself He ascended and fell from the roof toward the ground. Elijah came caught him. said to You have troubled me four hundred parasangs [ parsei ] said to him: What caused me not poverty, gave him a basket [ shifa ] of dinars,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana was sitting and weaving mats, a certain matron asked him for a needle. He said to her: "I will go and straighten my hair, and then I will descend from the roof to the ground." Elijah came and received it. He said to him: "You have exerted yourself for four hundred parasangs!" He said to him: "Who caused me, was it not poverty?" He gave him a ship full of dinars.

hebrew_text: רָמֵי לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: תְּנַן: אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָדָם עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן וְאוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהַקֶּרֶן קַיֶּימֶת לוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, אֵלּוּ הֵן: כִּיבּוּד אָב וְאֵם, וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וַהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּם.
human_translation: Rava raises a contradiction to Rav Naḥman We learned These matters that a person engages in and enjoys their profits in this world, and the principal remains for him for the World-to-Come, they are: Honoring one’s father and mother, acts of loving kindness, and bringing peace between one person and another; and Torah study is equal to all of them.
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: We learned in a Mishnah: These are the things that a person does and enjoys their fruits in this world, while the principal remains for him in the World to Come. These are they: honoring father and mother, acts of loving-kindness, bringing peace between a person and his fellow, and the study of Torah which is equivalent to them all.

hebrew_text: בְּכִיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם כְּתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יַאֲרִיכֻן יָמֶיךָ וּלְמַעַן יִיטַב לָךְ״, בִּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים כְּתִיב: ״רֹדֵף צְדָקָה וָחָסֶד יִמְצָא חַיִּים צְדָקָה וְכָבוֹד״,
human_translation: With regard to honoring one’s father and mother, it is written: “That your days may be long, and that it may go well with you” With regard to acts of loving kindness it is written: “He who pursues righteousness and kindness shall find life, prosperity, and honor”
llm_translation: In honor of father and mother it is written: "that your days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with you." Concerning the performance of acts of loving-kindness it is written: "He who pursues righteousness and kindness will find life, righteousness, and honor."

hebrew_text: וּבַהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם כְּתִיב: ״בַּקֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם וְרׇדְפֵהוּ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָתְיָא ״רְדִיפָה״ ״רְדִיפָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בַּקֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם וְרׇדְפֵהוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״רֹדֵף צְדָקָה וָחֶסֶד״. בְּתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה כְּתִיב: ״כִּי הוּא חַיֶּיךָ וְאֹרֶךְ יָמֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And with regard to bringing peace it is written: “Seek peace and pursue it” And Rabbi Abbahu says: is derived pursuing pursuing It is written here: “Seek peace and pursue it,” and it is written there, “Pursues righteousness and kindness.” With regard to Torah study it is written: “For that is your life and the length of your days”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding the pursuit of peace, it is written: "Seek peace and pursue it." And Rabbi Abbahu said: It is written here "pursue, pursue." It is written here: "Seek peace and pursue it," and it is written there: "Pursue righteousness and kindness." In the Torah it is written: "For it is your life and the length of your days."

hebrew_text: בְּשִׁילּוּחַ הַקֵּן נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יִיטַב לָךְ וְהַאֲרַכְתָּ יָמִים״, לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי הָא! תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. תָּנֵי תַּנָּא: ״אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר?!
human_translation: With regard to dispatch the nest it is also written: “That it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days” let him also teach this taught and omitted The tanna taught: These matters, and you say he taught and omitted
llm_translation: In the sending away of the mother bird, it is written: "so that it will be good for you and you will prolong days," let it teach: why is this so? A Tanna taught and concluded. Another Tanna taught: "These are the things," and you say a Tanna taught and concluded?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רַב אִידִי אַסְבְּרַאּ לִי: ״אִמְרוּ צַדִּיק כִּי טוֹב כִּי פְרִי מַעַלְלֵיהֶם יֹאכֵלוּ״ – וְכִי יֵשׁ צַדִּיק טוֹב וְיֵשׁ צַדִּיק שֶׁאֵינוֹ טוֹב? אֶלָּא: טוֹב לַשָּׁמַיִם וְלַבְּרִיּוֹת – זֶהוּ צַדִּיק טוֹב, טוֹב לַשָּׁמַיִם וְרַע לַבְּרִיּוֹת – זֶהוּ צַדִּיק שֶׁאֵינוֹ טוֹב.
human_translation: Rava said: Rav Idi explained to me. “Say you of the righteous who is good, that they shall eat the fruit of their actions” And is there a righteous person who is good and is there a righteous person who is not good? Rather, good toward Heaven and toward people is a good righteous person; good toward Heaven but bad toward people is a righteous person who is not good.
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Idi explained to me: "Say to the righteous that it is good, for they shall eat the fruit of their deeds" (Isaiah 3:10) - Is there a righteous person who is good and a righteous person who is not good? Rather, good for the heavens and for the creatures - this is a righteous person who is good, good for the heavens and bad for the creatures - this is a righteous person who is not good.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אוֹי לְרָשָׁע רָע כִּי גְמוּל יָדָיו יֵעָשֶׂה לוֹ״. וְכִי יֵשׁ רָשָׁע רַע וְיֵשׁ שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַע? אֶלָּא: רַע לַשָּׁמַיִם וְרַע לַבְּרִיּוֹת – הוּא רָשָׁע רַע, רַע לַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵינוֹ רַע לַבְּרִיּוֹת – זֶהוּ רָשָׁע שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַע.
human_translation: On a similar note, “Woe to the evil wicked one, for the work of his hands shall be done to him” And is there a wicked man evil and is there who is not evil? Rather, evil toward Heaven and evil toward people is an evil wicked person; evil toward Heaven and not evil toward people is a wicked person who is not evil.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As an example in the matter, you say: 'Woe to the wicked, evil is upon him; for the recompense of his hands shall be done to him.' And is there a wicked person who is evil, and one who is not evil? Rather, one who is evil to Heaven and evil to creatures – he is a wicked person who is evil. One who is evil to Heaven but not evil to creatures – this is a wicked person who is not evil."

hebrew_text: הַזְּכוּת יֵשׁ לָהּ קֶרֶן וְיֵשׁ לָהּ פֵּירוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִמְרוּ צַדִּיק כִּי טוֹב וְגוֹ׳״ – עֲבֵירָה יֵשׁ לָהּ קֶרֶן וְאֵין לָהּ פֵּירוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹי לָרָשָׁע רָע וְגוֹ׳״
human_translation: merit has a principal and it has profits, as it is stated: “Say you of the righteous who is good, A sin has a principal but it has no profits, as it is stated: “Woe to the evil wicked one,
llm_translation: The merit she has a horn and she has fruits, as it is stated: "Say the righteous is good, etc." - sin she has a horn and she has no fruits, as it is stated: "Woe to the wicked, evil, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים: ״וְיֹאכְלוּ מִפְּרִי דַרְכָּם וּמִמֹּעֲצֹתֵיהֶם יִשְׂבָּעוּ״? עֲבֵירָה שֶׁעוֹשָׂה פֵּירוֹת – יֵשׁ לָהּ פֵּירוֹת. וְשֶׁאֵין עוֹשָׂה פֵּירוֹת – אֵין לָהּ פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: But how do I realize “Therefore they shall eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices” a sin that produces profits, have profits that does not produce profits does not have profits
llm_translation: And rather what am I establishing: "And they shall eat from the fruit of their way, and from their own counsels they shall be satisfied"? A transgression that produces fruits - it has fruits. And one that does not produce fruits - it has no fruits.

hebrew_text: מַחְשָׁבָה טוֹבָה מְצָרְפָהּ לְמַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָז נִדְבְּרוּ יִרְאֵי ה׳ אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ וַיַּקְשֵׁב ה׳ וַיִּשְׁמָע וַיִּכָּתֵב סֵפֶר זִכָּרוֹן לְפָנָיו לְיִרְאֵי ה׳ וּלְחֹשְׁבֵי שְׁמוֹ״. מַאי: ״ולְחֹשְׁבֵי שְׁמוֹ״? אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֲפִילּוּ חָשַׁב אָדָם לַעֲשׂוֹת מִצְוָה וְנֶאֱנַס וְלֹא עֲשָׂאָהּ – מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ.
human_translation: links a good thought to an action, as it is stated: “Then they that feared the Lord spoke one with the other, and the Lord listened, and heard, and a book of remembrance was written before Him, for them that fear the Lord, and that think upon His name” What “and that think upon His name”? Rav Asi said: Even a person intended to perform a mitzva but due to beyond control he did not perform it, the verse ascribes him as if he performed
llm_translation: Good thought combines it to action, as it is stated: "Then those who feared the Lord spoke with one another, and the Lord paid attention and heard, and a book of remembrance was written before Him for those who feared the Lord and esteemed His name." What is meant by "esteemed His name"? Rav Assi said: Even if a person intended to perform a commandment and was prevented and did not do it, the Scripture credits him as if he had done it.

hebrew_text: מַחְשָׁבָה רָעָה אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְצָרְפָהּ לְמַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָוֶן אִם רָאִיתִי בְלִבִּי לֹא יִשְׁמַע ה׳״. וְאֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּם: ״הִנְנִי מֵבִיא אֶל הָעָם הַזֶּה רָעָה פְּרִי מַחְשְׁבוֹתָם״? מַחְשָׁבָה שֶׁעוֹשָׂה פְּרִי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְצָרְפָהּ לְמַעֲשֶׂה, מַחְשָׁבָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ פְּרִי – אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְצָרְפָהּ לְמַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not link an evil thought to an action, as it is stated: “If I had regarded iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not hear” But how do I realize “Behold I will bring upon these people evil, even the fruit of their thoughts” thought that produces fruit, the Holy One, Blessed be He, links it to action a thought that does not produce fruit, the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not link it to action.
llm_translation: Evil thought, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not join it to action, as it is stated: "If I have seen iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear." But rather, what do I fulfill: "Behold, I am bringing evil upon this people, the fruit of their thoughts"? A thought that produces fruit, the Holy One, blessed be He, joins it to action; a thought that does not produce fruit, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not join it to action.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן תְּפֹשׂ אֶת [בֵּית] יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּלִבָּם״? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הָהוּא בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב, דְּאָמַר מָר: חֲמוּרָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, שֶׁכׇּל הַכּוֹפֵר בָּהּ כְּמוֹדֶה בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: But that which is written: “So I may take the house of Israel in their own heart” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: That is written with regard to idol worship, as the Master says: Idol worship is severe, as anyone who denies it is like one who admits the entire Torah.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, this that is written: "In order to grasp the house of Israel in their hearts"? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: That is in reference to idol worship, as the Master said: Severe is idol worship, for anyone who denies it is as if he denies the entire Torah.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: כִּדְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ – הוּתְּרָה לוֹ. הוּתְּרָה לוֹ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ כְּהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: Ulla said: in accordance with of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: When a person transgresses and repeats it is permitted to him. Can it enter your mind that is permitted to him Rather, it becomes as if permitted to him,
llm_translation: Ulla said: Like Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: Once a person commits a transgression and repeats it, it becomes permitted for him. It becomes permitted for him? Is this your true opinion? Rather, it becomes for him as if it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר וְאַל יְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתֶּם בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אִישׁ גִּלּוּלָיו לְכוּ עֲבֹדוּ [וְאַחַר] אִם אֵינְכֶם שֹׁמְעִים אֵלָי, וְאֶת שֵׁם קׇדְשִׁי לֹא תְחַלְּלוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina: It is preferable for a person to transgress in secret and not to desecrate the name of Heaven in public [ befarhesya ], as it is stated: “As for you, house of Israel, so says the Lord Go you, serve everyone his idols, even because you will not hearken to Me, but My sacred name you shall not profane”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: It is better for a person to commit a sin in secret and not desecrate the name of Heaven in public, as it is stated: "But as for you, O house of Israel, thus said the Lord God: Go serve each of you his idols, if you will not listen to Me; but My holy name you shall no longer profane."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי הַזָּקֵן: אִם רוֹאֶה אָדָם שֶׁיִּצְרוֹ מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו – יֵלֵךְ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ, וְיִלְבַּשׁ שְׁחוֹרִים, וְיִתְכַּסֶּה שְׁחוֹרִים, וְיַעֲשֶׂה כְּמוֹ שֶׁלִּבּוֹ חָפֵץ, וְאַל יְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ilai the Elder says: If a person sees that his inclination is overcoming him, he should go to a place where he is not known, and wear black and he should cover himself in black and he should do as his heart desires, but he should not desecrate the name of Heaven in public.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elai the Elder said: If a person sees that his inclination is overpowering him, he should go to a place where he is not recognized, and wear black garments, and cover himself with black, and do as his heart desires, and not desecrate the name of Heaven openly.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא חָס עַל כְּבוֹד קוֹנוֹ – רָאוּי לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם. מָה הִיא? רַבָּה אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בַּקֶּשֶׁת. רַב יוֹסֵף אוֹמֵר: זֶה הָעוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר!
human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it taught anyone who does not care about his Creator’s honor, it is fitting for him not to have come into the world. What is this? Rabba says: This is one who gazes at a rainbow, Rav Yosef says: This is one who transgresses in secret,
llm_translation: I am? And it was taught in a Baraita: Anyone who does not have mercy on the honor of his Creator - it is fitting for him not to have come into the world. What is it? Rabba says: This refers to one who gazes at the rainbow. Rav Yosef says: This refers to one who commits a sin in secret!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא – דְּמָצֵי כָּיֵיף לְיִצְרֵיהּ, וְהָא – דְּלָא מָצֵי כָּיֵיף לְיִצְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: not difficult, this to one who can overcome his inclination And that to one who cannot overcome his inclination.
llm_translation: Not difficult, this - that one who finds pleasure for his inclination, and this - that one who does not find pleasure for his inclination.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין מַקִּיפִין בְּחִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם, אֶחָד שׁוֹגֵג וְאֶחָד מֵזִיד. מַאי ״אֵין מַקִּיפִין״? אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂים כְּחֶנְווֹנִי. מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא אָמַר: לוֹמַר שֶׁאִם הָיְתָה שְׁקוּלָה – מַכְרַעַת.
human_translation: We learned there Credit is not given with regard to the desecration of name, whether unintentionally or intentionally. What Credit is not given [ makkifin ]? Mar Zutra says: that does not act like a storekeeper Mar, son of Rabbana, says: to say that if were equal, tilts
llm_translation: We learned there: One does not encompass in desecration of the Name, whether unintentionally or intentionally. What is "does not encompass"? Mar Zutra said: That they do not act like Chanvoni. Mar, son of Ravina, said: To say that if she was weighed - she would tip the scales.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְעוֹלָם
human_translation: The Sages taught: Always
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Always

hebrew_text: יִרְאֶה אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כְּאִילּוּ חֶצְיוֹ חַיָּיב וְחֶצְיוֹ זַכַּאי. עָשָׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת – אַשְׁרָיו, שֶׁהִכְרִיעַ עַצְמוֹ לְכַף זְכוּת, עָבַר עֲבֵירָה אַחַת – אוֹי לוֹ, שֶׁהִכְרִיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ לְכַף חוֹבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְחוֹטֶא אֶחָד יְאַבֵּד טוֹבָה הַרְבֵּה״ – בִּשְׁבִיל חֵטְא יְחִידִי שֶׁחָטָא אוֹבֵד מִמֶּנּוּ טוֹבוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: a person should view himself as though he were half-liable and half-meritorious. he performs one mitzva he is fortunate, as he tilts his to the scale of merit. he transgresses one prohibition, woe to him, as he tilts his to the scale of liability, as it is stated: “But one sin destroys much good” due to one sin that transgresses he squanders much good.
llm_translation: A person should see himself as if his scale is equally balanced between guilt and merit. If he performs one mitzvah - fortunate is he, for he has tipped his scale to the side of merit. If he commits one transgression - woe to him, for he has tipped his scale to the side of guilt, as it is stated: "And one sin destroys much good" - for the sin of one individual, he loses many good things.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְפִי שֶׁהָעוֹלָם נִידּוֹן אַחַר רוּבּוֹ, וְהַיָּחִיד נִידּוֹן אַחַר רוּבּוֹ, עָשָׂה מִצְוָה אַחַת – אַשְׁרָיו, שֶׁהִכְרִיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ וְאֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם לְכַף זְכוּת, עָבַר עֲבֵירָה אַחַת – אוֹי לוֹ, שֶׁהִכְרִיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ וְאֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם לְכַף חוֹבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְחוֹטֵא אֶחָד כּוּ׳״ – בִּשְׁבִיל חֵטְא יְחִידִי שֶׁעָשָׂה זֶה אָבַד מִמֶּנּוּ וּמִכׇּל הָעוֹלָם טוֹבָה הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Since the world is judged by its majority, and an individual is judged by his majority, he performs one mitzva he is praiseworthy, as he tilts himself and the entire world to the scale of merit. he transgresses one prohibition, woe to him, as he tilts for himself and the entire world to the scale of liability, as it is stated: “But one sin due to one sin that this commits, he squanders much goodness from himself and from the entire world.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Because the world is judged after the majority, and the individual is judged after the majority, if one performs a single commandment - praiseworthy is he, for he has tipped himself and the entire world to the side of merit. But if one commits a single transgression - woe to him, for he has tipped himself and the entire world to the side of liability, as it is stated: "And one sinner destroys much good" - for the sin of one individual who commits this, he and the entire world lose much good.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ צַדִּיק גָּמוּר כׇּל יָמָיו וּמָרַד בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה – אִיבֵּד אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צִדְקַת הַצַּדִּיק לֹא תַצִּילֶנּוּ בְּיוֹם פִּשְׁעוֹ״. וַאֲפִילּוּ רָשָׁע גָּמוּר כׇּל יָמָיו וְעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה – אֵין מַזְכִּירִים לוֹ שׁוּב רִשְׁעוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרִשְׁעַת הָרָשָׁע לֹא יִכָּשֶׁל בָּהּ בְּיוֹם שׁוּבוֹ מֵרִשְׁעוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: Even completely righteous all his life and he rebelled at the end he loses early as it is stated: “The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him on the day of his transgression” And even completely wicked all his life and repented in the end, he is no longer reminded of his wickedness, as it is stated “And as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not stumble over it on the day that he turns from his wickedness.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: Even if a completely righteous person all his days and rebelled at the end - he nullifies the former, as it is said: "The righteousness of the righteous shall not save him on the day of his transgression." And even if a completely wicked person all his days and repented at the end - they do not mention his wickedness, as it is said: "And the wickedness of the wicked shall not cause him to stumble on the day he turns from his wickedness."

hebrew_text: וְנִיהְוֵי כְּמֶחֱצָה עֲוֹנוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה זְכִיּוֹת? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּתוֹהֶא עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: But should be like half sins and half merits, Reish Lakish said: to regrets all initial
llm_translation: "And should be like half sins and half merits? Reish Lakish said: In the case of the first ones."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בַּמִּקְרָא וּבַמִּשְׁנָה וּבְדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ – לֹא בִּמְהֵרָה הוּא חוֹטֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַחוּט הַמְשֻׁלָּשׁ לֹא בִמְהֵרָה יִנָּתֵק״. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא בַּמִּקְרָא וְלֹא בַּמִּשְׁנָה וְלֹא בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ – אֵינוֹ מִן הַיִּישּׁוּב.
human_translation: Anyone who is engaged in Bible, and in Mishna, and in desired mode of behavior, will not be quick to sin, as it is stated: “And a threefold cord is not quickly broken” And anyone who does not engage in Bible, nor Mishna, nor desired mode of behavior, is not part of society,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught: Anyone who is proficient in Scripture, Mishnah, and worldly matters does not sin hastily, as it is stated: "And a threefold cord is not quickly broken." But anyone who is not proficient in Scripture, Mishnah, and worldly matters is not of the returning ones.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: לְמָה צַדִּיקִים נִמְשָׁלִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה – לְאִילָן שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם טׇהֳרָה, וְנוֹפוֹ נוֹטֶה לִמְקוֹם טוּמְאָה. נִקְצַץ נוֹפוֹ – כּוּלּוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם טׇהֳרָה. כָּךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא יִסּוּרִים עַל צַדִּיקִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּירְשׁוּ הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה רֵאשִׁיתְךָ מִצְעָר וְאַחֲרִיתְךָ יִשְׂגֶּה מְאֹד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: To what are the righteous in this world compared? To a tree that is standing entirely in a pure place and its branches hang over an impure place. its branches are cut, it will stand entirely in a pure place. So too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, brings afflictions upon the righteous in this world so that they will inherit the World-to-Come as it is stated: “And your beginning was in pain, your end shall greatly increase”
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: Why are the righteous compared to a tree in this world? - Like a tree whose trunk stands in a place of purity, and its branches extend to a place of impurity. If its branches are cut off, its trunk remains in a place of purity. So too, the Holy One, blessed be He, brings suffering upon the righteous in this world, so that they may inherit the World to Come, as it is said: "And your beginning will be small, and your end will be very great."

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה רְשָׁעִים דּוֹמִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה – לְאִילָן שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם טוּמְאָה וְנוֹפוֹ נוֹטֶה לִמְקוֹם טׇהֳרָה. נִקְצַץ נוֹפוֹ – כּוּלּוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם טוּמְאָה. כָּךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְשַׁפֵּיעַ לָהֶן טוֹבָה לָרְשָׁעִים בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה כְּדֵי לְטוֹרְדָן וּלְהוֹרִישָׁן לְמַדְרֵיגָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵשׁ דֶּרֶךְ יָשָׁר לִפְנֵי אִישׁ וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ דַּרְכֵי מָוֶת״.
human_translation: And to what are the wicked in this world compared? To a tree that stands entirely in an impure place and whose branches hang over a pure place. its branches are cut off, it stands entirely in an impure place. So too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, bestows good upon the wicked in this world in order to expel them and banish them to the lowest level as it is stated: “There is a way which seems right to a man, but its end are the ways of death”
llm_translation: And why do the wicked resemble a tree in this world - a tree whose trunk stands in a place of impurity and its branch leans towards a place of purity. If its branch is cut off - its entire trunk stands in a place of impurity. So too, the Holy One, blessed be He, bestows goodness upon the wicked in this world in order to torment them and to ultimately drive them out to the lowest level, as it is stated: "There is a way that seems straight to a man, but its end is the way of death."

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר הָיָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וּזְקֵנִים מְסוּבִּין בַּעֲלִיַּת בֵּית נַתְּזָה בְּלוֹד. נִשְׁאֲלָה שְׁאֵילָה זוֹ בִּפְנֵיהֶם: תַּלְמוּד גָּדוֹל אוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה גָּדוֹל? נַעֲנָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְאָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה גָּדוֹל. נַעֲנָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר: תַּלְמוּד גָּדוֹל. נַעֲנוּ כּוּלָּם וְאָמְרוּ: תַּלְמוּד גָּדוֹל, שֶׁהַתַּלְמוּד מֵבִיא לִידֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And already was Rabbi Tarfon and the Elders were reclining in the loft of the house of Nit’za in Lod, this question was asked of them: study greater or is action greater? Rabbi Tarfon answered and said: Action is greater. Rabbi Akiva answered and said: Study is greater. Everyone answered and said: Study is greater, as study leads to action.
llm_translation: And as it was, Rabbi Tarfon and elders were reclining in the upper story of the house of Nitzah in Lod. This inquiry was posed before them: "Is study greater or action greater?" Rabbi Tarfon answered and said: "Action is greater." Rabbi Akiva answered and said: "Study is greater." They all answered and said: "Study is greater, for study leads to action."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד שֶׁקָּדַם לְחַלָּה אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה, לִתְרוּמוֹת וּלְמַעַשְׂרוֹת חֲמִשִּׁים וְאַרְבַּע, לִשְׁמִיטִּים שִׁשִּׁים וְאַחַת, לְיוֹבְלוֹת מֵאָה וְשָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei says: study is greater, as it preceded ḥalla forty years. terumot and tithes fifty-four Sabbatical sixty-one Jubilee 103
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Great is Torah study, for it preceded the world by forty years, for contributions and tithes fifty-four, for Sabbatical years sixty-one, for Jubilees one hundred and three.

hebrew_text: מֵאָה וְשָׁלֹשׁ? מֵאָה וְאַרְבַּע הָוְיָין! קָסָבַר: יוֹבֵל מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ הוּא מְשַׁמֵּט.
human_translation: 103 It was 104 maintains the Jubilee releases from start
llm_translation: One hundred and three? One hundred and four they are! He holds: the Jubilee is from its beginning it releases.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁהַלִּימּוּד קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה כָּךְ דִּינוֹ קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה, כִּדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין תְּחִילַּת דִּינוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם אֶלָּא עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פּוֹטֵר מַיִם רֵאשִׁית מָדוֹן״.
human_translation: And just as study before action, so too, judgment precedes an action in accordance with Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna says: The beginning of a person’s judgment is only concerning matters of Torah, as it is stated: “The beginning of judgment is as one lets out water”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Just as learning precedes action, so too judgment precedes action, as in the case of Rav Hamnuna. For Rav Hamnuna said: The beginning of a person's judgment is only based on matters of Torah, as it is said: "He who lets out water is the beginning of strife."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁדִּינוֹ קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה כָּךְ שְׂכָרוֹ קוֹדֵם לְמַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתֵּן לָהֶם אַרְצוֹת גּוֹיִם וַעֲמַל לְאֻמִּים יִירָשׁוּ. בַּעֲבוּר יִשְׁמְרוּ חֻקָּיו וְתוֹרֹתָיו יִנְצֹרוּ״.
human_translation: And just as judgment precedes an action so too does reward precede an action as it is stated: “And He gave them the lands of nations, and they took the labor of peoples in possession, that they might observe His statutes and protect His laws”
llm_translation: "And as the judgment precedes the action, so too the reward precedes the action, as it is stated: 'He gave them the lands of nations, and they inherited the toil of peoples, in order that they might observe His statutes and keep His laws.'"

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא בַּמִּקְרָא וְלֹא בַּמִּשְׁנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּפָסוּל לְעֵדוּת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹכֵל בַּשּׁוּק הֲרֵי זֶה דּוֹמֶה לְכֶלֶב. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת. אָמַר רַבִּי אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: הֲלָכָה כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: anyone who does not engage in Bible, nor Mishna, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And he is disqualified from bearing witness, The Sages taught: One who eats in the marketplace is comparable to a dog, And some say he is disqualified from bearing witness. Rabbi Idi bar Avin said: halakha in accordance with Some say.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kol she'eino lo bamaikra v'lo bamishna. Amar Rabbi Yochanan: u'pasul le'edut. Tanu Rabanan: ha'ochel bashuk harei zeh domeh le'kelev. V'yesh omrim pasul le'edut. Amar Rabbi Idi bar Avin: halacha ke'yesh omrim." English translation: "Everything that is not in the Scripture and not in the Mishnah. Rabbi Yochanan said: and is disqualified for testimony. The Rabbis taught: one who eats in the marketplace is likened to a dog. And some say he is disqualified for testimony. Rabbi Idi bar Avin said: the halacha is according to those who say."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: רַגְזָן
human_translation: bar Kappara taught: An angry person
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: "Ragzan."

hebrew_text: לֹא עָלְתָה בְּיָדוֹ אֶלָּא רַגְזָנוּתָא. וּלְאָדָם טוֹב מַטְעִימִים אוֹתוֹ מִפְּרִי מַעֲשָׂיו. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא בַּמִּקְרָא וְלֹא בַּמִּשְׁנָה וְלֹא בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ – דּוֹר הֲנָאָה מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְמוֹשַׁב לֵצִים לֹא יָשָׁב״ – מוֹשָׁבוֹ מוֹשַׁב לֵצִים.
human_translation: has managed only anger [ ragzanuta ], And a good person is given the fruit of his actions to taste. And any who does not engage in Bible, nor Mishna, nor desired mode of behavior, vow to not benefit from him, as it is stated: “Nor sat in the seat of the scornful” seat seat of the scornful,
llm_translation: He did not ascend except with anger. And to a person, they make him taste from the fruit of his actions. And anyone who is not in the Scripture, nor in the Mishnah, nor in the way of the land - the generation that benefits from him, as it is said: "And in the seat of scoffers he does not sit" - his seat is the seat of scoffers.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה נִקְנֵית
llm_translation: We will return to you, the woman is acquired.

hebrew_text: הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ בּוֹ וּבִשְׁלוּחוֹ. הָאִשָּׁה מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בָּהּ וּבִשְׁלוּחָהּ. הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֶׁהִיא נַעֲרָה, בּוֹ וּבִשְׁלוּחוֹ.
human_translation: A man can betroth by himself or by his agent. a woman can become betrothed by herself or by her agent. A man can betroth his daughter when she is a young woman, by himself or by his agent.
llm_translation: The man sanctifies in him and in his sending. The woman sanctifies in her and in her sending. The man sanctifies his daughter when she is a young girl, in him and in his sending.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַשְׁתָּא בִּשְׁלוּחוֹ מְקַדֵּשׁ, בּוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִצְוָה בּוֹ יוֹתֵר מִבִּשְׁלוּחוֹ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב סָפְרָא מְחָרֵיךְ רֵישָׁא, רָבָא מָלַח שִׁיבּוּטָא.
human_translation: Now one can betroth by his agent, is necessary by himself? Rav Yosef says: more mitzva by himself than by his agent. like that of Rav Safra, would singe the head Rava, would salt a turbot fish
llm_translation: Gemara: Now, this year in his sending, he sanctifies, in it is a question?! Rav Yosef said: The mitzvah in it is greater than in his sending. For this that Rav Safra delayed the beginning, Rava salted the dish.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּהָא אִיסּוּרָא נָמֵי אִית בֵּהּ, כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר לָאָדָם שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַד שֶׁיִּרְאֶנָּה, שֶׁמָּא יִרְאֶה בָּהּ דָּבָר מְגוּנֶּה וְתִתְגַּנֶּה עָלָיו, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״.
human_translation: There are who say: With regard to this it also involves a prohibition, in accordance with that Rav Yehuda says Rav says, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: It is forbidden for a man to betroth a woman until he sees her, lest he see something repulsive in her and she will become repugnant to him, And the Merciful One states “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself”
llm_translation: There are those who say: In this prohibition there is indeed something in it, as Rav Yehudah said Rav. For Rav Yehudah said Rav: It is forbidden for a man to betroth a woman until he sees her, lest he see in her something repulsive and she becomes repugnant to him, and the Merciful One said: "Love your neighbor as yourself."

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב יוֹסֵף – אַסֵּיפָא אִיתְּמַר, הָאִשָּׁה מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בָּהּ וּבִשְׁלוּחָהּ. הַשְׁתָּא בִּשְׁלוּחָהּ מִיקַּדְּשָׁא בָּהּ מִיבַּעְיָא?! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִצְוָה בָּהּ יוֹתֵר מִבִּשְׁלוּחָהּ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב סָפְרָא מְחָרֵיךְ רֵישָׁא, רָבָא מָלַח שִׁיבּוּטָא.
human_translation: And when Rav Yosef was stated, it was stated with regard to the latter clause A woman can become betrothed by herself or by her agent. Now she can become betrothed by her agent, is necessary by herself? Rav Yosef says: more mitzva by herself than by her agent. like that of Rav Safra, would singe the head Rava, would salt a turbot fish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And when it was stated that Rav Yosef said – in the latter clause it was stated: A woman becomes consecrated through her and through her emissary. Now, if through her emissary she becomes consecrated through her, is it necessary?! Rav Yosef said: The mitzvah is more with her than with her emissary. For this is like when Rav Safra would salt the head, Rava would salt the tail.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּהָא אִיסּוּרָא לֵית בַּהּ, כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: טָב לְמֵיתַב טַן דּוּ מִלְּמֵיתַב אַרְמְלוּ.
human_translation: But in this there is no prohibition, as that Reish Lakish As Reish Lakish said: It is better to sit two bodies, than to sit a widow.
llm_translation: However, in this case there is no prohibition, as Reish Lakish expounded, for Reish Lakish said: "It is better to sit in the shadow of one's own deeds than in the shadow of the deeds of others."

hebrew_text: הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֶׁהִיא נַעֲרָה. כְּשֶׁהִיא נַעֲרָה – אִין, כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה – לָא. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה, עַד שֶׁתִּגְדַּל וְתֹאמַר: ״בִּפְלוֹנִי אֲנִי רוֹצָה״.
human_translation: A man can betroth his daughter when she is a young woman. When she is a young woman, yes, when she is a minor, no, supports Rav, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say Rabbi Elazar: It is prohibited for a person to betroth his daughter when she is a minor, until that she grows up and says: I want so-and-so.
llm_translation: The man sanctifies his daughter when she is a young woman. When she is a young woman - yes, when she is a minor - no. Rav assists him, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say it was Rabbi Elazar: It is forbidden for a man to sanctify his daughter when she is a minor, until she grows up and says, "I want to marry so-and-so."

hebrew_text: שְׁלִיחוּת מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשִׁלַּח״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: From where do we agency? As it is taught And he sends [ veshillaḥ ]. teaches that he can appoint an agent [ shaliaḥ ],
llm_translation: The mission of where? For it was taught: "And he shall send" - teaches that he is making a messenger.

hebrew_text: ״וְשִׁלְּחָהּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִיא עוֹשָׂה ״שָׁלִיחַ״. ״וְשִׁלַּח״ ״וְשִׁלְּחָהּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַשָּׁלִיחַ עוֹשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: “and he sends her [ veshilleḥah ]” teaches that she can appoint an agent “and he sends,” “and he sends her” teach that an agent can appoint another agent.
llm_translation: "Ve'shilchah" - teaches that she does "shaliach." "Ve'shilach" "ve'shilchah" - teaches that the shaliach does shaliach.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן בְּגֵירוּשִׁין, בְּקִידּוּשִׁין מְנָלַן? וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּיָלֵיף מִגֵּירוּשִׁין – מָה לְגֵירוּשִׁין, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצְאָה״ ״וְהָיְתָה״ – מַקִּישׁ הֲוָיָה לִיצִיאָה, מָה יְצִיאָה מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ – אַף הֲוָיָה נָמֵי מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: We found with regard to divorce; from where do we with regard to betrothal? And if you would say that is derived from divorce, What about divorce is that it against her will, The verse states: “And she departs and becomes juxtaposes becoming to leaving just as appoint an agent leaving so too he appoint an agent becoming
llm_translation: I found in regards to divorces, where do we derive the concept of sanctifications? And if you were to say that it is derived from divorces - what is the comparison to divorces, that they are done willingly! The verse states: "and she shall go out" "and she shall be" - it equates being to going out, just as going out is done through an agent - so too being is also done through an agent.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״צֵא תְּרוֹם״ – תּוֹרֵם כְּדַעַת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ דַּעַת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת – תּוֹרֵם בְּבֵינוֹנִית, אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשִּׁים.
human_translation: But that which we learned one who says to his agent: Go out separate teruma must separate in accordance with the mindset of the owner. And if he does not know the mindset of the owner, he separates an intermediate one-fiftieth
llm_translation: And rather, this that we learned: One who says to his messenger, "Go and lift up," - he should lift up according to the understanding of the homeowner. And if he does not know the understanding of the homeowner - he should lift up in moderation, one out of fifty.

hebrew_text: פִּיחֵת עֲשָׂרָה אוֹ הוֹסִיף עֲשָׂרָה – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה. מְנָלַן? וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּיָלֵיף מִגֵּירוּשִׁין – מָה לְגֵירוּשִׁין, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן חוֹל! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַתֶּם״, ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשָּׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: If subtracted ten or added ten his teruma is teruma . From where do we And if you would say that is derived from divorce, What to divorce is that it is a non-sacred verse states “you,” “you also” to include an agent.
llm_translation: The opening of ten or adding ten - his contribution is a contribution. From where do we derive this? And if you were to say that he should add from the divorces - what is the relevance of divorces, as they are mundane! The verse states: "You," "also you" - to include the agent.

hebrew_text: וְנִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בִּתְרוּמָה, וְנֵיתוֹ הָנָךְ וְנִגְמְרוּ מִינֵּיהּ! מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִפְרַךְ: שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָהּ בְּמַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: And let the Merciful One write in teruma and these can come and be derived from it. because can be refuted: that it is by thought.
llm_translation: "And it is written, 'Mercy shall be given in contribution,' and the funds were given and its types were completed! Because there is room to refute: for it is established in thought."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: חֲבוּרָה שֶׁאָבַד פִּסְחָהּ, וְאָמְרוּ לְאֶחָד: ״צֵא וּבַקֵּשׁ וּשְׁחוֹט עָלֵינוּ״, וְהָלַךְ וּמָצָא וְשָׁחַט, וְהֵן לָקְחוּ וְשָׁחֲטוּ, אִם שֶׁלּוֹ נִשְׁחַט רִאשׁוֹן – הוּא אוֹכֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְהֵם אוֹכְלִים וְשׁוֹתִים עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: But that which we learned a group whose Paschal offering was lost and they said to one Go and search and slaughter on our and went and found and slaughtered but they took and slaughtered If his was slaughtered first, he eats from his and they eat and drink with him.
llm_translation: And this that we learned: A group whose Passover offering got lost, and they said to one of them, "Go out and search and slaughter for us." And he went and found and slaughtered, and they took it and slaughtered. If his was slaughtered first - he eats from his, and they eat and drink with him.

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן? וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּיָלֵיף מֵהָנָךְ – מָה לְהָנָךְ, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן חוֹל אֵצֶל קָדָשִׁים!
human_translation: From where do we And if you would say that is derived from these What about these is that they are non-sacred relative to offerings,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive this? And if you will say that it is derived from here - what is the comparison to here, for here they are mundane in comparison to holy things!

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: מִנַּיִן שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁחֲטוּ אֹתוֹ כֹּל קְהַל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, וְכִי כָּל הַקָּהָל כּוּלָּן שׁוֹחֲטִין? וַהֲלֹא אֵינוֹ שׁוֹחֵט אֶלָּא אֶחָד! אֶלָּא מִכָּאן שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: He derives it from which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: From where that a person’s agent is like himself? As it is stated “And the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall slaughter it in the afternoon” Is it so the whole assembly slaughters But only one slaughters Rather, from here that a person’s agent is like himself.
llm_translation: He went out from Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: From where do we derive that the emissary of a person is like himself? As it is stated: "And they shall slaughter it, the entire congregation of the children of Israel, between the evenings." Are all the members of the congregation slaughtering? But is it not the case that only one person slaughters! Rather, from here we derive that the emissary of a person is like himself.

hebrew_text: נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּקָדָשִׁים, וְנֵיתֵי הָנָךְ וְנִיגְמְרוּ מִינֵּיהּ! מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִפְרַךְ: מָה לְקָדָשִׁים, שֶׁכֵּן רוֹב מַעֲשֵׂיהֶן עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One write with regard to offerings, and these, can come and be derived from it. because can be refuted: What about offerings majority of their actions by an agent.
llm_translation: It is written, "Mercy is inscribed upon the holy ones," and yet they come and are completed from there! Because there is a refutation: What about the holy ones, whose actions are mostly done through an agent.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי? – הֵי תֵּיתֵי?
human_translation: cannot be derived one from one derive one from two. Which derived
llm_translation: One from one does not come, give one from two? - Give.

hebrew_text: לָא נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּקָדָשִׁים וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ – מָה לְהָנָךְ, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן חוֹל אֵצֶל קֳדָשִׁים. לָא נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּגֵירוּשִׁין וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ – מָה לְהָנָךְ, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן בְּמַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One not write with regard to offerings and derive from these, What about these is that they are non-sacred relative to offerings, Let the Merciful One not write with regard to divorce, and derive from these, What about these is they can be by means of thought,
llm_translation: The Merciful One did not write in the Holy Scriptures "and you shall give from these" - what is meant by "from these," that they are permitted in a secular context alongside holy items. The Merciful One did not write in the Holy Scriptures "and you shall give from these divorces" - what is meant by "from these," that they are valid in thought.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לָא לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בִּתְרוּמָה, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ! הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Let the Merciful One not write with regard to teruma , and derive from these, indeed
llm_translation: Instead: not to write "the Merciful One" in the context of terumah, and it should be read as "from here"! This is indeed the correct understanding.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא ״אַתֶּם״ ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יַנַּאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ – מָה אַתֶּם בְּנֵי בְּרִית, אַף שְׁלוּחֲכֶם בְּנֵי בְּרִית.
