human_translation: But why do I “you,” “you also” is necessary to the of Rabbi Yannai, as Rabbi Yannai says “you also,” Just as you, are members of the covenant, so too, your agents members of the covenant.
llm_translation: And rather, "you" "also you" why to me? From it requires to him to like Rabbi Yannai. For Rabbi Yannai said "also you" - just as you are sons of the covenant, so too your messengers are sons of the covenant.

hebrew_text: הָא לְמָה לִי קְרָא? מִדְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָפְקָא! דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הָעֶבֶד נַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גֵּט מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּתוֹרַת גִּיטִּין וְקִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Why do I a verse this It derived from that Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba Rabbi Yoḥanan says, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A slave cannot become an agent to receive a bill of divorce from the hand of a woman’s husband because he is not in the laws of bills of divorce and betrothal.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "Why do I need a verse? From Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan went out! For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: A slave cannot be appointed as an agent to receive a bill of divorce from the husband of a woman immediately, because he is not knowledgeable in the laws of divorce and betrothal."

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: עֶבֶד, דְּלָאו בַּר הֶיתֵּירָא הוּא כְּלָל. אֲבָל נׇכְרִי, הוֹאִיל וְאִיתֵיהּ בִּתְרוּמָה דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, דִּתְנַן: הַנׇּכְרִי וְהַכּוּתִי שֶׁתָּרְמוּ – תְּרוּמָתָן תְּרוּמָה, אֵימָא שָׁלִיחַ נָמֵי עָבֵיד, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say: a slave since he cannot release at all; but a gentile, since he is included in his own teruma , as we learned A gentile or a Samaritan who separated teruma their teruma is considered teruma , I will say also be agent. teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: A slave, who is not a son of the free, is not included. But a non-Jew, since he has a portion in his own terumah, as we learned: A non-Jew and a Samaritan who set aside terumah - their terumah is terumah, say a messenger can act on their behalf, this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּפָטַר, דִּתְנַן: תְּרוּמַת נׇכְרִי מְדַמַּעַת וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ חוֹמֶשׁ וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, ״אַתֶּם״ ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon, who exempts As we learned the teruma of a gentile a mixture of and non-sacred and he is liable for it one-fifth But Rabbi Shimon exempts why do I “you” “you also”?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Rabbi Shimon, who exempted, as we learned: The offering of a non-Jew causes tears, and one is obligated to give a fifth on it, and Rabbi Shimon exempts, "You" "also you" why do I need them?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר מָר: ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא אֲרִיסִין, ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא שׁוּתָּפִין, ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא הַתּוֹרֵם אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ, אֵימָא: ״אַתֶּם״ – וְלֹא שְׁלוּחֲכֶם נָמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say: Since the Master says “you,” but not sharecroppers, “you” but not partners “you” but not a steward [ apotropos ] “you” but not one who separates from that is not his, also say: “You” and not your agents. teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: Since the Master said, "You" - and not renters, "You" - and not partners, "You" - and not hired workers, "You" - and not one who appoints someone who is not his own, say: "You" - and not your messenger also, this is what we understand.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, דְּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְהַאי קְרָא לִדְרָשָׁא אַחֲרִינָא, מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן יוֹצְאִים
human_translation: This works out well to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, But to Rabbi Yonatan, who derives a different exposition from this verse, from where do we As it is taught Rabbi Yonatan says: From where do we all of the Jews can fulfill
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha. Rather, to Rabbi Yonatan, for he derives from this verse another interpretation, where do we find this? As it was taught, Rabbi Yonatan says: From where do we derive that all of Israel are able to fulfill..."

hebrew_text: בְּפֶסַח אֶחָד? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁחֲטוּ אֹתוֹ כֹּל קְהַל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, וְכִי כׇּל הַקָּהָל כּוּלָּם שׁוֹחֲטִים? וַהֲלֹא אֵינוֹ שׁוֹחֵט אֶלָּא אֶחָד! אֶלָּא מִכָּאן שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹצְאִים בְּפֶסַח אֶחָד – שָׁלִיחַ בְּקָדָשִׁים מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: with one Paschal offering? as it is stated “And the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall slaughter it in the afternoon” Is it so that the whole assembly slaughters But only one slaughters. Rather, from here that all of the Jews can fulfill with one Paschal from where does he agency with regard to offerings?
llm_translation: In one Passover? As it is stated: "And they shall slaughter it, the entire congregation of the assembly of Israel, between the evenings." And is the entire congregation slaughtering? But is it not that only one slaughters! Rather, from here it is derived that all of Israel go out with one Passover – how do we know that there is a messenger for consecrated offerings?

hebrew_text: – מִינֵּיהּ. וְדִילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִית לֵיהּ שׁוּתָּפוּת בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: from that But perhaps it is different there, since has partnership with them
llm_translation: From him. And perhaps it is different there, because there is partnership in their bodies.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְיִקְחוּ לָהֶם אִישׁ שֶׂה לְבֵית אָבֹת שֶׂה לַבָּיִת״. וְדִילְמָא הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּאִית לֵיהּ שׁוּתָּפוּת בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ? אִם כֵּן תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי לְמָה לִי? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְהֵיכָא דְּשָׁיֵיךְ תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לְהֵיכָא דְּלָא שָׁיֵיךְ.
human_translation: Rather, from here: “And they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers’ houses, a lamb for a household” But perhaps there too since has partnership with them? If so, why do I two verses If is not applicable for where it belongs, apply it to where it does not belong,
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And they shall take for themselves each man a lamb for a father's house, a lamb for a household." But perhaps there, it is also necessary, for there is partnership in their bodies? If so, why do I need two verses? If it is not relevant here, where it is appropriate for both verses to be relevant, it is relevant here where it is not appropriate.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״אִישׁ״ זוֹכֶה, וְלֹא הַקָּטָן זוֹכֶה. הָהוּא מֵ״אִישׁ לְפִי אׇכְלוֹ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: This is required for him to that of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: a man, can acquire but a minor cannot acquire That is derived from “According to every man’s eating
llm_translation: This is what he asked according to Rabbi Yitzchak. For Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Man" acquires, and not the minor acquires. That one is derived from "according to his eating" Genesis 25:34.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ דְּשׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד. סָבַר לַהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: And still is required for him that one may slaughter a Paschal offering for an individual. holds in accordance with the one who says one may not slaughter a Paschal offering for an individual.
llm_translation: And once he asked him, "Do we slaughter the Passover lamb for an individual?" He thought to him like the one who said, "We do not slaughter the Passover lamb for an individual."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָשִׂיא אֶחָד נָשִׂיא אֶחָד מִמַּטֶּה״. תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ שְׁלִיחוּת מֵהָכָא! וְתִיסְבְּרָא דְּהָא שְׁלִיחוּת הוּא? וְהָא קְטַנִּים לָאו בְּנֵי שְׁלִיחוּת נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: But that Rav Giddel says Rav says: From where that a person’s agent is like himself? as it is stated “And you shall take one prince of every tribe, Let agency be derived from here; And you understand that this was agency? But minors cannot be agency,
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the emissary of a person is like himself? As it is stated: "And one prince, one prince from each tribe." Let him derive the concept of agency from here! And should it be reasoned that this is agency? But are minors not considered like the agents themselves!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי הָא דְּרָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁזָּכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָשִׂיא אֶחָד נָשִׂיא אֶחָד״. וְתִיסְבְּרַאּ זְכוּת הִיא? הָא חוֹבָה נָמֵי אִיכָּא, דְּאִיכָּא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּהַר, וְלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּבִקְעָה, וְאִיכָּא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּבִקְעָה וְלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּהַר!
human_translation: Rather, like that of Rava bar Rav Huna, as Rava bar Rav Huna says Rav Giddel says Rav says: From where that one can act in a person’s interest in his absence? as is stated: “And one prince.” And you understand it is a benefit? But it was also disadvantage, as there is for whom it is preferable to him on a hill and it is not preferable to him in a valley, and there is for whom it is preferable to him in a valley and it is not preferable to him on a hill.
llm_translation: Rather, as in the case of Rava son of Rav Huna. For Rava son of Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Giddel who said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that a person can be acquitted not in his presence? As it is stated: "And one leader, one leader." Is it possible that this is a merit? There is indeed a liability, for there are cases where it is suitable for him on the mountain but not suitable for him in the valley, and there are cases where it is suitable for him in the valley but not suitable for him on the mountain!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא כִּדְרָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן לִיתוֹמִים שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶן שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מַעֲמִידִין לָהֶם אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס לָחוּב וְלִזְכּוֹת? ״לָחוּב״ אַמַּאי? אֶלָּא: ״לָחוּב עַל מְנָת לִזְכּוֹת״ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָשִׂיא אֶחָד נָשִׂיא אֶחָד מִמַּטֶּה תִּקְחוּ״.
human_translation: Rather, like that of Rava bar Rav Huna, as Rava bar Rav Huna says Rav Giddel says Rav says: From where that orphans came to divide their father’s property, that the court appoints a steward for them, to disadvantage and to benefit? Why to disadvantage? Rather, to disadvantage in order to benefit. the verse states: “And you shall take one prince of every tribe”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather like Rava son of Rav Huna. For Rava son of Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Giddel who said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that orphans who come to divide the estate of their father, the court appoints for them an apotropos for liability and for merit? "For liability," why? Rather, "for liability in order to merit" – the Talmud teaches: "And one prince, one prince from each tribe you shall take."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחְלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶם – בֵּית דִּין מַעֲמִידִים לָהֶם אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, וּבוֹרְרִים לָהֶם חֵלֶק יָפֶה, וְאִם הִגְדִּילוּ – יְכוֹלִים לְמַחוֹת. וְרַב נַחְמָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: אִם הִגְדִּילוּ אֵינָם יְכוֹלִים לְמַחוֹת, דְּאִם כֵּן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: orphans came to divide their father’s property, the court appoints for them, and they select for them, a fine portion. And when they have grown up, can protest And Rav Naḥman said his own When they have grown up, they cannot protest, as if so, what advantage the power of the court
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Orphans who come to divide their father's estate - the court appoints for them an apotropos, and they choose for them a good portion. And if they grow up - they are able to protest. And Rav Nachman himself said: If they grow up, they are not able to protest, for if so, what power does the court have?

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן ״אִם כֵּן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה״? וְהָתְנַן: שׁוּם הַדַּיָּינִים שֶׁפִּיחֲתוּ שְׁתוּת אוֹ הוֹתִירוּ שְׁתוּת – מִכְרָן בָּטֵל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִכְרָן קַיָּים. (וְאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל): אִם כֵּן – מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה! וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: And is Rav Naḥman of If so, what advantage the court have But didn’t we learn the appraisal by the judges Where they decreased one-sixth or added one-sixth their sale is void. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Their sale is valid. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If so, what advantage the power of the court And Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana says Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who has the following question for Rav Nachman, "If so, what power does the court have?" And we learned: Any judges who have made a mistake in their ruling or have left out a ruling - their sale is void. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Their sale is valid. (And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said): If so - what power does the court have! And Rav Huna son of Chinena said in the name of Rav Nachman: The halakha follows the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא:
human_translation: not difficult.
llm_translation: Not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא – דִּטְעוֹ, הָא – דְּלָא טְעוֹ. אִי דְּלָא טְעוֹ, מַאי יְכוֹלִים לְמַחוֹת? יְכוֹלִים לְמַחוֹת בְּרוּחוֹת.
human_translation: this erred that they did not err If where they did not err why they can protest; They can protest with regard to locations.
llm_translation: The one who erred, the one who did not err. If one did not err, what can they do to rectify? They can rectify with winds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָאַחִין שֶׁחָלְקוּ הֲרֵי הֵן כְּלָקוֹחוֹת. פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁתוּת – נִקְנֶה מִקָּח. יָתֵר עַל שְׁתוּת – בָּטֵל מִקָּח. שְׁתוּת – קָנָה, וּמַחְזִיר אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: brothers who divided they are like purchasers less than one-sixth transaction is acquired, more than one-sixth, transaction is void. one-sixth, acquired, and must return fraud.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Brothers who divided, behold they are like purchasers. Less than a sixth - the purchase is acquired. More than a sixth - the purchase is nullified. A sixth - he acquires, and returns the overcharge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דַּאֲמַרַן ״פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁתוּת – נִקְנֶה מִקָּח״ – לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא שַׁוְּיֵהּ שָׁלִיחַ, אֲבָל שַׁוְּיֵהּ שָׁלִיחַ, אָמַר: לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁדַּרְתָּיךָ וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי.
human_translation: Rava says: That which we said, less than one-sixth transaction is acquired, we said only where did not appoint an agent But if appointed an agent, say: I sent you to my benefit and not to my detriment.
llm_translation: Rava said: This that we said, "Less than a prutah - acquires a purchase" - we only said it when it is not appointed as a messenger, but when it is appointed as a messenger, he said: "For the purpose of fixing you, not to distort."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דַּאֲמַרַן ״יָתֵר מִשְּׁתוּת – בָּטֵל מִקָּח״ – לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא אָמַר (נִיפְלִיגַן) [נִפְלוֹג] בְּשׁוּמָא דְּבֵי דִינָא, אֲבָל אָמַר נִפְלוֹג בְּשׁוּמָא דְּבֵי דִינָא – מִכְרָן קַיָּים, דִּתְנַן: שׁוּם הַדַּיָּינִים שֶׁפִּיחֲתוּ שְׁתוּת אוֹ הוֹתִירוּ שְׁתוּת – מִכְרָן בָּטֵל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִכְרָן קַיָּים.
human_translation: And that which we said, more than one-sixth transaction is void, we said only when did not say: Let us divide by an appraisal of the court. But he said: Let us divide by an appraisal of the court, the transaction is valid, as we learned the appraisal the judges: where they decreased one-sixth or added one-sixth their sale is void. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Their sale is valid.
llm_translation: And this that we say, "More than half - the sale is annulled," we only said that it does not apply if it fell into the domain of the court, but if it fell into the domain of the court, their sale stands, as we learned: If the judges imposed a tax or left a tax - their sale is annulled. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Their sale stands.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דַּאֲמַרַן ״שְׁתוּת – קָנָה, וּמַחְזִיר אוֹנָאָה״ – לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּמִטַּלְטְלֵי, אֲבָל בִּמְקַרְקְעֵי – אֵין אוֹנָאָה לְקַרְקָעוֹת. וּבִמְקַרְקְעֵי לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דִּפְלוּג בְּעִילּוּיָא, אֲבָל פְּלוּג בְּמִשְׁחֲתָא – לָא, כִּדְרַבָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן, אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּדֵי אוֹנָאָה – נָמֵי חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: And that which we said, one-sixth acquired and he must return fraud, we said only with regard to movable property. But with regard to land, there is no fraud with regard to land. And with regard to land, we said only when they divided according to the value But they divided by measure not with of Rabba, as Rabba said: Any matter that is according to measure, or according to weight, or according to number, even less than the amount fraud, is also returned.
llm_translation: The one who said, "Shetut - acquisition, and returning overcharge" - we only said this regarding movable objects, but regarding real estate, there is no overcharge for the land. And regarding real estate, we did not say this, except in the case of enhancement, but in the case of deterioration - no, as Rabah said: Anything that involves measurement, weight, or count, even if it is less than the value of the overcharge - yes, it is returned.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ אֶת הַבְּעֵירָה בְּיַד חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן – פָּטוּר מִדִּינֵי אָדָם, וְחַיָּיב בְּדִינֵי שָׁמַיִם. שִׁילַּח בְּיַד פִּיקֵּחַ – פִּיקֵּחַ חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And that which we learned one who sends a fire in the hands of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, is exempt according to human laws but liable according to the laws of Heaven. he sent in the hands of competent person, the competent person is liable.
llm_translation: And this that we learned: One who sends a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor with a burning coal - he is exempt from human judgment, but liable to heavenly judgment. If he sent with a discerning person - the discerning person is liable.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאֵין שָׁלִיחַ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה. דְּאָמְרִינַן: דִּבְרֵי הָרַב וְדִבְרֵי תַּלְמִיד – דִּבְרֵי מִי שׁוֹמְעִים?
human_translation: But why Let us say a person’s agent is like himself. There is different, as there is no agency for transgression, as we say: the words of the Master, and the words of student, whose words listened to?
llm_translation: And why? Say: The messenger of a person is like himself! This is different there because there is no messenger for a transgression. As we say: The words of the master and the words of the disciple - whose words are listened to?

hebrew_text: וְהָדְתַנְיָא: שָׁלִיחַ שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – שָׁלִיחַ מָעַל, עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל. כִּי עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת – בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מִיהָא מָעַל. אַמַּאי? נֵימָא: אֵין שָׁלִיחַ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה!
human_translation: And that which is taught an agent who did not perform his agency agent has misused performed his agency, the owner has misused when performed the agency of the owner, the owner in any event misused Why? Let us say there is no agency for transgression.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: A messenger who did not fulfill his mission - the sender is responsible. If he fulfilled his mission - the homeowner is responsible. When he fulfilled his mission on behalf of the homeowner - the homeowner is responsible. Why? Say: There is no messenger for a sinful matter!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מְעִילָה, דְּיָלְפָא ״חֵטְא״ ״חֵטְא״ מִתְּרוּמָה: מָה תְּרוּמָה מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ – אַף מְעִילָה מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: misuse is different, as is derived “sin” “sin” from teruma , Just as teruma appoint an agent, so too misuse appoint an agent,
llm_translation: The differences of a cloak, that "sin" "sin" from terumah: Just as terumah is effective through an agent - so too a cloak is effective through an agent.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִינַּהּ! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי מְעִילָה וּשְׁלִיחוּת יָד שְׁנֵי כְּתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין. מְעִילָה – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. שְׁלִיחוּת יָד מַאי הִיא?
human_translation: And let us derive from because misuse and misappropriation are two verses that come as one, And any two verses that come as one do not teach misuse is that which we said, what is misappropriation?
llm_translation: And we will differentiate it! Because it involves a cloak and a sending of the hand, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach. Cloak - this is what we said. What is a sending of the hand?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לְחַיֵּיב עַל הַמַּחְשָׁבָה כְּמַעֲשֶׂה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁלַח בּוֹ יָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא שָׁלַח יָדוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: as it is taught “For every matter of trespass” Beit Shammai say: to render liable for thought, like action. And Beit Hillel say: One is liable only if he misappropriates it, as is stated: “Whether he has not put his hand
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "For every transgression," Beit Shammai say: One is liable for intent as for the deed. And Beit Hillel say: One is not liable until he actually performs the act, as it is stated: "If he did not send forth his hand, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: וַהֲלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״! אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: וַהֲלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״אִם לֹא שָׁלַח יָדוֹ בִּמְלֶאכֶת רֵעֵהוּ״! אָמְרוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: אִם כֵּן, ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״ לְמָה לִי? שֶׁיָּכוֹל אֵין לִי אֶלָּא הוּא, אָמַר לְעַבְדּוֹ וְלִשְׁלוּחוֹ מִנַּיִן – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״.
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: But isn’t it stated: “For every matter of trespass,” Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: But isn’t it stated: “Whether he has not put his hand unto his neighbor’s goods”? Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: If so, why do I “For every matter of trespass”? as might I have only he from where told his slave or his agent The verse states: “For every matter of trespass,”
llm_translation: The House of Shammai said to the House of Hillel: "But isn't it stated, 'For every matter of trespass'!" The House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: "But isn't it stated, 'If he did not send his hand in his neighbor's work'!" The House of Shammai said to the House of Hillel: If so, why do I need 'For every matter of trespass'? So that he can be able, I have nothing else but that. He said to his servant and his messenger: From where - it is a teaching to say, 'For every matter of trespass'.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְבֵית הִלֵּל. אֶלָּא לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, דְּמוֹקְמִי לֵיהּ לְהַאי קְרָא בְּמַחְשָׁבָה כְּמַעֲשֶׂה,
human_translation: This works out well to Beit Hillel. But to Beit Shammai, who establish this verse for thought like action
llm_translation: He left it for Beit Hillel. Rather, for Beit Shammai, as he established for him this verse in thought as in deed,

hebrew_text: נֵילַף מִינֵּיהּ! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה מְעִילָה טְבִיחָה וּמְכִירָה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין. מְעִילָה – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן, טְבִיחָה וּמְכִירָה מַאי הִיא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּטְבָחוֹ אוֹ מְכָרוֹ״ – מָה מְכִירָה עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר, אַף טְבִיחָה עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר.
human_translation: let us derive because misuse and slaughter or sale are two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach misuse that which we said, what is slaughter or sale? The verse states: “And he slaughters it or sells it” Just as a sale by means of another, so too slaughter by means of another,
llm_translation: Divide from it! Because it is a cloak that is slaughtered and sold, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach. Slaughter - what is the meaning of "slaughter and sell"? The verse says: "And slaughter or sell" - just as selling is done by another, so too slaughter is done by another.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״אוֹ״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשָּׁלִיחַ. דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה תָּנָא: ״תַּחַת״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשָּׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “or” to include an agent. The school of Ḥizkiyya taught: “for” to include an agent.
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "Or" - to include the agent. The school of Chizkiyah taught: "Under" - to include the agent.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְלַמְּדִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בִּשְׁחוּטֵי חוּץ, ״דָּם יֵחָשֵׁב לָאִישׁ הַהוּא דָּם שָׁפָךְ״ – הוּא וְלֹא שְׁלוּחוֹ.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said two verses that come as one do not teach but according to the one who said teach what can be said? The Merciful One reveals in slaughtered outside “It shall be considered blood for that [ hahu ] man; he has spilled blood” he but not his agent.
llm_translation: The one who says that two Scriptures that come together do not teach, what is there to say? "Reveal, O Merciful One, in the slaughter outside, 'the blood shall be attributed to that man who shed the blood'" - it is he and not his emissary.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן גַּבֵּי שְׁחוּטֵי חוּץ, בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה מְנָלַן? דְּיָלֵיף מִשְּׁחוּטֵי חוּץ.
human_translation: We found with regard to slaughtered outside. From where do we to the entire Torah? derived from slaughtered outside,
llm_translation: I have found regarding those who slaughter outside the Temple, where in the entire Torah is it derived from? It is derived from "outside" Exodus 29:14.

hebrew_text: אַדְּיָלֵיף מִשְּׁחוּטֵי חוּץ, נֵילַיף מֵהָנָךְ! הֲדַר כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְנִכְרַת הָאִישׁ הַהוּא״ – אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְגוּפוֹ, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: before deriving from slaughtered outside, let us derive from these The Merciful One again writes “And that [ hahu ] man shall be cut off If is not needed for matter itself, apply it to the matter of the entire Torah,
llm_translation: Adyaleif from outside slaughter, neileif from here! Hadar wrote the Merciful One: "And that man shall be cut off" - if it is not relevant to his body, make it relevant to the entire Torah.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִים, הָנֵי ״הָהוּא״ ״הָהוּא״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בְּהוּ? חַד, לְמַעוֹטֵי שְׁנַיִם שֶׁאוֹחֲזִים בְּסַכִּין וְשׁוֹחֲטִים, וְחַד, ״הוּא״ – וְלֹא אָנוּס, ״הוּא״ – וְלֹא שׁוֹגֵג, ״הוּא״ – וְלֹא מוּטְעֶה.
human_translation: And according to the one who says two verses that come as one do not teach what does he interpret those “That “That One to exclude two who hold a knife and slaughter And one “That but not one compelled “that but not unwittingly; “that and not was mistaken,
llm_translation: And according to the one who says that two Scriptures that come together do not teach, what does he expound in them? One, to exclude two who hold a knife and slaughter, and one, "he" - not coerced, "he" - not unwitting, "he" - not misled.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ? מֵ״הוּא״ ״הָהוּא״. וְאִידָּךְ? ״הוּא״ ״הַהוּא״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And the other from “ hu ” “ hahu .” And the other does not interpret “ hu ” “ hahu .”
llm_translation: And the other one? "He." And the other one? "He" is not expounded.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּתָנֵי: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״צֵא הֲרוֹג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ״, הוּא – חַיָּיב, וְשׁוֹלְחָיו – פָּטוּר. שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם חַגַּי הַנָּבִיא: שׁוֹלְחָיו חַיָּיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֹתוֹ הָרַגְתָּ בְּחֶרֶב בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן״.
human_translation: But that which is taught One who says to his agent: Go kill a person, he, is liable and the one who appointed him is exempt. Shammai the Elder says in the name of Haggai the prophet: The one who appointed him is liable, as it stated “Him you have slain with the sword of the children of Ammon”
llm_translation: The one who teaches: One who says to his emissary, "Go, kill the soul," he - is liable, and his emissary - is exempt. Shammai the Elder says in the name of Hagai the Prophet: His emissary is liable, as it is stated: "You have killed him with the sword of the children of Ammon."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּשַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן? קָסָבַר: שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד מְלַמְּדִין, וְ״הוּא״ ״הַהוּא״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם דָּרֵישׁ, וּמַאי חַיָּיב – חַיָּיב בְּדִינֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: What is the reason of Shammai the Elder? He holds two verses that come as one do teach And does not interpret “ hu ” “ hahu .” And if you wish, say Actually interpret And what liable? liable according to the laws of Heaven,
llm_translation: What is the reason of Shammai the Elder? He holds: Two Scriptures that come as one teach, and "hu" and "hahu" are not expounded. And if you wish, say: Indeed they are expounded, and what is the liability? Liability in the laws of Heaven.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִדִּינֵי שָׁמַיִם נָמֵי פָּטוּר?! אֶלָּא: דִּינָא רַבָּה וְדִינָא זוּטָא אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: By inference, that the first tanna holds he is exempt even according to the laws of Heaven? Rather, the between them a great judgment and a small judgment.
llm_translation: From the principle that the first Tanna holds: Even from the laws of Heaven one is exempt?! Rather, there is a great law and a minor law, and there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא: ״אֹתוֹ הָרַגְתָּ בְּחֶרֶב בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say there, is different, since the Merciful One reveals: “Him you have slain with the sword of the children of Ammon,”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: It is different there, for the Merciful One has declared: "You have killed him with the sword of the children of Ammon."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הֲרֵי לְךָ כְּחֶרֶב בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן, מָה חֶרֶב בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן – אֵין אַתָּה נֶעֱנָשׁ עָלָיו, אַף אוּרִיָּה הַחִתִּי – אִי אַתָּה נֶעֱנָשׁ עָלָיו. מַאי טַעְמָא – מוֹרֵד בַּמַּלְכוּת הֲוָה, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״וַאדֹנִי יוֹאָב וְעַבְדֵי אֲדֹנִי עַל פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה חֹנִים״.
human_translation: And the other Behold for you like the sword of Ammon. Just as you are not punished the sword of Ammon so too you are not punished for Uriah the Hittite, What is the reason was a rebel against the monarchy as he said to “And my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open field”
llm_translation: And the other opinion: "Here is for you as a sword of the Ammonites," what is the sword of the Ammonites - you are not punished for it, also Uriah the Hittite - you are not punished for it. What is the reason? - He was rebelling against the kingdom, as it says to him: "And my lord Joab and the servants of my lord are encamped in the open field."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר סָבַר שַׁמַּאי שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד מְלַמְּדִין, וְ״הוּא״ ״הַהוּא״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ, מוֹדֶה בְּאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ ״צֵא בְּעוֹל אֶת הָעֶרְוָה״ וֶ״אֱכוֹל אֶת הַחֵלֶב״ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, וְשׁוֹלְחָיו פָּטוּר. שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ זֶה נֶהֱנֶה וְזֶה מִתְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: Rava said: If you say Shammai holds two verses that come as one do teach and he does not interpret “ hu ” “ hahu ,” concedes with regard to one who says to his agent: Go and engage in sexual intercourse with a forbidden relative, and eat fat, that is liable and the one who appointed him is exempt, as we have not found in the entire Torah this benefits but that becomes liable.
llm_translation: Rava said: If you might say that Shammai holds that two Scriptures that come as one teach, and "he" does not expound, he agrees by saying to send him out "Go with a naked one" and "eat the fat" which is obligatory, and his messengers are exempt. For we did not find in the entire Torah this one benefits and this one is liable.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר: שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד. דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי: אֵין שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הֱוֵי לִי עֵד״ – אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה קִידֵּשׁ אִשָּׁה בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם וְלָא אָמַר לָהֶם: ״אַתֶּם עֵדַיי״ – הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי?
human_translation: It was stated Rav says: An agent can become a witness. In the school of Rabbi Sheila they say: An agent cannot become a witness. What is the reason of the school of Rabbi Sheila? If we say because did not say to Be a witness for me, if that is so, betrothed a woman in the presence of two and did not say to them: You are my witnesses, so too that it is not a betrothal?
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said, "A messenger can serve as a witness." The house of Rabbi Sheila said, "A messenger cannot serve as a witness." What is the reason for the house of Rabbi Sheila? If you say it is because he did not say to him, "Be my witness," but rather sanctified a woman in the presence of two without saying to them, "You are my witnesses," is it not the case that the sanctifications were not valid?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַב אָמַר: שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד – אַלּוֹמֵי קָא מְאַלֵּימְנָא לְמִילְּתֵיהּ. דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי: אֵין שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד – כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: ״שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ״ – הָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּגוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav says: An agent can become a witness, we strengthen his words In the school of Rabbi Sheila they say: An agent cannot become a witness. Since the Master said a person’s agent is like himself, is considered like himself.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav said: "A messenger can be made into a witness" - these are the words we are accustomed to say regarding his matter. The house of Rabbi Sheila said: "A messenger cannot be made into a witness" - since the Master said: "A person's messenger is like himself" - he is considered like his own self.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אָמַר לִשְׁלֹשָׁה ״צְאוּ וְקַדְּשׁוּ לִי הָאִשָּׁה״ – אֶחָד שָׁלִיחַ וּשְׁנַיִם עֵדִים, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כּוּלָּם שְׁלוּחִין הֵן, וְאֵין שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אֲבָל בִּשְׁנַיִם – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לָא!
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection said to three Go out and betroth the woman for me, one agent and two witnesses; the statement of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel say: They are all agents, and an agent cannot become a witness disagree only with regard to three But with regard to two all agree not
llm_translation: Challenger: He said to three, "Go and sanctify for me the woman" - one is a messenger and two are witnesses, the words of Beit Shammai. And Beit Hillel says: all of them are messengers, and a messenger cannot be made a witness. Until here they only disagree in three, but in two - the words of everyone is no!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלִיחַ וְעֵד אֶחָד. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלִיחַ וּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים. וְרַב כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?! אֵיפוֹךְ. וְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מַתְנִי אִיפְּכָא: רַב אָמַר: אֵין שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד, דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי: שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד. וְהִילְכְתָא: שָׁלִיחַ נַעֲשֶׂה עֵד.
human_translation: he, who said in accordance with that tanna , As it is taught Rabbi Natan says: Beit Shammai say the agent and one witness and Beit Hillel say: The agent and two witnesses And Rav in accordance with Beit Shammai? Reverse And Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, taught opposite Rav says: An agent cannot become a witness, in the school of Rabbi Sheila they say: An agent can become a witness. And the halakha an agent can become a witness.
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, Beit Shammai say: one messenger and one witness. And Beit Hillel say: one messenger and two witnesses. And Rav is like Beit Shammai?! Turn it around. And Rav Acha, son of Rava, taught the reversal: Rav said: a messenger cannot be made a witness, as the house of Rabbi Sheila said: a messenger can be made a witness. And the conclusion is: a messenger can be made a witness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״צְאוּ וְקַדְּשׁוּ לִי אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״ – הֵן הֵן שְׁלוּחָיו, הֵן הֵן עֵדָיו. וְכֵן בְּגֵירוּשִׁין,
human_translation: Rava says Rav Naḥman says: said to two Go and betroth the woman for me, the very same his agents are his witnesses. And a similar with regard to divorce:
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: He said to two: "Go and sanctify for me the woman" - they are his messengers, they are his witnesses. And so too in divorces.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: And a similar with regard to monetary law.
llm_translation: And so in matters of monetary law.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּקִידּוּשִׁין – מִשּׁוּם דִּלְמֵיסְרַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֲבָל גֵּירוּשִׁין – נֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא עֵינָיו נָתַן בָּהּ.
human_translation: And necessary as had he taught us only in betrothal because are coming to render her forbidden But divorce, we should be concerned perhaps cast his eyes upon her
llm_translation: And it is necessary that if we hear in betrothals - because perhaps he will divorce her, but in divorces - there is a concern that maybe he has set his eyes on her.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גֵּירוּשִׁין – מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתְּתָא לְבֵי תְרֵי לָא חַזְיָא, אֲבָל מָמוֹנָא – אֵימָא: הָנֵי מִיפְלָג פָּלְגִי. צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And had taught us divorce, because a woman is not fit for two But money, say these divide are necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear about divorces - because there are two houses that do not see eye to eye, but regarding money - say: those who divide divide. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר הַמַּלְוֶה חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים – הָנֵי נוֹגְעִים בְּעֵדוּת נִינְהוּ, דְּאִי אָמְרִי: ״לָא פְּרַעְנֵיהּ״ אָמַר לְהוּ: ״פְּרָעוּנִי״!
human_translation: What does hold? If he holds one who lends another in witnesses, must repay him in witnesses, these are affected by their testimony. As, if they say: We did not repay him say to them: Pay me
llm_translation: What does he hold? If he holds that one who lends to his fellow with witnesses must repay him with witnesses - these are the ones who touch upon the testimony, for if they were to say, "We did not repay," he would say to them, "Repay me!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים אֵין צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים, וּמִגּוֹ דְּיָכְלִי לְמֵימַר: ״אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ לְלֹוֶה״, יְכוֹלִין לְמֵימַר: ״פְּרַעְנֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה״.
human_translation: Rather, actually holds one who lends another in witnesses, does not need to repay him in witnesses. And since are able to say: We returned to the debtor, they can to say: We repaid the creditor,
llm_translation: Rather, forever he holds: one who lends to his fellow with witnesses does not need to repay him with witnesses, and from where can we say: "let him return to the lender," we can say: "let him repay to the lender."

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעַת הֶיסֵּת – מִשְׁתַּבְעִי הָנֵי עֵדִים דְּיָהֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ, וּמִשְׁתְּבַע מַלְוֶה דְּלָא שָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ, וּפָרַע לֵיהּ לֹוֶה לְמַלְוֶה.
human_translation: And now, when the Sages instituted an oath of inducement, these witnesses take an oath that they gave to him, and lender takes an oath that he did not take and the debtor pays the lender
llm_translation: And now, in the matter of the enactment of the Sages regarding an oath of collection – these witnesses are contradicted, that we gave to him, and the lender is contradicted that he did not take from him, and he pays to the lender.

hebrew_text: הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ. תְּנַן הָתָם: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה – הִיא וְאָבִיהָ מְקַבְּלִין אֶת גִּיטָּהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵין שְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם זוֹכוֹת כְּאֶחָד, אֶלָּא אָבִיהָ מְקַבֵּל אֶת גִּיטָּהּ. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין יְכוֹלָה לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת גִּיטָּהּ – אֵין יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְגָּרֵשׁ.
human_translation: a man can betroth his daughter We learned there a betrothed young woman, she and her father receive her bill of divorce. Rabbi Yehuda said: Two hands do not acquire as one. Rather, her father receives her bill of divorce And any who is unable to safeguard her bill of divorce, is unable to be divorced,
llm_translation: The man sanctifies his daughter. We learned there: A betrothed maiden - she and her father accept her divorce. Rabbi Yehuda said: Two hands are not like one, rather her father accepts her divorce. And anyone who cannot keep her divorce document - cannot get divorced.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כְּמַחְלוֹקֶת לְגֵירוּשִׁין, כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת לְקִידּוּשִׁין. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְגֵירוּשִׁין, אֲבָל לְקִידּוּשִׁין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָבִיהָ וְלֹא הִיא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Just as a dispute with regard to divorce, so too a dispute with regard to betrothal. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The dispute is with regard to divorce, but betrothal everyone agrees her father but not her.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Just as there is a dispute regarding divorces, so too there is a dispute regarding betrothals. And Rabbi Yochanan said: There is a dispute regarding divorces, but regarding betrothals - everyone agrees it is her father's words and not hers.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן? גֵּירוּשִׁין, דְּמַכְנֶסֶת עַצְמָהּ לִרְשׁוּת אָבִיהָ – בֵּין הִיא וּבֵין אָבִיהָ. קִידּוּשִׁין, דְּמַפְקַעַת עַצְמָהּ מֵרְשׁוּת אָבִיהָ – אָבִיהָ וְלֹא הִיא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yoḥanan, in accordance with of the Rabbis, divorce, when she brings herself into her father’s authority either she or her father betrothal, where she removes herself from her father’s authority, her father but not her.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: What is the reason for the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan against the sages? Regarding divorce, for she removes herself from her father's domain - both she and her father. Regarding betrothal, for she removes herself from her father's domain - her father and not she.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַאֲמָר, דְּמַפְקַעַת עַצְמָהּ מֵרְשׁוּת אָבִיהָ, וּתְנַן:
human_translation: But isn’t there levirate betrothal, removes herself from her father’s authority, and we learned
llm_translation: And behold the statement, that she removes herself from her father's domain, and we learned:

hebrew_text: קְטַנָּה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין – אֵין עוֹשִׂים בָּהּ מַאֲמָר אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת אָבִיהָ. וְהַנַּעֲרָה – בֵּין מִדַּעַת עַצְמָהּ בֵּין מִדַּעַת אָבִיהָ, (מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּקִידּוּשִׁין).
human_translation: a minor girl after betrothal, can perform levirate betrothal only with the consent of her father. And a young woman, either with her consent [ mida’at atzmah ] or with the consent of her father, unlike with regard to betrothal.
llm_translation: A young girl from the age of betrothal - they do not perform the betrothal with her except with the knowledge of her father. And a young woman - whether with her own knowledge or with the knowledge of her father, (which is not the case with marriage).

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן? קִידּוּשִׁין, דְּמִדַּעְתַּהּ – אָבִיהָ וְלָא הִיא. גֵּירוּשִׁין, דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ – בֵּין הִיא בֵּין אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, it was stated like this: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is reason of Rabbi Yoḥanan, in accordance with the Rabbis? betrothal, which with consent her father but not her, divorce, without her consent, either she or her father
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: What is the reason for the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan against the view of the Rabbis? Regarding betrothal, since she is aware - her father and not she. Regarding divorce, due to her husband's coercion - whether it is her father or not.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי מַאֲמָר, דְּמִדַּעְתַּהּ, וְקָתָנֵי: בֵּין הִיא וּבֵין אָבִיהָ! הָתָם בְּמַאֲמָר דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ, וְרַבִּי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: קָנָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: But isn’t levirate betrothal with her consent, and it teaches either she or her father There to levirate betrothal that is against her will, and it is Rabbi As it is taught performs levirate betrothal with his yevama without her consent, Rabbi says: acquires And the Rabbis say: He does not acquire
llm_translation: Behold the statement, that it is against her will, and it teaches: whether she is willing or not! There, in the case of a statement made under duress, and she is a Rabbi. As it was taught: one who makes a statement with his yevamah without her consent, Rabbi says: he has acquired her, and the Sages say: he has not acquired her.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי? גָּמַר מִבִּיאָה דִיבָמָה, מָה בִּיאָה דִיבָמָה בְּעַל כֻּרְחַהּ – אַף הָכָא נָמֵי בְּעַל כֻּרְחַהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יָלְפִינַן מִקִּידּוּשִׁין, מָה קִידּוּשִׁין דְּמִדַּעְתַּהּ – אַף הָכָא נָמֵי דְּמִדַּעְתַּהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi He derives from sexual intercourse that a yevama : Just as intercourse with yevama against her will, so too here, against her will. And the Rabbis hold we derive from betrothal: Just as betrothal with her consent, so too here, with her consent.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi? He learned from the case of yibum, just as in the case of yibum the levir has full intention - so too here, the levir has full intention. And the Rabbis hold: We derive from betrothals, just as in the case of betrothals it is with her knowledge - so too here, it is with her knowledge.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי סָבַר: מִילֵּי דִיבָמָה מִיבָמָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: קִידּוּשִׁין מִקִּידּוּשִׁין הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi holds one should derive matters a yevama from a yevama , And the Rabbis hold one should derive betrothal from betrothal,
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rabbi holds: Matters of levirate marriage were for the purpose of levirate marriage. And the Rabbis hold: Matters of betrothal were for the purpose of betrothal.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּדְקָא מְתָרֵץ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּקִידּוּשִׁין״. אֶלָּא נֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין שְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם זוֹכוֹת כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as Rabbi Yoḥanan explains, from that it teaches latter clause a young woman, unlike with regard to betrothal. Then shall we say this should be a conclusive refutation of Reish Lakish, Reish Lakish said to you: whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: Two hands do not acquire as one.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: as it was explained by Rabbi Yohanan, from the end of the Mishnah: "That which is not so in betrothals." Rather, should we say that this is the reasoning of Reish Lakish? Reish Lakish said to you: This is the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah, who said: "Two hands are not equal to one."

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּקִידּוּשִׁין?! מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּגֵירוּשִׁין מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא מַאֲמָר דְּדָמֵי לְקִידּוּשִׁין, תְּנָא נָמֵי: מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּקִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: If Rabbi Yehuda, Unlike with regard to betrothal? It should Unlike with regard to divorce, Yes, it is indeed so, since it taught levirate betrothal, which similar to betrothal, it also taught: Unlike with regard to betrothal.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: What is not so in Kiddushin?! What is not so in Geirushin, he requires it! It is not so, for it is taught in a Baraita that is similar to Kiddushin, it is taught: What is not so in Kiddushin.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַאי שְׁנָא מַאֲמָר? הוֹאִיל וּזְקוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן נָמֵי לָא תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ מֵעִיקָּרָא: שָׁאנֵי מַאֲמָר, הוֹאִיל וּזְקוּקָה וְעוֹמֶדֶת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, what is levirate betrothal different from Since she is bonded and standing Now that you have arrived at this Rabbi Yoḥanan also should not pose a difficulty for you from the outset. Levirate betrothal is different, since is bonded and standing
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, what is different about this statement? Since it is necessary and standing. Now that you have come to this, Rabbi Yochanan also will not be difficult for you from the outset: the statement is different, since it is necessary and standing.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֶׁהִיא נַעֲרָה, בּוֹ וּבִשְׁלוּחוֹ. בּוֹ וּבִשְׁלוּחוֹ – אִין, בָּהּ וּבִשְׁלוּחָהּ – לָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ! אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָא נָמֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא.
human_translation: We learned a man can betroth his daughter when she is a young woman, by himself or by his agent. Yes, by himself or by his agent, but no, by herself or by her agent. a conclusive refutation of Reish Lakish, Reish Lakish said to you: This too is Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: A man betroths his daughter when she is a na'arah, both with him and through his messenger. With him and through his messenger - no, with her and through her messenger - yes. This is the teaching of Reish Lakish! Reish Lakish said to you: Indeed, it is the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? וְהָקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בִּתְמָרָה זוֹ״, ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בָּזוֹ״ וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאן תַּנָּא ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי״ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי״?
human_translation: But can you establish this in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? But the last clause, teaches: one who says to a woman: Be betrothed to me with this date Be betrothed to me with that And we say: Who taught Become betrothed Become betrothed,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who established for her like Rabbi Yehuda? And it was taught in the latter clause: One who says to a woman, "Be consecrated to me with this date palm," "Be consecrated to me with this olive tree," and we say: Who is the Tanna who said "Be consecrated," "Be consecrated"?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר שְׁבוּעָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד!
human_translation: And Rabba said: It is Rabbi Shimon, who says unless one states an oath to each and every one
llm_translation: And Rabba said: Rabbi Shimon is the one who said: Until it is said, "A week for each and every one!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּבִפְרָטֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּמִי סָבַר לַהּ?
human_translation: And if you would say entire Rabbi Yehuda, and with regard to the specification he holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, But does he hold in accordance
llm_translation: And if you say, the whole matter is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and in specific cases he holds like Rabbi Shimon, who holds differently?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כָּלַל – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, פָּרַט – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁבוּעָה לֹא לָךְ, לֹא לָךְ, לֹא לָךְ״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא לָךְ, לֹא לָךְ, לֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ שְׁבוּעָה״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר שְׁבוּעָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught This is the principle included he is liable only one specified he is liable for each and every one; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: an oath nor yours, nor yours, nor yours, he is liable for each and every one. Rabbi Eliezer says: not yours, nor yours, nor yours, and nor yours, an oath, he is liable for each and every one. Rabbi Shimon says: He is liable only if states an oath for each and every one.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: This is the principle: "Klal" - it is only liable for one, "Prat" - liable for each and every one, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: "An oath, not for you, not for you, not for you" - liable for each and every one. Rabbi Eliezer says: "Not for you, not for you, not for you, and not for you, an oath" - liable for each and every one. Rabbi Shimon says: One is never liable until he says an oath for each and every individual.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, וּבִשְׁלִיחוּת סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rather, entire Rabbi Shimon, and with regard to agency he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rather: entirely Rabbi Shimon it is, and in the agency he holds like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַסִּי לָא עָל לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמוּר הָאִידָּנָא בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף אֲנָא לָא עֲיַילִ[י], רַבִּי אָבִין הוּא דְּעָיֵיל וַאֲמַר: חַבְרוּתָא כּוּלַּהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. וּצְוַוח רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ כִּי כְרוּכְיָא: ״וְיָצְאָה. וְהָיְתָה״, וְלֵיכָּא דְּאַשְׁגַּח בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר סַמְכָא הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, כְּמִין יַמָּא לְטִיגְנֵי הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi did not go to the study hall. He found Rabbi Zeira said to him: What was said today in the study hall? said to him: I too did not go, Rabbi Avin is the one who went, and he said: The entire coterie with Rabbi Yoḥanan And Reish Lakish screamed like a crane: “And she departs and becomes But no one paid any attention to him. said to him: Rabbi Avin reliable? said to him: Yes, was like from the sea to a frying pan [ tignei ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi did not come to the study hall. He found Rabbi Zeira, and said to him: What is the saying of the people of the study hall now? He said to him: I also did not go, it is Rabbi Avin who went and said: The entire companionship is like Rabbi Yochanan. And Reish Lakish shouted like a lion: "And she went out and she was," and there is no one who pays attention to it. He said to him: Is Rabbi Avin the son of Samka? He said to him: No, he is like the sea for frying fish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֲנָא, לָא רַבִּי אָבִין בְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְלָא רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר כָּהֲנָא, אֶלָּא רַבִּי אָבִין סְתָם. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִירְמֵא דִּידֵיהּ אַדִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: I not Rabbi Avin, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, nor Rabbi Avin bar Kahana, but Rabbi Avin, without specification. What difference is there? to raise a contradiction between his his
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: I, not Rabbi Avin son of Rabbi Chiya, and not Rabbi Avin son of Kahana, rather Rabbi Avin the anonymous. What is the practical difference? To say his own words.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן:
human_translation: Rava asked Rav Naḥman:
llm_translation: Requested from him Rava from Rav Nachman:

hebrew_text: נַעֲרָה, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל גִּיטָּהּ מִיַּד בַּעְלָהּ? כְּיַד אָבִיהָ דָּמְיָא, אוֹ כַּחֲצַר אָבִיהָ דָּמְיָא? כְּיַד אָבִיהָ דָּמְיָא, מָה אֲבִיָּה מְשַׁוֵּי שָׁלִיחַ – אַף הִיא נָמֵי מְשַׁוְּיָא שָׁלִיחַ. אוֹ דִילְמָא כַּחֲצַר אָבִיהָ דָּמְיָא, וְעַד דְּמָטֵיא גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ לָא מִיגָּרְשָׁה.
human_translation: what is a young woman to appoint an agent to receive her bill of divorce from the hand of her husband? considered like her father’s hand, or considered like her father’s courtyard? considered like her father’s hand, just as her father can appoint an agent, so too she can appoint an agent. Or perhaps considered like her father’s courtyard, and she is not divorced until the bill of divorce reaches her possession,
llm_translation: Maiden, what is the law if she appoints a messenger to receive her bill of divorce from her husband? Is it like the hand of her father, which is like her own hand, or is it like the courtyard of her father, which is like her own hand? If it is like the hand of her father, just as her father's hand is effective – so too, her messenger's hand is effective. Or perhaps it is like the courtyard of her father, and until the bill of divorce reaches her hand, she is not divorced.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא הָא? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: כָּתַב גֵּט וּנְתָנוֹ בְּיַד עַבְדָּהּ יָשֵׁן וּמְשַׁמַּרְתּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. נֵיעוֹר – אֵינוֹ גֵּט. נֵיעוֹר אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ גֵּט – דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ חָצֵר מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתָּהּ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כַּחֲצַר אָבִיהָ דָּמְיָא, כִּי מְטָא גִּיטַּהּ לִידַהּ נָמֵי לָא תִּיגָּרַשׁ, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ חָצֵר הַמִּשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ!
human_translation: And is Rava uncertain this But doesn’t Rava say: wrote a bill of divorce and placed it in the hand of slave, sleeping, but is guarding him, it is bill of divorce. awake, it is not bill of divorce. Why is it not bill of divorce awake? for her a courtyard that is not consciously secured by her, And if it enters your mind considered like her father’s courtyard, even when the bill of divorce reaches her possession she should not be divorced, since she is a courtyard that is not consciously secured by her father.
llm_translation: And who is in doubt about this to Rava? And Rava said: If one wrote a bill of divorce and gave it into the hand of his old maidservant and she guards it - this is a valid bill of divorce. If she is a youth - it is not a valid bill of divorce. Why is it not valid if she is a youth? Because her courtyard is guarded without her knowledge. And if your reasoning is like her father's courtyard, when her bill of divorce comes into her hand, she also will not be divorced, because her courtyard is guarded without her father's knowledge!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּכִי יַד אָבִיהָ דָּמְיָא, וְהָכִי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: מִי אַלִּימָא כְּיַד אָבִיהָ לְשַׁוּוֹיֵי אִיהִי שָׁלִיחַ, אוֹ לָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין עוֹשָׂה שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: Rather, it is actually obvious to that is considered like her father’s hand and this is what he was asking: Is as strong as her father’s hand, that she can appoint an agent, or not? said to him: She cannot appoint an agent.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, it is obvious to him that the hand of her father is like blood, and thus he asks her: Should we say that the hand of her father is comparable to the hand of a messenger, or not? He said to her: One cannot appoint a messenger.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: קְטַנָּה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ. הָא נַעֲרָה – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּשֶׁאֵין לַהּ אָב.
human_translation: raised an objection to him a minor girl who said Receive my bill of divorce for me, it is not valid bill of divorce until the bill of divorce reaches her possession, But a young woman, it is a bill of divorce, With what are we dealing here? where she does not have a father,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: A minor who said, "My get was accepted" - it is not a get until a get reaches her hand. Here, with what are we dealing? With a case where she has no father.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם אָמַר אָבִיהָ: ״צֵא וְקַבֵּל גֵּט לְבִתִּי״, אִם רָצָה בַּעַל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ – לֹא יַחְזוֹר. מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא בִּדְיֵשׁ לָהּ אָב עָסְקִינַן! חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: קְטַנָּה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״ – אֵינוֹ גֵּט, עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ. הָא נַעֲרָה – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – כְּשֶׁאֵין לָהּ אָב, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהּ אָב וְאָמַר אָבִיהָ: ״צֵא וְקַבֵּל לְבִתִּי גִּיטָּהּ״, וְרוֹצֶה בַּעַל לַחְזוֹר – לֹא יַחְזוֹר.
human_translation: But from that the latter teaches: If her father said Go out and receive a bill of divorce for my daughter, if the husband seeks to retract he cannot retract by inference, that the first we are dealing with where she has a father. is incomplete and this is what it is teaching: a minor girl who said: Receive my bill of divorce for me, it is not a bill of divorce until the bill of divorce reaches her possession. But a young woman, it is a bill of divorce In what is this statement said? when she does not have a father. But she has a father, and her father said Go out and receive my daughter’s bill of divorce on and the husband seeks to retract he cannot retract
llm_translation: Talmudic text: This is as it is taught in the latter clause: If her father said, "Go and receive a get for my daughter," if the husband wants to retract from it, he may not retract. From the inference of the former clause, we are dealing with a father who is engaged with her! This is a case of lacking and this is what is taught: A minor who said, "Accept my get," it is not a get until the get reaches her hand. This young girl - this is a get. In what case are these matters said? When she does not have a father, but if she has a father and her father said, "Go and receive a get for my daughter," and the husband wants to retract - he may not retract.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: קְטַנָּה שֶׁנִּתְקַדְּשָׁה שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: צְרִיכָה גֵּט, וּצְרִיכָה מֵיאוּן. אָמַר קַרְנָא: דְּבָרִים בְּגוֹ: אִם גֵּט, לָמָּה מֵיאוּן? אִם מֵיאוּן, לָמָּה גֵּט?
human_translation: It was stated a minor who became betrothed without her father’s consent. Shmuel says: she requires a bill of divorce and she requires refusal, Karna says: matters within If a bill of divorce, why refusal? if refusal, why a bill of divorce?
llm_translation: It was stated: A minor who was consecrated without the knowledge of her father, Samuel said: She requires a bill of divorce, and she requires a fine. Karnah said: This matter is in doubt: If she requires a bill of divorce, why does she require a fine? If she requires a fine, why does she require a bill of divorce?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הָא מָר עוּקְבָא וּבֵי דִינֵיהּ בְּכַפְרִי. אַפְכוּהָ, שַׁדְּרוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָאֱלֹהִים! צְרִיכָה גֵּט, וּצְרִיכָה מֵיאוּן. וְחַס לֵיהּ לְזַרְעֵיהּ דְּאַבָּא בַּר אַבָּא, דְּנֵימָא הָכִי.
human_translation: said to him: Now Mar Ukva and his court are in Kafrei, they reversed sent before Rav. said to By God! She requires a bill of divorce and she requires refusal. And forbid that the seed of Abba bar Abba, say such
llm_translation: They said to him: "This master, Uqva, and his court are in Kapri. Turn her away, send her before Rav." He said to them: "By God! She needs a bill of divorce, and she needs support. And may there be mercy for the descendants of Abba bar Abba, as it is said thus."

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: צְרִיכָה גֵּט – שֶׁמָּא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, צְרִיכָה מֵיאוּן – שֶׁמָּא לֹא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, וְיֹאמְרוּ אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: She requires a bill of divorce perhaps the father desired the betrothal, She requires refusal perhaps the father did not desire the betrothal, and will say betrothal does not take effect with her sister.
llm_translation: The reason what? Said Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika: It requires a get - lest the father consented to the betrothal, it requires refusal - lest the father did not consent to the betrothal, and they will say that betrothals do not take effect with her sister.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְהוּא שֶׁשִּׁדְּכוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: And this when they arranged
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "And he who was crushed."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵיאוּן אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה. אַף עַל גַּב דְּשִׁידְּכוּ? מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי הָא, לָא מַתְנֵי הָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אָמַר עוּלָּא: קְטַנָּה שֶׁנִּתְקַדְּשָׁה שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ – אֲפִילּוּ מֵיאוּן אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה.
human_translation: Ulla said: she does not even require refusal. even though they arranged He who teaches this does not teach that. There are who say Ulla says: a minor became betrothed without her father’s consent, she does not even require refusal,
llm_translation: Ulla said: Even if she is a minor, she does not require consent. Even though they married her off? The one who taught this did not teach that. There are those who say Ulla said: A minor who was consecrated without her father's knowledge - even if she is a minor, she does not require consent.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: וְכוּלָּן, אִם מֵתוּ, אוֹ מֵיאֲנוּ, אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ, אוֹ שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ אַיְילוֹנִיּוֹת – צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Kahana raises an objection: And if, any of had died, or had performed refusal; or had been divorced; or had been found a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ], her rival wives are permitted
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Kahana asked: And all of them, if they died, or refused, or were divorced, or were found to be barren - their bonds are permitted.

hebrew_text: דְּקַדְּשַׁהּ מַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּקַדְּשַׁהּ אָבִיהָ, בְּמֵיאוּן סַגִּי לַהּ?! גֵּט מְעַלְּיָא בָּעֲיָא! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּקַדִּשָׁה אִיהִי נַפְשַׁהּ, וְקָתָנֵי דְּבָעֲיָא מֵיאוּן!
human_translation: When she was betrothed by whom? If we say her father betrothed her refusal enough for her require a proper bill of divorce? Rather, is it not where she betrothed herself and teaches that she requires refusal.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Who sanctified her? If you say her father sanctified her, is it enough with his consent?! A get requires an additional act! Rather, it is not that her father sanctified her, but rather she sanctified herself, and the Mishnah teaches that she requires consent!"

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה לָהּ מַעֲשֵׂה יְתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב.
human_translation: raised the objection and he resolved it: where she became an orphan in her father’s lifetime,
llm_translation: He is presenting to her and he is explaining to her: for example, if an act of orphanhood was done to her in the lifetime of the father.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין מוֹכְרָהּ לִקְרוֹבִים. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ: מוֹכְרָהּ לִקְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raises an objection: cannot sell to relatives said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: sell her to relatives,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Hamnuna asked: One does not sell it to relatives. In the name of Rabbi Elazar they said: One sells it to relatives.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁמּוֹכְרָהּ אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. הַאי אַלְמָנָה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקַדְּשַׁהּ אָבִיהָ, מִי מָצֵי מְזַבֵּין לַהּ? הָא אֵין אָדָם מוֹכֵר אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְשִׁפְחוּת אַחַר אִישׁוּת! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּקַדִּישׁ אִיהִי נַפְשַׁהּ וְקָא קָרֵי לַהּ אַלְמָנָה!
human_translation: And they agree that he can sell her to a High Priest a widow, to a common priest a divorcée or a yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ]. What are the circumstances of this widow If we say her father betrothed her is he able to sell her A person cannot sell his daughter into servitude after betrothed Rather, isn’t when she betrothed herself and calls her a widow,
llm_translation: And similar is the case if she sold herself to a High Priest, she is divorced and redeemed to an ordinary priest. How so is the case of this widow different? If you say that her father betrothed her, who can offer sacrifices for her? But does a man sell his daughter into servitude after she is married! Rather, if she did not sanctify herself, she is considered a widow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי יִעוּד. וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: מָעוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת לָאו לְקִידּוּשִׁין נִיתְּנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Amram said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Here from a betrothal of designation, And in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, who says: The original money was not given for betrothal.
llm_translation: Rav Amram said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: Here we are dealing with the sanctification of designated funds. And according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: The initial funds were not designated for sanctifications.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: מֵת וְנָפְלָה לִפְנֵי אָחִיו לְיִבּוּם, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מְמָאֶנֶת לְמַאֲמָרוֹ, וְאֵינָהּ מְמָאֶנֶת לְזִיקָּתוֹ. כֵּיצַד? עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר – צְרִיכָה גֵּט, וּצְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה, וּצְרִיכָה מֵיאוּן.
human_translation: It was stated: died, and she happened before his brothers for levirate marriage, Rav Huna says Rav says: performs refusal for his levirate betrothal, but she perform refusal for his bond How so? he performed levirate betrothal with her, she requires a bill of divorce, and she requires ḥalitza , and she requires refusal.
llm_translation: It was stated: If a man dies childless and his widow falls to his brother for levirate marriage, Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: She refuses his statement, but she does not refuse his cohabitation. How so? If he made a statement regarding her - she requires a bill of divorce, and she requires halitzah, and she requires chalitzah.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָה גֵּט – שֶׁמָּא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי שֵׁנִי. צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה – שֶׁמָּא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי רִאשׁוֹן. צְרִיכָה מֵיאוּן – שֶׁמָּא לֹא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב לֹא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי שֵׁנִי, וְיֹאמְרוּ אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: She requires a bill of divorce, perhaps the father desired the betrothal of the second requires ḥalitza , perhaps the father desired the betrothal of the first She requires refusal, perhaps the father did not desire either the betrothal of the first or the betrothal of the second and will say betrothal does not take effect with her sister,
llm_translation: A get is required - lest the father consented to the betrothal of the second. A halitzah is required - lest the father consented to the betrothal of the first. A refusal is required - lest the father did not consent to either the betrothal of the first or the betrothal of the second, and they would say that the betrothals do not take effect on her sister.

hebrew_text: לֹא עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר – אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה אֶלָּא חֲלִיצָה בִּלְבַד. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ: תִּיבְּעֵי נָמֵי מֵיאוּן, שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ? הַכֹּל יוֹדְעִים: אֲחוֹת חֲלוּצָה דְּרַבָּנַן. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי אֲחוֹת גְּרוּשָׁה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲחוֹת חֲלוּצָה מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: he did not perform levirate betrothal with her, she requires only ḥalitza . If you say she should require refusal as well, lest say betrothal does not take effect with her sister, Everyone knows a sister of ḥalutza by rabbinic law as Reish Lakish said Here Rabbi taught a sister of divorcée by Torah law, a sister of ḥalutza by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: He did not make a statement about it - it only requires ḥalitzah. What do you say: Let them ask from Me'un, lest they say that betrothals take effect with her sister? Everyone knows: the sister of a ḥalutzah is according to the Rabbis. As Reish Lakish said: Here Rabbi changed the status of a divorced sister from Torah law, the status of a ḥalutzah from the words of the Sages.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בֵּי תְרֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָא שָׁתוּ חַמְרָא תּוּתֵי צִיפֵּי בְּבָבֶל. שְׁקַל חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ כָּסָא דְחַמְרָא, יְהַב לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר: מִיקַּדְּשָׁא לִי בְּרַתָּיךְ לִבְרִי. אֲמַר רָבִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב –
human_translation: these two that were drinking wine under poplar trees [ tzifei ] in Babylonia. One of them took a cup of wine gave it to his friend. He said: Betroth for me your daughter to my son Ravina says: Even according to the one who says we are concerned perhaps the father desired
llm_translation: Behold, there were two individuals who were drinking wine on the banks of the Euphrates in Babylon. One of them took a cup of wine, gave it to his friend, and said: "Sanctify yourself to me with this cup." Ravina said: Even according to the one who says we should be concerned that perhaps she consented, the father -

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא נִתְרַצָּה הַבֵּן לָא אָמְרִינַן. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבִינָא: וְדִילְמָא שָׁלִיחַ שַׁוְּיֵהּ? לָא חֲצִיף אִינִישׁ לְשַׁוּוֹיֵי לַאֲבוּהּ שָׁלִיחַ. וְדִילְמָא אַרְצוֹיֵי אַרְצְיַיהּ קַמֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר שִׁימִי: בְּפֵירוּשׁ אָמַר מָר דְּלָא סָבַר לְהָא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: we do not say perhaps the son desired The Sages said to Ravina: But perhaps appointed an agent A person is not brazen to appoint his father agent But perhaps made his desire to Rabba bar Shimi said to since the Master, explicitly said that he does not agree with this of Rav and Shmuel
llm_translation: Perhaps the son consented, did we not say? The Rabbis said to Ravina: But maybe a messenger was appointed for him? A person is not presumptuous to appoint a messenger for his father. And maybe his land is in front of him? Rabba bar Shimi said to him: The Master explicitly stated that he does not agree with what Rav and Shmuel said.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּכִישָׁא דְיַרְקָא בְּשׁוּקָא. אֲמַר רָבִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא נִתְרַצָּה הָאָב – הָנֵי מִילֵּי דֶּרֶךְ כָּבוֹד, אֲבָל דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן – לָא.
human_translation: a certain man who betrothed with a bundle of vegetables in the marketplace. Ravina says: Even according to the one who says we are concerned perhaps the father desired this matter applies in a dignified manner. But in a degrading manner, no
llm_translation: That man who sanctified a courtyard in the city of Yarka in the marketplace. Ravina said: Even according to the one who says we are concerned that the father may consent - those matters of honor, yes, but matters of disgrace, no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: בִּזָּיוֹן דְּמַאי? אִי בִּזָּיוֹן דְּיַרְקָא, אִי בִּזָּיוֹן דְּשׁוּקָא? נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּכַסְפָּא בְּשׁוּקָא, אוֹ בְּכִישָׁא דְיַרְקָא בְּבֵיתָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דֶּרֶךְ בִּזָּיוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: What degradation Was degradation that vegetables, was degradation in the marketplace? practical difference where one betrothed with money in the marketplace, or with a bundle of vegetables in a house. What said to him: this and that, is a degrading manner.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: With the disgrace of what? If with the disgrace of a marketplace, or with the disgrace of a street? It emerged from there that one sanctifies with silver in the marketplace, or with a jug of urine in the house, what is it? He said to him: Both this and that are a form of disgrace.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דְּאָמַר לְקָרִיבַאי, וְהִיא אָמְרָה לְקָרִיבַהּ. כְּפַתֵּיהּ עַד דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״תֶּיהְוֵי לְקָרִיבַהּ״. אַדְּאָכְלִי וְשָׁתוּ אֲתָא קָרִיבֵיהּ בְּאִיגָּרָא וְקַדְּשַׁהּ.
human_translation: That said: to my relative, while she, said to her relative. forced him until he said to Let be to her, relative. While they were eating and drinking his relative came to the roof and betrothed her
llm_translation: That one who said to Karivai, and she said to Karivah. He persuaded her until he said to her: "Be for Karivah." After they ate and drank, intimacy came to them in the chamber and he sanctified her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּתִיב ״שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יַעֲשׂוּ עַוְלָה וְלֹא יְדַבְּרוּ כָזָב״. רָבָא אָמַר: חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם טוֹרֵחַ בִּסְעוּדָה וּמַפְסִידָהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: It is written: “The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies” Rava said a presumption that a person does not take the trouble of a meal and cause it to be lost.
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is written, "The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies." Rava said: It is a strong presumption that a person does not bother with a meal and lose it.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּלָא טְרַח.
human_translation: What between The between them where he did not take the trouble
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them that he did not exert effort.

hebrew_text: נִתְקַדְּשָׁה לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ, וְהָלַךְ אָבִיהָ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְעָמְדָה וְנִישֵּׂאת, אָמַר רַב: אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אָבִיהָ וִימַחֶה. רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, שֶׁמָּא יָבוֹא אָבִיהָ וִימַחֶה, וְנִמְצֵאת זָרָה אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה לְמַפְרֵעַ. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וְחַשׁ לַהּ רַב לְהָא דְּרַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: became betrothed with her father’s consent, and her father left for overseas, and she went ahead and got married Rav says: she may partake of teruma until her father comes and protests, Rav Asi said: She may not partake Perhaps her father will come and protest, and it will be found retroactively that a non-priest has partaken of teruma . There was an incident and Rav was concerned of Rav Asi
llm_translation: The daughter was betrothed to her father's knowledge, and her father went to the province of the sea and stood and married her. Rav said: She may eat terumah until her father comes and annuls it. Rav Assi said: She may not eat, lest her father come and annul it, and she will be found to have eaten terumah intentionally. There was a case, and Rav was concerned for her like Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: וּמוֹדֶה רַב שֶׁאִם מֵתָה – אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ. אוֹקִי מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: And Rav concedes that if dies, does not inherit her, Establish money in the possession of its owner.
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel, son of Rav Yitzchak: And Rav concedes that if she dies - he does not inherit her. He collects the money with the presumption of her master.

hebrew_text: נִתְקַדְּשָׁה לְדַעַת וְנִיסֵּת שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת, וְאָבִיהָ כָּאן, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: became betrothed with consent, and she married without consent, and her father is here, Rav Huna said: She may not partake Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: She may partake
llm_translation: It has consecrated to knowledge and it was tested not to knowledge, and her father here, Rav Huna said: She does not eat. Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba said: She eats.
