hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַב, דְּאָמַר אוֹכֶלֶת – הָתָם הוּא דְּלָא אִיתֵיהּ לְאָב, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְאָב, הַאי דְּאִישְׁתִּיק – מִירְתָּח רָתַח. רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת. וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַב אַסִּי דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, הָתָם הוּא דְּשֶׁמָּא יָבוֹא אָבִיהָ וִימַחֶה, אֲבָל הָכָא מִדִּשְׁתֵיק – אִיתְנוֹחֵי אִיתְנְחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said she may not partake and even according to Rav, who said she may partake there, where the father is not present. But here, where the father is present, that he was silent this so angry Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: She may partake and even according to Rav Asi, who said she may not partake there that perhaps her father will come and protest. But here, from that he was silent he is comfortable
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It does not consume. And even according to Rav, who said it consumes – there, it is because it is not in the possession of the father, but here, since it is in the possession of the father, this one who remains silent – he boils with anger. Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: It consumes. And even according to Rav Assi who said it does not consume, there, it is because perhaps her father will come and annul it, but here, since he remains silent – it is fitting and proper for him.

hebrew_text: נִתְקַדְּשָׁה שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ, וְנִיסֵּת שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת, וְאָבִיהָ כָּאן, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת, רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. אָמַר עוּלָּא: הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא ״כַּחֹמֶץ לַשִּׁנַּיִם וְכֶעָשָׁן לָעֵינָיִם״. הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הָתָם דְּקִידּוּשֵׁי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אָמְרַתְּ לָא אָכְלָה, הָכָא לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: became betrothed without the consent of her father, and married without consent, and her father is here, Rav Huna said: She may partake Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: She may not partake Ulla said: This of Rav Huna, “as vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes” Now And what there, when betrothal by Torah law, you said she may not partake not all the more so here,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "She was betrothed without her father's knowledge, and she was married without her knowledge, and her father is here. Rav Huna said: She may eat, Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said: She may not eat. Ula said: This is like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes. Now, there regarding the betrothals of the Torah, you say she may not eat, so here, all the more so?!"

hebrew_text: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי תַלְמִיד. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב הוּנָא – הוֹאִיל וְנַעֲשָׂה בָּהּ מַעֲשֵׂה יְתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב.
human_translation: the statement of student seems Rava said: What is the reason of Rav Huna? Since an action was done with her an orphan in the lifetime of her father,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The words of a disciple are visible. Rava said: What is the reason for Rav Huna's statement - since it was done with regard to the case of an orphan during the lifetime of the father.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: קְטַנָּה שֶׁנִּתְקַדְּשָׁה שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ, אָמַר רַב: בֵּין הִיא וּבֵין אָבִיהָ יְכוֹלִין לְעַכֵּב. וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אָבִיהָ וְלֹא הִיא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַב אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ חִיָּיא בַּר רַב לְרַב אַסִּי: ״אִם מָאֵן יְמָאֵן אָבִיהָ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אָבִיהָ, הִיא עַצְמָהּ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם מָאֵן יְמָאֵן״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: It was stated a minor girl who became betrothed without her father’s consent, Rav says: Either she or her father is able to prevent And Rav Asi says: Her father but not she, Rav Huna raised an objection to Rav Asi, and some say Ḥiyya bar Rav to Rav Asi: “If her father refuses I have only her father from where she herself The verse states: “If he refuses [ ma’en yema’en ].” in any case.
llm_translation: It was stated: A minor who was consecrated without the knowledge of her father, Rav said: Both she and her father can annul it. And Rav Assi said: Her father and not she. Rav Huna raised an objection to Rav Assi, and they said to him: Chiya the son of Rav said to Rav Assi: "If her father refuses, I only have her father, where is she herself from?" The Talmud teaches: "If her father refuses" - in any case.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב: לָא תֵּיזְלוּ בָּתַר אִיפְּכָא. יָכֵול לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי לְכוּ: כְּגוֹן שֶׁפִּיתָּהּ שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת. פִּיתָּהּ שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת קְרָא בָּעֵי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לוֹמַר שֶׁמְּשַׁלֵּם קְנָס כִּמְפוּתָּה.
human_translation: Rav said to those Do not go after the opposite, can answer your where he seduced her not for the sake of marriage. a seduction not for the sake of marriage, a verse required Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: to say that pays the fine like a seduced woman.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav: Do not go after the last one. Can we change it for you: For example, if she cooked it without any intention. If she cooked it without any intention, does the verse require it? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: To say that he pays a penalty as if it were a fine.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דִּתְנֵינָא: ״מָהֹר יִמְהָרֶנָּה לּוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״ – שֶׁצְּרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ קִידּוּשִׁין. וְאִם פִּיתָּהּ לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת, קִידּוּשִׁין לְמָה לִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: צְרִיכָה קִידּוּשִׁין לְדַעַת אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to him: If so, this is what we learned “He shall pay a dowry for her to be his wife” that she requires betrothal from him. And if seduced her for the sake of marriage, why do I betrothal? Abaye said to him: she requires betrothal with her father’s consent,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef: If so, this is what we learned: "He shall hasten to marry her" - because she needs his betrothal. And if she intended for some form of marriage, why do I need betrothal? Abaye said to him: Betrothal is needed with her father's knowledge.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בִּתְמָרָה זוֹ״, ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בָּזוֹ״ אִם יֵשׁ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״בָּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ וּבָזוֹ״ אִם יֵשׁ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה בְּכוּלָּן – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. הָיְתָה אוֹכֶלֶת רִאשׁוֹנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: one who says to a woman: Be betrothed to me with this date, Be betrothed to me with that if one of is worth one peruta she is betrothed, but if not, she is not betrothed, with this and with this and with this if all of them are worth one peruta she is betrothed, but if not, she is not betrothed. she was eating one by one she is not betrothed unless one of them is worth one peruta .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says to a woman, "Be consecrated to me with this date palm," or "Be consecrated to me with this olive tree," if one of them is worth a perutah - she is consecrated, but if not - she is not consecrated. If he says, "With this and this and this," if one of them is worth a perutah in total - she is consecrated, but if not - she is not consecrated. If he was eating them one by one - she is not consecrated until one of them is worth a perutah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תְּנָא ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי״ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי״? אָמַר רַבָּה: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר שְׁבוּעָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Who taught Be betrothed to me, be betrothed to me, Rabba says: It is Rabbi Shimon, who said unless he will state an oath to each and every one.
llm_translation: Gemara: Who is the Tanna that said "hitkaddeshi" "hitkaddeshi"? Rabba said: It is Rabbi Shimon, as he said until each and every one says "shvuah" (an oath).

hebrew_text: ״בָּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ וּבָזוֹ״ אִם יֵשׁ בְּכוּלָּן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה כּוּ׳. אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרֵישָׁא, מַאי אִירְיָא אוֹכֶלֶת? אֲפִילּוּ מִנְחַת נָמֵי, דְּהָא ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בָּזוֹ״ קָאָמַר! אֶלָּא אַסֵּיפָא.
human_translation: With this and with this and with this if all of them are worth one peruta . To which If we say is referring to the first clause why specifically she ate Even she placed also as he said: Be betrothed to me with this Rather, to the latter clause,
llm_translation: "Despised, despised, despised" - if all of them are equal in value to a prutah. What is the case? If we say the first one, what is the matter of a female animal? Even a meal offering, for it says, "Consecrate to Me with this." Rather, the latter case.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּקַמַּיְיתָא? וְהָא מִלְוָה הִיא! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲרֵי שֻׁלְחָן, וַהֲרֵי בָּשָׂר, וַהֲרֵי סַכִּין, וְאֵין לָנוּ [פֶּה] לֶאֱכוֹל!
human_translation: And even the first But is a loan, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There is a table, and there is meat, and there is a knife, and we have nothing to eat.
llm_translation: "And even in Kamayta? But it is a loan! Rabbi Yochanan said: Here is a table, here is meat, here is a knife, and we have no mouth to eat!"

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: לְעוֹלָם אַרֵישָׁא, וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא מַנַּחַת, דְּאִי אִיכָּא שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא. אֲבָל אוֹכֶלֶת, הוֹאִיל וּמִיקָּרְבָא הֲנָיָיתַהּ, אֵימָא גָּמְרָה וּמַקְנְיָא נַפְשַׁהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel both said: Actually, is referring to the first clause and it is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary placed that if is worth one peruta , yes, if not, not But eating since her benefit is immediate, say that she has decided to transfer herself teaches us
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel both said: Always first, and not that he is asking: he is not asking for a meal offering, for if there is a similar small item - no, if not - no. But a female animal, since it is already close, say that she has completed and acquired herself, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא, וּמַאי ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said Actually, is referring to the latter clause And what Unless one of them is worth one peruta ? Unless the last is worth one peruta .
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Always consider the conclusion, and what is the meaning of "until one of them is equal to a perutah" - until the last one is equal to a perutah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה, דַּעְתַּהּ אַפְּרוּטָה,
human_translation: Rava says: Conclude three from of Rabbi Ami: Conclude from it one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed, And conclude from it one who betroths by a loan and one peruta , her mind on the peruta
llm_translation: Rava said: Learn from it from the statement of Rabbi Ammi three. Learn from it: One who sanctifies with a loan, it is not sanctified, and learn from it: One who sanctifies with a loan and a penny, her intention is with the penny.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מָעוֹת בְּעָלְמָא – חוֹזְרִים.
human_translation: And conclude from it generally, money returned.
llm_translation: And hear from it: "Ma'ot be'alma - chozrim."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֲחוֹתוֹ, רַב אָמַר: מָעוֹת חוֹזְרִים. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מָעוֹת מַתָּנָה. רַב אָמַר: מָעוֹת חוֹזְרִים – אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשׁוּם פִּקָּדוֹן. וְלֵימָא לַהּ לְשׁוּם פִּקָּדוֹן! סָבַר לָא מְקַבְּלָה.
human_translation: It was stated: one who betroths his sister Rav says: The money returned And Shmuel says: money a gift Rav says: The money returned, a person knows that betrothal does not take effect with his sister, and he decided to give for the sake of a deposit. And let him say to her for the sake of a deposit. He thought she would not accept
llm_translation: It was stated: One who betroths his sister, Rav said: the coins return. And Shmuel said: the coins are a gift. Rav said: the coins return - a person knows that betrothals do not take effect with his sister, and he concluded and gave them for the sake of a deposit. And let him say that he gave them for the sake of a deposit! He thought that she would not accept.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: מָעוֹת מַתָּנָה – אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה. וְנֵימָא לַהּ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה! סָבַר: כְּסִיפָא לַהּ מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel maintains: money a gift, a person knows that betrothal does not take effect with his sister, and he decided to give for the sake of a gift. And let him say to her for the sake of a gift. thought it would be embarrassing to her
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel holds: "Monetary gifts - a person knows that betrothals do not take effect with his sister, and he concluded and gave it as a gift to Shum. And it is said to her, 'as a gift to Shum!' He holds: the end of the matter is for her." English translation: And Samuel maintains: "Monetary gifts - a person knows that betrothals do not take effect with his sister, and he concluded and gave it as a gift to Shum. And it is said to her, 'as a gift to Shum!' He holds: the end of the matter is for her."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבִינָא: הַמַּפְרִישׁ חַלָּתוֹ קֶמַח – אֵינָהּ חַלָּה, וְגָזֵל בְּיַד כֹּהֵן. וְאַמַּאי גָּזֵל בְּיַד כֹּהֵן? נֵימָא: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁים חַלָּה קֶמַח, וְנָתַן לְשֵׁם מַתָּנָה!
human_translation: Ravina raises an objection one who separates his ḥalla , flour, is not ḥalla . And stolen property in the priest’s possession. And why stolen property in the priest’s possession? let us say A person knows that one cannot separate ḥalla flour, and he gave for the sake of a gift.
llm_translation: Ravina raises an objection: One who separates his dough as flour - it is not considered dough, and he has stolen in the hand of a priest. And why has he stolen in the hand of a priest? Let us say: A person knows that they do not separate dough as flour, and he gave it as a gift!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּנָפֵיק חוּרְבָּה מִינַּהּ – זִימְנִין דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְכֹהֵן פָּחוֹת מֵחָמֵשׁ רְבָעִים קֶמַח, וְהַאי אָלֵישׁ לֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, וְקָסָבַר נִתַּקְּנָה עִיסָּתוֹ, וְאָתֵי לְמֵיכְלַהּ בְּטִיבְלַהּ.
human_translation: There it is different. because ruinous emerge from it. Sometimes the priest has, less than five-fourths flour, and this He will knead this together and think his dough has been made ready And he will come to eat it in its untithed
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for a sword came out of it - sometimes when a priest has less than five quarters of flour, and this one comes to him with his fellow, and he thinks his dough is prepared, and comes to eat it with him in ritual purity.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁים חַלָּה קֶמַח! יוֹדֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ. יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישׁ חַלָּה קֶמַח, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ, דְּסָבַר: טַעְמַיְיהוּ מַאי – מִשּׁוּם טִירְחָא דְכֹהֵן וְטִירְחָא דְכֹהֵן אַחֵילְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t you say a person knows that one may not separate ḥalla flour? He knows but he does not know He knows that one cannot separate ḥalla flour, but he does not know as he thinks: What the reason Due to the labor of the priest, the labor of the priest I have relinquished
llm_translation: And she said: A person knows that they do not separate challah from flour! Knows and does not know. Knows that they do not separate challah from flour, and does not know, for he thought: What is their reason? Because of the toil of the Kohen and the toil of the Kohen you shall give it to him.

hebrew_text: וְתִיהְוֵי תְּרוּמָה, וְלֹא תֵּאָכֵל עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא עָלֶיהָ חַלָּה מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר. מִי לָא תְּנַן: מִן הַנָּקוּב עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב – תְּרוּמָה, וְלֹא תֵּאָכֵל עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא עָלֶיהָ תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר?
human_translation: But Let be teruma , and it should not be eaten until he removes ḥalla for it from somewhere else, Didn’t we learn from a perforated for a non-perforated teruma and it may not be eaten until he removes teruma and tithes for it from somewhere else.
llm_translation: And it shall be terumah, and it shall not be eaten until one brings upon it challah from another place. Who taught us this? From that which is perforated, for that which is not perforated - it is terumah, and it shall not be eaten until one brings upon it terumah and ma'aser from another place?

hebrew_text: בִּתְרֵי מָנֵי – צָאֵית, בְּחַד מָנָא – לָא צָאֵית.
human_translation: in two containers, will listen. in one container, he will not listen.
llm_translation: Between two counts - you went out, with one count - you did not go out.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם כֹּהֵן מֵיצָת צָיֵית, וְקָסָבַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת נִתַּקְּנָה עִיסָּתוֹ, וְאָתֵי לְמֵיכַל בְּטִיבְלָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, a priest will listen and owner will think his dough has been made ready and will come to eat in untithed
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Indeed, a priest should remove the fat, and the owner of the house believes that his dough has become leavened, and he comes to eat with a ritual immersion.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁין חַלָּה קֶמַח! יוֹדֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ. יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁין חַלָּה קֶמַח, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ, דְּסָבַר טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם טִירְחָא דְכֹהֵן, טִירְחָא דְכֹהֵן קַבְּלַהּ עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t you say a person knows that one may not separate ḥalla flour? He knows but he does not know He knows that one cannot separate ḥalla flour, but he does not know as he thinks: What the reason due to the labor of the priest. the labor of the priest has accepted himself.
llm_translation: And she said: A person knows that they do not separate challah from flour! Knows and does not know. Knows that they do not separate challah from flour, and does not know, for he thinks: What is the reason? Because of the toil of the Kohen, the toil of the Kohen he accepted upon himself.

hebrew_text: וְתִיהְוֵי תְּרוּמָה, וְיַחְזוֹר וְיִתְרוֹם. מִי לָא תְּנַן: מִשֶּׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב עַל הַנָּקוּב – תְּרוּמָה, וְיַחְזוֹר וְיִתְרוֹם! הָא אוֹקֵימְנָא: בִּתְרֵי מָאנֵי צָאֵית, בְּחַד מָנָא לָא צָאֵית.
human_translation: But let it be teruma , and he should separate teruma again. Didn’t we learn from a non-perforated for a perforated teruma but he must separate teruma again We have established in two containers, will listen, in one container, one will not listen.
llm_translation: And it shall be terumah, and he shall return and lift it up. Who taught us this? From when it is not pierced upon the pierced - terumah, and he shall return and lift it up! Here is the resolution: with two measures you went out, with one measure you did not go out.

hebrew_text: וְלָא צָאֵית?! וְהָתְנַן: הַתּוֹרֵם קִישּׁוּת וְנִמְצָא מָרָה, אֲבַטִּיחַ וְנִמְצֵאת סָרוּחַ – תְּרוּמָה, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְרוֹם! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תְּרוּמָה מְעַלְּיָא הִיא,
human_translation: And will not listen But didn’t we learn one who separated a cucumber teruma and was found bitter a melon and it was found spoiled, teruma , but he must separate teruma again? There it is different, as it is full-fledged teruma by Torah law,
llm_translation: "And did you not go out?! But didn't we learn: If one designates a handful and it is found to be bitter, he should designate another handful and it is found to be acceptable - it is considered terumah, and he should go back and separate it! The case is different there, for terumah is of higher sanctity by Torah law."

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבִּי אִלְעַאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי: מִנַּיִן לַתּוֹרֵם מִן הָרָעָה עַל הַיָּפָה שֶׁתְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא תִשְׂאוּ עָלָיו חֵטְא בַּהֲרִימְכֶם אֶת חֶלְבּוֹ״ – אִם אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ, נְשִׂיאוּת חֵטְא לָמָּה? מִכָּאן לַתּוֹרֵם מִן הָרָעָה עַל הַיָּפָה שֶׁתְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: from of Rabbi Ilai, for Rabbi Ilai says: From where that one who separates teruma from poor-quality for superior-quality that his teruma is teruma ? As it is stated “And you shall bear no sin by reason of it, seeing that you have set apart from it the best thereof” if it were not sacred why bear a sin? From here that one separates teruma from poor-quality for superior-quality his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: From Rabbi Elai. As Rabbi Elai said: From where do we derive that one should separate from evil for beauty, that his separation should be a true separation? As it is stated: "And you shall not bear sin because of it when you raise up its fat" - if it is not holy, why the bearing of sin in its elevation? From here we derive that one should separate from evil for beauty, that his separation should be a true separation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לָהּ: ״בָּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ וּבָזוֹ״. אֲבָל אָמַר לָהּ: ״בְּאֵלּוּ״ – אֲפִילּוּ אוֹכֶלֶת נָמֵי מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, כִּי קָא אָכְלָה – מִדְּנַפְשַׁהּ קָאָכְלָה.
human_translation: taught only if he said to her With this and with this and with this But he said to her With these, even is eating also betrothed when she eats, she eats of her own
llm_translation: They did not disagree except that he said to her: "With this and with this and with this." But if he said to her: "With these" - even if she is eating consecrated food, when she eats, she eats from her own appetite.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּאַלּוֹן בְּרִמּוֹן וּבֶאֱגוֹז״ אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לָהּ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״, אִם יֵשׁ בְּכוּלָּן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״בָּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ וּבָזוֹ״, אִם יֵשׁ בְּכוּלָּם שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״בָּזוֹ״ – נְטָלַתּוּ וַאֲכָלַתּוּ, ״בָּזוֹ״ – נְטָלַתּוּ וַאֲכָלַתּוּ, וְעוֹד ״בָּזוֹ״ וְעוֹד ״בָּזוֹ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava: Be betrothed to me with an oak tree, with a pomegranate, and with a nut, or if he said to her: Be betrothed to me with these, if combined they are worth one peruta , she is betrothed. But if not, she is not betrothed. with this and with this and with this if combined they are worth one peruta , she is betrothed. But if not, she is not betrothed. with this she took it and ate it; with this she took it and ate it; and also with this and also with this she is not betrothed unless one of them is worth one peruta .
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Rava: "Consecrate yourself to Me with this oak, this pomegranate, and this walnut," or if he said to her: "Consecrate yourself to Me with these," if any one of them is equal in value to the smallest coin - she is sanctified, and if not - she is not sanctified. "With this one, and this one, and this one," if any one of them is equal in value to the smallest coin - she is sanctified, and if not - she is not sanctified. "With this one" - she takes it and eats it, "with this one" - she takes it and eats it, and furthermore "with this one" and furthermore "with this one" - she is not sanctified until one of them is equal in value to the smallest coin.

hebrew_text: הַאי ״בְּאַלּוֹן בְּרִמּוֹן בֶּאֱגוֹז״, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵימָא דְּאָמַר לַהּ: ״אוֹ בְּאַלּוֹן, אוֹ בְּרִמּוֹן, אוֹ בֶּאֱגוֹז״, אִם יֵשׁ בְּכוּלָּן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת? וְהָא ״אוֹ״ קָאָמַר! וְאֶלָּא ״בְּאַלּוֹן וּבְרִמּוֹן וּבֶאֱגוֹז״ – הַיְינוּ ״בָּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ וּבָזוֹ״! אֶלָּא לָאו דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״בְּאֵלּוּ״, הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לָהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״ – מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו בְּ״אֵלּוּ״ עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this With an oak tree, with a pomegranate, with a nut? If we say that he said to her: Either with an oak tree, or with a pomegranate, or with a nut, if combined they are worth one peruta she is betrothed? But didn’t he say: Or, But rather, With an oak tree, and with a pomegranate, and with a nut that is With this and with this and with this Rather, is it not where he said to her: with these? But from that the latter clause teaches: Or if he said to her: Be betrothed to me with these, it may be inferred that the first clause we are not dealing with These.
llm_translation: This "in the oak, in the pomegranate, in the walnut," how so? If you say to her, "either in the oak, or in the pomegranate, or in the walnut," if all of them are equal, is a small part sanctified? But it says "or"! Rather, "in the oak and in the pomegranate and in the walnut" – meaning "in this one and in this one and in this one"! Rather, if she did not say to her "in these," this is derived from the latter clause: or if he said to her, "be consecrated to me with these" – from the fact that we are not dealing with "in these" in the beginning.

hebrew_text: פָּירוּשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּאַלּוֹן בְּרִמּוֹן בֶּאֱגוֹז״, כֵּיצַד? כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״.
human_translation: is explaining, Be betrothed to me with an oak tree, with a pomegranate, with a nut; How so? For example, when he said to her: Be betrothed to me with these.
llm_translation: Explanations are being explained: "Consecrate yourself to Me with these - with the oak, with the pomegranate, with the walnut," how so? For example, if one said to her, "Consecrate yourself to Me with these."

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא ״בָּזוֹ״ נְטָלַתּוּ וַאֲכָלַתּוּ, אִם יֵשׁ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶם שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: And the latter clause teaches With this took it and ate it, if one of them is worth one peruta , she is betrothed. And if not, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: And it was taught in the latter clause: "With disgrace" - she takes it and eats it. If one of them is worth a perutah - it becomes sanctified, and if not - it does not become sanctified.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ רֵישָׁא, לָא קָא מְפַלֵּיג בֵּין אוֹכֶלֶת לְמַנַּחַת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כֹּל הֵיכָא דַּאֲמַר לַהּ ״בְּאֵלּוּ״ כִּי קָא אָכְלָה – מִנַּפְשַׁהּ קָא אָכְלָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: While in the first clause does not distinguish between is eating and one who is placing conclude from any where he said to her: With these, when she is eating she is eating of her own Conclude from
llm_translation: And if the beginning, not is arguing between eating to offering. Hear from it: wherever that said to her "in these" when she ate - from herself she ate, hear from it.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַסֵּיפָא קָאֵי, וּמַאי ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, הָכִי נָמֵי: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one, who says is referring to the latter clause and What unless one of them is worth one peruta ? Unless the last one is worth one peruta . So too, Unless the last one is worth one peruta .
llm_translation: The one who says the conclusion is standing, and what is "until one of them is worth a perutah" - until the last one is worth a perutah, so it is said: until the last one is worth a perutah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אַרֵישָׁא קָאֵי, וְאוֹכֶלֶת אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ – הָכָא כְּלָלֵי קָחָשֵׁיב, פְּרָטֵי לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: But according to Rav and Shmuel, who both say is referring to the first clause And it was necessary for is eating here lists groupings; does not list individual
llm_translation: Instead, for Rav and Shmuel who both say: the first one is standing, and the female goat is needed for him - here general cases are considered, specific cases are not considered.

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי הִיא, דַּאֲמַר: לָא שְׁנָא ״כְּזַיִת כְּזַיִת״, וְלָא שְׁנָא ״כְּזַיִת וּכְזַיִת״, פְּרָטָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi who says no difference An olive-bulk an olive-bulk or an olive-bulk and an olive-bulk are individual
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ha mani - Rabbi hi, da'amar: la sh'na 'kezayit kezayit', v'la sh'na 'kezayit u'kezayit', prata havei."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוֶה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִלְוָה לְהוֹצָאָה נִיתְּנָה. נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוֶה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר מִלְוָה לְהוֹצָאָה נִיתְּנָה, וּמָר סָבַר מִלְוָה לָאו לְהוֹצָאָה נִיתְּנָה?
human_translation: Rav says: one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed, a loan is given to be spent. Let us say subject to tanna’im , one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed, and some say she is betrothed. What, is it not disagree with regard to this: Sage holds a loan is given to be spent, and Sage holds a loan is not given to be spent?
llm_translation: Rav said: One who sanctifies with a loan - it is not sanctified, the loan was given for withdrawal. It was stated in a Baraita: One who sanctifies with a loan - it is not sanctified, and some say: it is sanctified. What is the reason they do not argue about this? Because one Sage holds that the loan was given for withdrawal, and the other Sage holds that the loan was not given for withdrawal?

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא?! אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְשָׁוִים בְּמֶכֶר שֶׁזֶּה קָנָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִלְוָה לְהוֹצָאָה נִיתְּנָה, בְּמַאי קָנֵי?!
human_translation: And you understand Say the latter clause And they agree with regard to a sale that he acquires If you say a loan is given to be spent, with what has he acquired
llm_translation: And it was created?! Say rather the latter part: And it is valid in a sale, for this one acquired. If you say it was given as a loan for expenditure, with what did he acquire?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הוּנָא חַבְרִין מוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּמִילֵּי אוּחְרֵי, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָמַר לַהּ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״ וְנִמְצָא מָנֶה חָסֵר דִּינָר. מָר סָבַר: כְּסִיפָא לַהּ מִילְּתָא לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ. וּמָר סָבַר: לָא כְּסִיפָא לַהּ מִילְּתָא לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Our colleague Huna interprets to other matters And with what are we dealing here? where he said to her: Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, and it was found one hundred dinars less dinar, Sage, holds the matter is embarrassing for her, from claiming And Sage, holds the matter is not embarrassing for her from claiming
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Hunah, a colleague, established for her with other words, and here with what are we dealing? For example, if he said to her, "Be consecrated to me with a maneh," and a maneh lacking a dinar was found. Mar thought: The latter part of the matter is essential for her. And Mar thought: The latter part of the matter is not essential for her.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמָנֶה״ וְנָתַן לָהּ דִּינָר – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וְיַשְׁלִים, לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ? אָמְרִי: מָנֶה חָסֵר דִּינָר כְּסִיפָא לַהּ מִילְּתָא לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ, מָנֶה חָסֵר תִּשְׁעִים וָתֵשַׁע לָא כְּסִיפָא לַהּ מִילְּתָא לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ.
human_translation: But rather, that which Rabbi Elazar says: Be betrothed to me with one hundred dinars, and he gave her dinar, she is betrothed and he must finish let us say his statement parallel to tanna’im . say one hundred dinars less a dinar, the matter is embarrassing for her, from claiming one hundred dinars less ninety-nine, the matter is not embarrassing for her from claiming
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rabbi Elazar: "Be consecrated to me with a maneh" and he gave her a dinar - behold she is consecrated and he should fulfill, let us say as the Tannaim said to his hearing? They said: A maneh lacking a dinar is like a sippa for her a matter to be resolved, a maneh lacking ninety-nine is not like a sippa for her a matter to be resolved.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּפִקָּדוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדֵךְ״ וְהָלְכָה וּמְצָאַתּוּ שֶׁנִּגְנַב אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד, אִם נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנּוּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וּבְמִלְוָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנּוּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִלְוָה
human_translation: raises an objection one who says to a woman: Be betrothed to me with the deposit that I have in your possession, and she went and found that stolen or that lost, if value of one peruta of it remains betrothed And if not, she is not betrothed, But with a loan she is betrothed, even though value of one peruta of it does not remain. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A loan
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: One who says to a woman, "Be consecrated to me with the marriage contract that I have in your possession," and he walks away and it is found that it was stolen or lost, if there remains from it the value of a prutah - she is consecrated, and if not - she is not consecrated. And in the case of a loan, even though there does not remain from it the value of a prutah - she is consecrated. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: loan

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּפִקָּדוֹן. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר: מִלְוָה, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וּמָר סָבַר: נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – אִין, וְאִי לָא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – לָא. אֲבָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת!
human_translation: is like a deposit. They disagree only with regard to Sage who holds a loan, even though value of one peruta does not remain of it. And Sage holds value of one peruta remains from it, yes, but if value of one peruta does not remain of it, cannot. But everyone agrees one betroths with a loan, she is betrothed.
llm_translation: Behold, it is like a deposit. Until here they do not argue, but Mar holds: lending, even though it does not remain with her, a prutah is equal, and Mar holds: if it does not remain with her, a prutah is not equal. But everyone agrees that in the case of lending, she becomes sanctified!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְתִסְבְּרַאּ הָא מְתָרַצְתָּא? הָא מְשַׁבַּשְׁתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: Rava said to him: And you understand this explainable? It is corrupted
llm_translation: Rava said to him: And do you think this is a satisfactory answer? This is a confused response.

hebrew_text: הַאי פִּקָּדוֹן הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּקַבִּיל עֲלַיהּ אַחְרָיוּת, הַיְינוּ מִלְוָה. אִי דְּלָא קַבִּיל עֲלַיהּ אַחְרָיוּת – אִי הָכִי אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וּבְמִלְוָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, נִיפְלוֹג וְנִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא קִבְּלָה עָלֶיהָ אַחְרָיוּת, אֲבָל קִבְּלָה עָלֶיהָ אַחְרָיוּת, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת!
human_translation: What are the circumstances of this deposit If she assumed responsibility for it is a loan, If she did not assume responsibility for it, if so, rather than teaching in the latter clause But with a loan she is betrothed despite that value of one peruta of it does not remain; let him distinguish and teach within the itself, In what is this statement said, If she did not assume responsibility upon herself But she assumed responsibility upon herself, even though value of one peruta did not remain from it, she is betrothed.
llm_translation: This deposit, how is its value? If he accepted responsibility for it, that is a loan. If he did not accept responsibility for it - if so, the latter clause teaches: And in a loan, even though nothing remains of it, even a small coin - it is sanctified, it is distinguished and given to its own: in what case is this said? - that he did not accept responsibility for it, but if he accepted responsibility for it, even though nothing remains of it, even a small coin is sanctified!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: וּבְמִלְוָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיֵּיר הֵימֶנָּה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rather, answer this But with a loan she is not betrothed, despite that value of one peruta of it remains.
llm_translation: Rather, resolve it thus: And in a loan, even though there remains a perutah, it is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מִלְוָה הֲרֵי הִיא כְּפִקָּדוֹן. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? אָמַר רַבָּה: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בְּבֵי רַב דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: בְּמִלְוָה בִּרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים לַחֲזָרָה וְהוּא הַדִּין לְאוּנְסִין קָמִיפַּלְגִי,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A loan is like a deposit. With regard to what do they disagree? Rabba said: I found the scholars in the study hall of Rav who were sitting and saying: They disagree with regard to a loan in the possession of owner with regard to retraction And the same is true, with regard to accidents.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A loan is like a deposit. With what are they arguing? Rabba said: I found them discussing in the study hall of Rav who was sitting and saying: Regarding a loan, in the possession of the owners, for return, and the same applies to cases of force, they are arguing.

hebrew_text: דְּמָר סָבַר: מִלְוָה בִּרְשׁוּת לֹוֶה קָיְימָא, וְהוּא הַדִּין לָאוֹנָסִים. וּמָר סָבַר: מִלְוָה בִּרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים קָיְימָא, וְהוּא הַדִּין לָאוֹנָסִים.
human_translation: As Sage, holds: A loan stands in the possession of the debtor, And the same is true with regard to accidents, And Sage, holds: A loan stands in the possession of the owner, and the same is true with regard to accidents.
llm_translation: Mar believes: lending with the consent of the borrower is valid, and the same applies to ones compelled. And Mar believes: lending with the consent of the owners is valid, and the same applies to ones compelled.

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ: לָאוֹנָסִים – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבִרְשׁוּת לֹוֶה קָיְימִי, מַאי טַעְמָא – לָא גָּרְעָא מִשְּׁאֵלָה, מָה שְׁאֵלָה דְּהָדְרָה בְּעֵינַהּ חַיָּיב בָּאוֹנָסִים, מִלְוָה לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. אֶלָּא הָכָא מִלְוָה בִּרְשׁוּת בְּעָלִים לַחֲזָרָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And I said to them: With regard to accidents, everyone agrees stands in the possession of the debtor What is the reason? no worse than borrowing Just as borrowing whereby returned intact is liable for accidents, not all the more so a loan, Rather, here between them a loan in the possession of the owner with regard to retraction
llm_translation: I would say to them: Regarding forced loans - everyone agrees that with the borrower's consent, the transaction is valid. What is the reason? It is not less than a gift. Just as a gift that is later regretted is subject to forced repayment, all the more so a loan. But here, a loan with the owner's consent for return, there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַשּׁוֹאֵל קוּרְדּוֹם מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, בִּיקַּע בּוֹ – קְנָאוֹ. לֹא בִּיקַּע בּוֹ – לֹא קְנָאוֹ. לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: But rather, that which Rav Huna says: one who borrows an ax from his friend he chops with it he has acquired it he has not chopped with it he has not acquired it. Let us say this halakha stated parallel to tanna’im .
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rav Huna: One who asks his friend for a Kordeom, if he tore it - he is zealous. If he did not tear it - he is not zealous. Let us say as the Tannaim said: Did she say it to be heard?

hebrew_text: לָא, עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בְּמִלְוָה, דְּלָא הָדְרָה בְּעֵינַהּ. אֲבָל בִּשְׁאֵלָה, דְּהָדְרָה בְּעֵינַהּ, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בִּיקַּע בּוֹ – אִין, לֹא בִּיקַּע בּוֹ – לֹא קְנָאוֹ.
human_translation: No, they disagree only with regard to a loan, which is not returned intact. But with regard to borrowing which is returned intact, everyone agrees one chopped with it, yes, he has not chopped with it, he has not acquired it.
llm_translation: Not, until here not they argue except in lending, for not returned in her eyes. But in borrowing, for returned in her eyes, the words of all he is successful - yes, not he is successful - no zeal.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי? ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בִּשְׁטַר חוֹב״, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ מִלְוָה בְּיַד אֲחֵרִים וְהִירְשָׁהּ עֲלֵיהֶם, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. הַאי שְׁטַר חוֹב הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שְׁטַר חוֹב דַּאֲחֵרִים – הַיְינוּ מִלְוָה בְּיַד אֲחֵרִים! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁטַר חוֹב דִּידַהּ, וּבִמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: Let us say is subject to tanna’im . Be betrothed to me with a promissory note, or if he had a loan in the possession of others and he authorized her to Rabbi Meir says she is betrothed and the Rabbis say she is not betrothed. What are the circumstances this promissory note? If we say a promissory note of others this is a loan in the possession of others, Rather, is it not her promissory note, they disagree with regard to one who betroths with a loan,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'ei? 'Hitkadesh li b'shtar chov,' o shehayah lo milvah b'yad acherim v'hirshah aleihem, Rabbi Meir omer: mekudeshet, v'chachamim omerim: einah mekudeshet. Hai shtar chov heichi damei? Ileima shtar chov d'acherim – hainu milvah b'yad acherim! Ella lav shtar chov didah, u'vimkadesh b'milvah kamiflagi?" English translation: "Is it said according to the opinion of the Tannaim? 'She is consecrated to me with a bond,' or if he had a loan in the hands of others and she inherited it from them, Rabbi Meir says: she is consecrated, and the Sages say: she is not consecrated. How is this bond similar? If you say it is the bond of others – that is a loan in the hands of others! Rather, is it not her own bond, and they disagree about consecration through a loan?"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם שְׁטַר חוֹב דַּאֲחֵרִים, וְהָכָא בְּמִלְוָה בִּשְׁטָר וּבְמִלְוָה עַל פֶּה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Actually, a promissory note of others, and here disagree In a loan with note and in a loan by oral
llm_translation: Always a promissory note of others, and here in a loan with a promissory note and in a loan orally he argues.

hebrew_text: בְּמִלְוָה בִּשְׁטָר בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי – בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּתַנְיָא: אוֹתִיּוֹת נִקְנוֹת בִּמְסִירָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין שֶׁכָּתַב וְלֹא מָסַר, בֵּין שֶׁמָּסַר וְלָא כָּתַב – לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב וְיִמְסוֹר.
human_translation: With regard to a loan with note, concerning what do they disagree? They disagree concerning the dispute between Rabbi and the Rabbis, as it is taught Letters, are acquired by transferring the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: Whether one wrote but did not transfer whether he transferred but did not write has not acquired once writes and transfers
llm_translation: In a loan with a document, what do they argue about? - In the dispute of Rabbi and the Rabbis they argue. For it was taught: "Documents are acquired through delivery," the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: "Whether one wrote but did not deliver, or whether one delivered but did not write - he does not acquire until it is written and delivered."

hebrew_text: מָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Sage, is of of Rabbi And one Sage, is not of of Rabbi
llm_translation: Master has it of Rabbi, and master does not have it of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לֵית לְהוּ דְּרַבִּי, וְהָכָא בִּדְרַב פָּפָּא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי מַאן דְּזָבֵין שְׁטָרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, צָרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב לֵיהּ: ״קְנִי לָךְ הוּא וְכׇל שִׁעְבּוּדֵיהּ״. מָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say No one is of of Rabbi and here disagree with regard to of Rav Pappa, as Rav Pappa says: This one who sells note to his friend must write for him: Let it be acquired by you, it and all its liens. Sage, is of of Rav Pappa. And Sage, is not of of Rav Pappa.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world there is no one like Rabbi, and here in the case of Rav Papa it is different, for Rav Papa said: One who writes a document for his friend, must write for him, "Acquire it for yourself and all its services." One master has Rav Papa, and one master does not have Rav Papa.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא וְהָכָא בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: And if you wish, say Everyone is of of Rav Pappa, And here disagree with regard to of Shmuel, as Shmuel says:
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world there is one like Rav Papa, and here in Dismuel he stumbled. For Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹכֵר שְׁטַר חוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְחָזַר וּמְחָלוֹ – מָחוּל, וַאֲפִילּוּ יוֹרֵשׁ מוֹחֵל. דְּמָר אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: one who sells a promissory note to another, and went back and forgave it is forgiven, And even inheritor can forgive that Sage, is of of Shmuel. And Sage, is not of of Shmuel;
llm_translation: The seller of a promissory note of debt to his fellow, and he returned and annulled it - it is annulled, and even if the heir annuls. For there is a teaching of Shmuel. And there is no teaching of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְהָכָא בְּאִשָּׁה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: אִשָּׁה סָמְכָה דַּעְתַּהּ, מֵימָר אָמְרָה: לָא שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ לְדִידִי וּמָחֵל לֵיהּ לְאַחֲרִינֵי, וּמָר סָבַר: אִשָּׁה נָמֵי לָא סָמְכָה דַּעְתַּהּ
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone is of of Shmuel, and here disagree with regard to a woman Sage, holds a woman relies she says He would not leave my and forgive of others. And Sage, holds even a woman does not rely
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world there is one named Shmuel, and here it is in a woman that the disagreement arises. The Master thought: A woman relies on her intuition, perhaps she said: I did not leave him for my own sake and forgive him to others, and the Master thought: A woman also does not rely on her intuition.

hebrew_text: בְּמִלְוָה עַל פֶּה. בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? בִּדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, תְּנֵהוּ לִפְלוֹנִי בְּמַעֲמַד שְׁלָשְׁתָּן – קָנָה.
human_translation: with a loan oral with regard to what do they disagree? with regard to of Rav Huna, Rav says, as Rav Huna says Rav says: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, give it to so-and-so, in the presence of three has acquired
llm_translation: In a loan on credit. With what do they argue? In the school of Huna, Rav said, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: "Give me the money in your possession, and transfer it to so-and-so in the presence of all three – it is acquired."

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּפִקָּדוֹן, אֲבָל מִלְוָה – לָא. וּמָר סָבַר: לָא שְׁנָא מִלְוָה וְלָא שְׁנָא פִּקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: Sage, holds when Rav said this applies in a deposit, But a loan, not And Sage, holds: is no difference a loan or a deposit.
llm_translation: Master says: When Rav Huna said matters regarding a deposit, but regarding a loan - no. And Master says: It is not different, whether a loan or a deposit.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בִּשְׁטָר״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שָׁמִין אֶת הַנְּיָיר, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Let us say subject to tanna’im . Be betrothed to me with a document, Rabbi Meir says she is not betrothed, and Rabbi Elazar says she is betrothed, and the Rabbis say appraises the paper If has the value of one peruta , she is betrothed. But if not, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'ei: 'Hitkadeshi li bish'tar' - Rabbi Meir omer: Einah mekudeshet, v'Rabbi Elazar omer: Mekudeshet, v'Chachamim omerim: Sham'in et ha'neyar, im yesh bo shaveh prutah - mekudeshet, v'im lav - einah mekudeshet." English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita: 'Sanctify yourself to me with a document' - Rabbi Meir says: It does not sanctify her, and Rabbi Elazar says: It sanctifies her, and the Sages say: We inspect the paper, if it has the value of a perutah - it sanctifies her, and if not - it does not sanctify her."

hebrew_text: הַאי שְׁטָר הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שְׁטַר חוֹב דַּאֲחֵרִים – קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַדְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. אֶלָּא בִּשְׁטַר חוֹב דִּידַהּ, וּבִמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי!
human_translation: What are the circumstances this document? If we say a promissory note by others, of Rabbi Meir difficult of Rabbi Meir, Rather, to a promissory note of her, and they disagree with regard to one who betroths with a loan.
llm_translation: This document, how is it comparable? If you say it is a debt document of others - it is difficult according to Rabbi Meir, according to Rabbi Meir. Rather, in her own debt document, and in the case of a consecration through a loan, they disagree!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּדְּשָׁהּ בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says With what are we dealing here? where he betrothed her with a document that had no witnesses to it.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, "Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when she was betrothed with a document that does not require witnesses."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי חֲתִימָה כָּרְתִי, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: עֵדֵי מְסִירָה כָּרְתִי, וְרַבָּנַן מְסַפְּקָא לְהוּ אִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אִי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, הִלְכָּךְ שָׁמִין אֶת הַנְּיָיר, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir to his reasoning, as he says Signatory witnesses effect And Rabbi Elazar to his reasoning, as he says: Witnesses to the transmission effect And the Rabbis are uncertain if in accordance with Rabbi Meir if in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. Therefore, appraises the paper: If it has the value of one peruta , she is betrothed. But if not, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir for his reasoning said: Witnesses of sealing, I have cut off. And Rabbi Elazar for his reasoning said: Witnesses of delivery, I have cut off. And the sages were in doubt whether to follow the opinion of Rabbi Meir or the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, therefore they place the paper in a place where it can be heard. If it contains the value of a perutah - it is sanctified, and if not, it is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, וּבִדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּבָעֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שְׁטַר אֵירוּסִין שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, מַהוּ? הֲוָיָה לִיצִיאָה מַקְּשִׁינַן, מָה יְצִיאָה בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ, אַף הֲוָיָה נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא: הֲוָיוֹת לַהֲדָדֵי מַקְּשִׁינַן, מָה הֲוָיָה דְכֶסֶף לָא בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ, אַף הֲוָיָה דִשְׁטָר לָא בָּעֵינַן לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say where he wrote not for her sake, And they disagree with regard to of Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish asks: What is a document of betrothal that wrote not for her sake? we juxtapose becoming to leaving Just as leave we require for her sake, so too, become we require for her sake as well. Or perhaps we juxtapose becoming to each other: Just as becoming of money we do not require for her sake so too, becoming of a document, we do not require for her sake.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For example, if he wrote it not for its sake, and Uvda d'Reish Lakish disagrees. For Reish Lakish asks: A marriage contract that he wrote not for its sake, what is the law? We are concerned about its validity for divorce, if it is valid for its sake, it is also valid for its sake. Or perhaps: We are concerned about its value for exchange, if we do not require the value of money for its sake, we also do not require the value of a contract for its sake.

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּבַעְיַהּ הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: ״וְיָצְאָה... וְהָיְתָה״, מַקִּישׁ הֲוָיָה לִיצִיאָה. מָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: After raised the dilemma, then resolved it: “And she departs and becomes juxtaposes becoming to leaving, One Sage, is of of Reish Lakish, And Sage, is not of of Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: After Be'aya asked, he then explained: "And she shall go out... and she shall be," equating being to going out. Master Reish Lakish found a source for it, but Master did not find a source for it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ. וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרָבָא וְרָבִינָא, וְרַב פָּפָּא וְרַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאִיתְּמַר: כְּתָבוֹ לִשְׁמָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ, רָבָא וְרָבִינָא אָמְרִי: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא אָמְרִי: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone is of of Reish Lakish, and with what are we dealing here? where he wrote for her sake but unbeknownst to her. And disagree concerning the dispute between Rava and Ravina, and Rav Pappa and Rav Sherevya, as it was stated he wrote for her sake but unbeknownst to her Rava and Ravina say she is betrothed; Rav Pappa and Rav Sherevya say she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In the whole world there is one who expounds like Resh Lakish, and here we are dealing with what he wrote for its own sake and not with her knowledge. And in the dispute of Rava and Ravina, and Rav Papa and Rav Sheravya disagreed. For it was stated: what he wrote for its own sake and not with her knowledge, Rava and Ravina said: she is sanctified, Rav Papa and Rav Sheravya said: she is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֲשֵׂה לִי שִׁירִים נְזָמִים וְטַבָּעוֹת, וְאֶקַּדֵּשׁ אֲנִי לָךְ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ מָמוֹן לְיָדָהּ.
human_translation: Let us say subject to these tanna’im , as it is taught Make bracelets, earrings, and rings for me, and I will be betrothed to you once he has made them she is betrothed; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: She is not betrothed until money enters her possession.
llm_translation: Said like the Sages of the Mishnah, as it was taught: "Make for Me songs, musical instruments, and rings, and I will sanctify you," once she made them - she is sanctified, the words of Rabbi Meir, and the sages say: she is not sanctified until the money reaches her hand.

hebrew_text: הַאי מָמוֹן הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן נָמֵי לָא! אֶלָּא בְּמַאי כּוּ מִקַּדְּשָׁא? אֶלָּא לָאו בְּמָמוֹן אַחֵר, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this money If we say that money, by inference the first tanna , holds even that money is also not But with what with is betrothed, Rather, is not with other money, And conclude from it disagree with regard to one who betroths with a loan,
llm_translation: This money, how is it valued? If you say that same money, it is not so, as it was taught in the first clause: Even that same money is not valued! Rather, with what is it valued? Not with other money, but rather it is inferred that it is divided in the case of sanctification and in the case of a loan.

hebrew_text: וְסָבְרִי דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִלָּה [וְעַד] סוֹף וְהָוֵה מִלְוָה. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וּמָר סָבַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת?
human_translation: And they hold that everyone agrees a wage is from the beginning to end, And it is a loan, What, is it not disagree with regard to this, that Sage, holds one who betroths with a loan, she is betrothed, and Sage, holds one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed?
llm_translation: And the opinion of the entire world is that she is betrothed for hire from the beginning until the end, and it becomes a loan. What is it that they do not disagree about? For one Master holds: One who consecrates with a loan, she becomes consecrated, and the other Master holds: One who consecrates with a loan, she does not become consecrated?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְהָכָא – בְּיֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר:
human_translation: No, everyone one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed, and here disagree a wage is from the beginning to end. Sage, holds:
llm_translation: Not, that all the world sanctifies with a loan is not sanctified, and here - with its rental from the beginning until the end, Mar Savar:

hebrew_text: אֵינָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת אֶלָּא בַּסּוֹף. וּמָר סָבַר: יֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף.
human_translation: a wage is only at the end And Sage, holds: a wage is from the beginning to end,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "It is not for renting except at the end. And Mar thought: It is for renting from the beginning until the end."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף, וּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְהָכָא, בְּאוּמָּן קוֹנָה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: אוּמָּן קוֹנָה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין אוּמָּן קוֹנֶה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees a wage is from the beginning to end. And one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed. And here disagree with regard to a craftsman acquires enhancement of the vessel. Sage, holds: A craftsman acquires through enhancement of the vessel, And Sage, holds: A craftsman does not acquire through enhancement of the vessel.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The entire world acquires it for rental from the beginning to the end, and one sanctifies it through a loan - it is not sanctified. And here, an expert acquires it through praise, like a borrowed vessel. One Master holds: An expert acquires it through praise of the vessel, and one Master holds: An expert does not acquire it through praise of the vessel.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין אוּמָּן קוֹנָה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי, וְיֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף, וּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוָה אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוֹסִיף לָהּ נוֹפֶךְ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ. דְּמָר סָבַר: מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה, דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַפְּרוּטָה, וּמָר סָבַר: דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַמִּלְוָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say that everyone agrees a craftsman does not acquire through enhancement of the vessel, and a wage is from the beginning to end. And one who betroths with a loan, she is not betrothed. And with what are we dealing here? where he added a jewel [ nofekh ] of his own for her, as Sage, holds a loan and one peruta , his mind on the peruta . And Sage, holds his mind on the loan.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The entire world does not acquire a vessel with praise, and she is rented from the beginning to the end, and one sanctifies it with a loan, she is not sanctified, and here we are dealing with what? For example, he added to it a handle of his own. Mar holds: loan and handle, his intention is handle, and Mar holds: his intention is loan.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁעָשִׂיתִי עִמָּךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאֶעֱשֶׂה עִמָּךְ״ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאֶעֱשֶׂה עִמָּךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן ״בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁעָשִׂיתִי עִמָּךְ״.
human_translation: And in the dispute these tanna’im . As it is taught with the payment which I have worked for you, she is not betrothed with the payment which I will work for you, she is betrothed, Rabbi Natan says: With the payment which I will work for you, she is not betrothed, And all the more so With the payment which I have worked for you.
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as it was taught: "In return for what I have done with you" - she is not betrothed. "In return for what I will do with you" - she is betrothed. Rabbi Natan says: "In return for what I will do with you" - she is not betrothed, and certainly "In return for what I have done with you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר: בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: בֵּין ״בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁעָשִׂיתִי״, בֵּין ״בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאֶעֱשֶׂה עִמָּךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְאִם הוֹסִיף לָהּ נוֹפֶךְ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: Actually, they said whether With the payment which I have worked for you, or: With the payment which I will work for you, she is not betrothed. But if he added a nofekh of his own for her, she is betrothed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda the Prince says: In truth they said: Whether "for the reward that I have earned" or "for the reward that I will earn with you" - it does not sanctify her. And if he added to her a nose ring from his own - it sanctifies her.

hebrew_text: בֵּין תַּנָּא קַמָּא לְרַבִּי נָתָן – אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׂכִירוּת, בֵּין רַבִּי נָתָן לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא – אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה. מָר סָבַר: מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה, דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַמִּלְוָה, וּמָר סָבַר: דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַפְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: between the first tanna and Rabbi Natan a wage: between Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi a loan and one peruta . Sage, holds a loan and one peruta his mind on the loan, And Sage, holds his mind on the peruta ,
llm_translation: Between the first Tanna and Rabbi Natan - there is a difference regarding hiring. Between Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Yehuda the Prince - there is a difference regarding lending with interest. Master holds: lending with interest, his opinion is for lending, and Master holds: his opinion is for interest.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּכוֹס זֶה שֶׁל יַיִן״ וְנִמְצָא שֶׁל דְּבַשׁ, ״שֶׁל דְּבַשׁ״ וְנִמְצָא שֶׁל יַיִן, ״בְּדִינָר זֶה שֶׁל כֶּסֶף״ וְנִמְצָא שֶׁל זָהָב, ״שֶׁל זָהָב״ וְנִמְצָא שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי עָשִׁיר״ וְנִמְצָא עָנִי, ״עָנִי״ וְנִמְצָא עָשִׁיר – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם הִטְעָהּ לְשֶׁבַח, מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Be betrothed to me with this cup of wine, and it was found of honey; of honey, and it was found of wine; With this dinar of silver, and it was found of gold; of gold, and it was found of silver; On the condition that I am wealthy, and he was found poor; poor, and he was found wealthy, she is not betrothed Rabbi Shimon says: If he misled her to advantage betrothed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Consecrate to Me with this cup of wine," and it turns out to be with honey; "with honey," and it turns out to be with wine; "with this dinar of silver," and it turns out to be with gold; "with gold," and it turns out to be with silver; "on condition that I am rich," and it turns out that I am poor; "poor," and it turns out that I am rich - it is not consecrated. Rabbi Shimon says: If one consecrated it for praise, it is consecrated.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּכוֹס זֶה״, תָּנֵי חֲדָא: בּוֹ וּבַמֶּה שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בּוֹ וְלֹא בַּמֶּה שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בַּמֶּה שֶׁבְּתוֹכוֹ וְלֹא בּוֹ. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – בְּמַיָּא, הָא – בְּחַמְרָא, הָא – בְּצִיהֲרָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Be betrothed to me with this cup, is taught one with and with its contents. And is taught another with but not with its contents. And is taught another with its contents but not with it. And not difficult: this with regard to water, this with regard to wine, this with regard to oil.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Consecrate yourself to Me with this cup." One teaching states: with it and with what is inside it. And another teaching states: with it and not with what is inside it. And another teaching states: with what is inside it and not with it. And there is no difficulty: this one refers to water, this one refers to wine, this one refers to oil.

hebrew_text: אִם הִטְעָהּ לְשֶׁבַח הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן יַיִן וְנִמְצָא חוֹמֶץ, חוֹמֶץ וְנִמְצָא יַיִן – שְׁנֵיהֶם יְכוֹלִין לַחֲזוֹר בָּהֶם. אַלְמָא, אִיכָּא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּחַלָּא וְאִיכָּא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּחַמְרָא. הָכָא נָמֵי: אִיכָּא נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּכַסְפָּא וְלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּדַהֲבָא!
human_translation: If he misled her to advantage, betrothed. But doesn’t Rabbi Shimon accept wine and it was found vinegar, vinegar and it was found wine, both can retract from Apparently, there is for whom preferable vinegar and there is for whom preferable wine. here too, there is for whom preferable silver and not preferable for him gold.
llm_translation: If he misled her for praise, behold, she is sanctified. And according to Rabbi Shimon, if it was wine and it turned into vinegar, vinegar and it turned into wine - both are capable of reverting. This implies that there are those who are pleased with milk and there are those who are pleased with wine. Here too: there are those who are pleased with silver and not pleased with gold!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי דְּיָתֵיב וְקָמַסְבַּר לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָמַר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״הַלְוֵינִי דִּינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, וְלֵךְ וְקַדֵּשׁ לִי אִשָּׁה פְּלוֹנִית״ וְהָלַךְ וְהִלְוָה שֶׁל זָהָב. מָר סָבַר: קְפֵידָא. וּמָר סָבַר: מַרְאֶה מָקוֹם הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi says: I found Abaye sitting and explaining to his son: With what are we dealing here? where one said to his agent: Lend me a dinar of silver and go and betroth for me such and such a woman and he went and lent of gold Sage, holds particular And Sage, holds he is indicating to him.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: I found Abaye sitting and thinking to himself: What are we dealing with here? For example, if someone said to his messenger, "Lend me a silver dinar, and go and betroth a certain woman for me," and he went and lent a gold dinar. One Master thought: Precision is required. And one Master thought: It is a matter of the place he is from.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי״? ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לוֹ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! הִטְעָהּ לְשֶׁבַח? הִטְעָהוּ לְשֶׁבַח מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! ״נִמְצָא״ מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי דְּזָהָב הֲוָה!
human_translation: If so, Be betrothed to me? should have Be betrothed to him. He misled her to advantage? should have He misled him to advantage, found from the outset, it was also of gold.
llm_translation: So is it, "Sanctify yourself to Me"? "Sanctify yourself to Him" - who requires it of him! Did he make a mistake for praise? Did he make a mistake for praise - who requires it of him! "Found" from the outset was like gold!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֲנִי וַאֲרִי שֶׁבַּחֲבוּרָה (תַּרְגֵּימְנָא) [תַּרְגֵּימְנוּהָ] וּמַנּוּ – רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָמְרָה הִיא לִשְׁלוּחָהּ ״צֵא וְקַבֵּל לִי קִדּוּשַׁי מִפְּלוֹנִי שֶׁאָמַר לִי הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּדִינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף״ וְהָלַךְ וְנָתַן לוֹ דִּינָר שֶׁל זָהָב, מָר סָבַר: קְפֵידָא, וּמָר סָבַר: מַרְאֶה מָקוֹם הִיא לוֹ, וּמַאי ״נִמְצָא״ – דְּקָא צַיִיר בִּבְלִיתָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: I and the lion of the group explained it, And who is Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin: With what are we dealing here? where she said to her agent: Go and accept my betrothal for me from so-and-so, who said to me: Be betrothed to me with a dinar of silver, and went and gave a dinar of gold. Sage, holds particular And Sage, holds she is indicating to him And what found, where was wrapped in a cloth,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: I and the lion in the group (we translated it) and counted - Rabbi Chiya bar Avin, here with what are we dealing - for example, if she said to her messenger, "Go and receive my betrothal from so-and-so who told me, 'Be betrothed to me with a silver dinar,'" and he went and gave him a gold dinar, one master thinks: it is a fine, and one master thinks: it is a showing of place, and what is "it was found" - that he drew with a pen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ מַרְאֶה מָקוֹם הוּא לוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Shimon, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Rabbi Elazar, they all hold he is indicating to him, Rabbi Shimon this that we said. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel as we learned
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Shimon, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Rabbi Elazar all hold the opinion that it is a proper place for him. Rabbi Shimon - as we said, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel - as we learned:

hebrew_text: גֵּט פָּשׁוּט, עֵדָיו מִתּוֹכוֹ. מְקוּשָּׁר, עֵדָיו מֵאֲחוֹרָיו. פָּשׁוּט שֶׁכָּתְבוּ עֵדָיו מֵאֲחוֹרָיו, וּמְקוּשָּׁר שֶׁכָּתְבוּ עֵדָיו מִתּוֹכוֹ – שְׁנֵיהֶם פְּסוּלִים. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מְקוּשָּׁר שֶׁכָּתְבוּ עֵדָיו מִתּוֹכוֹ – כָּשֵׁר, שֶׁיָּכוֹל לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ פָּשׁוּט. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: an ordinary document, its witnesses inside it, tied its witnesses on the back of it. an ordinary whose witnesses wrote on the back of it, or a tied whose witnesses wrote inside of it, both of these not valid. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says: A tied whose witnesses wrote inside of it valid, because one can transform it into an ordinary Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Everything in accordance with regional custom.
llm_translation: Get pashtut, eidav mitokho. Me'kushar, eidav me'akhorav. Pashtut shekatvu eidav me'akhorav, u'mekushar shekatvu eidav mitokho - shneihem pesulim. Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel omer: Me'kushar shekatvu eidav mitokho - kasher, sheyakhol la'asoto pashtut. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel omer: Hakol keminhag hamedinah.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא לֵית לֵיהּ מִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה? וְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּאַתְרָא דִּנְהִיגִי בְּפָשׁוּט וַעֲבַד לֵיהּ מְקוּשָּׁר, אִי נָמֵי: בְּאַתְרָא דִּנְהִיגִי בִּמְקוּשָּׁר וַעֲבַד לֵיהּ פָּשׁוּט – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּוַדַּאי קְפִידָא.
human_translation: And we discussed it: And does the first tanna not accept regional custom? And Rav Ashi says in a place where the custom is an ordinary and he made a tied one for him; alternatively, in a place where the custom is a tied and he made an ordinary for him; everyone agrees that certainly particular
llm_translation: We were learning in it: And the first Tanna does not have the custom of the province? And Rav Ashi said: In a place where they are accustomed to wear it loosely, and he wears it tied, or in a place where they are accustomed to wear it tied, and he wears it loosely - everyone agrees that this is certainly not considered a violation.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי, בְּאַתְרָא דִּנְהִיגִי בֵּין בְּפָשׁוּט בֵּין בִּמְקוּשָּׁר, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עֲבֵיד לִי פָּשׁוּט״, וַאֲזַל וַעֲבַד לֵיהּ מְקוּשָּׁר. מָר סָבַר: קְפֵידָא, וּמָר סָבַר: מַרְאֶה מָקוֹם הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: in which they disagree in a place where the custom is either an ordinary or a tied and said to Make an ordinary for me, and went and made a tied for him. Sage, holds particular And Sage, holds indicating position to
llm_translation: When they disputed, in a place where they were accustomed, whether in a simple manner or in a complex manner, and he said to him: "Do it for me simply," and he went and did it for him in a complex manner. One Master thought: Precision, and one Master thought: It is a matter of appearance for him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – דִּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וְקִבֵּל לָהּ גִּיטָּהּ מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר – פָּסוּל, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַכְשִׁיר. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: מַרְאָה מָקוֹם הִיא לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar as we learned a woman who said Receive my bill of divorce for me in such and such a place, and he received her bill of divorce for her elsewhere, it is invalid. And Rabbi Elazar deems it valid. Apparently, he holds she is indicating a place to him
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar - as we learned: A woman who said, "Accept my get from so-and-so's place," and he gave her the get from a different place - it is invalid, but Rabbi Elazar deems it valid. This implies that he holds: It is his place that he sees.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁבַח מָמוֹן, אֲבָל בְּשֶׁבַח יוּחֲסִין, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מַאי טַעְמָא – ״מְסָאנָא דְּרַב מִכַּרְעַאי לָא בָּעֵינָא״. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אִם הִטְעָהּ לִשְׁבַח יוּחֲסִים אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Ulla says: dispute with enhanced monetary But with enhanced lineage, everyone agrees she is not betrothed. What is the reason I do not desire a shoe that is larger than my foot. This is also taught Rabbi Shimon concedes if he misled her with enhanced lineage, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: Ula said: A dispute regarding praise of wealth, but in praise of lineage, everyone agrees - it does not sanctify. What is the reason? "The support of Rav's legs, I do not need." It was also taught likewise: Rabbi Shimon concedes, if one erred in praising lineage, it does not sanctify.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא. דְּקָתָנֵי: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי כֹּהֵן״ וְנִמְצָא לֵוִי, ״לֵוִי״ וְנִמְצָא כֹּהֵן, נָתִין וְנִמְצָא מַמְזֵר, ״מַמְזֵר״ וְנִמְצָא נָתִין. וְלָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: the mishna is also precise, as teaches: On the condition that I am a priest, and he was found a Levite; a Levite, and he was found a priest; a Gibeonite, and he was found a mamzer , a mamzer , and he was found a Gibeonite, And Rabbi Shimon does not disagree
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise. As it teaches: "On the condition that I am a Kohen," and it turns out he is a Levi, "Levi" and it turns out he is a Kohen, he is given and it turns out he is a Mamzer, "Mamzer" and it turns out he is given. And Rabbi Shimon does not disagree.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא דְּקָתָנֵי: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בַּת אוֹ שִׁפְחָה מְגוּדֶּלֶת״ וְאֵין לוֹ, עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לוֹ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ, דִּשְׁבַח מָמוֹן הוּא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא פְּלִיג?!
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi objects to this But that is taught On the condition that I have a grown daughter or maidservant, and he does not have on the condition that he does not have and he does have which is enhanced monetary also that does not disagree
llm_translation: The Master, Bar Rav Ashi, objects to her: Rather, it should be taught: "On the condition that I have a daughter or a maidservant being raised." And if he does not have, on the condition that he does not have and he does have, for it is praiseworthy wealth, is it not so that they do not disagree?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּלִיג בְּרֵישָׁא וְהוּא הַדִּין לְסֵיפָא. הָכָא נָמֵי פְּלִיג בְּרֵישָׁא וְהוּא הַדִּין לְסֵיפָא.
human_translation: Rather, he disagrees in the first clause and the same is true with regard to the latter clause, Here too, he disagrees in the first clause, and the same is true with regard to the latter clause.
llm_translation: Rather, he disputes in the beginning, and the same applies to the end. Here too, he disputes in the beginning, and the same applies to the end.

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? הָתָם, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דִּשְׁבַח מָמוֹן, פְּלִיג בְּרֵישָׁא וְהוּא הַדִּין בְּסֵיפָא. הָכָא, דִּשְׁבַח יוּחֲסִים הוּא, אִם אִיתָא דִּפְלִיג, נִתְנֵי!
human_translation: How can be compared? There, both this and that of enhanced monetary he disagreed in the first clause and the same is true in the last clause, here, is of enhanced lineage, if it is so that disagrees, let him teach
llm_translation: So now? There, because both of them praise money, they argue in the beginning and it is the same in the end. Here, it is praise of lineage. If it comes that they argue, let it be given!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי שְׁבַח יוּחֲסִים, מִי סָבְרַתְּ מַאי מְגוּדֶּלֶת – גְּדוֹלָה מַמָּשׁ? מַאי מְגוּדֶּלֶת – גַּדֶּלֶת, דְּאָמְרָה הִיא: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּשָׁקְלָה מִילֵּי מִינַּאי וְאָזְלָא נָדְיָא קַמֵּי שִׁיבָבוֹתַיי.
human_translation: If you wish, say Here too, enhanced lineage, Do you maintain what a grown actually grown what Grown? grows Because she say: not satisfactory for me as she will take words from me and will go pass before my neighbors,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Here, it is discussing praise of lineage. Who holds that what is greatness - actual greatness? What is greatness - tallness, as it says: "I do not like that she took my words and went away before my elders."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי קַרְיָינָא״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁקָּרָא שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר עַד שֶׁיִּקְרָא וִיתַרְגֵּם. יְתַרְגֵּם מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ?! וְהָתַנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמְתַרְגֵּם פָּסוּק כְּצוּרָתוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה בַּדַּאי. וְהַמּוֹסִיף עָלָיו – הֲרֵי זֶה מְחָרֵף וּמְגַדֵּף. אֶלָּא מַאי תַּרְגּוּם – תַּרְגּוּם דִּידַן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: on the condition that I am literate once he has read three verses in the synagogue she is betrothed. Rabbi Yehuda says until he reads and translates one translates his own understanding? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: One who translates a verse literally is a liar, and one who adds is curses and blasphemes Rather, which translation our translation.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "On the condition that I am called," once one reads three verses in the synagogue - she is betrothed. Rabbi Yehuda says, until he reads and translates. Translate from his own knowledge?! But it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, one who translates a verse literally - this is praiseworthy. And one who adds to it - this is a disgrace and a blasphemy. Rather, what is the translation - our translation.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״קַרְיָינָא״, אֲבָל אָמַר לַהּ: ״קָרָא אֲנָא״ – עַד דְּקָרֵי אוֹרָיְיתָא נְבִיאֵי וּכְתוּבֵי בְּדִיּוּקָא.
human_translation: And this statement applies if he said to her: I am literate, but he said to her: I am a reader, unless to read the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings with precision.
llm_translation: And these are the words that he said to her: "Qaryana," but he said to her: "Qara ana" - until he reads the Torah, Prophets, and Writings with precision.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה״, חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: הֲלָכוֹת, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: on the condition that I study [ shoneh ], Ḥizkiyya says halakhot , and Rabbi Yoḥanan says Torah,
llm_translation: "Because I am different," Hezekiah said: Halakhot, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Torah.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵיזוֹ הִיא מִשְׁנָה? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הֲלָכוֹת, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִדְרָשׁ!
human_translation: raises an objection What is Mishna? Rabbi Meir says halakhot , Rabbi Yehuda says homiletics.
llm_translation: Challenger: What is Mishnah? Rabbi Meir says: Halakhot, Rabbi Yehuda says: Midrash!

hebrew_text: מַאי תּוֹרָה – מִדְרַשׁ תּוֹרָה. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: ״תָּנֵינָא״, אֲבָל אֲמַר לַהּ: ״תַּנָּא אֲנָא״, עַד דְּתָנֵי הִילְכְתָא, סִפְרָא, וְסִיפְרֵי, וְתוֹסֶפְתָּא.
