human_translation: What Torah, homiletic of the Torah. And this statement applies if he said to her: I study [ taneina ]. But he says to her: I am a tanna [ tanna ana ], unless he studies halakha , Sifra and Sifrei , and Tosefta .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is Torah? - Interpretation of Torah. And these matters that he said to her: 'We have learned,' but he said to her: 'I have taught,' until he teaches Halakha, Sifra, and Sifrei, and Tosefta."

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי תַּלְמִיד״ – אֵין אוֹמְרִים כְּשִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי וּכְשִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זוֹמָא, אֶלָּא, כֹּל שֶׁשּׁוֹאֲלִין אוֹתוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם דָּבָר אֶחָד בְּתַלְמוּדוֹ וְאוֹמְרוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּמַסֶּכְתָּא דְכַלָּה. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי חָכָם״ – אֵין אוֹמְרִים כְּחַכְמֵי יַבְנֶה, כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וַחֲבֵירָיו, אֶלָּא, כֹּל שֶׁשּׁוֹאֲלִים אוֹתוֹ דְּבַר חׇכְמָה בְּכׇל מָקוֹם וְאוֹמְרָהּ.
human_translation: on the condition that I am a student one does not say like Shimon ben Azzai or like Shimon ben Zoma, Rather, anyone who, he is asked one matter in any topic of his studies, and can say and even in tractate of Kalla . on the condition that I am a scholar, one does not say like the scholars of Yavne, like Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues. Rather, anyone who, he is asked a matter of wisdom on any topic and can say
llm_translation: "Regarding 'on the condition that I am a student' – one does not say like Shimon ben Azzai and like Shimon ben Zoma, rather, anyone that they ask him in any place one thing in his learning and he says it, even in the tractate of Ketubot. 'On the condition that I am a wise man' – one does not say like the sages of Yavneh, like Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues, rather, anyone that they ask him a matter of wisdom in any place and he says it."

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי גִּבּוֹר״ – אֵין אוֹמְרִים כְּאַבְנֵר בֶּן נֵר וּכְיוֹאָב בֶּן צְרוּיָה, אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁחֲבֵירָיו מִתְיָרְאִים מִמֶּנּוּ מִפְּנֵי גְבוּרָתוֹ. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי עָשִׁיר״ – אֵין אוֹמְרִים כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַרְסוֹם וּכְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁבְּנֵי עִירוֹ מְכַבְּדִים אוֹתוֹ מִפְּנֵי עוֹשְׁרוֹ.
human_translation: on the condition that I am strong, one does not say as Abner ben Ner, or as Joab ben Zeruiah, Rather, anyone of whom others are afraid due to his strength. on the condition that I am wealthy, one does not say as Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥarsom or as Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, but anyone who is honored by the members of his town due to his wealth.
llm_translation: "‘For I am mighty’ – one does not say like Abner son of Ner and like Joab son of Zeruiah, but rather everyone whom his peers fear him because of his might. ‘For I am rich’ – one does not say like Rabbi Elazar ben Charsum and like Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, but rather all the inhabitants of his city honor him because of his wealth."

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי צַדִּיק״ – אֲפִילּוּ רָשָׁע גָּמוּר – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁמָּא הִרְהֵר תְּשׁוּבָה בְּדַעְתּוֹ. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי רָשָׁע״ – אֲפִילּוּ צַדִּיק גָּמוּר – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁמָּא הִרְהֵר דְּבַר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּדַעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: on the condition that I am righteous man, even if a completely wicked man she is betrothed, perhaps he had thoughts of repentance in his mind on the condition that I am a wicked man, even a completely righteous man she is betrothed, perhaps he had thoughts of idol worship in his mind,
llm_translation: "‘For I am righteous’ – even if he is completely wicked – she is sanctified, lest he entertain thoughts of repentance in his mind. ‘For I am wicked’ – even if he is completely righteous – she is sanctified, lest he entertain thoughts of idolatry in his mind."

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים חׇכְמָה יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶחָד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים יוֹפִי יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וְאֶחָד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים עֲשִׁירוּת יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה רוֹמִי וְאֶחָד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים עֲנִיּוּת יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה בָּבֶל וְאֶחָד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים גַּסּוּת יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה עֵילָם וְאֶחָד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Ten kav wisdom descended to the world; Eretz Yisrael took nine and all the world one. Ten kav beauty descended to the world; Jerusalem took nine and all the world in its entirety one. Ten kav wealth descended to the world; Rome took nine and all the world in its entirety one. Ten kav poverty descended to the world; Babylonia took nine and all the world in its entirety one. Ten kav arrogance descended to the world; Eilam took nine and all the world in its entirety one.
llm_translation: Ten kavim of wisdom descended to the world, nine were taken by the land of Israel and one the entire world. Ten kavim of beauty descended to the world, nine were taken by Jerusalem and one the entire world. Ten kavim of wealth descended to the world, nine were taken by Rome and one the entire world. Ten kavim of poverty descended to the world, nine were taken by Babylon and one the entire world. Ten kavim of arrogance descended to the world, nine were taken by Edom and one the entire world.

hebrew_text: וְגַסּוּת לְבָבֶל לָא נְחִית? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וָאֶשָּׂא עֵינַי וָאֵרֶא וְהִנֵּה שְׁתַּיִם נָשִׁים יוֹצְאוֹת וְרוּחַ בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם וְלָהֵנָּה כְנָפַיִם כְּכַנְפֵי הַחֲסִידָה וְתִשְׁנֶה אֶת הָאֵיפָה בֵּין הָאָרֶץ וּבֵין הַשָּׁמָיִם. וָאֹמַר אֶל הַמַּלְאָךְ הַדֹּבֵר בִּי אָנָה הֵמָּה מוֹלִכוֹת אֶת הָאֵיפָה. וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי לִבְנוֹת לָהֿ בַיִת בְּאֶרֶץ שִׁנְעָר״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ חֲנוּפָּה וְגַסּוּת הָרוּחַ שֶׁיָּרְדוּ לְבָבֶל!
human_translation: But did arrogance not descend to Babylonia? But isn’t it written: “Then I lifted my eyes and saw, and behold there came forth two women, and the wind was in their wings, for they had wings like the wings of a stork. And they lifted up the measure between the earth and the heaven. Then I said to the angel that spoke with me: ‘To where do they take the measure?’ And he said to me: ‘To build her a house in the land of Shinar’” And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This flattery and arrogance that descended to Babylonia,
llm_translation: "And arrogance of Babylon did not descend? And it is written: 'Then I lifted up my eyes and looked, and behold, two women were coming out with the wind in their wings; and they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the ephah between the earth and the sky.' And I said to the angel who was speaking with me, 'Where are they taking the ephah?' And he said to me, 'To build a temple for her in the land of Shinar.' And Rabbi Yochanan said: This is hypocrisy and the arrogance of the spirit that descended to Babylon!"

hebrew_text: אִין, לְהָכָא נְחִית, וְאִשְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי הוּא דְּאִשְׁתַּרְבּוּב לְהָתָם. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: ״לִבְנוֹת לָהּ בַּיִת״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Yes, it descended to here, and it made its way to there, is also precise, as it teaches: “To build her a house,” Conclude from it
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "Here, it is not, and it is a matter of multiplication, for it multiplies there. It is specifically stated in the verse: 'To build her a house,' learn from it."

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר מָר: סִימָן לְגַסּוּת – עֲנִיּוּת, וַעֲנִיּוּת בְּבָבֶל הוּא דְּאִיכָּא! מַאי עֲנִיּוּת – עֲנִיּוּת דְּתוֹרָה. דִּכְתִיב: ״אָחוֹת לָנוּ קְטַנָּה וְשָׁדַיִם אֵין לָהּ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ עֵילָם, שֶׁזָּכְתָה לִלְמוֹד, וְלֹא זָכְתָה לְלַמֵּד.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t the Master say: A sign of arrogance poverty, and there is poverty in Babylonia, what poverty poverty with regard to Torah, As it is written: “We have a little sister, and she has no breasts” and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This Eilam, whose merited to learn but did not merit to teach.
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Mar say: A sign of arrogance is poverty, and there is poverty in Babylonia! What is the poverty? The poverty of Torah. As it is written: "Our sister is young, and she has no breasts," and Rabbi Yochanan said: This refers to Elam, who merited to learn but did not merit to teach.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים גְּבוּרָה יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלוּ פָּרְסִיִּים וְכוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים כִּנִּים יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה מָדַי כּוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים כְּשָׁפִים יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה מִצְרַיִם כּוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים נְגָעִים יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלוּ חֲזִירִים כּוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים זְנוּת יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה עַרְבִיָּא כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Ten kav strength descended to the world; the Persians took nine Ten kav lice descended to the world; Media took nine Ten kav witchcraft descended to the world; Egypt took nine Ten kav plagues descended to the world; pigs, took nine Ten kav licentiousness descended to the world; Arabia took nine
llm_translation: Ten kavim of strength descended to the world, nine were taken by Persia, etc. Ten kavim of nests descended to the world, nine were taken by Media, etc. Ten kavim of magic descended to the world, nine were taken by Egypt, etc. Ten kavim of plagues descended to the world, nine were taken by swine, etc. Ten kavim of promiscuity descended to the world, nine were taken by Arabia, etc.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים עַזּוּת יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה מֵישָׁן כּוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים שִׂיחָה יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלוּ נָשִׁים כּוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים שִׁכְרוּת יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלוּ כּוּשִׁים כּוּ׳. עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּים שֵׁינָה יָרְדוּ לָעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלוּ עֲבָדִים וְאֶחָד נָטְלוּ כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Ten kav brazenness descended to the world; Meishan, took nine Ten kav conversation descended to the world; women took nine Ten kav drunkenness descended to the world; the Kushites took nine Ten kav sleep descended to the world; slaves took nine and all the world in its entirety took one.
llm_translation: Ten kavim of impudence descended to the world, nine were taken from the sleep, as it is said: "Ten kavim of impudence descended to the world, nine were taken by women," as it is said: "Ten kavim of impudence descended to the world, nine were taken by Kushites," as it is said: "Ten kavim of impudence descended to the world, nine were taken by slaves, and one was taken by the entire world."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲנִי כֹּהֵן״ וְנִמְצָא לֵוִי, ״לֵוִי״ וְנִמְצָא כֹּהֵן, ״נָתִין״ וְנִמְצָא מַמְזֵר. ״מַמְזֵר״ וְנִמְצָא נָתִין, ״בֶּן עִיר״ וְנִמְצָא בֶּן כְּרַךְ, ״בֶּן כְּרַךְ״ וְנִמְצָא בֶּן עִיר. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁבֵּיתִי קָרוֹב לַמֶּרְחָץ״ וְנִמְצָא רָחוֹק, ״רָחוֹק״ וְנִמְצָא קָרוֹב.
human_translation: on the condition that I am a priest, and he was found a Levite; A Levite, and he was found a priest; a Gibeonite, and he was found a mamzer , A mamzer , and he was found a Gibeonite; a resident of town, and he was found a resident of city; A resident of a city, and he was found a resident of a town; on the condition that my house is close to the bathhouse, and it was found far; Far and it was found close,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "On the condition that I am a Kohen," and it turns out he is a Levi; "Levi," and it turns out he is a Kohen; "Netin," and it turns out he is a Mamzer; "Mamzer," and it turns out he is a Netin; "Ben Ir," and it turns out he is a Ben Karach; "Ben Karach," and it turns out he is a Ben Ir. "On the condition that my house is close to the bathhouse," and it turns out it is far; "far," and it turns out it is close.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בַּת אוֹ שִׁפְחָה מְגוּדֶּלֶת״ וְאֵין לוֹ, אוֹ ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לוֹ״ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים״ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ, אוֹ עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ וְאֵין לוֹ. וּבְכוּלָּם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרָה: ״בְּלִבִּי הָיָה לְהִתְקַדֵּשׁ לוֹ״ – אַף עַל פִּי כֵן אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְכֵן הִיא שֶׁהִטְעַתּוּ.
human_translation: on the condition that he has a grown daughter or a maidservant, and he does not have or on the condition that he does not have and he has on the condition that he has no sons, and he has or on the condition that he has and he does not have And in all these despite that she stated: I intended to become betrothed to him nevertheless, she is not betrothed. And similarly, she who misled him
llm_translation: "Regarding a case where he has a daughter or a maidservant who is grown, and he does not have, or 'regarding a case where he does not have' and he has. 'Regarding a case where he does not have children' and he has, or regarding a case where he has and he does not have. And in all of them, even though she said: 'In my heart was to sanctify myself to him' – nevertheless, she is not sanctified. And so it is that they deceived him."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין לְנִכְסֵיהּ אַדַּעְתָּא לְמִיסַּק לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּבְעִידָּנָא דְּזַבֵּין לָא אֲמַר וְלָא מִידֵּי. אָמַר רָבָא: הָוֵי דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב, וּדְבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָם דְּבָרִים. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא הָא? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: a certain man who sold his property with the intention of ascending to Eretz Yisrael, but at the time that he sold he did not say anything Rava said: that is matter that in the heart, and matters that in the heart are not matters. From where does Rava this If we say from that which we learn
llm_translation: The man who was selling his property in order to go to the Land of Israel, and at the time of selling he did not say anything. Rava said: Words that are in the heart are not considered words. How does Rava know this? From what we learned:

hebrew_text: ״יַקְרִיב אֹתוֹ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ. יָכוֹל בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִרְצֹנוֹ״.
human_translation: “he shall offer it” teaches that they coerce him might against his will, the verse states: “According to his will.”
llm_translation: "Yakriv oto" - teaches that they force him. Could it be against his will? The Torah teaches: "For his acceptance."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? – כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר: ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״. וְאַמַּאי? הָא בְּלִבֵּיהּ לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָן דְּבָרִים? וְדִילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דַּאֲנַן סָהֲדִי דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּכַפָּרָה.
human_translation: How these They coerce him until he says: I want But why but in his heart it is not satisfactory for him Rather, is it not because we say: matters that in the heart are not matters, But perhaps there it is different, since is clear to us that it is satisfactory for him to atonement,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? - They force him until he says, "I want." And why? This is not pleasing to him in his heart! Rather, is it not because we say: Words that are not in the heart are not words? And perhaps it is different there, for we testify that it is pleasing to him in atonement.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים, כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר: ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״. וְאַמַּאי? הָא בְּלִבֵּיהּ לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָן דְּבָרִים? וְדִילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִצְוָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rather, from the latter clause And similarly, you find with bills of divorce of women and of manumission of slaves they coerce him until he says: I want But why but in his heart it is not satisfactory for him Rather, is it not because we say matters that in the heart are not matters? But perhaps there it is different, because it is a mitzva to listen statements of the Sages,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from the latter part: And similarly, you find in bills of divorce of women and deeds of manumission of slaves, we compel him until he says, "I desire." And why? Because it is not pleasing to him in his heart! Rather, is it not because we say that matters of the heart are not considered matters? Perhaps it is different there, because it is a mitzvah to hear the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, מֵהָכָא: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְאָמַר: כְּסָבוּר הָיִיתִי שֶׁהִיא כֹּהֶנֶת וַהֲרֵי הִיא לְוִיָּה, לְוִיָּה וְנִמְצֵאת כֹּהֶנֶת, עֲנִיָּיה וַהֲרֵי הִיא עֲשִׁירָה, עֲשִׁירָה וַהֲרֵי הִיא עֲנִיָּיה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הִטְעַתּוּ. וְאַמַּאי? הָא קָאָמַר כְּסָבוּר הָיִיתִי! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָן דְּבָרִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּלְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef says: from here one who betroths a woman and he said: I thought that she was a priest, and she is a Levite; she a Levite, and she is found a priest; she poor, and she is wealthy; she wealthy, and she is poor, she is betrothed because she did not mislead him. But why but he said: I thought Rather, because we say matters that in the heart are not matters. Abaye said to him: Perhaps it is different there, since as a stringency,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said from here: One who betroths a woman and says, "I thought she was a Kohenet, but she is actually a Leviah; she is a Leviah, and it turns out she is a Kohenet; she is poor, but she is actually rich; she is rich, but she is actually poor," she is sanctified, because he did not deceive her. And why? Is it because he said, "I thought"? Rather, it is because we say that matters of the heart are not considered words. Abbaye said to him: Perhaps it is different there, due to stringency.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, מֵהָכָא: בְּכוּלָּם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרָה ״בְּלִבִּי הָיָה לְהִתְקַדֵּשׁ לוֹ״ – אַף עַל פִּי כֵן אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְאַמַּאי? הָא קָאָמְרָה ״בְּלִבִּי הָיָה״! וְדִילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאַתְנִיה לָאו כֹּל כְּמִינַּהּ דְּעָקְרָא לֵהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said from here, And in all these despite that she stated: I intended to become betrothed to him nevertheless, she is not betrothed. But why but she said: I intended But perhaps it is different there, as, since he stipulated it is not in her power to uproot his condition
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said from here: "In all of them," even though it says, "In my heart he was to be sanctified to him" - nevertheless, she is not sanctified. And why? Because she said, "In my heart he was"! But perhaps it is different there, since since she did not give him exactly like his species to her teachers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: עוֹבָדָא הֲוָה בֵּי רַב חִסְדָּא, וְרַב חִסְדָּא בֵּי רַב הוּנָא, וּפַשְׁטוּהָ מֵהָא: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי מִן הַחַלּוֹן אוֹ מִן הַדְּלוֹסְקָמָא״, וְהֵבִיא לוֹ. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת: ״לֹא הָיָה לִי בְּלִבִּי אֶלָּא עַל זֶה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֵבִיא לוֹ מִזֶּה – בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל. וְאַמַּאי? הָא קָאָמַר ״בְּלִבִּי״! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָן דְּבָרִים?
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin says: There was an incident Rav Ḥisda’s study hall, and Rav Ḥisda Rav Huna’s study hall, and they resolved it from this one who says to his agent: Bring me from the window or from the box [ hadeluskema ], and brought it to him, although the owner said: My intention was only from this once he brought to him from that the owner having misused But why but he said: My intention Rather, is it not because we say matters that in the heart are not matters?
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin: There was an incident at the house of Rav Ḥisdah, and Rav Ḥisdah was at the house of Rav Huna, and they derived it from this: One who says to his messenger, "Bring me from the window or from the balcony," and he brought it to him, even though the homeowner said, "I only had this in mind," since he brought it from the other place – the homeowner transgresses. And why? Is it because he said "in my mind"? Rather, is it not because we say that matters of the heart are not considered matters?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּלְמִיפְטַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ מִקׇּרְבָּן קָאָתֵי.
human_translation: But perhaps it is different there, that he is coming to exempt himself from an offering
llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there, for perhaps he is exempting himself from the offering.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר מֵזִיד הֲוָה! לָא עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ דִּמְשַׁוֵּי נַפְשֵׁיהּ רַשִּׁיעָא.
human_translation: he could have said was intentional, It is not common a person to place himself a wicked person
llm_translation: He had to say it intentionally! A person does not commit an act that makes him a wicked person.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה לֵיהּ לוֹמַר ״נִזְכַּרְתִּי״, דִּתְנַן: נִזְכַּר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְלֹא נִזְכַּר שָׁלִיחַ – שָׁלִיחַ מָעַל.
human_translation: he could have said: I remembered as we learned the owner remembered and the agent did not remember the agent misused
llm_translation: He had to say "I remembered," as we learned: The homeowner remembered, but the messenger did not remember - the messenger is negligent.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבְּנִינְהוּ לְנִיכְסֵיהּ אַדַּעְתָּא לְמִיסַּק לְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל. סְלֵיק וְלָא אִיתְּדַר לֵיהּ. אָמַר רָבָא: כֹּל דְּסָלֵיק – אַדַּעְתָּא לְמֵידַר הוּא, וְהָא לָא אִיתְּדַר לֵיהּ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אַדַּעְתָּא לְמִיסַּק, וְהָא סְלֵיק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: a certain man who sold his property with the intention of ascending to Eretz Yisrael He ascended but he was not able to settle Rava said: Whoever ascends with the intention of settling and he was not able to settle There are who say He intended to ascend and he ascended,
llm_translation: That man who purchased for himself a field in the land of Israel. He went up and did not find it. Rava said: Anyone who goes up - it is as if he has sold it, and this one did not find it. Some say: He purchased a field, and this one went up to it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבְּנִינְהוּ לְנִיכְסֵיהּ אַדַּעְתָּא לְמִיסַּק לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְסוֹף לָא סְלֵיק. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִי בָּעֵי, סָלֵיק. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אִי בָּעֵי, לָא סָלֵיק? מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּאִיתְיְלִיד אוּנְסָא בְּאוֹרְחָא.
human_translation: a certain man who sold his property with the intention of ascending to Eretz Yisrael, ultimately he did not ascend Rav Ashi said: If he wanted he could have ascended. There are who say If he wanted couldn’t he have ascended? What between There is a between them when circumstances beyond his control along the way,
llm_translation: That man who purchased for himself a ship to travel to the land of Israel, in the end did not embark. Rav Ashi said: If he wants, he will embark. Some say: If he wants, he will not embark? What is the difference between them? The difference between them is that there is a possibility of danger on the way.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״צֵא וְקַדֵּשׁ לִי אִשָּׁה פְּלוֹנִית בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ וְהָלַךְ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״הֲרֵי הִיא בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: one who says to his agent: Go and betroth for me so-and-so in such and such a place, and went and betrothed her in a different place, she is not betrothed, she is in such and such a place; and betrothed her in a different place, she is betrothed,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says to his messenger, "Go and betroth for me a certain woman in a certain place," and he goes and betroths her in a different place - she is not betrothed. If he says, "Here she is in a certain place," and he betroths her in a different place - she is betrothed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי גִיטִּין: הָאוֹמֵר ״תְּנוּ גֵּט זֶה לְאִשְׁתִּי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – פָּסוּל, ״הֲרֵי הִיא בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״ וּנְתָנוֹ לָהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And we also learned with regard to bills of divorce one who says Give this bill of divorce to my wife in such and such a place, and they gave to her in another place, invalid. She is in such and such a place, and they gave to her in another place, valid.
llm_translation: Gemara: And we learned in the Mishnah in the matter of divorce documents: One who says, "Give this divorce document to my wife in such and such a place," and they gave it to her in a different place - it is invalid. But if he says, "Here she is in such and such a place," and they gave it to her in a different place - it is valid.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין – מִשּׁוּם דִּלְקָרוֹבַהּ קָאָתֵי, בְּהַאי אַתְרָא רָחֲמוּ לִי וְלָא מְמַלְּ[לִ]י מִילֵּי עִלָּוַי, בְּהַאי אַתְרָא סָנוּ לִי מְמַלְּ[לִ]י מִילֵּי עִלָּוַי. אֲבָל גַּבֵּי גִּיטִּין, דִּלְרַחוֹקַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֵימַר לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And necessary because had taught us with regard to betrothal, In a case when he is coming to draw her near They love me in this place and will not say remarks about me, they hate me in that place and will say remarks about me. But with regard to bills of divorce, when he is coming to distance her say he does not care
llm_translation: And it is necessary. For if we were to hear regarding betrothal - because she is close, in this place they would have mercy on me and not speak words against me, in this place they would hate me and speak words against me. But regarding divorce, because she is far, one might say it does not matter to him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן גַּבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין, בְּהַאי אַתְרָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִיבַּזֵּי, בְּהַאי אַתְרָא לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין – אֵימָא לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us with regard to divorce, in this place acceptable for him to degrade himself in that place not acceptable for him but with regard to betrothal, say he does not care necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear regarding divorces, in this place it is preferable for him that he should be in the category of those who are separated, in this place it is not preferable for him, but regarding betrothals - say that it is not difficult for him, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים, וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם וְנִמְצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ נְדָרִים – תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: one who betroths a woman on the condition that there are no vows upon her and it was found that there were vows upon her she is not betrothed, married her without specification, and it was found that there were vows upon her she is divorced without marriage contract,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths a woman on the condition that she has no vows upon her, and vows are found upon her - she is not betrothed. If he betroths her without any specific condition, and vows are found upon her - she may leave without a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין עָלֶיהָ מוּמִין וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. כְּנָסָהּ סְתָם וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּהּ מוּמִין – תֵּצֵא שֶׁלֹּא בִּכְתוּבָּה. שֶׁכׇּל הַמּוּמִין הַפּוֹסְלִין בַּכֹּהֲנִים פּוֹסְלִין בַּנָּשִׁים.
human_translation: on the condition that there are no blemishes upon her, and she was discovered to have blemishes, she is not betrothed. married her without specification and she was discovered to have blemishes, she is divorced without marriage contract. that all the blemishes that disqualify priests disqualify women
llm_translation: Regarding a case where it has no blemishes and blemishes are found in it - it is not sanctified. If one collected it without specifying and blemishes are found in it - it shall go out not according to the written law. For all blemishes that disqualify in the priests disqualify in the women.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא! הָכָא, קִידּוּשִׁין אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, תְּנָא כְּתוּבּוֹת אַטּוּ קִידּוּשִׁין, הָתָם, כְּתוּבּוֹת אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, תְּנָא קִידּוּשִׁין אַטּוּ כְּתוּבּוֹת.
human_translation: And we also learned like this with regard to marriage contracts, Here was necessary for betrothal, he taught marriage contracts due to betrothal; there was necessary for marriage contracts, he taught betrothal due to marriage contracts.
llm_translation: Gemara: And we learned in a Mishnah in front of the Scriptures, "For this is the case!" Here, regarding Kiddushin, it is necessary for him. The Tanna taught Scriptures first and then Kiddushin. There, regarding Scriptures, it is necessary for him. The Tanna taught Kiddushin first and then Scriptures.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, אוֹ אִשָּׁה אַחַת בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׁלַח סִבְלוֹנוֹת לְאַחַר מִכָּאן
human_translation: one who betroths two women with worth one peruta , or one woman with worth less than one peruta , despite that he later sent gifts [ sivlonot ]
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who betroths two women for the same value, or one woman for less than the same value, even though he sent his gifts to another place.

hebrew_text: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, שֶׁמֵּחֲמַת קִידּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שָׁלַח. וְכֵן קָטָן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ.
human_translation: she is not betrothed, because he sent on account of the first betrothal, And similarly, a minor who betrothed
llm_translation: "It is not sanctified, because due to the initial sanctifications it was sent. And so too a minor who sanctified."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, אַיְּידֵי דְּקָא נָפֵיק מָמוֹנָא מִינֵּיהּ – טָעֵי, אֲבָל פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, אֵימָא יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וְכִי קָא מְשַׁדַּר סִבְלוֹנוֹת – אַדַּעְתָּא דְּקִידּוּשִׁין קָא מְשַׁדַּר.
human_translation: And necessary As, had taught us worth one peruta , Since of his money goes out, he errs But worth less than one peruta , say: He knows that betrothal does not take effect with worth less than one peruta , and when he sends gifts he sends with the intention of betrothal,
llm_translation: Gemara: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear that it is equal to a perutah, since money is coming out of it - it is erroneous. But if it is less than equal to a perutah, say: perhaps he knows that betrothals do not take effect with less than a perutah. And when he sends his burdens - it is known that he is sending betrothals.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, מִשּׁוּם דְּבֵין פְּרוּטָה לְפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לָא קִים לְהוּ לְאִינָשֵׁי. אֲבָל קָטָן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ – הַכֹּל יוֹדְעִין שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשֵׁי קָטָן כְּלוּם, אֵימָא: כִּי קָא מְשַׁדַּר סִבְלוֹנוֹת אַדַּעְתָּא דְקִידּוּשֵׁי קָא מְשַׁדַּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And had he taught us these two because between one peruta and worth less than one peruta is not established to people, But a minor who betroths everyone knows that the betrothal of a minor is nothing, say when he sends gifts, he sends for the sake of betrothal, teaches us
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two, because between a small coin less than the value of a small coin is not established for people. But a minor who sanctified - everyone knows that the sanctification of a minor is nothing, say: when he sends his burdens, the knowledge of the sanctification is sent, he informs us.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְסִבְלוֹנוֹת. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְסִבְלוֹנוֹת. אָמַר רַבָּה: וּמוֹתְבִינַן אַשְּׁמַעְתִּין: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׁלַח סִבְלוֹנוֹת לְאַחַר מִכָּאן – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא: שֶׁמֵּחֲמַת קִידּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שָׁלַח.
human_translation: was stated Rav Huna says: One concerned about gifts. And Rabba similarly says one concerned about gifts. Rabba says: And we raised an objection against halakha of ours, Even if he sent gifts later, she is not betrothed. Abaye said to him: There, reason as it teaches: Because he sent on account of the first betrothal.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Huna said: We are concerned for miscarriages. And so said Rabbah: We are concerned for miscarriages. Rabbah said: And we are satisfied with what we have heard: Even though one sent miscarriages to another place from here - it is not sanctified! Abaye said to him: There, as it is taught in the reason: because of the sanctifications of the firstborns he sent.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבָּה: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא: שֶׁמֵּחֲמַת קִידּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שָׁלַח. הָכָא הוּא דְּטָעֵי. הָא בְּעָלְמָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: There are who say Rabba says: From where do I say the reason as teaches: Because he sent on account of the first betrothal. it is here since he erred But generally, does betrothal.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rabba said: From where do I say this to her, as it is taught in the reasoning: because of the first sanctifications he sent. Here is where he erred. That was in general sanctifications.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי: ״לָא מִיבַּעְיָא״ קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בְּעָלְמָא, דְּלָא נְחֵית לְתוֹרַת קִידּוּשִׁין כְּלָל, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הָכָא, דִּנְחֵית לְתוֹרַת קִידּוּשִׁין אֵימָא: הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Abaye is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary in general, when he had not entered the laws, of betrothal at all, Rather, even here when he has entered the laws of betrothal say should be betrothal. teaches us
llm_translation: Abaye said: "לָא מִיבַּעְיָא" - he means, not that he does not require it in general, for he does not descend to the level of the obligation of sanctification, but even here, where he does descend to the level of the obligation of sanctification, why not say: Let them be sanctified, which implies to us.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְקַדְּשִׁי וַהֲדַר מְסַבְּלִי – חָיְישִׁינַן, מְסַבְּלִי וַהֲדַר מְקַדְּשִׁי – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: What was about it; Rav Pappa says: In a place where betroth and afterward send gifts we are concerned send gifts and afterward betroth we are not concerned
llm_translation: What is the case of the ascent? Rav Papa said: In a place where I sanctify and then carry - we are concerned; if I carry and then sanctify - we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: מִקׇּדְשֵׁי וַהֲדַר מְסַבְּלִי – פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּרוּבָּא מְקַדְּשִׁי וַהֲדַר מְסַבְּלִי, וּמִיעוּטָא מְסַבְּלִי וַהֲדַר מְקַדְּשִׁי. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נֵיחוּשׁ לְמִיעוּטָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: they betroth and afterward send gifts, is obvious No, necessary where most betroth and afterward send gifts, and a minority send gifts and afterward betroth Lest you say we should be concerned about the minority teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Mikdashay vehadar mesabbeli - peshita! La tzerikha, druba mekaddeshi vehadar mesabbeli, u'mi'uta mesabbeli vehadar mekaddeshi. Mahu d'teima: neichush l'mi'uta, ka mashma lan." English translation: "My sanctuaries and my adornments sustain me - it is obvious! It is not necessary, for much sanctifies and then sustains, and a little sustains and then sanctifies. What is the reason for concern about a little? It is evident to us."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא מֵרָבָא: הוּחְזַק שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה בַּשּׁוּק, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי (שֶׁמַּחְזִיק) [שֶׁהוּחְזַק] שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה בַּשּׁוּק נַחְזִיק בָּהּ כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ? מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְקַדְּשִׁי וַהֲדַר כָּתְבִי כְּתוּבָּה – חָיְישִׁינַן, כָּתְבִי וַהֲדַר מְקַדְּשִׁי – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna inquired of Rava: marriage contract was established, in the marketplace, what is said to him: And should we establish her as a married woman because a marriage contract was established in the marketplace? What was about it? Rav Ashi says: In a place where betroth and afterward write a marriage contract, we are concerned they write and afterward betroth we are not concerned.
llm_translation: Requested text: Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna from Rava asked: If a signed document is found in the marketplace, what is the law? He said to him: Just because a signed document is found in the marketplace, do we assume that it is valid like a married woman? What is the reasoning for this? Rav Ashi said: When it is found in a place where they consecrate documents, and then write it, we are concerned; but if they write it and then consecrate it, we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: מְקַדְּשִׁי וַהֲדַר כָּתְבִי – פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ סָפְרָא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא סָפְרָא הוּא דְּאִתְרְמִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: betroth and afterward write is obvious No, necessary where a scribe is not commonly available. Lest you say a scribe who happened teaches us
llm_translation: My sanctity and splendor, write - it is obvious! Not necessary, for a book is not common. What do you say, it is a book that is hidden, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ אוֹ אִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ כְּאַחַת – אֵינָן מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים וּבָהֶן שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְלִיקֵּט אָדָם אֶחָד כַּלְכַּלָּה שֶׁל תְּאֵנִים. וְשֶׁלָּהֶן הָיְתָה, וְשֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית הָיְתָה, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי כּוּלְּכֶם מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת לִי בְּכַלְכַּלָּה זוֹ״, וְקִיבְּלָה אַחַת מֵהֶן עַל יְדֵי כּוּלָּן. וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אֲחָיוֹת מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: one who betroths a woman and her daughter or a woman and her sister in one neither is betrothed. And an incident involving five women, and among them two sisters, and one person gathered a basket of figs that were from their and was of Sabbatical and he said: You are hereby all betrothed to me with this basket, and one of them accepted on behalf of all of them. And the Sages said: The sisters are not betrothed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths a woman and her daughter, or a woman and her sister together - they are not betrothed. There was an incident with five women, among them two sisters, and a man gathered a cluster of figs. It belonged to one of them, and it was the seventh year produce. And he said: "Behold, all of you are betrothed to me with this cluster." And one of them accepted it on behalf of all. The Sages said: Sisters are not betrothed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחֹתָהּ לֹא תִקָּח לִצְרֹר״, הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ צָרוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ, לֹא יְהֵא לוֹ לִיקּוּחִים אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וְנִכְרְתוּ הַנְּפָשׁוֹת הָעֹשֹׂת מִקֶּרֶב עַמָּם״ – אִי קִידּוּשִׁין לָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ, כָּרֵת מִי מִחַיַּיב?
human_translation: From where are these matters Rami bar Ḥama said: as the verse states: “And you shall not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival to her” The Torah states: When that they become rival wives to one another, he will not be able to take, even one of them. Rava said to him: If so, this, that it is written even the souls that do them shall be cut off from among their people” if betrothal does not take effect with her, renders liable to receive excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ]?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the law regarding the enjoyment of words? Ramei son of Hama said: As the verse states: "A woman to her sister you shall not take to be a rival," the Torah said: At the time when these rivals were made for each other, he should not have the right to take them even one of them. Rava said to him: If so, then is it not as it is written: "And the souls that do from among their people shall be cut off"? If he did not perform the betrothals, who is liable for the penalty of karet? English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: קְרָא בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, וּמַתְנִיתִין כִּדְרַבָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: The verse consecutively. And the mishna in accordance with of Rabba, as Rabba says: Any that cannot sequentially cannot be even simultaneously.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Scripture with this after that, and Mishnah in accordance with Rabba. For Rabba said: Anything that is not with this after that, even in one daughter, it is not.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַבָּה: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: the itself. Rabba says: Any that cannot sequentially cannot be even simultaneously. Abaye raised an objection to his
llm_translation: Body. Rabah said: Anything that is not one after the other, even in one daughter, it is not. Abaye raised an objection:

hebrew_text: הַמַּרְבֶּה בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר – פֵּירוֹתָיו מְתוּקָּנִים וּמַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו מְקוּלְקָלִין. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה אֲפִילּוּ בְּבַת אַחַת אֵינוֹ.
human_translation: one who increases tithes, his produce is rendered fit but the tithes are ruined, But why Let us say any that cannot sequentially cannot be even simultaneously.
llm_translation: The one who increases in tithing - his fruits are sweetened and his tithes are spoiled. And why? It is said: "Anything that is not after another, even in one daughter, it is not."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, דְּאִיתֵיהּ לַחֲצָאִים, דְּאִי אָמַר: ״תִּיקְדּוֹשׁ פַּלְגָא דְחִיטְּתָא״ – קָדְשָׁה.
human_translation: said to him: tithe is different, as takes effect partially, As, if one said: Let half of wheat be designated designated it.
llm_translation: He said to him: "The tithe is different, for it belongs to the priests, for if one were to say, 'Sanctify half a measure of wheat' - it is sanctified."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, דְּלֵיכָּא לַחֲצָאִין, וְלֵיכָּא בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה. וְאָמַר רָבָא: יָצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם בַּעֲשִׂירִי, וּקְרָאָן ״עֲשִׂירִי״ – עֲשִׂירִי וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְעוֹרָבִים זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: But isn’t there animal tithe, which does not take effect partially, And no sequentially, And Rava says: two emerged as the tenth, and he called them tenth, tenth and eleventh are intermingled with each other.
llm_translation: Behold, the tithe of an animal, where there are no halves, and there is no one after the other. And Rava said: Two go out on the tenth, and they read "tenth" - the tenth and one mixed with the other.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה, דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּטָעוּת. דִּתְנַן: קָרָא לַתְּשִׁיעִי ״עֲשִׂירִי״, וְלָעֲשִׂירִי ״תְּשִׁיעִי״, וְלָאַחַד עָשָׂר ״עֲשִׂירִי״ – שְׁלָשְׁתָּן מְקוּדָּשִׁין.
human_translation: Animal tithe is different, as can be in an error. As we learned called the ninth tenth, and the tenth ninth and the eleventh tenth, three are consecrated.
llm_translation: The tithes of an animal are different, for it has a mistake. As we learned: It says for the ninth "tenth," and for the tenth "ninth," and for the eleventh "tenth" - all three are sanctified.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי תּוֹדָה, דְּלֵיתַהּ בְּטָעוּת, וְלֵיתַהּ נָמֵי בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, וְאִיתְּמַר: תּוֹדָה שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה עַל שְׁמוֹנִים חַלּוֹת, חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: קָדְשִׁי לַהּ אַרְבָּעִים מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לָא קָדְשִׁי לַהּ אַרְבָּעִים מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים.
human_translation: There is a thanks-offering, which are not in error, and are also not sequentially. And it was stated a thanks-offering that was slaughtered by eighty loaves, Ḥizkiyya said: Forty of the eighty are consecrated, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Not forty of the eighty are consecrated.
llm_translation: Behold a thanksgiving offering, if it was not slaughtered mistakenly, and if it was not also mixed up one with another, and it was stated: a thanksgiving offering that was slaughtered for eighty loaves, Hezekiah said: my sanctification to Him is forty out of eighty. And Rabbi Yochanan said: my sanctification to Him is not forty out of eighty.

hebrew_text: לָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאָמַר: ״קָדְשִׁי לַהּ אַרְבָּעִים מִתּוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים״ – קָדְשִׁי, ״לֹא יִקְדְּשׁוּ אַרְבָּעִים אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קָדְשִׁי שְׁמוֹנִים״ – לָא קָדְשִׁי.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: All, concede anywhere that said: forty of the eighty be consecrated, are consecrated; Forty should not be consecrated unless eighty are consecrated, they are not consecrated.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If it was said regarding it, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Everyone agrees wherever it was said, 'My holy things for Him: forty out of eighty' - 'My holy things,' 'they shall not sanctify forty unless they sanctify My holy things: eighty' - 'not My holy things.'"

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בִּסְתָם, מָר סָבַר: לְאַחְרָיוּת קָא מִיכַּוַּון. וּמָר סָבַר: לְקׇרְבָּן גָּדוֹל קָא מִיכַּוַּון.
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to without specification Sage, holds: he intends to ensure And Sage, holds: intends a large offering
llm_translation: They only disputed in a general case, one Master holds: it is for the sake of succession. And the other Master holds: it is for the sake of a great offering.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא, לְמָה לֵיהּ לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי כְּרַבָּה? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And why does Rava explain in accordance with Rabba? Let him derive betrothal that is not given to consummation these are
llm_translation: Rava, why is it necessary for him to be called Rabbah? Let him go out for the betrothals that are not designated for intercourse.

hebrew_text: לִדְבָרָיו דְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: he stated in accordance with the statement of Rami bar Ḥama.
llm_translation: According to the words of Ramei bar Hama, he said.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין. אָמַר רָבָא: בַּר אֲהִינָא אַסְבְּרַהּ לִי: ״כִּי יִקַּח אִישׁ אִשָּׁה וּבְעָלָהּ״, קִידּוּשִׁין הַמְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה – הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין, קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה – לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: It was stated betrothal that is not given to consummation, Abaye says it is betrothal, Rava says: It is not betrothal. Rava says: bar Ahina explained to me “When a man takes a woman and engages in sexual intercourse with her” betrothal that is given to consummation is betrothal, betrothal that is not given to consummation is not betrothal.
llm_translation: It was stated: Betrothals that are not designated for consummation, Abbaye said: they are betrothals. Rava said: they are not betrothals. Rava said: Bar Ahina explained to me: "When a man takes a wife and marries her," betrothals designated for consummation - they are betrothals, betrothals that are not designated for consummation - they are not betrothals.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ אוֹ אִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ כְּאַחַת – אֵינָן מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת. הָא אַחַת מֵאִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ אוֹ מֵאִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְאַמַּאי? קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה נִינְהוּ! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרָבָא!
human_translation: We learned one who betroths a woman and her daughter or a woman and her sister in one neither is betrothed. But one of the woman or her daughter, or of the woman or her sister, she is betrothed. But why These are a betrothal that is not given to consummation, a conclusive refutation of Rava?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One who betroths a woman and her daughter, or a woman and her sister together - they are not betrothed. But if one of them is betrothed to him, either the daughter or the sister - she is betrothed. And why is this so? Because they are betrothals that are not designated for consummation! This is the statement of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים וּבָהֶן שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְלִיקֵּט אֶחָד כַּלְכַּלָּה שֶׁל תְּאֵנִים, וְשֶׁלָּהֶן הָיְתָה, וְשֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית הָיְתָה, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי כּוּלְּכֶם מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת לִי בְּכַלְכַּלָּה זוֹ״. וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אֲחָיוֹת מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת. אֲחָיוֹת הוּא דְּאֵינָן מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת, הָא נָכְרִיּוֹת – מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said to you And according to your reasoning say the latter clause An incident involving five women, and among them two sisters. And one gathered a basket of figs that were from their and was of the Sabbatical And he said: You are hereby all betrothed to me with this basket, And the Sages said: The sisters are not betrothed. it is the sisters who are not betrothed, but the unrelated women, are betrothed.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: And according to your reasoning, let me say the conclusion: There was an incident with five women, among them two sisters, and a basket of figs was gathered, and it belonged to them, and it was the seventh year produce, and he said: "Behold, all of you are sanctified to me with this basket." And the sages said: Sisters are not sanctified. Sisters who are not sanctified, but foreign women are sanctified.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵימָא דְּאָמַר ״כּוּלְּכֶם״ – ״קְנִי אַתְּ וַחֲמוֹר״ הוּא, וְ״אַתְּ וַחֲמוֹר״ לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that he said: You are all is Let you and the donkey acquire And you and the donkey not acquired
llm_translation: "How are they similar? Perhaps you will say, 'When it says 'all of you' – 'buy yourself and a donkey' is it, and 'buy yourself and a donkey' did not acquire."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: ״אַחַת מִכֶּם״ וְקָתָנֵי: אֵין אֲחָיוֹת מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת? לְרָבָא קַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא, לְאַבָּיֵי קַשְׁיָא סֵיפָא. אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, רָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not where he said to them: One of you and it teaches the sisters are not betrothed, first clause is difficult for Rava, last clause is difficult for Abaye. Abaye explains to his reasoning, Rava explains to his reasoning.
llm_translation: Rather, is it not that he said to them: "One of you," and it teaches: Are his sisters not betrothed? For Rava, the beginning is difficult, for Abbaye, the end is difficult. Abbaye resolves according to his reasoning, Rava resolves according to his reasoning.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ כְּאַחַת – אֵינָן מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת. הָא אַחַת מֵאִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, מֵאִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Abaye explains to his reasoning, one who betroths a woman and her daughter or a woman and her sister in one neither is betrothed. But one of a woman and her daughter a woman and her sister betrothed
llm_translation: Abaye resolves according to his reasoning: one who sanctifies a woman and her daughter, or a woman and her sister together - they are not sanctified. But if one of them is from a woman and her daughter, or from a woman and her sister - she is sanctified.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר: ״הָרְאוּיָה לְבִיאָה תִּתְקַדֵּשׁ לִי״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים וּבָהֶן שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְלִיקֵּט אֶחָד כַּלְכַּלָּה שֶׁל תְּאֵנִים וְאָמַר: ״הָרְאוּיָה לִי מִכֶּם תִּתְקַדֵּשׁ לִי״, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אֲחָיוֹת מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: And if he said: The one fit for sexual intercourse shall be betrothed to me, neither is betrothed, And an incident also involving five women, and among them two sisters. And one gathered a basket of figs and said: The one fit with me shall be betrothed to me and the Sages said: The sisters are not betrothed.
llm_translation: And if he said, "The one fitting for betrothal shall be consecrated to me" - she is not consecrated. And there was an incident with five women, among them two sisters, and one gathered a basket of figs and said, "The one fitting for me among you shall be consecrated to me," and the sages said: The sisters are not consecrated.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אַחַת מֵאִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ אוֹ אַחַת מֵאִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ – נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וַאֲחוֹתָהּ כְּאַחַת, וְאֵינָן מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים וּבָהֶם שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְלִיקֵּט אֶחָד כַּלְכַּלָּה שֶׁל תְּאֵנִים וְאָמַר: הֲרֵי כּוּלְּכֶם וְאַחַת מִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת לִי בְּכַלְכַּלָּה זוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין אֲחָיוֹת מְקוּדָּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: And Rava explains to his reasoning: one who betroths one of a woman and her daughter or one of a woman and her sister it becomes as one who simultaneously betrothed a woman and her daughter or a woman and her sister, and they are not betrothed, And an incident also involving five women, and among them two sisters. And one gathered a basket of figs and said: All of you, and one of two sisters, are hereby betrothed to me with this basket. And the Sages said: The sisters are not betrothed.
llm_translation: Rava resolves according to his reasoning: One who sanctifies one of two women, either a wife and her daughter or a wife and her sister - it is as if he sanctified a wife and her daughter, or a wife and her sister together, and they are not sanctified. And there was an incident with five women, among them two sisters, and one gathered a basket of figs and said: "Here, all of you, and one of the two sisters are sanctified to me with this basket," and the sages said: "Sisters are not sanctified."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ סְתָם – אֵין הַבּוֹגְרוֹת בַּכְּלָל. הָא קְטַנּוֹת בַּכְּלָל. וְאַמַּאי? קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה נִינְהוּ, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרָבָא!
human_translation: Come hear one who betroths his daughter without specification, the grown women are not included minor daughters are included, But why these betrothal that is not given to consummation, and a conclusive refutation of Rava.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who betroths his daughter silently - the betrothals are not valid at all. But if they are minors, they are valid. And why? Because they are betrothals that are not designated for consummation, and it is a statement of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא גְּדוֹלָה וּקְטַנָּה.
human_translation: Rava said to you: With what are we dealing here? when there is only adult and minor
llm_translation: Rava said to you: Here we are dealing with what? When there is there only greatness and smallness.

hebrew_text: הָא בּוֹגְרוֹת קָתָנֵי! מַאי בּוֹגְרוֹת – בּוֹגְרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא. אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: But teaches: Grown women, What grown women? Grown women in general. If so, what of stating
llm_translation: Here are the translations: Talmudic text: "הָא בּוֹגְרוֹת קָתָנֵי! מַאי בּוֹגְרוֹת – בּוֹגְרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא. אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?" English translation: "Here it is taught 'bogrot'! What is 'bogrot' - bogrot of the world. If so, what is it to say?"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּשַׁוִּיתֵיהּ שָׁלִיחַ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כִּי מְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשֵׁי – אַדַּעְתַּהּ דִּידַהּ קָא מְקַבֵּל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִידֵּי דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where designated him agent Lest you say when accepts betrothal accepts it with her in mind, teaches us that a person does not set aside something from which he has benefit,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what was entrusted to the agent. What might you say, when one accepts the sanctification - her knowledge is accepting, she is informing us that a person does not relinquish his benefit immediately upon having it.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ ״קִידּוּשַׁי לְדִידָךְ״? אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִצְוָה דְּרַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ וְעָבֵיד מִצְוָה דְּלָא רַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Aren’t we dealing where said to him: my betrothal is for you? Even so, a person does not set aside a mitzva that is incumbent upon him, and perform a mitzva that is not incumbent upon him,
llm_translation: We are dealing with one who said to him, "My sanctifications are for you"? Even so, a person should not forsake a commandment that is incumbent upon him and perform a commandment that is not incumbent upon him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי כִּתֵּי בָנוֹת מִשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וְאָמַר: ״קִידַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי הַגְּדוֹלָה, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת וְאִם גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת, אִם קְטַנָּה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת שֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה מִן הַגְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת״ – כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרוֹת, חוּץ מִקְּטַנָּה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Come hear one who has two groups of daughters from two women, and he said: I betrothed my elder daughter but I do not know if eldest of the older or if the eldest of the younger if youngest of the older who is older than the eldest of the younger all are prohibited except for the youngest of the younger the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who has two daughters from two wives, and he said, "I have betrothed my elder daughter, and I do not know if she is the elder among the elders or if she is the elder among the younger ones, or if she is the younger among the elders, that she is greater than the elder among the younger ones" - all of them are forbidden, except for the younger among the younger ones, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּשֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״אֵין יָדוּעַ״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where they were identified and later intermingled. is also precise, as it teaches I do not know, and it does not teach It is not known. Learn from
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? When they recognized and in the end they intermingled. Precisely it is stated: "I do not know," and it does not state "it is not known," infer from it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: לָא מַחֵית אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִסְפֵיקָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמַחֵית אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִסְפֵיקָא.
human_translation: If so, what of stating to exclude of Rabbi Yosei, who says: A person does not place himself of uncertainty, teaches us that a person does place himself of uncertainty,
llm_translation: So what can be said? To go out from Rabbi Yosei, who said: A person should not endanger himself due to doubt. It is heard for us that a person endangers himself due to doubt.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִי שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אַחַת מִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ קִידֵּשׁ – נוֹתֵן גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּשֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: ״אֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ״.
human_translation: Come hear one who betrothed one of two sisters and he does not know which he betrothed, give a bill of divorce to this and a bill of divorce to that With what are we dealing here? when they were identified and later intermingled. is also precise, as it teaches He does not know, and it does not teach It is not known.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who sanctified one of two sisters and does not know which one he sanctified - he gives a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to this one. Here, what are we dealing with? When they were recognized and ultimately became mixed up. Specifically stated, for it was taught: "He does not know," and it does not state: "It is not known."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: מֵת וְלוֹ אָח אֶחָד, חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן. הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם – אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם. אִם קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ, אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָם מִיָּדָם.
human_translation: If so, what of stating It was necessary the latter clause died and he had one brother, performs ḥalitza with both of he had two one performs ḥalitza And one takes in levirate marriage married before not remove them from
llm_translation: Thus, what is there to say? The latter part is necessary: If a man dies leaving one brother, he performs chalitzah with both of them. If he had two brothers – one performs chalitzah and one performs yibum. If they preceded and entered, they are not removed from their hands immediately.

hebrew_text: דַּוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי וַהֲדַר מִיחְלָץ – לָא, דְּקָא פָּגַע בַּאֲחוֹת זְקוּקָתוֹ.
human_translation: specifically performs ḥalitza and afterward performs levirate marriage, but performs levirate marriage and afterward performs ḥalitza , not as he encountering the sister of bound to him
llm_translation: Specifically he releases and then performs yibum, but yibum and then performs chalitzah - no, because he has encountered his yevamah's sister.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁקִּדְּשׁוּ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, זֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ קִידֵּשׁ וְזֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ קִידֵּשׁ – זֶה נוֹתֵן שְׁנֵי גִטִּין, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן שְׁנֵי גִטִּין! הָכָא נָמֵי, שֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: ״אֵין יָדוּעַ״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear two who betrothed two sisters, this does not know which he betrothed and that does not know which he betrothed, this gives two bills of divorce, and that gives two bills of divorce. Here too, where they were identified and later intermingled. is also precise, as it teaches Does not know, and it does not teach: It is not known. Learn from it
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two who consecrated two sisters, this one does not know which one he consecrated, and this one does not know which one he consecrated - this one gives two bills of divorce, and this one gives two bills of divorce! Here it is stated, that they were recognized and ultimately became mixed up. It is specifically stated that "he does not know," and it is not stated "it is not known," infer from it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: מֵת, וְלָזֶה אָח וְלָזֶה אָח – זֶה חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן וְזֶה חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן. לָזֶה אֶחָד וְלָזֶה שְׁנַיִם –
human_translation: If so, what of stating It was necessary the latter clause died and this had a brother and that had a brother, this performs ḥalitza with both of them, and that performs ḥalitza with both of them. this had one and that had two
llm_translation: If so, what is the meaning to say? The latter part is necessary for it: If one dies, and this one is a brother and this one is a brother - this one performs chalitzah for both of them and this one performs chalitzah for both of them. For this one there is one chalitzah and for this one there are two -

hebrew_text: הָאֶחָד חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְהַשְּׁנַיִם – אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַבֵּם. אִם קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ – אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן מִיָּדָם.
human_translation: the one performs ḥalitza with both of them, and the two one performs ḥalitza and one, performs levirate marriage If they married before does not remove them from
llm_translation: One removes for both, and the second - one removes and one performs levirate marriage. If they preceded and entered - they are not removed from their hands immediately.

hebrew_text: דַּוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי וַהֲדַר מִיחְלָץ – לָא, דְּקָא פָּגַע בִּיבָמָה לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: specifically performs ḥalitza and afterward performs levirate marriage, but performs levirate marriage and afterward performs ḥalitza , not as he encountering a yevama to public.
llm_translation: Specifically he releases and then performs yibum, but yibum and then performs releases - no, because he encountered the yevamah in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי טָבְיוֹמֵי: לְזֶה חֲמִשָּׁה בָּנִים וּלְזֶה חֲמִשָּׁה בָּנוֹת, וְאָמַר: ״אַחַת מִבְּנוֹתֶיךָ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לְאֶחָד מִבָּנַי״ – כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת צְרִיכָה חֲמִשָּׁה גִּיטִּין. מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם – כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת צְרִיכָה אַרְבָּעָה גִּיטִּין, וַחֲלִיצָה מֵאֶחָד מֵהֶן.
human_translation: Come hear, as Tavyumei taught this had five sons and that had five daughters, and said: One of your daughters is betrothed to one of my sons, each and every one requires five bills of divorce, one of the died each and every one requires four bills of divorce, and ḥalitza from one of them,
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in the days of Tavi: "For this one, five sons and for this one, five daughters." And he said: "One of your daughters is betrothed to one of my sons" - each and every one requires five bills of divorce. If one of them dies - each and every one requires four bills of divorce, and halitzah from one of them.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי כְּשֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ, הָא ״אַחַת מִבְּנוֹתֶיךָ לְאֶחָד מִבָּנַי״ קָתָנֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא. וְהִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי בְּיַעַ״ל קַגַ״ם.
human_translation: And if you would say here too where they were identified and later intermingled, teaches: One of your daughters to one of my sons, The refutation of Rava is a conclusive refutation. And the halakha is in accordance with of Abaye with regard to yod , ayin , lamed , kuf , gimmel , mem :
llm_translation: And if you will say: So it is indeed, when they were recognized and in the end they intermingled, but "one of your daughters to one of my sons" it teaches, the statement of Rava is preferable, preferable. And the halakha is in accordance with the view of Abbaye in Ya'arot Devash, page 23.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים. אָמַר רַב: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִמַּתְנִיתִין אַרְבַּע, וְנָקֵיט רַב בִּידֵיהּ תְּלָת.
human_translation: An incident involving five women, Rav says: learn four from the mishna. And Rav held three in his hand,
llm_translation: The matter of five women. Rav said: Learn from it four, and Rav took in her hand three.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קִידְּשָׁהּ בְּגָזֵל – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, אֲפִילּוּ בְּגָזֵל דִּידַהּ. מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: שֶׁלָּהֶם הָיְתָה וְשֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית הָיְתָה – טַעְמָא דִּשְׁבִיעִית, דְּהֶפְקֵר הוּא, הָא דִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ – לָא.
human_translation: Learn from it one who betroths with produce of Sabbatical she is betrothed, And learn from it betroths with a stolen item, even her stolen item, she is not betrothed. From where from that it teaches was from their and was of Sabbatical The reason of Sabbatical which ownerless But of the other years of the seven- not
llm_translation: Listen to the conclusion: one who sanctifies produce of the seventh year - it becomes sanctified. And listen to the conclusion: if one sanctified stolen property - it does not become sanctified, even if it was stolen from oneself. From where? Because it is taught: "It was theirs and it was of the seventh year" - the reason of the seventh year, since it is ownerless, but that of the remaining two weeks - no.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אִשָּׁה נַעֲשֵׂית שָׁלִיחַ לַחֲבֶירְתָּהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית לָהּ צָרָה.
human_translation: And learn from it: A woman can become an agent for another and even in a situation where she becomes rival wife of
llm_translation: And hear from it: a woman becomes an agent for her friend, even in a place where she herself becomes a rival.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ מַאי הִיא? קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִים לְבִיאָה. וְנִיחְשְׁבַהּ! מִשּׁוּם דִּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי כְּאַבָּיֵי אִי כְּרָבָא.
human_translation: And what is the other betrothal that is not given to consummation. And let count this because he is uncertain whether in accordance with Abaye, whether in accordance with Rava,
llm_translation: And the other opinion, what is it? Betrothals that are not designated for consummation. And it is considered! Because it is doubtful to him, whether like Abaye or like Rava.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רַבִּי זֵירָא אַמְרַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהוּא לָא אֲמַר?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גָּזַל וְלֹא נִתְיָיאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים – שְׁנֵיהֶם אֵינָם יְכוֹלִים לְהַקְדִּישׁ, זֶה לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְזֶה לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ. הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: מִי אָמַר רַב כְּווֹתִי?
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended he stated this halakha before Rabbi Yoḥanan, said to him: Did Rav say so? But didn’t he say And didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: robbed and owner has not despaired neither of them can consecrate This because it is not his, and that because it is not in his possession. this is he said to him: Did Rav say in accordance with my
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended, she said this teaching before Rabbi Yohanan. He said to her: Who said so, Rav? But he did not say so?! And Rabbi Yohanan said: If one steals and the owners do not despair - neither of them can consecrate it, this one because it is not his, and this one because it is not in his possession. So he said to her: Who said so, Rav Kevuti?

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: קִידְּשָׁהּ בְּגָזֵל, בְּחָמָס, וּבִגְנֵיבָה, אוֹ שֶׁחָטַף סֶלַע מִיָּדָהּ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! הָתָם בְּגָזֵל דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection betrothed her with in robbery, in a forced transaction, or in theft, or if he grabbed a sela from her hand and betrothed her she is betrothed. There her stolen
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates into English as follows: Opposition: If she consecrated it with stolen property, with violence, or with robbery, or if he snatched a stone from her hand and consecrated it - it is sanctified! There, with stolen property, it is her own.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אוֹ שֶׁחָטַף סֶלַע מִשֶּׁלָּהּ – מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא בְּגָזֵל דְּעָלְמָא עָסְקִינַן! פָּירוּשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ: קִידְּשָׁהּ בְּגָזֵל, בְּחָמָס, וּבִגְנֵיבָה כֵּיצַד? כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָטַף סֶלַע מִיָּדָהּ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: But from that the last clause teaches: Or if he grabbed a sela of hers, it may be inferred that the first clause we are dealing with stolen from others. is explaining betrothed with in robbery, in a forced transaction, or in theft; how so? For example, if he grabbed a sela from her hand and betrothed her with it.
llm_translation: The Gemara continues: Or if one snatched a rock from her possession – is this not included in the general principle stated in the Mishnah regarding robbery? The Gemara explains: It means that he consecrated it with robbery, with violence, and with theft. How so? For example, if he snatched a rock from her hand and consecrated it with it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַתְנִיתִין, דְּגָזֵל דִּידַהּ, וְקָאָמַר רַב: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – דְּשַׁדֵּיךְ, הָא – דְּלָא שַׁדֵּיךְ.
human_translation: But the mishna with stolen item hers, and Rav says she is not betrothed. not difficult; this where he had arranged that where he had not arranged
llm_translation: The Mishnah states, regarding a stolen item, and Rav said: "It is not sanctified!" It is not difficult: this - where it was thrown, this - where it was not thrown.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲוָה קָא מָשְׁיָא כַּרְעַאּ בִּמְשִׁיכְלָא דְמַיָּא, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, חֲטַף זוּזֵי מֵחַבְרֵיהּ וּשְׁדָא לַהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: מִיקַּדְּשַׁתְּ לִי. אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר: לֵית דְּחָשׁ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: סְתַם גְּזֵילָה – יֵאוּשׁ בְּעָלִים הָוֵי.
human_translation: a certain woman who was washing her feet in a vessel of water. A certain man came grabbed dinars from another and threw to her, said to her: You are betrothed to me. That man came before Rava, said: There is not who is concerned for this of Rabbi Shimon, who said: an ordinary robbery owner has despaired
llm_translation: That woman who was walking on the bank of the river, a certain man came, snatched her purse from her companions, and threw it to her. He said to her: "Be consecrated to me." That man came before Rava. He said: "There is no concern for what Rabbi Shimon said, for he said: 'An openly stolen object is considered ownerless.'"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אֲרִיסָא דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּמוֹזָא דְשַׁמְכֵי, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן אַחֲלָךְ? וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמוֹזָא, אֲבָל כִּישָׁא, מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא שְׁקַלִי כִּישָׁא, שְׁקֵיל אַתְּ כִּישָׁא, כִּישָׁא כִּי כִישָׁא.
human_translation: a certain sharecropper who betrothed with a handful [ bemoza ] of onions [ deshamkhei ] He came before Rava said to him: Who relinquished to you? And this matter applies to a handful, but a bundle can say to I took a bundle, you take a bundle; one bundle for bundle.
llm_translation: That sharecropper who sanctified in the barn of Shamkei, came before Rava. He said to him: Who permitted you? These matters in the barn are permitted, but in the field, one can say to him: I take a sharecropper, you take a sharecropper, a sharecropper is like a sharecropper.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא סְרָסְיָא דְּקַדֵּישׁ בִּפְרוּמָא דְשִׁיכְרָא. אֲתָא מָרֵיהּ דְּשִׁיכְרָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי לָא תִּיתֵּיב מֵהַאי חָרִיפָא? אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר: לֹא אָמְרוּ ״כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל יָפוֹת״, אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן תְּרוּמָה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: a certain brewer [ sarseya ] who betrothed with sediment [ bifruma ] from the beer. The owner of the beer came found him. said to him: Why don’t you give from this, sharp came before Rava said said Go to the better only with regard to teruma alone,
llm_translation: That certain eunuch who sanctified with the wine of the winepress. His master of the winepress came and found him. He said to him: Why did you not sit from this sharp wine? He came before Rava. He said: They did not say "a king among beautiful women," but only regarding the matter of terumah.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמְרוּ: תּוֹרֵם שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה? הֲרֵי שֶׁיָּרַד לְתוֹךְ שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ וְלִיקֵּט וְתָרַם שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, אִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, וְאִם לָאו – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: As it is taught When did they say one separates teruma without consent, his teruma is teruma ? there was who entered another’s field and gathered and separated teruma without permission, if concerned about as robbery, his teruma is not teruma , but if not his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: How do they say: One who separates his contribution without the knowledge of his contribution, is his contribution separated? If he descended into the field of his fellow and gathered and separated without permission, if he is concerned about theft - his contribution is not a contribution, and if not - his contribution is a contribution.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ אִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל אִם לָאו? הֲרֵי שֶׁבָּא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וּמְצָאוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל יָפוֹת״ אִם נִמְצְאוּ יָפוֹת מֵהֶם – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה. הָיוּ הַבְּעָלִים מְלַקְּטִים וּמוֹסִיפִים, בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And from where would know whether concerned as robbery or not? the owner came and found him and said to him: Go to the better if better than is found, his teruma is teruma , But if not, his teruma is not teruma , the owners were gathering and adding either way, his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: And from where did he know if he is concerned about theft or not? Behold, the homeowner came and found him and said to him, "Take your belongings with the beautiful ones." If the beautiful ones were found among them - his contribution is a contribution, and if not - his contribution is not a contribution. The owners were collecting and adding, in any case - his contribution is a contribution.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דַּעֲבַד, וְאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: But here, acts because of embarrassment, and she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: However, here, it is due to suspicion that he did it, and it does not sanctify it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּחֶלְקוֹ, בֵּין קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים, בֵּין קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג בֵּין מֵזִיד – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ, בְּמֵזִיד – קִידֵּשׁ.
human_translation: who betroths with his portion whether offerings of the most sacred order whether offerings of lesser sanctity, she is not betrothed. with second tithe, whether unwittingly intentionally, has not betrothed the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: unwittingly he has not betrothed intentionally he has betrothed
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who sanctifies an animal from his own portion, whether it is of the most holy offerings or of lesser sanctity, it does not become sanctified. In the case of a second tithe, whether the act of sanctification was unintentional or intentional, it was not sanctified – these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: In the case of unintentional sanctification, it was not sanctified; in the case of intentional sanctification, it was sanctified.

hebrew_text: וּבַהֶקְדֵּשׁ, בְּמֵזִיד – קִידֵּשׁ, וּבְשׁוֹגֵג – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג – קִידֵּשׁ, בְּמֵזִיד – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ.
human_translation: And with consecrated intentionally he has betrothed and unwittingly he has not betrothed the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says unwittingly he has betrothed intentionally he has not betrothed
llm_translation: In the Sanctuary, intentionally - he sanctified, and unintentionally - he did not sanctify, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: unintentionally - he sanctified, intentionally - he did not sanctify.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּמָעֲלָה מַעַל בַּה׳״ – לְרַבּוֹת קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים שֶׁהֵן מָמוֹנוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: Shall we say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? As it is taught and he commits a trespass against the Lord, to include offerings of lesser sanctity which are the property the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Neima Matnitin de'lo k'Rabbi Yosei HaGalili, de'tanya: "U'ma'alah ma'al baHashem" - l'rabot kodashim kalim shehem mamono, divrei Rabbi Yosei HaGalili. English translation: The Gemara: It was stated in a Baraita not like Rabbi Yosei HaGalili, as it was taught: "And he commits a trespass against the Lord" - to include light holy items that are his property, the words of Rabbi Yosei HaGalili.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי – מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה – לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? כִּי קָא זָכוּ – מִשֻּׁלְחַן גָּבוֹהַּ קָא זָכוּ.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says while alive, but after slaughter not What is the reason When receive they receive from the table of the Most High,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yosei HaGalili, when Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says - from the living, but after slaughter - no. What is the reason? When they were fit - they were fit from a high table.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּחֶלְקוֹ, בֵּין קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים וּבֵין קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: who betroths with his portion whether offerings of the most sacred order or whether offerings of lesser sanctity, has not betrothed Learn from it
llm_translation: Precisely it was stated, as it was taught: One who sanctifies in his portion, whether with the holiest of holies or with lesser sanctities - he has not sanctified. Learn from it.
