hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לְאַחַר פְּטִירָתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְתַלְמִידָיו: אַל יִכָּנְסוּ תַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְכָאן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקַּנְתְּרָנִים הֵם, וְלֹא לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה הֵם בָּאִים אֶלָּא לְקַפְּחֵנִי בַּהֲלָכוֹת הֵם בָּאִים. דָּחַק סוֹמְכוֹס וְנִכְנַס. אָמַר לָהֶם: כָּךְ שָׁנָה לִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּחֶלְקוֹ, בֵּין קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים וּבֵין קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: After the death of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda said to his students: Do not let the students of Rabbi Meir enter here because they are vexatious [ kanteranim ]. And they do not come to study Torah, rather they come to overwhelm me with halakhot . Sumakhos, pushed and entered He said to them: This Rabbi Meir taught me: who betroths with his portion whether offerings of the most sacred order or whether offerings of lesser sanctity, he has not betrothed
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: After the passing of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda said to his students: The students of Rabbi Meir should not enter here, because they are contentious, and they do not come to study Torah but rather to engage in legal disputes. Somchos forcibly entered. He said to them: Rabbi Meir taught me thus: One who sanctifies his portion, whether it be of the Holy of Holies or of lesser sanctity, has not sanctified it.

hebrew_text: כָּעַס רַבִּי יְהוּדָה (עֲלֵיהֶם). אָמַר לָהֶם: לֹא כָּךְ אָמַרְתִּי לָכֶם: אַל יִכָּנְסוּ מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְכָאן מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקַּנְתְּרָנִים הֵם, וְלֹא לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה הֵם בָּאִים אֶלָּא לְקַפְּחֵנִי בַּהֲלָכוֹת הֵם בָּאִים. וְכִי אִשָּׁה בַּעֲזָרָה מִנַּיִן?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda became angry with He said to them: Didn’t I say this to you: Do not let the students of Rabbi Meir enter here because they are vexatious? And they do not come to study Torah, rather they come to overwhelm me with halakhot . as from where a woman in the courtyard?
llm_translation: Anger Rabbi Yehuda (about them). He said to them: Not thus I said to you: Let not enter disciples of Rabbi Meir here because they are troublemakers, and not to learn Torah they come but to make me stumble in halakhot they come. And a woman in the Azarah, from where?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: יֹאמְרוּ: מֵאִיר שָׁכַב, יְהוּדָה כָּעַס, יוֹסֵי שָׁתַק – (דִּבְרֵי) תוֹרָה מָה תְּהֵא עָלֶיהָ? וְכִי אֵין אָדָם עָשׂוּי לְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשִׁין לְבִתּוֹ בַּעֲזָרָה? וְאֵין אִשָּׁה עֲשׂוּיָה לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהּ שָׁלִיחַ לְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ בַּעֲזָרָה? וְעוֹד: דָּחֲקָה וְנִכְנְסָה מַאי?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, said: They will say: Meir died, Yehuda grew angry, Yosei remained silent; what will become of the words of Torah? but isn’t it common a man to accept betrothal for his daughter in the courtyard? And isn’t it common a woman to designate an agent for herself to accept her betrothal in the courtyard? And furthermore: What pushed and entered?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: They shall say: Meir lay down, Yehuda became angry, Yosei remained silent - what should be the ruling regarding (the study of) Torah? Is a man not obligated to arrange for the betrothal of his daughter in the Temple courtyard? And is a woman not obligated to appoint a messenger to accept her betrothal in the Temple courtyard? Furthermore: If she was coerced and entered, what is the law?

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״זֶה יִהְיֶה לְךָ מִקֹּדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים מִן הָאֵשׁ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״לְךָ״ – וּלְכׇל צְרָכֶיךָ. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: כְּאֵשׁ. מָה אֵשׁ לַאֲכִילָה, אַף הוּא נָמֵי לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says she is betrothed, Rabbi Yosei says she is not betrothed. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Both of them derived one verse, “This shall be yours of the most holy things, reserved from the fire” Rabbi Yehuda holds “yours” and for all your needs, And Rabbi Yosei holds to the fire Just as fire for consumption, so too, is also for consumption
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: It sanctifies. Rabbi Yosei says: It does not sanctify. Rabbi Yochanan said: Both of them expounded one verse: "This shall be to you the most holy portion from the fire." Rabbi Yehuda holds: "to you" - for all your needs. And Rabbi Yosei holds: like fire. Just as fire is for eating, so too it is for eating.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan:

hebrew_text: נִמְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּחֶלְקוֹ, בֵּין קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים וּבֵין קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ. וְרַב אֲמַר: עֲדַיִין הִיא מַחְלוֹקֶת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִסְתַּבְּרָא,
human_translation: They counted and they concluded: one who betroths with his portion whether offerings of the most sacred order or whether offerings of lesser sanctity, has not betrothed And Rav says: It is still a dispute Abaye said: It is reasonable in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: They counted and concluded: One who sanctifies from his own portion, whether it be of the Holy of Holies or of lesser sanctity - he has not sanctified. And Rav said: It is still a matter of dispute. Abaye said: The reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan is understood.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין חוֹלְקִים מְנָחוֹת כְּנֶגֶד זְבָחִים – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל מִנְחָה אֲשֶׁר תֵּאָפֶה בַּתַּנּוּר... לְכׇל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן תִּהְיֶה״.
human_translation: As it is taught From where that may not receive a share meal-offerings in exchange for offerings, The verse states: “And every meal-offering that is baked in the oven…shall all the sons of Aaron have”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that one does not divide the meal offerings against the sacrifices? The verse states: "And every meal offering that is baked in the oven... shall be for all the sons of Aaron."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יַחְלְקוּ מְנָחוֹת כְּנֶגֶד זְבָחִים, שֶׁלֹּא קָמוּ תַּחְתֵּיהֶם בְּדַלּוּת, אֲבָל יַחְלְקוּ מְנָחוֹת כְּנֶגֶד עוֹפוֹת, שֶׁהֲרֵי קָמוּ תַּחְתֵּיהֶן בְּדַלּוּת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל נַעֲשָׂה בַמַּרְחֶשֶׁת... לְכׇל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן תִּהְיֶה״.
human_translation: might they may not receive a share meal-offerings in exchange for offerings since they do not substitute for them in poverty. But they may receive a share meal-offerings in exchange for bird since they do substitute for them in poverty. the verse states: “And all that is prepared in the deep pan…shall all the sons of Aaron have,”
llm_translation: He is able not they shall divide meal-offerings against sacrifices, that not they stood beneath them in poverty, but they shall divide meal-offerings against birds, that behold they stood beneath them in poverty? Scripture says: "And all shall be made with a griddle... it shall belong to all the sons of Aaron."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יַחְלְקוּ מְנָחוֹת כְּנֶגֶד עוֹפוֹת, שֶׁהַלָּלוּ מִינֵי דָמִים וְהַלָּלוּ מִינֵי קְמָחִים, אֲבָל יַחְלְקוּ עוֹפוֹת כְּנֶגֶד זְבָחִים, שֶׁהַלָּלוּ וְהַלָּלוּ מִינֵי דָמִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעַל מַחֲבַת״.
human_translation: might they may not receive a share meal-offerings in exchange for bird since these, are types of blood and those, are types of flour. But they may receive a share bird in exchange for offerings, since both types of blood the verse states: “And on a griddle,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Can they not divide the meal offerings against the birds, for these are types of blood and these are types of flour, but they can divide the birds against the sacrifices, for these and these are types of blood? The Talmud teaches: "And on the griddle."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יַחְלְקוּ עוֹפוֹת כְּנֶגֶד זְבָחִים, שֶׁהַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם בַּיָּד וְהַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם בִּכְלִי, אֲבָל יַחְלְקוּ מְנָחוֹת כְּנֶגֶד מְנָחוֹת, שֶׁהַלָּלוּ וְהַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם בַּיָּד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל מִנְחָה בְלוּלָה בַשֶּׁמֶן לְכׇל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״.
human_translation: might they may not receive a share bird in exchange for offerings because the actions, these by hand, and the actions, those with a utensil, But they may receive a share meal-offerings in exchange for meal-offerings, since the actions with these and those by hand. the verse states: “And every meal-offering mingled with oil…shall all the sons of Aaron
llm_translation: He can not divide birds against sacrifices, for these perform their actions by hand and these perform their actions by vessel, but they can divide meal-offerings against meal-offerings, for these and these perform their actions by hand? The verse teaches: "And every meal-offering mixed with oil, for all the sons of Aaron."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יַחְלְקוּ מַחֲבַת כְּנֶגֶד מַרְחֶשֶׁת וּמַרְחֶשֶׁת כְּנֶגֶד מַחֲבַת, שֶׁזּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂיהָ רַכִּים וְזוֹ מַעֲשֶׂיהָ קָשִׁים, אֲבָל יַחְלְקוּ מַחֲבַת כְּנֶגֶד מַחֲבַת וּמַרְחֶשֶׁת כְּנֶגֶד מַרְחֶשֶׁת, שֶׁהַלָּלוּ וְהַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם קָשִׁים, אִי נָמֵי מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם רַכִּים? – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַחֲרֵבָה לְכׇל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן תִּהְיֶה״.
human_translation: might they may not receive a share a griddle in exchange for - a deep pan, or a deep pan in exchange for - a griddle, since the actions this a soft and the actions that a hard But they may receive a share a griddle in exchange for a griddle, or a deep pan in exchange for a deep pan, since the actions these and those a hard alternatively, the actions a soft the verse states: “Or dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have”
llm_translation: One might have thought that they should not divide the griddle against the gridiron, and the gridiron against the griddle, because the work of this one is soft and the work of that one is hard. But they should divide the griddle against the griddle, and the gridiron against the gridiron, because the work of these and the work of those are hard. Are we to say that their work is soft? - The Talmud teaches: "And the sword shall be upon all the sons of Aaron."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יַחְלְקוּ בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים אֲבָל יַחְלְקוּ בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ כְּאָחִיו״ וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״אִם עַל תּוֹדָה״ – כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין חוֹלְקִין בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים כָּךְ אֵין חוֹלְקִים בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים.
human_translation: might may not receive a share of offerings of the most sacred order, but they may receive a share of offerings of lesser sanctity the verse states one as well as another” and near it “If for a thanks-offering” Just as one may not receive a share of offerings of the most sacred order, so too, one may not receive a share of offerings of lesser sanctity,
llm_translation: He is able not they shall divide in holy of holies but they shall divide in holy light? Scripture says: "Each like his brother" and adjacent to it: "If for a thanksgiving" - just as they do not divide in holy of holies, so too they do not divide in holy light.

hebrew_text: ״אִישׁ״ אִישׁ חוֹלֵק, אֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל מוּם, וְאֵין הַקָּטָן חוֹלֵק וַאֲפִילּוּ תָּם. סְתָם סִפְרָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהוּא קָאָמַר דְּלֵית בַּהּ דִּין חֲלוּקָהּ כְּלָל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: “One ish a man [ ish ] receives a share even blemished, but a minor may not receive a share even unblemished. who is unattributed Sifra Rabbi Yehuda, and he says that no law of receiving a share to it at all, Conclude from it
llm_translation: "Man" a man divides, even with a blemish, and the minor does not divide, even if whole. A sealed document, who is it according to? Rabbi Yehuda, and he is saying that there is no judgment of division in it at all. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּכְרַב מִי לָא תַּנְיָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַצְּנוּעִים מוֹשְׁכִין אֶת יְדֵיהֶם, וְהַגַּרְגְּרָנִים חוֹלְקִים. מַאי חוֹלְקִים? חוֹטְפִים, כִּדְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁחָטַף חֶלְקוֹ וְחֵלֶק חֲבֵרוֹ, וְהָיוּ קוֹרְאִין אוֹתוֹ: ״בֶּן חַמְצָן״ עַד יוֹם מוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: But isn’t it taught in accordance with Rav? But isn’t it taught the modest ones withdraw their hands and the gluttons receive shares What receive shares? they snatch as it teaches latter clause An incident involving one who snatched his share and his colleague’s share, and they called him ben Ḥamtzan, until the day he died.
llm_translation: Rava said: And according to whom is this Mishnah teaching? And it was taught in a Mishnah: The modest ones pull their hands, and the bold ones divide. What does "divide" mean? They snatch, as it is taught in the latter clause: There was an incident with one who snatched his portion and the portion of his fellow, and they would call him: "Son of Hametzan" until the day of his death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: מַאי קְרָאָה? ״אֱלֹהַי פַּלְּטֵנִי מִיַּד רָשָׁע מִכַּף מְעַוֵּל וְחוֹמֵץ״. רַבָּה אָמַר: מֵהָכָא, ״לִמְדוּ הֵיטֵב דִּרְשׁוּ מִשְׁפָּט אַשְּׁרוּ חָמוֹץ״
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: What is the verse “My God, rescue me out of the hand of the wicked, out of the grasp of the unrighteous and grasping man [ ḥometz ]” Rabba said: from here: “Learn to do well; seek justice, relieve the oppressed [ ḥamotz ]”
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheilah said: What is the verse? "My God, save me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and ruthless." Rabba said: From here, "Learn to do good; seek justice, correct oppression."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג, בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹגֵג – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ, מֵזִיד – קִידֵּשׁ וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּגְמָרָא: ״וְכׇל מַעְשַׂר הָאָרֶץ מִזֶּרַע הָאָרֶץ מִפְּרִי הָעֵץ לַה׳ הוּא קֹדֶשׁ לַה׳״ – לַה׳ הוּא, וְלֹא לְקַדֵּשׁ בּוֹ אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: second tithe, whether unwittingly intentionally, has not betrothed the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: unwittingly he has not betrothed intentionally he has betrothed From where are these matters Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, says in the name of tradition: “And all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land, or of the fruit of the tree, is the Lord’s; it is holy to the Lord” it is for the Lord, but not for betrothing a woman with it.
llm_translation: Second tithe, whether unintentional or intentional - did not sanctify, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Unintentional - did not sanctify, intentional - sanctified, and so on. Where are these words derived from? Rav Acha, son of Rava, said in the name of tradition: "And all the tithe of the land, from the seed of the land, from the fruit of the tree, is holy to the Lord" - it is holy to the Lord, and not to sanctify a woman with it.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֵּן תָּרִימוּ גַם אַתֶּם תְּרוּמַת ה׳״, וּתְנַן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! – דְּלָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״לַה׳״.
human_translation: there is teruma of the tithe, which it is written: “So you also shall set apart a gift of the Lord And we learned one who betroths with teruma , she is betrothed. as “to the Lord” is not written with regard to it,
llm_translation: Behold, the offering of the tithe, as it is written: "So shall you also present an offering to the Lord," and we learned: One who sanctifies with a contribution - sanctifies! - for it does not say in it "to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי חַלָּה, דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ: ״תִּתְּנוּ לַה׳״, וּתְנַן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמוֹת – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! – דְּלָא כְּתִיב בַּיהּ ״קֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: But there is ḥalla , about which it is written: you shall give to the Lord” And we learned one who betroths with terumot , she is betrothed. as “holy” was not written with regard to it.
llm_translation: And behold, regarding challah, for it is written in it: "You shall give to the Lord," and we learned: one who sanctifies with terumot - she is sanctified! - for it is not written in it "holy."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית, דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא קֹדֶשׁ תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם״, וּתְנַן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! – דְּלָא כְּתִיב בַּיהּ ״לַה׳״.
human_translation: But there is Sabbatical about which it is written: “It is a Jubilee, it shall be holy to you” And we learned one who betroths with produce of the Sabbatical she is betrothed. but “to the Lord” is not written with regard to it.
llm_translation: And behold, regarding the seventh year, for it is written in it: "It is a Jubilee, holy it shall be for you." And we learned: One who sanctifies produce during the seventh year - it becomes sanctified! - because it is not written in it "to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״קֹדֶשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל לַה׳ רֵאשִׁית תְּבוּאָתֹה״, וּתְנַן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת! הָהוּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּתִיב.
human_translation: But there is teruma , which it is written: “The Jewish people are the Lord’s holy portion, His first fruits of the increase” And we learned one who betroths with teruma , she is betrothed. That was written with regard to the Jewish people,
llm_translation: Behold, regarding Terumah, as it is written: "The holy portion of the children of Israel unto the Lord, the first of their produce." And we learned: One who sanctifies with Terumah - sanctifies! That which is written in Israel.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו מִמֵּילָא שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ? תַּרְגְּמַהּ רָבִין סָבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא״ – בַּהֲוָיָיתוֹ יְהֵא.
human_translation: But don’t you understand it by itself Ravin the Elder interpreted it before Rav: the verse states: “It is As it is, it should be,
llm_translation: "And is it not from the fact itself that you have heard its type? Rabin the Elder translated it before Rav: He said: The verse states, 'He' - in his existence let it be."

hebrew_text: וּבַהֶקְדֵּשׁ, בְּמֵזִיד – קִידֵּשׁ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג – קִידֵּשׁ, בְּמֵזִיד – לֹא קִידֵּשׁ. אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: שְׁמַעִית מִינֵּהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּרְתֵּי: שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֵׂר דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, שִׁגְגַת הֶקְדֵּשׁ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר – שְׁנֵיהֶם אֵין אִשָּׁה מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בָּהֶם.
human_translation: And with consecrated intentionally he has betrothed unwittingly he has not betrothed the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says unwittingly he has betrothed intentionally he has not betrothed Rabbi Ya’akov said: I learned two from Rabbi Yoḥanan, an unwitting tithe of Rabbi Yehuda an unwitting consecrated of Rabbi Meir. In both of these the woman is not betrothed with
llm_translation: In the case of consecration, if done intentionally - it is sanctified; if done unintentionally - it is not sanctified, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: if done unintentionally - it is sanctified; if done intentionally - it is not sanctified. Rabbi Yaakov said: I have heard two aspects from Rabbi Yochanan: the unintentional mistake of tithing by Rabbi Yehuda, and the unintentional mistake of consecration by Rabbi Meir - in both cases, a woman does not become sanctified through them.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא – לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אִשָּׁה רוֹצֶה, וַחֲדָא – לְפִי שֶׁאֵין שְׁנֵיהֶם רוֹצִים, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: נִיחְזֵי אֲנַן: מַעֲשֵׂר – אִיהִי לָא נִיחָא לַהּ מִשּׁוּם טִרְחָא דְאוֹרְחָא, אִיהוּ נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִיקְנֵי אִיתְּתָא מִמֵּילָא. אֶלָּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ – תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לָא נִיחָא לְהוּ דְּנִתַּחִיל הֶקְדֵּשׁ עַל יְדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: One because the woman does not want and other because neither wants And I do not know which of them Rabbi Yirmeya said: Let us see tithe, not satisfactory for her due to the trouble of the way satisfactory for him since he acquires a woman by itself, But consecrated not satisfactory for the two of them that consecrated be desacralized by their
llm_translation: One - because the woman does not want, and one - because neither of them wants, and we do not know which one. Rabbi Yirmiyah said: Let us see: Tithing - it is not pleasing to her because of the burden of the road, but it is pleasing to him because he acquires a wife effortlessly. Rather, betrothal - both of them are not pleased with it because when one betroths, it is through them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: אִיפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִי לָא אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: מַעֲשֵׂר, אִיהִי לָא נִיחָא לַהּ מִשּׁוּם טִירְחָא דְאוֹרְחָא, אִיהוּ לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם אוּנְסָא דְאוֹרְחָא?! אֶלָּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ, בִּשְׁלָמָא אִיהִי לָא נִיחָא לַהּ דְּנִתַּחִיל הֶקְדֵּשׁ עַל יְדַהּ, אֶלָּא אִיהוּ מִי לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִיקְנֵי אִיתְּתָא מִמֵּילָא?
human_translation: And Rabbi Ya’akov said the opposite is reasonable. Couldn’t it be said tithe not satisfactory for her due to the trouble of the way, not satisfactory for him due to the accident along the way. But consecrated granted her, not satisfactory for her that consecrated be desacralized through her, but why wouldn’t satisfactory for him to acquire a woman by itself,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov said: The opposite seems more reasonable. Who wouldn't agree to say: Maaser, it is not pleasing to her due to the exertion of the road, but it is pleasing to him due to the compulsion of the road?! Rather, Hekdesh, it is understandable that it is not pleasing to her because Hekdesh began with her, but who wouldn't agree that it is pleasing to him because he acquires a wife from it?

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: אִשָּׁה אֵין מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת, מָעוֹת מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּצְאוּ לְחוּלִּין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִשָּׁה אֵין מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת – מָעוֹת הֵיאַךְ יֵצְאוּ לְחוּלִּין?
human_translation: Rava inquired of Rav Ḥisda: a woman cannot be betrothed what is money become desacralized said to him: woman is not betrothed, how can the money become desacralized?
llm_translation: Rava asked R. Ḥisda: A woman who does not become betrothed, what is the status of the coins that are given to her for betrothal? He said to him: If a woman does not become betrothed, how can the coins go out to secular use?

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: בְּמֶכֶר מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף בְּמֶכֶר לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin inquired of Rav Ḥisda: What with regard to a sale: said to him: Even with regard to a sale he does not acquire
llm_translation: Requested translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin asked Rav Chisda: In a sale, what is the law? He said to him: Even in a sale, he did not acquire.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: חֶנְוָנִי כְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֶנְוָנִי כְּשׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: raised an objection to him: a storekeeper as a homeowner; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: a storekeeper as a money changer.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Chenvani is like the master of the house, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Chenvani is like Shulchani.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר: חֶנְוָנִי כְּשׁוּלְחָנִי, וּמָר סָבַר חֶנְוָנִי כְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת. אֲבָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא: אִם הוֹצִיא – מָעַל! רַבִּי מֵאִיר לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קָאָמַר: לְדִידִי, אִם הוֹצִיא נָמֵי לֹא מָעַל, אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, אוֹדִי לִי מִיהָא דְּחֶנְוָנִי כְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת! וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, כְּשׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to As Sage, holds a storekeeper as a money changer, and Sage, holds a storekeeper as a homeowner. But everyone if spend he has misused Rabbi Meir stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, According to me, if he spent he has also not misused but according to you, at least concede to me that a storekeeper as to a homeowner. And said to him: No, as a money changer.
llm_translation: Until here, he did not argue except that Master holds: Chenvani is like a messenger, and Master holds Chenvani is like a homeowner. But according to the entire world: if he took out – he is liable! Rabbi Meir agrees with the words of Rabbi Yehuda, saying: According to my opinion, if he took out, he is also not liable, but according to your opinion, I will agree with you that Chenvani is like a homeowner! And he said to him: No, he is like a messenger.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav says:
llm_translation: Said Rav:

hebrew_text: חָזַרְנוּ עַל כׇּל צְדָדִים שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְלֹא מָצִינוּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּשׁוֹגֵג אֵין מִתְחַלֵּל, בְּמֵזִיד מִתְחַלֵּל.
human_translation: We reviewed all angles of Rabbi Meir, and we did not find consecrated is not desacralized unwittingly is desacralized intentionally.
llm_translation: We have reviewed all the opinions of Rabbi Meir, and we did not find that if one mistakenly desecrates the Sabbath, he is not liable, but if intentionally, he is liable.

hebrew_text: וּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ בְּכׇתְנוֹת כְּהוּנָּה שֶׁלֹּא בָּלוּ, הוֹאִיל וְנִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת.
human_translation: And our mishna, with regard to priestly tunics that have not worn out because they were given benefit from them since the Torah was not given to the ministering angels.
llm_translation: From our Mishnah in the garments of the priesthood that have not worn out, since they were given to benefit from them, because the Torah was not given to ministering angels.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כׇּתְנוֹת כְּהוּנָּה שֶׁבָּלוּ מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. מַאי לָאו אֲפִילּוּ לֹא בָּלוּ? לָא, בָּלוּ דַּוְקָא.
human_translation: Come hear: priestly tunics that have worn out, misuses by them; the statement of Rabbi Meir. What, is it not even they had not worn out, No, specifically have worn out.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Linen garments that have not been worn are subject to ritual impurity, the words of Rabbi Meir. What is the reason? Is it not even if they have not been worn? No, specifically if they have been worn.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מוֹעֲלִים בְּחַדְתִין וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִים בְּעַתִּיקִים. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מוֹעֲלִין אַף בְּעַתִּיקִים, שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מוֹעֲלִין בִּשְׁיָרֵי הַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: Come hear: One misuse by new but one not misuse by old the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: One misuse even by old as Rabbi Meir would say: One misuse by the remainder of the chamber,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One is liable for foreskins but not for hymens. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: One is liable even for hymens, for Rabbi Meir used to say: One is liable for the gates of the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְנִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, דְּהָא חוֹמַת הָעִיר וּמִגְדְּלוֹתֶיהָ מִשְּׁיָרֵי הַלִּשְׁכָּה אָתוּ, דִּתְנַן: חוֹמַת הָעִיר וּמִגְדְּלוֹתֶיהָ, וְכׇל צׇרְכֵי הָעִיר בָּאִין מִשְּׁיָרֵי הַלִּשְׁכָּה. לָא תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֶלָּא אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But why Let us say because they were given benefit since the Torah was not given to ministering angels as the wall of the city and its towers comes from the remainder of the chamber, as we learned The wall of the city, its towers, and all requirements of the city come from the remainder of the chamber. Do not say Rabbi Meir. Rather, say Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And why? Say: Since they were given to benefit from, because the Torah was not given to the ministering angels, for the wall of the city and its towers come from the leftovers of the chamber, as we learned: the wall of the city and its towers, and all the needs of the city come from the leftovers of the chamber. Do not say Rabbi Meir, rather say Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אַבְנֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ מוֹעֲלִים בָּהֶם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. לָא תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֶלָּא אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Come hear As it is taught Rabbi Yishmael bar Rabbi Yitzḥak said: stones of Jerusalem that fell, one misuse by them; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Do not say Rabbi Meir. Rather, say Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Come and hear: as it was taught, Rabbi Yishmael the son of Rabbi Yitzchak said: The stones of Jerusalem that were dismantled are considered disqualified, the words of Rabbi Meir. Do not say Rabbi Meir, rather say Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, יְרוּשָׁלַיִם מִי מִיקַּדְּשָׁא? וְהָתְנַן: כְּאִימְּרָא, כַּדִּירִים, כָּעֵצִים, כָּאִישִּׁים, כַּהֵיכָל, כַּמִּזְבֵּחַ, כִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר: ״יְרוּשָׁלַיִם״ לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: If Rabbi Yehuda, is Jerusalem consecrated But didn’t we learn like the lamb like the enclosures, like the wood like the fires like the Sanctuary, like the altar, like Jerusalem, Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who says Jerusalem has not said anything,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If Rabbi Yehuda, Jerusalem who sanctifies? And we learned: like a city, like dwellings, like trees, like men, like a temple, like an altar, like Jerusalem. Rabbi Yehuda says: anyone who says "Jerusalem" did not say anything.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא אָמַר: ״כִּירוּשָׁלַיִם״, וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״כִּירוּשָׁלַיִם״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, עַד שֶׁיִּדּוֹר בְּדָבָר הַקָּרֵב בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם!
human_translation: And if you would say because did not say: Like Jerusalem, but isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who says like Jerusalem has not said anything, until he vows by an item that is sacrificed in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: And if you will say, because he did not say "Jerusalem," but it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who says "Jerusalem" - it is as though he said nothing until he dwells in the matter that is close in Jerusalem!

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי נִינְהוּ וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: are two tanna’im and with regard to of Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Two Tannaim are they, and the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּבַר פְּדָא, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּמֵזִיד – מִתְחַלֵּל, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – אֵין מִתְחַלֵּל. וְלֹא אָמְרוּ בְּשׁוֹגֵג מִתְחַלֵּל אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן בִּלְבָד. וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאֵין מִתְחַלֵּל, קׇרְבָּן בְּמַאי מִחַיַּיב?!
human_translation: Ulla said in the name of bar Padda: Rabbi Meir would say: Consecrated is desacralized intentionally; is not desacralized unwittingly. And they said unwittingly is desacralized only with regard to an offering, But since it is not desacralized for what rendered liable an offering,
llm_translation: Ulla said in the name of Bar Peda: Rabbi Meir says, "If one consecrates intentionally, he becomes desecrated; if unintentionally, he does not become desecrated." And they only said that unintentional consecration does not result in desecration with regard to the matter of the offering alone. But since he does not become desecrated, with what is he liable regarding the offering?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין פָּרֵישׁ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּבַר פְּדָא, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּמֵזִיד – מִתְחַלֵּל, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – אֵין מִתְחַלֵּל. וְלֹא אָמְרוּ בְּשׁוֹגֵג מִתְחַלֵּל אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן אֲכִילָה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came he explained in the name of bar Padda: Rabbi Meir would say: Consecrated is desacralized intentionally; is not desacralized unwittingly. And they said unwittingly is desacralized only with regard to eating.
llm_translation: Instead, when Ravin the Pharisee came in the name of Bar Peda, he said: Rabbi Meir used to say: If one consecrates intentionally, he becomes desecrated; if unintentionally, he does not become desecrated. And they only said that unintentional consecration desecrates with regard to eating alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר הוֹאִיל וּסְתַם לַן תְּנָא כְּוָתֵיהּ, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ הוֹאִיל וּסְתַם לַן תְּנָא כְּוָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rav Adda bar Ahava says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Meir with regard to tithe as tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with his And halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to consecrated as tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said in the name of Rav Adda bar Ahava: The halakha is according to Rabbi Meir in matters of tithing, since a Tanna taught it to us anonymously in accordance with his opinion, and the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda in matters of consecration, since a Tanna taught it to us anonymously in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, מַאי הִיא – דִּתְנַן: כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין לוֹ חוֹמֶשׁ וְאֵין לוֹ בִּיעוּר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ לוֹ.
human_translation: What is in accordance with Rabbi Meir with regard to tithe? as we learned a vineyard fourth year, Beit Shammai say: It does not have one-fifth, And it does not have disposal, And Beit Hillel say: It does have
llm_translation: As Rabbi Meir in Ma'aser, what is it - as we learned: A vineyard of a quarter, Beit Shammai says: it does not have tithing and it does not have selection. And Beit Hillel says: it does.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ לוֹ פֶּרֶט וְיֵשׁ לוֹ עוֹלֵלוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כּוּלּוֹ לַגַּת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: It has individual fallen grapes [ peret ], and it has incompletely formed clusters [ olelot ]. And Beit Hillel say: All of it to the winepress
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "He has a detail and he has offspring." And House of Hillel says: "All for the winepress."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל – גָּמְרִי ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״ מִמַּעֲשֵׂר, מָה מַעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לוֹ חוֹמֶשׁ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בִּיעוּר – אַף כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי יֵשׁ לוֹ חוֹמֶשׁ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בִּיעוּר. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי לָא גָּמְרִי ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״ מִמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: What is the reason of Beit Hillel? They derive “holy” from “holy” tithe, Just as tithe has one-fifth and it has disposal, so too, fourth-year vineyard has one-fifth and it has disposal. And Beit Shammai do not derive “holy” “holy” from tithe.
llm_translation: What is the reason for the opinion of Beit Hillel? - They learn "holy" "holy" from tithe, just as tithe has a fifth and has the concept of selection, so too a quarter vineyard has a fifth and has the concept of selection. But Beit Shammai did not learn "holy" "holy" from tithe.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים כְּמַעֲשֵׂר, כְּמַאן סְבִירָא לְהוּ? אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אַמַּאי כּוּלּוֹ לַגַּת? הָאָמַר מַעֲשֵׂר מָמוֹן הֶדְיוֹט הוּא! אֶלָּא לָאו כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר!
human_translation: And Beit Hillel, say like tithe, in accordance with whose do they hold If in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, why all of it to the winepress? Didn’t say tithe is common, property, Rather, is it not in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: House of Hillel says like tithe, like who holds for them? If like Rabbi Yehuda, why all to the winepress? He said tithe is money of the commoner! Rather not like Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ מַאי הִיא – דִּתְנַן: שִׁילַּח בְּיַד פִּיקֵּחַ וְנִזְכַּר עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ אֵצֶל חֶנְווֹנִי – חֶנְווֹנִי מָעַל לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא.
human_translation: What is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to consecrated As we learned sent in the possession of competent and remembered before reached the storekeeper, the storekeeper misused consecrated when he will spend
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Kadesh, what is it? - as we learned: If one sent with a messenger and he remembered before it reached Chenwoni - Chenwoni transgresses when he takes it out.

hebrew_text: וּכְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂר מִי לָא תְּנַן? וְהָתְנַן: הַפּוֹדֶה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁלּוֹ – מוֹסִיף עָלָיו חֲמִישִׁיתוֹ, בֵּין מִשֶּׁלּוֹ בֵּין שֶׁנִּיתַּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה. מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא – מִי מָצֵי יָהֵיב לֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנָה? וְהָאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂר מָמוֹן גָּבוֹהַּ הוּא! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to tithe? But didn’t we learn one who redeems his second tithe, he adds to it its one-fifth, whether from his given to him as a gift. whose If we say it is Rabbi Meir, can one give to as a gift? But didn’t he say tithe is property Most High, Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to Rabbi Yehuda, in regards to tithing, did we not teach? And we learned: One who redeems his second tithe - he adds a fifth to it, whether it is his own or was given to him as a gift. Who is the Tanna? If you say it is Rabbi Meir - can one give it to him as a gift? But didn't he say: Tithing is a matter of monetary value! Rather, it is not Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דְּיָהֵיב נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּטִיבְלֵיהּ, וְקָסָבַר: מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ כְּמִי שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: No, actually Rabbi Meir, and with what are we dealing here? where he gave him in its untithed produce. and he holds gifts that have not been separated are not considered as though they have been separated.
llm_translation: No, Rabbi Meir, and here we are dealing with what? For example, if one gives his wife her marriage contract and he thinks: gifts that were not thrown are like those that were not thrown, they are similar.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַפּוֹדֶה נֶטַע רְבָעִי שֶׁלּוֹ – מוֹסִיף עָלָיו חֲמִישִׁיתוֹ, בֵּין מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, בֵּין שֶׁנִּיתַּן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה. מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר – מִי מָצֵי יָהֵיב לֵיהּ? וְהָא גָּמְרִי ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״ מִמַּעֲשֵׂר! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: Come hear one who redeems his fourth-year produce, he adds to it its one-fifth, whether from his given to him as a gift. whose If we say Rabbi Meir, can one give to But didn’t he derive “holy” “holy” from tithe? Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who redeems his quarter of a field - he adds a fifth to it, whether it is his own or whether it was given to him as a gift. Is that so? If you say it is Rabbi Meir - who would give it to him? But we have learned "holy" "holy" from the tithe! Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דְּיָהֵיב כְּשֶׁהוּא סְמָדַר. וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: סְמָדַר אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא פֶּרִי.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Meir, and with what are we dealing here? where he gave him when it was a bud. And this is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says: A bud is forbidden because it is a fruit.
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Meir, and here with what we are dealing, such as that he gives while it is still attached. And not like Rabbi Yosei, who said: attached is forbidden, because it is still a fruit.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָשַׁךְ הֵימֶנּוּ מַעֲשֵׂר בְּסֶלַע וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לִפְדּוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁעָמַד בִּשְׁתַּיִם – נוֹתֵן סֶלַע, וּמִשְׂתַּכֵּר בְּסֶלַע, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁלּוֹ. מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אַמַּאי מִשְׂתַּכֵּר בְּסֶלַע? ״וְנָתַן אֶת הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Come hear pulled tithe worth a sela from him, and did not manage to redeem it until stood at two gives a sela and he gains a sela and the second tithe is his, whose If we say Rabbi Meir, why does gain a sela ? The Merciful One states And he will give the money and it will be assured to him Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one extended his tithe onto a rock and did not manage to redeem it until it stood on two rocks - he gives a rock, and he transacts with a rock, and it becomes his second tithe. Who is the authority? If you say it is Rabbi Meir, why does he transact with a rock? "And he shall give the money and it shall be assured to him" - the Merciful One said! Rather, it is not the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָכָא חַד סְתָמָא, וְהָכָא תְּרֵי סְתָמֵי.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yehuda. as here one unattributed here two unattributed
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Yehuda, and here one anonymous, and here two anonymous.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סְתָמָא דַּוְקָא, מָה לִי חַד סְתָמָא מָה לִי תְּרֵי סְתָמֵי?! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן בִּבְחִירָתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: But if an unattributed specifically what to me one unattributed two unattributed Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Meir, since we learned preferred in accordance with his
llm_translation: And if it is a mere assumption, why do I need one assumption, why do I need two assumptions?! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, since we learned in the choice like his.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: בְּהֵמָה שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְמִגְדַּל עֵדֶר וּכְמִדָּתָהּ לְכׇל רוּחַ, זְכָרִים – עוֹלוֹת, נְקֵבוֹת – זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: We learned there an animal that was found from Jerusalem as Migdal Eder, and within that distance in any direction, Males burnt-offerings, Females peace-offerings,
llm_translation: We learned there: Regarding an animal found from Jerusalem to Migdal Eder, and according to its measure for every spirit, males - burnt offerings, females - peace offerings.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא זְכָרִים, עוֹלוֹת הוּא דְּהָווּ, זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים לָא הָווּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הָכָא בָּבָא לָחוּב בִּדְמֵיהֶן עָסְקִינַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא עוֹלוֹת, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּמֵזִיד מִתְחַלֵּל.
human_translation: But are males burnt-offerings and not peace-offerings? Rabbi Oshaya said: here we are dealing with one who comes to obligate their value. and this is saying: we are concerned perhaps burnt-offerings, And this is Rabbi Meir, who says: Consecrated is desacralized intentionally.
llm_translation: Rather, males, they are burnt offerings, for they were, peace offerings were they not? Rabbi Oshaia said: Here we are dealing with the case where they came to obligate themselves with their money, and thus he said: We are concerned that perhaps they are burnt offerings, and this is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who said: One who consecrates intentionally desecrates.

hebrew_text: וּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף מִי מִתְחַלֵּל? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין מוֹעֵל אַחַר מוֹעֵל בְּמוּקְדָּשִׁין אֶלָּא בִּבְהֵמָה וּבִכְלִי שָׁרֵת בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And inherent sanctity, be desacralized? But didn’t we learn There is no misuse after misuse with regard to consecrated apart from an animal and from service vessels alone.
llm_translation: "And the sanctity of the body, who defiles it? And we learned: One does not benefit from one consecration to another in consecrated items except in an animal and in a service vessel alone."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? הָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, בָּא חֲבֵירוֹ וְרָכַב, בָּא חֲבֵירוֹ וְרָכַב – כּוּלָּם מָעֲלוּ. הָיָה שׁוֹתֶה בְּכוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב, בָּא חֲבֵירוֹ וְשָׁתָה, בָּא חֲבֵירוֹ וְשָׁתָה – כּוּלָּם מָעֲלוּ! הָהִיא – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: How was riding on animal, another came and rode another came and rode they have all misused was drinking from a golden cup another came and drank another came and drank they have all misused That is Rabbi Yehuda, this Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: How so? If one was riding on an animal, his fellow came and rode, his fellow came and rode - all of them ascend. If one was drinking from a cup of gold, his fellow came and drank, his fellow came and drank - all of them ascend! That one - Rabbi Yehuda it is, that one - Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נִשְׁמַע לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר – לָאו אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּשׁוֹגֵג מִתְחַלֵּל וּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף לָא מִתַּחֲלָא. לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּמֵזִיד מִתְחַלֵּל קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף לָא מִתַּחֲלָא! הָתָם לָא קָא מְכַוֵּין לְאַפּוֹקִינְהוּ לְחוּלִּין. הָכָא – קָא מְכַוֵּין לְאַפּוֹקִינְהוּ לְחוּלִּין.
human_translation: Let us hear, from of Rabbi Yehuda to Rabbi Meir: Didn’t Rabbi Yehuda say consecrated is desacralized unwittingly, and inherent sanctity are not desacralized. to Rabbi Meir as well, although consecrated is desacralized intentionally, inherent sanctity not be desacralized. There, does not intend to withdraw it to a non-sacred here, does intend to withdraw it to a non-sacred
llm_translation: From Rabbi Yehudah it was heard to Rabbi Meir - did not say Rabbi Yehudah: one who sanctifies unintentionally becomes desecrated, and the sanctity of the body does not become desecrated. To Rabbi Meir also, even though one who sanctifies intentionally becomes desecrated, the sanctity of the body does not become desecrated! There, they do not intend to bring it to a mundane state. Here, they intend to bring it to a mundane state.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים, בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? – אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שְׁמֵיהּ: קַל וָחוֹמֶר: קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים מִתְחַלְּלִים – קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Say that you have heard Rabbi Meir in offerings of the most sacred order, did you hear him in offerings of lesser sanctity, One of the Sages, and his name was Rabbi Ya’akov, said to him: an a fortiori offerings of the most sacred order be desacralized, not all the more so offerings of lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: Statement: If you heard from Rabbi Meir regarding the holiest of holies, how much more so regarding the lesser holies? - That certain one said to him, the one from the Sages, and Rabbi Yaakov is his name: A fortiori reasoning: If the holiest of holies can be desecrated, then certainly the lesser holies can be desecrated?!

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּמֵזִיד – מִתְחַלֵּל, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – אֵין מִתְחַלֵּל, אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים וְאֶחָד קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים. קַל וָחוֹמֶר: קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים מִתְחַלְּלִים – קֳדָשִׁים קַלִּים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: It was also stated: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Akiva, says Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says Rabbi Meir would say: Consecrated is desacralized intentionally, is not desacralized unwittingly. both offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity, an a fortiori offerings of the most sacred order be desacralized, not all the more so offerings of lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: It was stated: Namely, Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Akiva said, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Rabbi Meir used to say: If one sanctified intentionally – he becomes desecrated, if unintentionally – he does not become desecrated, whether it is the most holy sacrifices or less holy sacrifices. A fortiori: If the most holy sacrifices become desecrated – all the more so the less holy sacrifices?!

hebrew_text: תָּהֵי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכִי אוֹמְרִים לוֹ לָאָדָם: עֲמוֹד וַחֲטָא בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתִּזְכֶּה? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַמְתִּין לַהּ עַד שֶׁתּוּמַם, וּמַיְיתֵי שְׁתֵּי בְּהֵמוֹת וּמַתְנֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan wondered about And does one say to a person: Arise and sin in order that you may gain? Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: waits for it until it develops a blemish. And he brings two animals and stipulates
llm_translation: Let it be with him, Rabbi Yochanan: And do they say to a person: Stand and sin so that you may merit? Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: Wait for her until she is mature, and bring two animals and give as a gift.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: זְכָרִים – עוֹלוֹת. דִּילְמָא תּוֹדָה הִיא? דְּמַיְיתֵי נָמֵי תּוֹדָה. וְהָא בָּעֲיָא לֶחֶם! דְּמַיְיתֵי נָמֵי לֶחֶם.
human_translation: The Master says Males burnt-offerings, perhaps it is a thanks-offering, that also bring a thanks-offering But require bread He brings bread as well.
llm_translation: Master said: "Zekharim - olot." Perhaps it is a thanksgiving offering? For it resembles a thanksgiving offering. But it requires bread! For it resembles bread.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא אָשָׁם הוּא? אָשָׁם בֶּן שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח בֶּן שָׁנָה. וְדִילְמָא אֲשַׁם מְצוֹרָע הוּא, אֲשַׁם נָזִיר הוּא? לָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: But perhaps it is a guilt-offering, a guilt-offering in its second year, and an in its first year was found. But perhaps it is the guilt-offering of a leper the guilt-offering of a nazirite, not common,
llm_translation: Perhaps it is an Asham? Asham son of two years, and his wife is a year old. And perhaps it is an Asham of a Metzora, an Asham of a Nazir? It is not common.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא פֶּסַח הוּא? פֶּסַח בִּזְמַנּוֹ, מִזְהָר זְהִירִי בֵּיהּ, וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ – שְׁלָמִים הוּא.
human_translation: But perhaps it is a Paschal offering, a Paschal offering, in its time carefully guard it And that not in its time, it as a peace-offering.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is Pesach? Pesach in its time, be cautious with it, and if not in its time - it is a peace offering.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר נִינְהוּ? לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא, לְמֵיכְלִינְהוּ בְּמוּמָן? הָכִי נָמֵי בְּמוּמָן מִתְאַכְלִי!
human_translation: And perhaps is a firstborn or tithe, With regard to which halakha to eat them in their blemished These as well are eaten in their blemished
llm_translation: Perhaps they are considered firstborn and tithe? For what purpose? To eat them with a blemish? Indeed, with a blemish they may be eaten!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נְקֵבוֹת – זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים. דִּילְמָא תּוֹדָה הִיא? דְּמַיְיתֵי תּוֹדָה. וְהָא בָּעֲיָא לֶחֶם! דְּמַיְיתֵי נָמֵי לֶחֶם.
human_translation: The Master says Females peace-offerings, Perhaps it is a thanks-offering, that bring thanks-offering But require bread He brings bread as well.
llm_translation: Master said: Females - peace offerings. Perhaps it is a thanksgiving offering? It resembles a thanksgiving offering. But it requires bread! It also resembles bread.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא חַטָּאת הִיא? חַטָּאת בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח בַּת שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. וְדִילְמָא חַטָּאת שֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתָהּ! לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: But perhaps it is a sin-offering, a sin-offering in its first year, and an in its second year was found. But perhaps a sin-offering whose year had passed not common,
llm_translation: Perhaps it is a sin offering? A sin offering of one year, and a woman gives birth after two years. And perhaps it is a sin offering that has passed its year! It is not common.

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתְּכַח בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ, מַאי? תַּנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן חֲכִינַאי אוֹמֵר: עֵז בַּת שְׁנָתָהּ לְחַטָּאת. לְחַטָּאת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּחַטָּאת – כּוֹנְסָהּ לְכִיפָּה וְהִיא מֵתָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ.
human_translation: what was found in its first year? It is taught Ḥananya ben Ḥakhinai says: a goat in its first year, as a sin-offering. Can it enter your mind as a sin offering? Rather, Abaye says: as a sin-offering, conveys it into a cell and it dies on its own.
llm_translation: You found a goat in its first year, what is the law? It was taught: Chananya son of Chakinai says: A goat in its first year for a sin-offering. For a sin-offering, is that your opinion?! Rather Abaye said: Like a sin-offering - it gathers for its atonement and dies from it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין לוֹקְחִים בְּהֵמָה בִּמְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי,
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not purchase an animal with second-tithe money
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not purchase an animal with Second Tithe coins.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָקַח בְּשׁוֹגֵג – יַחְזְרוּ דָּמִים לִמְקוֹמָם. בְּמֵזִיד – תַּעֲלֶה וְתֵאָכֵל בַּמָּקוֹם. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּמִתְכַּוֵּין וְלָקַח תְּחִילָּה לְשֵׁם שְׁלָמִים, אֲבָל בְּמִתְכַּוֵּין לְהוֹצִיא מְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי לְחוּלִּין, בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג בֵּין מֵזִיד – יַחְזְרוּ דָּמִים לִמְקוֹמָם.
human_translation: and if one purchased unwittingly, the money returns to its place, intentionally, is brought up and eaten in place, Rabbi Yehuda said: In what is this statement said? with regard to with intent, and purchased the outset for the sake of a peace-offering, But with regard to with intent to withdraw the second-tithe money to a desacralized whether unwitting, intentional, the money returns to its place.
llm_translation: "And if he took it unintentionally - the blood shall be returned to its place. If he took it intentionally - it shall be offered up and eaten in its place. Rabbi Yehuda said: In what case are these words said? In a case where one intended to bring it initially for the sake of peace offerings, but if one intended to use it to withdraw money from second tithe for common use, whether unintentionally or intentionally - the blood shall be returned to its place."

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּמֵזִיד – קִידֵּשׁ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אִשָּׁה יוֹדַעַת שֶׁאֵין מְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מִתְחַלְּלִין עַל יָדָהּ, וְעוֹלָה וְאוֹכַלְתּוֹ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: intentionally, he has betrothed Rabbi Elazar said: a woman knows that second-tithe money is not desacralized by her and she ascend and eat it in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: Intentionally - he sanctified! Rabbi Elazar said: A woman who knows that second tithe coins are not being redeemed through her, and she goes up and eats it in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: וַהֲרֵי בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה, עֲבָדִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת, דְּאָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין מְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מִתְחַלְּלִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וּתְנַן: אֵין לוֹקְחִים בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה עֲבָדִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת בִּמְעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי אֲפִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. וְאִם לָקַח – יֹאכַל כְּנֶגְדָּן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya objects to this: But a non-kosher animal, slaves, or land, a person knows that second-tithe money is not desacralized by them, and we learned One may not purchase a non-kosher animal, slaves, or land with second-tithe money, even in Jerusalem. And if one did purchase he must eat corresponding to their
llm_translation: Rebbe Yirmiyah objects to her: And behold, with regard to an impure animal, slaves, and plots of land, for a person knows that second tithe money is not desecrated on them. And we learned in a Mishnah: One may not purchase an impure animal, slaves, and plots of land with second tithe money, even in Jerusalem. And if one did purchase them, he may eat opposite them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּאִשָּׁה חֲבֵירָה עָסְקִינַן, דְּיָדְעָה.
human_translation: Rather, here, we are dealing with a woman devoted to the meticulous observance of mitzvot, especially the halakhot of ritual purity, teruma , and tithes [ ḥavera ], who knows
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with a woman who is familiar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִם לָקַח יֹאכַל כְּנֶגְדָּן. וְאַמַּאי? יַחְזְרוּ דָּמָיו לִמְקוֹמָם, כִּי הָתָם!
human_translation: The Master said: If one did purchase he must eat corresponding to their But why the money must return to its place, as there,
llm_translation: Master said: If he took, he may eat opposite them. And why? His blood shall return to its place, as it is there!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: Shmuel says:
llm_translation: Said Shmuel:

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁבָּרַח. וְטַעְמָא דְּבָרַח, הָא לֹא בָּרַח – קָנְסִינַן לְמוֹכֵר. וְנִקְנְסֵיהּ לְלוֹקֵחַ! לָאו עַכְבְּרָא גַּנָּב אֶלָּא חוֹרָא גַּנָּב.
human_translation: where fled And the reason is that he fled, but had he not fled, we would penalize the seller And let us penalize the buyer not the mouse steals, but the hole steals.
llm_translation: When he fled, and the reason for fleeing, if he did not flee - we penalize the seller. And we penalize the buyer! Is it not a mouse that steals, but a hole that steals.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא עַכְבְּרָא, חוֹרָא מַאי קָעָבֵיד? מִסְתַּבְּרָא, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא אִיסּוּרָא – הָתָם קָנְסִינַן.
human_translation: But if not mouse, what has the hole done? It stands to reason anywhere that the forbidden is, there we penalize.
llm_translation: And if not a mouse, what is the hole for? It is reasonable, wherever there is a prohibition - there we impose a penalty.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעׇרְלָה, בְּכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם, בְּשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, וּבְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה, בְּצִפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע, וּבִשְׂעַר נָזִיר, וּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, וּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וְחוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מְכָרָן וְקִידֵּשׁ בִּדְמֵיהֶן – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: one who betroths with orla , with diverse kinds in a vineyard, with an ox that is stoned, or with a heifer whose neck is broken, with leper’s birds or with a nazirite’s hair, or a firstborn donkey, or meat in milk, or non-sacred that were slaughtered in the courtyard, is not betrothed, one sold them and betrothed with money their she is betrothed,
llm_translation: It was taught: One who sanctifies with uncircumcised produce, with mixtures of the vineyard, with a stoned ox, and with a decapitated calf, with the birds of the leper, and with the hair of a Nazirite, and with the firstborn of a donkey, and with meat cooked in milk, and with mundane animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard – it is not sanctified. If one sells them and sanctifies with their value – it is sanctified.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּעׇרְלָה מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֲרֵלִים לֹא יֵאָכֵל״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִיסּוּר אֲכִילָה, הֲנָאָה מִנַּיִן? שֶׁלֹּא יֵהָנֶה מִמֶּנּוּ, וְלֹא יִצְבַּע בּוֹ, וְלֹא יַדְלִיק בּוֹ אֶת הַנֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַעֲרַלְתֶּם אֶת עׇרְלָתוֹ״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת כּוּלָּם.
human_translation: With orla : From where do we As it is taught forbidden [ arelim ] it shall not be eaten” I have only a prohibition eating From where benefit that one may not benefit from it and one may not paint with and one may not light a lamp with The verse states: “Then you shall count the fruit thereof [ orlato ] as forbidden [ araltem ]” to include all these
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive the prohibition of benefit from uncircumcised produce? For it was taught: "Uncircumcised shall not be eaten" - I have only the prohibition of eating, but from where do we derive the prohibition of deriving benefit from it, and not anointing with it, and not lighting a candle with it? The Talmud teaches: "And you shall circumcise the foreskin of your heart" - to include all of them.

hebrew_text: בְּכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם מְנָלַן? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא: ״פֶּן תִּקְדַּשׁ״ – פֶּן תּוּקַד אֵשׁ.
human_translation: with diverse kinds in a vineyard. From where do we Ḥizkiyya said: The verse states: “lest be forbidden [ pen tikdash ]” Lest it be burned [ pen tukad esh ],
llm_translation: In the restrictions of the vineyard, from where do we derive them? Hezekiah said: Scripture says: "Lest you consecrate" - lest fire consume it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״פֶּן יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ״. אִי מָה קֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו וְיוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין – אַף כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו וְיוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְחִזְקִיָּה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says Lest it become consecrated [ kodesh ], If just as consecrated transfers money it and becomes desacralized, so too, diverse kinds in a vineyard transfer money they and become desacralized. Rather, it is clear as of Ḥizkiyya.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Lest it become holy." If the sanctified animal takes its blood and goes out to secular use, so too, the boundaries of the vineyard take its blood and go out to secular use! Rather, Mechavvarta as Dhezikya.

hebrew_text: ״שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל״ מִנַּיִן? דְּתַנְיָא: מִמַּשְׁמָע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סָקוֹל יִסָּקֵל הַשּׁוֹר״ – אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁנְּבֵילָה הִיא, וּנְבֵילָה אֲסוּרָה בַּאֲכִילָה? מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ״? מַגִּיד לָךְ שֶׁאִם שְׁחָטוֹ לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ – אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: From where an ox that is stoned? As it is taught by inference from which is stated the ox shall be stoned, Don’t I know that animal carcass, and it is prohibited to eat animal carcass? What the verse states: “Its flesh shall not be eaten”? is telling you that if one slaughtered after its verdict had been reached prohibited to eat
llm_translation: "The stoned ox" - from where? As it was taught: From the implication of the verse, as it is stated: "The ox shall be stoned" - I do not know that it is a carcass, and a carcass is forbidden for consumption? What is the teaching when it says: "Its flesh shall not be eaten"? It informs you that if it was slaughtered after its judgment was completed, it is forbidden for consumption.

hebrew_text: בַּהֲנָאָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבַעַל הַשּׁוֹר נָקִי״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זוֹמָא אוֹמֵר: כְּאָדָם שֶׁאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״יָצָא פְּלוֹנִי נָקִי מִנְּכָסָיו וְאֵין לוֹ בָּהֶם הֲנָאָה שֶׁל כְּלוּם״.
human_translation: From where from benefit The verse states: “But the owner of the ox shall be clear.” From where may be inferred Shimon ben Zoma says: like a person who says to another: So-and-so was left clear [ naki ] of his property, and he has no benefit from it at all.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive the concept of benefit? The Torah teaches us: "And the owner of the ox shall be innocent." What does this imply? Shimon ben Zoma says: It is like a person who says to his friend: "So-and-so has gone out clean from his property, and he has no benefit from them at all."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ״ לְהֵיכָא דְּשָׁחֵיט לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ הוּא דַּאֲתָא? דִּילְמָא הֵיכָא דְּשָׁחֵיט לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ שְׁרֵי, וְהָא ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל״ – הֵיכָא דְּסַקְלֵיהּ מִיסְקָל הוּא דַּאֲתָא, וְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: From where that this “Its flesh shall not be eaten,” comes to where he slaughtered after its verdict was reached, Perhaps it is permitted if he slaughtered after its verdict had been reached. And this “Shall not be eaten,” comes where they stoned it, and in accordance with of Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: From what is derived this prohibition of "he shall not eat his flesh"? To where does it apply that one slaughters after its judgment is completed? Perhaps it applies to where one slaughters after its judgment is completed, it is permitted, and this prohibition of "he shall not eat" – to where does it apply that he is stoned, it is the case that he comes, and as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יֹאכַל״ ״לֹא תֹאכַל״ וְ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ״ – אֶחָד אִיסּוּר אֲכִילָה וְאֶחָד אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁפָּרַט לְךָ בִּנְבֵילָה!
human_translation: As Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Elazar says wherever it is stated: “It shall not be eaten”; “you,” “shall not eat”; or “you,” “shall not eat”; both a prohibition eating and a prohibition benefit unless the verse specifies for you in the manner that it specified for you with regard to an animal carcass,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: In every place where it is stated, "Do not eat," "You shall not eat," and "You shall not eat them" – one is a prohibition of consumption and one is a prohibition of benefit, until the verse specifies for you as it specified for you in the case of a carcass!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּנָפְקָא לַן אִיסּוּר אֲכִילָה מִ״לֹּא יֹאכַל״, הָכָא אִיסּוּר אֲכִילָה מִ״סָּקוֹל יִסָּקֵל״ נָפְקָא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לְאִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב, נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״לֹא יֵהָנֶה״.
human_translation: This statement applies only where we derive the prohibition eating from the words: “It may not be eaten,” here, the prohibition eating is derived from: “It shall be stoned,” As if it enters your mind that is written to prohibit benefit, let the verse state: “One may not derive benefit.”
llm_translation: These matters, where it emerged to us a prohibition of eating "he shall not eat," here a prohibition of eating "he shall be stoned" emerged. For if it would enter your mind to the prohibition of benefit, it is as it is written in the verse: "He shall not derive benefit."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל״, ״אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ״ לְמָה לִי?! אַף עַל גַּב דְּשַׁחְטֵיהּ כְּעֵין בָּשָׂר – אָסוּר.
human_translation: Alternatively, “It shall not be eaten,” why do I “its flesh”? although he slaughtered like meat, forbidden
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: 'Lo ye'achel', 'et besaro' l'mah li?! Af al gav de'shachteih ke'ein basar - asur." English translation: If it is said: "It shall not be eaten," "its flesh," why do I need it?! Even though it was slaughtered like regular meat - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: וְאֵימָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּבָדַק צוּר וְשָׁחַט בָּהּ, דְּמִיחֲזֵי כִּסְקִילָה, אֲבָל שַׁחְטֵיהּ בְּסַכִּין – לָא! מִידֵּי סַכִּין בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא כְּתִיב? וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: בַּכֹּל שׁוֹחֲטִין, בֵּין בְּצוֹר, בֵּין בִּזְכוּכִית, בֵּין בִּקְרוּמִית שֶׁל קָנֶה.
human_translation: Mar Zutra objects to this: But say this applies where he examined stone and slaughtered with it be considered like stoning, But he slaughtered it with a knife, not Was a knife written in the Torah? And moreover, it is taught slaughter with anything whether with a stone, whether with glass, whether with the stalk of a reed.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra objects to him: But say, where these words apply, in a case where one examines a rock and slaughters upon it, as it appears like stoning, but if he slaughters it with a knife - no! Is it not written in the Torah regarding the matter of slaughtering with a knife? And furthermore, it was taught: In all cases one may slaughter, whether on rock, or on glass, or on the top of a reed.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּנָפְקָא לַן אִיסּוּר אֲכִילָה וְאִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִ״לֹּא יֵאָכֵל״, הַאי ״בַּעַל הַשּׁוֹר נָקִי״ לְמַאי אֲתָא? לַהֲנָאַת עוֹרוֹ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ״ כְּתִיב, בְּשָׂרוֹ אָסוּר וְעוֹרוֹ מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And now that we have derived the prohibition eating and the prohibition benefiting from: “It shall not be eaten,” what does that “But the owner of the ox shall be clear,” come to benefit its hide enter your mind to say it is written: “Its flesh shall not be eaten,” its flesh is forbidden, but its hide is permitted.
llm_translation: At this time when we were presented with the prohibition of eating and the prohibition of deriving benefit, both are derived from the verse "it shall not be eaten." This "innocent owner of the ox," for what purpose does it come? For the benefit of its hide. If you were to ask my opinion, I would say: "its flesh shall not be eaten" is written, its flesh is prohibited and its hide is permitted.

hebrew_text: וּלְהָנָךְ תַּנָּאֵי דְּמַפְּקִי לֵיהּ הַאי ״בַּעַל הַשּׁוֹר נָקִי״ לַחֲצִי כּוֹפֶר וְלִדְמֵי וַלְדוֹת, הֲנָאַת עוֹרוֹ מְנָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: And to those tanna’im who expound this “The owner of the ox shall be clear,” to half indemnity payment for offspring from where do they benefiting from hide?
llm_translation: The scholars taught: that which the verse "the owner of the ox shall be innocent" applies to half payment and to damages, how do we determine the benefit of its hide?

hebrew_text: מֵ״אֶת בְּשָׂרוֹ״, אֶת הַטָּפֵל לִבְשָׂרוֹ. וְאִידַּךְ?
human_translation: from “Its flesh et besaro ].” that which is secondary to the flesh, And the other
llm_translation: From "his flesh," he anointed his flesh. And the other?

hebrew_text: ״אֶת״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: שִׁמְעוֹן הָעַמְסוֹנִי וְאָמְרִי לַהּ נְחֶמְיָה הָעַמְסוֹנִי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ כׇּל אֶתִּין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְ״אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תִּירָא״, פֵּירַשׁ.
human_translation: does not interpret “ et ” As it is taught Shimon HaAmasoni, and some say Neḥemya HaAmasoni, would interpret all “ et ” in the Torah, Once he reached “You shall fear the Lord your God” he withdrew
llm_translation: "Et" not expounded. As it was taught: Shimon the Emsonite said, and some say it was Nehemiah the Emsonite, used to expound every "et" in the Torah. Once he reached the verse "et Hashem Elohecha tira" (Deuteronomy 6:13), he explained.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, כׇּל אֶתִּין שֶׁדָּרַשְׁתָּ מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶם? אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁקִּבַּלְתִּי שָׂכָר עַל הַדְּרִישָׁה, כָּךְ קִבַּלְתִּי עַל הַפְּרִישָׁה. עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְלִימֵּד: ״אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תִּירָא״ – לְרַבּוֹת תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: His students said to him: Our teacher, what will be with all “ et ” that you interpreted He said to them: Just as I received reward for the exposition, so I received reward for withdrawal until Rabbi Akiva came and expounded: “You shall fear the Lord your God”: to include Torah scholars,
llm_translation: They said to him his students: Rabbi, all the times that you expounded, what will be upon them? He said to them: Just as I received reward for the exposition, so I received for the separation. Until Rabbi Akiva came and taught: "You shall fear the Lord your God" - to include the disciples of the sages.

hebrew_text: בְּעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה: מְנָלַן? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: ״כַּפָּרָה״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ, כְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: with a heifer whose neck is broken, From where do we The school of Rabbi Yannai said: atonement was written with regard to it. as sacrificial animals.
llm_translation: In the case of the heifer whose neck is to be broken: From where do we derive this? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: "Like atonement" is written regarding it, like the laws of sanctity.

hebrew_text: ״צִיפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע״ מְנָלַן? דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: נֶאֱמַר מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר מִבִּפְנִים, וְנֶאֱמַר מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: with the leper’s birds, From where do we As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: enables is stated and atones, inside And enables is stated and atones, outside
llm_translation: "The birds of the leper, where are they derived from? For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: It is stated that they are effective and atone from within, and it is stated that they are effective and atone from without."

hebrew_text: מָה מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר הָאָמוּר בִּפְנִים עָשָׂה בּוֹ מַכְשִׁיר כִּמְכַפֵּר – אַף מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר הָאָמוּר בַּחוּץ עָשָׂה בּוֹ מַכְשִׁיר כִּמְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: Just as enabling and atoning stated inside made the enabling like the atoning so too, enabling and atoning stated outside made the enabling like the atoning
llm_translation: What is valid and atones when stated regarding inside, if it was made with it valid it is like atoning - also what is valid and atones when stated regarding outside, if it was made with it valid it is like atoning.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: צִיפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע מֵאֵימָתַי אֲסוּרִים? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת לְקִיחָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מִשְּׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה, שְׁחִיטָה הוּא דְּאָסְרָה לַהּ. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת לְקִיחָה, מֵעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה נָפְקָא, מָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה מֵחַיִּים – אַף צִיפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: It was stated From when prohibited the leper’s birds? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From the moment of slaughter; and Reish Lakish says: From the moment taken Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From the moment of slaughter, it is the slaughter that prohibits them, Reish Lakish says: From the moment taken, is derived from the heifer whose neck is broken. Just as a heifer whose neck is broken during lifetime, so too, leper’s birds during lifetime.
llm_translation: It was stated: The birds of a leper, from when are they forbidden? Rabbi Yochanan said: From the time of slaughter, and Reish Lakish said: From the time of taking. Rabbi Yochanan said: From the time of slaughter, for it is the slaughter that renders them forbidden. Reish Lakish said: From the time of taking, as an analogy is drawn from a decapitated calf. Just as a decapitated calf is considered dead – so too the birds of a leper are considered dead.

hebrew_text: וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה גּוּפַהּ מֵאֵימָתַי? אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: גְּבוּל שָׁמַעְתִּי בָּהּ וְשָׁכַחְתִּי, וְנָסְבִין חַבְרַיָּא לוֹמַר: יְרִידָתָהּ לְנַחַל אֵיתָן הִיא אוֹסַרְתָּהּ. אִי מָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה מִשְּׁעַת לְקִיחָה לָא מִיתַּסְרָא, אַף צִיפּוֹרֵי מְצוֹרָע נָמֵי מִשְּׁעַת לְקִיחָה לָא מִיתַּסְרִי! הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם אִית לֵיהּ גְּבוּל אַחֲרִינָא, הָכָא מִי אִית לֵיהּ גְּבוּל אַחֲרִינָא?!
human_translation: And the heifer whose neck is broken, itself, from when Rabbi Yannai said: I heard boundary, it but I have forgotten But the group were inclined to say its descent to a hard valley, is renders it forbidden. If just as a heifer whose neck is broken, it is not forbidden from the moment taken so too, the leper’s birds should also not be forbidden from the moment taken. How can be compared? There, it has another boundary here, does it have another boundary?
llm_translation: "And a calf that is decapitated, from when is its body considered impure? Rabbi Yannai said: I heard its boundary and forgot it, and my colleagues gathered to say: Its descent to Nahal Eitan renders it forbidden. If so, a decapitated calf, from the moment of its taking, does not become forbidden, so too, the birds of a leper, from the moment of their taking, do not become forbidden! Is it so now?! There, it has another boundary, but here, does it have another boundary?!"

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״כׇּל צִפּוֹר טְהֹרָה תֹּאכֵלוּ״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמְשׁוּלַּחַת, ״וְזֶה אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֹאכְלוּ מֵהֶם״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשְּׁחוּטָה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מֵחַיִּים אֲסוּרָה, לְאַחַר שְׁחִיטָה מִיבַּעְיָא?! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקֳּדָשִׁים, דְּמֵחַיִּים אֲסִירִי, וְאָתְיָא שְׁחִיטָה וּמַכְשְׁרָה לְהוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish “Of all clean birds you may eat” to include sent away “But these are they of which you shall not eat” to include slaughtered And if it enters your mind is forbidden from alive, is necessary after slaughter? lest you say: Just as it is in of sacrificial animals, where prohibited them when alive, and slaughter comes and renders them fit teaches us
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "Every clean bird you may eat" - to include the domesticated bird, "But these you shall not eat of them" - to include the slaughtered one. And if you think that it is prohibited while alive, after slaughter it should be permissible?! Lest you say, since they become sanctified while alive, they are prohibited, and then comes slaughter and renders them fit for consumption, this is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁחָטָהּ וְנִמְצֵאת טְרֵיפָה – יִקַּח זוּג לַשְּׁנִיָּה, וְהָרִאשׁוֹנָה מוּתֶּרֶת בַּהֲנָאָה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מֵחַיִּים אֲסוּרָה, הָרִאשׁוֹנָה אַמַּאי מוּתֶּרֶת בַּהֲנָאָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת טְרֵיפָה בִּבְנֵי מֵעֶיהָ, דְּלָא חָל עֲלַהּ קְדוּשָּׁה כְּלָל.
human_translation: raised objection to slaughtered and it was found a bird with a condition that would have caused it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], a partner is taken for the second, while the first is permitted to benefit And if it enters your mind is forbidden from alive, why is permitted to benefit from the first one, said to him: With what are we dealing here? where was found a tereifa in its inner organs, that consecration did not take effect at all,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: If one slaughters it and it is found to be a treifah - he should take a pair for the second slaughter, and the first one is permitted for benefit. And if you think that it is forbidden from the outset, why is the first one permitted for benefit? He said to him: What are we dealing with here? For example, when it is found to be a treifah in its offspring, for holiness did not take effect upon it at all.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁחָטָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּאֵזוֹב וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵץ אֶרֶז וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁנִי תוֹלַעַת, רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוּקְצָה לְמִצְוָתָהּ – אֲסוּרָה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְנִשְׁחֲטָה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִצְוָתָהּ – מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: raised objection to slaughtered without a hyssop, or without cedar wood, or without a scarlet thread, Rabbi Ya’akov says: Since was set aside for its mitzva, forbidden Rabbi Shimon says: Since it was not slaughtered in accordance with its mitzva, permitted.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: If it was slaughtered not with hyssop, and not with cedar wood, and not with scarlet wool, Rabbi Yaakov says: Since it was disqualified for its commandment - it is forbidden. Rabbi Shimon says: Since it was slaughtered not according to its commandment - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא מָר סָבַר: שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה – שְׁמָהּ שְׁחִיטָה, וּמָר סָבַר: שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה – לֹא שְׁמָהּ שְׁחִיטָה. דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא מֵחַיִּים לָא מִיתַּסְרָא!
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to Sage, holds slaughter that is not fit is considered slaughter, and Sage, holds slaughter that is not fit is not considered slaughter But everyone agrees at least is not prohibited from benefit from it alive,
llm_translation: Until here, they do not argue except Master holds: slaughter that is not proper - its name is slaughter, and Master holds: slaughter that is not proper - its name is not slaughter. The whole world agrees with him, it does not cause death!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: נֶאֱמַר מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר מִבִּפְנִים, וְנֶאֱמַר מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: is tanna’im . As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: enables is stated and atones, inside And enables is stated and atones, outside
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita from the school of Rabbi Yishmael: It says "validating and atoning from within," and it says "validating and atoning from without."

hebrew_text: מָה מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר הָאָמוּר בִּפְנִים – עָשָׂה בּוֹ מַכְשִׁיר כִּמְכַפֵּר, אַף מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר הָאָמוּר בַּחוּץ – עָשָׂה בּוֹ מַכְשִׁיר כִּמְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: Just as enabling and atoning stated inside made the enabling like the atoning so too, enabling and atoning stated outside made the enabling like the atoning
llm_translation: What is considered valid and atoning when said regarding inside - he made with it something valid as atoning, so too what is considered valid and atoning when said regarding outside - he made with it something valid as atoning.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: ״כָּל צִפּוֹר טְהֹרָה תֹּאכֵלוּ״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמְשׁוּלַּחַת, ״וְזֶה אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֹאכְלוּ מֵהֶם״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשְּׁחוּטָה.
human_translation: the itself, “Of all clean birds you may eat” to include the sent away “But these are they of which you shall not eat” to include the slaughtered
llm_translation: Body: "Every clean bird you may eat" - to include the messenger bird, "But these you shall not eat of them" - to include the slaughtered bird.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: לֹא מָצִינוּ בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁאֲסוּרִים. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: וְלָא הֲרֵי
human_translation: And I will reverse Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: we have not found living creatures that are forbidden Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak objects to this But haven’t there are
llm_translation: And the opposite! Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: We did not find any living creatures that are forbidden. Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak objected to him: But behold
