hebrew_text: מוּקְצֶה וְנֶעֱבָד, דְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִינְהוּ וַאֲסִירִי! כִּי אֲסִירִי – לְגָבוֹהַּ, לְהֶדְיוֹט – מִישְׁרֵא שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: set aside and worshipped which are living creatures and are forbidden. when forbidden, for the Most High, for a common
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Muktzeh v'ne'evad, d'ba'alei chayim ninhu va'asiri! Ki asiri - l'gavoh, l'hediyot - mishra shrei." Translation: "Muktzeh and lost, for they are considered owners of living beings and prohibited! When they are prohibited - for the elite, for the commoner - they are considered straight."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הֲרֵי רוֹבֵעַ וְנִרְבָּע בְּעֵדִים, דְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִינְהוּ וַאֲסִירִי! אֶלָּא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: לֹא מָצִינוּ רוֹב בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים שֶׁאֲסוּרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya objects to But copulated copulated in witnesses, they are living creatures and are forbidden, Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: We have not found most living creatures that are forbidden
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Yirmeya objects to him: Behold, one who traps and quadruples with witnesses, they are considered owners of animals and are liable! Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: We did not find the majority of owners of animals to be liable.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְשִׁלַּח עַל פְּנֵי הַשָּׂדֶה״ – כְּשָׂדֶה, מָה שָׂדֶה מוּתֶּרֶת – אַף הַאי נָמֵי מוּתֶּרֶת. הַאי ״שָׂדֶה״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״שָׂדֶה״ – שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲמוֹד בְּיָפוֹ וְיִזְרְקֶנָּה לַיָּם, בִּגְבָת וְיִזְרְקֶנָּה לַמִּדְבָּר, וְשֶׁלֹּא יַעֲמוֹד חוּץ לָעִיר וְיִזְרְקֶנָּה בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר. אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁעוֹמֵד בָּעִיר וְיִזְרְקֶנָּה חוּץ לַחוֹמָה.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The verse states: “And shall let go into the open field” like a field: Just as a field is permitted, so too, this is also permitted. that “field” coming to this? That is necessary for that which is taught “field” that one may not stand in Jaffa and throw to the sea, in Gevat and throw it to the desert, and that he may not stand outside the city and throw it inside the city. Rather, any which he is standing in the city and throws it outside the wall
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Ishmael it was taught: As the verse states, "And he shall send it away over the face of the field" - just as a field that is exempt, so too this one is exempt. Why is the term "field" used in this context? Because it comes to teach as it is taught: "Field" - that one should not stand in Jaffa and throw it into the sea, nor stand on a hill and throw it into the desert, and that one should not stand outside the city and throw it into the midst of the city. Rather, anything that is standing within the city should be thrown outside the wall.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? אִם כֵּן נִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״שָׂדֶה״, מַאי ״הַשָּׂדֶה״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And the other If so, let the Torah write “field”; what “the field”? Conclude two from it,
llm_translation: And the other opinion? If so, it should be written in the verse: "field," what is "the field"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לֹא אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״שַׁלַּח״ לְתַקָּלָה.
human_translation: Rava says The Torah did not say “let go” for stumbling block.
llm_translation: Rava said: The Torah did not say, "Send" for an easy matter.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׂעַר נָזִיר. מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״קָדֹשׁ יִהְיֶה גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ״ – גִּידּוּלוֹ יִהְיֶה קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: with a nazirite’s hair, From where do we As the verse states “He shall be holy [ kadosh ], he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long” His growth shall be holy.
llm_translation: In hair of Nazir. From where? As said Scripture "holy he will be grow long hair his head" - his growth will be holy.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה קֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו, וְיוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין – אַף שְׂעַר נָזִיר תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו וְיוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין! מִי קָרֵינַן ״קוֹדֶשׁ״? ״קָדוֹשׁ״ קָרֵינַן.
human_translation: If just as consecrated transfers money it and becomes desacralized, so too, a nazirite’s hair should transfer money it and desacralized. Do we read holy [ kodesh ] We read “holy [ kadosh ].”
llm_translation: If what is holy takes hold of his blood, and he goes out to secular use - so too, the hair of a Nazirite takes hold of his blood and goes out to secular use! Why do we read "kodesh" (holy)? We should read "kadosh" (holy).

hebrew_text: בְּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר. נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּתַנְיָא: פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לְאַחַר עֲרִיפָה, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: with a firstborn donkey, Shall we say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon? As it is taught a firstborn donkey, benefit is prohibited; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Shimon permits Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: after neck broken, and everyone agrees
llm_translation: In the case of a firstborn donkey. It was stated in a Mishnah not like Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: The firstborn donkey is forbidden for benefit, the words of Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Shimon permits. Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: After its neck is broken, and this is the view of all.

hebrew_text: בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב. מְנָלַן? דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״לֹא תְבַשֵּׁל גְּדִי בַּחֲלֵב אִמּוֹ״ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים: אֶחָד אִיסּוּר אֲכִילָה, וְאֶחָד אִיסּוּר הֲנָאָה, וְאֶחָד אִיסּוּר בִּישּׁוּל.
human_translation: meat in milk, From where do we The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: three times: “You shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk” One the prohibition eating and one the prohibition benefit and one the prohibition cooking
llm_translation: Meat in milk. From where do we derive this? As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: "You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk" three times: one prohibition of eating, and one prohibition of benefit, and one prohibition of cooking.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בָּשָׂר בְּחָלָב אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם קָדוֹשׁ אַתָּה לַה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ לֹא תְבַשֵּׁל גְּדִי בַּחֲלֵב אִמּוֹ״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאַנְשֵׁי קֹדֶשׁ תִּהְיוּן לִי״. מָה לְהַלָּן אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה – אַף כָּאן אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says: prohibited to eat meat in milk but permitted to benefit as is stated: “For you are a holy people to the Lord your God. You shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk” and it states there “And you shall be holy men to Me” Just as there, prohibited to eat but permitted to benefit so too here, prohibited to eat but permitted to benefit
llm_translation: Mishnah that not like this Tanna. That it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says: Meat in milk forbidden in eating and permitted in benefit, as it says: "For you are a holy people to the Lord your God, you shall not cook a kid in its mother's milk." And further it says: "And you shall be men of holiness to Me." Just as there it is forbidden in eating and permitted in benefit, so too here it is forbidden in eating and permitted in benefit.

hebrew_text: וְחוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: שְׁחוֹט לִי – בְּשֶׁלִּי. וְשֶׁלָּךְ – בְּשֶׁלָּךְ. מַה שֶׁלִּי בְּשֶׁלָּךְ – אָסוּר, אַף שֶׁלָּךְ בְּשֶׁלִּי – אָסוּר.
human_translation: or non-sacred that were slaughtered in the courtyard, From where are these matters, Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: The Torah said: Slaughter for Me, in My and your in your Just as prohibited My in your so too, prohibited your in My
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And chullin that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard. From where are these matters? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: The Torah said, "Slaughter for Me - for Mine. And for you - for yours. Just as Mine in yours is prohibited, so too yours in Mine is prohibited."

hebrew_text: אִי מָה שֶׁלִּי בְּשֶׁלָּךְ עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, אַף שֶׁלָּךְ בְּשֶׁלִּי עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד לֹא הֱבִיאוֹ לְהַקְרִיב קׇרְבָּן לַה׳... וְנִכְרַת״, עַל קׇרְבָּן – עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, עַל חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה – אֵין עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: If just as My in your punishable by karet , so too, your in My punishable by karet . the verse states: and has not brought it to the door of the Tent of Meeting to sacrifice an offering to the Lord…and that man shall be cut off” for an offering he is punishable with karet , for non-sacred in the courtyard he is not punishable with karet .
llm_translation: "If what is mine is subject to your punishment of excision, then what is yours is subject to my punishment of excision? The verse states: 'But at the entrance to the tent of meeting they did not bring it to present an offering to the Lord... and he shall be cut off.' Regarding an offering – the punishment is excision, but regarding mundane animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard – there is no punishment of excision."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְשֶׁלִּי בְּשֶׁלָּךְ – שֶׁכֵּן עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת!
human_translation: can be refuted What to My in your is punishable by karet ,
llm_translation: There is room to differentiate: "What is mine is yours" - for the punishment is likewise excision!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מֵהָכָא: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ״ ״וְשָׁחַט אֹתוֹ״ ״וְשָׁחַט אֹתוֹ״. תְּלָתָא קְרָאֵי יַתִּירֵי, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said from here: three verses that a superfluous “and he slaughters it” “and he shall slaughter it” “and he shall slaughter it” Why the verse state
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: From here: "And he shall slaughter" "and he shall slaughter it" "and he shall slaughter it." Three verses are superfluous, what is the Talmud to say?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יִרְחַק מִמְּךָ הַמָּקוֹם... וְזָבַחְתָּ״, בְּרִחוּק מָקוֹם אַתָּה זוֹבֵחַ וְאִי אַתָּה זוֹבֵחַ בְּמָקוֹם קָרוֹב, פְּרָט לְחוּלִּין שֶׁלֹּא יִשָּׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: because it is stated “If the place be too far from you, then you shall slaughter When far from the place, you may slaughter but you may not slaughter in a near place, exclude non-sacred that they may not be slaughtered in the courtyard.
llm_translation: According to what is stated: "When the place is distant from you... and you shall sacrifice," when in a distant place you sacrifice, but if you do not sacrifice in a close place, excluding mundane animals that should not be slaughtered in the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא תְּמִימִים הָרְאוּיִם לִיקָּרֵב, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִים, שֶׁכֵּן: מִין הַמַּכְשִׁיר. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַחַיָּה? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת הַחַיָּה, שֶׁהִיא בִּשְׁחִיטָה כִּבְהֵמָה. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָעוֹפוֹת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ״ ״וְשָׁחַט אוֹתוֹ״ ״וְשָׁחַט אוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: And I have only unblemished which are fit to be sacrificed. From where to include blemished I include blemished since the type that is fit From where to include the undomesticated animal, I include the undomesticated animal since it by slaughtering, like a domesticated animal. From where to include fowl, The verse states: “And he slaughters it,” “and he shall slaughter it,” “and he shall slaughter it,”
llm_translation: I have only those that are fitting to draw near, how do I include those with blemishes? I include those with blemishes, for it is a kind that is fit. How do I include animals? I include animals, for they are slaughtered like cattle. How do I include birds? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall slaughter," "and he shall slaughter it," "and he shall slaughter it."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט, וְאִם שָׁחַט יְהֵא מוּתָּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי יִרְחַק מִמְּךָ הַמָּקוֹם... וְזָבַחְתָּ... וְאָכַלְתָּ״, מַה שֶּׁאַתָּה זוֹבֵחַ בְּרִחוּק מָקוֹם – אַתָּה אוֹכֵל, וְאִי אַתָּה אוֹכֵל מַה שֶּׁאַתָּה זוֹבֵחַ בְּמָקוֹם קָרוֹב, פְּרָט לְחוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: might one may not slaughter but if he did slaughter it would be permitted for him the verse states: “If the place be too far from you, then you shall slaughter and you shall eat That which you slaughter in a far place, you may eat, but you may not eat that which you slaughter in a near place, excludes non-sacred that were slaughtered in the courtyard.
llm_translation: He is able not to slaughter, and if he slaughtered, is it permitted? The Talmud teaches: "When the place which the Lord your God shall choose to set His name there is far from you... then you shall slaughter... and you shall eat." Just as when you slaughter in a distant place – you may eat, but if you slaughter in a nearby place, this excludes common animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא תְּמִימִים
human_translation: And I have only unblemished
llm_translation: And I have only the "temimim."

hebrew_text: הָרְאוּיִם לִיקְרַב, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, שֶׁכֵּן: מִין הַמַּכְשִׁיר. וּמִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַחַיָּה? מְרַבֶּה אֲנִי אֶת הַחַיָּה, שֶׁהִיא בִּשְׁחִיטָה כִּבְהֵמָה. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָעוֹפוֹת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ״ ״וְשָׁחַט אוֹתוֹ״ ״וְשָׁחַט אוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: which are fit to be sacrificed. From where to include blemished I include blemished since the type that is fit And from where to include the undomesticated animal I include the undomesticated animal since it by slaughtering, like a domesticated animal. From where to include birds, The verse states: “And he slaughters it,” “and he shall slaughter it,” “and he shall slaughter it,”
llm_translation: The suitable ones to bring near, from where do we derive to include those with blemishes? I increase those with blemishes, as it says: a species that is fit. And from where do we derive to include animals? I increase animals, as they are like cattle in terms of ritual slaughter. And from where do we derive to include birds? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall slaughter it," "And he shall slaughter it," "And he shall slaughter it."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יִשְׁחוֹט, וְאִם שָׁחַט יַשְׁלִיכֶנּוּ לִפְנֵי כְלָבִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לַכֶּלֶב תַּשְׁלִכוּן אֹתוֹ״ – אוֹתוֹ אַתָּה מַשְׁלִיךְ לַכֶּלֶב, וְאִי אַתָּה מַשְׁלִיךְ חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: might he may not slaughter but if he did slaughter he may cast it before the dogs, The verse states: you shall cast it to the dogs” You may cast it, to the dogs, but you may not cast non-sacred that have been slaughtered in the courtyard,
llm_translation: He is able not to slaughter, and if he slaughtered, should he throw it before dogs? The Talmud says: "To a dog you shall throw it" - you shall throw it to the dog, and if you do not throw it, the sacrificial portions that were slaughtered in the Temple.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ מָר יְהוּדָה לְרַב יוֹסֵף וּלְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה דַּהֲווֹ קָיְימִי אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי רַבָּה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּנְיָא: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּפֶטֶר חֲמוֹר, בְּבָשָׂר בְּחָלָב, וּבְחוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בָּעֲזָרָה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אַלְמָא חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Mar Yehuda found Rav Yosef and Rav Shmuel, son of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, standing at the entrance of Rabba’s study hall. He said to them: is taught one who betroths with a firstborn donkey, with meat in milk, or with non-sacred slaughtered in the courtyard, Rabbi Shimon says she is betrothed, and the Rabbis say she is not betrothed. Apparently, according to Rabbi Shimon, non-sacred slaughtered in the courtyard is not by Torah law,
llm_translation: They found Master Yehudah to Rav Yosef and to Rav Shmuel the son of Rabbah bar Bar Ḥana who were sitting at the entrance of the study hall. He said to them: It was taught in a baraita: One who sanctifies with the redemption of a donkey, with meat cooked in milk, and with non-sacred animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard, Rabbi Shimon says: it is sanctified, and the Sages say: it is not sanctified. This implies that non-sacred animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard are not biblically prohibited according to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטוּ בַּעֲזָרָה – יִשָּׂרְפוּ, וְכֵן חַיָּה שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה בַּעֲזָרָה. אִישְׁתִּיקוּ.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Rabbi Shimon says: Non-sacred, slaughtered in the courtyard be burned, as well as a undomesticated animal slaughtered in the courtyard. They were silent
llm_translation: And they asked: Rabbi Shimon says: Non-sacred animals that were slaughtered in the Temple courtyard - shall be burned, and likewise an animal that was slaughtered in the Temple courtyard. They were silent.

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: פָּלְגָאָ[ה] אוֹקְמִינְכוּ, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה וְנִמְצֵאת טְרֵיפָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: They came before Rabba He said to them: A quarrelsome has put you up With what are we dealing here where it was slaughtered and found a tereifa , and Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning
llm_translation: They came before Rabah. He said to them: "If you have established a doubt, what are we dealing with here - for example, if it was slaughtered and found to be a treifah." And Rabbi Shimon agrees with his reasoning.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַטְּרֵיפָה וְכֵן הַשּׁוֹחֵט וְנִמְצֵאת טְרֵיפָה – זֶה וָזֶה חוּלִּין בַּעֲזָרָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר בַּהֲנָאָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִים.
human_translation: As it is taught one who slaughters tereifa , as well as one who slaughters and it was found a tereifa , this and that non-sacred in the courtyard, Rabbi Shimon permits to benefit And the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who slaughters a treifah animal, and similarly one who slaughters and it is found to be treifah - both are permitted in the Temple courtyard. Rabbi Shimon permits deriving benefit, while the Sages prohibit it.

hebrew_text: מְכָרָן וְקִידֵּשׁ בִּדְמֵיהֶן – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מְנָלַן? מִדְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה: ״וְהָיִיתָ חֵרֶם כָּמֹהוּ״, כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה מְהַיֶּיה הֵימֶנָּה – הֲרֵי הוּא כָּמוֹהוּ, מִכְּלָל דְּכׇל אִיסּוּרִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה שְׁרוּ.
human_translation: one sold and betrothed with money their she is betrothed. From where do we from the Merciful One reveals with regard to idol worship: “And you shall be banned like it” anything that you come from it, is like it. by inference that all prohibitions of the Torah, permitted.
llm_translation: Their sale and betrothal with their value - she is betrothed. From where do we derive this? From the flag of mercy in foreign worship: "And you shall be annihilated like it," anything that you derive from it - it is like it, from the general principle of all prohibitions in the Torah are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִינַּהּ! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּשְׁבִיעִית שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכֹל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: But let us derive from because idol worship and Sabbatical are two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And we will switch its kind! Because it becomes foreign worship and the seventh, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. שְׁבִיעִית מַאי הִיא? ״יוֹבֵל הִיא קֹדֶשׁ תִּהְיֶה לָכֶם״ – מָה קוֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו, אַף שְׁבִיעִית תּוֹפֶסֶת דָּמֶיהָ.
human_translation: idol worship what we said. What is Sabbatical “It is a Jubilee, it shall be holy to you” Just as consecrated property transfers money it so too, the Sabbatical transfers money
llm_translation: Foreign worship - this that we say. Seventh what is it? "Jubilee it is holy shall be to you" - what holy takes its blood, also seventh takes its blood.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה קוֹדֶשׁ תּוֹפֵס אֶת דָּמָיו וְיוֹצֵא לְחוּלִּין, אַף שְׁבִיעִית תּוֹפֶסֶת דָּמֶיהָ וְיוֹצְאָה לְחוּלִּין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּהְיֶה״ – בַּהֲוָיָיתָהּ תְּהֵא.
human_translation: If just as consecrated transfers money it and becomes desacralized, so too, Sabbatical transfer money becomes desacralized. the verse states: “Shall be,” As it is, it shall be,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If what sanctifies takes its blood and goes out to secular use, does the seventh year produce its blood and go out to secular use? The Torah teaches: "It shall be" - in its existence it shall be.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? לָקַח בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית בָּשָׂר – אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מִתְבַּעֲרִים בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. בַּבָּשָׂר דָּגִים – יָצָא בָּשָׂר נִכְנְסוּ דָּגִים. בְּדָגִים יַיִן – יָצְאוּ דָּגִים נִכְנַס יַיִן. בְּיַיִן שֶׁמֶן – יָצָא יַיִן נִכְנַס שֶׁמֶן. הָא כֵּיצַד? אַחֲרוֹן אַחֲרוֹן נִתְפָּס בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וּפְירִי עַצְמוֹ אָסוּר.
human_translation: How so? purchased meat with produce Sabbatical these and those, are disposed of in the Sabbatical fish with meat, meat loses fish assumes wine with fish, fish loses wine assumes oil with wine, wine loses oil assumes How so? The final of Sabbatical transferred and the produce itself forbidden.
llm_translation: How so? He took seventh-year fruits with meat - these and those are being burned in the seventh year. With fish meat - fish meat that entered is considered meat. With fish wine - fish that entered, wine came out. With wine oil - wine that came out, oil entered. How so? The last one caught in the seventh year, and the fruit itself is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מְלַמְּדִין, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְלַמְּדִין מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? [תְּרֵי] מִיעוּטֵי כְּתִיבִי, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״כִּי חֵרֶם הוּא״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא״ – הִיא אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא לָא.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says do not teach But according to the one who says that they do teach what can be said? restriction are written Here, is written: “For it is banned” And there, is written: “It is a Jubilee” “it,” yes, not anything else.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says we do not teach, but for the one who says we do teach, what can be said? Two limitations are written, it is written here: "for it is a ban," and it is written there: "it is a jubilee" - it is not, from another source it is not.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמוֹת וּבַמַּעַשְׂרוֹת, וּבַמַּתָּנוֹת, וּבְמֵי חַטָּאת, וּבְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַאֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: one who betroths with terumot , or with tithes, or with gifts or with the water of purification, or with the ashes of purification, she is betrothed, and even if an Israelite,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who sanctifies with Terumot, and with Tithes, and with Gifts, and with the waters of the Sin-Offering, and with the ashes of the Sin-Offering - she is sanctified, even if she is an Israelite.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר עוּלָּא: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמוֹת, וּבְמַעַשְׂרוֹת, וּבַמַּתָּנוֹת בְּמֵי חַטָּאת, וּבְאֵפֶר פָּרָה – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַאֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Ulla says: benefit of discretion, does not have monetary Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ulla one who betroths with terumot , or with tithes, or with gifts, with the water of purification, or with the ashes heifer, she is betrothed, and even if an Israelite.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Ula: Benefit pleasure not money. Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ula: One who sanctifies with his contributions, and with his tithes, and with the gifts of the sin-offering water, and with the ashes of the red heifer - behold, this one sanctifies, even if he is an Israelite.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לוֹ טְבָלִים מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן. וְקָא סָבַר: מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: said to him: here with an Israelite who came into untithed produce from the household of his mother’s father, a priest, and holds gifts that have not been separated are considered as though they have been separated.
llm_translation: He said to him: Here in Israel, when tevulim fell to him from the house of his mother's father, he is considered a kohen. And he thought: Gifts that were not separated are not like those that were separated, they are considered as if they were separated.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מֵרַב הוּנָא: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה מָמוֹן אוֹ אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמוֹת וּבְמַעַשְׂרוֹת וּבְמַתָּנוֹת בְּמֵי חַטָּאת וּבְאֵפֶר פָּרָה – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וַאֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָאו אוֹקֵימְנָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לוֹ טְבָלִים מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin inquired of Rav Huna: benefit of discretion have monetary or does it not have monetary said to him: You learned it one who betroths with terumot , or with tithes, or with gifts, with the water of purification, or with the ashes heifer, she is betrothed, and even if an Israelite. said to him: But didn’t we establish it, to an Israelite who came into untithed produce from the household of his mother’s father, a priest?
llm_translation: The text in English: Rabbi Chiya bar Avin asked Rav Huna: Is pleasure considered money or is it not considered money? He said to him: Teach it: One who sanctifies with terumot, tithes, gifts, sin-offering water, and the ashes of the red heifer - she is considered sanctified, even if she is an Israelite! He said to him: But is it not established in Israel that if tevel (untithed produce) fell to him from his father's house, he is a priest?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּצָאָה אַתְּ. אִיכְּסִיף, הוּא סָבַר: מִשְּׁמַעְתָּא קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא: רַב אַסִּי דְּהוּצָל קָאֵי כְּוָתָיךְ.
human_translation: said to him: You are out [ hotza’a ]. was embarrassed, he thought told him due to halakha he said to him: This is what I said: Rav Asi, from Huzal, stands in accordance with your
llm_translation: He said to him: "You are dismissed." If he added, he thought: he is saying it from what he heard. He said to him: "This is what I am saying: Rav Assi, who is standing before you."

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַגּוֹנֵב טִבְלוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – מְשַׁלֵּם לוֹ דְּמֵי טִבְלוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶלָּא דְּמֵי חוּלִּין שֶׁבּוֹ. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה מָמוֹן, וּמָר סָבַר: טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . One who steals another’s untithed produce pays him the value of the other’s untithed produce; the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: He pays only the value of the non-sacred that it contains. What, is it not that they disagree about this That Sage, holds benefit of discretion has monetary and Sage, holds benefit of discretion does not have monetary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanna'ei: hagonav tivlo shel chaveiro - meshalem lo demei tivlo shel chaveiro, divrei Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda omer: einu meshalem ela demei chullin shebo. Mai lav baha kamiflagi, deMar savar: tovat hana'ah mammon, uMar savar: tovat hana'ah einah mammon." English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita: One who steals the tithe of his fellow - he must pay him the value of his fellow's tithe, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: He only pays the value of the non-sacred items within it. What is the reason they do not disagree in this matter? One Sage holds: Benefit is considered as money, and the other Sage holds: Benefit is not considered as money."

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן, וְהָכָא בִּטְבָלִים שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לוֹ מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן וּבְמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין. וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: No, everyone agrees benefit of discretion does not have monetary and here with an Israelite who came into untithed produce from the household of his mother’s father, a priest. And they disagree with regard to gifts that have not been separated are considered as though they have been separated. Sage, holds are considered as though they have been separated, And Sage, holds are not considered as though they have been separated;
llm_translation: Not, that all the world, benefit pleasure not money, and here in tubs that fell to him from his father's house, a Kohen, and in gifts that were not separated as one who separated, money he disputes. Master holds: as one who separated money. And Master holds: not as one who separated money.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּמִי שֶׁהוּרְמוּ דָּמְיָין וְטוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן, וְהָכָא בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חִיטָּה אַחַת פּוֹטֶרֶת אֶת הַכְּרִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say everyone agrees are considered as though they have been separated, and benefit of discretion does not have monetary and here disagree with regard to of Shmuel. As Shmuel says: one grain exempts the heap,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world, like one who has thrown away dyed wool and a valuable pleasure, it is not considered money. And here, in the case of Dishmuel, there is a dispute. For Shmuel said: One wheat kernel exempts the pile.

hebrew_text: דְּמָר אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: As Sage, is of of Shmuel, And Sage, is of not of Shmuel,
llm_translation: The Master has a disciple named Shmuel. And the Master does not have a disciple named Shmuel.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לֵית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי, דְּקַנְסוּהוּ רַבָּנַן לְגַנָּב.
human_translation: And if you wish, say everyone is of not of Shmuel; and here, this is reasoning of Rabbi the Sages penalized the thief.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For everyone in the world does not have the name Shmuel, and here is the reason of Rabbi, that the Rabbis penalized him for stealing.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּקַנְסוּהוּ רַבָּנַן לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת, דְּלָא אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְשַׁהוֹיֵהּ לְטִיבְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say everyone is of of Shmuel, and here, this is reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda: The Sages penalized the owner, since he should not have left his untithed produce
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In all the world there is one named Shmuel, and here this is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, that the Rabbis imposed a fine upon the homeowner, so that he should not delay him in immersing his utensils.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּתְרוּמוֹת, וּבַמַּעַשְׂרוֹת, וּבַמַּתָּנוֹת, בְּמֵי חַטָּאת, וּבְאֵפֶר פָּרָה – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וְאַף עַל פִּי יִשְׂרָאֵל. וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַנּוֹטֵל שָׂכָר לָדוּן – דִּינָיו בְּטֵלִים, לְהָעִיד – עֵדוּתוֹ בְּטֵלָה, לְהַזּוֹת וּלְקַדֵּשׁ – מֵימָיו מֵי מְעָרָה, וְאֶפְרוֹ אֵפֶר מִקְלֶה!
human_translation: We learned one who betroths with terumot , or with tithes, or with gifts with the water of purification, or with the ashes heifer, she is betrothed, and even if an Israelite. And raises a contradiction one who accepts payment to judge, his judgments are nullified. to testify, his testimony is nullified. to sprinkle or to sanctify his water cave water, and his ashes are burnt ashes.
llm_translation: We learned: One who sanctifies with terumot, tithes, and gifts, with the waters of purification, and with the ashes of the red heifer - she is sanctified even according to the opinion of the Israelites. And we raised an objection: One who takes payment to be a judge - his judgments are null and void, to testify - his testimony is null and void, to sprinkle and sanctify - his water is water of a cave, and his ashes are ashes of a stick!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּשָׂכָר הֲבָאָה וּמִילּוּי, כָּאן בִּשְׂכַר הַזָּאָה וְקִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult, here, with payment for bringing and filling There, to payment for sprinkling and sanctifying.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Not difficult, here regarding the reward of coming and filling, here regarding the reward of shining and sanctifying.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי הָכָא: ״בְּמֵי חַטָּאת וּבְאֵפֶר פָּרָה״, וְקָתָנֵי הָתָם: ״לְהַזּוֹת וּלְקַדֵּשׁ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches here, with the water of purification or with the ashes of purification, and it teaches there, To sprinkle or to sanctify, Learn from it
llm_translation: Precisely, as it is taught here: "with the water of purification and with the ashes of the heifer," and it is taught there: "to sprinkle and to sanctify." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִישׁ מְקַדֵּשׁ
llm_translation: The man sanctifies you.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״צֵא וְקַדֵּשׁ לִי אִשָּׁה פְּלוֹנִית״, וְהָלַךְ וְקִדְּשָׁהּ לְעַצְמוֹ – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לַשֵּׁנִי. וְכֵן הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ וּבָא אַחֵר וְקִידְּשָׁה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִשְׁנֵי. בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן – תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: one who says to another: Go and betroth so-and-so to me, and went and betrothed her to himself, she is betrothed to the second And similarly, one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after thirty days, and another came and betrothed her within thirty days, she is betrothed to the second an Israelite woman to a priest, she may partake of teruma .
llm_translation: One who says to his fellow: "Go and sanctify for me a certain woman," and he went and sanctified her for himself - she is sanctified to the second. And similarly, one who says to a woman: "Behold, you are sanctified to me after thirty days," and another comes and sanctifies her within thirty days - she is sanctified to the second. The daughter of Israel to a Kohen - she may eat of the terumah.

hebrew_text: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו וּלְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ וּבָא אַחֵר וְקִידְּשָׁה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, אוֹ בַת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל – לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: from now, and after thirty days and another came and betrothed her within thirty days, she is betrothed or she is not betrothed the daughter of a non-priest to a priest, or the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, she may not partake of teruma .
llm_translation: "From now and after thirty days," and another comes and betroths her within thirty days - she is betrothed and she is not betrothed. The daughter of Israel to a Kohen, or the daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - she shall not eat of the Terumah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״צֵא וְקַדֵּשׁ״. תָּנָא: מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּהַג בּוֹ מִנְהַג רַמָּאוּת. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, ״הָלַךְ״ נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי – הָלַךְ בְּרַמָּאוּת.
human_translation: one who says to another: Go and betroth taught What he did is done; but he has treated him, in a deceitful manner, And the tanna of our when teaches Went, also went deceitfully.
llm_translation: Gemara: One who says to his fellow, "Go out and sanctify." It was taught: What he did is done, except that he acted in a manner of haughtiness. And our Mishnah teaches, "he went out" - he went out haughtily.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ״,
human_translation: What is different here that teaches: one who says to another,
llm_translation: What is different here that it teaches "one who says to his fellow,"

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּקָתָנֵי ״הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ״?
human_translation: and what is different there, that teaches: one who says to his agent,
llm_translation: And what is the difference there that it teaches "one who says to his messenger"?

hebrew_text: הָכָא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, וְהָתָם רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. הָכָא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּאִי תְּנָא ״שְׁלוּחוֹ״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: שְׁלוּחוֹ הוּא דְּהָוֵי רַמַּאי, דְּסָמְכָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ, סָבַר: עָבֵד לִי שְׁלִיחוּתַי, אֲבָל חֲבֵירוֹ, דְּלָא סָמְכָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ, אֵימָא לָא לֶיהֱוֵי רַמַּאי.
human_translation: Here teaches us a novel and there teaches us a novel here teaches us a novel as had it taught: His agent, I would say it is his agent who is a scoundrel as relies thinking: perform my agency for me, But Another, upon whom he does not rely, say should not a scoundrel.
llm_translation: Here the abundance is implied to us, and there the abundance is implied to us. Here the abundance is implied to us: for if a Mishnah were to state "his messenger," I would say: his messenger is one who is deceitful, for he relies on his own judgment, thinking: he has done my mission, but his fellow, who does not rely on his own judgment, I might say is not deceitful.

hebrew_text: הָתָם רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּאִי תְּנָא: ״הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חֲבֵירוֹ הוּא דְּכִי קִדְּשָׁהּ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, דְּסָבַר: לָא טָרַח, אֲבָל שְׁלוּחוֹ דְּטָרַח אֵימָא: מַרְאֶה מָקוֹם הוּא לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: there teaches us a novel as had it taught: One who says to another, I would say it is another that she is not betrothed if he betrothed her in a different place, as he thinks not trouble But his agent, who trouble say he is showing him place teaches us
llm_translation: There, abundance is being inferred for us: for if a Tanna were to teach: "One who says to his fellow," I would say: his fellow is the one who, when he sanctifies it in another place, does not sanctify it, for he holds: he did not exert himself, but his messenger who exerted himself, I would say: the place he sees is for him, it is being inferred for us.

hebrew_text: רָבִין חֲסִידָא אֲזַיל לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי לֵיהּ אִיתְּתָא לִבְרֵיהּ, קַידְּשַׁהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ. וְהָתַנְיָא: מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה – עָשׂוּי, אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּהַג בּוֹ מִנְהַג רַמָּאוּת! לָא יַהֲבוּהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאוֹדוֹעֵי! סָבַר: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אֲתָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא מְקַדֵּשׁ לַהּ.
human_translation: Ravin the Pious went to betroth a woman to his son, betrothed her to himself. But isn’t it taught What he did is done, but he has treated him in a deceitful manner? would not give her to he should have informed thought: In the meantime, someone else come betroth her.
llm_translation: Rabin Hasida went to visit the holy ones, his wife went with him, she sanctified herself. And it was taught: What he did - they did, except that he practiced a custom of deceit! They did not give him any attention. He wanted to be praised! He thought: Thus and thus another person comes after me and sanctifies Him.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה יְהַיב לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְרַב, אֲמַר: זִבְנַהּ נִיהֲלִי לְהַאי אַרְעָא. אֲזַל זַבְנַהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ. וְהָתַנְיָא: מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה – עָשׂוּי, אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּהַג בּוֹ מִנְהַג רַמָּאוּת! בָּאגָא דְאַלִּימֵי הֲוָה (לֵיהּ), לְרַב – נָהֲגִי בֵּיהּ כָּבוֹד, לְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה – לָא נָהֲגִי בֵּיהּ כָּבוֹד. אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאוֹדוֹעֵי! סְבַר: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אֲתָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא זַבֵּין לַהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana gave money to Rav said: Purchase this land for me. went and purchased it for himself. But isn’t it taught What he did is done, but he has treated him in a deceitful manner? was in a valley by violent treated Rav respect did not treat Rabba bar bar Ḥana respect. should have informed him. thought: In the meantime someone else will come purchase
llm_translation: Rabba bar Bar Ḥana gave him money for Rav, saying: "I bought this land for him." He went and bought it for himself. And it was taught: "What one does – is done, except that he acted with deceit!" In the courtyard of the palm trees, he (Rav) was honored, for Rav – they showed respect to him, but for Rabba bar Bar Ḥana – they did not show him respect. He wanted to make him known! He thought: "Thus and thus, another person will come and buy it for him."

hebrew_text: רַב גִּידֵּל הֲוָה מְהַפֵּיךְ בְּהַהִיא אַרְעָא. אֲזַל רַבִּי אַבָּא זַבְנַהּ. אֲזַל רַב גִּידֵּל קַבְלֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא. אֲזַל רַבִּי זֵירָא וְקַבְלֵיהּ לְרַב יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא. אָמַר לֵיהּ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה אֶצְלֵנוּ לָרֶגֶל. כִּי סְלֵיק, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָנִי מְהַפֵּךְ בַּחֲרָרָה, וּבָא אַחֵר וּנְטָלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ, מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Giddel was engaging in a certain land. Rabbi Abba went purchased it. Rav Giddel went complained about to Rabbi Zeira. Rabbi Zeira went and complained about to Rav Yitzḥak Nappaḥa. said to him: Wait until ascends to us for the pilgrimage Festival, When ascended found him said to him: a pauper is engaging in a loaf and another came and took it from him, what
llm_translation: Rav Giddel was overturning in that land. Rabbi Abba went and bought it. Rav Giddel went and gave it to Rabbi Zeira. Rabbi Zeira went and gave it to Rav Yitzchak Nappacha. He said to him: "Wait until he comes to us on foot." When he went out, he forgot it. He said to him: "A poor person overturns in a pit, and another comes and takes it from him, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִקְרָא רָשָׁע. וְאֶלָּא מָר מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא. הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי נִיתְּבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ מָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זַבּוֹנֵי לָא מְזַבֵּינְנָא לַהּ, דְּאַרְעָא קַמַּיְיתָא הִיא, וְלָא מְסַמְּנָא מִילְּתָא. אִי בָּעֵי בְּמַתָּנָה – נִישְׁקְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: is called wicked. But what is the reason the Master acted this way? said to him: I did not know Now too, the Master should give it to him, said to him: selling, I will not sell it, as it is first land and matter is not omen. If he wants as a gift, let him take it.
llm_translation: He said to him: "He is called wicked." But Master, what is the reason he did so? He said to him: "I did not know." Now, the Master became angry with him. He said to him: "We do not sell to him, for he is a land surveyor, and we do not reveal the matter. If he wants to buy it as a gift - we will weigh it for him."

hebrew_text: רַב גִּידֵּל לָא נָחֵית לַהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשׂוֹנֵא מַתָּנֹת יִחְיֶה״. רַבִּי אַבָּא לָא נָחֵית לַהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּהַפֵּיךְ בַּהּ רַב גִּידֵּל. לָא מָר נָחֵית לַהּ וְלָא מָר נָחֵית לַהּ וּמִיתְקָרְיָא אַרְעָא דְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Giddel did not descend to as it is written: “But he who hates gifts shall live” Rabbi Abba did not descend to it, because Rav Giddel engaging in it this Sage did not descend to and that Sage did not descend to it, and it was called the land of the Sages.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel did not agree with him, as it is written: "And one who hates gifts will live." Rabbi Abba did not agree with him because Rav Giddel turned him over. Neither master agreed with him, and it is called the land of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי כּוּ׳. לֹא בָּא אַחֵר וְקִידְּשָׁה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים, מַהוּ? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְאַכְּלוּ הַמָּעוֹת.
human_translation: And similarly, one who says to a woman: Be betrothed to me another did not come and betroth her within thirty what is Rav and Shmuel both say: She is betrothed even if the money has been used
llm_translation: The one who says to a woman, "Be consecrated to me as of now," if another did not come and consecrate her within thirty days, what is the ruling? Rav and Shmuel both say: She is considered consecrated, even though the coins were consumed.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? הָנֵי זוּזֵי לָא לְמִלְוָה דָּמוּ וְלָא לְפִקָּדוֹן דָּמוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason these dinars not comparable to a loan, nor comparable to a deposit
llm_translation: What is the reason? These coins are not for a loan of money nor for a deposit of money.

hebrew_text: לְפִקָּדוֹן לָא דָּמוּ – פִּקָּדוֹן בִּרְשׁוּתָא דְמָרֵיהּ קָא מִתְאַכְּלִי, וְהָנֵי בִּרְשׁוּתָא דִידַהּ קָא מִתְאַכְּלִי. לְמַלְוֶה נָמֵי לָא דָּמוּ – מִלְוָה לְהוֹצָאָה נִיתְּנָה, הָנֵי בְּתוֹרַת קִידּוּשִׁין יַהֲבִינְהוּ נִיהֲלַהּ.
human_translation: They are not comparable to a deposit, a deposit is used in its owner’s possession, whereas these are used in her own possession, are also not comparable to a loan; a loan is given for spending these were given to her for the purpose of betrothal.
llm_translation: Deposit not his – deposit in the domain of his master is being consumed, and these in her domain are being consumed. Loan not his – a loan for expenditure was given, and these in the laws of betrothal were given to her.

hebrew_text: לֹא בָּא אַחֵר וְקִידְּשָׁהּ, וְחָזְרָה בָּהּ, מַהוּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חוֹזֶרֶת – אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר, וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת – לָא אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: another did not come and betroth her, and she retracted her what is Rabbi Yoḥanan said: She can retract statement, comes and nullifies statement Reish Lakish said: She cannot retract statement does not come and nullify statement.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates into English as follows: "Not another came and betrothed her, and then she changed her mind, what is the ruling? Rabbi Yochanan said: If she changes her mind - it is as though she speaks and annuls her speech. Reish Lakish said: If she does not change her mind - it is not as though she speaks and annuls her speech."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בִּיטֵּל, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא תָּרַם בִּיטֵּל – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה. וְהָא הָכָא דְּדִיבּוּר וְדִיבּוּר הוּא, וְקָאָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר! שָׁאנֵי נְתִינַת מָעוֹת לְיַד אִשָּׁה, דְּכִי מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמוּ, וְלָא אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish canceled If he canceled before separated the teruma , his teruma is not teruma . And here it is statement and statement, a statement comes and nullifies statement. Giving money to a woman is different, as it is considered like an action, and statement does not come and nullify action
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "Bitel, if until he did not elevate, Bitel - his terumah is not terumah." But here, it is a case of speech and speech it is, and he comes with speech and nullifies speech! It is different with giving money into a woman's hand, for when the act is done, and speech does not come and nullify the act.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ בַּשָּׁלִיחַ אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁלַח אַחֲרָיו שָׁלִיחַ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״גֵּט שֶׁנָּתַתִּי לְךָ בָּטֵל הוּא״ – הֲרֵי זֶה בָּטֵל. וְהָא נְתִינַת גֵּט לְיַד שָׁלִיחַ, דְּכִי נְתִינַת מָעוֹת לְיַד אִשָּׁה דָּמֵי, וְקָתָנֵי הֲרֵי זֶה בָּטֵל!
human_translation: raised objection one who sends a bill of divorce to his wife, and encountered the agent or sent agent after him and said to him: The bill of divorce that I gave you is nullified, it is thereby nullified. And giving a bill of divorce to an agent is considered like giving money to a woman, and teaches it is nullified,
llm_translation: He raised an objection: If one sends a bill of divorce to his wife and it reaches the messenger or if he sent another messenger after him and said to him, "The bill of divorce that I gave you is null and void," - this renders it null and void. But isn't the giving of a bill of divorce into the hand of a messenger similar to the giving of money into the hand of a woman, and it was taught: this renders it null and void!

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, כֹּל כַּמָּה דְּלָא מְטָא גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ – דִּיבּוּר וְדִיבּוּר הוּא, אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: There too, as long as the bill of divorce has not reached the woman’s hand it is statement and statement. a statement comes and nullifies statement.
llm_translation: There, it is taught, all as long as not come get to her - speech and speech it, come speech and annul speech.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים יוֹרְדִין לִידֵי טוּמְאָתָן בְּמַחְשָׁבָה, וְאֵין עוֹלִים מִידֵּי טוּמְאָתָן אֶלָּא בְּשִׁינּוּי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan: All vessels descend into their ritual impurity by means of thought. But they ascend from their ritual impurity only by means of a change an action.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: All the vessels descend into their impurity through intent, and they do not ascend from their impurity except through immersion in a mikveh.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה וּמִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה, מַחְשָׁבָה אֵין מוֹצִיאָה לֹא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה וְלֹא מִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה לָא מַפְּקָה, דְּלָא אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל מַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא מִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה מִיהָא תַּפֵּיק!
human_translation: An action negates action and thought a thought negates neither action nor thought. Granted, does not negate action, as a statement does not come and nullify action. But it should at least offset thought.
llm_translation: The matter of bringing out from the handiwork and from thought, thought does not bring out neither from handiwork nor from thought. Granted, from handiwork it does not bring out, for speech does not come and nullify the handiwork, but from thought it does come out!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מַחְשָׁבָה דְּטוּמְאָה, דְּכִי מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי, וְכִדְרַב פָּפָּא. דְּרַב פָּפָּא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב: ״כִּי יִתֵּן״, וְקָרֵינַן: ״כִּי יוּתַּן״. הָא כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: Thought of ritual impurity is different, as is considered like action, and in accordance with of Rav Pappa. As Rav Pappa raises a contradiction: is written ki yitten . we read “ ki yuttan ,” How so?
llm_translation: The matter of impure calculation is different, as in the case of the act of bloodshed, and like Rav Papa. For Rav Papa raised an objection: It is written, "when he gives," and we read it as, "when he is given." How so?

hebrew_text: ״כִּי יוּתַּן״ דֻּומְיָא ״דְּכִי יִתֵּן״. מָה ״יִתֵּן״ דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ, אַף ״יוּתַּן״, דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: “if water is placed [ ki yuttan ]” similar to: If one places [ ki yitten ]; just as places [ yitten ] that satisfactory to so too, “is placed [ yuttan ]” that satisfactory to
llm_translation: "Ki Yutan" dumya "deki yiten." Mah "yiten" de'nicha lei, af "Yutan," de'nicha lei.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד מַתְנֵי לְהָא שְׁמַעְתְּתָא אַהָא: וְכֵן הִיא שֶׁנָּתְנָה רְשׁוּת לִשְׁלוּחָהּ לְקַדְּשָׁהּ, וְהָלְכָה הִיא וְקִדְּשָׁהּ אֶת עַצְמָהּ, אִם שֶׁלָּהּ קָדְמוּ – קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ קִידּוּשִׁין, וְאִם שֶׁל שְׁלוּחָהּ קָדְמוּ – אֵין קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rav Zevid taught this with regard to this And similarly, where she gave permission to her agent to accept betrothal for her and she went and accepted betrothal herself if her came first, her betrothal is betrothal, but if of her agent came first, her betrothal is not a betrothal.
llm_translation: Rav Zebid teaches this matter: And similarly, if she was given permission to send herself to sanctify herself, and she went and sanctified herself, if her own actions preceded - her sanctifications are valid, but if the sending of her preceded - her sanctifications are not valid.

hebrew_text: לֹא קִדְּשָׁהּ אֶת עַצְמָהּ וְחָזְרָה בָּהּ, מַהוּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חוֹזֶרֶת, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חוֹזֶרֶת, אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת, לָא אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: not accept betrothal herself and retracted what is Rabbi Yoḥanan says: She can retract and Reish Lakish says: She cannot retract Rabbi Yoḥanan said: She can retract a statement comes and nullifies statement, Reish Lakish said: She cannot retract a statement does not come and nullify statement.
llm_translation: She did not sanctify herself and she returned in her, what? Rabbi Yochanan said: she returns, and Reish Lakish said: she does not return. Rabbi Yochanan said: she returns, the speech comes and nullifies the speech. Reish Lakish said: she does not return, the speech does not come and nullify the speech.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בִּיטֵּל, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא תָּרַם בִּיטֵּל – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה! אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּדַם בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְתָרַם אֶת כִּרְיוֹ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish canceled If he canceled before separated teruma , his teruma is not teruma . Rava says: With what are we dealing here? where the homeowner preceded and separated teruma his heap which is an action,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: Bitel, if he did not separate terumah - his terumah is not terumah! Rava said: What are we dealing with here? For example, when the homeowner preceded and separated his produce, it becomes a valid act.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים יוֹרְדִים לִידֵי טוּמְאָתָן בְּמַחְשָׁבָה, וְאֵין עוֹלִין מִטּוּמְאָתָן אֶלָּא בְּשִׁינּוּי מַעֲשֶׂה. מַעֲשֶׂה מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה וּמִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה, מַחְשָׁבָה אֵינָהּ מוֹצִיאָה לֹא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה וְלֹא מִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא מִיַּד מַעֲשֶׂה לָא מַפְּקָה, לָא אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל מַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא מִיַּד מַחְשָׁבָה מִיהָא תַּפֵּיק!
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to All vessels descend into their ritual impurity by means of thought. But they ascend from their ritual impurity only by means of a change an action. An action negates action and thought a thought negates neither action nor thought. Granted, does not negate action, a statement does not come and nullify action. But it should at least offset thought.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him, Reish Lakish: All vessels descend into their impurity through thought, and they only ascend from their impurity through an actual change. An actual change removes the impurity immediately from both an actual change and from thought, but thought does not remove the impurity neither immediately from an actual change nor from thought. For certainly, from an actual change it does not remove immediately, since speech does not come and nullify the action, but from thought it does remove immediately!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי מַחְשָׁבָה דְּטוּמְאָה דְּכִי מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי, וְכִדְרַב פָּפָּא. דְּרַב פָּפָּא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב: ״כִּי יִתֵּן״, וְקָרֵינַן: ״כִּי יוּתַּן״. הָא כֵּיצַד? ״כִּי יוּתַּן״ דֻּומְיָא ״דָּיִתֵּן״, מָה ״יִתֵּן״ דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ אַף ״יוּתַּן״ נָמֵי דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to Thought of ritual impurity is different, as is considered like action, and in accordance with of Rav Pappa. As Rav Pappa raises a contradiction: is written ki yitten . we read “ ki yuttan .” How so? “if water is placed [ ki yuttan ]” similar to: If one places [ ki yitten ]; just as places [ yitten ] that satisfactory to so too, “is placed [ yuttan ]” that satisfactory to
llm_translation: He said to him: The calculation of impurity is different from the calculation of monetary matters, as Rav Papa said. For Rav Papa raised an objection: It is written, "כִּי יִתֵּן" (Leviticus 27:8), and we read it as, "כִּי יוּתַּן." How so? "כִּי יוּתַּן" is similar to "דָּיִתֵּן." Just as "יִתֵּן" is suitable for it, so too "יוּתַּן" is suitable for it.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ בַּשָּׁלִיחַ אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁלַח אַחֲרָיו שָׁלִיחַ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״גֵּט שֶׁנָּתַתִּי לְךָ בָּטֵל הוּא״ – הֲרֵי זֶה בָּטֵל תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: one who sends a bill of divorce to his wife, and encountered the agent or sent agent after him and said to him: The bill of divorce that I gave you is nullified, it is thereby nullified. The refutation of Reish Lakish is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: One who sends a bill of divorce to his wife, and it reaches the messenger, or if he sent another messenger after him, and he said to him, "The bill of divorce that I gave you is null and void" - this is a nullification of the agency of Reish Lakish, a nullification.

hebrew_text: וְהִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּקַמַּיְיתָא. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: שָׁאנֵי נְתִינַת מָעוֹת לְיַד אִשָּׁה דִּכְמַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָתֵי דִּיבּוּר וּמְבַטֵּל דִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, and even according to the first And even though there is to say giving money to a woman is different, as it is considered like an action, even so, a statement comes and nullifies statement
llm_translation: And he should walk in the ways of Rabbi Yochanan, even in his presence. And even though there is to say: it is different giving money into the hand of a woman, as in the case of Damai, nevertheless, when speech comes and nullifies speech.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא הִילְכְתָא אַהִילְכְתָא. אָמְרַתְּ: הִילְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְקַיְימָא לַן הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּחֲזוֹר וִיגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ?
human_translation: The halakha difficult the halakha You said the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, and we maintain the halakha in accordance with Rav Naḥman. As a dilemma was raised before What is return and divorce with
llm_translation: The difficult matter is resolved. You said: The matter is resolved according to Rabbi Yochanan, but we maintain the matter is resolved according to Rav Nachman, for they raised the question: What if one changes his mind and divorces her?

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: חוֹזֵר וּמְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמְגָרֵשׁ בּוֹ. וְקַיְימָא לַן הִילְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן! נְהִי דְּבַטְּלֵיהּ מִתּוֹרַת שְׁלִיחַ, מִתּוֹרַת גֵּט לָא בַּטְּלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: can return and divorce with it, Rav Sheshet says: He cannot return and divorce with it. And we maintain the halakha in accordance with of Rav Naḥman although has nullified from his status as an agent, he has not nullified from its status as a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: he may retract and annul it, Rav Sheshet said: he may not retract and annul it. And our conclusion is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Nachman! For even though he annulled it from the Torah law of agency, he did not annul it from the Torah law of divorce.

hebrew_text: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לַשֵּׁנִי. אָמַר רַב: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לַשֵּׁנִי לְעוֹלָם, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אֲמַר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לַשֵּׁנִי עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם פָּקְעִי קִידּוּשֵׁי שֵׁנִי וְגָמְרִי קִידּוּשֵׁי רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: she is betrothed to the second Rav says: She is betrothed to the second forever, and Shmuel says: She is betrothed to the second until thirty days After thirty days the betrothal of the second lapses, and the betrothal of the first is completed.
llm_translation: Sanctified to the second. Rav said: Sanctified to the second forever, and Shmuel said: Sanctified to the second for thirty days, after thirty days I nullify the sanctification of the second and complete the sanctification of the first.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב חִסְדָּא וְקָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: קִידּוּשֵׁי שֵׁנִי בְּמַאי פָּקְעִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: מָר אַרֵישָׁא מַתְנֵי לַהּ וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, רַב יְהוּדָה אַסֵּיפָא מַתְנֵי לַהּ וְלָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda sat and difficult: By what betrothal of the second abrogated? Rav Yosef said to him: The Master teaches with regard to the first clause and he difficult, Rav Yehuda teaches to the latter clause and he does not difficult.
llm_translation: Sitting was Rav Ḥisdah and he asked: The sanctification of the second cup, with what do they open it? Rav Yosef said to him: The master teaches the first part and asks about it, Rav Yehudah teaches the end part and does not ask about it.

hebrew_text: ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו וּלְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לְעוֹלָם. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים פָּקְעִי קִידּוּשֵׁי שֵׁנִי וְגָמְרִי קִידּוּשֵׁי רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: from now and after thirty days, Rav says: she is betrothed or she is not betrothed forever, And Shmuel says: she is betrothed or she is not betrothed only until thirty days after thirty the betrothal of the second abrogated, and the betrothal of the first is completed.
llm_translation: "From now and after thirty days" etc. Rav said: She is sanctified and she is not sanctified forever. And Shmuel said: She is sanctified and she is not sanctified except until thirty days, after thirty days the sanctifications of the second are nullified and the sanctifications of the first are completed.

hebrew_text: לְרַב מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי תְּנָאָה הֲוַאי, אִי חֲזָרָה הֲוַאי. לִשְׁמוּאֵל פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דִּתְנָאָה הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Rav is uncertain Is it a condition, is it a retraction, It is obvious to Shmuel that it is a condition.
llm_translation: To Rav it is a dilemma, whether it was given or whether it was returned. To Shmuel it is obvious that it was given, as it was taught.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – גֵּט וְאֵינוֹ גֵּט, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: And in the dispute between these tanna’im . As it is taught From today and after death, is bill of divorce or is not a bill of divorce. the statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi says: like this bill of divorce.
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as it was taught: "From the day and onwards after death" - it is a divorce document yet not a divorce document, the words of the sages. Rabbi says: Such is a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּנַן, וְנֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי! צְרִיכָא. דְּאִילּוּ אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּנַן, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָתָם דִּלְרַחוֹקַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֲבָל הָכָא, דִּלְקָרוֹבַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל דִּתְנָאָהּ הֲוַאי.
human_translation: And let Rav, say halakha in accordance with the Rabbis, and let Shmuel say halakha in accordance with Rabbi necessary As had Rav said halakha in accordance with the Rabbis, I would say: There, when he comes to distance her But here, when he comes to draw her near, say concedes to Shmuel that it is a condition,
llm_translation: And it was stated: Rav says, the halakha is according to the Rabbis, and it was stated: Shmuel says, the halakha is according to Rabbi! It is necessary. For if Rav had said the halakha is according to the Rabbis, I would have said: There, where he is far away, he holds that way, but here, where he is close, let us concede to Shmuel that this is what he taught.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּאֵין גֵּט לְאַחַר מִיתָה. אֲבָל הָכָא דְּיֵשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had Shmuel said halakha in accordance with Rabbi I would say: It is there as there is no bill of divorce after death, But here, where there is betrothal after thirty say Shmuel concedes to Rav. necessary
llm_translation: And if Shmuel were to say: the halacha is like Rabbi, I would have said: there, where there is no get after death. But here, where there is betrothal after thirty days, I would agree with Rav, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּלְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַב, בָּא אֶחָד וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו וּלְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו וּלְאַחַר עֶשְׂרִים יוֹם״
human_translation: Abaye said: And according to the reasoning of Rav, one came and said to her: You are hereby betrothed to me from now and after thirty days. And another came and said to her: You are hereby betrothed to me from now and after twenty days,
llm_translation: Abaye said: And according to the reasoning of Rav, one came and said to her: "Behold, you are consecrated to me from now and after thirty days," and another came and said to her: "Behold, you are consecrated to me from now and after twenty days."

hebrew_text: וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו וּלְאַחַר עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים״, מֵרִאשׁוֹן וּמֵאַחֲרוֹן – צְרִיכָה גֵּט, מֵאֶמְצָעִי – אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה גֵּט.
human_translation: and another came and said to her: You are hereby betrothed to me from now and after ten days, she requires a bill of divorce from the first and last she does not require a bill of divorce from the middle one.
llm_translation: And another one came and said to her: "Behold, you are sanctified to me from now, and after ten days," from the beginning and from the end - she requires a get; from the middle - she does not require a get.

hebrew_text: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ – אִי תְּנָאָה הֲוַאי, דְּקַמָּא קִידּוּשֵׁי, דְּהָנָךְ לָאו קִידּוּשֵׁי. אִי חֲזָרָה הֲוַאי, דְּבָתְרָא קִידּוּשֵׁי, דְּהָנָךְ לָאו קִידּוּשֵׁי.
human_translation: whichever way you If is a condition of the first a betrothal, whereas of those not betrothals. If it is a retraction, of the last a betrothal, whereas of those not betrothals,
llm_translation: "What is your soul?" - If it is a gift, then the previous sanctifications, that one is not sanctifications. If it is a return, then the subsequent sanctifications, that one is not sanctifications.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַאי לִישָּׁנָא מַשְׁמַע תְּנָאָה וּמַשְׁמַע חֲזָרָה וְתִיבְעֵי גִּיטָּא מִכֹּל חַד וְחַד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious Lest you say this formulation means a condition and means a retraction, and require a bill of divorce from each and every one of them, teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: this for sleeping implies teaching and implies reviewing and the requirements of a get from each and every one, it implies for us.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה תּוֹפְסִין בָּהּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה תּוֹפְסִין בָּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: אַסְבְּרַהּ לָךְ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שַׁוּוֹ נַפְשַׁיְהוּ כִּי שִׁרְגָּא דְלִיבְנֵי, דְּכֹל חַד וְחַד רְוָחָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ שְׁבַק.
human_translation: Ulla Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even one hundred is effective with regard to her. And similarly, Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even one hundred is effective with regard to her. Rav Mesharshiyya, son of Rav Ami, said to Rabbi Asi: I will explain to you the reason of Rabbi Yoḥanan: have rendered themselves like a row [ sheraga ] of bricks, each and every one leaves a gap for the other.
llm_translation: Oula said Rabbi Yohanan: Even if a hundred grasp it. And so said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yohanan: Even if a hundred grasp it. Rav Mesharshaya son of Rav Ammi said to Rabbi Assi: Have you considered the reason of Rabbi Yohanan? He equated them to a white hair, for each and every one of them leaves his spirit to his companions.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חֲנִינָא: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – גֵּט וְאֵינוֹ גֵּט, וְאִם מֵת – חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina raises an objection from today and after death, bill of divorce or not bill of divorce. And if he dies she performs ḥalitza , but does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The text states: Rav Chanina raises an objection: "From the day of death and onwards" - it is a divorce document but not a divorce document, and if he dies - she performs chalitzah but does not engage in levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב – מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ, לִשְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי: הָא מַנִּי – רַבָּנַן הִיא, וַאֲנַן דְּאָמְרִי כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav, supports him, According to Shmuel as well, whose is this It is the Rabbis, and I, say in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rav – it supports him, and also according to Shmuel: "This is a teaching of the Rabbis, and we say it like Rabbi."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר שִׁיּוּרָא הָוֵי, כֹּל גִּיטָּא דִּמְשַׁיַּיר בַּהּ וְלָא כְּלוּם הוּא. יַבּוֹמֵי מְיַיבֵּם!
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said is leaves Any bill of divorce that leaves is not anything, enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan, for he said: "Shiyura is effective, any get that has shiyur in it is valid, and it is not nothing. Yavomei may perform yibum!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: גֵּט לְהוֹצִיא, וּמִיתָה לְהוֹצִיא, מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר גֵּט, גְּמָרַתּוּ מִיתָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? גֵּט מוֹצִיאה מֵרְשׁוּת יָבָם, מִיתָה מַכְנֶסֶת לִרְשׁוּת יָבָם!
human_translation: Rava said: a bill of divorce to remove and death to remove whatever part is left bill of divorce completed by death, Abaye said to him: Are comparable; A bill of divorce removes her from the authority of the yavam , death brings her into the authority of the yavam ,
llm_translation: Rava said: A get for divorce, and death for yibum, just as a get finalizes the divorce, so too death finalizes the yibum. Abaye said to him: Who is comparable? A get removes the woman from the domain of the yavam, while death brings her into the domain of the yavam!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי? גְּזֵירָה ״מִשּׁוּם מֵהַיּוֹם אִם מַתִּי״ – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: what is the reason there decree due to from today if I die. this is a bill of divorce
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: There, what is the reason? A decree "from the day when" - this is a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: וְנִגְזוֹר ״מֵהַיּוֹם אִם מַתִּי״ דְּתַחְלוֹץ, אַטּוּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״! אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹלֶצֶת – מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: But let us a decree from today if I die, she should perform ḥalitza , due to from today and after death. as, if you say she performs ḥalitza , she entered into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: "And it was decreed, 'from the day if she dies' of Tachlotz, then 'from the day and after death'! If you say Choleitz - she performs Yibum."

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹלֶצֶת – מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת! תִּתְיַיבֵּם וְאֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם, חֲשָׁשָׁא דְרַבָּנַן הוּא.
human_translation: Here too, if you say she performs ḥalitza , she entered into levirate marriage. let her perform levirate marriage and no with that. is a concern of the Sages,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here it is taught: If you say "chalitzah" - she performs levirate marriage! She performs levirate marriage, and there is no concern in this, it is a Rabbinic precaution.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֶתֵּן לִךְ מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְהוּא יִתֵּן. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֶתֵּן לִךְ מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, נָתַן לָהּ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me on the condition that I will give you two hundred dinars, she is betrothed and he shall give On the condition that I will give you from now and until thirty days, he gave to her within thirty she is betrothed, but if not, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are consecrated to me on the condition that I give you two hundred zuz," she is indeed consecrated, and he must give the money. If he says, "On the condition that I give you the money from now until thirty days," and he gives it to her within thirty days, she is consecrated. But if not, she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאַרְאֵךְ מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיַרְאֶה לָהּ. וְאִם הֶרְאָה עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: On the condition that I have two hundred dinars, she is betrothed if he has On the condition that I will show you two hundred dinars, she is betrothed, and he shall show to her. And if shows on the table, she is not betrothed,
llm_translation: "‘On condition that I have two hundred zuz’ – behold, she is betrothed, and he has acquired her. ‘On condition that I will see you for two hundred zuz’ – behold, she is betrothed, and he will see her. And if he showed the money on the table – she is not betrothed."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: ״וְהוּא יִתֵּן״. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן״. רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: ״וְהוּא יִתֵּן״ תְּנָאָה הָוֵי, מְקַיֵּים תְּנָאָה וְאָזֵיל. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״לִכְשֶׁיִּתֵּן״ לְכִי יָהֵיב הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Huna says And he shall give, Rav Yehuda says When he gives, Rav Huna says And he shall give, is a condition proceeds to fulfill the condition. Rav Yehuda says When he gives, when he will give will be a betrothal, now at least is not a betrothal.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: Rav Huna said, "And he shall give." Rav Yehudah said, "When he gives." Rav Huna said, "And he shall give" is a Tannaic statement, he fulfills the statement and departs. Rav Yehudah said, "When he gives," now they did not fulfill the sanctification.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שֶׁפָּשְׁטָה יָדָהּ וְקִבְּלָה קִידּוּשִׁין מֵאַחֵר. לְרַב הוּנָא לָא הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, לְרַב יְהוּדָה הָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי.
human_translation: What is between The difference between them where she extended her hand and accepted betrothal from another According to Rav Huna is not betrothal, According to Rav Yehuda, is betrothal,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? The difference between them is that she extended her hand and received the betrothal from another. According to Rav Huna, they were not valid betrothals; according to Rav Yehudah, they were valid betrothals.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי גִיטִּין כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וְהִיא תִּתֵּן. אִיתְּמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: ״וְהִיא תִּתֵּן״. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״לִכְשֶׁתִּתֵּן״. רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: ״וְהִיא תִּתֵּן״, תְּנָאָה הָוֵי, מְקַיְּימָא תְּנָאָה וְאָזְלָה. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״לִכְשֶׁתִּתֵּן״, לְכִי יָהֲבָה לֵיהּ הוּא דְּהָוֵי גֵּט, הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא הָוֵי גֵּט.
human_translation: And we also learned concerning bills of divorce like this case one who says to a woman: This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, she is divorced and she shall give It was stated Rav Huna says: And she shall give; Rav Yehuda says: When she gives. Rav Huna says: And she shall give, it is a condition, she proceeds to fulfill the condition. Rav Yehuda says: When she gives, when she will give to him it will be bill of divorce, now, in any event, is not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah regarding the following case: One who says to a woman, "Behold, this is your bill of divorce on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz," - she is divorced, and she must give it. It was stated: Rav Huna said, "And she must give it." Rav Yehudah said, "When she gives it." Rav Huna said, "And she must give it," it is a stipulation, the stipulation is upheld, and she may then depart. Rav Yehudah said, "When she gives it," for when he gives it to her, it becomes a bill of divorce; now, if she does not give it to him, it is not a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שֶׁנִּתְקָרַע הַגֵּט אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד, לְרַב הוּנָא הָוֵי גֵּט, לְרַב יְהוּדָה לָא הָוֵי גֵּט.
human_translation: What is between The difference between them where the bill of divorce was torn or lost According to Rav Huna it is bill of divorce, According to Rav Yehuda it is not a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? The difference between them is if the divorce document was torn or lost. According to Rav Huna, it is considered a divorce document, but according to Rav Yehudah, it is not considered a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי קִידּוּשִׁין, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, מִשּׁוּם דִּלְקָרוֹבַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֲבָל גֵּירוּשִׁין, דִּלְרַחוֹקַהּ קָאָתֵי, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: And it is necessary As had taught us with regard to betrothal, there Rav Huna says because comes to draw her near But divorce, when he comes to distance her, say concedes to Rav Yehuda
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear regarding betrothals, in this case Rav Huna is saying, because she is close, but divorces, because she is far, let Rav Yehudah agree.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָךְ: בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיהוּ לָא כְּסִיף לֵיהּ לְמִתְבְּעַהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִיהִי כְּסִיפָא לַהּ לְמִיתְבְּעֵיהּ אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if stated with regard to this Rav Huna says in this because he is not ashamed to demand from her But here, when she is ashamed to claim from him, say that concedes to Rav Yehuda necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in that case: In that case Rav Huna said, because he did not want to contradict him, but here, where he contradicts him, I might say that Rav Yehuda agrees with him, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְקָרַע הַגֵּט אוֹ שֶׁאָבַד – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, לְאַחֵר לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא עַד שֶׁתִּתֵּן.
human_translation: raises an objection This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, even if the bill of divorce was torn or lost she is divorced. she may not marry another until she gives
llm_translation: Challenger: "Here is your bill of divorce on condition that you give me two hundred zuz." Even if the bill of divorce was torn or lost - she is considered divorced, and she may not remarry another until she gives the money.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: אָמַר לָהּ ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתְּנִי לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״ וָמֵת, נָתְנָה – אֵין זְקוּקָה לַיָּבָם, לֹא נָתְנָה – זְקוּקָה לְיָבָם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֶנֶת לְאָחִיו אוֹ לְאָבִיו אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִן הַקְּרוֹבִים.
human_translation: And it is further taught said to This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you will give me two hundred dinars, and he died she gave she is not bound to the yavam , she did not give she is bound to the yavam . Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: she give to brother, or to his father, or to one of the relatives
llm_translation: And furthermore it was taught: He said to her, "Behold, this is your bill of divorce on the condition that you give me two hundred zuz." And he died.
