If she gave the money - she is not bound to the levirate marriage; if she did not give the money - she is bound to the levirate marriage. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She may give the money to her brother, or to her father, or to one of her close relatives.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר: ״לִי וְלֹא לְיוֹרְשַׁיי״, וּמָר סָבַר: ״אֲפִילּוּ לְיוֹרְשַׁיי״, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא תְּנָאָה הָוֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: disagree only with regard to Sage, holds me, but not to my heirs. And Sage, holds Even to my heirs. In any event, everyone agrees it is a condition a conclusive refutation of Rav Yehuda.
llm_translation: Until here, they only argue regarding that Mar holds: "For me and not for my heirs," and Mar holds: "Even for my heirs." For everyone in the world, a gift is valid from her, the preference of Rav Yehuda!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַב יְהוּדָה: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי הִיא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי, וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ. וַאֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda say to you: whose is this It is Rabbi as Rav Huna says Rabbi says: Anyone who states On the condition, like states from now, And the Rabbis disagree with him, And I spoke with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Yehudah: "Ha mani - Rabbi hi." For Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi: Anyone who says "al menat" is like one who says "me'achshav," and the Rabbis disagree with him. And I say like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בְּבָבֶל הֲוָה אָמְרִינַן: הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי, פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: the itself. Rav Huna says Rabbi says anyone who states On the condition, like states from now, Rabbi Zeira said: When we were in Babylonia we would say: that Rav Huna says Rabbi says: Anyone who states On the condition, like states from now, the Rabbis disagree with him.
llm_translation: The body, Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi: Anyone who says "on condition" is like one who says "from now." Rabbi Zeira said: When we were in Babylonia, we used to say: This that Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi: Anyone who says "on condition" is like one who says "from now," the Rabbis disputed about it.

hebrew_text: כִּי סָלְקִי לְהָתָם אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַסִּי דְּיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר לַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּאוֹמֵר ״עַל מְנָת״ כְּאוֹמֵר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ דָּמֵי, לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״.
human_translation: When I ascended to there, I found Rabbi Asi sitting and saying in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: All concede with regard to one who says On the condition, like states from now. They disagreed only From today and after death,
llm_translation: When he went there, he found Rabbi Assi sitting and saying to him in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Everyone agrees when one says "on condition" it is like saying "from now," they only disagreed about "from today and after death."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – גֵּט וְאֵינוֹ גֵּט, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה גֵּט.
human_translation: And it is taught from today and after death, bill of divorce or not bill of divorce. the statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi says: like this bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'From the day and after death' - a divorce document and it is not a divorce document, the words of the sages. Rabbi says: Like this is a divorce document."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר בְּ״עַל מְנָת״ נָמֵי פְּלִיגִי, אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בְּ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ – נִיפְלְגֵי בְּ״עַל מְנָת״?
human_translation: And according to Rav Yehuda, who said also disagree with regard to On the condition, of disagreeing with regard to From today and after death, let disagree with regard to On the condition.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda, who said in the name of "Ba'al Menat" - they dispute, would they dispute in "from the day and after death"? - they dispute in "Ba'al Menat"?

hebrew_text: לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחַ דְּרַבִּי, דְּ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ נָמֵי הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. וְנִיפְלְגִי בְּ״עַל מְנָת״, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחַ דְּרַבָּנַן! כֹּחַ דְּהֶיתֵּירָא עֲדִיף.
human_translation: to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabbi From today and after death, this is also bill of divorce. And let them disagree with regard to On the condition, to convey to you the far-reaching nature of the Rabbis, preferable the power of leniency.
llm_translation: To inform you the power of Rabbi, that "from today and after death" also this is a bill of divorce. And it is disputed in "with intent of," to inform you the power of the Rabbis! The power of the more lenient is preferable.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֶתֵּן לְךָ מִכָּאן וְכוּ׳״. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָאו תְּנָאָה הוּא, וּלְזָרוֹזֵיהּ קָאָמְרָ[ה], קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: on the condition that I will give you from now obvious lest you say is not a condition, and he said to motivate himself teaches us
llm_translation: "Upon the condition that I give you from here and onwards." Obviously! What might you say: It is not a gift, but rather a loan, and for its interest he is speaking, as it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״ וְכוּ׳. וְנֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא יֵשׁ לוֹ! וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא יֵשׁ לוֹ!
human_translation: on the condition that I have two hundred dinars, And let us be concerned perhaps he has And furthermore, it is taught we are concerned perhaps he has
llm_translation: "‘On condition that I have two hundred zuz,’ etc. And we are concerned that perhaps he has the money! Furthermore, it was taught: We are concerned that perhaps he has the money!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי, הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי סָפֵק.
human_translation: not difficult, this to a definite betrothal, that an uncertain betrothal.
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in definite sanctifications, here in uncertain sanctifications.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאַרְאֵךְ מָאתַיִם זוּז״ וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: לֹא נִתְכַּוְּנָה אֶלָּא לִרְאוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ. וְאִם הֶרְאָה לָהּ עַל הַשֻּׁלְחָן – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּנָקֵט דְּמֵי בְּעִיסְקָא.
human_translation: on the condition that I will show you two hundred dinars, taught intended to see only his own And if he showed her on the table she is not betrothed, obvious, No, necessary that even if he holds money as joint venture,
llm_translation: "‘On condition that I will see you for two hundred zuz’ etc. It was taught: He intended only to see her beauty. And if he showed it to her on the table – she is not betrothed. Obviously! It is not necessary even though he took the money in a purse."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בֵּית כּוֹר עָפָר״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאַרְאֵךְ בֵּית כּוֹר עָפָר״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְיַרְאֶנָּה. וְאִם הֶרְאָהּ בַּבִּקְעָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: on the condition that I possess a beit kor of earth, she is betrothed, he possesses On the condition that I possess in such and such a place, if he possesses in that place she is betrothed, but if not she is not betrothed. on the condition that I will show you a beit kor of earth, she is betrothed, and he shall show her. And if he showed in a valley, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "On the condition that I have a pit of earth" - this is consecrated, and he has it. "On the condition that I have in a specific place" - if he has it in that place, it is consecrated, and if not, it is not consecrated. "On the condition that I will see a pit of earth" - this is consecrated, and he will see it. And if he saw it in a valley - it is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְנֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא יֵשׁ לוֹ! וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא יֵשׁ לוֹ! לָא קַשְׁיָא. הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי, הָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי סָפֵק.
human_translation: And let us be concerned perhaps he possesses And furthermore, it is taught we are concerned perhaps he possesses not difficult, this to a definite betrothal, that to an uncertain betrothal.
llm_translation: Gemara: And we are concerned that perhaps he has it! Furthermore, it was taught in a braita: We are concerned that perhaps he has it! This is not difficult. This is in cases of definite sanctification, and this is in cases of uncertain sanctification.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא גַּבֵּי אַרְעָא וּלְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא גַּבֵּי זוּזֵי! צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי זוּזֵי, מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּמַצְנְעִי. אֲבָל אַרְעָא, אֵימָא: אִי דְּאִית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא – קָלָא אִית לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I to teach with regard to land, and why do I to teach with regard to money? necessary as had taught us with regard to money because people tend to hide But land, you say if he had land would publicity, teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why do I need to teach about land and why do I need to teach about money! It is necessary, for if we were to teach about money, people would act deceptively. But regarding land, one might say: if one has land - it is obvious, he has land, he does not need to inform us.

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאי נָפְקָא לָךְ מִינַּהּ, אֲנָא טָרַחְנָא וּמַיְיתֵינָא! קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: on the condition that I possess in such and such a place, if he possesses obvious lest you say say to her: What difference does it make to you I will go to the trouble of bringing teaches us
llm_translation: "Regarding 'on the condition that I have in the place of so-and-so,' if he has it, etc. It is obvious! What might you have thought? He said to her: 'What benefit do you derive from it? I have exerted myself and acquired it!' It is evident to us."

hebrew_text: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאַרְאֵךְ בֵּית כּוֹר עָפָר״. תָּאנָא: לֹא נִתְכַּוְּונָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לִרְאוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ. וְאִם הֶרְאָהּ בַּבִּקְעָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּנָקֵיט בְּדִיסְתּוּרָא.
human_translation: on the condition that I will show you a beit kor of earth, taught intended to see only his own And if he showed in a valley, she is not betrothed. obvious; No, necessary where he maintains as a sharecropper [ distora ],
llm_translation: "Upon the condition that I will see the house of Kor dust." It was taught: This intention was only to see his parable. And if he showed it in a valley - it is not sanctified. It is obvious! There is no need to take it into a discussion.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ תְּנַן:
human_translation: With regard to consecrated we learned
llm_translation: Regarding the sanctified animal, we learned:

hebrew_text: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ שָׂדֵהוּ בִּשְׁעַת הַיּוֹבֵל, נוֹתֵן בְּזֶרַע חוֹמֶר שְׂעוֹרִים חֲמִשִּׁים שֶׁקֶל כָּסֶף. הָיוּ נְקָעִים עֲמוּקִּים עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים אוֹ סְלָעִים גְּבוֹהִים עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים – אֵין נִמְדָּדִין עִמָּהּ. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן – נִמְדָּדִין עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: one who consecrates his field during the time of the Jubilee he gives fifty silver shekels for a ḥomer , barley seed. had crevices, ten handbreadths deep, or boulders ten handbreadths high, they are not measured with it, less than that, they are measured with it.
llm_translation: The one who sanctifies his field during the Jubilee year, gives with the seed a measure of barley worth fifty silver shekels. If there were deep holes ten handbreadths or high rocks ten handbreadths - they are not measured with it. Less than this - they are measured with it.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: נְהִי דְּבַהֲדֵי אַרְעָא לֹא קָדְשׁוּ, נִקְדְּשׁוּ בְּאַפֵּי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ! וְכִי תֵּימָא: כַּמָּה דְּלָא הָוֵי בֵּית כּוֹר לָא חֲשִׁיב, וּרְמִינְהוּ:
human_translation: And we discussed Granted, that are not consecrated with the field, let be consecrated by themselves, And if you would say as long as does not a beit kor it is not important, raises a contradiction
llm_translation: We were in it: "Even though the lands were not sanctified, they were sanctified with their own willpower!" And if you will say: "Just as a pit that is not a proper pit is not considered, but we raise an objection:

hebrew_text: ״שָׂדֶה״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? – לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֶרַע חֹמֶר שְׂעֹרִים בַּחֲמִשִּׁים״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁהִקְדִּישׁ בָּעִנְיָן הַזֶּה, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת, לֶתֶךְ וַחֲצִי לֶתֶךְ, סְאָה, תַּרְקַב, וַחֲצִי תַּרְקַב, וַאֲפִילּוּ רוֹבַע מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שָׂדֶה״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם!
human_translation: a field What the verse states Since it is stated “The sowing of a ḥomer of barley shall be valued at fifty I have only consecrated in this manner, From where includes a half- kor , and half of a half- kor , a se’a , a tarkav , and half a tarkav , and even a quarter From where The verse states “a field” in any case.
llm_translation: The term "field" - what is the teaching to say? - Because it is stated: "A homer of barley seed for fifty shekels," I might have only that which was sanctified for this matter, how do I know to include, for flax and half a flax, for a se'ah, a tarkav, and half a tarkav, and even a quarter, how do I know? The teaching to say: "field" - in any case!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: הָכָא בִּנְקָעִים מְלֵאִים מַיִם עָסְקִינַן, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו בְּנֵי זְרִיעָה נִינְהוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי דּוּמְיָא דִסְלָעִים גְּבוֹהִים, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Mar Ukva bar Ḥama said: Here we are dealing with crevices filled with water. Due to that they are not fit for sowing, is also precise, as it teaches similar to high boulders, Learn from
llm_translation: Master Uqva bar Hama said: Here in the case of cisterns filled with water we are dealing with, because they are not considered seeds. It is precisely stated, as it was taught: similar to the appearance of high rocks, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִיכֵּן נָמֵי! הָנְהוּ נְאגָנֵי דְאַרְעָא מִיקְּרוּ, שִׁדְרָא דְאַרְעָא מִקְּרוּ.
human_translation: If so, even less than as well, these are called the cracks in the ground. are called the spine of the ground.
llm_translation: If so, even less than that is also forbidden! These are the reeds of the land that they uprooted, the barley of the land that they uprooted.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי מֶכֶר תְּנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״בֵּית כּוֹר עָפָר אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״, וְהָיוּ שָׁם נְקָעִים עֲמוּקִּים עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים אוֹ סְלָעִים גְּבוֹהִים עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים – אֵין נִמְדָּדִים עִמָּהּ. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן – נִמְדָּדִים עִמָּהּ. וְאָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מְלֵאִים מַיִם.
human_translation: With regard to a sale we learned one who says to another: I am selling you a beit kor of earth, there were crevices ten handbreadths deep or boulders ten handbreadths high they are not measured with it; less than that, they are measured with it. And Mar Ukva bar Ḥama says: Even if they are not filled with water,
llm_translation: Regarding the laws of sale, we learned: If one says to his fellow, "I am selling you a pit of dust," and there were there deep cracks ten handbreadths deep or high rocks ten handbreadths high - they are not measured with it. Less than this - they are measured with it. And Mar Ukva son of Hama said: Even though they do not hold water.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם רוֹצֶה שֶׁיִּתֵּן אֶת מְעוֹתָיו בְּשָׂדֶה אַחַת וְיֵרָאֶה לוֹ כִּשְׁנַיִם וְכַשְּׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Pappa says: Because a person does not want to give his money for one field and it appears to him like two or three places.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Papa said: Because a person does not want to put his money in one field and have it appear to him as two or three places.

hebrew_text: הָכָא מַאי? לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ מְדַמֵּינַן לַהּ, אוֹ לְמֶכֶר מְדַמֵּינַן לַהּ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ מְדַמֵּינַן לַהּ, דְּאָמַר לַהּ: אֲנָא טָרַחְנָא וְזָרַעְנָא וּמַיְיתֵינָא.
human_translation: What here, we compare it to consecrated or do we compare it to a sale, It stands to reason we compare it to consecrated as say to her: I will go to the trouble of sowing and bringing
llm_translation: Here what? To sanctify we estimate for it, or to sell we estimate for it? It makes sense to estimate for sanctifying it, as it says: "I have toiled and brought forth and obtained."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל תְּנַאי שֶׁאֵינוֹ כִּתְנַאי בְּנֵי גָּד וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן – אֵינוֹ תְּנַאי. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵהֶם אִם יַעַבְרוּ בְנֵי גָד וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן״. וּכְתִיב: ״וְאִם לֹא יַעַבְרוּ חֲלוּצִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Any condition that is not like the condition the children of Gad and the children of Reuben is not condition As it is stated: “And said to them, if the children of Gad and the children of Reuben pass over And it is written “But if they will not pass over armed
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabbi Meir says: Any teaching that is not like the teaching of the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben - is not a teaching. As it is stated: "And he said to them, 'If the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben cross over.'" And it is written: "But if the armed men do not cross over."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: צָרִיךְ הַדָּבָר לְאוֹמְרוֹ, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא כֵּן, יֵשׁ בַּמַּשְׁמָע שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן לֹא יִנְחָלוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says: necessary to state the matter, as otherwise, it might have meant that they will not inherit even in the land of Canaan.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says: The matter needs to be said, that if not so, there is in the implication that even in the land of Canaan they will not inherit.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר! אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לָאו לִתְנַאי כָּפוּל הוּא דַּאֲתָא, לִכְתּוֹב: ״וְאִם לֹא יַעַבְרוּ וְנֹאחֲזוּ בְתֹכְכֶם״, ״בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן״
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel is saying well, to Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Meir said to you: If it enters your mind does not come a compound condition let it write: But if they will not pass over they shall receive a possession among you, “In the land of Canaan.”
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemar shapir ka'amar leih Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel leRabbi Meir! Amar lakh Rabbi Meir: Iy sakla da'takh lavo litnai kaful hu da'ata, likhtov: 'Ve'im lo ya'avoru venochazu betokhekhem,' 'be'eretz Kena'an.'"

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִתְנַאי כָּפוּל הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: Why do I Conclude from it that it comes to a compound condition.
llm_translation: "Why to me? Learn from it that it is a case of a repeated teaching that has come."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אָמַר: אִי לָא כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא ״וְנֹאחֲזוּ בְתֹכְכֶם״ – בְּאֶרֶץ גִּלְעָד, אֲבָל אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן – כְּלָל לָא. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר? ״בְתֹכְכֶם״ – כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִית לְכוּ מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says: If the Merciful One had not written: “In the land of Canaan,” I would say “They shall receive a possession among you” to the land of Gilead, But not the land of Canaan at all. And Rabbi Meir “Among you,” means anywhere that you have
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel said: If the Merciful One had not written "in the land of Canaan," I would have thought "and they shall possess it" - in the land of Gilead, but the land of Canaan - not at all. And Rabbi Meir? "Among you" - wherever there is a place for you to dwell.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מָשָׁל לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה – לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה מְחַלֵּק נְכָסָיו לְבָנָיו, אָמַר: פְּלוֹנִי בְּנִי יִירַשׁ שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי בְּנִי יִירַשׁ שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי בְּנִי יִתֵּן מָאתַיִם זוּז וְיִירַשׁ שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית, וְאִם לֹא יִתֵּן – יִירַשׁ עִם אֶחָיו בִּשְׁאָר נְכָסִים.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel said: a parable: To what is this matter, comparable? to a person who was dividing up his property among his sons, said: My son so-and-so shall inherit such and such a field; and my son so-and-so shall inherit such and such a field; and my son so-and-so shall give two hundred dinars and inherit such and such a field, and if he does not give he will inherit of the remainder of the property with his brothers.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel said: What is this matter similar to? - To a man who was dividing his estate among his sons, he said: "So-and-so, my son, shall inherit a certain field, and so-and-so, my son, shall inherit a different field, and so-and-so, my son, shall give two hundred zuz and inherit a certain field, and if he does not give, he shall inherit with his brothers in the rest of the estate."

hebrew_text: מִי גָּרַם לוֹ לִירַשׁ עִם אֶחָיו בִּשְׁאָר נְכָסִים – כְּפֵילוֹ גָּרַם לוֹ.
human_translation: What causes to inherit of the remainder of the property with his brothers? double causes him
llm_translation: Who caused him to inherit with his brothers in the rest of the property - his double caused him to inherit.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא דָּמְיָא מָשָׁל לְמַתְנִיתִין! הָתָם קָתָנֵי: יֵשׁ בַּמַּשְׁמָע שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן לֹא יִנְחָלוּ, אַלְמָא כְּפֵילָה לְאֶרֶץ גִּלְעָד נָמֵי מַהֲנֵי.
human_translation: But parable is not similar to the mishna, there teaches: It might have meant that they will not inherit even in the land of Canaan, apparently double is also effective for the land of Gilead
llm_translation: The text says: "But is it not similar to a mishnah! There it teaches: There is in the tradition that even in the land of Canaan they will not inherit, implying that it is a double portion for the land of Gilead."

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא קָתָנֵי: מִי גָּרַם לוֹ לִירַשׁ עִם אֶחָיו בִּשְׁאָר נְכָסִים – כְּפֵילוֹ גָּרַם לוֹ, אַלְמָא כְּפֵילָה לִשְׁאָר נְכָסִים הוּא דְּקָמַהֲנֵי!
human_translation: And here teaches: What causes to inherit of the remainder of the property with his brothers? double causes him. apparently double is effective for the rest of the property,
llm_translation: And here it is taught: Who caused him to inherit with his brothers in the rest of the property - his double caused him to inherit. This implies that a double portion is for the rest of the property!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא. הָא – מִקַּמֵּי דְּנֵימָא לֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר ״וְנֹאחֲזוּ״,
human_translation: not difficult, this before Rabbi Meir said to him “They shall receive a possession
llm_translation: Not difficult. This - from before as it is said by Rabbi Meir "and they shall grasp,"

hebrew_text: הָא – לְבָתַר דְּנֵימָא לֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר ״וְנֹאחֲזוּ״.
human_translation: that after Rabbi Meir said to “They shall receive a possession,”
llm_translation: This is the translation: "This - after it was said to him, Rabbi Meir, 'and they shall take hold of'."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם תֵּיטִיב שְׂאֵת, וְאִם לֹא תֵיטִיב לַפֶּתַח חַטָּאת רֹבֵץ״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְמָה לִי? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: אִם תֵּיטִיב – אַגְרָא, אִם לֹא תֵיטִיב – לָא אַגְרָא וְלָא דִּינָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is that it is written, “If you do well, shall it not be lifted up? And if you do not do well, sin crouches at the door” However, according to Rabbi Ḥanina why do I enter your mind to say If you do well a reward? if you do not do well neither reward nor punishment. teaches us
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written: "If you do well, will you not be accepted? And if you do not do well, sin is crouching at the door." But according to Rabbi Chanina, why do I need it? By the rise of your thought, I say: If you do well - there is reward, if you do not do well - there is no reward and no punishment, this is what he implies to us.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אָז תִּנָּקֶה מֵאָלָתִי״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is that it is written, “Then you shall be clear from my oath However, according to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, why do I
llm_translation: In truth, to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written: "Then I will be clear from my oath," but to Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הֵיכָא דְּנִיחָא לַהּ לְדִידַהּ וְלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְדִידְהוּ מַיְיתֵי בְּעַל כֻּרְחַיְיהוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: necessary enter your mind to say: where is satisfactory for her, but not satisfactory for should bring against their wishes. teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, I would say: where it is pleasing to her and not pleasing to him, the owner of the vineyard comes and informs us.

hebrew_text: ״אִם לֹא תֹאבֶה הָאִשָּׁה״ לְמָה לִי? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הֵיכָא דְּנִיחָא לְהוּ לְדִידְהוּ וְלָא נִיחָא לַהּ לְדִידַהּ – נַיְיתֵי בְּעַל כֻּרְחַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: “If the woman is not willing Why do I necessary, enter your mind to say: If it is satisfactory for them but not satisfactory for her, should bring against her wishes. teaches us
llm_translation: "If the woman does not desire, why do I need it? I require it, for I would say: in a case where it is pleasing to him and not pleasing to her - the husband may compel her, as it is inferred for us."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם בְּחֻקֹּתַי תֵּלֵכוּ״, ״וְאִם בְּחֻקֹּתַי תִּמְאָסוּ״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמָה לִי? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״אִם בְּחֻקֹּתַי תֵּלֵכוּ״ – בְּרָכָה, ״אִם בְּחֻקֹּתַי תִּמְאָסוּ״ – לֹא בְּרָכָה וְלֹא קְלָלָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is that it is written: “If you walk in My statutes” “And if you shall reject My statutes” However, according to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, why do I necessary, enter your mind to say: If you follow My statutes a blessing, if you reject My statutes neither a blessing nor a curse. teaches us
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written: "If you walk in My statutes," "and if you despise My statutes." But according to Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, why do I need it? I might say, your mind will come to say: "If you walk in My statutes" - blessing, "and if you despise My statutes" - neither blessing nor curse, it implies to us.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״אִם תֹּאבוּ וּשְׁמַעְתֶּם וְגוֹ׳״, ״וְאִם תְּמָאֲנוּ וּמְרִיתֶם וְגוֹ׳״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמָה לִי? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״אִם תֹּאבוּ״ – טוֹבָה, ״וְאִם תְּמָאֲנוּ״ – לֹא טוֹבָה וְלֹא רָעָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is that it is written: “If you are willing and obedient “But if you refuse and rebel But according to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, why do I necessary, enter your mind to say: “If you are willing” good, “but if you refuse” neither good nor bad. teaches us
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written, "If you are willing and obedient," "and if you refuse and rebel," but according to Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, why do I need it? I will say based on my own reasoning: "If you are willing" – good, "and if you refuse" – neither good nor bad, this is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: מַאי
human_translation: What
llm_translation: What is it?

hebrew_text: ״חֶרֶב תְּאֻכְּלוּ״? אָמַר רָבָא: מִילְחָא גְּלָלְנִיתָא, נַהֲמָא דִשְׂעָרֵי אַקּוּשָׁא, וּבֻצְלֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: פַּת פּוּרְנִי חֲרֵיבָה בְּמֶלַח, וּבְצָלִים – קָשִׁים לַגּוּף כַּחֲרָבוֹת.
human_translation: “You shall be devoured by the sword” Rava says: coarse grains [ gelalenita ] of salt, hard barley bread, and onions. As the Master said: Dried bakery [ purnei ] bread with salt and onions harms the body like swords.
llm_translation: "‘You shall be consumed by the sword’? Rava said: It is due to the consumption of coarse salt, the heat of leeks, and onions. As Mar said: Coarse bread is harmful with salt, and onions are as harmful to the body as swords."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם לֹא שָׁכַב אִישׁ אֹתָךְ וְאִם לֹא שָׂטִית טֻמְאָה תַּחַת אִישֵׁךְ הִנָּקִי״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, ״חִנְקִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: ״הנקי״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, this is that it is written “If no man has lain with you, and if you have not gone aside to uncleanness, being under your husband, you shall be free [ hinnaki ]” But according to Rabbi Meir, should have you should choke [ ḥinnaki ] Rabbi Tanḥum said: hinnaki is written.
llm_translation: In truth, to Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, that is what is written: "If a man has not lain with you, and if you have not been defiled under your husband, you are clean." Rather, to Rabbi Meir, "clean" is what is required! Rabbi Tanchum said: "clean" is written.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנָּקִי״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמָה לִי? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״אִם לֹא שָׁכַב אִישׁ״ – הִנָּקִי, ״וְאִם שָׁכַב״ – לֹא הִנָּקִי וְלֹא חִנְקִי, אֶלָּא אִיסּוּרָא בְּעָלְמָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is that it is written hinnaki But according to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, why do I necessary, enter your mind to say: If no man has lain with you, you shall be free, and if he has lain neither be free nor choke; rather, merely a prohibition teaches us
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written: "Innocent." Rather, for Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, why do I need it? It is necessary, for your mind might say: "If a man did not lie" - innocent, "and if he lied" - not innocent and not guilty, but rather a mere prohibition, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״הוּא יִתְחַטָּא בוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי יִטְהָר וְאִם לֹא יִתְחַטָּא וְגוֹ׳״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is that it is written, “He shall purify himself with it on the third day and on the seventh day, and he shall be pure; but if he does not purify himself But according to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, why do I
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written: "He shall purify himself with it on the third day and on the seventh day he shall be clean, but if he does not purify himself, etc." Rather, to Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִצְוַת הַזָּאָה בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַשְּׁבִיעִי, וְהֵיכָא דַּעֲבַד בְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ עֲבַד – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: necessary, enter your mind to say: The mitzva of sprinkling on the third and seventh but if he performed on one of them performed teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: the commandment of sprinkling on the third and on the seventh, and wherever one of them is done - it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ לְמָה לִי? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: שְׁלִישִׁי לְמַעוֹטֵי שֵׁנִי, שְׁבִיעִי לְמַעוֹטֵי שִׁשִּׁי, דְּקָא מְמַעֵט בִּימֵי טׇהֳרָה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דַּעֲבַד בִּשְׁלִישִׁי וּבִשְׁמִינִי, דְּקָא מַפֵּישׁ בִּימֵי טׇהֳרָה – אֵימָא שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: “And the pure shall sprinkle on the impure on the third day and on the seventh day” Why do I necessary, enter your mind to say third excludes second, seventh excludes sixth because he decreases the days of purity But if he performed on the third and on the eighth in he increases to the days of purity, say proper. teaches us
llm_translation: "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day" - Why do I need it? It is necessary, for if you were to say: the third to exclude the second, the seventh to exclude the sixth, that it reduces the days during the days of purity, but where he does it on the third and on the eighth, that it extends the days during the days of purity - I might say it is plausible, for it is consistent with our reasoning.

hebrew_text: ״וְחִטְּאוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ לְמָה לִי? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְקׇדָשִׁים, אֲבָל לִתְרוּמָה – בְּחַד נָמֵי סַגִּיא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I “And on the seventh day he shall purify him” necessary, enter your mind to say: This matter, applies for consecrated but for teruma one also sufficient. teaches us
llm_translation: "And they shall sin on the seventh day" - why do I need it? It is necessary, as your mind would say: these words are for holy things, but for terumah - in one respect it is significant, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְאָמַר: כְּסָבוּר הָיִיתִי שֶׁהִיא כֹּהֶנֶת וַהֲרֵי הִיא לְוִיָּה, לְוִיָּה וַהֲרֵי הִיא כֹּהֶנֶת, עֲנִיָּה וַהֲרֵי הִיא עֲשִׁירָה, עֲשִׁירָה וַהֲרֵי הִיא עֲנִיָּה – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הִטְעַתּוּ.
human_translation: one who betroths a woman and says: I thought that she was the daughter of a priest, and she is the daughter of a Levite, the daughter of a Levite and she is the daughter of a priest, poor and she is wealthy; wealthy and she is poor, she is betrothed, because she did not mislead him,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths a woman and says, "I thought she was a priestess, but she is actually a Levite; she is a Levite, but she is actually a priestess; she is poor, but she is actually wealthy; she is wealthy, but she is actually poor" – she is indeed betrothed, because he did not deceive her.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לָאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, אוֹ ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, אוֹ ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, אוֹ ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לִיךְ יְבָמִיךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after I convert, or: After you convert, After I am emancipated, or After you are emancipated, After your husband dies, or After your sister dies, After your yavam performs ḥalitza for you, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are consecrated to me after you convert," or "after you have converted," "after you are freed," or "after you have been freed," "after your husband dies," or "after your sister dies," "after your yavam releases you" – she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״אִם יָלְדָה אִשְׁתְּךָ נְקֵבָה הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אִם הָיְתָה אֵשֶׁת חֲבֵרוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת וְהוּכַּר עוּבָּרָהּ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין, וְאִם יָלְדָה נְקֵבָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: And similarly, one who says to another: If your wife gives birth to a female is hereby betrothed to me, is not betrothed if the wife of the other was pregnant and her fetus was discernible his statement is upheld, and if she gives birth to a girl, is betrothed
llm_translation: And so one who says to his fellow: "If your wife gives birth to a female, she is sanctified to me" - she is not sanctified. If his fellow's wife was pregnant and her pregnancy was recognizable - his words stand, and if she gives birth to a female - she is sanctified.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין תּוֹרְמִין מִן הַתָּלוּשׁ עַל הַמְחוּבָּר. וְאִם תָּרַם – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: We learned there One may not separate teruma from detached for, attached And if he separated teruma his teruma is not teruma ,
llm_translation: We learned there: One does not separate from the suspended onto the attached. And if he separated - his terumah is not terumah.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אַסִּי מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָמַר ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁים יִהְיוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ מְחוּבָּרִים״, ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ מְחוּבָּרִים יִהְיוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁים לִכְשֶׁיִּתָּלְשׁוּ״ וְנִתְלְשׁוּ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ לָאו כִּמְחוּסָּר מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Asi raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is said: The detached produce of this garden bed should be teruma for the attached produce of this garden bed; The attached produce of this garden bed should be teruma for the detached produce of this garden bed, when they will be detached; and was detached? said to him: Anything that is in one’s power is not considered lacking action.
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Assi from Rabbi Yochanan: He said, "The fruits of the citron tree, these shall be detached, they shall be terumah upon the fruits of the citron tree, these shall be attached," "The fruits of the citron tree, these shall be attached, they shall be terumah upon the fruits of the citron tree, these shall be detached, when they become detached." And they became detached, what is the law? He said to him: Anything that is in his possession is not like something lacking in action of value.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הָאוֹמֵר לָאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לִיךְ יְבָמִיךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: raised an objection to one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after I convert, After you convert, After I am emancipated, After you are emancipated, After your husband dies, After your sister dies, After your yavam performs ḥalitza for you, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are betrothed to me after you convert," "after you have converted," "after you are freed," "after you have been freed," "after your husband dies," "after your sister dies," "after your yavam performs chalitzah for you" – she is not betrothed.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ לָאו בְּיָדוֹ, אֶלָּא גֵּר, הָוֵי בְּיָדוֹ! גֵּר נָמֵי לָאו בְּיָדוֹ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Granted, all these it is not in his power but a convert, is in his power, a convert, it is also not in his power as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: In truth, all of them are not in his possession, rather, a convert, it is in his possession! A convert also is not in his possession, as Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan:

hebrew_text: גֵּר צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאי טַעְמָא: ״מִשְׁפָּט״ כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ כַּדִּין, מִי יֵימַר דְּמִזְדַּקְּקוּ לֵיהּ הָנֵי תְּלָתָא.
human_translation: A convert requires three What is the reason It is written with regard to law, considered a judgment who says that those three will be available to him?
llm_translation: A convert needs three. What is the reason? "Judgment" is written in it like the law, who can say that these three are disputing it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הַנּוֹתֵן פְּרוּטָה לְשִׁפְחָתוֹ, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֲשַׁחְרְרִיךְ״ – הָכִי נָמֵי דְּהָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין? הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם – מֵעִיקָּרָא בְּהֵמָה, הַשְׁתָּא – דַּעַת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel objects to this: If that is so, one who gives one peruta to his maidservant and says: You are hereby betrothed to me after I emancipate you, so too that it is a betrothal How can be compared? There, initially an animal, now an independent mind.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Abba bar Memel objected to her: Rather, from now on, one who gives a prutah to his maidservant and says, "Behold, you are betrothed to me after I free you" - is this considered a valid betrothal? Is it so now that they are betrothed? There - initially with an animal, now - with a different intent.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הַנּוֹתֵן פְּרוּטָה לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֲגָרְשִׁיךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, הָכִי נָמֵי לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּהָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין? נְהִי דִּבְיָדוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ, בְּיָדוֹ לְקַדְּשָׁהּ?
human_translation: But that which Rabbi Oshaya says: one who gives one peruta to his wife and says to her: You are hereby betrothed to me after I divorce you, she is not betrothed, so too according to Rabbi Yoḥanan that it is a betrothal Although he has the power to divorce her, he have the power to betroth her
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rabbi Oshaya said: One who gives a prutah to his wife and says to her, "Behold, you are sanctified to me after I divorce you" - she is not sanctified. So too according to Rabbi Yochanan who performs the betrothal? If it is in his power to divorce her, is it in his power to sanctify her?

hebrew_text: תִּפְשׁוֹט דְּבָעֵי רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הַנּוֹתֵן שְׁתֵּי פְּרוּטוֹת לְאִשָּׁה, בְּאַחַת אָמַר לָהּ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי הַיּוֹם״, וּבְאַחַת אָמַר לָהּ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֲגָרְשִׁיךְ״, תִּפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ דְּלָא הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין! דִּלְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתָפְסִי קִידּוּשִׁין הַשְׁתָּא – תָּפְסִי נָמֵי לְאַחַר כֵּן.
human_translation: resolve dilemma raised Rav Oshaya: one who gives two perutot to a woman, with one he says to her: Be betrothed to me today, and with one he says to her: Be betrothed to me after I divorce you? resolve from here that it is not a betrothal. Perhaps just as the betrothal is effective now, it is also effective afterward.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a dilemma of Rav Ashi: One who gives two coins to a woman, with one he says to her, "Be consecrated to me today," and with the other he says to her, "Be consecrated to me after I divorce you," her status of betrothal is not established! Perhaps the reason is so that she should not become betrothed now - let her become betrothed afterwards.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין תּוֹרְמִין מִן הַתָּלוּשׁ עַל הַמְחוּבָּר, וְאִם תָּרַם – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר: ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁין יִהְיוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ מְחוּבֶּרֶת״, ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ מְחוּבֶּרֶת יִהְיוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁין״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. אֲבָל אָמַר ״לִכְשֶׁיִּתָּלְשׁוּ״ וְנִתְלְשׁוּ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: One may not separate teruma from the detached for the attached, and if he separated teruma , his teruma is not teruma . How so? he said: The detached produce of this garden bed will be teruma for the attached produce of this garden bed, The attached produce of this garden bed will be teruma for the detached produce of this garden bed, he has not said anything But he said when they will be detached, and they become detached, his statement is valid,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: One does not separate terumah from that which is hanging on that which is attached, and if one separated – his terumah is not terumah. How so? He said: "The fruits of this detached arugah shall be considered attached for terumah upon the fruits of this attached arugah," "The fruits of this attached arugah shall be considered detached for terumah upon the fruits of this detached arugah" – he did not say anything. But he said, "When they become detached" and they became detached – his words stand.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁין יִהְיוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ מְחוּבֶּרֶת״, ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ מְחוּבֶּרֶת יִהְיוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁין לִכְשֶׁיָּבִיאוּ שְׁלִישׁ וְיִתָּלְשׁוּ״, וְהֵבִיאוּ שְׁלִישׁ וְנִתְלְשׁוּ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: Moreover, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said even one said: The detached produce of this garden bed will be teruma for the attached produce of this garden bed, The attached produce of this garden bed will be teruma for the detached produce of this garden bed when they, will reach one-third and are detached, they will reach one-third and are detached, his statement is upheld.
llm_translation: "Moreover, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: Even if one were to say, 'The fruits of this citron are detached, they shall be designated as terumah,' 'The fruits of this citron are attached,' they shall be designated as terumah. 'The fruits of this citron are attached,' they shall be designated as terumah, 'The fruits of this citron are detached,' when the third year arrives, they shall be detached.' And when the third year arrived and they were detached - his words stand."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לֹא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אֶלָּא בְּשַׁחַת, אֲבָל בַּאֲגַם – לֹא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בַּאֲגַם. מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי אֲגַם לִישָּׁנָא דְּבוּצְלָנָא הוּא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הֲלָכֹף כְּאַגְמֹן רֹאשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabba says: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says only with regard to fodder, But not to soft [ agam ]. Rav Yosef says: even to soft From where may be inferred that this agam is a term of growth [ butzlana ]? Rabbi Elazar said as the verse states: “Is it to bow down his head as a bulrush [ ke’agmon ]”
llm_translation: Rabba said: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov did not say except in a pit, but in a marsh - no. Rav Yosef said: Even in a marsh. What is implied by this marsh, is it the marsh of Butzalna? Rabbi Elazar said: As the verse states: "His head is like the finest gold."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵרוֹ ״אִם יָלְדָה אִשְׁתְּךָ נְקֵבָה, מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין אִשְׁתּוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת, אֲבָל אִשְׁתּוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין. כְּמַאן? אִי כְּרַבָּה כְּשֶׁהוּכַּר עוּבָּרָהּ, אִי כְּרַב יוֹסֵף – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הוּכַּר עוּבָּרָהּ.
human_translation: In accordance with whose that which is taught one who says to another: If your wife gives birth to a female she is betrothed to me, he has not said anything? And Rabbi Ḥanina says: They taught only where wife is not pregnant. But his wife is pregnant his statement is upheld. In accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabba, where her fetus was noticeable, If in accordance with Rav Yosef, even if her fetus was not noticeable.
llm_translation: As to where this goes, as it was taught: One who says to his fellow, "If your wife gives birth to a female, she is betrothed to me," - he has said nothing. And Rabbi Chanina said: They only taught this when his wife is not pregnant, but if his wife is pregnant - his words are valid. According to whom? If like Rabba who recognized her pregnancy, or like Rav Yosef - even though he did not recognize her pregnancy.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבָּה: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אֶלָּא בְּשַׁחַת דְּבֵי כִיבְשָׁא, אֲבָל בְּשַׁחַת דְּבֵי שָׁקְיָא – לָא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁחַת דְּבֵי שָׁקְיָא.
human_translation: And there are who say Rabba says: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says only with regard to fodder of a non-irrigated field, But not about fodder of an irrigated field. Rav Yosef said: even to fodder of an irrigated field,
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rabba said: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov did not say this except in the case of the pit of Kivsha, but in the case of the pit of Shakya - he did not. Rav Yosef said: Even in the case of the pit of Shakya.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״אִם יָלְדָה אִשְׁתְּךָ נְקֵבָה מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין אִשְׁתּוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת, אֲבָל אִשְׁתּוֹ מְעוּבֶּרֶת – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִים. כְּמַאן – כְּשֶׁהוּכַּר עוּבָּרָהּ, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: in accordance with whose that which is taught one says to another: If your wife gives birth to a female she is betrothed to me, he has not said anything? And Rabbi Ḥanina says: They taught only when his wife is not pregnant, but his wife is pregnant his statement is upheld. In accordance with whose where her fetus was noticeable, everyone agrees
llm_translation: As to where this goes, as it was taught: One who says to his fellow, "If your wife gives birth to a female, she is consecrated to me," he has said nothing. And Rabbi Chanina said: They only taught this when his wife is not pregnant, but if his wife is pregnant, his words are valid. As to where - when her pregnancy is recognized, and this is the opinion of all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, וְרַבִּי, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ – אָדָם מַקְנֶה דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לְעוֹלָם. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי – דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Abaye says: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, and Rabbi and Rabbi Meir all hold A person can transfer an entity that has not yet come into the world. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov that which we said, Rabbi As it is taught
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, and Rabbi, and Rabbi Meir all hold the opinion that a person can acquire something that has not yet come into the world. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - this is what we said. Rabbi - as it was taught:

hebrew_text: ״לֹא תַסְגִּיר עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדֹנָיו״, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּלוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד עַל מְנָת לְשַׁחְרְרוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כְּגוֹן דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ: ״לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֲךָ, הֲרֵי עַצְמְךָ קָנוּי לְךָ מֵעַכְשָׁיו״.
human_translation: “You shall not deliver a slave to his master” Rabbi says: The verse is speaking of one who acquires a slave, in order to emancipate him. What are the circumstances Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: For example, if wrote to When I will purchase you, you are hereby acquired to yourself from now.
llm_translation: "Do not hand over a slave to his master," Rabbi says: When one acquires a slave with the intention of freeing him, the Scripture speaks. How so? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: For example, if he wrote to him: 'When I acquire you, behold, you are acquired for yourself from now.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָךְ יְבָמִיךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir as it is taught one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after I convert, After you convert, After I am emancipated, After you are emancipated, After your husband dies, After your sister dies, After your yavam performs ḥalitza for you, she is not betrothed. Rabbi Meir says: She is betrothed. Rabbi Yoḥanan HaSandlar says: She is not betrothed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are betrothed to me after you convert," "After you have converted," "After you are freed," "After you have been freed," "After your husband dies," "After your sister dies," "After your yavam performs chalitzah for you" – she is not betrothed. Rabbi Meir says: She is betrothed. Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker says: She is not betrothed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ ״אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת״ – מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says she is betrothed. And what reason did say she is not betrothed? Due to enmity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: "Mekudeshet." And what is the reason they said, "Eina Mekudeshet" - because of enmity.

hebrew_text: וְנִחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא! הַיְינוּ רַבִּי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא.
human_translation: And let us also count Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi Rabbi is Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi;
llm_translation: And it was thought before Rabbi Yehuda the Prince! That is Rabbi, that is Rabbi Yehuda the Prince.

hebrew_text: וְנִחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״ – אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר.
human_translation: And let us also count Rabbi Akiva, as it is taught I will produce for you, that is konam , need not nullify
llm_translation: And it was thought before Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: "Their quiver that I fill" - there is no need to nullify.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָפֵר, שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲדִיף עָלָיו יָתֵר מִן הָרָאוּי לוֹ. הָאִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: בְּאוֹמֶרֶת: ״יִקְדְּשׁוּ יָדַי לְעוֹשֵׂיהֶם״, וְיָדַיִם אִיתַנְהוּ בָּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: He should nullify perhaps she will exceed more for him than is fitting for him Wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says: to who says: Let my hands be sanctified to their Maker? and hands exist in the world;
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Beautiful, lest one prioritize it more than is fitting for him. When it was said about it, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: By saying, "They shall sanctify My hands for the work," and hands are given to them in the world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לָאִשָּׁה ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֲדַבֵּר עָלַיִךְ לַשִּׁלְטוֹן״, ״וְאֶעֱשֶׂה עִמָּךְ כְּפוֹעֵל״, דִּבֵּר עָלֶיהָ לַשִּׁלְטוֹן וְעָשָׂה עִמָּהּ כְּפוֹעֵל – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me on the condition that I will speak your to the authorities, I will act for you as a laborer, he spoke her to the authorities or acted for her as a laborer, she is betrothed. But if not, she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are consecrated to me on the condition that I have authority over you," "and I will treat you according to my actions," if he spoke to her regarding authority and acted towards her according to his words - she is consecrated. But if not - she is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְהוּא שֶׁנָּתַן לָהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. וּבְשָׂכָר לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁהִרְכַּבְתִּיךְ עַל הַחֲמוֹר שֶׁהוֹשַׁבְתִּיךְ בְּקָרוֹן אוֹ בִּסְפִינָה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: And this if he gave her worth one peruta And not by the value But isn’t it taught by value when I had you ride on a donkey, when I had you sit on a wagon [ karon ], or: in a boat, she is not betrothed,
llm_translation: Gemara: Reish Lakish said: "And he who gave her is equal to a perutah." But for payment, no? And it was taught in a braita: "For payment, when I have transported you on a donkey that I have seated you on in a wagon or on a ship - it is not sanctified."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׂכַר שֶׁאַרְכִּיבִךְ עַל הַחֲמוֹר, שֶׁאוֹשִׁיבִךְ בְּקָרוֹן אוֹ בִּסְפִינָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי בְּדִיהַב לַהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְהָא בִּשְׂכַר קָאָמַר.
human_translation: By value when I will have you ride on a donkey, when I will have you sit on a wagon, or: in a boat, she is betrothed. And if you would say here too, to where he gave her worth one peruta , says: By value,
llm_translation: In reward that I will ride you on the donkey, that I will return you in a wagon or in a ship - it is sanctified. And if you say here it is comparable to gold for her, it is equal to a small coin, but here it is in reward that he said.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: שֵׁב עִמִּי בְּצַוְותָּא וְאֶקַּדֵּשׁ לָךְ, שְׂחוֹק לְפָנַי, רְקוֹד לְפָנַי, עֲשֵׂה כַּדִּימוֹס הַזֶּה – שָׁמִין, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. וְכִי תֵּימָא, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּדִיהַב לַהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְהָא שָׁמִין אוֹתוֹ קָאָמַר! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught Sit together with me and I will be betrothed to you, Perform entertainment before me, Dance before me, Perform like this layer [ dimus ] appraises If is worth the value of one peruta , she is betrothed, but if not, she is not betrothed. And if you would say here too, where he gave her worth one peruta , but says: appraises it. a conclusive refutation Reish Lakish?
llm_translation: And furthermore it was taught: "Sit with me in the commandment, and I will sanctify you, laughter before me, dancing before me, do like this diamond - we listen, if it has the value of a perutah - it is sanctified, and if not - it is not sanctified. And if you will say, here it is made of gold and it has the value of a perutah, and yet he said it is silver! The excellence of Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַאי תַּנָּא בָּרָא סָבַר: אֵינָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת אֶלָּא לְבַסּוֹף. וְתַנָּא דִידַן סָבַר יֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִילָּה וְעַד סוֹף.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to you: This tanna of the baraita maintains wage only at the end And the tanna of our maintains a wage is from the beginning to end.
llm_translation: He said to you, Reish Lakish: This Tanna Bara holds: It is not for rental but for purchase. And our Tanna holds: It is for rental from the beginning to the end.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי דּוּחְקֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְאוֹקוֹמַיהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין בְּיֶשְׁנָהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת מִתְּחִילָּה וְעַד סוֹף, וּבְדִיהַב לַהּ?
human_translation: And what forces Reish Lakish to establish the mishna in that a wage is from the beginning to end, and where he gave her
llm_translation: And what is the difficulty that Reish Lakish expounded to the Mishnah in its place regarding renting from the beginning to the end, and with what?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ, מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״עַל מְנָת״? נִיתְנֵי ״בִּשְׂכַר״, אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כֹּל ״עַל מְנָת״ הֵיכָא דִּיהַב לַהּ הוּא.
human_translation: Rava said the mishna was difficult for Why does specifically teach: On the condition? Let him teach: By value, Rather, conclude from any On the condition, where he has given her
llm_translation: Rava said: The Mishnah is stringent with it, what is the meaning of teaching "on condition"? It should have taught "for payment," rather learn from it: wherever "on condition" is stated, it is where he gave it to her.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה אַבָּא״, רָצָה הָאָב – מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מֵת הָאָב – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מֵת הַבֵּן – מְלַמְּדִין הָאָב לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה.
human_translation: On the condition that father will want father wants she is betrothed; but if not, she is not betrothed. the father dies, she is betrothed, the son dies, one instructs the father to say that he does not want
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "On the condition that Abba will consent." If the father consents, she is betrothed; if not, she is not betrothed. If the father dies, she is betrothed. If the son dies, the father teaches to say that he does not consent.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה אַבָּא״? אִילֵּימָא עַד דְּאָמַר אַבָּא ״אִין״, אֵימָא מְצִיעֲתָא: מֵת הָאָב – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וְהָא לָא אֲמַר ״אִין״! אֶלָּא:
human_translation: What On the condition that father will want If we say until father says yes, say the middle clause the father dies, she is betrothed. But he did not say yes, Rather,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "on condition that Abba will agree"? If you say it is until Abba says "no," then what is the proposal? If the father dies - she is betrothed, but did he not say "no"! Rather:

hebrew_text: עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּשְׁתּוֹק אַבָּא. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: מֵת הַבֵּן – מְלַמְּדִין אֶת הָאָב לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה. אַמַּאי? וְהָא שְׁתֵיק! אֶלָּא אֲמַר לַהּ ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא יְמַחֶה אַבָּא״.
human_translation: On the condition that father will remain silent say the last clause the son died, one instructs the father to say that he does not want Why he remained silent Rather, he said to her: On the condition that father will not object
llm_translation: In order that Abba should be silent. Say the latter part: If the son dies - they teach the father to say that he does not want. Why? But he is silent! Rather, he said to her, "In order that Abba should not erase."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא בְּחַד טַעְמָא וּמְצִיעֲתָא וְסֵיפָא בְּחַד טַעְמָא! אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אִין. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִדְרַבִּי יַנַּאי דָּחֲקִינַן וּמוֹקְמִינַן מַתְנִיתִין בִּתְרֵי טַעֲמֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּחַד תַּנָּא וְלָא מוֹקְמִינַן בִּתְרֵי תַּנָּאֵי וּבְחַד טַעְמָא.
human_translation: the first clause one reason, and the middle clause and last clause one reason? Rabbi Yannai said: Yes, Reish Lakish said: Conclude from according to of Rabbi Yannai one forces a mishna following two reasons, and in accordance with of one tanna , rather than establishing two tanna’im and one reason.
llm_translation: The beginning with one reason and the middle with a different reason, and the end with one reason! Rabbi Yannai said: No. Reish Lakish said: Learn from it regarding Rabbi Yannai that we are stringent and establish Mishnayot with two reasons, and in the matter of one Tanna, and we do not establish with two Tannaim and with one reason.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם חַד טַעְמָא הוּא, וּמַאי ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה אַבָּא״ – עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא יְמַחֶה אַבָּא מִכָּאן וְעַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ami said: Actually, is one reason, and what On the condition that father wants On the condition that father will not object from now and until thirty days
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ami said: Always one reason it is, and what is "on condition that Abba will be pleased" - on condition that Abba will not erase from here until thirty days.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״קִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ לְמִי קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ״, וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר ״אֲנִי קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ״ – נֶאֱמָן. זֶה אָמַר ״אֲנִי קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ״ וְזֶה אָמַר ״אֲנִי קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ״ – שְׁנֵיהֶם נוֹתְנִים גֵּט. וְאִם רָצוּ – אֶחָד נוֹתֵן גֵּט, וְאֶחָד כּוֹנֵס.
human_translation: I betrothed my daughter but I do not know to whom I betrothed her, and one came and said: I betrothed her, deemed credible. this said: I betrothed her, and that said: I betrothed her, both give a bill of divorce And if they desire, one gives a bill of divorce and one may marry
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "I have sanctified my daughter, and I do not know to whom I have sanctified her." And one comes and says, "I have sanctified her" - he is believed. This one said, "I have sanctified her," and that one said, "I have sanctified her" - both of them give a bill of divorce. And if they wish, one gives the bill of divorce, and one collects.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: – נֶאֱמָן לִיתֵּן גֵּט, וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן לִכְנוֹס. נֶאֱמָן לִיתֵּן גֵּט, אֵין אָדָם חוֹטֵא וְלֹא לוֹ. וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן לִכְנוֹס? אֵימָא יִצְרוֹ תּוֹקְפוֹ.
human_translation: Rav says: deemed credible may give a bill of divorce, but not deemed credible to marry deemed credible to give a bill of divorce, a person sins only for his own But he is not deemed credible to marry say his inclination overcome him,
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav: - Trustworthy to give a get, and not trustworthy to marry. Trustworthy to give a get, a person does not sin and not him. And not trustworthy to marry? Say his inclination is overpowering him.

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אַף נֶאֱמָן לִכְנוֹס. וּמוֹדֶה רַב אַסִּי בְּאוֹמֶרֶת ״נִתְקַדַּשְׁתִּי וְאֵינִי יוֹדַעַת לְמִי נִתְקַדַּשְׁתִּי״ וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר ״קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ״ שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱמָן לִכְנוֹס.
human_translation: Rav Asi says: He deemed credible even to marry And Rav Asi concedes in who says: I became betrothed but I do not know to whom I became betrothed, and one came and said: I betrothed her, that he is not deemed credible to marry her.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: Even trustworthy to enter. And Rav Assi concedes in saying, "I have sanctified myself, and I do not know to whom I have sanctified myself." And one comes and says, "I have sanctified her," he is not trustworthy to enter.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: רָצוּ – אֶחָד נוֹתֵן גֵּט וְאֶחָד כּוֹנֵס, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב! אָמַר לְךָ רַב: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא אַחֵר בַּהֲדֵיהּ – אִירְתוֹתֵי מִירְתַת.
human_translation: We learned they desire, one gives a bill of divorce and one may marry a conclusive refutation of Rav, Rav said to you: There, it is different, as, since there is another with him he is afraid
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If they both want - one gives a bill of divorce and one collects, the cleverness of Rav! Rav said to you: It is different there, since there is another one with him - his intentions are different.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב אַסִּי: קִידַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ לְמִי קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ, וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר קִידַּשְׁתִּיהָ – אַף נֶאֱמָן לִכְנוֹס. כְּנָסָהּ וּבָא אַחֵר וְאָמַר אֲנִי קִדַּשְׁתִּיהָ – לֹא כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ לְאוֹסְרָהּ עָלָיו.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Asi: I have betrothed my daughter but I do not know to whom I betrothed her, and one came and said: I betrothed her, deemed credible even to marry married her, and another came and said: I betrothed her, it is not within power to prohibit her to
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Assi: "I have betrothed my daughter, and I do not know to whom I have betrothed her." And one came and said, "I have betrothed her" - he is believed to enter. He entered, and another came and said, "I have betrothed her" - not everyone is believed to forbid her upon him.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה ״נִתְקַדַּשְׁתִּי וְאֵינִי יוֹדַעַת לְמִי נִתְקַדַּשְׁתִּי״ וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר ״אֲנִי קִידַּשְׁתִּי״ – אֵין נֶאֱמָן לִכְנוֹס. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא מְחַפָּה עָלָיו.
human_translation: a woman who said: I became betrothed but I do not know to whom I became betrothed, and one came and said: I betrothed not deemed credible to marry Because she is protecting him.
llm_translation: The woman who said, "I am betrothed and I do not know to whom I am betrothed," and one comes and says, "I have betrothed her" - he is not believed to enter into marriage with her, because she is concealing the truth about him.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לִסְקוֹל עַל יָדוֹ? רַב אָמַר: אֵין סוֹקְלִין. וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: סוֹקְלִין.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before what is with regard to stoning based on Rav says does not stone and Rav Asi says stones
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: What about stoning him? Rav said: We do not stone. And Rav Assi said: We stone.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: אֵין סוֹקְלִין, כִּי הֵימְנֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְאָב, לְאִיסּוּרָא, לִקְטָלָא לָא הֵימְנֵיהּ. רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: סוֹקְלִין, לְכוּלַּהּ מִילְּתֵיהּ הֵימְנֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְאָב. אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: וּמוֹדֵינָא בְּאוֹמֶרֶת ״נִתְקַדַּשְׁתִּי״, שֶׁאֵין סוֹקְלִים.
human_translation: Rav said does not stone when the Merciful One deems the father credible to the prohibition with regard to killing did not deem him credible. Rav Asi said: stones the Merciful One deems the father credible with regard to all matters, Rav Asi says: And I concede of says: I became betrothed, that does not stone
llm_translation: Rav said: One does not stone, for the Merciful One is compassionate towards a father, for a prohibition, for a killing - He is not compassionate towards it. Rav Assi said: One stones, for in all its matters the Merciful One is compassionate towards a father. Rav Assi said: And we establish it in the case of saying "I have sanctified myself," that one does not stone.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הָנֵי שְׁמַעְתָּתָא דִּידִי מְרַפְּסָן אִיגָּרֵי. הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאִם בָּא לִכְנוֹס כּוֹנֵס – אָמַרְתָּ סוֹקְלִים, מְקוֹם שֶׁאִם בָּא לִכְנוֹס אֵין כּוֹנֵס – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁסּוֹקְלִין?
human_translation: And Rav Asi says: These halakhot of mine are roof breakers, Now, in a case where where if came to marry may marry you say stones is it not logical that stone a case if came to marry he may not marry
llm_translation: And Rav Assi said: Those rumors of mine are spread on the roofs. Now, what about a place where if one comes to gather, he gathers - you say they are stoning; a place where if one comes to gather, he does not gather - is it not the law that they are not stoning?

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, לְאָב הֵימְנֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא, לְדִידַהּ לָא הֵימְנַהּ.
human_translation: But is not so, The Merciful One deems credible a father did not deem her, credible
llm_translation: And not she, to father believed her, the Merciful One, to us not believed her.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה – אֵין סוֹקְלִין. וְאַזְדָּא רַב חִסְדָּא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: ״בְּנִי זֶה בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד״, ״בִּתִּי זוֹ בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד״ – נֶאֱמָן לְקׇרְבָּן, אֲבָל לֹא לְמַכּוֹת וְלֹא לָעוֹנָשִׁין.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Both this and that does not stone And Rav Ḥisda follows his reasoning, as Rav Ḥisda says This son of mine is nine years and one day old, This daughter of mine is three years and one day old, deemed credible with regard to an offering but not with regard to lashes and not with regard to punishments.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "One this and one this - they are not stoned." And Rav Ḥisda supported his reasoning, for Rav Ḥisda said: "My son, this one, is nine years and one day old, and 'My daughter, this one, is three years and one day old' - they are fit for a sacrifice, but not for lashes and not for punishments."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: ״בְּנִי זֶה בֶּן שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד״ ״בִּתִּי זוֹ בַּת שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד״ –
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda This son of mine is thirteen years and one day old, This daughter of mine is twelve years and one day old,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ḥisda: "My son, this one, is a son of thirteen years and one day." "My daughter, this one, is a daughter of twelve years and one day."

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמָן לִנְדָרִים, וְלַחֲרָמִים, וּלְהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת וְלַעֲרָכִים, אֲבָל לֹא לְמַכּוֹת וְלָעוֹנָשִׁין.
human_translation: deemed credible with regard to vows, and with regard to dedications, with regard to consecrations and with regard to valuations, But not with regard to lashes or with regard to punishments
llm_translation: Faithful for vows, and for things devoted, and for consecrated things, and for valuations, but not for blows and punishments.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״קִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי״, ״קִדַּשְׁתִּיהָ וְגֵרַשְׁתִּיהָ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה״, וַהֲרֵי הִיא קְטַנָּה – נֶאֱמָן. ״קִדַּשְׁתִּיהָ וְגֵרַשְׁתִּיהָ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה״, וַהֲרֵי הִיא גְּדוֹלָה – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. נִשְׁבֵּית וּפְדִיתִיהָ, בֵּין שֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה בֵּין שֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: I betrothed my daughter I betrothed her and her divorce when she was a minor girl, and she is a minor girl deemed credible I betrothed her and her divorce when she was a minor, and she is an adult woman not deemed credible. She was taken captive and I redeemed her, he is not deemed credible whether she was a minor girl or an adult woman.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "I have sanctified my daughter," "I have sanctified her and divorced her when she is a minor," and she is indeed a minor - he is believed. "I have sanctified her and divorced her when she is a minor," and she is actually an adult - he is not believed. If he marries her and then redeems her, whether she is a minor or an adult - he is not believed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? רֵישָׁא בִּידֵיהּ, סֵיפָא לָאו בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? the first clause in his power the latter clause not in his power
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? The beginning is in her hand, the end is not in her hand.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי בְּיָדוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאָהּ לְחָלָל, דְּקָא פָסְלַהּ מִכְּהוּנָּה!
human_translation: But not But in his power to marry to a ḥalal , which disqualifies her from the priesthood.
llm_translation: And no? But behold, it is in his power to render it invalid, for he is disqualifying it from the priesthood!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בֶּן יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִקְוֵה טׇהֳרָה לַחֲלָלִין.
human_translation: This not difficult, is in accordance with Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda, who says: The daughters of Israelites a ritual bath of purity for individuals of ḥalal status.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: The matter is not difficult, as Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda said: "The daughters of Israel establish purity for the unconsecrated."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי בְּיָדוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאָהּ לְמַמְזֵר! כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: But in power to marry her to a mamzer , in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: Betrothal does not take effect with is liable a prohibition
llm_translation: Behold, it is in his power to marry her off to a mamzer! Like Rabbi Akiva who said: Betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי בְּיָדוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאָהּ אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּכְרַבִּי סִימַאי, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר: מִן הַכֹּל עוֹשֶׂה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַמְזֵר, חוּץ מֵאַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״לֹא יִקָּח... וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל״: – חִלּוּלִים עוֹשֶׂה, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה מַמְזֵרִים.
human_translation: But in power to marry her a widow to a High Priest, and in accordance with Rabbi Simai, as it is taught Rabbi Simai says: In all Rabbi Akiva deems a mamzer , apart from a widow to a High Priest, as the Torah stated shall he not take…and he shall not profane [ yeḥallel ] He renders ḥalalim but he does not render mamzerim .
llm_translation: Behold in his hand to marry widow to high priest, and like Rabbi Simai, as it was taught, Rabbi Simai says: Rabbi Akiva does everything except for a mamzer, except for a widow to a high priest, for the Torah said: "He shall not take... nor profane": - he commits profanations, but does not commit mamzerim.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב, דְּאָמַר: בּוֹאוּ וְנִצְוַוח עַל עֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בִּיאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Yeshevav, who says: Come, let us shout at Akiva ben Yosef, who would say: every a Jew may not engage in intercourse the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yeshivav said: "Come, let us protest against Akiva ben Yosef, who used to say: 'Anyone who does not have lineage in Israel is a mamzer.'"

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב אִי לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִטַּעְמָא דְּרַבִּי סִימַאי קָאָתֵי, הֲרֵי בְּיָדוֹ לְהַשִּׂיאָהּ לְחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: This work out well according to Rabbi Yeshevav if a reasoning of his own, well, But if he comes to exclude the reason of Rabbi Simai, in power to marry her to those liable for positive
llm_translation: The Gemara left it for Rabbi Yeshivav, whether according to his own reasoning - it is good. Rather, if it is to be inferred from the reasoning of Rabbi Simai, he is able to bring it to those liable for a positive commandment!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי וְתִסְבְּרַאּ רֵישָׁא מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ הוּא? נְהִי דִּבְיָדוֹ לְקַדְּשָׁהּ, בְּיָדוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ? וְעוֹד, אִילּוּ אֲמַר הַאי דְּלָא נִיחָא [לֵיהּ] בְּגַוַּהּ מִי מָצֵי מְקַדֵּשׁ [לַהּ] נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: And you understand the first clause is because in his power? Although in his power to betroth her, in his power to divorce her? And furthermore, if this one, says that not satisfactory to her, can betroth her to him against his will?
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, and does the first part of the Mishnah hold that it is in his hand? Even if it is in his hand to sanctify her, is it in his hand to divorce her? Furthermore, if he were to say that if it is not pleasing to him in her appearance, can he sanctify her and then divorce her immediately?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: רֵישָׁא רַחֲמָנָא הֵימְנֵיהּ, כְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן לְאָב שֶׁנֶּאֱמָן לֶאֱסוֹר אֶת בִּתּוֹ מִן הַתּוֹרָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת בִּתִּי נָתַתִּי לָאִישׁ הַזֶּה״, ״לָאִישׁ״ – אֲסָרָהּ, ״הַזֶּה״ – הִתִּירָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi says: the first clause the Merciful One believes him, in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says Rav says: From where a father is deemed credible to render his daughter forbidden by Torah law? As it is stated: “I gave my daughter to this man [ la’ish hazzeh ]” to “the man [ la’ish ],” he rendered her forbidden “this [ hazzeh ],” he rendered her permitted
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: The beginning, the Merciful One trusted him, like Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that a father is trusted to prohibit his daughter in marriage from the Torah? As it is stated: "I have given my daughter to this man," "to this man" - he prohibited her, "this" - he permitted her.

hebrew_text: בְּנִישּׂוּאִין הֵימְנֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְאָב, בִּשְׁבוּיָיה לָא הֵימְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Merciful One deems the father credible with regard to marriage, does not deem him credible with regard to a captive.
llm_translation: In matters of marriage, the Torah is more lenient towards the father, but in matters of captivity, it is not lenient towards him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁאָמַר בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָתוֹ ״יֵשׁ לִי בָּנִים״ – נֶאֱמָן. ״יֵשׁ לִי אַחִים״ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: one who said at the time of his death: I have children, deemed credible. I have brothers, not deemed credible.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who, at the time of his death, said, "I have sons" - he is believed. "I have brothers" - he is not believed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַלְמָא נֶאֱמָן לְהַתִּיר וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן לֶאֱסוֹר. נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן,
human_translation: Apparently, is deemed credible to render permitted but he is not deemed credible to render forbidden. we say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Natan?
llm_translation: Gemara: "It is reliable to permit, but it is not reliable to prohibit." This is as we learned in the Mishnah, not like Rabbi Natan,

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: בִּשְׁעַת קִידּוּשִׁין אָמַר יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים, בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָה אָמַר אֵין לוֹ בָּנִים, בִּשְׁעַת קִידּוּשִׁין אָמַר אֵין לוֹ אַחִים, בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָה אָמַר יֵשׁ לוֹ אַחִים – נֶאֱמָן לְהַתִּיר וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן לֶאֱסוֹר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אַף נֶאֱמָן לֶאֱסוֹר.
