human_translation: As it is taught said at the time of betrothal he has children, at the time of death he said he does not have children; said at the time of betrothal he does not have brothers, at the time of death he said he has brothers, deemed credible to render permitted, but he is not deemed credible to render forbidden the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Natan says: deemed credible even to render forbidden.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: At the time of betrothal, he said he has sons; at the time of death, he said he has no sons. At the time of betrothal, he said he has no brothers; at the time of death, he said he has brothers - he is believed to permit but not believed to prohibit, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Nathan says: He is even believed to prohibit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּבִשְׁעַת מִיתָה קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ, אֵימָא קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלָאו כָּל דְּכֵן הוּא? הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה הָתָם דְּקָא מַרַע לֵיהּ לְדִבּוּרֵיהּ, אָמְרַתְּ קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר, מַתְנִיתִין, דְּלָא קָא מַרַע לֵיהּ לְדִבּוּרֵיהּ, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: Rava says: There, it is different, since at the time of death he retracted say he spoke the truth. Abaye said to him: And isn’t it all the more so Now if there, where weakens his statement, you say he spoke the truth, the mishna, where does not weaken his statement, is it not all the more so
llm_translation: Rava said: The case there is different, since at the time of death he retracted from it, perhaps he meant to say "a bowstring." Abaye said to him: But is it not all the same? Now, there, where he is causing harm with his words, you say he meant to say "a bowstring." In the Mishnah, where he is not causing harm with his words, all the more so?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא מוּחְזָק לַן בְּאַחֵי וְלָא מוּחְזָק לַן בִּבְנֵי, דְּאָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מוּחְזָק לַן בִּבְנֵי וְלָא בְּאַחֵי אָמַר: ״יֵשׁ לִי בָּנִים״ – נֶאֱמָן, ״יֵשׁ לִי אַחִים״ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. לָאו כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ דְּאָסַר לַהּ אַכּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא. בָּרַיְיתָא
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: The mishna where we have a presumptive status with regard to brothers and we not have a presumptive status with regard to children. As we say: Since we not presumptive status with regard to either children or brothers, he said: I have children, deemed credible, I have brothers, not deemed credible. It is not in his to render her forbidden to everyone, baraita
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: The Mishnah that is not firmly established for us with brothers but is firmly established for us with sons, for we say: Since it is not firmly established for us with brothers and not with sons, he said: "I have sons" – he is believed, "I have brothers" – he is not believed. Not all like its kind that forbids her to eat regular food. Baraita.

hebrew_text: דְּמוּחְזָק לַן בְּאַחֵי וְלָא מוּחְזָק לַן בִּבְנֵי, דְּאָמְרִינַן: ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״: מַאי קָאָמַר, לְמִיפְטְרַהּ מִיָּבָם? מָצֵי אֲמַר: פָּטַרְנָא לִךְ בְּגִיטָּא.
human_translation: where we have a presumptive status that brothers, but we do not have a presumptive status that children, As we say Why would I lie? what is he saying to exempt her from a yavam ? he can say I exempt you by a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: We are confident in our brothers but not confident in our sons, as we say: "What do I have to do with falsehood." What is it saying, to exempt her from yibum? You can say: We exempt you with a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי סָבַר: ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״ כִּי עֵדִים דָּמֵי, וְאָתוּ עֵדִים עָקְרִי חֲזָקָה. וְרַבִּי נָתָן סָבַר: ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״ כִּי חֲזָקָה דָּמֵי, לָא אַתְיָא חֲזָקָה וְעָקְרָה חֲזָקָה לִגְמָרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi maintains Why would I lie, considered like witnesses, and witnesses come and uproot a presumption. And Rabbi Natan maintains Why would I lie, considered like a presumption, a presumption cannot come and uproot presumption entirely.
llm_translation: Rabbi Savar: "What do I need to lie" for witnesses are like evidence, and witnesses come to uproot a presumption. And Rabbi Nathan Savar: "What do I need to lie" for a presumption is like evidence, a presumption does not come to completely uproot another presumption.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ סְתָם – אֵין הַבּוֹגְרוֹת בַּכְּלָל. מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי בָנוֹת מִשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וְאָמַר: ״קִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי הַגְּדוֹלָה, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת, אוֹ גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת, אוֹ קְטַנָּה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת שֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה מִן הַגְּדוֹלוֹת שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת״ – כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרוֹת חוּץ מִן הַקְּטַנָּה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן מוּתָּרוֹת, חוּץ מִן הַגְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת.
human_translation: one who betroths his daughter without specification, the grown women are not included one who has two groups daughters from two women, and he said: I betrothed my elder daughter but I do not know if the eldest of the older or the eldest of the younger or the youngest of the older who is older than the eldest of the younger all are forbidden, except for the youngest of the younger the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: they are all permitted except for the eldest of the older
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths his daughter implicitly - the eldest daughters are not included. If one has two daughters from two wives, and he says, "I have betrothed my eldest daughter, and I do not know if she is the eldest among the eldest, or the eldest among the youngest, or the youngest among the eldest, who is greater than the greatest among the youngest" - all are forbidden except for the youngest among the youngest, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: all are permitted, except for the eldest among the eldest.

hebrew_text: ״קִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי הַקְּטַנָּה, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם קְטַנָּה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת, אוֹ קְטַנָּה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת, אוֹ גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת שֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה מִן הַקְּטַנּוֹת שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת״ – כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרוֹת חוּץ מִן הַגְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן מוּתָּרוֹת, חוּץ מִן הַקְּטַנָּה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת.
human_translation: I betrothed my younger daughter, but I do not know if the youngest of the younger or the youngest of the older or the eldest of the younger who is younger than the youngest of the older they are all forbidden, except for the eldest of the older the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: They are all permitted except for the youngest of the younger
llm_translation: "I have consecrated my youngest daughter, and I do not know if she is the youngest among the young, or the youngest among the adults, or the oldest among the young, which would make her younger than the youngest among the adults." - All of them are forbidden except for the oldest among the adults, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: All of them are permitted except for the youngest among the young.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא קְטַנּוֹת בַּכְּלָל,
human_translation: minor girls are included
llm_translation: "Gema, ha katannot baklal," "Gema, these are the small ones included."

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: קִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִים לְבִיאָה, הָווּ קִידּוּשִׁין! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא גְּדוֹלָה וּקְטַנָּה.
human_translation: learn from that betrothal that is not given to consummation, is betrothal Here we are dealing with which there are only an adult woman and a minor girl.
llm_translation: You heard from her: Kiddushin that are not designated for marital relations, are they Kiddushin! Here, with what are we dealing? When there is only an adult and a minor.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״בּוֹגְרוֹת״ קָתָנֵי! מַאי בּוֹגְרוֹת – בּוֹגְרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: But teaches: Grown women, What grown women? grown women in general.
llm_translation: And this, "bogerot" it teaches! What is "bogerot" - the "bogerot" of the world.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, בּוֹגְרוֹת מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּשַׁוִּיתֵיהּ שָׁלִיחַ, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי מְקַבֵּל קִידּוּשֵׁי אַדַּעְתָּא דִידַהּ קָא מְקַבֵּל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִידֵּי דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה מִינֵּיהּ, וְעָבֵיד מִידֵּי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: is obvious, what are grown women doing Here we are dealing with where appointed agent Lest you say when accepts betrothal he accepts with in mind, teaches us a person does not put aside a matter from which he derives benefit, and perform a matter from which he does not derive benefit,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What is the case of "Peshita," what is their function? Here, what are we dealing with? That he appointed a messenger. What might you say? When one accepts the sanctification of his knowledge, he is accepting his own sanctification. This teaches us: A person does not leave the benefit that he has for the benefit that he does not have.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ: ״קִדּוּשַׁיי לָךְ״? אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִצְוָה דְּרַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ וְעָבֵיד מִצְוָה דְּלָא רַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Are we not dealing where says to him: my betrothal to you? Even so, a person does not put aside a mitzva that is imposed upon him, to perform a mitzva that is not imposed upon him,
llm_translation: We are dealing with one who said to him: "My sanctity to you"? Even so, a person should not forsake a commandment that is easily performed and instead do a commandment that is not easily performed.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי בָנוֹת. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא זוּטְרָא מִינַּהּ לְהָךְ גְּדוֹלָה קָרֵי לַהּ,
human_translation: one who has two groups of daughters And necessary as had taught us first in this Rabbi Meir says that since there is one younger than her, calls any Elder.
llm_translation: One who has two daughters. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear before him, in that case Rabbi Meir said, since there is a smaller one from her to the larger one, he calls her.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּהָא, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דִּ״קְטַנָּה״ – לְהָךְ קְטַנָּה דְּכוּלְּהוּ קָרֵי לַהּ. וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: But in this say he concedes to Rabbi Yosei calls that youngest of all: Younger, And if was stated with regard to this Rabbi Yosei says this But in that say he concedes to Rabbi Meir. necessary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But in this case, say they agree with Rabbi Yosei that "Ketanah" - for this small one, they call her. And if it was stated in this case, in this case Rabbi Yosei said, but in that case, say they agree with Rabbi Meir, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: מַחֵית אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִסְפֵיקָא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: לָא מַחֵית אִינִישׁ לִסְפֵיקָא. וְהָאִיפְכָּא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: הַנּוֹדֵר ״עַד הַפֶּסַח״ – אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ, ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא פֶּסַח״ – אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא,
human_translation: Is this to say that Rabbi Meir maintains: A person places himself in uncertainty, and Rabbi Yosei maintains a person does not place himself in uncertainty, But haven’t we learned the opposite as we learned one takes a vow until Passover, it is forbidden until arrives. Until it will be it is forbidden until ends.
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Meir, he holds: a person may endanger himself for a doubt, while Rabbi Yosei holds: a person may not endanger himself for a doubt. And the opposite we have heard for them, as we learned: one who vows "until Pesach" – it is forbidden until it arrives, "until there is Pesach" – it is forbidden until it departs.

hebrew_text: ״עַד פְּנֵי פֶסַח״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא.
human_translation: Until before Passover, Rabbi Meir says: forbidden until arrives. Rabbi Yosei says: until it ends.
llm_translation: "Until the face of Pesach" - Rabbi Meir says: forbidden until it arrives, Rabbi Yosei says: until it departs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אַבְדִּימִי אָמַר רַב: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. וְהָתַנְיָא: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁזְּמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ, וְאָמַר: ״עַד פְּנֵי״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיָּצָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Avdimi says Rav says: The opinions is reversed, And it is taught this is the principle: any that has a fixed time, and one said: Until before Rabbi Meir says until ends; Rabbi Yosei says: Until it arrives.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Avdimi said in the name of Rav: Muḥlephet HaShitah. And it was taught in a Baraita: This is the principle: whenever his appointed time has arrived, and he said, "until the face" – Rabbi Meir says: until he exits, Rabbi Yosei says: until he arrives.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי בָנוֹת, אֲבָל בְּכַת אַחַת – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל גְּדוֹלָה מַמָּשׁ, קְטַנָּה מַמָּשׁ, אֶמְצָעִית בִּשְׁמָהּ קָרֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: dispute to two groups of girls, But with regard to one group, everyone agrees actual eldest actual youngest middle he calls her by her name.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The dispute is in two groups of daughters, but in one group - everyone agrees that the oldest is truly the oldest, the youngest is truly the youngest, and the one in the middle is called by her name.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה,
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Abaye: If that is so,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Matna to Abbaye: Rather, from now on,

hebrew_text: אֶמְצָעִית שֶׁבְּכַת שְׁנִיָּה תִּשְׁתְּרֵי! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא גְּדוֹלָה וּקְטַנָּה.
human_translation: the middle of the second group should be permitted, Here we are dealing with where there are only an adult woman and a minor girl,
llm_translation: Middle of a wall of a courtyard two! Here with what we are dealing, with that there is only large and small.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּאִיכָּא, לִיתְנְיַיהּ. וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֶמְצָעִית שֶׁבְּכַת רִאשׁוֹנָה, דְּוַדַּאי סְפֵיקָא וַאֲסִירָא לֵיהּ, מִי קָתָנֵי לַהּ?
human_translation: And so too, it is reasonable as, if it is so, that there is let teach her But according to your reasoning, the middle one of the first group is definitely uncertainty and is forbidden to does teach her?
llm_translation: And thus it is fitting to conclude, for if it is said that there is, let him present it. And according to your reasoning, the middle one in the line of the first, for surely it is doubtful and forbidden for him, who would teach it to him?

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם תַּנָּא קְטַנָּה דִּידַהּ לְאִיסּוּרָא, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְהָךְ דְּקַשִּׁישָׁא מִינַּהּ,
human_translation: How can be compared? There it taught younger than for a prohibition, and the same is true of this who is older than
llm_translation: So now?! There, a Tanna taught: A small jug of hers for her prohibition, and the same to strike a hard one from her.

hebrew_text: הָכָא, אִם אִיתָא דְּאִיכָּא – נִיתְנְיַיהּ.
human_translation: here, if it is so that there is should teach her,
llm_translation: Here, if it is said that there is - it is given to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: הָא פֶּסַח, דְּכִי כַת אַחַת דָּמֵי, וּפְלִיגִי!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: Passover, which is comparable to one group and disagree
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua to Rava: "This Passover, for it is like one group of blood, and they argue!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם בְּלִישָּׁנָא דְעָלְמָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: ״עַד פְּנֵי הַפֶּסַח״ – עַד קַמֵּי פִיסְחָא, וּמָר סָבַר: עַד דְּמִיפְּנֵי פִּיסְחָא.
human_translation: said to him: There they disagree with regard to the general language. Sage, holds Until before Passover, Until before Passover, and Sage, holds until Passover passes
llm_translation: He said to him: There, in the world's language, they disagree. The Master thought: "Until the face of the Passover" - until the eve of Passover, and the Master thought: until the eve of Passover.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״קִדַּשְׁתִּיךְ״ וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״לֹא קִדַּשְׁתַּנִי״ – הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו. הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״קִדַּשְׁתַּנִי״ וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא קִדַּשְׁתִּיךְ״ – הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: one who says to a woman: I betrothed you, and she says: You did not betroth me, he is forbidden to her relatives, And she is permitted to his relatives, she says: You betrothed me, and he says: I did not betroth you, he is permitted to her relatives and she is forbidden to his relatives
llm_translation: The one who says to a woman, "I have sanctified you," and she says, "You have not sanctified me" - he is forbidden to her relatives, and she is permitted to his relatives. She says, "You have sanctified me," and he says, "You have not sanctified me" - he is permitted to her relatives, and she is forbidden to his relatives.

hebrew_text: ״קִידַּשְׁתִּיךְ״ וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא קִידַּשְׁתָּ אֶלָּא בִּתִּי״ – הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת גְּדוֹלָה וּגְדוֹלָה מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו. הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת קְטַנָּה וּקְטַנָּה מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: I betrothed you, and she says: You betrothed only my daughter, he is forbidden to the relatives of the older and the older is permitted to his relatives. He is permitted to the relatives of the younger and the younger is permitted to his relatives,
llm_translation: "״Kiddashtich״ and she says "Lo kiddashta ela bitti" - it is prohibited with close relatives who are major, and major relatives are permitted with his close relatives. It is permitted with minor close relatives, and minor relatives are permitted with his close relatives."

hebrew_text: ״קִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּךְ״ וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא קִדַּשְׁתָּ אֶלָּא אוֹתִי״ – הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת קְטַנָּה וּקְטַנָּה מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו. הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת גְּדוֹלָה וּגְדוֹלָה אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: I betrothed your daughter, and she, says: You betrothed only me, he is forbidden to the relatives of the younger and the younger is permitted to his relatives; he is permitted to the relatives of the older and the older is forbidden to his relatives.
llm_translation: "I have sanctified my daughter" and she says "You have not sanctified except me" - he is forbidden with his close relatives who are minors, and each minor is permitted with his close relatives. He is permitted with his close relatives who are adults, and each adult is forbidden with his close relatives.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה קִדַּשְׁתִּיךְ וְכוּ׳. וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּיהּ דִּידֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּגַבְרָא לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ וּמִיקְּרֵי אָמַר.
human_translation: one who says to a woman: I betrothed you, And necessary As, had taught us with regard to himself, because a man does not care he happens to say
llm_translation: The one who says to a woman, "I have sanctified you," etc. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear his own words from him, because a man is not particular about himself, and he may have said.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִיהִי, אֵימָא: אִי לָאו דְּקִים לַהּ בְּדִיבּוּרַהּ, לָא הֲוָת אָמְרָה, וְלִיתְּסַר אִיהוּ בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But she say if her statement was not certain to her she would not have said and he should be forbidden to her relatives teaches us
llm_translation: But Iyehi, say: If it were not established for her in her speech, she would not have said, and he would not have been removed from her relatives, he would have listened to us.

hebrew_text: ״קִידַּשְׁתִּיךְ״ וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת וְכוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הֵימְנֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְאָב, מִדְּרַבָּנַן הֵימְנוּהָ לְדִידַהּ וְתִיתְּסַר בְּרַתַּהּ בְּדִיבּוּרַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: I betrothed you, and she says: Why do I this as well? was necessary enter your mind to say: by Torah law, the Merciful One deems credible a father deem credible by rabbinic law, and her daughter should be forbidden on her statement. teaches us
llm_translation: "״I have sanctified you״ and she says and so forth. This, why do I need it? It is necessary, for your mind to say: From the Torah, the Merciful One trusted her to the father, from the Rabbis, they trusted her to herself, and her daughter was removed by her speech, this is what we hear."

hebrew_text: ״קִידַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּךְ״ וְכוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא הָא, תְּנָא נָמֵי הָא.
human_translation: I betrothed your daughter, why do I this as well? Since taught this it also taught this
llm_translation: "I have sanctified your daughter" etc. This, what is it to me? As it was taught in a Baraita, this was also taught.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר: כּוֹפִין, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מְבַקְּשִׁין. אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרֵישָׁא – לָאו ״כּוֹפִין״ אִיכָּא וְלָא ״מְבַקְּשִׁין״ אִיכָּא! אֶלָּא אַסֵּיפָא.
human_translation: It was stated Rav says: forces and Shmuel says: requests With regard to which If we say to the first clause, no forces, is nor is requests, Rather, to the latter clause
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said: "We force," and Shmuel said: "We request." What is the reason? If you say the first clause - there is "forcing" and not "requesting"! Rather, the latter clause.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״מְבַקְּשִׁין״ – לְחַיֵּי, אֶלָּא ״כּוֹפִין״ אַמַּאי?! אָמַר: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּאִיתְּסַר בְּקָרִיבֶיהָ.
human_translation: Granted, requests it is well. But why force say: It is not satisfactory for me to be forbidden to her relatives?
llm_translation: In truth, "seeking" - for life, rather "forcing" - why?! He said: It is not pleasing to me that it is prohibited in its vicinity.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: שְׁמַעְתָּתָא אַהֲדָדֵי אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנּוּ לִיתֵּן גֵּט. אָמַר רַב: אִם נָתַן גֵּט מֵעַצְמוֹ – כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לִיתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: Rather, halakhot were stated together, Shmuel says requests of him to give a bill of divorce. Rav says: If he gave a bill of divorce of his own accord, forces him to give marriage contract
llm_translation: Rather: You heard from Hadadei it was said, Shmuel said: They seek from him to give a bill of divorce. Rav said: If he gave a bill of divorce of his own accord - we force him to give a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כּוֹפִין וּמְבַקְּשִׁין. תַּרְתֵּי?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנּוּ לִיתֵּן גֵּט, וְאִם נָתַן מֵעַצְמוֹ – כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לִיתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: It was also stated: Rav Aḥa bar Adda says Rav says, and some say Rav Aḥa bar Adda says Rav Hamnuna says Rav says: forces and requests two this is is saying: requests of him to give a bill of divorce, and if he gave a bill of divorce of his own accord forces him to give her marriage contract.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Acha bar Adda said in the name of Rav, and some say he said in the name of Rav Acha bar Adda who said in the name of Rav Hamnuna said in the name of Rav: "We compel and request." Two things?! This is what he meant: We request from him to give a bill of divorce, and if he gives it willingly - we compel him to give a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעֵד אֶחָד – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשָׁיו. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב יְהוּדָה: שְׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים, מַאי? אִין וְלָא וְרַפְיָא בִּידֵיהּ. אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעֵד אֶחָד – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשָׁיו, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: one who betroths with, one witness, one not be concerned that his betrothal raised a dilemma before Rav Yehuda: both concede what Yes and no, and uncertain to him. It was stated Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: one who betroths with one witness, one not be concerned that his betrothal and even if both concede
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: One who sanctifies on behalf of another - we are not concerned for his sanctifications. A contradiction was raised to Rav Yehudah from his own teachings: Both agree, what is the reason? There is no "and" and "Raphya" in his hands. It was stated: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: One who sanctifies on behalf of another - we are not concerned for his sanctifications, even if both agree.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״קִדַּשְׁתִּיךְ״ וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא קִדַּשְׁתַּנִי״ – הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו. אִי דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים – אַמַּאי מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו? וְאִי דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים – אַמַּאי אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ? אֶלָּא לָאו בְּעֵד אֶחָד!
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman one who says to a woman: I betrothed you, and she says: You did not betroth me, he is forbidden to her relatives and she is permitted to his relatives. If where there are witnesses, why she permitted to his relatives? And if there are no witnesses why he forbidden to her relatives Rather, is it not to one witness?
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: One who says to a woman, "I have sanctified you," and she says, "You have not sanctified me" - he is forbidden to her relatives, but she is permitted to his relatives. If there are witnesses - why is she permitted to his relatives? And if there are no witnesses - why is he forbidden to her relatives? Rather, it is not with one witness!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דַּאֲמַר לַהּ ״קִידַּשְׁתִּיךְ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי״, וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where he said to her: I betrothed you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, but they went overseas
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, if he said to her, "I have betrothed you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so," and they went to the country of the sea.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְלָנָה עִמּוֹ בְּפוּנְדְּקִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים – מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? וְאִי דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים – מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית הִלֵּל? אֶלָּא לָאו בְּעֵד אֶחָד!
human_translation: raised an objection to one divorces his wife, and she lodged with him in an inn, Beit Shammai say: She does not require a second bill of divorce from him, and Beit Hillel say: She requires a second bill of divorce from him. What are the circumstances If there are witnesses what is the reason that Beit Shammai If there are no witnesses, what is the reason that Beit Hillel Rather, is it not to one witness
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: One who divorces his wife and she is with him in Pundekia, Beit Shammai say: She does not need from him a second bill of divorce, and Beit Hillel say: She needs from him a second bill of divorce. What is the reason? If there are witnesses - what is the reasoning of Beit Shammai? And if there are no witnesses - what is the reasoning of Beit Hillel? Rather, is it not with one witness!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וּמוֹדִים בְּנִתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין שֶׁאֵין צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט שֵׁנִי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ עֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן – מָה לִי מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, מָה לִי מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause And concede with regard to who was divorced after betrothal that she does not require a second bill of divorce from him, due to he is not accustomed to her. And if it enters your mind one witness is deemed credible what to me after betrothal, what to me after marriage?
llm_translation: And to support your reasoning, say the following: And they agree regarding a woman who was divorced from betrothal that she does not require a second divorce document from him, because his heart is not arrogant towards her. And if you were to suggest that one witness is believed - what do I need from betrothal, what do I need from marriage?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא עֵדֵי יִחוּד וְלֵיכָּא עֵדֵי בִיאָה. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: לָא
human_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with where there are witnesses to seclusion, but there are no witnesses to intercourse. Beit Shammai hold: not
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with what? For example, where there are witnesses of betrothal but there are no witnesses of consummation. Beit Shammai hold: No.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִינַן הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי יִחוּד, הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי בִיאָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: אָמְרִינַן הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי יִחוּד, הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי בִיאָה. וּמוֹדִים וַדַּאי בְּנִתְגָּרְשָׁה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי יִחוּד הֵן הֵן עֵדֵי בִיאָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לִבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ.
human_translation: say: These are the witnesses of seclusion, these are the witnesses of intercourse. And Beit Hillel hold: We say these are the witnesses of seclusion, these are the witnesses of intercourse. And concede certainly in divorced from betrothal, that we do not say these are the witnesses of seclusion, these are the witnesses of intercourse, because he is not accustomed to her.
llm_translation: We say: Yes, yes, they are witnesses of betrothal, they are witnesses of consummation. And Beit Hillel holds: We say: Yes, yes, they are witnesses of betrothal, they are witnesses of consummation. And they certainly agree that if she was divorced from the betrothal, for we do not say: Yes, yes, they are witnesses of betrothal, they are witnesses of consummation, because his heart is not arrogant towards her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְרַב: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעֵד אֶחָד – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשָׁיו, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעֵד אֶחָד, בֵּי דִינָא רַבָּה אָמְרִי: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשָׁיו. מַאן בֵּי דִינָא רַבָּה? רַב. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעֵד אֶחָד, בֵּי דִינָא רַבָּה אָמְרִי: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשָׁיו. מַאן בֵּי דִינָא רַבָּה – רַבִּי.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta says in the name of Rav: one who betroths with one witness, one not be concerned that his betrothal and even if both concede Rabba bar Rav Huna says: one who betroths with one witness, the Great Court says one not be concerned that his betrothal Who the Great Court? Rav. And there are who say Rabba bar Rav Huna said Rav said: one who betroths with one witness, the Great Court says one not be concerned that his betrothal Who the Great Court? Rabbi
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav: One who sanctifies Shabbat on behalf of another - we are not concerned for his sanctification, and even if both parties agree. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: One who sanctifies Shabbat on behalf of another, in the Great Court they said: we are not concerned for his sanctification. Who are the Great Court? Rav. And there are those who say: Rabbah bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who sanctifies Shabbat on behalf of another, in the Great Court they said: we are not concerned for his sanctification. Who are the Great Court? Rabbi.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁבָּאוּ מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִשָּׁה עִמָּהֶם וַחֲבִילָה עִמָּהֶם, זֶה אוֹמֵר: זוֹ אִשְׁתִּי, וְזֶה עַבְדִּי, וְזוֹ חֲבִילָתִי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: זוֹ אִשְׁתִּי, וְזֶה עַבְדִּי, וְזוֹ חֲבִילָתִי. וְאִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת: אֵלּוּ שְׁנֵי עֲבָדַי, וַחֲבִילָה שֶׁלִּי – צְרִיכָה שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין, וְגוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מִן הַחֲבִילָה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami raises an objection two who came from overseas and a woman with them, and a bundle with them. This says: This is my wife, and this my slave, and this is my bundle. And this says: This is my wife, and this my slave, and this is my bundle. And the woman says: These are my two slaves and this is my bundle. she requires two bills of divorce, and she collects her marriage contract from the bundle.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ahadboi bar Ammi asked: Two men came from the region of the sea, and a woman was with them, and a bundle was with them. One of them says: This is my wife, and this is my servant, and this is my bundle. And the other says: This is my wife, and this is my servant, and this is my bundle. And the woman says: These are my two servants, and the bundle is mine - she requires two bills of divorce, and her marriage contract is written from the bundle.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִית לֵיהּ סָהֲדֵי לְהַאי וְאִית לֵיהּ סָהֲדֵי לְהַאי, מִי מָצְיָ[א] אַמְרַהּ: אֵלּוּ שְׁנֵי עֲבָדַי וַחֲבִילָה שֶׁלִּי? אֶלָּא לָאו בְּעֵד אֶחָד!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If where this has witnesses and that has witnesses can say: These are my two slaves, and this is my bundle? Rather, is it not to one witness?
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If there are witnesses for this one and witnesses for that one, who can say: 'These are my two slaves and this bundle is mine'? Rather, it is not in one witness!"

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרַאּ? עֵד אֶחָד בְּהַכְחָשָׁה מִי מְהֵימַן? אֶלָּא: לְמִישְׁרֵי לְעָלְמָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּשְׁרֵי,
human_translation: And you understand one witness in contradicting is deemed credible Rather, Everyone agrees that permitting to all permitted
llm_translation: And was it established? One witness in contradiction, who is believed? Rather, to straighten out the world, for everyone does not disagree that it is permissible.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: צְרִיכָה שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין – כְּדֵי לִגְבּוֹת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ מִן הַחֲבִילָה. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר מִטַּלְטְלֵי מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי לִכְתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And here, this is is saying: She requires two bills of divorce in order to collect her marriage contract from the bundle. And is Rabbi Meir, who says: movable property, is subject to a lien for a marriage contract.
llm_translation: And here is what he said: She needs two documents - in order to remove her writing from the bundle. And this is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, for he said: "Moving objects serve to establish a document."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִידּוּשָׁיו. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִדּוּשָׁיו. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ – דְּיָלְפַתְּ ״דָּבָר״ ״דָּבָר״ מִמָּמוֹן?
human_translation: What was about Rav Kahana said: One not concerned that his betrothal Rav Pappa said: One be concerned that his betrothal Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: What is your opinion that you derive from “matter” matter monetary matters.
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? Rav Kahana said: We are not concerned for his sanctifications. Rav Papa said: We are concerned for his sanctifications. Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: What is your opinion - that he should separate "item" "item" from his money?

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן הוֹדָאַת בַּעַל דִּין כְּמֵאָה עֵדִים דָּמֵי, אַף כָּאן הוֹדָאַת בַּעַל דִּין כְּמֵאָה עֵדִים דָּמֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לָא קָא חָיֵיב לְאַחֲרִינֵי, הָכָא קָא חָיֵיב לְאַחֲרִינֵי.
human_translation: if just as there, the admission of a litigant is similar to one hundred witnesses so too here, the admission of a litigant similar to one hundred witnesses. said to him: There, does not to the detriment of another, here, he to the detriment of another,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "There, the admission of a judge is like the testimony of a hundred witnesses, so too here, the admission of a judge is like the testimony of a hundred witnesses. He said to him: There, he is not obligated to others, here, he is obligated to others."

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אַדָּא סָבָא בְּנֵי דְּרַב מָרִי בַּר אִיסּוּר פְּלוּג נִיכְסַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְמִיהְדַּר לָא מָצוּ הָדְרִי בְּהוּ, וַאֲנַן לָא הָדְרִי,
human_translation: Mar Zutra and Rav Adda the Elder, the sons of Rav Mari bar Issur, divided their property between them. They came before Rav Ashi said to him The Merciful One states: “At the mouths of two witnesses, that if wish to retract they cannot retract And we will not retract
llm_translation: Mar Zutra and Rav Adda Saba, the sons of Rav Mari Bar Isur, disputed an issue in the presence of each other. They came before Rav Ashi, and he said to them: "By the mouth of two witnesses," the Merciful One said, for if He wanted to retract, He would not have retracted in them, and we do not retract.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא מִקַּיְימָא מִלְּתָא אֶלָּא בְּסָהֲדֵי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא אִיבְּרוֹ סָהֲדֵי אֶלָּא לְשַׁקָּרֵי.
human_translation: Or perhaps the matter is established only through witnesses. said to them: Witnesses were created only for liars,
llm_translation: Or perhaps the matter is not established except by witnesses? He said to them: The witnesses were not brought except to lie.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר לוֹ עֵד אֶחָד ״אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב״, וְהַלָּה שׁוֹתֵק – נֶאֱמָן. וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: אָמַר לוֹ עֵד אֶחָד ״אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב״ וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״ – פָּטוּר. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר ״לֹא״, הָא אִישְׁתִּיק – מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: Abaye says: one witness says to You ate fat, and that one, silent deemed credible And the tanna taught one witness said to You ate fat, and that says: I did not eat exempt the reason because he said not if he was silent, deemed credible.
llm_translation: Abaye said: If one witness said to him, "You ate fat," and he remains silent - he is believed. And it was taught in a Baraita: If one witness said to him, "You ate fat," and he says, "I did not eat," he is exempt. The reason that if he said "no," he is believed is because he remained silent.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר לוֹ עֵד אֶחָד ״נִטְמְאוּ טׇהֳרוֹתֶיךָ״, וְהַלָּה שׁוֹתֵק – נֶאֱמָן. וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״נִטְמְאוּ״ וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר ״לֹא נִטְמְאוּ״ – פָּטוּר. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר לֹא, הָא אִישְׁתִּיק – מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: And Abaye says if one witness says to Your ritually pure was rendered impure, and that silent, deemed credible. And the tanna taught one witness said was rendered impure, and that says: It was not rendered impure, he is exempt. The reason because he said not if he was silent, deemed credible.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: A single witness said to him, "Your purities have become impure," and the other remains silent - he is believed. And it was taught in a Baraita: If one witness says, "They have become impure," and the other says, "They have not become impure," - he is exempt. The reason that if he said "not," and the other remained silent - he is believed.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר לוֹ עֵד אֶחָד
human_translation: And Abaye says if one witness says to
llm_translation: And Abaye said: A single witness told him.

hebrew_text: ״שׁוֹרְךָ נִרְבַּע״ וְהַלָּה שׁוֹתֵק – נֶאֱמָן, וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: וְשֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בּוֹ עֲבֵירָה, וְשֶׁהֵמִית עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אוֹ עַל פִּי הַבְּעָלִים – נֶאֱמָן. הַאי ״עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד״, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּקָא מוֹדוּ בְּעָלִים, הַיְינוּ ״עַל פִּי הַבְּעָלִים״, אֶלָּא לָאו דְּשָׁתֵיק?
human_translation: Your ox was used for an act of bestiality and the other, is silent, deemed credible. And the tanna taught And that was used for a transgression that killed, by one witness or by the owner, deemed credible. What are the circumstances this by one witness? If the owner admits this is By the owner. Rather, is it not where silent?
llm_translation: "Your ox gores" and the owner is silent - he is trustworthy, and it was taught in a Baraita: "And if it was used for a transgression, and if it killed based on the testimony of one witness or based on the testimony of the owners - he is trustworthy." This "based on the testimony of one witness," what is the case? If it means the owners admit, that is "based on the testimony of the owners," but if not, it is not silent?

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, אִי לָאו דְּקִים לֵיהּ בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ דַּעֲבַד – חוּלִּין בַּעֲזָרָה לָא הֲוָה מַיְיתֵי.
human_translation: And necessary. As, had he taught us that first Were it not that he himself convinced that he had committed he would not bringing a non-sacred to courtyard
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear that case before us, if it is not that he established it by his own initiative - non-sacred items in the Temple courtyard would not have been brought.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל ״נִטְמְאוּ טׇהֳרוֹתֶיךָ״ – מֵימָר אָמְרִינַן: הַאי דְּשָׁתֵיק – דְּסָבַר, חֲזֵי לֵיהּ בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: But Your ritually pure were rendered ritually impure, we would say: that silent that he thinks is fit for him on his days of ritual impurity,
llm_translation: "But 'your pure ones have become impure' - the Gemara says: this one who is silent - he thinks, let him see it in its days of impurity."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מַפְסֵיד לֵיהּ בִּימֵי טׇהֳרָתוֹ, אֲבָל ״שׁוֹרוֹ נִרְבַּע״ מֵימָר אָמַר: כֹּל השְׁווֹרִים לָאו לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ קָיְימִי, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us this that he causes him a loss on his days of ritual purity, But His ox was used for an act of bestiality, can say Not all the oxen stand as altar. necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear this, because he is causing it to lose in its days of purity, but "his ox was gored," it was said: All oxen are not standing in relation to the altar, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אִשְׁתּוֹ זִינְּתָה בְּעַד אֶחָד וְשׁוֹתֵק, מַהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נֶאֱמָן. רָבָא אָמַר: אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. הָוֵי דָּבָר שֶׁבְּעֶרְוָה, וְאֵין דָּבָר שֶׁבְּעֶרְוָה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before by one witness his wife committed adultery, and silent, what is Abaye said: deemed credible. Rava said: He is not deemed credible. it is a matter involving forbidden relations, and there is no matter for forbidden sexual relations fewer than two
llm_translation: The question was asked of them: If his wife was suspected of committing adultery with one man and remains silent, what is the ruling? Abaye said: She is believed. Rava said: She is not believed. Be stringent with matters of prohibited relationships, and there is nothing more stringent than two witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּהָהוּא סַמְיָא דַּהֲוָה מְסַדַּר מַתְנְיָיתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל. יוֹמָא חַד נְגַהּ לֵיהּ וְלָא הֲוָה קָאָתֵי. שַׁדַּר שְׁלִיחָא אַבָּתְרֵיהּ. אַדְּאָזֵיל שְׁלִיחַ בַּחֲדָא אוֹרְחָא, אֲתָא אִיהוּ בַּחֲדָא. כִּי אֲתָא שָׁלִיחַ, אָמַר: אִשְׁתּוֹ זִינְּתָה. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מְהֵימַן לָךְ – זִיל אַפְּקַהּ, וְאִי לָא – לָא תַּפֵּיק.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say that a certain blind man who would review mishnayot before Mar Shmuel. One day was late for him and was not arriving. sent a messenger after him While messenger was going by one way, arrived by a different When messenger came he said his wife committed adultery. came before Mar Shmuel said to him: If is trusted by you, go divorce her, but if not, do not divorce
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this to her, that that attendant who was arranging the Mishnah was standing before Mar Samuel. One day he was delayed and was not standing. He sent another messenger after him. When the first messenger went on one path, he came on another path. When the second messenger came, he said: Your wife has committed adultery. He came before Mar Samuel, and he said to him: If you trust him, go and investigate, and if not, do not go out.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו אִי מְהֵימַן עֲלָךְ דְּלָאו גַּזְלָנָא הוּא? וְרָבָא: אִי מְהֵימַן לָךְ כְּבֵי תְרֵי – זִיל אַפְּקַהּ, וְאִי לָא – לָא תַּפְּקַהּ.
human_translation: What, is it not if he is trusted by you that he is not a thief And Rava If is trusted by you like two go divorce her, but if not, do not divorce
llm_translation: What is the reason that you are not trustworthy that you are not a thief? And Rava said: If you are trustworthy like two houses - go out and collect, and if not - do not collect.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּינַאי הַמֶּלֶךְ שֶׁהָלַךְ לְכוּחְלִית שֶׁבַּמִּדְבָּר, וְכִיבֵּשׁ שָׁם שִׁשִּׁים כְּרַכִּים, וּבַחֲזָרָתוֹ הָיָה שָׂמֵחַ שִׂמְחָה גְּדוֹלָה. וְקָרָא לְכׇל חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָמַר לָהֶם: אֲבוֹתֵינוּ הָיוּ אוֹכְלִים מְלוּחִים בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָיוּ עֲסוּקִים בְּבִנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אַף אָנוּ נֹאכַל מְלוּחִים זֵכֶר לַאֲבוֹתֵינוּ. וְהֶעֱלוּ מְלוּחִים עַל שׁוּלְחָנוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב, וְאָכְלוּ.
human_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say As it is taught An incident with King Yannai, who went to Koḥalit in the desert and conquered sixty cities there. And upon his return he rejoiced a great happiness And he summoned all the Sages of the Jewish people said to them: Our ancestors would eat salty foods when they were busy with the building of the Temple; we too shall eat salty foods in memory of our ancestors. And they brought salty food on tables of gold, and ate.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say this to her, as it was taught: There was an incident with Binyai the King who went to the village of Kuchlit in the desert, and he cooked there sixty pots, and upon his return he was exceedingly joyful. And he called all the sages of Israel, and said to them: Our ancestors used to eat salty food when they were engaged in the construction of the Temple, so we too shall eat salty food in memory of our ancestors. And they brought salty food on golden tables, and they ate.

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה שָׁם אֶחָד, אִישׁ לֵץ לֵב רַע וּבְלִיַּעַל, וְאֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פּוֹעֵירָה שְׁמוֹ. וַיֹּאמֶר אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פּוֹעֵירָה לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ: יַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ, לִבָּם שֶׁל פְּרוּשִׁים עָלֶיךָ. וּמָה אֶעֱשֶׂה? הָקֵם לָהֶם בַּצִּיץ שֶׁבֵּין עֵינֶיךָ. הֵקִים לָהֶם בַּצִּיץ שֶׁבֵּין עֵינָיו.
human_translation: And there was one present, a scoffer, an evil heart and a scoundrel called Elazar ben Po’ira. And Elazar ben Po’ira said to King Yannai: King Yannai, the hearts of the Pharisees, are against you. And what shall I do Have them stand by the frontplate between your eyes. He had stand by the frontplate between his eyes.
llm_translation: And there was there one, a man of mocking heart and wicked intent, and Elazar ben Po'irah was his name. And Elazar ben Po'irah said to King Yanai: "King Yanai, the hearts of the Pharisees are upon you." And what shall I do? He established for them a flower between his eyes. He established for them a flower between his eyes.

hebrew_text: הָיָה שָׁם זָקֵן אֶחָד וִיהוּדָה בֶּן גְּדִידְיָה שְׁמוֹ, וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוּדָה בֶּן גְּדִידְיָה לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ: יַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ! רַב לְךָ כֶּתֶר מַלְכוּת, הַנַּח כֶּתֶר כְּהוּנָּה לְזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן. שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אִמּוֹ נִשְׁבֵּית בְּמוֹדִיעִים. וַיְבוּקַּשׁ הַדָּבָר וְלֹא נִמְצָא. וַיִּבָּדְלוּ חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּזַעַם.
human_translation: there was a certain elder present called Yehuda ben Gedidya, and Yehuda ben Gedidya said to King Yannai: King Yannai, the crown of the monarchy suffices for you, Leave the crown of the priesthood for the descendants of Aaron. As they would say mother was taken captive in Modi’in, And the matter was investigated and was not discovered, And the Sages of Israel were expelled in rage,
llm_translation: There was a certain elder there, and Yehudah ben Gedidyah was his name. And Yehudah ben Gedidyah said to King Yanai: "King Yanai! It is abundant for you the crown of kingship, leave the crown of priesthood for the seed of Aharon. For they used to say: 'His mother was involved in adultery.' And the matter was investigated but not found. And the sages of Israel were separated in anger."

hebrew_text: וַיֹּאמֶר אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פּוֹעֵירָה לְיַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ: יַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ, הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כָּךְ הוּא דִּינוֹ, וְאַתָּה מֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל כָּךְ הוּא דִּינָךְ? וּמָה אֶעֱשֶׂה? אִם אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ לַעֲצָתִי: רוֹמְסֵם. וְתוֹרָה מָה תְּהֵא עָלֶיהָ? הֲרֵי כְּרוּכָה וּמוּנַּחַת בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית, כָּל הָרוֹצֶה לִלְמוֹד יָבוֹא וְיִלְמוֹד.
human_translation: And Elazar ben Po’ira said to King Yannai: King Yannai, such is the judgment of a common person in Israel. But you are a king and a High Priest. this your judgment And what should I do? If you listen to my advice, crush them. But what will become of the Torah? Behold, is wrapped and placed in the corner. Anyone who wishes to study can come and study.
llm_translation: Elazar ben Po'era said to Yanai the King: Yanai the King, the commoner in Israel, this is his judgment, and you, a king and high priest, this is your judgment? And what shall I do? If you listen to my advice: oppress them. And what will be the Torah concerning it? Behold, it is wrapped and placed in a corner, whoever wishes to learn should come and learn.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִיָּד נִזְרְקָה בּוֹ מִינוּת, דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר: תִּינַח תּוֹרָה שֶׁבִּכְתָב, תּוֹרָה שֶׁבְּעַל פֶּה מַאי? מִיָּד: וַתּוּצַץ הָרָעָה עַל יְדֵי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פּוֹעֵירָה, וַיֵּהָרְגוּ כׇּל חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם מִשְׁתּוֹמֵם, עַד שֶׁבָּא שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח וְהֶחְזִיר אֶת הַתּוֹרָה לְיוֹשְׁנָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: Immediately, heresy was injected into as he should have said works out well the Written Torah, what the Oral Torah? Immediately, the evil caught fire through Elazar ben Po’ira, and all the Sages of the Jewish people were killed. And the world was desolate until Shimon ben Shataḥ came and restored the Torah to its former
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Immediately suspicion was cast upon him, for it would have been fitting for him to say: "Let the written Torah be forgotten, what is the Oral Torah?" Immediately: "And the plague was stayed from the children of Israel by the hand of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, and the plague was stayed." And all the sages of Israel were killed, and the world was desolate until Shimon ben Shetach came and restored the Torah to its former state.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּבֵי תְרֵי אָמְרִי: ״אִישְׁתְּבַאי״ וּבֵי תְרֵי אָמְרִי: ״לָא אִישְׁתְּבַאי״ – מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָנֵי, סְמוֹךְ אַהָנֵי!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say that two said she was taken captive, and two said she was not taken captive, what did you see that you rely on these rely on these
llm_translation: "How are the cases similar? If you say that the House of Two says, 'She consented,' and the House of Two says, 'She did not consent' - what do you see that you rely on the brothers, rely on the brothers!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּעֵד אֶחָד, וְטַעְמָא דְּקָא מַכְחֲשִׁי לֵיהּ בֵּי תְרֵי, הָא לָאו הָכִי מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: Rather, to one witness And the reason that he is contradicted by the two, if not for that he would be deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rather, with one witness, and the reason that they contradict him with two, is not this trustworthy.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא: לְעוֹלָם תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי, וְכִדְאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי: בְּעֵדֵי הֲזָמָה. הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּעֵדֵי הֲזָמָה.
human_translation: And Rava Actually, two and two and in accordance with that Rav Aḥa bar Rav Minyumi says to conspiring witnesses. Here too, to conspiring witnesses.
llm_translation: Rava: Always two and two, as Rav Acha bar Rav Minyomei said: In the presence of conspiracy. Here too, in the presence of conspiracy.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא כִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שִׁפְחָה הִכְנִיסוּ תַּחְתֶּיהָ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say in accordance with by Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: They replaced with a maidservant.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say like Rabbi Yitzchak, for Rabbi Yitzchak said: They brought in a maidservant beneath her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava says:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דִּתְנַן: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּמְגוֹרָה שֶׁל דִּסְקִים בְּיַבְנֶה שֶׁהָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת בְּחֶזְקַת שְׁלֵימָה, וּמָדְדוּ וְנִמְצֵאת חֲסֵירָה –
human_translation: From where do I say As we learned Rabbi Shimon said: An incident with regard to reservoir of Diskim in Yavne, which had the presumptive status of complete, and they measured it and it was found to be deficient,
llm_translation: I say to her, as we learned: Rabbi Shimon said: There was an incident with a beam in the wall of the Discus-makers in Yavneh, which was assumed to be whole, but when they measured it, it was found to be deficient –

hebrew_text: כׇּל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל גַּבָּהּ הָיָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן מְטַהֵר, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְטַמֵּא. אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: מִקְוֶה זֶה בְּחֶזְקַת שָׁלֵם הוּא עוֹמֵד, מִסָּפֵק אַתָּה בָּא לְחַסְּרוֹ – אַל תְּחַסְּרֶנּוּ מִסָּפֵק. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אָדָם זֶה בְּחֶזְקַת טָמֵא הוּא עוֹמֵד, מִסָּפֵק אַתָּה בָּא לְטַהֲרוֹ – אַל תְּטַהֲרֶנּוּ מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: all ritual purification performed in Rabbi Tarfon would render ritually pure, and Rabbi Akiva render ritually impure. Rabbi Tarfon said: This ritual bath retained the presumptive status of whole you are coming to deficient out of uncertainty. Do not deem it deficient out of uncertainty. Rabbi Akiva said This person retained the presumptive status of ritually impure You are coming to purify him out of uncertainty. Do not deem him ritually pure out of uncertainty.
llm_translation: All purities that were done on its account, Rabbi Tarfon would declare pure, and Rabbi Akiva would declare impure. Rabbi Tarfon said: "This mikveh is standing in a presumption of being intact; if you come to diminish it - do not diminish it from a presumption." Rabbi Akiva said: "This person is standing in a presumption of being impure; if you come to purify him - do not purify him from a presumption."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: מָשָׁל לְעוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה, שֶׁעֲבוֹדָתוֹ כְּשֵׁירָה. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מָשָׁל לְעוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא בַּעַל מוּם, שֶׁעֲבוֹדָתוֹ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said a parable standing and sacrificing on the altar, and it became known that he is the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza . that his service valid. Rabbi Akiva said: parable standing and sacrificing on the altar, and it became known that he is blemished. that his service disqualified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: A parable for one who stands and offers upon the altar, and it is known that he is a son of divorce or a son of a bondwoman, that his service is valid. Rabbi Akiva said: A parable for one who stands and offers upon the altar, and it is known that he has a blemish, that his service is invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: אַתָּה דִּימִּיתוֹ לְבַעַל מוּם, וַאֲנִי דִּמִּיתִיו לְבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ לְבֶן חֲלוּצָה, נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה. אִי דּוֹמֶה לְבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה וּלְבֶן חֲלוּצָה – נְדוּנֶנּוּ כְּבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ כְּבֶן חֲלוּצָה, אִם דּוֹמֶה לְבַעַל מוּם – נְדוּנֶנּוּ כְּבַעַל מוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: You compared to a blemished whereas I compared it to the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza . Let us see to which it is similar. If is similar to the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , let us treat it like the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza ; if it is similar to a blemished let us treat it like a blemished
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: You have compared him to a blemished husband, and I have compared him to a son of a divorced woman or a son of a halutzah (levirate marriage). To whom does he appear similar? If he appears similar to a son of a divorced woman or a son of a halutzah, we judge him as a son of a divorced woman or a son of a halutzah. If he appears similar to a blemished husband, we judge him as a blemished husband.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לָדוּן: מִקְוֶה פְּסוּלוֹ בְּיָחִיד, וּבַעַל מוּם פְּסוּלוֹ בְּיָחִיד, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ בִּשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva began to analyze The disqualification of a ritual bath by an individual, and the disqualification of a blemished is an individual. And do not let the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza prove as his disqualification is by two
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva began to discuss: A mikveh whose immersion renders it invalid when done by an individual, and an animal with a blemish whose offering is invalid when brought by an individual, and a child of a divorced woman or a child of a halutzah whose status is invalid when testified by two witnesses.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: מִקְוֶה פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ, בַּעַל מוּם פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ מֵאֲחֵרִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: עֲקִיבָא! כׇּל הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מִמְּךָ כְּפוֹרֵשׁ מִן הַחַיִּים.
human_translation: Alternatively, The disqualification of a ritual bath is due to itself, the disqualification of a blemished due to himself. And do not let the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza prove as his disqualification is due to others, Rabbi Tarfon said to him: Akiva, anyone who separates from you, it is as though he has separated from life
llm_translation: Another matter: If his immersion is invalid in his own body, a blemished animal's offering is invalid in its own body, and a son of a divorced woman and a son of a halutzah should not prove his disqualification from others. Rabbi Tarfon said to him: Akiva! Anyone who separates from you is like one who separates from life.

hebrew_text: הַאי בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ בְּיָחִיד הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּקָא מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ, מִי מְהֵימַן? אֶלָּא דְּשָׁתֵיק,
human_translation: What are the circumstances this blemished whose disqualification is by an individual If denies his is deemed credible? Rather, that silent
llm_translation: This blemished individual whose disqualification is in a private capacity, what is the comparison? If he is refuting it, who will believe him? Rather, he remains silent.

hebrew_text: וְדִכְוָתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה דְּשָׁתֵיק, וְקָתָנֵי: מִקְוֶה פְּסוּלוֹ בְּיָחִיד וּבַעַל מוּם פְּסוּלוֹ בְּיָחִיד, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ בִּשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: And similarly with regard to the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza , to silent, and teaches: The disqualification of a ritual bath by an individual, and the disqualification of a blemished is an individual. And do not let the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza prove as his disqualification is by two
llm_translation: And his opinion regarding the son of a divorced woman and the son of a halutzah is silent, and it is taught: His mikveh renders him unfit when he is alone, and a blemished one renders him unfit when he is alone, and a son of a divorced woman and a son of a halutzah should not prove that his mikveh renders him unfit in two cases.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם דְּקָא מַכְחֵישׁ לֵיהּ, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: ׳אַמַּאי מְהֵימַן׳ – דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁלַח אַחְוִי. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי: מִקְוֶה פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ וּבַעַל מוּם פְּסוּלוֹ בְּגוּפוֹ, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה שֶׁפְּסוּלוֹ מֵאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: And Abaye said Actually, with who denies and that which you said: Why is deemed credible where said to him: Remove show And this is that which the baraita teaches: The disqualification of a ritual bath is due to itself, the disqualification of a blemished due to himself, And do not let the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza prove as his disqualification is due to others.
llm_translation: And Abbaye said: Always he contradicts him, and you said: 'Why do you trust?' - because he said to him: 'Send my brother.' And that is what is taught: A mikveh, its invalidity is in itself, and a blemished animal, its invalidity is in itself, and a son of a divorced woman and a son of a halutzah should not prove his own invalidity from others.

hebrew_text: וּבֶן גְּרוּשָׁה וּבֶן חֲלוּצָה דַּעֲבוֹדָתוֹ כְּשֵׁירָה, מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָיְתָה לּוֹ וּלְזַרְעוֹ אַחֲרָיו״ – בֵּין זֶרַע כָּשֵׁר וּבֵין זֶרַע פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And from where do we that the service of the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza is valid Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: As the verse states “And it shall be for him and his seed after him both fit seed and unfit seed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a son of a divorced woman and a son of a halutzah, his service is valid, from where do we know? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: As the verse states: 'And it shall be to him and to his descendants after him' - whether the seed is valid or whether the seed is invalid."

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״בָּרֵךְ ה׳ חֵילוֹ וּפֹעַל יָדָיו תִּרְצֶה״ – אֲפִילּוּ חוּלִּין שֶׁבּוֹ תִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: Shmuel’s father said from here: “Bless, Lord, his substance [ ḥeilo ], and accept the work of his hands” even his profane ones [ ḥullin ], accept
llm_translation: The father of Shmuel said: From here: "Bless the Lord, His strength, and the work of His hands you shall favor" - even the sick among you, you shall favor.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר: מֵהָכָא: ״וּבָאתָ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם״, וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁאָדָם הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּיָמָיו? אֶלָּא זֶה כָּשֵׁר וְנִתְחַלֵּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: from here, “And you shall come to the priest who shall be in those days” But can it enter your mind that a person can come to a priest who is not in his days? Rather, this a fit who became a ḥalal .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: From here: "And you shall come to the kohen who will be in those days," and do you think that a person goes to a kohen who was not in his days? Rather, this one is fit and becomes disqualified.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם דַּעֲבוֹדָתוֹ פְּסוּלָה, מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לָכֵן אֱמֹר הִנְנִי נֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת בְּרִיתִי שָׁלוֹם״ – כְּשֶׁהוּא שָׁלֵם וְלֹא כְּשֶׁהוּא חָסֵר. וְהָא ״שָׁלוֹם״ כְּתִיב! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וָיו דְּשָׁלוֹם קְטִיעָה הִיא.
human_translation: From where do we that the service of a blemished is invalid? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: As the verse states “Wherefore say: Behold, I give to him My covenant of peace [ shalom ]” when he is whole [ shalem ], but not when he is lacking But shalom is written, Rav Naḥman says: vav shalom is severed.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A blemished animal for its service is disqualified, whence? Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: As the verse states: "Therefore say, behold, I give to him my covenant of peace" - when it is complete and not when it is lacking. But isn't "peace" written? Rav Nachman said: The vav of "peace" is a broken vav.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה – הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר. וְאֵיזֶה זוֹ – זוֹ כֹּהֶנֶת, לְוִיָּה, וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית שֶׁנִּשְּׂאוּ לְכֹהֵן, לֵוִי, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Any case where there is betrothal, and no transgression the offspring follows the male, And which is this this the daughter of a priest; the daughter of a Levite; or the daughter of an Israelite, who married a priest, a Levite, or an Israelite.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Any place where there are sanctities but no transgressions - the offspring follows the male. And who is this? - This is a Kohenet, Leviah, and Israelite woman who married a Kohen, Levi, or Israelite.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְיֵשׁ עֲבֵירָה – הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם. וְאֵיזֶה זוֹ – זוֹ אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַמְזֵר וּלְנָתִין.
human_translation: And any case where there is betrothal and there is a transgression, the offspring follows the flawed And which is this this a widow to a High Priest, a divorced woman or a ḥalutza to a common priest, a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman to an Israelite, an Israelite woman to a mamzer or to a Gibeonite.
llm_translation: And every place where there are sanctifications and there is transgression - the offspring follows the blemish. And which is this - this is a widow to a High Priest, a divorced and halutzah to a common priest, a mamzeret and netinah to an Israelite, a daughter of Israel to a mamzer and to a netin.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ עָלָיו קִידּוּשִׁין, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהּ עַל אֲחֵרִים קִידּוּשִׁין – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. וְאֵיזֶה זֶה – זֶה הַבָּא עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה. וְכׇל מִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ לֹא עָלָיו וְלֹא עַל אֲחֵרִים קִידּוּשִׁין – הַוָּלָד כְּמוֹתָהּ. וְאֵיזֶה זֶה – זֶה וְלַד שִׁפְחָה וְנׇכְרִית.
human_translation: And any where cannot betrothal with but she can betrothal with others, the offspring is a mamzer . And which is this This is one who engages in intercourse with any one of those with whom relations are forbidden that are in the Torah. And any where cannot betrothal with him or with others, the offspring is like her. And which is this This is the offspring of maidservant or a gentile woman,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And anyone who does not have kiddushin upon him, but has kiddushin on others - the offspring is a mamzer. And who is this - this is one who comes from any of the forbidden relationships in the Torah. And anyone who does not have kiddushin neither upon him nor upon others - the offspring is like her. And who is this - this is the offspring of a maidservant or a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּלָלָא הוּא דְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר? הֲרֵי
human_translation: any case where there is betrothal Rabbi Shimon said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Is principle any case where there is betrothal and there is no transgression the offspring follows the male? But
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Kol makom sheyesh kiddushin. Amar lei Rabbi Shimon leRabbi Yochanan: Kelala hu dekol makom sheyesh kiddushin ve'ein aveirah havalad holech acharei hazachar? Harei English translation: Gemara: Everywhere there are kiddushin. Rabbi Shimon said to Rabbi Yochanan: Is it a general principle that everywhere there are kiddushin and the sin of the offspring follows the male? Behold

hebrew_text: גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת, דְּיֵשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה – הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם, דְּתַנְיָא: גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא? מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: גֵּר לֹא יִשָּׂא מַמְזֶרֶת, וְיֵשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְיֵשׁ עֲבֵירָה – הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם.
human_translation: a convert who married a mamzeret , where there is betrothal and there is no transgression, the offspring follows the flawed As it is taught a convert who married a mamzeret , the offspring is a mamzer . the statement of Rabbi Yosei. said to Do you maintain the mishna is Rabbi Yosei? the mishna is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: A convert may not marry a mamzeret , and there is betrothal and there is a transgression, the offspring follows the flawed
llm_translation: A convert who marries a mamzeret, there is kiddushin but no transgression - the offspring follows the blemish, as it was taught: A convert who marries a mamzeret - the offspring is a mamzer, the words of Rabbi Yosei! He said to him: Do you think the Mishnah is Rabbi Yosei's? The Mishnah is Rabbi Yehuda's, who said: A convert may not marry a mamzeret, and there is kiddushin but there is transgression - the offspring follows the blemish.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנְיַיהּ! תְּנָא ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּסֵיפָא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי.
human_translation: But let teach taught Any case in the latter clause, to include
llm_translation: "And it shall be given to him! It was taught: 'Every place' in the latter clause, to include."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, וּתְנָא ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, is Rabbi Yosei, and taught which is this to exclude
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Indeed, it is Rabbi Yosei," and the Tanna teaches "Which one" for exclusions.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ וְתוּ לָא? וַהֲרֵי חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּיֵשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה – הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בֶּן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But which is this And no more? But a ḥalal who married an Israelite woman, where is betrothal and there is no transgression, the offspring follows the male, This not difficult, holds in accordance with Rabbi Dostai ben Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: "And which is this?" And if not? And behold, a non-Jew who had relations with a Jewish woman, there are betrothals but no transgression - the offspring follows the male! This is not difficult, as Rabbi Dostai son of Rabbi Yehuda holds this opinion."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה, דְּיֵשׁ קִידּוּשִׁין וְאֵין עֲבֵירָה – הַוָּלָד הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר! תְּנָא ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּרֵישָׁא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי.
human_translation: But an Israelite who married a ḥalala , where there is betrothal and there is no transgression, the offspring follows the male, taught Any case in the first clause, to include
llm_translation: Behold, regarding a Jew who married a woman who is a halalah, where there is sanctification but no transgression - the offspring follows the male! A Tanna: "In every place" - the first opinion is to include all cases.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתְנְיַיהּ בְּהֶדְיָא! מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מִתְּנֵי לֵהּ. הֵיכִי נִיתְנֵי? כֹּהֶנֶת וּלְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית וַחֲלָלָה שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן לֵוִי וְיִשְׂרָאֵל – וַחֲלָלָה לְכֹהֵן מִי חַזְיָא?
human_translation: But let teach explicitly because he cannot teach it, How can teach A daughter of a priest; and a daughter of a Levite; and a daughter of an Israelite; and a ḥalala , who married a priest, a Levite, or an Israelite, is a ḥalala fit for a priest?
llm_translation: And it should be given with its adornment! Because he does not give it to her. How is it given? A priestess, a Levite, an Israelite, and a profaned woman that a priest, Levite, and Israelite married - but a profaned woman, who does she belong to?

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה – בְּנָהּ שְׁלִישִׁי הָוֵי!
human_translation: But there is of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a second-generation Egyptian man, who married a first-generation Egyptian woman, her son is a third-generation
llm_translation: The case of Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah, for Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: An Egyptian who married an Egyptian woman as his first wife – his son is considered a third-generation Egyptian!

hebrew_text: תְּנָא ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּרֵישָׁא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי. וּלְרַב דִּימִי דְּאָמַר שֵׁנִי הָוֵי, תְּנָא ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי.
human_translation: taught Any case in the first clause, to include And to Rav Dimi, who said is a second-generation taught: which is this to exclude
llm_translation: The Tanna said: "Every 'place' in the beginning, to include." And for Rav Dimi who said, "Two should be," the Tanna said: "Which one is it?" to exclude.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא, דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בָּאוּמּוֹת – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר.
human_translation: But there is As when Ravin came he Rabbi Yoḥanan says: With regard to the nations, follow the male
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And there is a case, for when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: "Bamot" - follow the male.

hebrew_text: נִתְגַּיְּירוּ, הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם. תְּנָא ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי.
human_translation: converted, follow the flawed of the two. taught: which is this to exclude
llm_translation: They converted, follow the blemished one in both of them. Tanna: "Which one" to exclude.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּרֵישָׁא – לְאֵתוֹיֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה, וּדְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ – לְמַעוֹטֵי דְּרַב דִּימִי וְרָבִין!
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say that the mishna is Rabbi Yehuda, Any case, of the first clause, to include an Israelite who married a ḥalala , and Rabba bar bar Ḥana which is this to exclude Rav Dimi and Ravin
llm_translation: This what? If you say, "In truth, it is the teaching of Rabbi Yehuda," "every place" in the first interpretation - to include the Israelites who carried the corpse, and Rabba bar bar Ḥana, "which is it" - to exclude the opinions of Rav Dimi and Ravin!

hebrew_text: ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּסֵיפָא – לְאֵתוֹיֵי גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּרֵישָׁא – כְּדַאֲמַרַן, ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ – כְּדַאֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״ דְּסֵיפָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי?
human_translation: Any case, of the latter clause, to include a convert who married a mamzeret . But if you say is Rabbi Yosei, Any case of the first clause, is as we said, which is this is as we said, But what Any case, of the latter clause, to add?
llm_translation: "The entire place" of the latter clause - to include a convert who married a mamzeret. Rather, if you say it is according to Rabbi Yosei, "the entire place" of the former clause - as we said, "which is it" - as we said, rather "the entire place" of the latter clause, what does it come to include?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״ דְּסֵיפָא לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא: אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא ״אֵיזוֹ זוֹ״. הָכִי נָמֵי אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא ״כׇּל מָקוֹם״.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, to Rabbi Yehuda Why do I which is this of the latter clause? Rather, Since taught first clause which is this it taught latter clause which is this So too Since taught first clause Any case, it taught latter clause Any case.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to your reasoning, according to Rabbi Yehuda, "Which is it" in the latter clause, why do I need it? Rather, since the first clause taught "Which is it," the latter clause also teaches "Which is it." So too, since the first clause taught "every place," the latter clause also teaches "every place."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בָּאוּמּוֹת – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר. נִתְגַּיְּירוּ – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: the itself: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: With regard to the nations, follow the male they converted follow the flawed of the two.
llm_translation: Body: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: With animals - follow the male. If they are castrated - follow the blemish that is in both of them.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בָּאוּמּוֹת הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר״? כִּדְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְאֶחָד מִן הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד?
human_translation: What With regard to the nations, follow the male? As it is taught From where to one of the nations who engaged in intercourse with a Canaanite woman and fathered a son that you are permitted to purchase as a slave,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "follow the male" with regards to the Ammonites? As it was taught: From where do we derive that if one of the Ammonite nations marries a Canaanite woman and begets a son, you are permitted to acquire him as a slave?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״. יָכוֹל אַף עֶבֶד שֶׁבָּא עַל שִׁפְחָה מִן הָאוּמּוֹת וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר הוֹלִידוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶם״ – מִן הַנּוֹלָדִין בְּאַרְצְכֶם, וְלֹא מִן הַגָּרִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם.
human_translation: The verse states: “And also of the children of the residents who sojourn with you, of them you may buy” might even slave who engaged in intercourse with a maidservant from the nations and fathered a son, that you are permitted to buy as a slave. the verse states: “Which they have begotten in your land” from those begotten in your land, but not from those who reside in your land,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And also from the sons of the residents who dwell among you, from them you shall acquire." Could this also include a slave who came upon a maidservant from the nations and fathered a son, whom you are permitted to acquire as a slave? The Talmud teaches: "Who were born in your land" – from those born in your land, and not from the residents in your land.

hebrew_text: ״נִתְגַּיְּירוּ הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַפָּגוּם שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם״ – בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּמִצְרִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא עַמּוֹנִית, מַאי פָּגוּם אִיכָּא, ״עַמּוֹנִי״ – וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית!
human_translation: they converted, follow the flawed of the two. To which If we say to an Egyptian man who married an Ammonite woman, what flawed is there an Ammonite man but not an Ammonite woman,
llm_translation: "They converted, he followed the blemish that is in both" - With what? If you say with an Egyptian who married an Ammonite woman, what blemish is there? "Ammonite" - and not Ammonitess!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּעַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית, וְאִי זָכָר הָוֵי – הַאי שִׁדְיֵהּ אַבָּתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ, וְאִם נְקֵבָה הָוְיָא – שִׁדְיַהּ אַבָּתְרַהּ דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, to an Ammonite man who married an Egyptian woman, and if is a male, cast him after And if is a female, cast her after
llm_translation: Rather, with an Ammonite who married an Egyptian woman, and if it is a male - this is his offspring after his father, and if it is a female - this is her offspring after her father.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לָהּ עָלָיו קִידּוּשִׁין. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, וְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצְאָה מִבֵּיתוֹ וְהָלְכָה וְהָיְתָה לְאִישׁ אַחֵר״ – לַאֲחֵרִים וְלֹא לִקְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: any where cannot betrothal with him, From where are these matters As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and determined it in the name of Rabbi Yannai; and Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, determined it in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: The verse states “And she departs out of his house, and goes and becomes another man’s wife” of others, but not of relatives,
llm_translation: All that she does not have upon him betrothal. From where are these words? For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and they came upon it because of Rabbi Yannai, and Rav Acha, son of Rava, and they came upon it because of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.
