The verse says: "And she went out of his house and went and became another man's" - to others and not to relatives.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: וְאֵימָא ״לְאַחֵר״ וְלֹא לְבֵן! בֵּן בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו״, ״אַחֵר״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לַאֲחֵרִים וְלֹא לִקְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba objects to this: But say “another” But not to son, With regard to a son it is explicitly written: “A man shall not take his father’s wife” why do I “another”? Learn from that others but not relatives.
llm_translation: Rebbe Abba objects to her: And say "to another" and not to a son! A son is explicitly written in it: "A man shall not take his father's wife," why do I need "another"? Learn from it for others and not for relatives.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי לְבֵן, הָא – לְכַתְּחִילָּה, וְהָא – דִּיעֲבַד.
human_translation: But say this and that to a son this ab initio . And that after the fact,
llm_translation: And why? Each one for the son, this - initially, and that - after the fact.

hebrew_text: לְכַתְּחִילָּה מֵאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה נָפְקָא: וּמָה אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, בְּכָרֵת לָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין, חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: ab initio derived from a wife’s sister If, a wife’s sister, with karet , she cannot be betrothed liability to court-imposed capital punishment, not all the more so
llm_translation: Initially, from the sister of a woman she emerged: And what is the sister of a woman, with regard to betrothal you shall not establish it, liable to capital punishment, how much more so the court?

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בַּאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, הָא – לְכַתְּחִילָּה, הָא – דִיעֲבַד! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: But say this and that to a wife’s sister, this ab initio , that after the fact. Yes, it is indeed so.
llm_translation: And why not? In the case of both, with the sister of a woman, this – initially, that – retroactively! So it is indeed.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, שְׁאָר עֲרָיוֹת מְנָלַן? יָלְפִינַן מֵאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה: מָה אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה מְיוּחֶדֶת, שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת – וְלָא תָּפְסִי בָּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין, אַף כֹּל שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת – לָא תָּפְסִי בָּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: We found a wife’s sister; from where do we other forbidden relations? We derive from a wife’s sister, Just as a wife’s sister, specified is a forbidden relative karet for its intentional and a sin-offering for its unwitting and betrothal is ineffective in so too, any that a forbidden relative whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin-offering, betrothal is ineffective in
llm_translation: We find the sister of a woman, how do we derive the rest of the forbidden relationships from her? We derive from the sister of a woman: Just as the sister of a woman is unique, as she is forbidden, and one is liable for intentional relations with her to receive the punishment of excision, and for unintentional relations with her to bring a sin offering - and yet betrothal does not take effect with her, so too, any other woman who is forbidden, and one is liable for intentional relations with her to receive the punishment of excision, and for unintentional relations with her to bring a sin offering - betrothal does not take effect with her.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ אָתְיָין, אֶלָּא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְאֵשֶׁת אָח – אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה – תֹּאמַר בְּאֵשֶׁת אָח שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Granted, all derived But a married woman and a brother’s wife can be refuted What about a wife’s sister is that she is not permitted in the case of a mitzva, Will you say with regard to a brother’s wife, who is permitted in the case of mitzva
llm_translation: In truth, all wines come, except for a man's wife and a brother's wife - there is a distinction: Just as a sister-in-law is a woman, so she has no permission in a place of commandment - you should say regarding a brother's wife that she has permission in a place of commandment.

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ נָמֵי אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְהָנָךְ, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָן – תֹּאמַר בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָן!
human_translation: a married woman can likewise be refuted: What about these that they cannot be permitted during the lives of those whose renders them prohibited, Will you say with regard to a married woman, who permitted during the life of the one who renders her forbidden,
llm_translation: The wife of a man, there is to differentiate: what for her benefit, that so she has no permission in his lifetime to forbid - you shall say in the wife of a man that she has permission in his lifetime to forbid!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אָמַר קְרָא: ״כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבֹת הָאֵלֶּה וְנִכְרְתוּ״, הוּקְשׁוּ כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת כּוּלָּם לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, מָה אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה לֹא תָּפְסִי בָּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין – אַף כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת כּוּלָּם לֹא תָּפְסִי בָּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yona says, and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: The verse states “Whoever shall do any of these abominations shall be cut off” all those with whom relations are forbidden are juxtaposed to a wife’s sister: Just as betrothal is not effective a wife’s sister, so too, betrothal is not effective with regard to all those with whom relations are forbidden.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yonah said, and it was stated by Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: The verse states, "Whatever of all these abominations he does, they shall be cut off." All the forbidden relationships are all connected to a sister of a wife. Just as a sister of a wife does not establish betrothal with her - so too, all the forbidden relationships do not establish betrothal with her.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי,
human_translation: If so,
llm_translation: If so,

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ נִדָּה נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבָא עַל הַנִּדָּה וְעַל הַסּוֹטָה, שֶׁאֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא ״וּתְהִי נִדָּתָהּ עָלָיו״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת נִדָּתָהּ – תְּהֵא בָּהּ הֲוָיָה.
human_translation: even a menstruating woman as well, why Abaye say: All concede with regard to one who engages in intercourse with a menstruating woman or with a sota , that the offspring is not a mamzer ? Ḥizkiyya said: the verse states: “And her impurity be [ ut’hi ] upon him” even at the time of her impurity, becoming [ havaya ] should to her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even a menstruating woman! Why did Abbaye say: Everyone agrees regarding one who had relations with a menstruating woman or with a suspected adulteress, that the child is not a mamzer? Hezekiah said: The verse says, "And her impurity is upon him," even during her impurity - let there be a presumption in her favor.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי אִיכָּא לְאַקּוֹשַׁהּ לְנִדָּה, וְאִיכָּא לְאַקּוֹשַׁהּ לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, מַאי חָזֵית דְּמַקְּשַׁתְּ לְהוּ לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה? אַקְּשַׁהּ לְנִדָּה! קוּלָּא וְחוּמְרָא – לְחוּמְרָא מַקְּשִׁינַן.
human_translation: After all, there is of juxtaposing to a menstruating woman, and there is of juxtaposing to a wife’s sister. What did you see that you juxtaposed them to a wife’s sister? juxtapose them to a menstruating woman? a leniency, or a stringency, we juxtapose to a stringency.
llm_translation: From the fact that there is a prohibition to betroth her to a menstruating woman, and there is a prohibition to betroth her to the sister of a woman, what do you see that you are trying to betroth her to the sister of a woman? Betroth her to a menstruating woman! We derive a logical inference and a stringent ruling - in a stringent case, we are stringent.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: אָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִיבָמָה: וּמָה יְבָמָה, שֶׁהִיא בְּלָאו – לָא תָּפְסִי בָּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין, חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת וְחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אִי הָכִי, שְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said is derived by an a fortiori from a yevama : Just as a yevama , is by prohibition, betrothal is not effective with her, those liable to death or liable to karet , not all the more so If so, also other is liable a prohibition
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: A comparison with a fortiori reasoning from yibum: And what is yibum? That it is with a prohibition - if one does not acquire her with betrothal, liable to death penalties and liable to karet, how much more so? If so, other prohibitions also liable to death penalties!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ – ״כִּי תִהְיֶיןָ לְאִישׁ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים הָאַחַת אֲהוּבָה וְהָאַחַת שְׂנוּאָה״, וְכִי יֵשׁ שְׂנוּאָה לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם וַאֲהוּבָה לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם? אֶלָּא: ״אֲהוּבָה״ – אֲהוּבָה בְּנִישּׂוּאֶיהָ, ״שְׂנוּאָה״ – שְׂנוּאָה בְּנִישּׂוּאֶיהָ. וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״כִּי תִהְיֶיןָ״.
human_translation: is written explicitly with whom he is liable prohibitions “If a man has two wives, the one beloved and the one hated” But is there one who is hated before the Omnipresent and one who is beloved before the Omnipresent? Rather, “beloved” beloved in her marriage, “hated” hated in her marriage, And the Merciful One states: “If a man has
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Those liable for a negative commandment with regard to a woman, it is written regarding them - "If a man has two wives, one loved and the other hated," is there hatred before the Omnipresent and love before the Omnipresent? Rather, "loved" - loved in her marriage, "hated" - hated in her marriage. And the Merciful One says: "If a man has two wives."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, ״כִּי תִהְיֶיןָ״ בְּמַאי מוֹקֵים? בְּאַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּכְרַבִּי סִימַאי.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva, who says: Betrothal does not take effect with is liable a prohibition with regard to what does he establish “If a man has to a widow to a High Priest, and in accordance with Rabbi Simai.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Akiva who said: betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments, "when they shall be" - with what are they established? With a widow to a High Priest, and like Rabbi Simai.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר: מִן הַכֹּל הָיָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עוֹשֶׂה מַמְזֵר חוּץ מֵאַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל״ – חִילּוּלִים עוֹשֶׂה, וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה מַמְזֵרוּת.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Simai says: From all Rabbi Akiva would render a mamzer , except for a widow to a High Priest, as the Torah said: “And he shall not profane [ yeḥallel ]” he renders them profane [ ḥillulim ], but he does not render mamzer status.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Simlai says: Of all things, Rabbi Akiva would perform the act of mamzer except for a widow to a High Priest, for the Torah stated: "He shall not defile" - he commits defilements, but does not commit mamzerut.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב, דְּאָמַר: בּוֹאוּ וְנִצְוַוח עַל עֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בִּיאָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר? הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב אִי לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי סִימַאי קָאָתֵי – שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yeshevav, who says: Come, let us shout at Akiva ben Yosef, who would say: every a Jew may not engage in intercourse the offspring is a mamzer , This works out well according to Rabbi Yeshevav if he comes to exclude the reason of Rabbi Simai,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yeshivav, for he said: "Come, let us protest against Akiva ben Yosef who used to say: 'Anyone who does not have lineage in Israel - is he a mamzer?' It would be better for Rabbi Yeshivav if he were to engage with the teachings of Rabbi Simai - that is proper."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי טַעְמָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר, וַאֲפִילּוּ חַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה, בְּמַאי מוֹקֵים לַהּ?
human_translation: But if a reasoning of his own, and even those liable a positive mitzva, with regard to what does he interpret
llm_translation: Rather, the reason he stated is on its own merit, and even those liable for a positive commandment, with what are they establishing it for her?

hebrew_text: בִּבְעוּלָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. וּמַאי שְׁנָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ עֲשֵׂה שֶׁאֵין שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל.
human_translation: to a non-virgin to a High Priest, And what is different from Because it is a positive mitzva that is not equally applicable to all,
llm_translation: In cohabitation with the High Priest. And what is the difference? Because it involves a positive commandment that is not equal in all cases.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אַדְּמוֹקֵי לַהּ בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, נוֹקְמַהּ בְּחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: And the Rabbis, rather than establishing to liable for prohibitions, let them establish it to those liable for a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: The sages, Admokei, say to her regarding those liable for prohibitions, she takes revenge on those liable for positive commandments!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי חַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה, בְּמַאי נִינְהוּ? אִי שְׁתֵּיהֶן מִצְרִיּוֹת – שְׁתֵּיהֶן שְׂנוּאוֹת, אִי אַחַת מִצְרִית וְאַחַת יִשְׂרְאֵלִית – שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים מֵעַם אֶחָד בָּעֵינַן, אִי בְּעוּלָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל – מִי כְּתִיב ״תִּהְיֶיןָ לְכֹהֵן״?
human_translation: These liable a positive mitzva, what are they? If both Egyptian they are both hated, If one is an Egyptian woman and the other a Jewish woman we require “two wives” from the same nation, If a non-virgin to a High Priest, is it written: If a priest has
llm_translation: These are obligated in a positive commandment, with what are they counted? If both are Egyptian - both are hated, if one is Egyptian and one is Israelite - we require two women from the same people, if she is married to the High Priest - who is it written "she shall be for the priest"?

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? בְּעַל כּוּרְחֵיךְ שִׁבְקֵיהּ לִקְרָא דְּהָוֵי דָּחֵיק, וּמוֹקֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: But Rabbi Akiva, You are forced to leave this verse as it establishes itself as a difficult
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva? The owner of your liver let him read, for it will be pressed, and he will save his soul.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מִי שֶׁאֵין לָהּ עָלָיו וְכוּ׳. שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״שְׁבוּ לָכֶם פֹּה עִם הַחֲמוֹר״ – עַם הַדּוֹמֶה לַחֲמוֹר. אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשֵׁי,
human_translation: And any where cannot with him From where do we a Canaanite maidservant Rav Huna says: The verse states “You abide here with [ im ] the donkey” a nation [ am ] similar to a donkey; We have found that betrothal is ineffective with
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And anyone who does not have upon him, etc. Where is a Canaanite maidservant derived from? Rav Huna said: The verse states: "Stay here with the donkey" - a people similar to a donkey. We find that one does not acquire sanctity through her.

hebrew_text: וְלָדָהּ כְּמוֹתָהּ מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדֹנֶיהָ״.
human_translation: from where do we her offspring is like her? As the verse states “The wife and her children shall be her master’s”
llm_translation: "And she shall give birth like her death, from where do we derive this? As the verse states: 'The woman and her children shall belong to her master.'"

hebrew_text: נׇכְרִית מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תִתְחַתֵּן בָּם״. אַשְׁכַּחְנָא דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, וְלָדָהּ כְּמוֹתָהּ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: From where do we a gentile woman The verse states: “Neither shall you make marriages with them” We have found that betrothal is ineffective with her; from where do we her offspring is like her?
llm_translation: Foreign woman, from where do we derive? Scripture says: "You shall not intermarry with them." We found that one does not acquire through her betrothal, and her offspring is like her, from where do we derive?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יָסִיר אֶת בִּנְךָ מֵאַחֲרַי״ – בִּנְךָ הַבָּא מִיִּשְׂרְאֵלִית קָרוּי בִּנְךָ, וְאֵין בִּנְךָ הַבָּא מִן הַנׇּכְרִית קָרוּי בִּנְךָ, אֶלָּא בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: As the verse states for he will turn away your son from following Me” your son, from a Jewish woman is called “your son” but your son from a gentile woman is not called your son, but her son.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: As the verse states, "When he takes your son from after me" - your son who comes from an Israelite woman is called your son, and your son who comes from a non-Jewish woman is not called your son, but rather her son.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בֶּן בִּתְּךָ הַבָּא מִן הַנׇּכְרִי – קָרוּי בִּנְךָ. נֵימָא קָסָבַר רָבִינָא נׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר?
human_translation: Ravina said: Learn from the son of your daughter, born to a gentile, is called your son Shall we say Ravina holds a gentile or slave who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer ?
llm_translation: Ravina said: Hear from it: a son of your daughter who comes from a non-Jew - is called your son. Should we say that Ravina holds that a non-Jew and a slave who comes upon a Jewish woman - the offspring is a mamzer?

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּכָשֵׁר לָא הָוֵי, מַמְזֵר לָא הָוֵי, פָּסוּל מִיקְּרֵי.
human_translation: Although he is not a fit he is not a mamzer . he is called disqualified.
llm_translation: Let it be that it is valid, it is not; a mamzer, it is not; disqualified from the outset.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בְּשִׁבְעָה גּוֹיִם כְּתִיב, שְׁאָר אוּמּוֹת מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יָסִיר אֶת בִּנְךָ״ – לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל הַמְּסִירִים.
human_translation: That is written with regard to the seven nations From where do we other nations? The verse states “For he will turn away your son to include all those who might turn away,
llm_translation: That one in seven nations it is written, the rest of the nations from where? Scripture says: "When he removes his son" - to include all who remove.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּדָרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִּקְרָא. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Shimon, who expounds the reason the verse But according to the Rabbis, what is the reason,
llm_translation: The Gemara left it for Rabbi Shimon, who interprets the reason of the verse. Rather, for the Rabbis, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאַחַר כֵּן תָּבוֹא אֵלֶיהָ וּבְעַלְתָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״ – מִכְּלָל דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: The verse states “And after that you may go in to her and be her husband, by inference that at the outset, betrothal would not take effect with her,
llm_translation: The verse says: "And afterwards you shall come to her and marry her, etc." - From the fact that initially you did not engage in betrothal with her.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין, וְלָדָהּ כְּמוֹתָהּ מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי תִהְיֶיןָ לְאִישׁ... וְיָלְדוּ לוֹ״ – כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״כִּי תִּהְיֶינָה״, קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְיָלְדוּ לוֹ״. וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״כִּי תִּהְיֶינָה״ – לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְיָלְדוּ לוֹ״.
human_translation: We found betrothal is ineffective with her; from where do we her child is like her? the verse states: “If a man has and they have borne him Anywhere that we read: “If he has,” we read: “And they have borne him,” And anywhere that we do not read: “If he has,” we do not read: “And they have borne him,”
llm_translation: We found that if she did not become pregnant from him, where is the source that she should be like her death? The verse says: "When a woman... and they shall bear children for him" - wherever we find the phrase "when they are," we find the phrase "and they shall bear children for him." And wherever we do not find the phrase "when they are," we do not find the phrase "and they shall bear children for him."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שִׁפְחָה נָמֵי! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדֹנֶיהָ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְתַנְיָא:
human_translation: If so, maidservant too, Yes, it is indeed so; But why do I “The wife and her children shall be her master’s”? for that which is taught
llm_translation: Thus: maidservant, she is not! Thus: she is not. Rather, "the woman and her children shall belong to her master" - why do I need it? As it is taught:

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לְשִׁפְחָתוֹ: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ בַּת חוֹרִין, וּוְלָדִךְ עֶבֶד״ – הַוָּלָד כְּמוֹתָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִים, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדֹנֶיהָ״.
human_translation: one who says to his maidservant: You are hereby a free woman but your offspring a slave, the offspring is like her. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. And the Rabbis say: statement is upheld, because it is stated: “The wife and her children shall be her master’s”
llm_translation: The one who says to his maidservant, "Behold, you are a free woman, and your offspring is a slave" - the offspring is like her, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. And the sages say: his words are upheld, as it is stated: "The woman and her children shall belong to her master."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רָבָא: אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: What is the derivation Rava said: to of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili,
llm_translation: What is the Talmud? Rava said: "AdRabbi Yosei HaGalili."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יְכוֹלִין מַמְזֵרִין לִיטָּהֵר. כֵּיצַד? מַמְזֵר שֶׁנָּשָׂא שִׁפְחָה, הַוָּלָד – עֶבֶד, שִׁיחְרְרוֹ – נִמְצָא הַבֵּן בֶּן חוֹרִין. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עֶבֶד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: Mamzerim can be purified, How so? a mamzer who married maidservant, offspring is a slave. emancipates him, son is found a freeman, Rabbi Eliezer says: this is a mamzer slave.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Tarfon says: Mamzerim can become purified. How so? A mamzer who marries a maidservant, the offspring - a slave, if he frees him - the son is found to be free. Rabbi Eliezer says: This one is a slave mamzer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לְכַתְּחִילָּה קָאָמַר, אוֹ דִיעֲבַד קָאָמַר? תָּא שְׁמַע: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: טִיהַרְתָּ אֶת הַזְּכָרִים, וְלֹא טִיהַרְתָּ אֶת הַנְּקֵיבוֹת.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Tarfon state ab initio , or he state after the fact, Come hear said to Rabbi Tarfon: You have purified the male but you have not purified the female
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, iba'ya lehu: Rabbi Tarfon lekhatkhila ka'amar, o didi'avad ka'amar? Ta shema: amru lo leRabbi Tarfon: tiher'ta et hazekharim, velo tiher'ta et hanekivot. English translation: The Gemara raises a question: Did Rabbi Tarfon initially say this, or did he say it after the fact? Come and hear: They said to Rabbi Tarfon: You purified the males, but you did not purify the females.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ לְכַתְּחִילָּה קָאָמַר, מַמְזֶרֶת נָמֵי תִּינְּסִיב לְעַבְדָּא! עֶבֶד אֵין לוֹ חַיִיס.
human_translation: And if you say stated ab initio a mamzeret should also marry slave A slave has no lineage.
llm_translation: And if you say "to begin with" he said, a mamzeret will be married to a slave! A slave has no rights.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּאוּשְׁפִּיזְכָּנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי מַמְזֵר הֲוָה, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אַקְדֵּמְתָּךְ – טַהַרְתִּינְהוּ לִבְנָךְ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְכַתְּחִילָּה – שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דִּיעֲבַד, מַאי נִיהוּ?
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Simlai’s host was a mamzer , and said to him: Had I earlier, I would have purified your sons Granted, if you say ab initio , well But if you say after the fact, what was
llm_translation: Come and hear: The household members of Rabbi Simlai were suspicious that he was a mamzer, and they said to him: If you have preceded us - we have purified your children. If you say it is acceptable from the outset - it is good, but if you say it happened incidentally, what is the law?

hebrew_text: דְּמַנְסֵיב לֵיהּ עֵצָה וְאָמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל גְּנוֹב וְאִיזְדַּבַּן בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי. וּבִשְׁנֵי דְּרַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי עֶבֶד עִבְרִי מִי הֲוָה? וְהָאָמַר מָר: אִין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לְכַתְּחִילָּה קָאָמַר – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן.
human_translation: that advised him by saying: Go steal, and be sold as a Hebrew slave, But in the days of Rabbi Simlai, was a Hebrew slave But didn’t the Master say: a Hebrew slave is practiced only when the Jubilee is practiced, Rather, isn’t it conclude from Rabbi Tarfon spoke ab initio , conclude from Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon.
llm_translation: He consulted with him a plan and said to him: Go steal and be captured with a Hebrew slave. And in the case of Rabbi Simlai, was the Hebrew slave his? And the Master said: A Hebrew slave is only common when the Jubilee year is common! Rather, did Rabbi Tarfon not hear it initially – he heard it. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Tarfon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עֶבֶד מַמְזֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר – דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לוֹ״ – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר פְּסוּלוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: This is a mamzer slave. Rabbi Elazar said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? As the verse states of his follows his flawed
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Behold, this is a mamzer. Rabbi Elazar said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? - For he said a verse: "to him" - go after his disqualification.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הַהוּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: ״לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם לְבֵית אֲבֹתָם״ כְּתִיב, אֲתָא ״לוֹ״ אַפְּקֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, that to a Jew who married a mamzeret . enter your mind to say it is written: “By their families, by their fathers’ houses” “of his” comes to exclude him
llm_translation: The Sages: That individual in Israel who married a mamzeret. Do you think I would say, "To their families, to their fathers' houses" is written, he comes to "him."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתַב ״לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם לְבֵית אֲבֹתָם״ אֲתָא ״לוֹ״ אַפְּקֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתִיב ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדֹנֶיהָ״, אֲתָא ״לוֹ״ אַפְּקֵיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן: כׇּל וָלָד בִּמְעֵי שִׁפְחָה כְּנַעֲנִית כְּוָלָד בִּמְעֵי בְּהֵמָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer not even though wrote: “By their families, by their fathers’ houses,” “of his” comes and excludes him? Here too, although it is written: “The wife and her children shall be her master’s” “of his” comes and excludes him. And the Rabbis, Any offspring in the womb of a Canaanite maidservant is considered like the offspring in an animal’s womb.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer: Not even though it is written "to their families, to their fathers' houses" does "to him" come to include him, here too, not even though it is written "the woman and her children shall belong to her master" does "to him" come to include him. And the Rabbis: Every child born from a maidservant is like a Canaanite slave; just as a child born from an animal's womb, its status is like that of an animal.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאוֹמֵר
llm_translation: We will return to you, O sayer.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִים עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל: כָּהֲנֵי, לְוִיֵּי, יִשְׂרְאֵלֵי, חֲלָלֵי, גֵּירֵי, וַחֲרוֹרֵי, מַמְזֵירֵי, נְתִינֵי, שְׁתוּקֵי, וַאֲסוּפֵי.
human_translation: ten lineage, ascended from Babylonia Priests; Levites; Israelites; priests disqualified due to flawed lineage [ ḥalalim ]; converts, and emancipated slaves; mamzerim ; Gibeonites, children of unknown paternity [ shetuki ]; and foundlings.
llm_translation: Ten lineages ascended from Babylon: Kohanim, Leviim, Yisraelim, Chalalim, Gerim, and Charorei, Mamzeirei, Netinim, Shutukei, and Asufei.

hebrew_text: כָּהֲנֵי לְוִיֵּי וְיִשְׂרְאֵלֵי – מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה. לְוִיֵּי יִשְׂרְאֵלֵי חֲלָלֵי גֵּירֵי וַחֲרוֹרִי – מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: priests, Levites, and Israelites, permitted to marry one another. Levites Israelites, ḥalalim , converts, and emancipated slaves, permitted to marry one another.
llm_translation: Priests of Levi and Israelites - permitted to enter one another. Levi Israelites, converts, and freed slaves - permitted to enter one another.

hebrew_text: גִּירֵי וַחֲרוֹרֵי מַמְזֵירֵי וּנְתִינֵי שְׁתוּקֵי וַאֲסוּפֵי – כּוּלָּם מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵם: שְׁתוּקִי כֹּל שֶׁהוּא מַכִּיר אֶת אִמּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר אֶת אָבִיו, אֲסוּפִי – כֹּל שֶׁנֶּאֱסָף מִן הַשּׁוּק, וְאֵינוֹ מַכִּיר לֹא אֶת אָבִיו וְלֹא אִמּוֹ. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הָיָה קוֹרֵא לַשְּׁתוּקִי: ״בְּדוּקִי״.
human_translation: converts, and emancipated slaves, mamzerim , and Gibeonites, children of unknown paternity [ shetuki ], and foundlings, permitted all of to marry one another. And these are A shetuki any who knows his mother but does not know his father. A foundling anyone who was collected from the marketplace and doesn’t know neither his father nor his mother. Abba Shaul would call a shetuki beduki .
llm_translation: The young children of the marketplace, the young children of the alleyways, the silent ones, and the gathered ones - all of them are permitted to intermarry. And these are they: the silent one - anyone who recognizes his mother but does not recognize his father, the gathered one - anyone who was gathered from the marketplace and does not recognize either his father or his mother. Abba Saul used to call the silent one "Beduki."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִין עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל. מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל״? נִיתְנֵי ״הָלְכוּ לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל״! מִילְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְקַמְתָּ וְעָלִיתָ אֶל הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִבְחַר ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ גָּבוֹהַּ מִכׇּל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל גְּבוֹהָה מִכׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת.
human_translation: ten lineage ascended from Babylonia. Why does specifically teach Ascended from Babylonia? Let him teach went to Eretz Yisrael. He teaches us a matter in passing, as it is taught “And you shall arise and go up to the place that the Lord, your God, shall choose” teaches that the Temple is higher than all of Eretz Yisrael, And Eretz Yisrael is higher than all of the lands.
llm_translation: Gemara: Ten genealogical lines ascended from Babylon. What is the meaning of the teaching "ascended from Babylon"? It should have said "they went up to the land of Israel"! The matter is clear from its context, as it is taught: "And you shall arise and go up to the place which the Lord your God shall choose," which teaches that the Temple is higher than all the land of Israel, and the land of Israel is higher than all the other lands.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ גָּבוֹהַּ מִכׇּל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: Granted, the Temple is higher than all of Eretz Yisrael. This is that which is written:
llm_translation: In truth, the Temple was higher than all the land of Israel - as it is written:

hebrew_text: ״דִּבְרֵי רִיבֹת בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ וְקַמְתָּ וְעָלִיתָ״, אֶלָּא אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל גְּבוֹהָה מִכׇּל אֲרָצוֹת מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״לָכֵן הִנֵּה יָמִים בָּאִים נְאֻם ה׳ וְלֹא יֹאמְרוּ עוֹד חַי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם. כִּי אִם חַי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה וַאֲשֶׁר הֵבִיא אֶת זֶרַע בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ צָפוֹנָה וּמִכֹּל הָאֲרָצוֹת אֲשֶׁר הִדַּחְתִּים שָׁם״.
human_translation: “Matters of controversy within your gates, and you shall arise and go up But from where do we that Eretz Yisrael is higher than all lands? As it is written: “Therefore behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when they shall no more say: As the Lord lives, Who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt, but: As the Lord lives, Who brought up and Who led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had driven them”
llm_translation: "Words of strife in your gates, and you shall arise and ascend," but is the land of Israel higher than all other lands? As it is written: "Therefore, behold, days are coming, says the Lord, when it will no longer be said, 'As the Lord lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt.' But, 'As the Lord lives, who brought up and who led the offspring of the house of Israel from the north land and from all the lands where He had driven them.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל״? נִתְנֵי ״עָלוּ לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל״! מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא עָלָה עֶזְרָא מִבָּבֶל עַד שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ כְּסוֹלֶת נְקִיָּה וְעָלָה.
human_translation: why does specifically teach: Ascended from Babylonia? Let him teach: Ascended to Eretz Yisrael. supports Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: Ezra did not ascend from Babylonia until he made it like fine flour, and he ascended
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the teaching "they ascended from Babylon"? It should be taught as "they ascended to the land of Israel"! This supports Rabbi Elazar, for Rabbi Elazar said: Ezra did not ascend from Babylon until he made it like pure fine flour, and then he ascended.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: ״עָלוּ״ – מֵאֵילֵיהֶם, תְּנַן. וְרָבָא אָמַר: ״הֶעֱלוּם״ תְּנַן. וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא עָלָה עֶזְרָא מִבָּבֶל עַד שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ כְּסוֹלֶת נְקִיָּה וְעָלָה.
human_translation: was stated Abaye said: We learned ascended, of their own And Rava said: We learned: brought them up, And they disagree about of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: Ezra did not ascend from Babylonia until he made it like fine flour, and he ascended.
llm_translation: It was stated: Abbaye said: "They went up" - from their strength, as we learned. And Rava said: "They ascended" we learned. And they disputed in the school of Rabbi Eliezer, for Rabbi Eliezer said: Ezra did not ascend from Babylon until he made it like pure fine flour and then ascended.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי – לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. רָבָא – אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: אַפְרוֹשֵׁי אַפְרוֹשִׁינְהוּ וּמִנַּפְשַׁיְיהוּ סְלִיקוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: בְּעַל כֻּרְחַיְיהוּ אַסּוֹקִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye does not of Rabbi Elazar, Rava does accept of Rabbi Elazar. if you wish, say that everyone accepts of Rabbi Elazar, and here they disagree with regard to this: Sage, holds separated and ascended of their own desire. And Sage, holds he brought them up against their will.
llm_translation: Abaye - does not have the ruling of Rabbi Elazar. Rava - has the ruling of Rabbi Elazar. If you wish, say: In all the world there are those who have the ruling of Rabbi Elazar, and here they are in dispute: one Master holds: they should spread out their kerchiefs and take the produce for themselves, and one Master holds: they should engage in partnership with them.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״עָלוּ״, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל אֲרָצוֹת עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִיסָּה לְבָבֶל. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״הֶעֱלוּם״, מִידָּע יַדְעִינְהוּ! נְהִי דְּיָדְעִי לְהָהוּא דָּרָא, לְדָרָא אַחֲרִינֵי לָא יָדְעִי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says they ascended this is that Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: all lands is muddled to Eretz Yisrael, and Eretz Yisrael is muddled to Babylonia. But according to the one who says he brought them up, knew Though was known to that generation, it was not known to other generations.
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says: "they went up," that is what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: all lands are considered like dough compared to the land of Israel, and the land of Israel is like dough compared to Babylon. But according to the one who says: "they were exiled," let them know! Even if one knows the generation in which they live, they do not know the subsequent generations.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״עָלוּ״, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאֶקְבְּצֵם אֶל הַנָּהָר הַבָּא עַל אַחֲוָה וַנַּחֲנֶה שָׁם יָמִים שְׁלֹשָׁה וָאָבִינָה בָעָם וּבַכֹּהֲנִים וּמִבְּנֵי לֵוִי לֹא מָצָאתִי שָׁם״.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says they ascended this is that is written “And I gathered them together to the river that runs to Ahava, and we camped there for three days; and I viewed the people and the priests, and found there none of the sons of Levi”
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "they went up," that is as it is written: "And I gathered them by the river that runs to Ahava, and we camped there for three days. And I examined the people and the priests, but I did not find any Levites there."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״הֶעֱלוּם״, הָא מִיזְהָר זְהִירִי? נְהִי דְּאִיזְּהוּר בִּפְסוּלִים, בִּכְשֵׁירִים לָא אִיזְדְּהוּר.
human_translation: But according to the one who says he brought them up, they were careful Though they were careful with regard to flawed with regard to unflawed they were not careful
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "he'alum," behold, he should be cautious? Even though he is cautious with invalid items, with valid items he is not cautious.

hebrew_text: כָּהֲנֵי לְוִיֵּי וְיִשְׂרְאֵלֵי. מְנָלַן דִּסְלִיקוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּשְׁבוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם וּמִן הָעָם וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִים וְהַשּׁוֹעֲרִים וְהַנְּתִינִים בְּעָרֵיהֶם וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּעָרֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: priests, Levites, and Israelites. From where do we that they ascended? As it is written: “So the priests, and the Levites, and some of the people, and the singers, and the gatekeepers, and the Gibeonites dwelt in their cities, and all of Israel in their cities”
llm_translation: Priests of Levi and Israelites. From where did they ascend? As it is written: "And the priests, the Levites, and some of the people, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the Nethinim, dwelt in their cities, and all Israel in their cities."

hebrew_text: חֲלָלֵי גֵּירֵי וַחֲרוֹרֵי. חֲלָלֵי מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה חֲזָקָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִבְּנֵי הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי חֳבַיָּה בְּנֵי הַקּוֹץ בְּנֵי בַרְזִלַּי אֲשֶׁר לָקַח מִבְּנוֹת בַּרְזִלַּי הַגִּלְעָדִי אִשָּׁה וַיִּקָּרֵא עַל שְׁמָם. אֵלֶּה בִּקְשׁוּ כְתָבָם הַמִּתְיַחְשִׂים וְלֹא נִמְצָאוּ וַיְגֹאֲלוּ מִן הַכְּהֻנָּה. וַיֹּאמֶר הַתִּרְשָׁתָא לָהֶם אֲשֶׁר לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִקֹּדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים עַד עֲמֹד כֹּהֵן לְאוּרִים וּלְתֻמִּים״.
human_translation: ḥalalim , converts, and emancipated slaves From where do we ḥalalim As it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Great a presumptive status, as it is stated: “And of the children of the priests: The children of Habaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their name. These sought the registry of their genealogy, but it was not found. Therefore, they were deemed polluted and put out from the priesthood. And the Tirshatha said to them that they should not eat of the offerings of the most sacred order until there arose a priest with the Urim VeTummim ”
llm_translation: The desecrated of Geirei and the pierced. The desecrated of Menalan? For it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Great and strong, as it is said: "And of the sons of the priests: the sons of Hobaiah, the sons of Hakkoz, the sons of Barzillai, who took a wife from the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite and was called by their name. These sought their register among those enrolled in the genealogies, but it was not found there, so they were excluded from the priesthood. The governor told them that they were not to partake of the most holy food until a priest with Urim and Thummim should arise."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר לָהֶם: הֲרֵי אַתֶּם בְּחֶזְקַתְכֶם. בַּמֶּה הֱיִיתֶם אוֹכְלִים בַּגּוֹלָה, בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל? אַף כָּאן נָמֵי, בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל.
human_translation: and said to them: You have your presumptive status. Of what did you partake in exile? of the consecrated the boundaries, Here too, of the consecrated the boundaries.
llm_translation: And he said to them: "Behold, you are in your presumption. With what were you eating in exile, with the holy things of the border? Also here, with the holy things of the border."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מַעֲלִים מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין? הָנֵי דַּאֲכוּל בִּתְרוּמָה אָתוּ לְאַסּוֹקִינְהוּ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּרִיעַ חֶזְקָתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And according to the one who says one elevates to lineage, teruma , Those who partake of teruma will be elevated There it is different, as their presumptive status had been weakened.
llm_translation: And for the one who says: They elevate from terumah for genealogical purposes? Those who eat terumah come to engage with them! It is different there, for their strength is weakened.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי גְּדוֹלָה חֲזָקָה? דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אֲכוּל בִּתְרוּמָה דְרַבָּנַן, וּלְבַסּוֹף אֲכוּל בִּתְרוּמָה דְאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: But what great a presumptive status? that initially they would partake of teruma by rabbinic law, and afterward they would partake of teruma by Torah law.
llm_translation: And rather what is the greatness of strength? That initially he ate from the tithes of the Rabbis, and ultimately he ate from the tithes of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי בִּדְרַבָּנַן – אֲכוּל, בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא – לָא אֲכוּל, וְכִי מַסְּקִינַן מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין – מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מִדְּרַבָּנַן לָא מַסְּקִינַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Actually, now also, they would partake of by rabbinic law, they would not partake of by Torah law, And when we elevate to lineage teruma , by Torah law, by rabbinic law, we do not elevate
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always one should be stringent with the Rabbis - to eat, with regards to the Torah - not to eat. And when we establish a ruling regarding terumah for genealogy - it is from the Torah, we do not establish a ruling from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי גְּדוֹלָה חֲזָקָה? דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם תְּרוּמָה דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, לְבַסּוֹף – אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם תְּרוּמָה דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, בִּדְרַבָּנַן – אֲכוּל, בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא – לָא אֲכוּל.
human_translation: If so, What Great a presumptive status? that initially, there was no to decree due to teruma by Torah law, Afterward, although there was reason to decree due to teruma by Torah law, to partake of teruma by rabbinic law, not eat teruma by Torah law.
llm_translation: So, what is the case of "great strength"? Initially, there is no need to separate due to the obligation of the biblical terumah, but ultimately, even though there is no need to separate due to the obligation of the biblical terumah, by rabbinic law - it is permitted to eat, by biblical law - it is not permitted to eat.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַתִּרְשָׁתָא לָהֶם אֲשֶׁר לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִקֹּדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים״ – בְּקֹדֶשׁ הַקָּדָשִׁים הוּא דְּלֹא יֹאכְל[וּ], הָא כֹּל מִידֵּי נֵיכוֹל!
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And the Tirshatha said to them that they should not eat of the offerings of the most sacred order [ kodesh hakodashim ]” it is from the offerings of the most sacred order that they may not eat, but anything they may eat,
llm_translation: "And it is written, 'And Darius said to them, 'Let the temple be rebuilt where they may offer sacrifices with the proper sacrifices and may have joy in it and may offer burnt offerings morning and evening, as well as on Sabbaths, new moons, and appointed festivals, as is commanded in the Torah of the Lord our God forever and ever.''' - In the Holy of Holies is where they may not eat, but everything else is permissible!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: לָא מִידֵּי דְּמִיקְּרֵי קֹדֶשׁ, וְלָא מִידֵּי דְּמִיקְּרֵי קָדָשִׁים. לָא מִידֵּי דְּמִיקְּרֵי קֹדֶשׁ – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל זָר לֹא יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״, וְלָא מִידֵּי דְּמִיקְּרֵי קָדָשִׁים, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר הִיא בִּתְרוּמַת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכֵל״, וְאָמַר מָר: ״בַּמּוּרָם מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים
human_translation: This is saying: not anything that is called sacred [ kodesh ], nor anything that is called most sacred [ kodashim ]. not anything that is called sacred as it is written “No non-priest may eat of the sacred” nor anything that is called most sacred as the verse states: “And a daughter of a priest, if she is married to a non-priest, she may not eat of that which is set apart from the sacred things” And the Master says: from separated from the offerings,
llm_translation: So it is stated: Not from that which is called holy, and not from that which is called holy items. Not from that which is called holy - as it is written: "And no stranger shall eat holy things," and not from that which is called holy items, as the verse says: "But if a priest's daughter becomes a widow or divorced, and has no child and returns to her father's house as in her youth, she may eat of her father's food, but no outsider shall eat of it." And Mar said: "From the most sacred things."

hebrew_text: לֹא תֹאכֵל״.
human_translation: she may not eat.
llm_translation: "Do not eat."

hebrew_text: ״גֵּירֵי וַחֲרוֹרֵי״. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכׇל הַנִּבְדָּל מִטֻּמְאַת גּוֹיֵי הָאָרֶץ אֲלֵהֶם״.
human_translation: converts and emancipated slaves From where do we Rav Ḥisda says: As the verse states and all such as had separated themselves to them from the impurity of the nations of the land
llm_translation: "Geirei and Charorei." Where are they from? Rav Chisda said, as the verse says: "And all who separate themselves from the impurity of the nations of the land to them."

hebrew_text: מַמְזֵרֵי. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּשְׁמַע סַנְבַלַּט הַחֹרֹנִי וְטֹבִיָּה הָעֶבֶד הָעַמּוֹנִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי רַבִּים בִּיהוּדָה בַּעֲלֵי שְׁבוּעָה לוֹ כִּי חָתָן הוּא לִשְׁכַנְיָה בֶן אָרַח וִיהוֹחָנָן בְּנוֹ לָקַח אֶת בַּת מְשֻׁלָּם בֶּן בֶּרֶכְיָה״, קָסָבַר נׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: mamzerim From where do we As it is written: “And Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, heard” and it is written “For there were many in Judah sworn to him because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah the son of Arah; and his son Jehohanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah” holds a gentile or a slave who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Illegitimate children. From where do we derive this? As it is written, "And Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite," and it is also written, "For many in Judah were bound by oath to him, because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah the son of Arah, and his son Jehohanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah." He holds that a non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman – the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? וְתוּ: מִמַּאי דַּהֲווֹ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי? דִּילְמָא לָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי! וְתוּ: מִמַּאי דְּהָכָא הֲווֹ לְהוּ וּסְלִיקוּ? דִּילְמָא הָתָם הֲווֹ!
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says the offspring is a mamzer . But according to the one who says the offspring is unflawed what can be said? And furthermore, from where that had offspring Perhaps he did not have offspring, And furthermore, from where that they had here, ascended Perhaps they were there,
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says: the child is a mamzer, but for the one who says: the child is legitimate, what can be said? And furthermore: from where did he have children? Perhaps he did not have children! And furthermore: from where did they come to him and leave? Perhaps they did not come!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְאֵלֶּה הָעוֹלִים מִתֵּל מֶלַח תֵּל חַרְשָׁא כְּרוּב אַדּוֹן וְאִמֵּר, וְלֹא יָכְלוּ לְהַגִּיד בֵּית אֲבֹתָם וְזַרְעָם אִם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל הֵם״, ״תֵּל מֶלַח״ – אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁדּוֹמִים מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם לְמַעֲשֵׂה סְדוֹם שֶׁנֶּהֶפְכָה לְתֵל מֶלַח. ״תֵּל חַרְשָׁא״ – זֶה שֶׁקּוֹרֵא ״אַבָּא״ וְאִמּוֹ מְשַׁתַּקְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, from here: “And these were they that ascended from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer; but they could not tell their fathers’ houses, nor their offspring, whether they were of Israel” “Tel Melah”; these are people whose actions were similar to the act of Sodom, which was turned into a mound of salt [ tel melaḥ ]. “Tel Harsha”; this who calls father, and his mother silences him,
llm_translation: Rather from here: "And these are the ones who ascend from Tel Melach, Tel Charsha like a lion, Lord and say, 'and they could not explain to their fathers' house and their seed if they are from Israel,'" "Tel Melach" - these are people whose deeds resemble the deeds of Sodom that turned into a pillar of salt. "Tel Charsha" - this is one who calls his father "Abba" and his mother silences him.

hebrew_text: ״וְלֹא יָכְלוּ לְהַגִּיד בֵּית אֲבֹתָם וְזַרְעָם אִם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל הֵם״ – זֶה הוּא אֲסוּפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱסַף מִן הַשּׁוּק. ״כְּרוּב אַדּוֹן וְאִמֵּר״ – אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָמַר אָדוֹן: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יִהְיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְפָנַי חֲשׁוּבִים כִּכְרוּב וְהֵם שָׂמוּ עַצְמָם כְּנָמֵר. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָמַר אָדוֹן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׂמוּ עַצְמָם כְּנָמֵר – הֵן חֲשׁוּבִים לְפָנַי כִּכְרוּב.
human_translation: “But they could not tell their fathers’ houses, nor their offspring, whether they were of Israel”; this a foundling who is gathered from the marketplace. “Cherub, Addon, and Immer,” Rabbi Abbahu says The Master [ Adon ], said: I said the Jewish shall be as important before Me as a cherub, but they made themselves as a leopard [ namer ]. There are who say Rabbi Abbahu said: The Master [ Adon ] said although they made themselves as a leopard [ namer ], they are as important before Me as a cherub.
llm_translation: "And they could not declare their fathers' houses and their seed, whether they were of Israel" – this is a collection that was gathered from the market. "Like a cherub, Adonai, and say" – Rabbi Abbahu said: Adonai said: I have said, let the Israelites be considered before Me like cherubs, but they have made themselves like leopards. Some say Rabbi Abbahu said: Adonai said: Even though they have made themselves like leopards, they are considered before Me like cherubs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: כׇּל הַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ חֲרָשׁוֹ לְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ וּזְרָעוֹ מֶלַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵלֶּה הָעוֹלִים מִתֵּל מֶלַח תֵּל חַרְשָׁא״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: anyone who marries a woman who is not suited for him the verse ascribes him as though he plowed [ ḥarash ] all the entire world and sowed it with salt [ melaḥ ], as it is stated “And these were they that ascended from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha.”
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: Anyone who marries a woman who is not fitting for him, the verse ascribes to him as if he had sown his seed in salt, as it is stated: "And these are the going up from Tel Melach, Tel Ḥarsha" (Ezra 2:59).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה לְשׁוּם מָמוֹן – הָוַיִין לוֹ בָּנִים שֶׁאֵינָן מְהוּגָּנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּה׳ בָּגָדוּ כִּי בָנִים זָרִים יָלָדוּ״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Adda says Rav says: anyone who marries a woman for the sake of money, he will have offspring inappropriately, as it is stated: “They have dealt treacherously against the Lord, for they have begotten strange children;
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Adda said Rav: Anyone who marries a woman for the sake of money - will have children who are not respectable, as it is stated: "They have dealt treacherously against the Lord, for they have begotten strange children."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר מָמוֹן פָּלֵט, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַתָּה יֹאכְלֵם חֹדֶשׁ אֶת חֶלְקֵיהֶם״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר: ״חֶלְקוֹ״ – וְלֹא חֶלְקָהּ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חֶלְקֵיהֶם״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״חֹדֶשׁ״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: חֹדֶשׁ נִכְנַס וְחֹדֶשׁ יָצָא וּמָמוֹנָם אָבַד.
human_translation: And lest you say money was spared, the verse states: “Now shall the new moon devour them with their portions,” And lest you say his portion but not the portion the verse states “their portions” And lest you say after a long time, the verse states: “The new moon.” From where may be inferred Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: A month comes and a month goes, and their money is lost.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And perhaps you will say, "It is the money of a fugitive slave." The Scripture states: "Now the month shall consume them." And perhaps you will say, "His portion" – and not her portion, the Scripture states: "Their portions." And perhaps you will say to include the majority of the time – the Scripture states: "month." What is the implication? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The month enters and the month exits, and their money is lost.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב אַדָּא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי סַלָּא אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: כׇּל הַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ אֵלִיָּהוּ כּוֹפְתוֹ וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רוֹצְעוֹ. וְתָנָא: עַל כּוּלָּם אֵלִיָּהוּ כּוֹתֵב וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא חוֹתֵם: אוֹי לוֹ לַפּוֹסֵל אֶת זַרְעוֹ, וְלַפּוֹגֵם אֶת מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ, וְלַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ, אֵלִיָּהוּ כּוֹפְתוֹ וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רוֹצְעוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Rav Adda says, and some say Rabbi Salla says Rav Hamnuna says: anyone who marries a woman who is not suited for him Elijah binds him and the Holy One, Blessed be He, straps him. And taught: Concerning all of them, Elijah writes and the Holy One, Blessed be He, signs Woe to he who disqualifies his offspring, and who brings a flaw to his family and who marries a woman who is not suited for him Elijah binds him and the Holy One, Blessed be He, straps him.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Adda said, and some say it was Rabbi Sala, said Rav Hamnuna: Anyone who marries a woman who is not suitable for him, Elijah coerces him and the Holy One, blessed be He, is displeased. And it was taught: Concerning all of them, Elijah writes and the Holy One, blessed be He, seals. Woe to him who disqualifies his seed, and who corrupts his family, and who marries a woman who is not suitable for him, Elijah coerces him and the Holy One, blessed be He, is displeased.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַפּוֹסֵל – פָּסוּל. וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר בִּשְׁבָחָא לְעוֹלָם, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּמוּמוֹ פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: And anyone who disqualifies is flawed he never speaks in praise And Shmuel says: he disqualifies with his flaw.
llm_translation: "And all who disqualifies - disqualified. And he is not speaking in praise forever, and Samuel said: With his blemish he disqualifies."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּמִנְּהַרְדְּעָא דְּעָל לְבֵי מַטְבְּחַיָּא בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי בִּישְׂרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נְטַר עַד דְּשָׁקֵיל (לְ)שַׁמָּעֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל וְנִיתֵּיב לָךְ. אֲמַר: מַאן יְהוּדָה בַּר שְׁוִיסְקֵאל דְּקָדֵים לִי, דְּשָׁקֵל מִן קַמַּאי?! אֲזַלוּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה. שַׁמְּתֵיהּ. אֲמַרוּ: רְגִיל דְּקָרֵי אִינָשֵׁי ״עַבְדֵי״. אַכְרֵיז עֲלֵיהּ דְּעַבְדָּא הוּא.
human_translation: a certain man from Neharde’a who entered a butcher shop in Pumbedita. He said to them: Give me meat. They said to him: Wait until the servant of Rav Yehuda bar Yeḥezkel has taken and we will give to you. said Who is Yehuda bar Sheviske’el, that he should precede me, that he should take before me? They went told Rav Yehuda excommunicated him, They said was in the habit of calling people slaves. proclaimed about him that he is a slave
llm_translation: That man from Nehardea went to the slaughterhouse in Pumbedita. He said to them: "Give me meat." They said to him: "Wait until we hear from Rav Yehudah bar Yechezkel and we will provide for you." He said: "Who is Yehudah bar Sheviskel who is more important than me, that you should wait for his approval?!" They went and told Rav Yehudah. He remained silent. They said: "People usually call slaves 'avadai.' Proclaim that he is a slave."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל הָהוּא אַזְמְנֵיהּ לְדִינָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אַיְיתִי פִּיתְקָא דְהַזְמָנָא. אֲזַל רַב יְהוּדָה לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵיזִיל אוֹ לָא אֵיזִיל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵיזָל לָא מִיבְּעֵי לָךְ לְמֵיזַל, מִשּׁוּם דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה אַתְּ, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה קוּם זִיל.
human_translation: That went and summoned to judgment before Rav Naḥman, summons arrived Rav Yehuda went before Rav Huna said to him: Should I go or should I not go? said to him: to go, you are not required to go, since you are a great man But due to the honor of the Exilarch’s house, get up go.
llm_translation: He went to summon him for judgment before Rav Nachman. He brought the document of summons. Rav Yehuda went to summon him before Rav Huna. He said to him: Shall I go or not go? He said to him: If you do not want to go, it is not necessary for you to go, because you are a great man, but out of respect for the house of the leader, get up and go.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּקָעָבֵיד מַעֲקֶה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר אִידִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּתְמַנָּה אָדָם פַּרְנָס עַל הַצִּבּוּר אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוּרְתָּא דְגוּנְדְּרִיתָא הוּא דְּקָא עָבֵידְנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סְנֵיא ״מַעֲקֶה״ דִּכְתִיב בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אוֹ ״מְחִיצָה״ דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: arrived found constructing a parapet. said to Does the Master not hold in accordance with that Rav Huna bar Idi says Shmuel says: Once a person has been appointed a leader of the community, he is prohibited from performing labor before three said to him: It is a little fence [ gundarita ] that I am constructing. said to him: Is ma’akeh , which is written in the Torah, or meḥitza , which the Sages said, distasteful
llm_translation: He found a shovel. He said to him: The master did not think like that which Rav Huna son of Idi said in the name of Shmuel: Once a person is appointed as a leader over the community, it is forbidden for him to engage in work in the presence of three? He said to him: It is a shovel of a gardener that I am using. He said to him: Is it the "shovel" that is written in the Torah, or the "fence" that the Rabbis spoke of?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יֵתִיב מָר אַקַּרְפִּיטָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמִי סְנֵי ״סַפְסָל״ דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן, אוֹ ״אִיצְטְבָא״ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵיכוֹל מָר אֶתְרוּנְגָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״אֶתְרוּנְגָּא״ תִּילְתָּא בְּרָמוּת רוּחָא – אוֹ ״אֶתְרוֹג״ כִּדְקַרְיוּהּ רַבָּנַן, אוֹ ״אֶתְרוֹגָא״ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִישְׁתֵּי מָר אַנְבָּגָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סְנֵי ״אִיסְפָּרָגוֹס״ דְּקַרְיוּהּ רַבָּנַן אוֹ ״אַנְפַּק״ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי?
human_translation: said to him: Let the Master sit on the bench [ karfita ]. said to him: Is safsal , which the Sages said, or itzteva , which people say, distasteful said to him: Let the Master eat a citron [ etronga ]. said to him: This is what Shmuel said: Anyone who says etronga one-third of a haughtiness of spirit. either etrog , as the Sages called it, or etroga , as people say said to him: Let the Master drink a cup [ anbaga ] said to him: Is ispargus , as the Sages called it, or anpak , as people say, distasteful
llm_translation: He said to him: Master, Akarpita sat. He said to him: And who is the hater of "sapṣal" that the Rabbis said, or "itsṭeva" that people say? He said to him: Let Master Akarpita come. He said to him, so said Shmuel: Anyone who says "itsrungga" a third in arrogance - or "itsrog" as the Rabbis call it, or "itsroga" as people say. He said to him: Master, Anbaga drank. He said to him: And who is the hater of "isparagos" that the Rabbis call it, or "anpaq" that people say?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תֵּיתֵי דּוֹנַג תַּשְׁקֵינַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁים בְּאִשָּׁה. קְטַנָּה הִיא. בְּפֵירוּשׁ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁים בְּאִשָּׁה כְּלָל, בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: said to him: Let Donag come pour us drinks. said to him: This is what Shmuel says: One may not make use of a woman She is a minor. Shmuel explicitly says: One may not make use of a woman at all, whether an adult or a minor.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Give me a cup, let us drink." He said to him: "Thus said Shmuel: One does not engage with a woman. She is a minor. In explanation, Shmuel said: One does not engage with a woman at all, whether she is an adult or a minor."

hebrew_text: נְשַׁדַּר לֵיהּ מָר שְׁלָמָא לְיַלְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קוֹל בָּאִשָּׁה עֶרְוָה. אֶפְשָׁר עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: Let the Master send peace to Yalta. said to him: This is what Shmuel says: A woman’s voice is nakedness, possible with a messenger. said to him: This is what Shmuel says:
llm_translation: The Master Shlama was informed that a voice was heard from a woman, naked. He said to him: So said Shmuel: "A voice from a woman is naked." It is possible through a messenger. He said to him: So said Shmuel:

hebrew_text: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹם אִשָּׁה. עַל יְדֵי בַּעְלָהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹם אִשָּׁה כְּלָל. שְׁלַחָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: שְׁרִי לֵיהּ תִּגְרֵיהּ דְּלָא נִישַׁוְּויָךְ כִּשְׁאָר עַם הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: One may not send greetings to a woman with her husband, said to him: This is what Shmuel says: One may not send greetings to a woman at all. his wife, sent to him: Release him so that he not equate you with another ignoramus.
llm_translation: One does not inquire about the well-being of a woman. Through her husband! He said to him: Thus said Shmuel: One does not inquire about the well-being of a woman at all. His wife sent to him: Release her from the vow that she is not like the rest of the common people.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי שְׁיָאטֵיהּ דְּמָר הָכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טַסְקָא דְהַזְמָנוּתָא שַׁדַּר מָר אַבָּתְרַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא שׁוּתָא דְמָר לָא גְּמִירְנָא, טַסְקָא דְהַזְמָנוּתָא מְשַׁדַּרְנָא לְמָר?! אַפֵּיק דִּיסְקָא דְהַזְמָנוּתָא מִבֵּי חָדֵיהּ וְאַחְזִי לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא גַּבְרָא וְהָא דִּסְקָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹאִיל וַאֲתָא מָר לְהָכָא לִישְׁתַּעֵי מִילֵּיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ מְחַנְּפִי רַבָּנַן אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: said to him: What is the reason the Master is here? said to him: The Master sent me a summons. said to him: Now I have not learned the Master’s speech, could I sent a summons to the Master? removed the summons from his bosom and showed it to him. said to him: Here is the man and here is the document. said to him: Since the Master has come here, let him present his statement, in order that should not say: The Sages flatter one another
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the reason that our master is silent here? He said to him: The scroll of appointment that Master Abba sent. He said to him: Now that the scroll of appointment has not been completed by our master, should we send the scroll of appointment to our master?! He took the scroll of appointment from his chest and showed it to him, he said to him: Here is the man and here is the scroll. He said to him: Since our master has come here to inquire about his words, so that the Rabbis should not say derogatory things about each other.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא שַׁמְּתֵיהּ מָר לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא? – צַיעַר שְׁלִיחָא דְרַבָּנַן. וְנַגְּדֵיהּ מָר, דְּרַב מְנַגֵּיד עַל מַאן דִּמְצַעַר שְׁלוּחָא דְרַבָּנַן. דַּעֲדִיף מִינֵּיהּ עֲבַדִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: What is the reason the Master excommunicated that man? He caused discomfort to an agent of the Sages, let the Master flog him, as Rav would flog one who causes discomfort to an agent of the Sages. I him more severely than that.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the reason that our master appointed him to that man? - The messenger of the Sages. And before him, the master, for Rav is appointed over one who diminishes the emissary of the Sages. He is preferable to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא אַכְרֵיז מָר עֲלֵיהּ דְּעַבְדָּא הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּרְגִיל דְּקָרֵי אִינָשֵׁי ״עַבְדֵי״, וְתָנֵי: כׇּל הַפּוֹסֵל – פָּסוּל, וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר בִּשְׁבָחָא לְעוֹלָם. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּמוּמוֹ פּוֹסֵל. אֵימַר דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל לְמֵיחַשׁ לֵיהּ, לְאַכְרוֹזֵי עֲלֵיהּ מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: What is the reason the Master proclaimed about him that he is a slave? said to him: is in the habit of calling people slaves, and is taught: Anyone who disqualifies is flawed he never speaks in praise And Shmuel said: He disqualifies with his flaw. say that Shmuel said to suspect him did he say to proclaim about him
llm_translation: What is the reason that the Master proclaims concerning it that it is a valid deed? He said to him: Because people commonly read "avadai" (my servants), and it was taught: Anyone who disqualifies - is disqualified, and he does not speak in praise forever. And Shmuel said: With his blemish he disqualifies. Should it be said that Shmuel said it to consider it, who said to proclaim concerning it?

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי (אֲתָא הַהוּא בַּר דִּינֵיהּ מִנְּהַרְדָּעֵי). אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא בַּר דִּינֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה: לְדִידִי קָרֵית לִי ״עַבְדָּא״, דְּאָתֵינָא מִבֵּית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי מַלְכָּא?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל דְּאָמַר מִדְּבֵית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי קָאָתֵינָא – עַבְדָּא הוּא.
human_translation: Meanwhile, that litigant arrived from Neharde’a. That litigant said to Rav Yehuda: You call me a slave? I, who come from the house of the Hasmonean kings? said to him: This is what Shmuel says: Anyone who says: I come from the house of the Hasmonean is a slave.
llm_translation: So it was that (a certain individual came from Nahardea). That individual said to Rav Yehudah: "According to my opinion, I read 'avadah,' which means from the House of Hashmonai is the king?!" He said to him: So said Shmuel: Whenever I say 'from the House of Hashmonai,' I mean 'avadah' (it is).

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה וּבָא, אִם קוֹדֶם מַעֲשֶׂה אֲמָרָהּ – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא אִיכָּא רַב מַתְנָה דְּקָאֵי כְּווֹתִי.
human_translation: said to Does the Master not hold in accordance with this that Rabbi Abba says Rav Huna says Rav says: any Torah scholar who proceeds to teach halakha if he said it before an action they listen to him, But if not, they do not listen to him, said to There is Rav Mattana, who stands by my
llm_translation: He said to him: The master did not think like that which Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Every Torah scholar who teaches a halacha and it comes to pass, if he said it before the action – we listen to him, and if not – do we not listen to him? He said to him: There is a great gift standing by.

hebrew_text: רַב מַתְנָה לָא חַזְיַיהּ לִנְהַרְדְּעָא תְּלֵיסַר שְׁנֵי. הָהוּא יוֹמָא אֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּכִיר מָר מַאי אֲמַר שְׁמוּאֵל כִּי קָאֵי חֲדָא כַּרְעָא אַגּוּדָּא וַחֲדָא כַּרְעָא בְּמַבָּרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל דְּאָמַר מִדְּבֵית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי מַלְכָּא קָאָתֵינָא – עַבְדָּא הוּא, דְּלָא אִישְׁתְּיוּר מִינַּיְיהוּ אֶלָּא הַהִיא רְבִיתָא דְּסָלְקָא לְאִיגָּרָא וְרָמְיָא קָלָא וְאָמְרָה: כֹּל דְּאָמַר מִבֵּית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי אֲנָא – עַבְדָּא הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Mattana had not seen Neharde’a thirteen years. That day he arrived. said to him: the Master remember what Shmuel said when he was standing one foot on the bank and one foot on the ferry? said to him: This is what Shmuel said Anyone who says: I come from the house of the Hasmonean is a slave, as none remained of them except for that young girl who ascended to the roof and raised her voice and said: anyone who says: I come from the house of the Hasmonean is a slave.
llm_translation: Rav Matna did not see him until thirteen years. On that day he came. He said to him: "Esteemed master, what did Shmuel say when one leg is in the Egeda and one leg is in the Mabara?" He said to him: "This is what Shmuel said: 'Anyone who says, "I am from the Hasmonean household," is a slave, for they do not have any lineage except for that girl who ascended to the roof, raised her voice, and said: 'Anyone who says, "I am from the Hasmonean household," I am a slave.'"

hebrew_text: נְפַלָה מֵאִיגָּרָא וּמִיתָה. אַכְרוּז עֲלֵיהּ דְּעַבְדָּא הוּא.
human_translation: fell from the roof and died, they publicized about him, that he was a slave.
llm_translation: She fell from the roof and died. An announcement was made concerning her that it was an accidental death.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יוֹמָא אִקַּרְעָן כַּמָּה כְּתוּבָּתָא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. כִּי קָא נָפֵיק, נָפְקִי אַבָּתְרֵיהּ לְמִירְגְּמֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי (שְׁתִיקוּ) [שָׁתְקִיתוּ] – שְׁתִיקוּ, וְאִי לָא מְגַלֵּינָא עֲלַיְיכוּ הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל תַּרְתֵּי זַרְעֲיָיתָא אִיכָּא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא: חֲדָא מִיקַּרְיָא דְּבֵי יוֹנָה, וַחֲדָא מִיקַּרְיָא דְּבֵי עוֹרַבְתִּי. וְסִימָנָיךְ: טָמֵא – טָמֵא, טָהוֹר – טָהוֹר. שַׁדְיוּהּ לְהָהוּא רִיגְמָא מִידַיְיהוּ וְקָם אַטְמָא בִּנְהַר מַלְכָּא.
human_translation: that day, several marriage contracts were torn up in Neharde’a, When was leaving they pursued him, to stone him, said to them: If you are silent, silent. And if not I will reveal about you this that Shmuel said: There are two offspring in Neharde’a. One is called the dove’s house, and one is called the raven’s house. And your mnemonic impure impure, pure pure, they threw those to stone him from their hands, And a dam arose in the Malka River.
llm_translation: On that day, they read as many scriptures as are written in Nehardea. When he went out, his disciples followed him. He said to them: If you have remained silent, remain silent, but if not, I will reveal to you what Shmuel said: There are two types of seed in Nehardea: one is called the seed of the dove, and the other is called the seed of the raven. And your sign is: if it is impure, it is impure; if it is pure, it is pure. They threw that teacher into the river, and the king of the river became impure.

hebrew_text: מַכְרִיז רַב יְהוּדָה בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא: אַדָּא וְיוֹנָתָן – עַבְדֵי. יְהוּדָה בַּר פָּפָּא – מַמְזֵירָא, בָּטִי בַּר טוֹבִיָּה בְּרָמוּת רוּחָא לָא שָׁקֵיל גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא. מַכְרֵיז רָבָא בְּמָחוֹזָא: בַּלָּאֵי, דַּנָּאֵי, טַלָּאֵי, מַלָּאֵי, זַגָּאֵי – כּוּלָּם לִפְסוּל. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: גּוֹבָאֵי – גִּבְעוֹנָאֵי, דּוּרְנוּנִיתָא – דָּרָאֵי נְתִינָאֵי. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַאי בֵּי כוּבֵּי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא – כּוּלָּם דְּעַבְדֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda proclaimed in Pumbedita: Adda and Yonatan, slaves; Yehuda bar Pappa mamzer ; Bati bar Tuviyya, in his arrogance, did not accept a bill of manumission Rava proclaimed in Meḥoza: Balla’ai, Danna’ai, Talla’ai, Malla’ai, Zagga’ai: All are flawed Rav Yehuda says: Gova’ai, Gibeonites, Dorenunita the village of Gibeonites, Rav Yosef says: this Bei Kuvei of Pumbedita, are all of slaves.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah proclaims in Pumbedita: Adah and Yonatan - slaves. Yehudah bar Papa - a tax collector, Bati bar Toviya in Ramut Ruha does not take the bill of emancipation. Rava proclaims in Mahoza: Balaei, Dannaei, Talla'ei, Mallaei, Zaggaei - all of them are disqualified. Rav Yehudah said: Gobaei - residents of Gibea, Durnunita - residents of Darai Natinai. Rav Yosef said: The household of Kubei in Pumbedita - all of them are slaves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת עֲבָדִים, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים עֲבָדִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְפַשְׁחוּר בֶּן אִימֵּר, וְכוּלָּם נִטְמְעוּ בַּכְּהוּנָּה. וְכׇל כֹּהֵן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ עַזּוּת פָּנִים אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מֵהֶם. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כּוּלְּהוּ יָתְבָן בְּשׁוּרָא דְבִנְהַרְדְּעָא. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אִם רָאִיתָ כֹּהֵן בְּעַזּוּת מֵצַח – אַל תְּהַרְהֵר אַחֲרָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַמְּךָ כִּמְרִיבֵי כֹהֵן״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Four hundred slaves, and some say four thousand slaves, were owned by Pashḥur ben Immer, and they were assimilated into the priesthood And any priest who has insolence is only from them. Abaye said: They all sit in the rows that are in Neharde’a. disagrees with of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: If you see an insolent priest, do not speculate about him since it is stated: “For your people are as those who strive with a priest”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Four hundred slaves, and some say four thousand slaves, belonged to Pashchur ben Immer, and all of them were integrated into the priesthood. And any kohen who has a haughty demeanor is only from them. Abbaye said: All of them sat in the marketplace of Bnei Harcha'ah. And it is in dispute with Rabbi Elazar, for Rabbi Elazar said: If you see a kohen with haughtiness, do not consider following him, as it is said: "And your people shall be like disputants of the kohen."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ, כְּשֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָתוֹ מֵעִיד עַל כׇּל הַשְּׁבָטִים וְאֵין מֵעִיד עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁבְטֵי יָהּ עֵדוּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל״, אֵימָתַי הָוֵי עֵדוּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל – בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַשְּׁבָטִים שִׁבְטֵי יָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda says Rav says: anyone who marries a woman who is not suited for him when the Holy One, Blessed be He, rests His Divine Presence He testifies with regard to all the tribes but He does not testify with regard to he as it is stated: “The tribes of the Lord, as a testimony to Israel” When is it a testimony to Israel? When the tribes are the tribes of the Lord,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda said in the name of Rav: Anyone who marries a woman who is not fitting for him, when the Holy One, blessed be He, spreads His Divine Presence over all the tribes and does not spread it over him, as it is stated: "The tribes of Hashem are a testimony for Israel." When are the tribes a testimony for Israel? When the tribes are the tribes of Hashem.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כְּשֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָתוֹ – אֵין מַשְׁרֶה אֶלָּא עַל מִשְׁפָּחוֹת מְיוּחָסוֹת שֶׁבְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא נְאֻם ה׳ אֶהְיֶה לֵאלֹהִים לְכֹל מִשְׁפְּחוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, ״לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״לְכֹל מִשְׁפְּחוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, rests His Divine Presence, He rests it only upon families of among Israel, as it is stated: “At that time, says the Lord, will I be the God of all the families of Israel” Of all Israel, is not stated, but “of all the families,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: When the Holy One, blessed be He, causes His Divine Presence to dwell, He causes it to dwell only on families of distinguished lineage in Israel, as it is stated: "At that time, says the Lord, I will be a God to all the families of Israel," it does not say "to all of Israel," but rather "to all the families."

hebrew_text: ״[וְהֵמָּה] יִהְיוּ לִי לְעָם״, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: זוֹ מַעֲלָה יְתֵירָה יֵשׁ בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לְגֵרִים. דְּאִילּוּ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״וְהָיִיתִי לָהֶם לֵאלֹהִים וְהֵמָּה יִהְיוּ לִי לְעָם״, וְאִילּוּ בְּגֵרִים כְּתִיב: ״מִי הוּא זֶה עָרַב אֶת לִבּוֹ לָגֶשֶׁת אֵלַי נְאֻם ה׳. וִהְיִיתֶם לִי לְעָם וְאָנֹכִי אֶהְיֶה לָכֶם לֵאלֹהִים״.
human_translation: “And they shall be my people.” Rabba bar Rav Huna says: This is a higher standard between Jews and converts, as with regard to Jews it is written about them: “And I will be their God, and they shall be My people” whereas with regard to converts it is written: “For who is he that has pledged his heart to approach unto Me? says the Lord. And you shall be My people, and I will be your God”
llm_translation: "And they shall be to Me a people," Rabba bar Rav Huna said: This is an additional elevation that Israel has over converts. For if it is written regarding Israel: "And I will be to them a God, and they shall be to Me a people," whereas regarding converts it is written: "Who is this that pledged his heart to approach Me? says the Lord. And you shall be to Me a people, and I will be to you a God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: קָשִׁים גֵּרִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּסַפַּחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִלְוָה הַגֵּר עֲלֵיהֶם וְנִסְפְּחוּ עַל בֵּית יַעֲקֹב״ – כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְנִסְפְּחוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״לַשְּׂאֵת וְלַסַּפַּחַת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo says: Converts are difficult for the Jewish people as a scab. that it is stated: “And the convert shall join himself with them, and they shall cleave [ venispeḥu ] to the house of Jacob” It is written here “ venispeḥu ,” and it is written there, “And for a sore and for a scab [ sappaḥat ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Helbo said: Converts are difficult for Israel like a skin disease, as it is stated: "And the convert shall join them and be attached to the house of Jacob" - it is written here "and be attached," and it is written there "for uplifting and for attachment."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: כְּשֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: When the Holy One, Blessed be He,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Hama son of Hanina: When the Holy One, blessed be He

hebrew_text: מְטַהֵר שְׁבָטִים, שִׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל לֵוִי מְטַהֵר תְּחִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּשֶׁב מְצָרֵף וּמְטַהֵר כֶּסֶף וְטִהַר אֶת בְּנֵי לֵוִי וְזִקַּק אֹתָם כַּזָּהָב וְכַכָּסֶף וְהָיוּ לַה׳ מַגִּישֵׁי מִנְחָה בִּצְדָקָה״.
human_translation: purifies tribes, purify the tribe of Levi first, as it is stated “And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver; and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver; and there shall be they that shall offer to the Lord offerings in righteousness”
llm_translation: Purifying tribes, tribe of Levi purifies first, as it is said: "And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver, and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and refine them as gold and silver, and they shall offer unto the Lord offerings in righteousness."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כֶּסֶף מְטַהֵר מַמְזֵרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּשֶׁב מְצָרֵף וּמְטַהֵר כֶּסֶף״. מַאי ״מַגִּישֵׁי מִנְחָה בִּצְדָקָה״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: צְדָקָה עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁמִּשְׁפָּחָה שֶׁנִּטְמְעָה – נִטְמְעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Money purifies mamzerim . as it is stated: “And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver,” What, “They that shall offer to the Lord offerings in righteousness”?
