Rabbi Yitzḥak says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, performed righteousness with the Jewish people that a family that has become assimilated assimilated.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Silver purifies mamzerim, as it is stated: "And He shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver." What is meant by "those who bring offerings in righteousness"? Rabbi Yitzchak said: The Holy One, blessed be He, performed righteousness with Israel, for a family that is mixed - remains mixed.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל אֲרָצוֹת עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִיסָּה לְבָבֶל. בִּימֵי רַבִּי בִּקְּשׁוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּבֶל עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר לָהֶן: קוֹצִים אַתֶּם מְשִׂימִים לִי בֵּין עֵינַי? רְצוֹנְכֶם, יִטָּפֵל עִמָּכֶם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר חָמָא.
human_translation: the itself Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: all lands is muddled to Eretz Yisrael, and Eretz Yisrael is muddled to Babylonia. In the days of Rabbi they sought to establish Babylonia muddled to Eretz Yisrael. he said to Are you placing thorns between my eyes? If you wish, Rabbi Ḥanina bar Ḥama will join you
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: All lands of dough to the land of Israel, and the land of Israel dough to Babylon. In the days of Rabbi, they sought to make Babylon dough to the land of Israel. He said to them: Are you putting thorns in my eyes? Your will, Rabbi Chanina bar Chama will deal with you.

hebrew_text: נִטְפַּל עִמָּהֶם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר חָמָא, אָמַר לָהֶם: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מֵרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: כׇּל אֲרָצוֹת עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִיסָּה לְבָבֶל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Ḥama joined them said to them: This I received from Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, who says in the name of his father, all lands is muddled to Eretz Yisrael, and Eretz Yisrael is muddled to Babylonia.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Chanina bar Chama joined them and said to them: This is what I have received as a tradition from Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yose, who said in the name of his father: All lands are like dough compared to the Land of Israel, and the Land of Israel is like dough compared to Babylonia."

hebrew_text: בִּימֵי רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בִּקְּשׁוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּבֶל עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר לָהֶם לַעֲבָדָיו: כְּשֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ טְלוּנִי בַּעֲרִיסָה וְרוּצוּ. כִּי עָיֵיל אָמַר לָהֶם: אֵין שְׁחִיטָה לָעוֹף מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: In the days of Rabbi Pineḥas, they sought to establish Babylonia muddled to Eretz Yisrael. He said to his servants: When I have said two statements in the house of study, pick me up on a stretcher and run, When he entered he said to Slaughter of a bird is not by Torah law.
llm_translation: In the days of Rabbi Pinchas, they sought to make Babylonian dough for the Land of Israel. He said to his servants: "When I say two things in the study hall, cover me with a blanket and run." For he was weary. He said to them: "There is no requirement for ritual slaughter for birds in the Torah."

hebrew_text: אַדְּיָתְבִי וְקָמְעַיְּינִי בַּהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: כׇּל אֲרָצוֹת עִיסָּה לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִיסָּה לְבָבֶל. נְטָלוּהוּ בַּעֲרִיסָה וְרָצוּ. רָצוּ אַחֲרָיו וְלֹא הִגִּיעוּהוּ. יָשְׁבוּ וּבָדְקוּ עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְסַכָּנָה וּפֵירְשׁוּ.
human_translation: While they were sitting and scrutinizing this he said to them: all lands is muddled to Eretz Yisrael, and Eretz Yisrael is muddled to Babylonia. picked him up on a stretcher and ran. pursued him but could not catch him. they sat and examined until they reached dangerous and they withdrew
llm_translation: Adiathvi and Kamayini were sitting there, he said to them: "All lands are dough for the Land of Israel, and the Land of Israel is dough for Babylon. They took it in a crib and ran. They ran after it but did not reach it. They sat and examined until they reached a dangerous place and departed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֵיכְלָא, בְּיָדֵינוּ הִיא, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁהֲרֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר נִטְמְעוּ בָּהּ. סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִשְׁפָּחָה שֶׁנִּטְמְעָה – נִטְמְעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says Sanctuary! It is in our power but what can I do, as the greatest of the generation are assimilated into it? holds in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: A family that has become assimilated assimilated,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "The Temple, it is in our hands, but what shall I do, for the great ones of the generation have become attached to it." He thought like Rabbi Yitzchak, for Rabbi Yitzchak said: "A family that becomes attached - becomes attached."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: מִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית הַצְּרִיפָה הָיְתָה בְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן וְרִיחֲקָהּ בֶּן צִיּוֹן בִּזְרוֹעַ. עוֹד אַחֶרֶת הָיְתָה וְקֵירְבָהּ בֶּן צִיּוֹן בִּזְרוֹעַ. כְּגוֹן אֵלּוּ – אֵלִיָּהוּ בָּא לְטַמֵּא וּלְטַהֵר, לְרַחֵק וּלְקָרֵב – כְּגוֹן אֵלּוּ דְּיָדְעִין, אֲבָל מִשְׁפָּחָה שֶׁנִּטְמְעָה – נִטְמְעָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: We too learn There was a family Beit HaTzerifa in Transjordan, and ben Tziyyon forcefully distanced it There was another that ben Tziyyon forcefully drew near, such as these, Elijah comes to impure and to pure, to distance and to draw near. Such as these, whose we know. But a family that has become assimilated, has become assimilated,
llm_translation: Abaye said: We also learned: The family of Beit HaTzrifah was on the other side of the Jordan, and Ben Zion distanced it with his arm. There was another family, and Ben Zion brought it close with his arm. Examples of these are: Elijah who comes to render impure and pure, to distance and to bring close - examples of those who are knowledgeable. But a family that has become assimilated - has become assimilated.

hebrew_text: תָּאנָא: עוֹד אַחֶרֶת הָיְתָה, וְלֹא רָצוּ חֲכָמִים לְגַלּוֹתָהּ. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים מוֹסְרִים אוֹתוֹ לִבְנֵיהֶם וּלְתַלְמִידֵיהֶן פַּעַם אַחַת בְּשָׁבוּעַ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ פַּעֲמַיִם בְּשָׁבוּעַ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּעַם אַחַת בְּשָׁבוּעַ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר אִם לֹא אֲגַלֶּה מִשְׁפָּחוֹת״ – יִהְיֶה נָזִיר, וְלֹא יְגַלֶּה מִשְׁפָּחוֹת.
human_translation: taught There was another but the Sages did not want to reveal its But the Sages transmit its to their children and to their students once every seven years, and some say twice every seven years, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: It stands to reason in accordance with the one who says once every seven years, as it is taught I am hereby a nazirite if I do not reveal families he should be a nazirite and not reveal families.
llm_translation: Tanna: Another incident there was, and the sages did not want to reveal it. But the sages would teach it to their sons and disciples once a week, and some say twice a week. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It makes sense like the one who said once a week. As it was taught: "Behold, I will be a Nazirite if I do not reveal the secrets of families" - he shall be a Nazirite, but he shall not reveal the secrets of families.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֵׁם בֶּן אַרְבַּע אוֹתִיּוֹת חֲכָמִים מוֹסְרִין אוֹתוֹ לְתַלְמִידֵיהֶן פַּעַם אַחַת בְּשָׁבוּעַ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ פַּעֲמַיִם בְּשָׁבוּעַ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּעַם אַחַת בְּשָׁבוּעַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֶה שְּׁמִי לְעֹלָם״, ״לְעַלֵּם״ כְּתִיב. רָבָא סָבַר לְמִידְרְשֵׁיהּ בְּפִירְקָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא: ״לְעַלֵּם״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The Sages transmit the four-letter name to their students once every seven years, and some say twice every seven years. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: It stands to reason in accordance with the one who says once every seven years, as it is written: “This is My name forever [ le’olam ]” written le’alem , Rava planned to expound in discourse. A certain elder said to him: It is written le’alem ,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The name of a student who reviews his studies with his disciples once a week, and some say twice a week. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is logical like the one who said once a week, as it is written: "This is My name forever," "forever" is written. Rava thought to expound in the study hall. That elder said to him: "Forever" is written.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבִינָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״זֶה שְּׁמִי״, וּכְתִיב ״זֶה זִכְרִי״. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לֹא כְּשֶׁאֲנִי נִכְתָּב אֲנִי נִקְרָא, נִכְתָּב אֲנִי בְּיוֹד הֵי וְנִקְרָא בְּאָלֶף דָּלֶית.
human_translation: Rabbi Avina raised a contradiction: It is written: “This is My name,” and it is written: “This is My remembrance” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Not as I am written am I pronounced. I am written with yod , heh , while pronounced with alef , dalet ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avina raised a contradiction: It is written, "This is My name," and it is written, "This is My memorial." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: When I am written, I am called with a Yod and Hei, but when I am read, I am called with an Aleph and Dalet.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֵׁם בֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה אוֹתִיּוֹת הָיוּ מוֹסְרִין אוֹתוֹ לְכׇל אָדָם, מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הַפָּרִיצִים – הָיוּ מוֹסְרִים אוֹתוֹ לִצְנוּעִים שֶׁבַּכְּהוּנָּה, וְהַצְּנוּעִים שֶׁבַּכְּהוּנָּה מַבְלִיעִים אוֹתוֹ בִּנְעִימַת אֲחֵיהֶם הַכֹּהֲנִים. תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: פַּעַם אַחַת עָלִיתִי אַחַר אֲחִי אִמִּי לַדּוּכָן, וְהִטֵּיתִי אָזְנִי אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְשָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהִבְלִיעַ שֵׁם בִּנְעִימַת אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, would transmit the twelve-letter name to any person. When the uninhibited ones increased, they would transmit it to discreet of the priesthood, and the discreet of the priesthood conceal it during the sweet of their priestly brothers, It is taught Rabbi Tarfon, said: one occasion I ascended after my mother’s brother to the platform and I inclined my ear near the High Priest, and I heard him conceal the name during the sweet of his priestly brothers.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially, Shem ben twelve years old they would teach him to everyone, when the insolent increased - they would teach him to the modest ones among the priests, and the modest ones among the priests would whisper it in the pleasantness of their priestly brothers. It was taught: Rabbi Tarfon said: Once I went after my mother's brother to the baths, and I inclined my ear to the High Priest and heard that he whispered the Name in the pleasantness of his priestly brothers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֵׁם בֶּן אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁתַּיִם אוֹתִיּוֹת אֵין מוֹסְרִין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁצָּנוּעַ וְעָנָיו, וְעוֹמֵד בַּחֲצִי יָמָיו, וְאֵינוֹ כּוֹעֵס, וְאֵינוֹ מִשְׁתַּכֵּר, וְאֵינוֹ מַעֲמִיד עַל מִדּוֹתָיו. וְכׇל הַיּוֹדְעוֹ, וְהַזָּהִיר בּוֹ וְהַמְשַׁמְּרוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָה – אָהוּב לְמַעְלָה, וְנֶחְמָד לְמַטָּה, וְאֵימָתוֹ מוּטֶּלֶת עַל הַבְּרִיּוֹת, וְנוֹחֵל שְׁנֵי עוֹלָמִים – הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The forty-two-letter name may be transmitted only to one who is discreet, and humble, and stands at half his life, and does not get angry, and does not get drunk, and does not insist upon his rights And anyone who knows and is careful with it and guards it in purity is beloved above and treasured below; and fear of him is cast upon the creatures; and he inherits two worlds, this world and the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The name of a person, forty-two letters are not given to him except for one who is modest and poor, and stands in the middle of his days, and is not angry, and does not get drunk, and does not act according to his character traits. And anyone who knows him, and is cautious with him and guards him in purity - he is loved above, cherished below, his fear is upon creatures, and he inherits two worlds - this world and the world to come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּסָבָא: בָּבֶל בְּחֶזְקַת כְּשֵׁרָה עוֹמֶדֶת, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ בַּמֶּה נִפְסְלָה. שְׁאָר אֲרָצוֹת – בְּחֶזְקַת פְּסוּל הֵן עוֹמְדוֹת, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ בַּמֶּה נִכְשְׁרָה. אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּחְזָק לְפָסוּל – פָּסוּל, מוּחְזָק לְכָשֵׁר – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Shmuel says in the name of elder: Babylonia has a presumptive status of unflawed until it becomes known to you in what way it was flawed other lands has a presumptive status of flawed until it becomes known to you in what way it was unflawed. Eretz Yisrael, has a presumptive status of flawed flawed has presumptive status of unflawed unflawed
llm_translation: Samuel said in the name of Sabba: Babylon stands in the presumption of being valid until it is known to you in what it became disqualified. Other lands stand in the presumption of being disqualified until it is known to you in what it became valid. The land of Israel, if it is presumed to be disqualified, it is disqualified; if it is presumed to be valid, it is valid.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפַאּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ מוּחְזָק לְפָסוּל – פָּסוּל. הָא סְתָמָא – כָּשֵׁר. וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי: מוּחְזָק לְכָשֵׁר – כָּשֵׁר. הָא סְתָמָא – פָּסוּל! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: This matter itself is difficult: you said has a presumptive status of flawed flawed unspecified unflawed And then teach: has a presumptive status of unflawed unflawed unspecified flawed Rav Huna bar Taḥalifa said in the name of Rav: not difficult.
llm_translation: The matter itself is difficult: You said, "If it is firmly established as invalid - it is invalid." If it is uncertain - it is valid. And then it teaches: If it is firmly established as valid - it is valid. If it is uncertain - it is invalid! Rav Huna the son of Taḥlipha said in the name of Rav: It is not difficult.

hebrew_text: כָּאן – לְהַשִּׂיאוֹ אִשָּׁה, כָּאן – לְהוֹצִיא אִשָּׁה מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: Here, to marrying him, There, to removing a woman from him.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: Here - to marry a woman, here - to divorce a woman from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כֹּל שֶׁסִּיחָתוֹ בְּבָבֶל, מַשִּׂיאִין לוֹ אִשָּׁה. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּאִיכָּא רַמָּאֵי, חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: Anyone whose speech is Babylonian, is to marry a woman But nowadays, when there are swindlers we are concerned
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Anyone whose conversation is in Babylon, they find him a wife. And now that there are many deceitful people, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: זְעֵירִי הֲוָה קָא מִישְׁתְּמִיט מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דַּהֲוָה אָמַר לֵיהּ: נְסֵיב בְּרַתִּי. יוֹמָא חַד הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא, מְטוֹ לְעוּרְקְמָא דְמַיָּא, אַרְכְּבֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ וְקָא מְעַבַּר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אוֹרָיְיתַן כְּשֵׁרָה, בְּנָתִין לָא כְּשֵׁרָן? מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ,
human_translation: Ze’eiri, was avoiding Rabbi Yoḥanan, since saying to him: Marry my daughter. One day, they were walking along the way, they arrived at puddle of water. lifted Rabbi Yoḥanan upon his shoulders and carried him over said to him: Our Torah is fit our daughters are not fit? What is your reason
llm_translation: The small one was trying to divert the attention of Rabbi Yochanan, who said to him: Marry my daughter. One day they were walking on the road, they came to a crossroads of water, he lifted him onto Rabbi Yochanan's shoulders and was crossing with him. He said to him: Their Torah is valid, but their daughters are not valid? What is your opinion,

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מִדִּתְנַן: עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִין עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל כָּהֲנֵי לְוִיֵּי – אַטּוּ כָּהֲנֵי לְוִיֵּי וְיִשְׂרְאֵלֵי כּוּלְּהוּ סְלִיקוּ? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִישְׁתְּיוּר מֵהָנֵי אִישְׁתְּיוּר נָמֵי מֵהָנֵי! אִישְׁתְּמִיטְתֵּיהּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא עָלָה עֶזְרָא מִבָּבֶל עַד שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ כְּסוֹלֶת נְקִיָּיה וְעָלָה.
human_translation: If we say a reason from that which we learned ten lineage ascended from Babylonia: Priests, Levites, is that to say all of the priests, Levites, and Israelites ascended Just as there remained from these there also remained from these, this statement of Rabbi Elazar escaped Ezra did not ascend from Babylonia until he made it like fine flour, and he ascended.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ileima miditnan: asarah yuchasin alu mibavel kohanei levie - attu kohanei levie ve'yisraeley kulhu seliku? Ki heichi de'ishteyur mehanei ishteyur namei mehanei! Ishtemitteih ha de'amar Rabbi Elazar: lo alah Ezra mibavel ad she'asa'ah kesoleit nekiya ve'alah." English translation: "Let us say from where do we derive: ten genealogical lines ascended from Babylon, priests of Levi - now, did the priests of Levi and all the Israelites ascend? In what way did they distinguish between the genealogical lines? The one who said, Rabbi Elazar: Ezra did not ascend from Babylon until he made it like clean flour and then ascended."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אִיקְּלַע לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא לְבֵי רַב יְהוּדָה, חַזְיֵיהּ לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה דְּגָדֵל וְלָא נָסֵיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָא מַנְסֵיב לֵיהּ מָר אִיתְּתָא לִבְרֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי יָדַעְנָא מֵהֵיכָא אֶנְסְבַיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ אֲנַן מִי יָדְעִינַן מֵהֵיכָא קָאָתֵינַן? דִּילְמָא מֵהָנָךְ דִּכְתִיב: ״נָשִׁים בְּצִיּוֹן עִנּוּ בְּתֻלֹת בְּעָרֵי יְהוּדָה״.
human_translation: Ulla arrived in Pumbedita to the house of Rav Yehuda. He observed that Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, was grown up and was unmarried. said to What is the reason the Master does not marry a woman to his son? said to him: Do I know from where I to marry said to him: Is that to say that we know where we come from? Perhaps from those whom it is written: “They have ravished the women in Zion, the maidens in the cities of Judah”
llm_translation: Ula came to the house of Rav Yehuda in Pumbedita, he saw Rav Yitzchak the son of Rav Yehuda who was grown up but had not yet married. He said to him: Why have you not married off your son? He said to him: Who can guarantee me that I will find a suitable match for him? He said to him: And can we guarantee from where we will find a suitable match for ourselves? Perhaps from those of whom it is written: "The maidens in Zion were humiliated, the virgins in the cities of Judah."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר, וְדִילְמָא מֵהָנָךְ דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״הַשֹּׁכְבִים עַל מִטּוֹת שֵׁן וּסְרֻחִים עַל עַרְשׂוֹתָם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם הַמַּשְׁתִּינִים מַיִם בִּפְנֵי מִטּוֹתֵיהֶם עֲרוּמִּים.
human_translation: And if you would say a gentile or a slave who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is unflawed, perhaps from those about whom it is written: “That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their couches” and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says These are people who urinate naked before their couches.
llm_translation: And if you will say, a non-Jew and a slave who cohabits with a Jewish woman, and the child born is valid, but perhaps it is from those of whom it is written in them: "Those who lie on beds of ivory and sprawl on their couches." And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: These are people who urinate in front of their beds naked.

hebrew_text: וּמְגַדֵּף בַּהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לָכֵן עַתָּה יִגְלוּ בְּרֹאשׁ גֹּלִים״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּמַשְׁתִּינִים מַיִם בִּפְנֵי מִטּוֹתֵיהֶם עֲרוּמִּים, ״יִגְלוּ בְּרֹאשׁ גּוֹלִים״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu ridiculed this If so, is this what is written: “Therefore now shall they go captive at the head of them that go captive” because they urinated naked before their couches they go captive at the head of them that go captive?
llm_translation: The one who scoffs at it, Rabbi Avahu said: If so, is this not what is written: "Therefore now they shall go into exile at the head of the exiles" - because they draw water with nakedness before their beds, "they shall go into exile at the head of the exiles."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וּמַדְבִּיקִין מִטּוֹתֵיהֶם זוֹ בָּזוֹ, וּמַחֲלִיפִין נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם זֶה לָזֶה, וּמַסְרִיחִים עַרְסוֹתָם בְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abbahu says: These are people who eat and drink together, and attach their beds together, and exchange their wives with each other, and befoul their couches with semen that is not theirs.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Avahu said: These are people who eat and drink together, and intertwine their beds with one another, and exchange their wives with one another, and defile their genitals with the seed of one that is not theirs.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל בָּתַר שְׁתִיקוּתָא, כִּי הַאי דְּבָדְקִי בְּנֵי מַעְרְבָא: כִּי מִינְּצוּ בֵּי תְרֵי בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי חָזוּ הֵי מִנַּיְיהוּ דְּקָדֵים וְשָׁתֵיק – אָמְרִי: הַאי מְיוּחָס טְפֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to what shall we do? said to him: Go after the silence, like the way the people of the West, examine: When two quarrel with each other, they observe which of them becomes silent first. they say: This is of finer lineage.
llm_translation: He said to him: How shall we conduct ourselves? He said to him: Go after silence, for this is what the sons of Ma'arava examined: When the two houses of study were sitting together, if the elders spoke first and then remained silent, they said: This is a generation of refinement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: שְׁתִיקוּתֵיהּ דְּבָבֶל – הַיְינוּ יִחוּסָא. אִינִי? וְהָא אִיקְּלַע רַב לְבֵי בַּר שָׁפֵי חַלָּא וּבְדַק בְּהוּ, מַאי לָאו בְּיַחֲסוּתָא? לָא, בִּשְׁתִיקוּתָא. הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: בְּדוּקוּ אִי שָׁתְקִי אִי לָא שָׁתְקִי.
human_translation: Rav says: The silence of Babylonia is its lineage. Is that so? But Rav arrived at the house of the son of a vinegar strainer and examined them. What, is it not into lineage? No, into their silence. This is said to Examine whether they become silent or they do not become silent.
llm_translation: Rav said: The silence of Babylon - that is Yichusa. Is it not so? But didn't Rav come to the house of Bar Shaphei the oil merchant and examine them, why not in genealogy? No, in silence. This is what he said to them: Examine whether she is silent or not silent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אִם רָאִיתָ שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁמִּתְגָּרִים זֶה בָּזֶה – שֶׁמֶץ פְּסוּל יֵשׁ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין אוֹתוֹ לִידַּבֵּק אֶחָד בַּחֲבֵירוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אִם רָאִיתָ שְׁתֵּי מִשְׁפָּחוֹת הַמִּתְגָּרוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ – שֶׁמֶץ פְּסוּל יֵשׁ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן, וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָהּ לִידַּבֵּק בַּחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: If you see two people feuding with each other, there is a trace of unfitness in one of them. is prevented from joining the other Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: If you see two families feuding with each other, there is a trace of unfitness in one of them, and is prevented from joining the other.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If you see two people quarreling with each other - there is a blemish in one of them, and we do not allow him to come into contact with his fellow. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If you see two families quarreling with each other - there is a blemish in one of them, and we do not allow her to come into contact with her companion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: בָּבֶל – בְּרִיאָה. מֵישׁוֹן – מֵיתָה. מָדַי – חוֹלָה. עֵילָם – גּוֹסֶסֶת. וּמָה בֵּין חוֹלִין לְגוֹסְסִין? רוֹב חוֹלִין לְחַיִּים, רוֹב גּוֹסְסִים לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa the Elder says in the name of Rav: Babylonia healthy Mishon dead, Media sick, Eilam moribund. And what between sick and moribund? Most sick to life, most moribund for death.
llm_translation: Rav Papa the Elder said in the name of Rav: Babylonia - creation. Meishon - death. Mada'i - illness. Eilam - barren. And what is the difference between the sick and the barren? Most of the sick recover to life, most of the barren lead to death.

hebrew_text: עַד הֵיכָן הִיא בָּבֶל? רַב אָמַר: עַד נָהָר עֲזָק, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עַד נְהַר יוּאָנִי. לְעֵיל בְּדִיגְלַת עַד הֵיכָא? רַב אָמַר: עַד בַּגְדָּא וְאַוְונָא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עַד מוּשְׁכְּנֵי. וְלֹא מוּשְׁכְּנֵי בַּכְּלָל? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּשְׁכְּנֵי הֲרֵי הִיא כַּגּוֹלָה לְיוּחֲסִין! אֶלָּא: עַד מוּשְׁכְּנֵי, וּמוּשְׁכְּנֵי בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: Until where does Babylonia Rav said: Until the River Azak, And Shmuel said: Until the River Yo’ani, Until where does upward, on the Tigris? Rav said: Until Bagda and Avna. And Shmuel said: Until Mushekanei. But isn’t Mushekanei included But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say Shmuel says: Mushekanei is like the exile, with regard to lineage? Rather, Until and including Mushekanei.
llm_translation: Until where is Babylon? Rav said: Until the Euphrates River, and Shmuel said: Until the Ulai River. Above in Diglat, until where? Rav said: Until Bagda and Avuna. And Shmuel said: Until Mushkenei. And are Mushkenei included? But didn't Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say in the name of Shmuel: Mushkenei are like a rolling thing for genealogical purposes! Rather: Until Mushkenei, and Mushkenei are included.

hebrew_text: לְתַחְתִּית בְּדִיגְלַת עַד הֵיכָא? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל: עַד אַפַּמֵיָיא תַּתָּאָה. תַּרְתֵּי אַפַּמֵיָיא הָוְיָין: חֲדָא עִילִּיתָא וַחֲדָא תַּתַּיְיתָא, חֲדָא כְּשֵׁירָה וַחֲדָא פְּסוּלָה, וּבֵין חֲדָא לַחֲדָא פַּרְסָה, וְקָא קָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי וַאֲפִילּוּ נוּרָא לָא מוֹשְׁלִי אַהֲדָדֵי. וְסִימָנָיךְ דִּפְסוּלְתָּא הָא דְּמִישְׁתַּעֲיָא מֵישָׁנִית.
human_translation: How far does downward, on the Tigris? Rav Shmuel said: Until Lower Appamya. There are two Appamya, the upper one and the lower one. one is unflawed and the other is flawed, and they are separated by a parasang [ parsa ]. And they are particular with regard to one another. they do not even loan each other fire, And your mnemonic the unfit one that that speaks the Mishon dialect.
llm_translation: At the bottom of the fishing-net until where? Rav Shmuel said: Until the Afamaya below. There are two Afamayas: one upper and one lower, one valid and one invalid, and between one and the other is a space. They are entangled with each other, and even if a fire does not rule over them, they are entangled. Your sign of invalidity is when it changes from its original state.

hebrew_text: לְעֵיל בִּפְרָת עַד הֵיכָא? רַב אָמַר: עַד אַקְרָא דְתוּלְבַּקְנֵי. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עַד גִּישְׁרָא דְּבֵי פְרָת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: עַד מַעַבַּרְתָּ[א] דְגִיזְמָא. לָיֵיט אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יוֹסֵף אַדְּרַב.
human_translation: How far does upward, on the Euphrates? Rav said: Until the fortress Tulbaknei. And Shmuel said: Until the bridge over the Euphrates. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Until the crossing at Gizma. Abaye would curse, and some say Rav Yosef one of Rav,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Until where is the boundary of P'rat? Rav said: Until the vineyard of Tuvlbaqnei. And Shmuel said: Until the bridge of the house of P'rat. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Until the crossing of Gizma. Abaye raised an objection and Rav Yosef supported him."

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַב לָיֵיט, אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל לָא לָיֵיט? אֶלָּא לָיֵיט אַדְּרַב, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם אַדְּרַב לָיֵיט, אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל לָא לָיֵיט, וְגִישְׁרָא דְּבֵי פְרָת לְתַתַּאיה הֲוָה קָאֵי.
human_translation: curse one of Rav, did not curse one of Shmuel? Rather, would curse one of Rav, and all the more so one of Shmuel. And if you wish, say: In fact, he cursed one of Rav, he did not curse one of Shmuel, and the bridge over the Euphrates stood lower down,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rav lait, adishmuel lait? Ela lait adrav, vekol sheken adishmuel. Ve'iba'it eima: Le'olam adrav lait, adishmuel lait, vegishra debei prat letatai havah ka'ei. English translation: Is Ad'rav correct, and Adishmuel not correct? Rather, Ad'rav is correct, and all the more so Adishmuel. And if you wish, say: Indeed, Ad'rav is correct, Adishmuel is not correct, and the bridge of the Euphrates River stands below it.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא הוּא [דְּ]דַלְיוּהּ פָּרְסָאֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: לְהָא גִּיסָא דִפְרָת עַד הֵיכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ? מִשּׁוּם בִּירָם? מְיַיחֲסִי דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא מִבִּירָם נָסְבִי.
human_translation: And it is now the Persians moved up Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Until where does on this side of the Euphrates? Rav Yosef said to him: What are you thinking? due to Biram? those of lineage Pumbedita marry from Biram,
llm_translation: The current situation is that he is Persian. Abaye said to Rav Yosef: For this matter of the cow, how far does it extend? He said to him: What is your opinion? Because of the city of Biram? They are related from the city of Pumbedita, not from Biram.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּמַחְלוֹקֶת לְיוּחֲסִין, כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת לְעִנְיַן גִּיטִּין. וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת לְיוּחֲסִין, אֲבָל לְגִיטִּין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל עַד אַרְבָּא תִנְיָינָא דְּגִישְׁרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Just as a dispute to lineage, so a dispute with regard to bills of divorce. And Rav Yosef says: dispute with regard to lineage, but with regard to bills of divorce, everyone agrees up to the second lake of the bridge
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Just as there is a dispute regarding matters of lineage, so too there is a dispute regarding matters of divorce. And Rav Yosef said: There is a dispute regarding matters of lineage, but regarding matters of divorce - everyone agrees up to the fourth chapter of Gittin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: חֲבֵיל יַמָּא – תְּכֵילְתָּא דְבָבֶל. שׁוּנְיָא וְגוּבְיָא – תְּכֵילְתָּא דַּחֲבֵיל יַמָּא. רָבִינָא אָמַר: אַף צִיצוֹרָא. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, חָנָן בֶּן פִּנְחָס אוֹמֵר: חֲבֵיל יַמָּא – תְּכֵילְתָּא דְּבָבֶל, שׁוּנְיָא וְגוּבְיָא וְצִיצוֹרָא – תְּכֵילְתָּא דַּחֲבֵיל יַמָּא. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְהָאִידָּנָא אִיעָרַבִי בְּהוּ כּוּתָאֵי. וְלָא הִיא, אִיתְּתָא הוּא דִּבְעָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְלָא יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ. מַאי חֲבֵיל יַמָּא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: זוֹ פְּרָת דְּבוֹרְסִי.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba said: Ḥaveil Yamma is the glory of Babylonia Shunya and Guvya the glory of Ḥaveil Yamma. Ravina said: Tzitzora also This is also taught Ḥanan ben Pineḥas says: Ḥaveil Yamma is the glory of Babylonia; Shunya and Guvya and Tzitzora the glory of Ḥaveil Yamma. Rav Pappa says: And nowadays, Samaritans have assimilated with them, And is not so. requested a woman from them and they would not give to him, What Ḥaveil Yamma? Rav Pappa said: This Euphrates to Bursi.
llm_translation: Ramai bar Abba said: "Havil Yama - the blue dye of Babylon. Shunyaa and Gubya - the blue dye of Havil Yama." Ravina said: "Also Tzitzura." It was taught similarly: Chanin ben Pinchas says: "Havil Yama - the blue dye of Babylon, Shunyaa, Gubya, and Tzitzura - the blue dye of Havil Yama." Rav Papa said: "And nowadays it is mixed with Kutaei." But it is not so, it is a plant that they wanted but did not give it to him. What is Havil Yama? Rav Papa said: "This is the cow of Deborsee."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא מִן שׁוֹט מֵישׁוֹט, עָמַד רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: שׁוֹט מֵישׁוֹט בֵּין הַנְּהָרוֹת עוֹמֶדֶת. וְכִי בֵּין הַנְּהָרוֹת עוֹמֶדֶת, מַאי הָוֵי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֵּין הַנְּהָרוֹת הֲרֵי הִיא כַּגּוֹלָה לְיוּחֲסִין. וְהֵיכָא קָיְימָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מֵאִיהִי דְקִירָא וּלְעֵיל. וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד מַעְבַּרְתָּא דְגִיזְמָא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רְצוּעָה נָפְקָא.
human_translation: a certain man who said to I am from Shot Mishot. Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa stood on his feet and said: Shot Mishot is located between the Rivers. And if it is located between the rivers, what of it? Abaye said Rabbi Ḥama bar Ukva says Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: between the rivers is like the exile, with regard to lineage. And where is located Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From Ihi Dekira and upward, But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Until the crossing at Gizma Abaye said: A strip extends
llm_translation: That man who said to them: "I am from Shoteh of Shoteh," Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha stood on his feet and said: "Shoteh of Shoteh stands between the rivers." And when it stands between the rivers, what is it? Abaye said, Rabbi Chama bar Ukva said, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: Between the rivers it is like a rolling wheel for genealogies. And where is it established? Rabbi Yochanan said: From here to there. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Until the crossing of the bridge of the reeds! Abaye said: A resolution has emerged.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִיקָא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: חִלָּזוֹן נִיהֲוַונְד הֲרֵי הִיא כַּגּוֹלָה לְיוּחֲסִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי: לָא תְּצִיתוּ לֵיהּ, יְבָמָה הִיא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ הָתָם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ דִּידִי הִיא? דְּרַב חֲנַנְאֵל הִיא! אֲזוּל שַׁיְילוּהּ לְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב: חִלָּזוֹן נִיהֲוַונְד הֲרֵי הִיא כַּגּוֹלָה לְיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: Rav Ika bar Avin says Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: Ḥillazon Nihavnad is like the exile with regard to lineage. Abaye said to them: Do not listen to it was a yevama fell before him there said to him: Is that to say is mine? It is Rav Ḥananel’s, They went and asked Rav Ḥananel. He said to them: Rav said as follows: Ḥillazon Nihavnad is like the exile with regard to lineage.
llm_translation: Rav Ikka bar Avin said in the name of Rav Hananel who said in the name of Rav: A widow who falls to a yavam is considered like a captive for lineage. Abbaye said to them: Do not kindle it, for there it is a yevamah who has fallen to him. He said to him: Is it my fault? It is Rav Hananel's! Go ask Rav Hananel, he said to them: Thus said Rav: A widow who falls to a yavam is considered like a captive for lineage.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּנְחֵם בַּחְלַח וּבְחָבוֹר נְהַר גּוֹזָן וְעָרֵי מָדָי״, חֲלַח – זוֹ חִלָּזוֹן, חָבוֹר – זוֹ הַדְיָיב, נְהַר גּוֹזָן – זוֹ גִּינְזַק, עָרֵי מָדָי – זוֹ חֲמָדָן וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: זוֹ נִהֲוַונְד וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: And disagrees of Rabbi Abba bar Kahana, as Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: What which is written “And he put them in Halah, and in Habor, on the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes” Halah is Ḥillazon; Habor is Hadyav; the river of Gozan is Ginzak; the cities of the Medes are Ḥamadan and its neighboring towns, and some say: This is Nihavnad and its neighboring towns.
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rabbi Abba bar Kahana. For Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: What is the meaning of what is written: "And he left in Halach and in Chavor the river of Gozan and the cities of Media," Halach - this is Chilazon, Chavor - this is Hadayav, the river of Gozan - this is Ginzak, the cities of Media - this is Chamadan and its surrounding areas, and some say: this is Nehavand and its surrounding areas.

hebrew_text: מַאי חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּרַךְ מוּשְׁכֵּי חוּסְקֵי וְרוּמְקֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכוּלָּם לִפְסוּל. קָסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּא: מוּשְׁכֵּי הַיְינוּ מוּשְׁכְּנֵי. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּשְׁכְּנֵי הֲרֵי הִיא כַּגּוֹלָה לְיוּחֲסִין! אֶלָּא מוּשְׁכֵּי לְחוּד וּמוּשְׁכְּנֵי לְחוּד.
human_translation: What neighboring towns Shmuel said: city Mushekhei, Ḥosekei, and Rumekei. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And to flawed It was assumed Mushekhei is Mushekanei. But doesn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin say Shmuel says: Mushekanei is like the exile with regard to lineage? Rather, Mushekhei is discrete, and Mushekanei is discrete.
llm_translation: What are her companions? Shmuel said: bundles of drawn and undrawn flax. Rabbi Yochanan said: and all of them are invalid. The Gemara's conclusion: drawn, that is drawn. And didn't Rabbi Chiya bar Avin say in the name of Shmuel: drawn, it is like a rolled scroll for genealogy! Rather, drawn separately and undrawn separately.

hebrew_text: ״וּתְלָת עִלְעִין בְּפֻמַּהּ בֵּין שִׁנַּהּ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ חִלָּזוֹן, הַדְיָיב, וּנְצִיבִין, שֶׁפְּעָמִים בּוֹלַעְתָּן וּפְעָמִים פּוֹלַטְתָּן.
human_translation: “And it had three ribs in its mouth between its teeth” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is Ḥillazon, Hadyav, and Netzivin, which sometimes swallows and sometimes discharges.
llm_translation: "And three lobes in its mouth, between its teeth." Rabbi Yohanan said: This refers to the chilazon, the dyav, and the netzivin, which sometimes you swallow and sometimes you spit out.

hebrew_text: ״וַאֲרוּ חֵיוָה אׇחֳרִי תִנְיָנָה דָּמְיָה לְדֹב״. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵלּוּ פָּרְסִיִּים, שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין כְּדוֹב, וּמְסוּרְבָּלִין כְּדוֹב, וּמְגַדְּלִין שֵׂעָר כְּדוֹב, וְאֵין לָהֶם מְנוּחָה כְּדוֹב. רַבִּי אַמֵּי כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי פָּרְסָא דְּרָכֵיב, אָמַר: הַיְינוּ דּוּבָּא נָיְידָא.
human_translation: “And behold a second beast, similar to a bear” Rav Yosef taught: These are Persians, who eat and drink like a bear, and are corpulent like a bear, and grow hair like a bear, and have no rest like a bear, When Rabbi Ami saw a Persian riding, he would say: This is a bear on the move.
llm_translation: "And they saw a living creature after the likeness of a bear." Rav Yosef taught: These are the Persians, who eat and drink like a bear, and relieve themselves like a bear, and grow hair like a bear, and have no rest like a bear. Rabbi Ammi, when he saw a Persian riding on a horse, said: 'This is the bear that is moving.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְלֵוִי: הַרְאֵנִי פָּרְסִיִּים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דּוֹמִים לַחֲיָילוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית דָּוִד. הַרְאֵנִי חַבָּרִין. דּוֹמִין לְמַלְאֲכֵי חַבָּלָה. הַרְאֵנִי יִשְׁמְעֵאלִים. דּוֹמִין לִשְׂעִירִים שֶׁל בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא. הַרְאֵנִי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבְּבָבֶל. דּוֹמִים לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת.
human_translation: Rabbi said to Levi: Show me Persians, said to him: are similar to the legions of the house of David. Show me Ḥabbarin, are similar to angels of destruction. Show me Ishmaelites. are similar to demons of an outhouse. Show me Torah scholars of Babylonia. are similar to ministering angels.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Levi: Show me Persians. He said to him: They resemble the soldiers of the house of David. Show me Arabs. They resemble the ministering angels. Show me Ishmaelites. They resemble the he-goats of the throne. Show me Babylonian Torah scholars. They resemble ministering angels.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲמַר: הוּמַנְיָא אִיכָּא בְּבָבֶל – כּוּלַּהּ עַמּוֹנָאֵי הִיא. מַסְגַּרְיָא אִיכָּא בְּבָבֶל – כּוּלָּהּ דְּמַמְזֵירֵי הִיא. בִּירְקָא אִיכָּא בְּבָבֶל – שְׁנֵי אַחִים יֵשׁ [בָּהּ] שֶׁמַּחֲלִיפִים נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם זֶה לָזֶה. בִּירְתָּא דְּסָטְיָא אִיכָּא בְּבָבֶל – הַיּוֹם סָרוּ מֵאַחֲרֵי הַמָּקוֹם, דְּאַקְפִּי פִּירָא בִּכְווֹרֵי בְּשַׁבְּתָא וַאֲזֻיל וְצָדוּ בְּהוּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא וְשַׁמְּתִינְהוּ רַבִּי אַחַי בְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה וְאִישְׁתַּמּוּד. אַקְרָא דְאַגְמָא אִיכָּא בְּבָבֶל – אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה יֵשׁ בָּהּ,
human_translation: When Rabbi was dying, he said There is Homanya in Babylonia, all its of Ammon. There is Masgariya in Babylonia, all its mamzerim . There is Bireka in Babylonia, there are two brothers who exchange wives with each other, There is Bireta DeSatya in Babylonia. Today they turned away from the Omnipresent. A ditch with fish overflowed, and they went and trapped on Shabbat. Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Yoshiya, excommunicated them, and they became apostates. There is Akra DeAgma in Babylonia. There is Adda bar Ahava there.
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi was at ease, he said: There is a certain characteristic in Babylon - it is entirely Ammonite. There is a certain characteristic in Babylon - it is entirely Mamzerite. There is a certain characteristic in Babylon - there are two brothers who exchange their wives with each other. There is a certain characteristic in Babylon - today they have turned away from following the place, for I saw a boar trampling on the vineyards on Shabbat, and I went and captured it on Shabbat, and I brought it to Rabbi Ahai son of Rabbi Yoshiyah, and they declared it permitted. There is a certain characteristic in Babylon - there is a man of love in it.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹם יוֹשֵׁב בְּחֵיקוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם. הַיּוֹם נוֹלַד רַב יְהוּדָה בְּבָבֶל.
human_translation: Today he is sitting in the lap of Abraham Today Rav Yehuda was born in Babylonia.
llm_translation: Today sits in the lap of Abraham. Today was born Rav Yehudah in Babylon.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר מָר: כְּשֶׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נוֹלַד רַבִּי. כְּשֶׁמֵּת רַבִּי נוֹלַד רַב יְהוּדָה. כְּשֶׁמֵּת רַב יְהוּדָה נוֹלַד רָבָא. כְּשֶׁמֵּת רָבָא נוֹלַד רַב אָשֵׁי. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁאֵין צַדִּיק נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד שֶׁנִּבְרָא צַדִּיק כְּמוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזָרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וּבָא הַשָּׁמֶשׁ״. עַד שֶׁלֹּא כָּבְתָה שִׁמְשׁוֹ שֶׁל עֵלִי זָרְחָה שִׁמְשׁוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנֵר אֱלֹהִים טֶרֶם יִכְבֶּה וּשְׁמוּאֵל שׁוֹכֵב וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: As the Master said: While Rabbi Akiva was dying, Rabbi was born; while Rabbi was dying, Rav Yehuda was born; while Rav Yehuda was dying, Rava was born; while Rava was dying, Rav Ashi was born. teaches you that a righteous person does not leave the world before an equally righteous person is created, as it is stated: “The sun also rises and the sun also sets” Before Eli’s sun had gone out, Samuel the Ramathite’s sun was rising, as it is stated: “And the lamp of God was not yet gone out, and Samuel was lying
llm_translation: The Master said: When Rabbi Akiva died, Rabbi was born. When Rabbi died, R. Yehuda was born. When R. Yehuda died, Rava was born. When Rava died, Rav Ashi was born. To teach you that a righteous person does not depart from the world until another righteous person like him is created, as it is said: "And the sun rises, and the sun sets." Until the sun of Eli had not yet set, the sun of Samuel the Ramatite rose, as it is said: "And the lamp of God had not yet gone out, and Samuel was lying down, etc."

hebrew_text: ״צִוָּה ה׳ לְיַעֲקֹב סְבִיבָיו צָרָיו״. רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: כְּגוֹן הוּמַנְיָא לְפוּם נַהֲרָא.
human_translation: “The Lord has commanded concerning Jacob, that they that are round about him should be his adversaries” Rav Yehuda says: Homanya Pum Nahara,
llm_translation: "The Lord commanded concerning Jacob, 'He has surrounded him with adversaries.'" Rav Yehudah said: For example, like the fish in the river.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי כְּהִנָּבְאִי וּפְלַטְיָהוּ בֶן בְּנָיָה מֵת וָאֶפֹּל עַל פָּנַי וָאֶזְעַק קוֹל גָּדוֹל וָאֹמַר אֲהָהּ אֲדֹנָי ה׳״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל: חַד אָמַר: לְטוֹבָה, וְחַד אָמַר: לְרָעָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר לְטוֹבָה – כִּי הָא דְּאִיסְתַּנְדְּרָא דְמֵישָׁן חַתְנֵיהּ דִּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הֲוָה, שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: מִכּוּלֵּי הַאי שְׁבִיָּיה דְּאַיְיתֵית לָךְ – לָא שַׁדַּרְתְּ לַן דְּקָאֵי לְקַמַּן?
human_translation: “And it came to pass, when I prophesied, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then fell I down upon my face, and cried with a loud voice, and said: Ah Lord God!” Rav and Shmuel One said for good, and one said for evil. The one who says for good like that the governor [ de’istandera ] of Meishan, who was the son-in-law of Nebuchadnezzar. He sent to From all those captives you have brought for yourself you have not sent us to stand before us.
llm_translation: "And it was when Hananiah the prophet and Palti the son of Benaiah died, and I fell on my face and cried out with a loud voice and said, 'Alas, Lord God!' Rab and Samuel: one said for good, and one said for evil. Whoever said for good - as this one who was engaged to the daughter of Nebuchadnezzar, he sent to her: 'From all this captivity that you have brought upon yourself - you did not send word to us that you are standing before us?'"

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ פְּלַטְיָהוּ בֶּן בְּנָיָהוּ: אֲנַן דַּחֲשִׁבִינַן נֵיקוּ מִקַּמָּךְ הָכָא, וְעַבְדִין נֵיזְלוּ לְהָתָם. וַאֲמַר נְבִיָּא: מִי שֶׁעָשָׂה טוֹבָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, יָמוּת בַּחֲצִי יָמָיו?
human_translation: wanted to send him from the Jews Pelatiah, son of Benaiah, said to We, who are important, shall stand before you here, and our slaves will go there, And the prophet said: One who did good for the Jewish people, die at half his days?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "They sought to expel him from the Jewish people. Paltiyahu son of Benaiah said to them: We who are considered clean from you here, and we will go there. And the prophet said: 'Whoever does good in Israel, may he die in the middle of his days.'"

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר לְרָעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּבֵא אֹתִי אֶל שַׁעַר בֵּית ה׳ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי הַפּוֹנֶה קָדִימָה וְהִנֵּה בְּפֶתַח הַשַּׁעַר עֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אִישׁ וָאֶרְאֶה בְתוֹכָם אֶת יַאֲזַנְיָה בֶן עַזֻּר וְאֶת פְּלַטְיָהוּ בֶן בְּנָיָהוּ שָׂרֵי הָעָם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא אֹתִי אֶל חֲצַר בֵּית ה׳ הַפְּנִימִית וְהִנֵּה פֶתַח הֵיכַל ה׳ בֵּין הָאוּלָם וּבֵין הַמִּזְבֵּחַ כְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אִישׁ אֲחֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳ וּפְנֵיהֶם קֵדְמָה״.
human_translation: The one who says for evil as it is written: “Then a spirit lifted me up, and brought me unto the east gate of the Lord’s House, which looked eastward; and behold, at the door of the gate five and twenty men; and I saw in the midst of them Jaazaniah the son of Azzur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people” and it is written: “And He brought me into the inner court of the Lord’s House, and, behold, at the door of the Temple of the Lord, between the porch and the altar, were about five and twenty men, with their backs toward the Temple of the Lord, and their faces toward the east”
llm_translation: One who said to his friend, as it is written: "And she brought me to the entrance of the house of the Lord, the inner gate that faces east, and there were twenty-five men at the entrance of the gate, and I saw among them Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, leaders of the people." And it is written: "And he brought me to the inner court of the house of the Lord, and behold, at the entrance of the temple of the Lord, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty-five men, with their backs to the temple of the Lord, and their faces toward the east."

hebrew_text: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפְנֵיהֶם קֵדְמָה״ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֲחוֹרֵיהֶם כְּלַפֵּי מַעֲרָב? מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״[אֲחֹרֵיהֶם] אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ מַפְרִיעִין עַצְמָם וּמַתְרִיזִין עַצְמָם כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה. וְקָאָמַר נְבִיָּא: מִי שֶׁעָשָׂה הָרָעָה הַזֹּאת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל יָמוּת עַל מִיטָּתוֹ?!
human_translation: From the it is stated: “And their faces toward the east,” don’t I know that their backs were toward the west, What the verse states: “Their backs toward the Temple of the Lord”? teaches that they exposed themselves and discharged toward above, And prophet is saying: he who did this evil in Israel die on his bed?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From what is heard, as it is stated: "And their faces were eastward" - I do not know that their backs were facing west? What is the Talmud teaching us by saying "their backs toward the house of the Lord" - it teaches that they were disturbing themselves and provoking themselves against heaven. And the prophet says: "Whoever committed this evil in Israel shall die by his bed!"

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר לְרָעָה, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּשְׁכְּנֵי – הֲרֵי הִיא כַּגּוֹלָה לַיּוֹחֲסִים. מֵישׁוֹן – לֹא חָשׁוּ לָהּ לֹא מִשּׁוּם עַבְדוּת וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם מַמְזֵרוּת, אֶלָּא כֹּהֲנִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהּ לֹא הִקְפִּידוּ עַל הַגְּרוּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: It may be concluded Shmuel said for evil, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin says Shmuel says: Mushekanei is like the exile with regard to lineage. Mishon, they were not concerned due to slavery nor due to mamzer status. Rather, the priests who were there were not particular with regard to divorced women.
llm_translation: The completion of Shmuel who said to Ra'ah, as Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Shmuel: "Mushkeni - it is like a captive for genealogy. Meishon - they did not care about it neither because of servitude nor because of mamzerut, but the priests who were in it did not pay attention to the divorces."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר לְטוֹבָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ – יָצָא לְחֵירוּת וְאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל עֶבֶד אִישׁ מִקְנַת כָּסֶף״, עֶבֶד אִישׁ וְלֹא עֶבֶד אִשָּׁה? אֶלָּא: עֶבֶד שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְרַבּוֹ עָלָיו – קָרוּי עֶבֶד, עֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין לְרַבּוֹ רְשׁוּת עָלָיו – אֵין קָרוּי עֶבֶד.
human_translation: Actually, I say to you Shmuel said for good, and Shmuel to his reasoning, as he says: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated and he does not require a bill of manumission. which is stated: every slave man that is bought for money” a slave a man, and not to a woman slave? Rather, a slave whose master has authority over him, is called a slave, A slave whose master does not have authority over him, is not called a slave
llm_translation: Forever, say to you, Samuel said for good, and Samuel for his reason said: one who emancipates his slave - he goes out to freedom and does not need a bill of emancipation, as it is said: "Every slave that is bought for money," a male slave and not a female slave? Rather, a slave who has permission from his master over him - he is called a slave, a slave who does not have permission from his master over him - he is not called a slave.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל אֲרָצוֹת בְּחֶזְקַת כְּשֵׁרוֹת הֵם עוֹמְדוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: This the statement of Rabbi Meir. But the Rabbis say: All lands retain a presumptive status of unflawed
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: All lands are considered as valid for standing.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר שְׁרָא לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן לְמִינְסַב אִיתְּתָא מְחוּזְיָיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ – דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל אֲרָצוֹת בְּחֶזְקַת כְּשֵׁרוֹת הֵן עוֹמְדוֹת? וְהָא בֵּי רַב כָּהֲנָא לָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי, וּבֵי רַב פָּפָּא לָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי, וּבֵי רַב זְבִיד לָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי! אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא קַיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ מֵרַב זְבִיד דִּנְהַרְדְּעָא.
human_translation: Ameimar permitted Rav Huna bar Natan to marry a woman from Meḥoza, Rav Ashi said to What is your reasoning Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis say all lands retain a presumptive status of unflawed but the school of Rav Kahana did not teach like this, and the school of Rav Pappa did not teach like this, and the school of Rav Zevid did not teach like this. Nevertheless, did not accept this halakha from him, because he had heard this Rav Zevid of Neharde’a,
llm_translation: Ammemar sent to Rav Huna the son of Nathan to his daughter from the city of Meḥuzyata. Rav Ashi said to him: What is your opinion – for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Meir, but the Sages say: Are all lands assumed to be in a state of ritual purity? But the household of Rav Kahana did not teach this way, and the household of Rav Papa did not teach this way, and the household of Rav Zevid did not teach this way! Even so, she did not accept it from him, because she heard from Rav Zevid of Dinharda.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַמְזֵירֵי וּנְתִינֵי טְהוֹרִים לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֵין טְהוֹרִים. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְזָרַקְתִּי עֲלֵיכֶם מַיִם טְהוֹרִים וּטְהַרְתֶּם״! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִכֹּל טֻמְאוֹתֵיכֶם וּמִכׇּל גִּלּוּלֵיכֶם״ – וְלֹא מִן הַמַּמְזֵרוּת. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אֲטַהֵר אֶתְכֶם״ – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר אַף מִן הַמַּמְזֵרוּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught Mamzerim and Gibeonites pure in the future; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Meir says: They not pure. Rabbi Yosei said to him: But hasn’t it already been stated: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you, and you shall be clean Rabbi Meir said to him: When it says: “From all your uncleanness, and from all your idols,” but not from mamzer status. Rabbi Yosei said to him: When it says: “Will I cleanse you,” you must say even from mamzer status.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Those who sprinkle and those who give pure offerings in the future, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Meir says: They are not pure. Rabbi Yosei said to him: But hasn't it already been said, "I will sprinkle clean water upon you, and you shall be clean"? Rabbi Meir said to him: When it says, "From all your impurities and from all your idols," it does not include mamzerim. Rabbi Yosei said to him: When it says, "I will purify you," you should also say it includes mamzerim.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָשַׁב מַמְזֵר בְּאַשְׁדּוֹד״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, מַאי ״וְיָשַׁב מַמְזֵר בְּאַשְׁדּוֹד״? כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף: יֵתְבוּן בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל לְרוּחְצָן בְּאַרְעֲהוֹן דַּהֲווֹ (דָּמוּ) [דָּמַיִין] בַּהּ לְנוּכְרָאִין.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, this is as it is written: “And a mamzer shall dwell in Ashdod” But according to Rabbi Yosei, what “And a mamzer shall dwell in Ashdod”? as Rav Yosef would translate The Jewish people shall dwell in tranquility in their land, where they were like strangers,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Meir, that is what is written: "And the bastard shall dwell in Ashdod." But according to Rabbi Yosei, what is "And the bastard shall dwell in Ashdod"? As Rav Yosef interpreted: The house of Israel should understand to immerse themselves in their land, where they are like wine among the nations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הֲוָה אָתֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ מַפֵּיק מִינַּן צַוְורָנֵי צַוְורָנֵי קוֹלָרִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, Rav Yosef says: If it were not Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, Elijah would come remove from us group after group forbidden people [ kolarin ],
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei. Rav Yosef said: If not for the fact that Rav Yehudah said, Shmuel said the halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei, Elijah would have come and taken away our necklaces.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּר נוֹשֵׂא מַמְזֶרֶת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: גֵּר לֹא יִשָּׂא מַמְזֶרֶת. אֶחָד גֵּר אֶחָד עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר וְחָלָל מוּתָּרִים בְּכֹהֶנֶת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? חֲמִשָּׁה קְהָלֵי כְּתִיבִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught A convert may marry a mamzeret the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: A convert may not marry a mamzeret . A convert, an emancipated slave, and a ḥalal are permitted to the daughter of a priest. What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, Five congregations are written,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A convert may marry a mamzeret, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: A convert may not marry a mamzeret. Both a convert and a freed slave, and a halal are permitted to marry into the priesthood. What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's opinion? Five congregations are written.

hebrew_text: חַד – לְכֹהֲנִים, וְחַד – לַלְוִיִּם, וְחַד – לְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים, וְחַד – לְמִישְׁרֵי מַמְזֵר בִּשְׁתוּקִי, וְחַד – לְמִישְׁרֵי שְׁתוּקִי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. קְהַל גֵּרִים לָא אִיקְּרִי קָהָל. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם מֵחַד ״קָהָל״ נָפְקִי, אִיַּיתַּר לֵיהּ לִקְהַל גֵּרִים.
human_translation: One to priests, and one to Levites; and one to Israelites; and one to permit a mamzer to a shetuki , and one to permit a shetuki to an Israelite, congregation of converts, it is not called a congregation And Rabbi Yehuda priests and Levites are derived from one “congregation,” remains for him to the congregation of converts,
llm_translation: One - for the priests, and one - for the Levites, and one - for the Israelites, and one - for the upright mamzerim in Shetuki, and one - for the upright Shetuki in Israel. A congregation of converts is not called a "congregation." And Rabbi Yehuda? The priests and Levites are distinguished from the rest of the "congregation," leaving it more for the congregation of converts.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, תְּרֵי קְהָלֵי נִינְהוּ, מַמְזֵר בִּשְׁתוּקִי וּשְׁתוּקִי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מֵחַד ״קָהָל״ נָפְקָא – ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר בִּקְהַל ה׳״ –
human_translation: And if you wish, say: So too, are two congregations, a mamzer with a shetuki and a shetuki with an Israelite derived from one “congregation,” “A mamzer shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: thus it is stated, there are two congregations, a mamzer in Shetuki and a Shetuki in Israel, from one "congregation" it is derived - "A mamzer shall not enter the assembly of the Lord" -

hebrew_text: מַמְזֵר וַדַּאי הוּא דְּלֹא יָבֹא, הָא מַמְזֵר סָפֵק – יָבֹא, בְּקָהָל וַדַּאי הוּא דְּלֹא יָבֹא, הָא בְּקָהָל סָפֵק – יָבֹא.
human_translation: It is a definite mamzer who may not enter, but a mamzer of an uncertainty, may enter. And similarly, it is into the congregation definite may not enter, but into a congregation uncertain he may enter.
llm_translation: Illegitimate child and certainly he should not enter, but if illegitimate child maybe he should enter, in congregation and certainly he should not enter, but if in congregation maybe he should enter.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָנֵי נָמֵי תְּרֵי קְהָלֵי נִינְהוּ, וְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מֵהָכָא: ״הַקָּהָל חֻקָּה אַחַת לָכֶם וְלַגֵּר הַגָּר״. וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? ״חֻקָּה אַחַת״ – הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: These too, are two congregations, and the reason of Rabbi Yehuda is from here: “As for the congregation, there shall be one statute both for you, and for the stranger that sojourns with you” And according to Rabbi Yosei, “one statute” interrupts the matter,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: These two are considered as two separate congregations, and the reason according to Rabbi Yehuda is from here: "There shall be one statute for you and for the stranger who resides among you." And according to Rabbi Yosei? "One statute" - he interrupted the matter.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר וְחָלָל מוּתָּרִין בְּכֹהֶנֶת. מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ לְרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁירוֹת לְהִנָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִים.
human_translation: a convert, and an emancipated slave, and a ḥalal are all permitted to the daughter of a priest supports of Rav, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Women of unflawed were not prohibited marrying those disqualified due to flawed lineage [ ḥalalim ],
llm_translation: One convert and one freed slave and one halal are permitted in marriage to a priest. This supports Rav, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They were not careful to marry suitable women to unsuitable men.

hebrew_text: דְּרַשׁ רַבִּי זֵירָא בְּמָחוֹזָא: גֵּר מוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. רַגְמוּהּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בְּאֶתְרוֹגַיְיהוּ. אֲמַר רָבָא: מִי אִיכָּא דְּדָרֵישׁ מִילְּתָא כִּי הַאי בְּדוּכְתָּא דִּשְׁכִיחִי גִּיּוֹרֵי? דְּרַשׁ רָבָא בְּמָחוֹזָא: גֵּר מוּתָּר בְּכֹהֶנֶת. טַעֲנוּהּ בְּשִׁירָאֵי. הֲדַר דְּרַשׁ לְהוּ: גֵּר מוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אַפְסֵידְתָּא לְקַמַּיְיתָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דְּטָבָא לְכוּ עֲבַדִי לְכוּ, אִי בָּעֵי מֵהָכָא נָסֵיב וְאִי בָּעֵי מֵהָכָא נָסֵיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira taught in Meḥoza: permitted a convert to a mamzeret . Everyone stoned him with their etrogim , Rava said: Is there who teaches such a matter in a place where there are commonly converts? Rava taught in Meḥoza permitted a convert to the daughter of a priest. They carried him on silk [ beshira’ei ] He later taught them: permitted a convert to a mamzeret . They said to him: You have forfeited first said to them: I have done for you what is good for you. If wishes, marry from here, and if he wishes, marry from here,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira expounded in Mahoza: A convert is permitted in the priesthood. The entire world stoned him with their eyes. Rava said: Is there anyone who expounds a matter like this in the marketplace where converts are common? Rabbi expounded in Mahoza: A convert is permitted in the priesthood. They challenged him in the streets. He then expounded to them: A convert is permitted in the priesthood. They said to him: You have caused us to lose our case. He said to them: Do what you wish, whether you want to marry from here or from there.

hebrew_text: וְהִילְכְתָא: גֵּר מוּתָּר בְּכֹהֶנֶת וּמוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. מוּתָּר בְּכֹהֶנֶת – לֹא הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁירוֹת לְהִנָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִים, וּמוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת – כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And the halakha permitted a convert to the daughter of a priest, and permitted to a mamzeret . permitted a convert to the daughter of a priest, women of unflawed were not prohibited marrying those disqualified And permitted to a mamzeret , in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: The discussion: A convert is permitted to marry a daughter of a Kohen and permitted to marry a daughter of a mamzeret. Permitted to marry a daughter of a Kohen - they were not warned like the other women not to marry disqualified individuals, and permitted to marry a daughter of a mamzeret - like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן: שְׁתוּקִי – כֹּל שֶׁמַּכִּיר. אָמַר רָבָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה שְׁתוּקִי כָּשֵׁר. מַאי טַעְמָא – רוֹב כְּשֵׁרִים אֶצְלָהּ, וּמִיעוּט פְּסוּלִין אֶצְלָהּ.
human_translation: And these are A shetuki any who knows Rava says: By Torah law, a shetuki is fit What is the reason Most are fit with regard to her, and a minority are unfit with regard to her.
llm_translation: These are they: Shetuki - anyone who recognizes. Rava said: A matter of Torah, Shetuki is valid. What is the reason? - Most are valid with her, and few are invalid with her.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָזְלִי אִינְהוּ לְגַבַּהּ, כֹּל דְּפָרֵישׁ – מֵרוּבָּא פָּרֵישׁ. מַאי אָמְרַתְּ – דִּילְמָא אָזְלָה אִיהִי לְגַבַּיְיהוּ הֲוָה לֵיהּ קָבוּעַ, וְכֹל קָבוּעַ כְּמֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה דָּמֵי,
human_translation: And if they came to her, Anything that separates separated from the majority What you say, perhaps she went to them, it is fixed and Anything fixed is considered half and half,
llm_translation: And if they went to a high place, anyone who separates - separates from the majority. What do you say - perhaps if she went to their height, it would be considered established for him, and all that is established is like half and half.

hebrew_text: וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר״ – מַמְזֵר וַדַּאי הוּא דְּלֹא יָבֹא, הָא מַמְזֵר סָפֵק – יָבֹא. בְּקָהָל וַדַּאי הוּא דְּלֹא יָבֹא, הָא בְּקָהָל סָפֵק – יָבֹא!
human_translation: And the Torah states: “A mamzer shall not enter It is a definite mamzer who may not enter, but a mamzer of an uncertainty may enter. it is into a congregation definite he may not enter, but into a congregation uncertain he may enter.
llm_translation: The Torah said: "A mamzer shall not enter" - Mamzer is certainly one who shall not enter, but if there is doubt whether he is a mamzer, he may enter. In the congregation, certainly one who shall not enter, but if there is doubt whether he is in the congregation, he may enter!

hebrew_text: וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ שְׁתוּקִי פָּסוּל? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאָבִיו. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, שְׁתוּקִי – שְׁתוּקִית לֹא יִשָּׂא, שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאָבִיו!
human_translation: And for what reason did say a shetuki flawed decree, lest he marry his sister from his father, If that is so, should not a shetuki marry a female shetuki , lest he marry his sister from his father.
llm_translation: And what is the reason they said that a mute person is disqualified? A decree lest he marry his sister from his father. Rather, from now on, a mute person - a mute woman he shall not marry, lest he marry his sister from his father!

hebrew_text: כֹּל כִּי הָנֵי מְזַנּוּ וְאָזְלִי? בַּת שְׁתוּקִית לֹא יִשָּׂא, שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאָבִיו! אֶלָּא: לָא שְׁכִיחָא, הָכִי נָמֵי לָא שְׁכִיחָא!
human_translation: And do engage in licentiousness to such an extent not marry the daughter of a female shetuki lest he marry his sister from his father, Rather, it is not common So too, it is not common
llm_translation: All when these feed and go? Daughter of Shetuqit will not marry, lest his sister marry from her father! Rather: it is not common, so too it is not common!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַעֲלָה עָשׂוּ בְּיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: Rather, established a higher standard with regard to lineage,
llm_translation: Rather, they made an ascent in Yuchasin.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא, דְּבַר תּוֹרָה: אֲסוּפִי – כָּשֵׁר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ – בְּבַעְלָהּ תּוֹלָה. מַאי אִיכָּא? מִיעוּט אֲרוּסוֹת וּמִיעוּט שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעֲלֵיהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם,
human_translation: And Rava says By Torah law, a foundling, is fit, What is the reason A married woman ascribes to her husband. What is there minority betrothed women And minority whose husbands have gone overseas
llm_translation: And Rava said, a matter of Torah: a gathered sheaf - valid. What is the reason? A woman of a man - she is dependent on her husband. What is the case? Few betrothals and few whose husbands went to the overseas province.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא פְּנוּיָה, וְאִיכָּא נָמֵי דְּמֵחֲמַת רְעָבוֹן, הָוֵה פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא. וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר בְּקָהָל ה׳״ – מַמְזֵר וַדַּאי הוּא דְּלֹא יָבֹא, הָא מַמְזֵר סָפֵק יָבֹא. בְּקָהָל וַדַּאי הוּא דְּלֹא יָבֹא, הָא בְּקָהָל סָפֵק יָבֹא.
human_translation: Since there are unmarried and there are also due to hunger, is half and half, And the Torah states: “A mamzer shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord” It is a definite mamzer who may not enter, but a mamzer of an uncertainty may enter. it is into a congregation definite he may not enter, but into a congregation uncertain he may enter.
llm_translation: Since there is an available seat, and there are others due to hunger, it is half and half. And the Torah said: "A bastard shall not enter the assembly of the Lord" - a bastard certainly shall not enter, but a doubtful bastard may enter. In the assembly certainly he shall not enter, but in the assembly a doubtful one may enter.

hebrew_text: וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ אֲסוּפִי פָּסוּל – שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאָבִיו. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה אֲסוּפִי – אֲסוּפִית לֹא יִשָּׂא, שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ בֵּין מֵאָבִיו בֵּין מֵאִמּוֹ! כֹּל הָנֵי שָׁדוּ וְאָזְלִי?! בַּת אֲסוּפִי לֹא יִשָּׂא, שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ! אֶלָּא לָא שְׁכִיחַ, הָכִי נָמֵי לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: And for what reason did say a foundling is unfit? Lest he marry his sister from his father. If that is so, should not a foundling marry foundling, lest he marry his sister from either his father or his mother. continually throwing away all these should not him marry the daughter of a foundling, lest he marry his sister, Rather, it is not common So too, it is not common
llm_translation: And what is the reason they said that an "asufi" is disqualified? Lest he marry his sister from his father. Rather, from now on, an "asufi" - he shall not marry an "asufit," lest he marry his sister, whether from his father or from his mother! All these will be ruined and lost?! A daughter of an "asufi" he shall not marry, lest he marry his sister! Rather, it is not common, so it is not common.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מַעֲלָה עָשׂוּ בְּיוֹחֲסִים.
human_translation: Rather, established a higher standard with regard to lineage,
llm_translation: Rather, they made an ascent in genealogies.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא: מְצָאוֹ מָהוּל –
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Huna says: found circumcised,
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Huna said: "If he was found to be circumcised -"

hebrew_text: אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. מְשַׁלְּטִי הַדָּמֵיהּ – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. שַׁיִיף מִשְׁחָא, וּמְלֵא כּוּחְלָא, רְמֵי חוּמְרֵי, תְּלֵי פִּיתְקָא, וּתְלֵי קְמִיעָא – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי.
human_translation: he is not subject to a foundling. his limbs are adjusted, he is not subject to a foundling. anointed with oil, or were smeared with salve, adorned with rings, a note [ pitka ] was hanging or an amulet was hanging he is not subject to a foundling.
llm_translation: There is no issue of Asufi in it. Its blood is dominant - there is no issue of Asufi. If it is sharp from the knife, and full of bile, if it throws up clots, hangs a piece of flesh, and hangs a membrane - there is no issue of Asufi.

hebrew_text: תְּלֵי בְּדִיקְלֵי, אִי מָטְיָא לֵיהּ חַיָּה – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי, אִם לָאו – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי.
human_translation: hanging from a palm tree, if an animal could reach him, he is subject to a foundling. If not, he is not subject to a foundling,
llm_translation: Palm branches, if a living creature is found on them - it has the status of a canopy, if not - it does not have the status of a canopy.

hebrew_text: זַרְדְּתָא סְמִיכָא לְמָתָא – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא סְמִיכְתָּא לְמָתָא וּשְׁכִיחִי בֵּיהּ רַבִּים – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי, וְאִם לָאו – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי.
human_translation: a thicket near a town, he is subject to a foundling. But if not, he is not subject to a foundling. in a synagogue near a town, and people are commonly found there, he is not subject to a foundling, But if not, he is subject to a foundling.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Zardeta semikha le'mata - yesh bo mi'shum asufi, ve'im lav - ein bo mi'shum asufi. Bei knishta semikhta le'mata u'sh'kikhi bei rabim - ein bo mi'shum asufi, ve'im lav - yesh bo mi'shum asufi. English translation: A beam that is close to the ground - if it has a threshold, it is considered susceptible to impurity; if not - it is not considered susceptible to impurity. A synagogue that has a beam close to the ground and many people frequent it - it is not considered susceptible to impurity; if not - it is considered susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַאי פֵּירָא דְסוּפְלֵי – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי, חֲרִיפְתָּא דְנַהֲרָא – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. פִּשְׁרֵי – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי.
human_translation: Ameimar said: this cistern into which date pits are placed [ peira desuflei ] he is subject to a foundling. in the middle of river he is not subject to a foundling. at the side he is subject to a foundling. the sides of a public domain, he is not subject to a foundling. the public domain he is subject to a foundling.
llm_translation: Amemar said: This fruit of the sycamore tree - it has the status of being susceptible to impurity, the sharpness of the river - it does not have the status of being susceptible to impurity. Unripe dates - they have the status of being susceptible to impurity. The hunting grounds of the public domain - it does not have the status of being susceptible to impurity. The public domain - it has the status of being susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּבִשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲסוּפִי. הָא דְּרָבָא אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – אַיְּידֵי דִּשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן קָטְלָא לֵיהּ?! וְאֶלָּא אַצִּידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – מַאי אִירְיָא שְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן? אֲפִילּוּ בְּלָא שְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן!
human_translation: Rava said: And in famine years, he is not subject to a foundling. this of Rava, to which If we say to the public domain because it is a famine year, kill him Rather, to the sides of a public domain, why specifically famine years? Even when not famine years,
llm_translation: Rava said: And in the case of two hunger, it does not have the status of gathering. Is this the statement of Rava? If you say it is due to public domain - because of two hunger, is it killed?! Rather, it is in the case of a public domain - what is the relevance of two hunger? Even without two hunger!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אִתְּמַר דְּרָבָא – אַהָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר זַבְדִּי אָמַר רַב: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁבַּשּׁוּק – אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ נֶאֱמָנִים עָלָיו, נֶאֱסַף מִן הַשּׁוּק – אֵין נֶאֱמָנִים עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rather, when Rava’s was stated, with regard to that which Rav Yehuda says Rabbi Abba says Rabbi Yehuda bar Zavdi says Rav says: As long as in the marketplace, his father and mother are deemed credible with regard to him collected from the marketplace, they are no deemed credible with regard to him.
llm_translation: Rather, when it was stated in the name of Rava – this is what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rabbi Abba who said in the name of Rabbi Yehudah bar Zavdi who said in the name of Rav: "As long as one is in the marketplace, his father and mother are trusted upon him; once he leaves the marketplace, they are not trusted upon him."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רָבָא: הוֹאִיל וְיָצָא עָלָיו שֵׁם אֲסוּפִי. וְאָמַר רָבָא: וּבִשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּאֱסַף מִן הַשּׁוּק אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ נֶאֱמָנִים עָלָיו.
human_translation: What is the reason Rava said: Since has been publicized with the name of a foundling, And Rava says: And in famine years, although has been collected from the marketplace, his father and mother are deemed credible with regard to him,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rava said: Since the name Asufi has been attached to him. And Rava said: Even in two famines, even though his father and mother are trustworthy concerning him, even though he has been gathered from the market.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שְׁלֹשָׁה נֶאֱמָנִים לְאַלְתַּר, אֵלּוּ הֵן: אֲסוּפִי, חַיָּה, וּפוֹטֶרֶת חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: three are deemed credible immediately These are they: A foundling, a midwife, and one who exempts her friends
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Three are trusted immediately, they are: a eunuch, a menstruating woman, and a widow from her companions.

hebrew_text: אֲסוּפִי – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: a foundling that which we said,
llm_translation: Asufi - Ha d'amaran.

hebrew_text: חַיָּה – דְּתַנְיָא: חַיָּה נֶאֱמֶנֶת לוֹמַר זֶה יָצָא רִאשׁוֹן וְזֶה יָצָא שֵׁנִי. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא יָצְתָה וְחָזְרָה, אֲבָל יָצְתָה וְחָזְרָה – אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הוּחְזְקָה עַל עוֹמְדָּהּ – נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַהְדַּר אַפַּהּ.
human_translation: a midwife as it is taught A midwife is deemed credible to say this emerged first and that emerged second In what is this statement said? When she has not left and returned. But if she left and returned, she is not deemed credible, Rabbi Eliezer says: she has stood in her place, she is deemed credible. But if not, she is not deemed credible. What is between them? The difference between them when turned her head
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Chayah - detanya: chayah ne'emanet lomar zeh yatza rishon ve zeh yatza sheni. Bameh devarim amurim - shelo yatzah vechazar, aval yatzah vechazar - einah ne'emanet. Rabbi Eliezer omer: huchzekah al omedah - ne'emanet, ve'im lav - einah ne'emanet. Mai beinaiyehu? Ika beinaiyehu de'ahdar apah. English translation: Chayah - as it was taught: a chayah is reliable to say this one came out first and this one came out second. Under what circumstances is this said? - If it did not go out and return, but if it went out and returned - it is not reliable. Rabbi Eliezer says: if it is established on its stance - it is reliable, and if not - it is not reliable. What is the difference between them? - There is a difference between them when it turns back.

hebrew_text: פּוֹטֶרֶת חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ מַאי הִיא? דִּתְנַן: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים שֶׁהָיוּ יְשֵׁנוֹת בְּמִטָּה אַחַת וְנִמְצָא דָּם תַּחַת אַחַת מֵהֶן – כּוּלָּן טְמֵאוֹת. בָּדְקָה אַחַת מֵהֶן וְנִמְצֵאת טְמֵאָה – הִיא טְמֵאָה, וְכוּלָּן טְהוֹרוֹת. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שֶׁבָּדְקָה עַצְמָהּ כְּשִׁיעוּר וֶוסֶת.
human_translation: What is one who exempts her friends? As we learned three women who were sleeping in one bed, and blood was found beneath one of them, they are all impure one of them examined and was found impure, she is impure and all are pure. Rav Ḥisda said: that she examined herself period of time menstruation,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Poteret chavroteha, mai hi? Ditanan: shalosh nashim shehayu yeshenot be'mitahachat venimtza dam tachatachat mehen – kulam temeot. Badkaachat mehen venimtzaet teme'ah – hi teme'ah, vekulam tehorot. Amar Rav Chisda: shebadka atzmah keshiur veset."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נֶאֱמֶנֶת חַיָּה לוֹמַר: זֶה כֹּהֵן וְזֶה לֵוִי, זֶה נָתִין וְזֶה מַמְזֵר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא קָרָא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁם עַרְעָר, אֲבָל קָרָא עָלֶיהָ עַרְעָר – אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: midwife deemed credible to say: This is a priest and that is a Levite; this is a Gibeonite and that is a mamzer . In what is this statement said? When no objection was registered about it. But if an objection was registered about it, she is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: The sages taught: An animal is believed to say, "This one is a Kohen, and this one is a Levi, this one is a Netin, and this one is a Mamzer." In what case are these matters said? When he did not call her a harlot, but if he called her a harlot, she is not believed.

hebrew_text: עַרְעָר דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא עַרְעָר חַד, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין עַרְעָר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם! אֶלָּא עַרְעָר תְּרֵי.
human_translation: An objection of what If we say an objection of one but doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: There is no objection less than two Rather, objection of two
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "What is the case of 'Ar'ar'? If you say it is one 'Ar'ar,' but didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: 'There is no 'Ar'ar' less than two!' Rather, 'Ar'ar' is two."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ עַרְעָר חַד. וְכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֵין עַרְעָר פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם – הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיתָא חֲזָקָה דְכַשְׁרוּת, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא חֲזָקָה דְכַשְׁרוּת – חַד נָמֵי מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Actually, I say to you objection of one and when Rabbi Yoḥanan said there is no objection less than two that statement only where there is a presumption of validity, But where there is no presumption validity, one is also deemed credible
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always say to you one objection. And did Rabbi Yochanan say, "An objection is not less than two"? - Those words are where there is a presumption of validity, but where there is no presumption of validity - one trustworthy witness.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמָן בַּעַל מִקָּח לוֹמַר: לָזֶה מָכַרְתִּי, וְלָזֶה אֵין מָכַרְתִּי. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בִּזְמַן שֶׁמִּקָּחוֹ בְּיָדוֹ, אֲבָל אֵין מִקָּחוֹ בְּיָדוֹ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
