human_translation: owner of purchased deemed credible to say: I sold to this and I did not sell to that In what is this statement said? When the purchased is in possession. But if the purchased is not in his possession, he is not deemed credible
llm_translation: A trustworthy buyer can say: "To this one I have sold, but to this one I have not sold." In what circumstances are these words spoken? When the item is in his possession, but if the item is not in his possession, he is not trustworthy.

hebrew_text: וְנִיחְזֵי זוּזֵי מִמַּאן נָקֵט? לָא צְרִיכָא דְּנָקֵט מִתַּרְוַיְיהוּ וְאָמַר: חַד מִדַּעְתַּאי, וְחַד בְּעַל כּוּרְחַי. וְלָא יְדִיעַ הֵי מִדַּעְתּוֹ וְהֵי לֹא מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: And let us see from whom he took the money, No, necessary where took from both of them, and said: One willingly, and one against my will, and it is not known which with his will and which against his will.
llm_translation: And the coins of Zuzim, from whom are they acquired? It is not necessary that they are acquired from both of them, and he said: One from my knowledge, and one from my neighbor. And it is not known whether it is from his knowledge or not from his knowledge.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמָן דַּיָּין לוֹמַר: לָזֶה זִכִּיתִי וְלָזֶה חִיַּיבְתִּי. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁבַּעֲלֵי דִינִים עוֹמְדִים לְפָנָיו, אֲבָל אֵין בַּעֲלֵי דִינִים עוֹמְדִים לְפָנָיו – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. וְנִיחְזֵי זְכוּתָא מַאן נָקֵיט?
human_translation: a judge deemed credible to say: I found this victorious and I found this one obligated In what is this statement said? When the litigants are standing before him. But if the litigants are not standing before him he is not deemed credible. And let us see who holds the writ of a favorable verdict.
llm_translation: Trustworthy is the judge to say: "To this one I acquitted and to this one I obligated." In what circumstances are these matters said? - When the litigants stand before him, but if the litigants do not stand before him, he is not trustworthy. And let us consider the merit, who will take it?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּקְרִיעַ זְכוּתַיְיהוּ. וְנִיהְדַּר וְנִידַיְּינִינְהוּ! בְּשׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי.
human_translation: No, necessary where their writs of a favorable verdict have been torn up then let him return and judge them of the judges’ discretion [ shuda dedayyanei ].
llm_translation: Not necessary, for their merits are torn. And they are glorified and we glorify them! In the market of those who judge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה נֶאֱמָנִין עַל הַבְּכוֹר, אֵלּוּ הֵן: חַיָּה, אָבִיו, וְאִמּוֹ. חַיָּה – לְאַלְתַּר, אִמּוֹ – כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, אָבִיו – לְעוֹלָם. כִּדְתַנְיָא. ״יַכִּיר״ – יַכִּירֶנּוּ לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Three are deemed credible with regard to a firstborn, they are: A midwife, his father, and his mother. A midwife immediately; his mother all seven his father forever. As it is taught he shall acknowledge shall acknowledge him to others.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Three are trusted regarding the firstborn, these are they: the animal, its father, and its mother. The animal - immediately, its mother - up to seven days, its father - forever. As it was taught: "He shall recognize" - he shall recognize it to others.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר: ״זֶה בְּנִי בְּכוֹר״. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁנֶּאֱמָן לוֹמַר: ״זֶה בְּנִי בְּכוֹר״, כָּךְ נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר: ״זֶה בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה״ וְ״זֶה בֶּן חֲלוּצָה״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: From here, Rabbi Yehuda said: A person deemed credible to say: This my firstborn son. And just as he deemed credible to say: This my firstborn son, so deemed credible to say This a son of a divorced woman, or: This a son of a ḥalutza . And the Rabbis say: he is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: From here Rabbi Yehuda said: A person is trusted to say, "This is my firstborn son." And just as he is trusted to say, "This is my firstborn son," so too he is trusted to say, "This is a son of divorce" and "This is a son of halitzah." And the Sages say: He is not trusted.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הָיָה קוֹרֵא לַשְּׁתוּקִי ״בְּדוּקִי״. מַאי ״בְּדוּקִי״? אִילֵימָא שֶׁבּוֹדְקִין אֶת אִמּוֹ וְאוֹמֶרֶת: לְכָשֵׁר נִבְעַלְתִּי – נֶאֱמֶנֶת, כְּמַאן – כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא! דִּתְנַן: הָיְתָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר זֶה? אָמְרָה לָהֶם: מֵאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וְכֹהֵן הוּא. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפִּיהָ אָנוּ חַיִּין. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Abba Shaul would call a shetuki beduki . What beduki ? If we say that they examine [ bodekin ] his mother, and she says: I engaged in sexual intercourse with unflawed she is deemed credible, with whose With Rabban Gamliel. we learned on another occasion, as we learned was pregnant, and they said to her: What is the status of this fetus, she said to them: from so-and-so, and he is a priest, Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: deemed credible, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: We don’t live from, her mouth, And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: Abba Saul used to call the fetus "Beduki." What is "Beduki"? If you say that they examine its mother and she says, "I became pregnant through so-and-so," trustworthy, like whom? Like Rabban Gamliel. We learned this once! For it was taught: If she was pregnant, and they asked her, "What is the nature of this fetus?" she would say to them, "From so-and-so, who is a certain priest." Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: Trustworthy. But Rabbi Joshua says: We do not rely on her testimony. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: – חֲדָא לְהַכְשִׁיר בָּהּ, וַחֲדָא לְהַכְשִׁיר בְּבִתָּהּ. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ – פּוֹסֵל בְּבִתָּהּ.
human_translation: One to render her fit and one to render her daughter fit This works out well according to the one who says: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her daughter unfit,
llm_translation: One animal to make it fit, and one animal to make its offspring fit. It is left according to the one who says: According to the words of the one who makes it fit, he disqualifies its offspring.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר בָּהּ – מַכְשִׁיר בְּבִתָּהּ, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל מַאי אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן?
human_translation: But according to the one who says: to the statement of the one who deems her fit he deems her daughter fit what is Abba Shaul coming to teach us?
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says: according to the words of the one who deems it fit - he deems it fit in its entirety, what does Abba Shaul come to teach us?

hebrew_text: דְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל עֲדִיפָא מִדְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּאִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָתָם, דְּרוֹב כְּשֵׁרִין אֶצְלָהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּרוֹב פְּסוּלִין אֶצְלָהּ – אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא. אָמַר רָבָא: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל.
human_translation: of Abba Shaul preferable that of Rabban Gamliel, as, if from there, I would say: There most are fit with regard to her, But where most are unfit with regard to her, say not necessary Rava says: halakha in accordance with Abba Shaul.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: D'Abba Shaul adifa miD'Rabban Gamliel. D'i mehatah hava ameina: Hatah, d'rov kesherin etzlah, aval heicha d'rov pesulin etzlah - eima la, tzericha. Amar Rava: Halacha k'Abba Shaul. English translation: Abba Shaul is preferred over Rabban Gamliel. For if it were from there, I would say: From there, where most are valid with her, but here where most are invalid with her - say no, it is necessary. Rava said: The halacha is like Abba Shaul.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הָאֲסוּרִין לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל – מוּתָּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: All those whom it is prohibited to enter into the congregation, are permitted to marry each other’s Rabbi Yehuda prohibits
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All those who are forbidden to enter the congregation - are permitted to enter one another. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: וַדָּאָן בְּוַדָּאָן – מוּתָּר, וַדָּאָן בִּסְפֵיקָן, וּסְפֵיקָן בְּוַדָּאָן, וּסְפֵיקָן בִּסְפֵיקָן – אָסוּר. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַסְּפֵיקוֹת: שְׁתוּקִי, אֲסוּפִי, וְכוּתִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: permitted those definite with those definite prohibited those definite with those an uncertainty, and those an uncertainty with those definite and those an uncertainty with those an uncertainty, And these are the an uncertainty: A shetuki , a foundling, and a Samaritan.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Definite in definite - permitted, definite in doubtful, and doubtful in definite, and doubtful in doubtful - prohibited. And these are the doubtful cases: Shetuki, Asufi, and Kutti."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי כׇּל הָאֲסוּרִין לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל? אִילֵימָא מַמְזֵירֵי וּנְתִינֵי שְׁתוּקֵי וַאֲסוּפֵי – הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא, מַמְזֵירֵי וּנְתִינֵי שְׁתוּקֵי וַאֲסוּפֵי מוּתָּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: What All those whom it is prohibited to enter into the congregation? If we say mamzerim and Gibeonites, shetukim , and foundlings, wasn’t it taught in the first clause mamzerim and Gibeonites, shetukim , and foundlings, permitted to marry each other’s
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason that all those who are forbidden to enter the congregation? If you say it is the ones who cause harm, the ones who give silence, and the ones who gather – but didn't the first part teach us that those who cause harm, the ones who give silence, and the ones who gather are permitted to enter one another!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר, אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַוַּדָּאָן בִּסְפֵיקָן – הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: וַדָּאָן בְּוַדָּאָן – מוּתָּר, וַדָּאָן בִּסְפֵיקָן, וּסְפֵיקָן בִּסְפֵיקָן – אָסוּר, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And furthermore, to which Rabbi Yehuda prohibits If we say to those definite with those an uncertainty, But from that it teaches latter clause Rabbi Eliezer says: permitted those definite with those definite prohibited those definite with those an uncertainty, and those an uncertainty with those definite and those an uncertainty with those an uncertainty; by inference, it is clear Rabbi Yehuda does not maintain
llm_translation: And come: Rabbi Yehuda prohibits, Ahaiya? If you say that they are in doubt - this is because the latter part teaches, Rabbi Eliezer says: Whether it is certain in a certain case - it is permitted, but if it is certain in a doubtful case, and a doubtful case in a doubtful case - it is prohibited, from the principle that Rabbi Yehuda does not agree with him!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר אַגֵּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת, מִידֵּי גֵּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת קָתָנֵי? כׇּל הָאֲסוּרִין לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: And if you would say Rabbi Yehuda prohibits to a convert with a mamzeret , does teach a convert with a mamzeret ? It teaches: All those whom it is prohibited to enter into the congregation,
llm_translation: And if you will say: Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a convert from marrying a mamzeret, is it taught from the case of a convert marrying a mamzeret? It is taught regarding all those who are forbidden to enter the congregation!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says:
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הָאֲסוּרִים לָבֹא בִּקְהַל כְּהוּנָּה, מַאי נִינְהוּ – גִּיּוֹרֶת פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי – מוּתָּרִין לָבוֹא זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: This is is saying: All those whom it is prohibited to enter into the congregation of the priesthood. who are they? a convert less than three years and one day and not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, are permitted to marry one another.
llm_translation: So it is stated: All those who are forbidden to enter the congregation of Kohanim, what are they – a convert within three years and one day, and not like Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai – they are permitted to intermarry with one another.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹקְמַהּ בְּבַת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי! אִם כֵּן, מִצִּידַּהּ תָּבְרַהּ.
human_translation: And let us establish to three years and one day and even with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai’s If so, is broken, from itself,
llm_translation: "And vengeance in a daughter of three years and one day, even according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai! If so, from her side she shall be created."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּבַת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, הָא פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, דְּמוּתֶּרֶת לָבֹא בִּקְהַל כְּהוּנָּה, אֲסוּרָה לָבוֹא זֶה בָּזֶה? הֲרֵי פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, דְּמוּתֶּרֶת לָבֹא בִּקְהַל כְּהוּנָּה וּמֻותֶּרֶת לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: Rather, the reason that three years and one day But less than three years and one day as she is permitted to enter into the congregation of the priesthood, she prohibited from marrying one another? since according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, less than three years and one day who is permitted to enter the congregation of the priesthood and permitted to marry one another.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason for the daughter of three years and one day being prohibited to marry a Kohen is that she is less than the daughter of three years and one day, who is permitted to enter the assembly of Kohanim. Is it forbidden for one to marry the other? Behold, the daughter of three years and one day is permitted according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, to enter the assembly of Kohanim, and it is permitted for one to marry the other!

hebrew_text: וּכְלָלָא הוּא דְּכׇל הָאֲסוּרִים לָבֹא בִּקְהַל כְּהוּנָּה מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה? וַהֲרֵי אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וַחֲלָלָה וְזוֹנָה דַּאֲסוּרִים לָבֹא בִּקְהַל כְּהוּנָּה, וַאֲסוּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה! וְתוּ: הָא מוּתָּר אָסוּר? וַהֲרֵי גֵּר שֶׁמּוּתָּר בְּכֹהֶנֶת וּמוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת!
human_translation: But is it principle all those whom it is prohibited to enter into the congregation of the priesthood are permitted to marry one another? But a widow, and a divorcée, and a woman disqualified from marrying a priest [ ḥalala ], and a woman who has engaged in sexual intercourse with a man forbidden to her by the Torah [ zona ], are prohibited to enter into the congregation of the priesthood and are prohibited to marry one another. And furthermore, But is permitted prohibited But convert, is permitted to a daughter of a priest, and is permitted to a mamzeret .
llm_translation: It is a principle that all those who are forbidden to enter the congregation of Kohanim are permitted to marry one another? But behold, a widow, a divorcee, a halalah, and a prostitute who are forbidden to enter the congregation of Kohanim, are forbidden to marry one another! And furthermore: Is one who is permitted forbidden? But behold, a convert who is permitted to a Kohenet is permitted to a mamzeret!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נָתָן בַּר הוֹשַׁעְיָא: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁכֹּהֵן אָסוּר לִישָּׂא אֶת בִּתּוֹ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ – גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת. וּכְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב – מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Natan bar Hoshaya said: This is is saying: Any that a priest may not marry his daughter. And who is that? A convert who married a female convert, and in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, are permitted to marry one another,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Natan bar Hoshaya said: This is what he meant to say: Any Kohen is forbidden to marry his daughter, and what is the reason? A convert who married a convert. And according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, they are permitted to marry one another.

hebrew_text: וּכְלָלָא הוּא דְּכׇל שֶׁכֹּהֵן אָסוּר לִישָּׂא אֶת בִּתּוֹ מוּתָּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה? הֲרֵי חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּכֹהֵן אָסוּר לִישָּׂא בִּתּוֹ, וַאֲסוּרִין נָמֵי לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה! לָא קַשְׁיָא, כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בֶּן יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But is it principle anyone whose daughter a priest may not marry permitted to marry one another? But a priest disqualified due to flawed lineage [ ḥalal ] who married a Jewish woman, as a priest may not marry his daughter, And are prohibited to marry one another. not difficult, is in accordance with Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda,
llm_translation: It is a principle that any Kohen is forbidden to marry his daughter to a non-Kohen, but it is permissible for them to marry each other? Is it not a contradiction, as in the case of a chalal who marries a daughter of Israel, a Kohen is forbidden to marry his daughter, and they are also forbidden to marry each other! It is not difficult, as Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda said.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה וְכֹהֵן אָסוּר לִישָּׂא בִּתּוֹ, וְאָסוּר נָמֵי לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה! וְתוּ: הָא מוּתָּר אָסוּר? וַהֲרֵי גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְכֹהֵן מוּתָּר לִישָּׂא בִּתּוֹ, וּמוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: But a ḥalal who married a ḥalala , as a priest may not marry his daughter, And are prohibited to marry one another. And furthermore, permitted prohibited But a convert who married a Jewish woman, and a priest is permitted to marry his daughter. And are permitted to marry one another.
llm_translation: Behold, a chalal who married a chalalah, and a kohen is forbidden to marry his daughter, and it is forbidden for them to have relations with one another! And furthermore: Is it permitted to forbid what is already forbidden? And behold, a convert who married a daughter of Israel, and a kohen is permitted to marry his daughter, and they are permitted to have relations with one another!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הָכָא מַמְזֵר מֵאֲחוֹתוֹ וּמַמְזֵר מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said Here, between them a mamzer from his sister, and a mamzer from a married woman
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: Here a mamzer from his sister and a mamzer from a married woman - there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ מַמְזֵר מֵאֲחוֹתוֹ נָמֵי הָוֵי מַמְזֵר. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ הָוֵי מַמְזֵר, מֵאֲחוֹתוֹ – לָא הָוֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: first tanna holds: Even a mamzer from his sister is also a mamzer . And Rabbi Yehuda holds: from a married woman is a mamzer , from his sister is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: We learned in the first teaching: One holds the opinion that even a mamzer from his sister is also considered a mamzer. And Rabbi Yehuda holds the opinion that a mamzer from a married woman is considered a mamzer, but from his sister is not considered a mamzer.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: אֵיזֶהוּ מַמְזֵר – כֹּל שֶׁהוּא בְּ״לֹא יָבֹא״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: What is teaching us We learned Who is a mamzer ? Any who is “He shall not enter” the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We learned: Who is a mamzer? - Anyone who is "lo yavo" (shall not enter), the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו כָּרֵת בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וַהֲלָכָה כִּדְבָרָיו. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Shimon HaTimni says: Any who for which one is liable karet at the hand of Heaven, and the halakha in accordance with his statement. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Any who for which one is liable to court capital punishment.
llm_translation: Shimon HaTimni says: Anyone upon whom a heavenly decree of excision is incumbent, and the halakha is according to his words. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Anyone upon whom a death penalty by the court is incumbent.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הָאֲסוּרִים לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל, וּמַאי נִיהוּ: גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי – מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: between them Ammonite and Moabite convert, and this is what is saying: All those whom it is prohibited to enter into the congregation. who are they? Ammonite and Moabite convert. are permitted to marry one another.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: There is a distinction between an Ammonite and a Moabite convert, and thus he said: All those who are forbidden to enter the congregation, what are they? An Ammonite and a Moabite convert - they are permitted to enter one another.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר גֵּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת, הָנֵי מִילֵּי גֵּר דְּרָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל, אֲבָל גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי דְּאֵין רְאוּיִין לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל – לָא.
human_translation: If so, what is Rabbi Yehuda prohibiting This is saying: Although Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a convert from a mamzeret , this matter convert, who is fit to enter into the congregation. But Ammonite and Moabite convert, who are not fit to enter into the congregation, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, what does Rabbi Yehuda prohibit? This is what he is saying: Even though Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a convert from the Ammonite and Moabite nations from entering the congregation, these are the words of a convert who is fit to enter the congregation, but a convert from the Ammonite and Moabite nations who are not fit to enter the congregation - no. English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי, מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי, כּוּתִי וְנָתִין, חָלָל וּמַמְזֵר שֶׁבָּאוּ עַל הַכֹּהֶנֶת וְעַל הַלְוִיָּה וְעַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – [פְּסָלוּהָ]. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – פּוֹסֵל, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: The Sages taught nine years and one day an Ammonite or Moabite convert, an Egyptian or Edomite a Samaritan, or a Gibeonite, a ḥalal , or a mamzer , who engaged in sexual intercourse with the daughter of a priest, or the daughter of a Levite, or an Israelite woman, has disqualified her from the priesthood. Rabbi Yosei says: Anyone whose offspring is unfit disqualifies and anyone whose offspring is not unfit does not disqualify Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A child of nine years and one day who converts, whether he is an Ammonite, a Moabite, an Egyptian, an Edomite, a Kutite, a Nathinite, a Halal, or a Mamzer, who came to marry a daughter of a Kohen, a Levite, or a daughter of Israel - he disqualifies her. Rabbi Yosei says: Anyone whose seed is disqualified - disqualifies, and anyone whose seed is not disqualified - does not disqualify. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says:

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ. וְכֹל שֶׁאִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ.
human_translation: Anyone whose daughter you may marry, you may marry his widow. And anyone whose daughter you may not marry, you may not marry his widow
llm_translation: All that you bear with your daughter - you bear with his widow. And all that you do not bear with your daughter - you do not bear with his widow.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין תַּנָּא קַמָּא וּבֵין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא לְמָדוּהָ אֶלָּא מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה,
human_translation: What is there between the first tanna and Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: between them a second Egyptian. And both of them learned only from a High Priest with a widow,
llm_translation: What is the difference between the first Tanna and Rabbi Yosei? Rabbi Yochanan said: There are two differences between them. And neither of them learned it except from the High Priest in the case of a widow.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כִּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה שֶׁבִּיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה וּפוֹסֵל בָּהּ, אַף כֹּל שֶׁבִּיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה – פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: the first tanna holds like a High Priest with a widow: Just as a High Priest with a widow, his intercourse by a transgression and he disqualifies her so too anyone whose intercourse by a transgression, disqualifies her
llm_translation: The first Tanna teaches: "When a High Priest marries a widow." Just as a High Priest who marries a widow invalidates her due to his transgression, so too, anyone who marries a widow due to his transgression - invalidates her.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: כִּי כֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל, אַף כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – פּוֹסֵל. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בָּנִים אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ לָהֶם דּוֹר שְׁלִישִׁי יָבֹא לָהֶם בִּקְהַל ה׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei holds like a High Priest with a widow: Just as a High Priest with a widow, whose offspring is unfit and he disqualifies so too, anyone whose offspring is unfit disqualifies to exclude a second Egyptian, whose offspring is not unfit, as the verse states: “The children of the third generation that are born to them may enter into the congregation of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: "When a High Priest marries a widow." Just as a High Priest with a disqualified seed disqualifies his offspring, so too anyone with a disqualified seed disqualifies his offspring. This is to exclude an Egyptian convert, whose seed is not disqualified, as the verse states: "The children born to them may enter the congregation of the Lord in the third generation."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אֶת בִּתּוֹ – אִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? אָמַר עוּלָּא: גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא לְמָדוּהָ אֶלָּא מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Anyone whose daughter you may marry, you may marry his widow. And anyone whose daughter you may not marry, you may not marry his widow What is there between Rabbi Yosei and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? Ulla said: The between them Ammonite and Moabite convert. And both of them learned only from a High Priest with a widow,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Whoever marries off his daughter - he marries off his widow, and whoever does not marry off his daughter - he does not marry off his widow." What is the difference between Rabbi Yosei and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? Ulla said: There is an Ammonite and a Moabite convert between them. And both of them only learned it from the High Priest concerning a widow.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: כִּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – וּפוֹסֵל, אַף כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל – פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yosei holds like a High Priest with a widow: Just as a High Priest with a widow, that his offspring are unfit and he disqualifies so too, anyone whose offspring is unfit disqualifies
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: "Just as a High Priest is disqualified due to his marriage to a widow. What disqualifies a High Priest due to his marriage to a widow is if his seed is disqualified - he disqualifies. So too, anyone whose seed is disqualified - disqualifies."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה שֶׁכׇּל זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל, אַף כֹּל שֶׁכׇּל זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל, אֲפִילּוּ נְקֵבוֹת, לְאַפּוֹקֵי גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי דִּנְקֵבוֹת הָווּ כְּשֵׁרוֹת לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל. דְּאָמַר מָר: עַמּוֹנִי וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית, מוֹאָבִי וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית.
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel like a High Priest with a widow. Just as a High Priest with a widow, as all his offspring are unfit, so too, everyone that all his offspring are unfit, even females, to exclude Ammonite or Moabite convert, as females are fit to enter into the congregation. As the Master said: An Ammonite man but not an Ammonite woman; a Moabite man but not a Moabite woman.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: Like a High Priest with a widow. Just as a High Priest with a widow, whose entire seed is disqualified, so too anyone whose entire seed is disqualified, even females, except for the Ammonite and Moabite converts, as their females are permitted to enter the congregation. As Mar said: Ammonite and not Ammonitess, Moabite and not Moabitess.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּאַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה שֶׁפְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. מַאן מֵיקֵל בְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי – רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְקָאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ. לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה שֶׁפְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: All concede with regard to a widow of questionable lineage, that she is unfit to priesthood. Who is the lenient of these tanna’im ? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he says: Anyone whose daughter you may marry, you may marry his widow; and anyone whose daughter you may not marry, you may not marry his widow to exclude what? to exclude a widow of questionable lineage; that she is unfit to the priesthood,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Everyone agrees regarding the widow of dough that she is disqualified for the priesthood. Who is lenient in these matters? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he said: Everything that you can marry into – you can marry his widow, and everything that you cannot marry into – you cannot marry his widow. What is the exclusion for? To exclude the widow of dough who is disqualified for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי דִּתְנַן: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא עַל אַלְמְנַת עִיסָּה שֶׁכְּשֵׁירָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא – הָוֵי סְפֵק סְפֵיקָא, וּסְפֵק סְפֵיקָא לְקוּלָּא.
human_translation: to exclude these tanna’im . As we learned Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira testified with regard to a widow of questionable lineage, that she is fit to the priesthood. What is the reason It is a compound uncertainty, and a compound uncertainty is to be lenient.
llm_translation: To go out from the words of the Mishnaic sages, as we learned: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira testified concerning a widow whose dough is fit for the priesthood. What is the reason? It is a double doubt, and a double doubt is lenient.

hebrew_text: וַדָּאָן בְּוַדָּאָן מוּתָּר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אֲמַר לִי: הִלֵּל שׁוֹנֶה: עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִים עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל וְכוּלָּם מוּתָּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר?!
human_translation: permitted those definite with those definite Rav Yehuda says Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. When I said that in front of Shmuel, he said to me: Hillel teaches ten lineage ascended from Babylonia, and all of them, are permitted to marry each other’s and you said halakha in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer?
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here, in this case, it is permitted. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer. For when I said it before Shmuel, he said to me: Hillel the Elder taught: Ten genealogical principles ascended from Babylon, and all of them are permitted to intermarry with one another, and you say the halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer?!"

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּרַב אַדְּרַב וּרְמִי דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאִיתְּמַר: אֲרוּסָה שֶׁעִיבְּרָה, רַב אָמַר: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי.
human_translation: And a contradiction can be raised of Rav against of Rav, and a contradiction can be raised from of Shmuel against of Shmuel. As it was stated a betrothed woman who became pregnant Rav says the offspring is a mamzer . And Shmuel says the offspring is a shetuki ,
llm_translation: "And throw of Rav Adarav and throw of Shmuel Adshmuel, as it was stated: A betrothed woman who transgressed, Rav said: The child is a mamzer. And Shmuel said: The child is legitimate."

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר וּמוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי וְאָסוּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. אֵיפוֹךְ, רַב אָמַר: הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rav says the offspring is a mamzer and is permitted to a mamzeret ; and Shmuel says the offspring is a shetuki and is prohibited to a mamzeret . Reverse Rav says: The offspring is a shetuki and Shmuel says: The offspring is a mamzer
llm_translation: Rav said: A child born from a mamzer is permissible in marriage to a mamzeret, and Shmuel said: A child born from a shetuki is forbidden in marriage to a mamzeret. Reverse it, Rav said: A child born from a shetuki, and Shmuel said: A child born from a mamzer.

hebrew_text: תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם דְּרוֹב כְּשֵׁרִים אֶצְלָהּ. אֲבָל הָתָם, דְּרוֹב פְּסוּלִים אֶצְלָהּ, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לִשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: why do I two necessary because if it were stated with regard to that with regard to that Rav states because the majority are fit with regard to her But there, where the majority are unfit with regard to her say that concedes to Shmuel
llm_translation: Two, why do I need? It is necessary, for if it is stated in this one, in this one Rav said in the name of Rav that most are valid with it. But there, since most are invalid with it, say that Samuel agrees.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָךְ, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב – מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיתְלְ[יַ]הּ בְּאָרוּס, אֲבָל בְּהָא אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לִשְׁמוּאֵל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it was stated in this with regard to this Rav states because it is to ascribe to the betrothed man, but in that say that he agrees with Shmuel necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in that case, in this case Rav said - because there is a reason to permit him in the case of betrothal, but in this case Samuel would agree, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וּמַאי מַמְזֵר דְּקָאָמַר רַב – לָאו מוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת, אֶלָּא דְּאָסוּר בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי, דְּאָסוּר בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ דְּרַב! אֶלָּא: מַאי שְׁתוּקִי – שֶׁמְּשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ מִדִּין כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Actually, do not reverse and what mamzer that Rav is saying? not permitted to a mamzeret , but that he is prohibited from a Jewish woman. And Shmuel says the offspring is a shetuki , prohibited from a Jewish woman. If so, that is Rav. Rather, what shetuki that one silences [ meshattekin ] him, from the halakha of the priesthood.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always do not reverse, and what is the mamzer that Rav is saying - not permitted in mamzeret, but forbidden in a daughter of Israel. And Samuel said: The child of a mute, that is forbidden in a daughter of Israel. If so, this is what Rav means! Rather: What is a mute - one who is silenced from priesthood.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, הַשְׁתָּא מִדִּין יִשְׂרָאֵל מְשַׁתְּקִינַן לֵיהּ, מִדִּין כְּהוּנָּה מִיבְּעֵי?! אֶלָּא: מַאי שְׁתוּקִי – שֶׁמְּשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ מִנִּכְסֵי אָבִיו. פְּשִׁיטָא, מִי יָדְעִינַן אֲבוּהּ מַנּוּ? לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּתְפַס.
human_translation: obvious? Now, one silences him from the halakha of a Jew is it necessary from the halakha of the priesthood? Rather, what shetuki that one silences him from his father’s property, is obvious; do we know who his father is? No, necessary where seized
llm_translation: The Gemara: Obviously, now that we establish that in the case of a Jewish court, we silence him, do we also require that in the case of the priesthood?! Rather, what is the meaning of "we silence him"? - That we silence him from his father's property. Obviously, who knows his father's property? It is unnecessary, as it is obvious.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאי שְׁתוּקִי – בְּדוּקִי, שֶׁבּוֹדְקִים אֶת אִמּוֹ וְאוֹמֶרֶת: ״לְכָשֵׁר נִבְעַלְתִּי״ – נֶאֱמֶנֶת. כְּמַאן – כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? הָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דִּתְנַן: הָיְתָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר זֶה? מֵאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וְכֹהֵן הוּא – רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמְרִים: נֶאֱמֶנֶת. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל!
human_translation: And if you wish, say: What shetuki beduki , that they examine his mother, and she says: I engaged in sexual intercourse with unflawed she is deemed credible. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabban Gamliel? didn’t Shmuel say once? As we learned was pregnant, and said to her: What is the status of this fetus? from so and so, and he is a priest; Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: deemed credible; and Rabbi Yehoshua says: She is not deemed credible. And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: What is "shtuki" - precise, that they examine his mother and she says, "I have been married to a valid man" - she is believed. Like whom? Like Rabban Gamliel? For Shmuel said once, as we learned: If she was pregnant, and they said to her, "What is the nature of this fetus?" From a certain man, who is a priest - Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer say: she is believed. Rabbi Yehoshua says: she is not believed. And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabban Gamliel!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָתָם רוֹב כְּשֵׁירִים אֶצְלָהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּרוֹב פְּסוּלִים אֶצְלָהּ, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: necessary As, if from there, I would say there, the majority are fit with regard to her, But here, the majority are unfit with regard to her, you say not necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, for if from there, I would say: from there, most are fit with it, but here, where most are unfit with it, I might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: וְכֵן רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כּוּתִי לֹא יִשָּׂא כּוּתִית. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: עֲשָׂאוּהוּ כְּגֵר לְאַחַר עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת, דְּתַנְיָא: גֵּר, עַד עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת – מוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – אָסוּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת.
human_translation: It is taught And similarly Rabbi Elazar says: A Samaritan may not marry a Samaritan woman. What is the reason Rav Yosef said: established him like a convert, after ten generations. As it is taught a convert, is permitted to a mamzeret within ten generations from this forward is prohibited from a mamzeret ,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: And similarly, Rabbi Elazar says: A Kutite may not marry a Kutitess. What is the reason? Rav Yosef said: They made him like a convert after ten generations, as it was taught: A convert, up to ten generations - is permitted with a mamzeret, from here onward - is forbidden with a mamzeret.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁתַּקֵּעַ שֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: And some say until the name of idol worship is forgotten from him,
llm_translation: And some say, until the name of idolatry is uprooted from it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם גֵּר יָשָׁן וּמַמְזֶרֶת חֲדָשָׁה, אָמְרִי: בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא דְּקָא נָסֵיב מַמְזֶרֶת. הָכָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ. אֶלָּא: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל,
human_translation: Abaye said to Is it comparable There, an old convert, and she is a new mamzeret , say: Jewish man is marrying a mamzeret . Here, this and that, are the same as each other. Rather, When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Elazar holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Who is similar? There, a convert who is old and a mamzeret who is new, they said: It is a son of Israel who is marrying a mamzeret. Here, both are equal, for they are both Hadadei. Rather, when Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi Elazar holds like Rabbi Yishmael,

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר: כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֲרָיוֹת הֵם. וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: נׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: and Rabbi Yishmael holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva Rabbi Elazar holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who says: Samaritans are lion converts, And Rabbi Yishmael holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: a gentile or slave who engaged in sexual intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds like Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar holds like Rabbi Yishmael, as he said: "Samaritans are considered like lions." Rabbi Yishmael holds like Rabbi Akiva, as he said: "A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman – the offspring is a mamzer."

hebrew_text: וּמִי סָבַר לָהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מִנַּיִן לְנׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד שֶׁבָּאוּ עַל הַכֹּהֶנֶת וְעַל הַלְוִיָּה וְעַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁפְּסָלוּהָ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yishmael hold in accordance with Rabbi Akiva But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: From where a gentile or slave who engaged in sexual intercourse with the daughter of a priest, or the daughter of a Levite, or the daughter of an Israelite, that they have disqualified her as it is stated: “But if a priest’s daughter is a widow, or divorced, and has no child,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who does Rabbi Yishmael hold like Rabbi Akiva? And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: From where do we derive that a non-Jew, a slave, who came upon a Kohenet, a Levite, or a daughter of Israel, disqualifies her? As it is stated: "And the daughter of a Kohen, if she becomes a widow or divorced, and has no offspring."

hebrew_text: – מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵרוּשִׁין, יָצָא נׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵרוּשִׁין.
human_translation: one who has widowhood and divorce, exclude a gentile or slave, who do not have widowhood and divorce;
llm_translation: One who has widows and divorcees, a non-Jew and a slave who do not have widows and divorcees.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַשְׁתָּא מַמְזֵר הָוֵי, מִיפְסַל בְּבִיאָתוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva Now is a mamzer , is necessary that disqualifies by engaging in intercourse
llm_translation: And if according to your opinion you think like Rabbi Akiva, now a mamzer he will be, he disqualifies with his entry, does he not require a proof?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר: כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֲרָיוֹת. וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: נׇכְרִי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who says: Samaritans are lion converts, and holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: a gentile or slave engaged in sexual intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar holds like Rabbi Ishmael, who said: Kutim are like lions' cubs. And he holds like Rabbi Akiva, who said: A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וּמִי סָבַר לַהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִילֵּל בְּצָרוֹת מוֹדִים שֶׁאֵין מַמְזֵר אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת!
human_translation: But does Rabbi Elazar hold in accordance with Rabbi Akiva? But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Although Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed with regard to rival wives, concede that a mamzer is only from one whose prohibition is a prohibition of forbidden relatives and punishable by karet .
llm_translation: And who does Rabbi Elazar hold like, Rabbi Akiva? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: Even though Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed, in cases of incest they agree that a mamzer is only from someone whose prohibition is a prohibition of incest and the punishment is karet!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: שָׁלֹשׁ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בַּדָּבָר.
human_translation: Rather, when Rabin came Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and some say Rabbi Abba bar Zavda says Rabbi Ḥanina says and some say Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: three divisions with regard to the matter.
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan, and some say in the name of Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rabbi Hanina, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Three disputes in the matter.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֲרָיוֹת הֵן, וְכֹהֲנִים שֶׁנִּטְמְעוּ בָּהֶם – כֹּהֲנִים פְּסוּלִים הָיוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַעֲשׂוּ לָהֶם מִקְצוֹתָם כֹּהֲנֵי בָמוֹת״, וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִן הַקּוֹצִים שֶׁבָּעָם. וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי פַּסְלִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds Samaritans are lion converts, and the priests who assimilated among them were unfit priests, as it is stated: “And made unto them from among themselves priests of the high places” And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From the thorns that are among the people, And due to that disqualified them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds: Kutim are like the cubs of lions, and priests who intermingled with them - those priests were disqualified, as it is stated: "And they shall make for themselves the ends of the priests of the high places." And Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From the thorns among them. And because of this, they disqualified them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֱמֶת הֵן, וְכֹהֲנִים שֶׁנִּטְמְעוּ בָּהֶן – כֹּהֲנִים כְּשֵׁרִים הָיוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַעֲשׂוּ לָהֶם מִקְצוֹתָם כֹּהֲנֵי בָמוֹת״, וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִן הַבְּחִירִים שֶׁבָּעָם. וְאֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מָה אֲסָרוּם – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיוּ מְיַיבְּמִים אֶת הָאֲרוּסוֹת
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds: Samaritans are true converts, and the priests who assimilated among them were fit priests, as it is stated: “And made unto them from among themselves priests of the high places” And Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from the chosen ones, of the people. And for what did prohibit them because they would perform levirate marriage with betrothed women.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: Kutim are converts of truth, and priests who intermingled with them - the priests were valid, as it is stated: "And they shall make them priests of the high places." And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: from the chosen ones among them. But why were they prohibited? Because they were performing levirate marriage with the betrothed women.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹטְרִים אֶת הַנְּשׂוּאוֹת. מַאי דָּרְשִׁי? ״לֹא תִהְיֶה אֵשֶׁת הַמֵּת הַחוּצָה לְאִישׁ זָר״ – הָךְ דְּיָתְבָה חוּצָה, הִיא לֹא תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר, אֲבָל הָךְ דְּלָא יָתְבָה חוּצָה – תִּהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר.
human_translation: and exempt married women what expound “The wife of the dead man shall not be married outside of the family to one not of his kin; She who sits outside, she shall not be married to one not of his kin, But she who is not sitting outside, shall marry one not of his kin.
llm_translation: And they dismiss the married women. What did he expound? "The wife of a deceased outside the family shall not be married to a stranger" - when she is outside the family, she shall not be married to a stranger, but when she is not outside the family, she shall be married to a stranger.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva to his reasoning, as he says: for which is liable a prohibition is a mamzer .
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva according to his reasoning said: There is a mamzer from those liable to negative commandments.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין בְּדִקְדּוּקֵי מִצְוֹת. מַאן יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים? אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: מַצַּת כּוּתִי מוּתֶּרֶת וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹסֵר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִים בְּדִקְדּוּקֵי מִצְוֹת. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁהֶחֱזִיקוּ בָּהּ כּוּתִים – הַרְבֵּה מְדַקְדְּקִים בָּהּ, יוֹתֵר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And some say because they are not well versed in the details of mitzvot. Who Some say? Rav Idi bar Avin said: It is Rabbi Eliezer. As it is taught The matza of a Samaritan is permitted and a person can fulfill his obligation of Passover with it; but Rabbi Eliezer prohibits since are not well versed in the details of mitzvot, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says any mitzva that Samaritans embraced they are more exacting in its than Jews.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there are those who say: Because they are not proficient in the details of the commandments. Who are those who say this? Rav Idi bar Avin said: It is Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught: Kutim's matzah is permitted, and one fulfills his obligation with it on Passover, and Rabbi Eliezer prohibits it, because they are not proficient in the details of the commandments. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Any commandment that the Kutim held onto – they are more meticulous about it than the Israelites.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָכִי, מַאי אֵין בְּקִיאִין? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין בְּתוֹרַת קִידּוּשִׁין וְגֵירוּשִׁין.
human_translation: But here, what they not well versed? because they are not well versed with regard to the laws of betrothal and divorce.
llm_translation: And rather thus, what is "not proficient"? Because they are not proficient in the laws of Kiddushin and Gittin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַמְזֵר מֵאֲחוֹתוֹ וּמַמְזֵר מֵאֵשֶׁת אָח נִתְעָרְבוּ בָּהֶן. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, יֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת? נִיתְנֵי חֲדָא! מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: a mamzer from his sister and a mamzer from brother’s wife were assimilated among them, What is he teaching us for which is liable to receive karet is a mamzer , let him teach one the incident that took place, took place in this way,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: A mamzer from his sister and a mamzer from his brother's wife intermingled. What are we to infer from this? Are there mamzers liable for karet? Let one be presented! There was a case that was so.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: עֶבֶד וְשִׁפְחָה נִתְעָרְבוּ בָּהֶן. אִיסּוּרָא מִשּׁוּם מַאי, מִשּׁוּם שִׁפְחָה? נִיתְנֵי חֲדָא! מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: And Rava says: slave and maidservant were assimilated among them. the prohibition due to what? due to maidservant, let him teach one The incident that took place, took place in this way.
llm_translation: Rava said: A male slave and a female slave became intermingled. The prohibition is due to what? Due to the female slave? Let it be taught as one! A case that was such, was such.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה כֹּהֶנֶת – צָרִיךְ לִבְדּוֹק אַחֲרֶיהָ אַרְבַּע אִמָּהוֹת שֶׁהֵן שְׁמֹנֶה: אִמָּהּ, וְאֵם אִמָּהּ, וְאֵם אֲבִי אִמָּהּ, וְאִמָּהּ, וְאֵם אָבִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ, וְאֵם אֲבִי אָבִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ. לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אַחַת.
human_translation: who marries a woman the daughter of a priest must investigate with regard to her four mothers, which are eight. her mother, and the mother of her mother, and the mother of her mother’s father, and her mother, And the mother of her father, and her mother, and the mother of her father’s father, and her mother a Levite or an Israelite he adds to these one additional
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who marries a Kohenet - must investigate after her four generations, which are eight: her mother, her mother's mother, her mother's father's mother, her mother's father, her father's mother and her father's father's mother. For a Levite or an Israelite, one more generation is added.

hebrew_text: אֵין בּוֹדְקִין לֹא מִן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּלְמַעְלָה, וְלֹא מִן הַדּוּכָן וּלְמַעְלָה, וְלֹא מִן הַסַּנְהֶדְרִין וּלְמַעְלָה. וְכֹל שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ אֲבוֹתָיו מִשּׁוֹטְרֵי הָרַבִּים וְגַבָּאֵי צְדָקָה – מַשִּׂיאִין לַכְּהוּנָּה וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִבְדּוֹק אַחֲרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: one need not investigate from the altar and above. Nor from the platform, and above, nor from the Sanhedrin and above, And anyone whose ancestors held public posts, and charity collectors, may marry into the priesthood, and there is no need to investigate their
llm_translation: We do not inspect neither from the altar and above, nor from the platform and above, nor from the Sanhedrin and above. And anyone whose ancestors were established as overseers of public funds and collectors of charity - they may be appointed to the priesthood, and there is no need to investigate further after them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף מִי שֶׁהָיָה חָתוּם עֵד בְּעַרְכֵי הַיְּשָׁנָה שֶׁל צִיפּוֹרִי. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: אַף מִי שֶׁהָיָה מוּכְתָּב בְּאִסְטְרַטְיָא שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even one who had signed a witness in the old court [ ba’arki ] of Tzippori Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: Even one who was written the army list [ be’isteratya ] of the king
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even someone who was signed as a witness on the evaluations of the old birds. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: Even someone who was inscribed in the royal archives.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא בִּנְשֵׁי בָּדְקִינַן וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּגַבְרֵי דְּלָא בָּדְקִינַן? נְשֵׁי דְּכִי מִינְּצוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי – בַּעֲרָיוֹת הוּא דְּמִינְּצוּ, וְאִם אִיתָא דְּאִיכָּא מִילְּתָא – לָא אִית לַיהּ קָלָא, גַּבְרֵי דְּכִי מִינְּצוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי – בְּיוּחֲסִין הוּא דְּמִינְּצֵי, אִם אִיתָא דְּאִיכָּא מִילְּתָא – אִית לַיהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: What is different about women we investigate and what is different about men we do not investigate When women quarrel with each other, it is through forbidden sexual intercourse, that they quarrel. And if it is so that there is a matter it not publicity. when men quarrel with each other, it is through lineage that they quarrel. if it is so that there is a matter it publicity,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between women that we investigate and men that we do not investigate? Women, when they are found in the company of each other, it is regarding matters of forbidden relationships that they are found, and if there is a matter to be found, there is no light for them. Men, when they are found in the company of each other, it is regarding matters of lineage that they are found, and if there is a matter to be found, there is light for them.

hebrew_text: וְאִיהִי נָמֵי תִּבְדּוֹק בֵּיהּ בְּדִידֵיהּ? מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁרוֹת לִינָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִים.
human_translation: But she should also investigate his supports Rav, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: not prohibited women unflawed to marry flawed
llm_translation: And where does she examine it by herself? It supports Rav, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "They were not warned that the kosher should not marry the unfit."

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה תָּנֵי: אַרְבַּע אִמָּהוֹת שֶׁהֵם שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: אַרְבַּע אִמָּהוֹת שֶׁהֵם שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה –
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava taught four mothers who are twelve, It was taught in a baraita : Four mothers who are sixteen. Granted, according to Rav Adda bar Ahava,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava taught: Four cubits which are twelve. In the Mishnah it was taught: Four cubits which are sixteen. Granted according to Rav Adda bar Ahava –

hebrew_text: מוֹקֵים לַהּ בִּלְוִיָּה וּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתָא נֵימָא פְּלִיגָא? לָא, מַאי ״עוֹד אַחַת״ – זוּג אַחַת.
human_translation: he interprets to a Levite or an Israelite woman, But we say the baraita disputes No, what is One additional? one pair,
llm_translation: Establishing for her in Levirate marriage and daughter of Israel. Rather, the Mishnah says a dispute? No, what is "another" - one pair.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל מִשְׁפָּחוֹת בְּחֶזְקַת כְּשֵׁרוֹת הֵן עוֹמְדוֹת. אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: מִשְׁנָתֵינוּ כְּשֶׁקּוֹרֵא עָלָיו עַרְעָר! מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי הָא – לָא מַתְנֵי הָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis say: All families retain a presumptive status of fitness, Is that so, But doesn’t Rav Ḥama bar Gurya say Rav says: Our mishna when an objection was registered about The one who taught this did not teach that
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: These are the words of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: All families are presumed to be of legitimate lineage. Is it not so? But didn't Rav Hama bar Gurya say in the name of Rav: According to our Mishnah, when a challenge is made against him, he is considered a mamzer! Whoever teaches this - does not teach that.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל מִשְׁפְּחוֹת בְּחֶזְקַת כְּשֵׁרוֹת הֵן עוֹמְדוֹת. אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: אִם קוֹרֵא עָלָיו עַרְעָר, צָרִיךְ לִבְדּוֹק אַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Yehuda says Rav says: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis say: All families retain presumptive status of fitness. Rav Ḥama bar Gurya says Rav says: When an objection is registered about he must investigate it.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yehudah says, Rav says: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: all families are presumed to be of good lineage. Rav Hama son of Gurya says, Rav says: If one casts aspersion upon him, one must investigate afterwards.

hebrew_text: אֵין בּוֹדְקִין מִן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּלְמַעְלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי לָאו דְּבַדְקוּהּ לָא הֲווֹ מַסְּקִי לֵיהּ. וְלֹא מִן הַדּוּכָן וּלְמַעְלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר מָר: שֶׁשָּׁם הָיוּ יוֹשְׁבִים מְיַיחֲסֵי כְּהוּנָּה וּמְיַיחֲסֵי לְוִיָּה.
human_translation: one need not investigate from the altar and above. What is the reason If had not examined his they would not have him to ascend Nor from the platform and above. What is the reason? as the Master said For there priesthood lineage and the Levites of lineage sat
llm_translation: We do not inspect from the altar and above. What is the reason? If it is not inspected, it is not deemed fit. And not from the platform and above. What is the reason? As the Master said: For there were seated there those who were genealogically traced to the priesthood and those who were genealogically traced to Levites.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מִסַּנְהֶדְרִין וּלְמַעְלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מְנוּקִּין בְּצֶדֶק – כָּךְ מְנוּקִּין מִכׇּל מוּם. אָמַר מָרִימָר: מַאי קְרָאָה – ״כֻּלָּךְ יָפָה רַעְיָתִי וּמוּם אֵין בָּךְ״.
human_translation: Nor from the Sanhedrin and above. What is the reason as Rav Yosef taught just as the court is clean in justice, so too, it is clean of any blemish, Mareimar said: What is the verse “You are all fair, my love; and there is no blemish in you”
llm_translation: "And not from Sanhedrin and above. What is the reason? For Rav Yosef teaches: Just as a court must be clear of any injustice, so too must they be clear of any blemish. Marimar said: What is the verse? 'You are all fair, my love, and there is no blemish in you.'"

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מוּמָא מַמָּשׁ! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִתְיַצְּבוּ שָׁם עִמָּךְ״, ״עִמָּךְ״ – בְּדוֹמִים לָךְ.
human_translation: say an actual blemish, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: the verse states “That they may stand there with you” “with you” With similarity to you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima muma mammash! Amar Rav Acha bar Yaakov: Amar kra: 'Ve'hit'yatzvu sham imach,' 'imach' - bedomim lach." English translation: "A blemish indeed! Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: The verse states: 'And they shall stand there with you,' 'with you' - in a similar manner to you."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מִשּׁוּם שְׁכִינָה? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָקֵל מֵעָלֶיךָ וְנָשְׂאוּ אִתָּךְ״ – בְּדוֹמִים לָךְ.
human_translation: But perhaps due to Divine Presence, Rav Naḥman said the verse states: “So shall they make it easier for you and bear the burden with you” With similarity to you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And perhaps because of the Divine Presence (Shechinah)? Rav Nachman said, the verse says: 'And they shall be light for you, and they shall carry you along with you' - in your likeness." English translation: "And perhaps because of the Divine Presence (Shechinah)? Rav Nachman said, the verse says: 'And they shall be light for you, and they shall carry you along with you' - in your likeness."

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִי שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ אֲבוֹתָיו מִשּׁוֹטְרֵי הָרַבִּים. לְמֵימְרָא דְּלָא מוֹקְמִינַן מִפְּסוּלִים? וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִים לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, וְאֵין הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִים לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. וְהָוֵינַן בָּהּ: ״הַכֹּל״ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַמְזֵר! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַב שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר זֵירָא בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי דְבֵי לֵוִי: בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: Anyone whose ancestors held public posts Is this to say that we do not establish from flawed And raises a contradiction All are fit to judge monetary law, but not all are fit to judge capital law. And we discussed it: What does All, to include? And Rav Yehuda says: to include a mamzer , Abaye said: in Jerusalem, And Rav Shimon bar Zeira similarly taught in Kiddushin from school of Levi: in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: The one whose ancestors were established as officers of the public. To say that we do not appoint disqualified individuals? And ask: Are all fit to judge financial cases, but not all fit to judge capital cases? And we raise a contradiction: "All" - to include what? And Rav Yehudah said: To include a mamzer! Abaye said: In Jerusalem. And similarly, Rav Shimon bar Zeira taught in the sanctification of the house of Levi: In Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: וְגַבָּאֵי צְדָקָה מַשִּׂיאִים. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּמִנְּצוּ בַּהֲדֵי אִינָשֵׁי, דְּאָמַר מָר: מְמַשְׁכְּנִים עַל הַצְּדָקָה וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְאִם אִיתָא דְּאִיכָּא – אִית לֵיהּ קָלָא.
human_translation: And charity collectors may marry What is the reason due to they quarrel with people, the Master said: may take collateral for charity even on the eve of Shabbat, And if it is so that there is it publicity
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the collectors of charity raise. What is the reason? Since they are found in the hands of people, as the Master said: They draw upon charity even on Friday evening, and if there is a need, a voice is given to it."

hebrew_text: אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָּנֵיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה גִּיּוֹרָא הֲוָה, וַהֲוָה קָא מִנְּצֵי אִיהוּ וְרַב בִּיבִי, מָר אָמַר: אֲנָא עָבֵידְנָא סְרָרוּתָא דְמָתָא, וּמַר אָמַר: אֲנָא עָבֵידְנָא סְרָרוּתָא דְמָתָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף אֲמַר לְהוּ: תְּנֵינָא: ״שׂוֹם תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ... מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ״, כׇּל מְשִׂימוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה מֵשִׂים – לֹא יִהְיֶה אֶלָּא מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava’s host was a convert, and he and Rav Beivai were quarreling. One said: I perform the service of the city, and one said: I perform the service of the city. They came before Rav Yosef said to them: We learned: “You shall set him king over you, one from among your brothers” All appointments that you appoint may be only from among your brothers.
llm_translation: The treasury of Rav Adda bar Ahava was a proselyte, and he was sitting with Rav Bivi. The master said: I am making a donation for the sake of the dead, and the master said: I am making a donation for the sake of the dead. They came before Rav Yosef, he said to them: We have learned: "You shall surely appoint over you a king... from among your brothers," all appointments that you make - should only be from among your brothers.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: וַאֲפִילּוּ אִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ. הִלְכָּךְ רַב בִּיבִי דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּא הוּא – לִיעַיֵּין בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא, וּמָר – לִיעַיֵּין בְּמִילֵּי דְמָתָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הִלְכָּךְ מַאן דְּמַשְׁרֵי צוּרְבָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן בְּאוּשְׁפִּיזְכָּנֵיהּ – לַאשְׁרֵי כְּרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, (דְּיָדַע לִמְהַפֵּיךְ) [דִּמְהַפֵּיךְ] לֵיהּ בִּזְכוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to And even mother Jewish? said to him: his mother is Jewish, “From among your brothers” are said about him. Therefore, Rav Beivai, who is a great man should oversee the matters of Heaven, and the Master, should oversee the matters of the city. Abaye said, Therefore, one has a Torah scholar as a guest, let him host such as Rav Adda bar Ahava, who knows how to plead in his favor,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Ahava: "Even if his mother is from Israel?" He said to him: "If his mother is from Israel, I call him your brother." Therefore, Rav Bibi, the great man, should engage in matters of Heaven, and Mar should engage in worldly matters. Abaye said: Therefore, one who allows his hair to grow long like the Sages, in his humility - fortunate is he like Rav Adda bar Ahava, (for he knows how to turn) how to turn it to his merit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא מִטַּפַּל בְּהוּ, רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ מִטַּפַּל בְּהוּ. בְּמַעְרְבָא אֲפִילּוּ רֵישׁ כּוֹרֵי לָא מוֹקְמִי מִינַּיְיהוּ. בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא אֲפִילּוּ רֵישׁ גַּרְגּוּתָא לָא מוֹקְמִי מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira would deal with Rabba bar Avuh would deal with them. In the West, they would not establish even an appointee over measurements from them, In Neharde’a, they would not establish even an appointee over irrigation from them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira would pray for them, Rabba bar Avuh would pray for them. In Ma'arava, even the head of mountains do not stand in their way. In Nehardea, even the head of a bridge does not stand in their way.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף מִי שֶׁהָיָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? דָּיְיקִי וּמַחְתְּמִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even one who What is the reason examine have them sign.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Even one who was, etc." What is the reason? Because it is precise and conclusive.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּחֲיָילוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית דָּוִד. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קְרָא? ״וְהִתְיַחְשָׂם בַּצָּבָא בַּמִּלְחָמָה״. וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא זְכוּתָן וּזְכוּת אֲבוֹתָם מְסַיַּיעְתָּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: in the military troops of the House of David, Rav Yosef said: What is the verse “Reckoned by lineage for service in war” And what is the reason Rav Yehuda says Rav says: in order that their merit and the merit of their ancestors will help them
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus and onwards. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: In the soldiers of the house of David. Rav Yosef said: What is the verse? "And they were enrolled in the army for war." And the reason is what? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: So that their merit and the merit of their fathers may assist them.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא צֶלֶק הָעַמּוֹנִי, מַאי לָאו דְּאָתֵי מֵעַמּוֹן? לָא, דְּיָתֵיב בְּעַמּוֹן. וְהָאִיכָּא אוּרִיָּה הַחִתִּי, מַאי לָאו דְּאָתֵי מֵחֵת? לָא, דְּיָתֵיב בְּחֵת.
human_translation: But isn’t there Zelek the Ammonite, what, is it not that came from Ammon? No, that he dwelled in Ammon, But isn’t there Uriah the Hittite what, is it not that came from Heth? No, that he dwelled in Heth.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And where is Tzelach the Ammonite, why does he not come from Ammon? No, for he resides in Ammon. And where is Uriah the Hittite, why does he not come from Heth? No, for he resides in Heth."

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא אִתַּי הַגִּתִּי! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי דְּיָתֵיב בְּגַת, וְהָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אִתַּי הַגִּיתִּי בָּא וּבִטְּלָהּ!
human_translation: But isn’t there Ittai the Gittite And if you would say so too that he dwelled in Gath but doesn’t Rav Naḥman say, Ittai the Gittite came and nullified its
llm_translation: The text reads: "And where is the Gitti coming from! And if you say that it is because he is sitting in Gath, but Rav Nachman said: 'The Gitti is coming and will be nullified!'"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת יְלָדִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְדָוִד, וְכוּלָּם בְּנֵי יְפַת תּוֹאַר הָיוּ, וְכוּלָּם מִסְתַּפְּרִים קוֹמֵי, וּמְגַדְּלִים בְּלוֹרִית הָיוּ, וְכוּלָּם יוֹשְׁבִים בִּקְרוֹנִיּוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב וְהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִים בְּרָאשֵׁי גְיָיסוֹת, וְהֵן הֵן בַּעֲלֵי אֶגְרוֹפִים שֶׁל בֵּית דָּוִד! דְּאָזְלִי לְבַעוֹתֵי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: And further, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: David had four hundred youths all sons of beautiful women, all of had their hair cut komei or grew a gentile hairstyle [ belorit ] and all of them sat in gold carts [ bikroniyyot ] and would march at the head of troops and these very ones were the strong men of the House of David, they would go forth in order to frighten everyone.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: David had four hundred children, and all of them were of beautiful appearance, and all of them were well-groomed, and they grew in rows, and all of them sat on golden thrones and walked at the head of the troops, and they were the owners of the slings of the house of David! They went down to the gates of the world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּת חָלָל זָכָר – פְּסוּלָה מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה לְעוֹלָם. יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה – בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁירָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּת גֵּר זָכָר כְּבַת חָלָל זָכָר.
human_translation: The daughter of a male ḥalal is unfit to the priesthood forever. an Israelite who married a ḥalala , his daughter is fit to the priesthood, a ḥalal who married a Jewish woman, his daughter is unfit to the priesthood. Rabbi Yehuda says: The daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of a male ḥalal ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A daughter of a ḥalal is permanently disqualified from the priesthood. An Israelite who marries a ḥalalah, his daughter is fit for the priesthood. A ḥalal who marries a daughter of an Israelite, his daughter is disqualified from the priesthood. Rabbi Yehuda says: The daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of a ḥalal.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת – בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁירָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, וְגֵר שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁירָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, אֲבָל גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת – בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. אֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד עֲבָדִים מְשׁוּחְרָרִים אֲפִילּוּ עַד עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא אִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁירָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: an Israelite who married a convert, his daughter is fit to the priesthood, and a convert who married a Jewish woman, his daughter is fit to the priesthood. But convert who married convert, his daughter is unfit to the priesthood. both converts and emancipated slaves, even up to ten generations. until his mother is Jewish. Rabbi Yosei says: Even convert who married convert, his daughter is fit to the priesthood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A convert who marries the daughter of a Kohen - his daughter is fit for the priesthood, and a non-Jew who marries the daughter of a Jewish woman - his daughter is fit for the priesthood. But a non-Jew who marries a convert - his daughter is disqualified for the priesthood. Whether the father was a convert or a freed slave, even for ten generations, until his mother is descended from Israel. Rabbi Yosei says: Even a convert who marries the daughter of a convert, his daughter is fit for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי לְעוֹלָם? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִידֵּי דַּהֲוָה אַמִּצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי, מָה לְהַלָּן לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת, אַף כָּאן נָמֵי לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What forever? lest you say just as it is in an Egyptian and an Edomite just as there, after three generations, so too here, also after three generations. teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "forever"? What is the reason? Since there was an Egyptian and an Edomite, what was the outcome after three generations there, so too here it will be after three generations, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ בְּעַמָּיו״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״לֹא יִטַּמָּא בַּעַל בְּעַמָּיו״. מָה לְהַלָּן זְכָרִים וְלֹא נְקֵבוֹת, אַף כָּאן זְכָרִים וְלֹא נְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: an Israelite who married a ḥalala , From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon it is stated here: “And he shall not profane his offspring among his people” and it is stated there: “He shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people” Just as there males but not females; so too here, males but not females.
llm_translation: Israel who carried out a profanation. From where are these words? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: It is stated here, "And he shall not profane his offspring among his people," and it is stated elsewhere, "Nor shall he defile himself among his people." Just as there it refers to males and not females, so too here it refers to males and not females.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל תִּישְׁתְּרֵי! מִי כְּתִיב בְּנוֹ? ״זַרְעוֹ״ כְּתִיב, ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ בְּעַמָּיו״.
human_translation: If that is so, the daughter of a High Priest should be permitted Is it written his son It is written: “His offspring,” “He shall not profane his offspring among his people.”
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, the daughter of the High Priest shall be permitted! Who is written about his son? "His offspring" is written, "He shall not profane his offspring among his people."

hebrew_text: בַּת בְּנוֹ תִּישְׁתְּרֵי! כְּתִיב ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״, מַקִּישׁ זַרְעוֹ לוֹ, מָה הוּא – בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה, אַף בְּנוֹ – בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה. בַּת בִּתּוֹ תִּיתְּסַר! אִם כֵּן, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: the daughter of his son should be permitted. It is written: “He shall not profane his offspring,” links his offspring to him: Just as him, his daughter is unfit; so too his son, his daughter is unfit. the daughter of his daughter should be prohibited, If so, of what use is the verbal analogy
llm_translation: Daughter of his son shall be disqualified! It is written, "He shall not profane his offspring," equating his offspring to him. Just as he – his daughter is disqualified, so too his son – his daughter is disqualified. Daughter of his daughter shall be disqualified! If so, what benefit does the similar decree serve?

hebrew_text: חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל – בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה. הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא: ״בַּת חָלָל זָכָר פְּסוּלָה מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה לְעוֹלָם״! אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: a ḥalal who married a Jewish woman, his daughter is unfit Wasn’t this taught in the first clause: The daughter of a male ḥalal is unfit to the priesthood forever? Since it taught the first clause an Israelite who married a ḥalala , it also taught the latter clause a ḥalal who married a Jewish woman,
llm_translation: A desecrated one who married a daughter of Israel - his daughter is disqualified. This is what the first Tanna taught: "The daughter of a desecrated one, male, is disqualified forever from the priesthood!" Since the first Tanna taught that if an Israelite married a desecrated woman, the latter Tanna also taught that a desecrated one who married a daughter of Israel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בֶּן יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִקְוֵה טׇהֳרָה לַחֲלָלוֹת, כָּךְ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִקְוֵה טׇהֳרָה לַחֲלָלִים. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ בְּעַמָּיו״ – בְּעִם אֶחָד הוּא דְּמֵיחֵל, בִּשְׁנֵי עֲמָמִים אֵינוֹ מֵיחֵל.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda says: Just as the sons of Israel a ritual bath of purity for ḥalalot , so the daughters of Israel are a ritual bath of purity for ḥalalim , What is the reason of Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yehuda? the verse states: “He shall not profane his offspring among his people” It is among one people that he profanes, among two peoples he does not profane.
llm_translation: Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda, as it was taught: Rabbi Dostai ben Yehuda says: Just as the sons of Israel immerse for purity for the unclean, so too the daughters of Israel immerse for purity for the unclean. What is the reason for Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yehuda? He said a verse: "He shall not defile his offspring among his people" - it is one nation that he defiles, he does not defile among two nations.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זַרְעוֹ, הִיא עַצְמָהּ, מִנַּיִן? אָמַרְתָּ: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, מָה זַרְעוֹ שֶׁלֹּא עָבַר עֲבֵירָה – מִתְחַלֵּל, הִיא שֶׁעָבְרָה עֲבֵירָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמִּתְחַלֶּלֶת?
human_translation: The Sages taught: “he shall not profane his offspring.” I have only his offspring from where she herself, i.e., You say a fortiori If his offspring, who did not commit a transgression, is profaned, is it not logical that she, who did commit a transgression, is profaned?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "He shall not profane his offspring" - I have only his offspring, herself, from where? You said: a fortiori, just as his offspring that did not commit a transgression - is profaned, she who committed a transgression - is it not logical that she is profaned?
