hebrew_text: הוּא, עַצְמוֹ יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁעָבַר עֲבֵירָה וְאֵין מִתְחַלֵּל! מָה לְהוּא, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין מִתְחַלֵּל בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, תֹּאמַר בְּהִיא, שֶׁמִּתְחַלֶּלֶת בְּכׇל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: He, himself, shall prove as he committed a transgression but not profaned. What about in that and in no case is profaned you say with regard to her, who is disqualified in all cases?
llm_translation: He himself will prove, that he transgressed a sin and is not desecrated! What is the reason for him, that indeed he is not desecrated in every place, you will say in this, that she desecrates in every place.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר: אָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״ – לֹא יְחוּלַּל, זֶה שֶׁהָיָה כָּשֵׁר וְנִתְחַלֵּל.
human_translation: And if it is your wish to say The verse states: “He shall not profane his offspring,” shall not become profaned. this who was fit and became profaned.
llm_translation: And if your soul to say: said the verse "he shall not profane his seed" - he shall not profane, this one that was valid and was profaned.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְזַרְעוֹ – שֶׁכֵּן יְצִירָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל״, לֹא יְחוֹלֵל – זֶה שֶׁהָיָה כָּשֵׁר וְנִתְחַלֵּל.
human_translation: What If it is your wish to say And if you would say can be refuted What about his offspring? in that he is formed through a transgression. the verse states: “He shall not profane his offspring,” shall not become profaned. this who was fit and became profaned.
llm_translation: What does "if your soul says" mean? And if you say there is room to refute: Just as his seed - for his creation is in transgression, the verse says, "He shall not profane," he shall not profane - this is one who was fit and became profaned.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזוֹ הִיא חֲלָלָה – כֹּל שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה מִן הַפְּסוּלִים. מַאי ״פְּסוּלִים״? אִילֵימָא פְּסוּלִים לוֹ, הֲרֵי מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ דִּפְסוּלָה לוֹ וּבָנֶיהָ כְּשֵׁרִים, דִּכְתִיב ״תּוֹעֵבָה הִיא״ – הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה, וְאֵין בָּנֶיהָ תּוֹעֲבִים!
human_translation: The Sages taught: Who is a ḥalala ? any born from flawed What flawed If we say unfit for him, isn’t there remarries his divorcée unfit for him, and her children are fit. As it is written “That is an abomination” That is an abomination, but the children of are not an abomination
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: What is considered a "chalalah"? Anything born from those who are disqualified. What are "disqualified"? If you say they are disqualified for him, behold, he can return his divorced wife who is disqualified for him, yet their children are legitimate, as it is written, "It is an abomination" - she is an abomination, but her children are not abominations!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵיזוֹ הִיא חֲלָלָה – כֹּל שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה מִן פְּסוּל כְּהוּנָּה. נוֹלְדָה – אִין, לֹא נוֹלְדָה – לָא? הֲרֵי אַלְמָנָה, וּגְרוּשָׁה, זוֹנָה, דְּלֹא נוֹלְדָה, וְקָא הָוְיָא חֲלָלָה!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: This is saying: Who is a ḥalala ? any born from one unfit for the priesthood. born, yes, not born not Aren’t there a widow, or a divorced woman, a zona not born and is a ḥalala .
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Thus he said: Which is a ḥalalah - all that was born from a disqualified kohen. If she was born - no, if she was not born - no? Behold, a widow, a divorcee, a prostitute, who was not born, and she becomes a ḥalalah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵיזוֹ חֲלָלָה מוּזְכֶּרֶת שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר כְּלָל? כֹּל שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה מִן פְּסוּל כְּהוּנָּה. מַאי ״מוּזְכֶּרֶת״? אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אָבִין: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵיזוֹ הִיא חֲלָלָה שֶׁעִיקָּרָהּ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה וְאֵין צְרִיכִין לְפָרֵשׁ מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים – כֹּל שֶׁנּוֹלְדָה מִן פְּסוּלֵי כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabba said: This is saying: Who is the ḥalala mentioned that did not have a moment of fitness at all, any born from one unfit for the priesthood. What is Mentioned? Rav Yitzḥak bar Avin said: This is saying: Who is the ḥalala whose is rooted in the words of the Torah, and it is not necessary to clarify by the words of the Sages? any born from one unfit for the priesthood.
llm_translation: Rabba said: Thus he said: Which disqualified offering is remembered that it did not have a moment of validity at all? Any that was born from a disqualified priesthood. What is "remembered"? Rav Yitzchak bar Avin said: Thus he said: Which is the disqualification whose essence is from the words of the Torah and does not require explanation from the words of the Sages - any that was born from the disqualifications of the priesthood.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַלְמָנָה אַלְמָנָה אַלְמָנָה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. גְּרוּשָׁה גְּרוּשָׁה גְּרוּשָׁה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a widow, a widow, a widow, he is liable only one a divorcée, a divorcée, a divorcée, he is liable only one
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Widow, widow, widow" - one is only liable once. "Divorcee, divorcee, divorcee" - one is only liable once.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וַחֲלָלָה זוֹנָה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵם כַּסֵּדֶר – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. זִינְּתָה וְנִתְחַלְּלָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: a widow, and a divorcée, and a ḥalala , a zona , when in order, is liable for each and every one became a zona and became a ḥalala and she divorced, and was widowed, is liable only one
llm_translation: Widow and divorced woman and halalah are prostitutes, when they are in order - obligated for each and every one. If she prostituted herself and became defiled and was divorced and was subjected to halitzah - he is only obligated for one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אַלְמָנָה אַלְמָנָה אַלְמָנָה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. הַאי אַלְמָנָה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁבָּא עַל אַלְמְנַת רְאוּבֵן וְעַל אַלְמְנַת שִׁמְעוֹן וְעַל אַלְמְנַת לֵוִי, אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת?
human_translation: The Master said a widow, a widow, a widow, he is liable only one What are the circumstances of this widow? If we say that he engaged in sexual intercourse With Reuven’s widow, and with Shimon’s widow, and with Levi’s widow, why is he liable only one
llm_translation: Master said: Widow, widow, widow - one is liable only for one. How is this widow comparable? If you say that he married the widow of Reuben, and the widow of Simeon, and the widow of Levi, why is he liable only for one?

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי גּוּפִין מוּחְלָקִים, הֲרֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִים!
human_translation: Aren’t they separate bodies, Aren’t they labels [ shemot ] separate [ muḥlakim ]
llm_translation: Behold bodies are divided, behold names are divided!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שֶׁבָּא עַל אַלְמָנָה אַחַת שָׁלֹשׁ בִּיאוֹת. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ – פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: Rather, that he engaged in three acts of intercourse with one widow. What are the circumstances? If they did not forewarn him is obvious he is liable only one
llm_translation: Rather, he came upon one widow three times. How so? If he did not find her – it is obvious that he is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ אַכֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא – אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת? וְהָתְנַן: נָזִיר שֶׁהָיָה שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״אַל תִּשְׁתֶּה״ ״אַל תִּשְׁתֶּה״ וְהוּא שׁוֹתֶה – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת!
human_translation: Rather, that they forewarned him for each and every one why is he liable only one But didn’t we learn A nazirite who was drinking wine the entire day is liable only one they said to him: Do not drink, do not drink, and he drinks, he is liable for each and every
llm_translation: Rather, that it is found in it, eat one and one - why is he not liable except for one? And we learned in a Mishnah: A Nazirite who was drinking wine all day long - he is liable only for one. They said to him: "Do not drink, do not drink," and he drinks - he is liable for each and every one!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁבָּא עַל אַלְמְנַת רְאוּבֵן שֶׁהָיְתָה אַלְמְנַת שִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה אַלְמְנַת לֵוִי. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא הֲרֵי שֵׁמוֹת מוּחְלָקִים – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן גּוּפִים מוּחְלָקִים בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: No, necessary where he engaged in sexual intercourse with Reuven’s widow, who was Shimon’s widow, who was Levi’s widow. Lest you say separate labels teaches us we require separate bodies and not
llm_translation: Not necessary, that he came upon the widow of Reuben who was the widow of Simeon who was the widow of Levi. What might you say? Behold, the names are divided - we need divided bodies, and there are none.

hebrew_text: ״אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וַחֲלָלָה זֹנָה״. הַאי תַּנָּא מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר – אִיפְּכָא נָמֵי! וְאִי קָסָבַר אֵין אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר – אֲפִילּוּ כַּסֵּדֶר הַזֶּה נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: a widow, and a divorcée, and a ḥalala , a zona , What does this tanna hold? If he holds a prohibition takes effect prohibition the reverse also And if he holds a prohibition does not take effect prohibition likewise not even in this order.
llm_translation: "Widow, divorcee, and halal are considered promiscuous." What does this Tanna hold? If he holds that one prohibition does not take effect on another prohibition - it should be the opposite! And if he holds that one prohibition does take effect on another prohibition - even according to this arrangement, it should not be so!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תַּנָּא אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר לֵית לֵיהּ, אִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: this tanna does not a prohibition takes effect another prohibition he holds an expanded prohibition.
llm_translation: Rava said: This Mishna teaches that one prohibition can take effect upon another prohibition, but it cannot take effect upon itself; a prohibition can only add to it.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה אֲסוּרָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְשַׁרְיָא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. הָוְיָא לַהּ גְּרוּשָׁה, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף לַהּ אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט – אִיתּוֹסַף לַהּ אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וַעֲדַיִין שַׁרְיָא לְמֵיכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. הָוְיָא לַהּ חֲלָלָה, מִיגּוֹ דְּאִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְמֵיכַל בִּתְרוּמָה – אִיתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּרָא לְגַבֵּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: a widow is forbidden to a High Priest but is permitted to a common priest. she becomes a divorcée, since a prohibition has been added to her with regard to a common priest, prohibition is added to her with regard to a High Priest. And she is still permitted to partake of teruma she becomes a ḥalala since a prohibition to eat teruma has been added, prohibition is added with regard to a High Priest
llm_translation: Widow forbidden to High Priest and permitted to ordinary priest. If she was divorced, since the prohibition was added to her regarding the ordinary priest - the prohibition was added to her regarding the High Priest, yet she is still permitted to eat from the offerings. If she was a divorcee, since the prohibition was added to her regarding eating from the offerings - the prohibition was added to her regarding the High Priest.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא זוֹנָה – מַאי אִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף אִית בַּהּ? אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא: הוֹאִיל וְשֵׁם זְנוּת פּוֹסֵל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: But a zona , what expanded prohibition is there with regard to her? Rav Ḥana bar Rav Ketina said: Since the label of zenut disqualifies in Israel,
llm_translation: Rather, "zonah" - what additional prohibition is there in it? Rav Ḥana bar Rav Kattina said: Since the name of promiscuity disqualifies in Israel.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא בְּ״יִקָּח״, הֲרֵי הוּא בְּ״לֹא יִקָּח״. כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּ״יִקָּח״ אֵינוֹ בְּ״לֹא יִקָּח״ – פְּרָט לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ אַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: Any who is in “Shall he take” is in “Shall he not take” any who is not in “Shall he take” is not in “Shall he not take.” excludes of a High Priest who engaged in intercourse with his widowed sister.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: Anything that is "to take," it is considered as "not to take." Anything that is not "to take," it is not considered as "not to take" - except for the High Priest who marries his sister, a widow.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּאֲמַר לָךְ, מַנִּי – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הָאוֹכֵל נְבֵילָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – פָּטוּר. דְּאִי רַבָּנַן, הָא אָמְרִי: אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: said to him: who said to you, whose It is Rabbi Shimon, who says A prohibition does not take effect prohibition As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: One who eats animal carcass on Yom Kippur is exempt As, if the Rabbis, don’t they say: A prohibition takes effect where another prohibition exists?
llm_translation: He said to him: that which he said to you, "Mani" - it is Rabbi Shimon, who said: a prohibition does not take effect on another prohibition. As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: one who eats nevelah on Yom Kippur - is exempt. For if it were according to the Rabbis, they would say: a prohibition takes effect on another prohibition.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כִּי אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר – הָנֵי מִילֵּי אִיסּוּר חָמוּר עַל אִיסּוּר קַל, אֲבָל אִיסּוּר קַל עַל אִיסּוּר חָמוּר – לָא חָיֵיל.
human_translation: You even say the Rabbis, as when the Rabbis say a prohibition takes effect where another prohibition exists, that statement severe prohibition, to a light prohibition, But a light prohibition does not take effect to a severe prohibition.
llm_translation: Even if you say it is according to the Rabbis, when the Rabbis say one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition - those matters of a severe prohibition upon a light prohibition, but a light prohibition upon a severe prohibition - does not take effect.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: הָא מַנִּי – רַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר, וְכִי אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר, הָנֵי מִילֵּי אִיסּוּר חָמוּר עַל אִיסּוּר קַל, אֲבָל אִיסּוּר קַל עַל אִיסּוּר חָמוּר – לָא חָיֵיל. דְּאִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הַשְׁתָּא אִיסּוּר חָמוּר עַל אִיסּוּר קַל לָא חָיֵיל, אִיסּוּר קַל עַל אִיסּוּר חָמוּר מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: There are who say whose is this? It is the Rabbis, who say: A prohibition takes effect where another prohibition exists. And when the Rabbis say a prohibition takes effect where another prohibition exists, that statement severe prohibition, to a light prohibition, but a light prohibition does not take effect to a severe prohibition. As, if Rabbi Shimon, now a severe prohibition does not take effect to a light prohibition, is necessary a light prohibition does not take effect to a severe prohibition?
llm_translation: There are those who say: This is a dispute of the sages, for they say: One prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition. And when the sages say that one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition, those matters of a severe prohibition upon a lenient prohibition are effective, but a lenient prohibition upon a severe prohibition - is not effective. For if it were according to Rabbi Shimon, now, a severe prohibition upon a lenient prohibition is not effective, does a lenient prohibition upon a severe prohibition require inquiry?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִיסּוּר כְּהוּנָּה שָׁאנֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say a prohibition priesthood is different. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: the prohibition of kohanim marrying women who are halalot is different, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: יִשְׂרָאֵל הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ – זוֹנָה מְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ. חֲלָלָה, מְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ אוֹ לָא מְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: an Israelite who engages in intercourse with his sister, makes her a zona he make her a ḥalala or he does not make her
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: "If a Israelite comes upon his sister - she is considered a prostitute to him. Is she considered a desecrated woman, is she considered a prostitute to him or is she not considered a prostitute to him?"

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן קַל וָחוֹמֶר: מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין הָוְיָא חֲלָלָה, מֵחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אוֹ דִילְמָא אֵין חֲלָלָה אֶלָּא מֵאִיסּוּר כְּהוּנָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין (אִיסּוּר) חֲלָלָה אֶלָּא מֵאִיסּוּר כְּהוּנָּה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Do we say an a fortiori she becomes a ḥalala by is liable prohibition, not all the more so by is liable karet ? Or perhaps ḥalala only a prohibition priesthood? said to him: a ḥalala only a prohibition priesthood alone.
llm_translation: We say a fortiori: If those liable to negative commandments render something profane, how much more so those liable to excisions? Or perhaps profanation only results from a prohibition related to the priesthood? He said to him: Profanation only results from a prohibition related to the priesthood alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן ״אֵין חֲלָלָה אֶלָּא מֵאִיסּוּר כְּהוּנָּה״? דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יֵאָמֵר גְּרוּשָׁה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְתֵיתֵי בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִכֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: הַשְׁתָּא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט אֲסוּרָה, לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל מִיבַּעְיָא? לָמָּה נֶאֶמְרָה: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחֲלוּקָה גְּרוּשָׁה מִזּוֹנָה וַחֲלָלָה בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, כָּךְ חֲלוּקָה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rava says: From where is this matter that the Sages state, a ḥalala only a prohibition priesthood, As it is taught not state a divorcée to a High Priest, and derive it by an a fortiori from a common priest. As I state Now is forbidden to a common priest, is necessary to a High Priest? why stated? Just as a divorcée is distinct from a zona and a ḥalala in a common priest, so too, distinct in a High Priest,
llm_translation: Rava said: From where is this matter that the Rabbis say, "Chalalah is only from a prohibition like priesthood"? For it was taught: One should not say that a divorced woman is permitted to a regular priest and forbidden to a High Priest, but rather, one should use a fortiori reasoning from a regular priest to a High Priest. And I say: If now, a regular priest is forbidden, why would a High Priest be required? Why is it stated: Just as a divorced woman is distinct from a prostitute and a chalalah with a regular priest, so too is she distinct with a High Priest.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, מִיגְרָע גָּרְעָה? אֶלָּא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחֲלוּקָה גְּרוּשָׁה מִזּוֹנָה וַחֲלָלָה בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט – כָּךְ אַלְמָנָה חֲלוּקָה מִגְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלָלָה זוֹנָה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: is obvious; is lower Rather, Just as a divorcée is distinct from a zona and a ḥalala in a common priest, so too, a widow is distinct from a divorcée, and a ḥalala , a zona in a High Priest,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it logical that she should be more stringent in the case of a widow than in the case of a divorcee? Rather, just as a divorcee is distinguished from a prostitute and a halalah in the case of an ordinary priest, so too a widow is distinguished from a divorcee and a prostitute in the case of a high priest.

hebrew_text: חֲלָלָה לָמָּה נֶאֶמְרָה? אֵין חֲלָלָה אֶלָּא מֵאִיסּוּר כְּהוּנָּה. זוֹנָה לָמָּה נֶאֶמְרָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״זוֹנָה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״זוֹנָה״, מָה כָּאן זַרְעוֹ חוּלִּין, אַף לְהַלָּן זַרְעוֹ חוּלִּין.
human_translation: Why is a ḥalala stated a ḥalala only from a prohibition priesthood. Why is a zona stated It is stated here: “ Zona ” and it is stated there: “ Zona ” Just as here, his offspring are profaned, so too there, in his offspring are profaned.
llm_translation: Profane, why was it stated? Profane is only from a prohibition of priesthood. Harlot, why was it stated? It is stated here "harlot," and it is stated elsewhere "harlot," just as here its seed is permissible, so too there its seed is permissible.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הִילְכָּךְ, כֹּהֵן הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Consequently, a priest who engages in intercourse with his sister
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Therefore, a kohen who marries his sister.

hebrew_text: – זוֹנָה מְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ, חֲלָלָה לָא מְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ. חָזַר וּבָא עָלֶיהָ – עֲשָׂאָהּ חֲלָלָה.
human_translation: renders her a zona , he does not render her a ḥalala , again engaged in intercourse with her, he makes her a ḥalala ,
llm_translation: A prostitute who is designated for him, a profaned woman is not designated for him. If he returns and has relations with her - he has made her profaned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם, אַחַת מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יִקָּח״, וְאַחַת מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל״. וְלִילְקֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ״! בְּשֶׁלֹּא גָּמַר בִּיאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: A High Priest with a widow is flogged two one due to shall he not take” and one due to he shall not profane” And let him also be flogged due to “He shall not profane his offspring,” where he did not complete his intercourse.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A High Priest who marries a widow receives two lashes, one for "he shall not take" and one for "he shall not defile." And let him also receive lashes for "he shall not defile his offspring"! Before he completes his act.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת, מַאי לָאו שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת וְתוּ לָא?
human_translation: Rava raises an objection a widow a divorcée is flogged due to two labels What, is it not two labels and no more?
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: A widow and a divorcee are punished for having two names, what is the reason that they are not punished for having two names?

hebrew_text: לָא, שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת עַל זֶה וּשְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת עַל זֶה.
human_translation: No; two labels for this, and two labels for that,
llm_translation: Not, two names on this and two names on this.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא: גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל אַחַת! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל אַחַת, וּלְעוֹלָם שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause a divorcée also a yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ], he is liable due to only one This is is saying: He is liable due to only one but actually two labels.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, say the latter part: A divorced woman and a widow - he is liable only for one! Thus he is saying: He is liable only for one, and forever two names.

hebrew_text: וַחֲלוּצָה דְּרַבָּנַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: גְּרוּשָׁה – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא גְּרוּשָׁה, חֲלוּצָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאִשָּׁה״! מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And a ḥalutza by rabbinic law? But isn’t it taught a divorcée. I have only a divorcée; from where a ḥalutza The verse states: “And a woman by rabbinic law, and the verse is a mere support,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the exemption of the Rabbis? And it was taught: A divorced woman - I have only a divorced woman, from where do we derive the exemption? The Talmud teaches: "And a woman"! From the Rabbis, and the verse is merely a support.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קִידֵּשׁ – לוֹקֶה, בָּעַל – לוֹקֶה. קִידֵּשׁ לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יִקָּח״. בָּעַל לוֹקֶה מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל״. רָבָא אָמַר: בָּעַל – לוֹקֶה, לֹא בָּעַל – אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִקַּח... וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל״ מָה טַעַם ״לֹא יִקַּח״? מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל״.
human_translation: Abaye says: betrothed is flogged; engaged in sexual intercourse is flogged betrothed, is flogged due to “Shall he not take.” engaged in intercourse, is flogged due to “He shall not profane.” Rava says: engaged in intercourse is flogged; did not engage in intercourse, he is not flogged because it is written: “Shall he not take…and he shall not profane,” For what reason not to take? so that he not profane.
llm_translation: Abaye said: One who sanctifies - is punished, one who betroths - is punished. One who sanctifies is punished because of "he shall not take." One who betroths is punished because of "he shall not profane." Rava said: One who betroths is punished, one who does not betroth is not punished, because it is written: "he shall not take... and he shall not profane." What is the reason for "he shall not take"? Because of "he shall not profane."

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה אַבָּיֵי בְּמַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ, שֶׁאִם קִידֵּשׁ וְלֹא בָּעַל – שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. ״לְקַחְתָּהּ לִהְיוֹת לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: And Abaye concedes in remarries his divorcée that if he betrothed without engaging in intercourse, he is not flogged. the Merciful One states “Take her again to be his wife” and no
llm_translation: Abaye concedes regarding returning his divorcee, that if he betrothed her and did not consummate the marriage - he is not penalized. "To take her to be his wife" the Merciful One said, and this is not applicable.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רָבָא בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה, שֶׁאִם בָּעַל וְלֹא קִידֵּשׁ – שֶׁלּוֹקֶה. ״וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ בְּעַמָּיו״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וַהֲרֵי הוּא חִילֵּל. וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים בְּמַחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ, שֶׁאִם בָּעַל וְלֹא קִידֵּשׁ – שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, דֶּרֶךְ לִיקּוּחִין אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And Rava concedes in a High Priest with a widow, that if he engaged in sexual intercourse without betrothing he is flogged the Merciful One states “And he shall not profane his offspring among his people” and he has profaned And they both concede in one who remarries his divorcée that if he engaged in intercourse without betrothing he is not flogged, the Torah forbade through the manner of taking,
llm_translation: Rava concedes regarding a High Priest with a widow, that if he cohabited and did not sanctify her - he is lashed. "And he shall not defile his offspring among his people," the Merciful One said, and yet he defiled. And both agree regarding returning his divorced wife, that if he cohabited and did not sanctify her - he is not lashed, as the Torah forbade taking her back.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּת גֵּר זָכָר כְּבַת חָלָל. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּת גֵּר זָכָר כְּבַת חָלָל זָכָר. וְהַדִּין נוֹתֵן: מָה חָלָל, שֶׁבָּא מִטִּפָּה כְּשֵׁרָה – בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה, גֵּר, שֶׁבָּא מִטִּפָּה פְּסוּלָה – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁבִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of ḥalal , It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of a male ḥalal , And logic dictates Just as a ḥalal , who comes from a fit drop his daughter is unfit a convert, who comes from an unfit drop, is it not logical that his daughter should be unfit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The daughter of a convert is like the daughter of a profaned person. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: The daughter of a convert is like the daughter of a profaned person who is male. And similarly, he gives the ruling: Just as a profaned person, who comes from a valid drop, his daughter is disqualified, so too a convert, who comes from a disqualified drop, is it not the case that his daughter is disqualified?

hebrew_text: מָה לְחָלָל, שֶׁכֵּן יְצִירָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵין יְצִירָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה, בִּתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: What about a ḥalal ? in that he is formed through a transgression, a High Priest with a widow shall prove since the formation of was not through a transgression, and his daughter is unfit
llm_translation: What is the case of a blemished animal, that its creation is through transgression. The High Priest may prove with a widow, that her creation is not through transgression, her daughter is disqualified.

hebrew_text: מָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה! חָלָל יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: What about a High Priest with a widow? in that his intercourse is a transgression. a ḥalal will prove
llm_translation: What is the High Priest with a widow, for this is his coming in transgression! A profane person shall prove it.

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין, לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן – שֶׁאֵינָן בְּרוֹב הַקָּהָל, אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא אֶת הַגֵּר שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּרוֹב הַקָּהָל וּבִתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: And the derivation has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that their common denominator is that they are unlike most of the congregation, I will also bring the convert, who is unlike most of the congregation, and his daughter is unfit to marry
llm_translation: The judgment returned, not seen this like seen this, the side equal in them - that they are not in the majority of the congregation, I will also bring the convert who is not in the majority of the congregation and his daughter is disqualified.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶם צַד עֲבֵירָה!
human_translation: What about their common denominator is that includes an aspect of a transgression,
llm_translation: What is the similarity between them, that they both have a side of transgression!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה יוֹכִיחַ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: Do not say a High Priest with a widow will prove rather, say a first Egyptian will prove
llm_translation: Do not say, "A High Priest may marry a widow," rather say, "A firstborn Egyptian may marry her."

hebrew_text: מָה לְמִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל. חָלָל יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: What about a first Egyptian? in that he is not fit to enter into the congregation a ḥalal will prove
llm_translation: What about the first Egyptian, that he is not fit to enter the congregation. A desecrated one shall prove it.

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין. לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן – שֶׁאֵינָן בְּרוֹב קָהָל, וּבִתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה. אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא אֶת הַגֵּר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּרוֹב קָהָל וּבִתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: And the derivation has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that their common denominator is that they are unlike most of the congregation, daughters are unfit I will also bring the convert, who is unlike most of the congregation, and his daughter is unfit to marry
llm_translation: The judgment returned. Not seen this like seen this, the side equal in them - that they are not in the majority, and his daughter is disqualified. Also, I will bring the convert, who is not in the majority and his daughter is disqualified.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן פּוֹסְלִים בְּבִיאָתָם. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: גֵּר נָמֵי פּוֹסֵל בְּבִיאָתוֹ, וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ בַּמָּה הַצַּד מֵהַאי דִּינָא.
human_translation: What about their common denominator is that they disqualify through their intercourse, And Rabbi Yehuda a convert also disqualifies through his intercourse, and he derives by the common factor from this halakha
llm_translation: What is the case of the equal side in them, that they disqualify upon their entry. And Rabbi Yehuda: A convert also disqualifies upon his entry, and he brings proof from where is this law.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר גֵּר. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: גִּיּוֹרֶת פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד – כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹל הַטַּף בַּנָּשִׁים... הַחֲיוּ לָכֶם״, וַהֲלֹא פִּינְחָס הָיָה עִמָּהֶם! וְרַבָּנַן? ״הַחֲיוּ לָכֶם״ – לַעֲבָדִים וְלִשְׁפָחוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says a convert It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: A female converts less than three years and one day is fit to the priesthood, as it is stated “But all the female children keep alive for yourselves” But wasn’t Pinehas with them, And the Rabbis, “keep alive for yourselves” as slaves and as maidservants,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Convert. It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: A female convert who is less than three years old and one day - she is fit for priesthood, as it is stated: "But all the young girls who have not known a man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves." But wasn't Pinchas among them! And the Rabbis? "Keep alive for yourselves" - for slaves and maidservants.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה לֹא יִקְחוּ לָהֶם לְנָשִׁים כִּי אִם בְּתוּלֹת מִזֶּרַע בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: עַד דְּאִית כׇּל זֶרַע מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: ״מִזֶּרַע״, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת זֶרַע.
human_translation: And all of expounded a single verse. “Neither shall they take as their wives a widow, nor her that divorced; but they shall take virgins of the seed of the house of Israel” Rabbi Yehuda holds: only if the entire seed is from the Jewish people, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov holds: “Of the seed and even part of the seed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all of them interpreted one verse: "A widow and a divorced woman shall not take for themselves as wives, only virgins from the offspring of the house of Israel." Rabbi Yehuda holds: Until there is no seed from Israel. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: "From the offspring," even from some of the seed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: מִי שֶׁנִּזְרְעוּ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי סָבַר: מִי שֶׁנִּזְרְעוּ בְּתוּלֶיהָ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, holds one who was seeded, in Israel, Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, holds one whose hymen was formed as a Jew,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: One who sows among Israel. Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai holds: One who sows among her virgins in Israel.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרָבָא:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rava:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to Rava:

hebrew_text: הַאי קְרָא, רֵישָׁא בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְסֵיפָא בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: this verse the first clause with a High Priest, and the latter clause with a common priest, said to him: Yes,
llm_translation: This verse, the beginning refers to the High Priest, and the end refers to a regular priest?! He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: וּכְתַב קְרָא הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנֵר אֱלֹהִים טֶרֶם יִכְבֶּה וּשְׁמוּאֵל שֹׁכֵב בְּהֵיכַל ה׳״ – וַהֲלֹא אֵין יְשִׁיבָה בַּעֲזָרָה אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי בֵית דָּוִד בִּלְבַד! אֶלָּא: ״נֵר אֱלֹהִים טֶרֶם יִכְבֶּה״ – בְּהֵיכַל ה׳, ״וּשְׁמוּאֵל שֹׁכֵב״ – בִּמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: But a verse be written this way, said to him: Yes, as it is written: “And the lamp of God was not yet gone out, and Samuel was laid down to sleep in the Temple of the Lord” but there is sit in the courtyard only for the kings of the house of David alone. Rather, “And the lamp of God was not yet gone out” in the Temple of the Lord, “and Samuel was laid down” in his place
llm_translation: And did the verse write so? He said to him: No, as it is written: "And the lamp of God had not yet gone out, and Samuel was lying down in the temple of the Lord" - but is there not seating in the Azarah except for the kings of the house of David alone! Rather: "The lamp of God had not yet gone out" - in the temple of the Lord, "and Samuel was lying down" - in his place.

hebrew_text: ״וְהָאַלְמָנָה אֲשֶׁר תִּהְיֶה אַלְמָנָה מִכֹּהֵן יִקָּחוּ״ – ״מִכֹּהֵן״ – אִין, מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל לָא?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״מִכֹּהֵן יִקָּחוּ״ – מִשְּׁאָר כֹּהֲנִים יִקָּחוּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״מִכֹּהֵן יִקָּחוּ״ – מִשְּׁאָר כֹּהֲנִים יִקָּחוּ.
human_translation: “And a widow who is the widow of a priest, they may take” of a priest, yes, of an Israelite may not this is is saying: of a priest they may take,” of the rest of the priests, they may take. That is also taught “Of a priest they may take” of the rest of the priests, they may take.
llm_translation: "And the widow who shall be a widow of a Kohen, they shall take" - "of a Kohen" - not of Yisrael?! This is what it means to say: "of a Kohen they shall take" - they shall take from the rest of the Kohanim. It was also taught similarly: "of a Kohen they shall take" - they shall take from the rest of the Kohanim.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִן הַמַּשִּׂיאִים לַכְּהוּנָּה יִקָּחוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: בַּת גֵּר זָכָר כְּבַת חָלָל זָכָר, כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ – אִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda states of one fit to marry into the priesthood, they may take. Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning as he says: The daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of a male ḥalal , anyone whose daughter you may marry, you may marry his widow; anyone whose daughter you may not marry, you may not marry his widow
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: From the princes to the priesthood they shall take. Rabbi Yehuda for his reasoning, as he said: The daughter of a convert, male, is like the daughter of a profaned one, male. Whoever you marry off your daughter to - you marry off his widow, and whoever you do not marry off your daughter to - you do not marry off his widow.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת. אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וּמִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ נָהֲגוּ כֹּהֲנִים סִילְסוּל בְּעַצְמָן כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even convert who married convert, Rav Hamnuna says in the name of Ulla: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, and similarly, Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. And from the day the Temple was destroyed, the priests were accustomed a higher standard for themselves, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even a convert who married a convert. Rav Hamnuna said in the name of Ulah: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei. And so said Rabbah bar bar Ḥana: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei. And from the day the Temple was destroyed, the priests conducted themselves with strictness like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר לִי הוּנָא: בָּא לִימָּלֵךְ – מוֹרִים לוֹ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, נָשָׂא – אֵין מוֹצִיאִים אוֹתָהּ מִמֶּנּוּ, כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Huna said to me: comes to consult we instruct him in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. he married we do not remove her from him, in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Hunah told me: If he comes to circumcise - they instruct him like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, if he lifts - they do not remove it from him, like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר ״בְּנִי זֶה מַמְזֵר״ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים עַל הָעוּבָּר שֶׁבְּמֵעֶיהָ מַמְזֵר הוּא – אֵינָם נֶאֱמָנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָנִים.
human_translation: One who says: This son of mine a mamzer , he is not deemed credible And even both of them, admit that a fetus in her womb is a mamzer , they are not deemed credible. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are deemed credible.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "My son is a mamzer" – he is not believed. And even if both of them admit regarding the fetus in her womb that it is a mamzer – they are not believed. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are believed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם״? לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא אִיהוּ, דְּלָא קִים לֵיהּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אִיהִי דְּקִים לַהּ – לָא מְהֵימְנָא. וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא הֵיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ חֲזָקָה דְכַשְׁרוּת, דְּלָא מְהֵימְנִי, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּר נָמֵי, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ חֲזָקָה דְכַשְׁרוּת לָא מְהֵימְנִי.
human_translation: What is And even both of them? is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary his when it is not clear to him, Rather, even her, when it is clear she is not deemed credible. And it is not necessary when has a presumption of unflawed that they are not deemed credible. Rather, even a fetus, who does not have a presumption of unflawed are not deemed credible.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "and even both of them"? It is not necessary that he is saying: It is not necessary for him, for it is not established for him, but even if it is established for her - we do not trust. And it is not necessary where there is a presumption of validity, for we do not trust, but even if there is a transgression, where there is no presumption of validity, we do not trust.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר נֶאֱמָנִים. כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״יַכִּיר״ – יַכִּירֶנּוּ לַאֲחֵרִים. מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר: ״זֶה בְּנִי בְּכוֹר״. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁנֶּאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר: ״זֶה בְּנִי בְּכוֹר״, כָּךְ נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר ״זֶה בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה״ וְ״זֶה בֶּן חֲלוּצָה״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: They are deemed credible. as it is taught “He shall acknowledge He, shall acknowledge him to others. From here, Rabbi Yehuda said a person is deemed credible to say: This is my firstborn son. And just as a person is deemed credible to say: This is my firstborn son, so too, a person is deemed credible to say This is a son of a divorced woman, or: This is a son of a ḥalutza . And the Rabbis say: he is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says trustworthy. As it was taught: "He shall acknowledge" - he shall acknowledge him to others. From here Rabbi Yehuda said: A person is trustworthy to say, "This is my firstborn son." And just as a person is trustworthy to say, "This is my firstborn son," so too a person is trustworthy to say, "This is a son of divorcee" and "This is a son of a halutzah." And the sages say: He is not trustworthy.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה – הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יַכִּיר״, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, ״יַכִּיר״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: Granted, to Rabbi Yehuda, this is that which is written: “He shall acknowledge,” But to the Rabbis why do I “he shall acknowledge”?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rava: Granted for Rabbi Yehuda - that is what is written "he shall recognize," but for the Rabbis, "he shall recognize," what do I need it for?

hebrew_text: בִּצְרִיךְ הֶכֵּירָא. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לָתֶת לוֹ פִּי שְׁנַיִם? פְּשִׁיטָא, לְמָה לִי קְרָא? מִיגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֵי מִיתְּבַהּ לֵיהּ מַתָּנָה, מִי לָא יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: when he requires identification, With regard to what halakha “By giving him a double portion” Isn’t obvious Why do I a verse he could have made a more advantageous claim [ miggo ]: If he desired to give him a gift would not give it to him?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Bitzrich hekira. Lemai hilcheta? Latet lo pi shnayim? Peshita, lama li kra? Migo de'i ba'ei mitbaha leih matanah, mi lo yahavi leih?" English translation: "Is recognition necessary? For what halacha? To give him two mouths? It is obvious, why do I need a verse? Since if he wants to give him a gift, wouldn't he give it to him?"

hebrew_text: בִּנְכָסִים שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לְאַחַר מִיכֵּן.
human_translation: to property that came at a later point,
llm_translation: In property that fell to another thereafter.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר אָדָם מַקְנֶה דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם, ״יַכִּיר״ לְמָה לִי? שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לוֹ כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹסֵס.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Meir, who says a person can transfer an entity that has not come into the world, why do I “He shall acknowledge”? where property came into when he was moribund,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Meir, for he said: a person acquires a thing that has not come into the world, "Yakir" - what do I need it for? Because they fell to him while he is still a fetus.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁנָּתַן רְשׁוּת לִשְׁלוּחוֹ לְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ, וְהָלַךְ הוּא וְקִדְּשָׁהּ, אִם שֶׁלּוֹ קָדְמוּ – קִידּוּשָׁיו קִידּוּשִׁין, וְאִם שֶׁל שְׁלוּחוֹ קָדְמוּ – קִידּוּשָׁיו קִידּוּשִׁין, וְאִם אֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ
human_translation: one who authorized his agent to betroth his daughter and went and betrothed her if his preceded his betrothal is betrothal; and if of his agent preceded betrothal is betrothal. And if it is not known
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who gives permission to his messenger to betroth his daughter, and he goes and betroths her, if his own betrothals preceded - his betrothals are valid, and if the betrothals of his messenger preceded - his betrothals are valid. But if it is not known.

hebrew_text: – שְׁנֵיהֶם נוֹתְנִים גֵּט. וְאִם רָצוּ – אֶחָד נוֹתֵן גֵּט, וְאֶחָד כּוֹנֵס.
human_translation: both give a bill of divorce And if they wish one gives a bill of divorce and the other
llm_translation: Both of them give a get. And if they wish, one gives the get, and one collects.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּתְנָה רְשׁוּת לִשְׁלוּחָהּ לְקַדְּשָׁהּ, וְהָלְכָה וְקִדְּשָׁהּ אֶת עַצְמָהּ, אִם שֶׁלָּהּ קָדְמוּ – קִדּוּשֶׁיהָ קִידּוּשִׁין, וְאִם שֶׁל שְׁלוּחָהּ קָדְמוּ – קִידּוּשָׁיו קִידּוּשִׁין. וְאִם אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין – שְׁנֵיהֶם נוֹתְנִים לָהּ גֵּט, וְאִם רָצוּ – אֶחָד נוֹתֵן לָהּ גֵּט וְאֶחָד כּוֹנֵס.
human_translation: And similarly, a woman who authorized her agent to betroth her and went and betrothed herself if her preceded her betrothal is betrothal, and if of her agent preceded betrothal is betrothal. And if they do not know both give her a bill of divorce. And if they wish, one may give a bill of divorce and the other marries
llm_translation: And so too, the woman who gave permission to her emissary to betroth her, and he went and betrothed her on her behalf, if her betrothal preceded his – her betrothal is valid, and if his preceded hers – his betrothal is valid. And if they do not know – both of them give her a bill of divorce, and if they wish – one gives her a bill of divorce and the other collects.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי דִידֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּגַבְרָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּיוּחֲסִין, אֲבָל אִיתְּתָא דְּלָא קִים לַהּ בְּיוּחֲסִין, אֵימָא לָא נִיהְווֹ קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: And necessary As had taught us with regard to himself, that because a man is expert with regard to lineage, But a woman, who is not expert with regard to lineage, say her betrothal should not be betrothal,
llm_translation: Gemara: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear regarding himself, because a man is established with him in lineage, but a woman who is not established with him in lineage, we might say that her betrothals are not betrothals.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גַּבֵּי דִידַהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתְּתָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, אֲבָל אִיהוּ אֵימָא לָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us with regard to herself, that because a woman is particular she marries, But say he does not care necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear regarding her, because there is a close relative and a potential rival, but he himself may say that it does not matter to him, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: קִידְּשָׁהּ אָבִיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְקִידְּשָׁה עַצְמָהּ בָּעִיר, וַהֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת. רַב אָמַר: הֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת לְפָנֵינוּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן לְקִידּוּשֵׁי שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: It was stated her father betrothed her on the way, and betrothed herself in the city, and she is a grown woman, Rav said: She is a grown woman at present, And Shmuel said: We are concerned with regard to the betrothal of both of them.
llm_translation: It was stated: Her father betrothed her on the road, and she betrothed herself in the city, and yet she is a bogeret. Rav said: She is a bogeret before us. And Shmuel said: We are concerned about the betrothals of both of them.

hebrew_text: אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא בְּתוֹךְ שִׁשָּׁה, בְּהָא נֵימָא רַב הֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת לְפָנֵינוּ? הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּבָגְרָה. אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שִׁשָּׁה, בְּהָא נֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל: חָיְישִׁינַן לְקִידּוּשֵׁי שְׁנֵיהֶם? וְהָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בֵּין נְעָרוֹת לְבַגְרוּת אֶלָּא שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בִּלְבַד!
human_translation: When If we say during the six in that Rav say: She is a grown woman at present? it is now she has reached her majority, Rather, after six In that Shmuel say: We are concerned with regard to the betrothal of both of them? But doesn’t Shmuel say: The difference between a young woman and a grown woman is six months alone,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When? If you wish, say within six months, in this case, Rav says, "Is she a bogeret before us?" Now, this is where she becomes a bogeret. Rather, after six months, in this case, Shmuel says, "Should we be concerned about the sanctity of both of them?" But Shmuel said, "The only difference between a na'arah and a bogeret is only six months!"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּהָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּמַשְׁלֵים שִׁשָּׁה. רַב אָמַר: הֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת לְפָנֵינוּ, מִדְּהַשְׁתָּא בּוֹגֶרֶת, בְּצַפְרָא נָמֵי בּוֹגֶרֶת. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אֲמַר: הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּאַיְיתַי סִימָנִים.
human_translation: No, necessary where he betrothed on the day that six were completed. Rav said: She is a grown woman at present. that since now a grown woman, she also a grown woman in the morning. And Shmuel said: it is now that her signs came,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he sanctified on that day of completing six. Rav said: Here is a cow in front of us, from now on it is a cow, in the end it will also be a cow. And Shmuel said: Now is the time for bringing signs.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל, מַאי שְׁנָא מִמִּקְוֶה? דִּתְנַן: מִקְוֶה שֶׁנִּמְדַּד וְנִמְצָא חָסֵר – כׇּל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל גַּבָּיו לְמַפְרֵעַ, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – טְמֵאוֹת.
human_translation: And Shmuel, what is different from ritual bath? As we learned a ritual bath which was measured and found deficient All pure items whose had been performed in it, retroactive whether in the private domain or in the public domain, are impure.
llm_translation: Samuel, what is different about a mikveh? For we learned: A mikveh that was measured and found lacking - all purifications that were performed upon it are invalid, whether done with the consent of the individual or with the consent of the public - they are impure.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: הַעֲמֵד טָמֵא עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ וְאֵימַר לֹא טָבַל.
human_translation: There, is different, since it can be said: Maintain an impure in its presumptive status and say it was not immersed.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for there is room to say: "Let the impure one stand on his presumption and say, 'I did not immerse.'"

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, הַעֲמֵד מִקְוֶה עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ וְאֵימַר לֹא חָסַר! הֲרֵי חָסֵר לְפָנֶיךָ. הָכָא נָמֵי: הֲרֵי בּוֹגֶרֶת לְפָנֶיךָ! הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דִּבְגַרָה. הָתָם נָמֵי: הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דַּחֲסַר!
human_translation: On the contrary, Maintain the ritual bath in its presumptive status, and say it was not deficient There is a deficient at present, Here too, there is a grown woman before you, it is now she has reached her majority. There too, it is now it has become deficient.
llm_translation: Great Rabbi, establish a mikveh based on his presumption and say, "It is not lacking!" Behold, it is lacking before you. Here too: Behold, it is a bogeret before you! Now it is a case of dibgara. There, it is said: Now it is lacking!

hebrew_text: הָתָם תַּרְתֵּי לְרֵיעוּתָא, הָכָא חֲדָא לְרֵיעוּתָא.
human_translation: There, two to weaken Here, one to weaken
llm_translation: There (are) two for partnership, here (is) one for partnership.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל, מַאי שְׁנָא מֵחָבִית? דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה בּוֹדֵק אֶת הֶחָבִית לְהַפְרִישׁ עָלֶיהָ תְּרוּמָה וְהוֹלֵךְ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִמְצֵאת חוֹמֶץ – כׇּל שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים וַדַּאי, מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ – סָפֵק.
human_translation: And Shmuel, what is different from a barrel? As it is taught one would inspect a barrel to continually separate teruma from it and afterward were found vinegar, all three days definitely From then onward, uncertain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel, what is different about a barrel? For it was taught: If one inspects a barrel to separate terumah upon it and then goes away, and afterwards vinegar is found in it - for three days for sure, from then on - it is uncertain. English translation: And Samuel, what is different about a barrel? For it was taught: If one inspects a barrel to separate terumah upon it and then goes away, and afterwards vinegar is found in it - for three days for sure, from then on - it is uncertain.

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵינַן חָבִית אַמִּקְוֶה: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּהָכָא וַדַּאי וּמַאי שְׁנָא דְּהָכָא סָפֵק?
human_translation: And we raised a contradiction between barrel of ritual bath: What is different that here, definitely and what is different that there, uncertain
llm_translation: We raise a contradiction: What is the difference between here, where it is certain, and what is the difference between here, where it is doubtful?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרְיָא: מַאן תְּנָא חָבִית – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּגַבֵּי מִקְוֶה נָמֵי סְפֵיקָא מְשַׁוֵּי.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥanina from Syria says: Who taught barrel? It is Rabbi Shimon, who with regard to a ritual bath also considers as uncertainty
llm_translation: And Rav Hanina from Sura said: Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah regarding a barrel? It is Rabbi Shimon, for he holds that in the case of a mikveh, doubt renders it invalid.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ עַל גַּבָּיו לְמַפְרֵעַ, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – טְמֵאוֹת. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים טְהוֹרוֹת, בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – תּוֹלִין.
human_translation: As it is taught All pure items whose had been performed in it, retroactive whether in the private domain or in the public domain, are impure. And Rabbi Shimon says in the public domain, they are pure, in the private domain, is suspended,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All purifications that were done on his back for rebellion, whether in private domain or in public domain - are impure. And Rabbi Shimon says: In a public domain they are pure, in a private domain - they are suspended.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לְרַבָּנַן, טֶבֶל לְמַפְרֵעַ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: הַעֲמֵד טֶבֶל עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ – וְאֵימַר לֹא נִיתְקַן.
human_translation: But to the Rabbis, untithed produce retroactively, There, it is different, as it can be said: Maintain the untithed produce in its presumptive status, and say not fixed,
llm_translation: But for the Rabbis, immerse for rebellion! The difference there is that one can say: "Place the immersion on his presumption - and say it was not fixed."

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, הַעֲמֵד יַיִן עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ, וְאֵימַר לֹא הֶחְמִיץ! הֲרֵי הֶחְמִיץ לְפָנֶיךָ. הָכָא נָמֵי, הֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת לְפָנֵינוּ! הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דִּבְגַרָה. הָכָא נָמֵי: הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּאַחְמֵיץ!
human_translation: On the contrary, maintain the wine in its presumptive status, and say it had not turned to vinegar? it is turned to vinegar at present. here too, she is a grown woman at present; it is now has she reached her majority. Here too, it is now it has turned to vinegar,
llm_translation: The Great One said: "Place wine on its strength, and say it did not ferment!" Behold, it has fermented before you. Here too, it is bubbling before us! This is the time of fermentation. Here too: This is the time of leavening!

hebrew_text: הָתָם תַּרְתֵּי לְרֵיעוּתָא, הָכָא חֲדָא לְרֵיעוּתָא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא.
human_translation: There, two to weaken Here, there is one to weaken
llm_translation: There, two for partnership, here, one for partnership is present.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי:
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im :
llm_translation: "Say: as the Tannaim said:"

hebrew_text: מִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מִי?
human_translation: Who remove from the possession of whom?
llm_translation: Who extracts from whose hand whom?

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹצִיא מִיָּדָם בְּלֹא רְאָיָה, וְהֵן אֵין מוֹצִיאִים מִיָּדוֹ בְּלֹא רְאָיָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אִם בָּרִיא הוּא – עָלָיו לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁהָיָה שְׁכִיב מְרַע, וְאִם שְׁכִיב מְרַע הוּא – עֲלֵיהֶם לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁבָּרִיא הָיָה.
human_translation: He remove from their possession without proof and they may not remove from his possession, without proof the statement of Rabbi Ya’akov. Rabbi Natan says: If he is healthy, is upon him to bring proof that he was on his deathbed and if he is on his deathbed, is upon them to bring proof that he was healthy
llm_translation: He removes from their hand without seeing, but they do not remove from his hand without seeing, the words of Rabbi Yaakov. Rabbi Natan says: If he is healthy, he must bring proof that he was lying sick, and if he was lying sick, they must bring proof that he was healthy.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי נָתָן וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב? אָמַר לָךְ רַב: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ כְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר הַעֲמֵד מָמוֹן עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ, אֲבָל הָכָא מִי נֵימָא הַעֲמֵד גּוּף עַל חֶזְקָתוֹ?!
human_translation: Let us say Rav spoke in accordance with Rabbi Natan and Shmuel spoke in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov, Rav said to you: I spoke even in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov, Rabbi Ya’akov states only there, it can be said Leave property in its status, But here, shall we say: Establish the body to its previous status?
llm_translation: Nay, Rav said like Rabbi Natan, and Shmuel said like Rabbi Yaakov? Rav said to you: I who say even like Rabbi Yaakov. Until here, Rav Yaakov did not say there where there is to say, "Establish money on his possession," but here, Nay, establish the body on his possession?!

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי נָתָן. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן הָתָם דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בְּחֶזְקַת בְּרִיאִים קָיְימִי, מַאן דְּקָא מַפֵּיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ מֵחֲזָקָה – (הָוֵי) עֲלֵיהּ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי רְאָיָה, אֲבָל הָכָא מִי קָא מַפְּקָא נַפְשַׁהּ מֵחֲזָקָה דְּקַמֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And Shmuel said: I spoke even in accordance with Rabbi Natan, Rabbi Natan states only there, as everyone has a presumptive status of being healthy. a person removes himself from presumption upon him to bring proof. But here, does remove herself from a presumption that was present?
llm_translation: Samuel said: I say even to Rabbi Nathan. Until here, Rabbi Nathan did not say. There, where everyone is established in the presumption of health, one who removes himself from the presumption - should bring proof. But here, who removes herself from the presumption that stands before her?

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי: קִידְּשָׁהּ אָבִיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְקִידְּשָׁה עַצְמָהּ בָּעִיר וַהֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת, תָּנָא חֲדָא: הֲרֵי הִיא בּוֹגֶרֶת לְפָנֵינוּ, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: חָיְישִׁינַן לְקִידּוּשֵׁי שְׁנֵיהֶם. מַאי לָאו: חַד כְּרַב וְחַד כִּשְׁמוּאֵל?
human_translation: Let us say is parallel to these tanna’im : her father betrothed her on the way, and betrothed herself in the city, and she is a grown woman, one taught: She is a grown woman at present, And is taught another We are concerned with regard to the betrothal of both of them. What, is it not that one is in accordance with Rav, and one is in accordance with Shmuel?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima kehanei tannaei: kidshah avihah baderech ve'kidshah atzmah ba'ir veharei hi bogeret, tana chada: harei hi bogeret lefanenu, vetanya idach: chayeshinan lekidushei shneihem. Mai lavo: chad kerav ve'chad kishmuel?" English translation: "It was said by the sages of the Mishnah: if her father betrothed her on the road and she betrothed herself in the city, she is considered a bogeret. One sage taught: she is considered a bogeret before us, and another teaching: we are concerned for the sanctity of both. What is the reason? One is like Rav and one is like Shmuel?"

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי כִּשְׁמוּאֵל – כָּאן בְּמַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵין מַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: No; this and that are in accordance with Shmuel. Here, where she denies his There, where she does not deny his
llm_translation: Not so, both this and that like Shmuel - here in his deception, here in his lack of deception.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא מִדְּמַתְנִיתָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, אָמוֹרָאֵי נָמֵי לָא פְּלִיגִי! וְתִסְבְּרָא? הָא רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מְנַשְּׁיָא מִדְּוִויל עֲבַד עוֹבָדָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וְאִיקְּפִיד שְׁמוּאֵל וְאָמַר: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כָּיְילִי לֵיהּ בְּקַבָּא זוּטָא וְהַאי מִדְּרַבָּנַן כָּיְילִי לֵיהּ בְּקַבָּא רַבָּה? וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לָא פְּלִיגִי, אַמַּאי קָא מִקְּפֵיד?
human_translation: let us say since the baraitot do not disagree, the amora’im , do not disagree And you understand it that way? But Rav Yosef, son of Rav Menashya of Dabil, performed an action in accordance with Rav and Shmuel took offense and said measured out to everyone in a small measure, and measured out to this of the Sages in a large measure? Now, if it enters your mind they did not disagree why did take offense?
llm_translation: And there is a saying from the Mishnah that they do not argue, the Amoraim also do not argue! And is it reasonable? This is because Rav Yosef, the son of Rav Menashya, from the town of Divil, did a deed like the deed of Rav, and Samuel was particular and said: All the people of the world are like a small basket to him, and this one from the Rabbanan is like a large basket to him? And if it enters your mind that they do not argue, why is he particular?

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא כִּי עֲבַד עוֹבָדָא, בְּמַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Perhaps when performed an action, where she denied
llm_translation: Perhaps when he did the work, with his staff.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב. וְהִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said to Rav Ashi: This is what Ameimar said: The halakha in accordance with of Shmuel. And Rav Ashi said: The halakha in accordance with of Rav. And the halakha in accordance with of Rav.
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Zutra to Rav Ashi, thus said Amemar: The custom is like the ways of Shmuel. And Rav Ashi said: The custom is like the ways of Rav. And the custom is like the ways of Rav.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיָּצָא הוּא וְאִשְׁתּוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָא הוּא וְאִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו וְאָמַר: ״אִשָּׁה שֶׁיָּצָאת עִמִּי לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם – הֲרֵי הִיא זוֹ, וְאֵלּוּ בָּנֶיהָ״ – אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה לֹא עַל הָאִשָּׁה, וְלֹא עַל הַבָּנִים. ״מֵתָה וְאֵלּוּ בָּנֶיהָ״ – מֵבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הַבָּנִים, וְאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: one who went overseas with his wife, and returned with his wife and children, and said: This is the woman who went overseas with me and these are her children, is not required to bring proof with regard to the woman, nor with regard to the children. died and these are her children, bring proof that the children but he does not bring proof with regard to the woman.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he and his wife went out to the sea, and he and his wife and his sons came back, and he said, "A woman who went out with me to the sea - this is she, and these are her sons," he does not need to bring proof regarding the woman or the sons. If she died and these are her sons, he brings proof regarding the sons, but he does not bring proof regarding the woman.

hebrew_text: ״אִשָּׁה נָשָׂאתִי בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם – הֲרֵי הִיא זוֹ, וְאֵלּוּ בָּנֶיהָ״ – מֵבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הָאִשָּׁה וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הַבָּנִים. ״מֵתָה וְאֵלּוּ בָּנֶיהָ״ – צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הָאִשָּׁה וְעַל הַבָּנִים.
human_translation: I married a woman overseas, and this is she, and these are her children, bring proof with regard to the woman, but is not required to bring proof with regard to the children. she died, and these are her children, required to bring proof with regard to the woman and the children.
llm_translation: "I have married a woman in the province of the sea - this is she, and these are her children" - he brings proof regarding the woman and there is no need to bring proof regarding the children. "She died and these are her children" - one must bring proof regarding the woman and regarding the children.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: וְכוּלָּן בִּכְרוּכִים אַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says: And all of in they cling to her
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: And all of them are tied behind it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִשָּׁה נָשָׂאתִי בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם״ – מֵבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הָאִשָּׁה, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הַבָּנִים. וּמֵבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הַגְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הַקְּטַנִּים. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת, אֲבָל בִּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים – מֵבִיא רְאָיָה עַל הָאִשָּׁה וְעַל הַבָּנִים, עַל הַגְּדוֹלִים וְעַל הַקְּטַנִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught I married a woman overseas, bring proof with regard to the woman, but is not required to bring proof with regard to the children. And he bring proof with regard to the adult but is not required to bring proof with regard to the minor In what is this statement said? in one woman, but when two women bring proof with regard to the woman and the children, with regard to the adult and with regard to the minor
llm_translation: The sages taught: "I have married a woman in the land of the sea" - one brings proof regarding the woman, and there is no need to bring proof regarding the children. And one brings proof regarding the adults, and there is no need to bring proof regarding the minors. In what case are these matters said? In the case of one woman, but with two women - one brings proof regarding the woman and the children, regarding the adults and the minors.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ:
human_translation: Reish Lakish said:
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish:

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַגְּבוּל, אֲבָל בְּיוּחֲסִין – לֹא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: taught only with regard to the consecrated the border, But with regard to lineage, not And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even with regard to lineage.
llm_translation: They did not differ except regarding the sanctity of the border, but regarding genealogical relationships - no. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even regarding genealogical relationships.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַלְקִין עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת, סוֹקְלִין וְשׂוֹרְפִין עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת, וְאֵין שׂוֹרְפִין תְּרוּמָה עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: flogs on the presumptive status, stones or burns on the presumptive status. But one does not burn teruma on the presumptive status
llm_translation: And it was established according to the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They administer lashes for established transgressions, they stone and burn for established transgressions, but they do not burn terumah for established transgressions.

hebrew_text: מַלְקִין עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת – כְּרַב יְהוּדָה. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הוּחְזְקָה נִדָּה בִּשְׁכֵינוֹתֶיהָ, בַּעְלָהּ – לוֹקֶה עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם נִדָּה.
human_translation: flogs on the presumptive status, in accordance with Rav Yehuda. As Rav Yehuda says: had her neighbors the presumptive status of a menstruating woman, her husband is flogged due to a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: Striking for the presumptions - like Rav Yehudah. For Rav Yehudah said: If a presumption of impurity is established in her neighbors, her husband receives lashes on her account due to impurity.

hebrew_text: סוֹקְלִין וְשׂוֹרְפִין עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת – כִּדְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה תִּינוֹק וְתִינוֹקֶת שֶׁהִגְדִּילוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת – נִסְקָלִין זֶה עַל זֶה, וְנִשְׂרָפִין זֶה עַל זֶה.
human_translation: stones or burns on the presumptive status, in accordance with of Rabba bar Rav Huna. As Rabba bar Rav Huna says: a man and a woman a boy and a girl who grew up in home they are stoned due to each other And they are burned due to each other
llm_translation: Stoning and burning on the presumption of adultery - as Rabba bar Rav Huna said: For Rabba bar Rav Huna said: A man and a woman, a minor boy and a minor girl who grew up together in the same house - they are stoned one on the other, and they are burned one on the other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁבָּאת לִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְתִינוֹק מוּרְכָּב לָהּ עַל כְּתֵיפָהּ, וְהִגְדִּילַתּוּ, וּבָא עָלֶיהָ, וֶהֱבִיאוּם לְבֵית דִּין וּסְקָלוּם. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבְּנָהּ וַדַּאי, אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכָּרוּךְ אַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says in the name of bar Kappara: An incident involving a woman who came to Jerusalem with a child riding on her shoulders, and she raised him, and he engaged in intercourse with her. And they brought them to court and stoned them not because he definitely her son, but because he clung to her,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi, said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of Bar Kappara: There was an incident with a woman who came to Jerusalem and a child was riding on her shoulder, and he grew up, and he had relations with her, and they brought them to the court and stoned them. Not because her son was certainly involved, but because he was enticed after her.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין שׂוֹרְפִין תְּרוּמָה עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: שׂוֹרְפִין עַל הַחֲזָקוֹת, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אֵין שׂוֹרְפִין. וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דִּתְנַן: תִּינוֹק שֶׁנִּמְצָא בְּצַד הָעִיסָּה וּבָצֵק בְּיָדוֹ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְטַהֵר, וַחֲכָמִים מְטַמְּאִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל תִּינוֹק לְטַפֵּחַ.
human_translation: But one does not burn teruma on the presumptive status. As Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: One burns on the presumptive status, and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One does not burn And they follow their reasoning as we learned child is found alongside started dough, and risen dough in his hand Rabbi Meir deems pure, And the Rabbis deem it impure, because it is the manner of a child to handle [ letappe’aḥ ]
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And we do not burn terumah on the coals - for Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: We burn on the coals, and Rabbi Yochanan says: We do not burn. And they went according to their reasoning, as we learned: If a child is found with dough on the side and dough in his hand - Rabbi Meir declares it pure, and the Sages declare it impure, because it is the way of a child to touch.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? קָסָבַר: רוֹב תִּינוֹקוֹת מְטַפְּחִין, וּמִיעוּט אֵין מְטַפְּחִין, וְעִיסָּה בְּחֶזְקַת טׇהֳרָה עוֹמֶדֶת, וּסְמוֹךְ מִיעוּטָא לַחֲזָקָה אִיתְּרַע לֵיהּ רוּבָּא. וְרַבָּנַן: מִיעוּטָא כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, רוּבָּא וַחֲזָקָה – רוּבָּא עֲדִיף.
human_translation: And we discussed What is the reasoning of Rabbi Meir? He holds a majority of children handle and a minority do not handle and dough retains a presumptive status of purity, And appends minority to the presumptive status majority is weakened. And the Rabbis the minority is considered like it does not exist. the majority and the presumptive status of purity the majority takes precedence.
llm_translation: We were learning in it: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? He holds: Most infants clap, and a minority do not clap, and dough in a state of purity stands, and leaning towards the minority to strengthen it, the majority is harmed. And the Rabbis say: The minority is like one who does not exist, the majority and the strength - the majority is superior.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: זוֹ הִיא שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין עָלֶיהָ אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין זוֹ חֲזָקָה שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין עָלֶיהָ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: This is that one burns teruma based on it, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is not the presumption that one burns teruma based on it.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: This is when they burn the terumah upon it. Rabbi Yochanan said: This is not a presumption that they burn the terumah upon it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵיזוֹ חֲזָקָה לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפִין עָלֶיהָ אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה? כְּדִתְנַן: עִיסָּה בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וּשְׁרָצִים וּצְפַרְדְּעִים מִטַּפְּלִין שָׁם, וְנִמְצְאוּ חֲתִיכוֹת בָּעִיסָּה. אִם רוֹב שְׁרָצִים – טְמֵאָה. אִם רוֹב צְפַרְדְּעִים – טְהוֹרָה.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the presumption that one burns teruma based on it? As we learned started dough is in the house, and creeping animals, and frogs, are present there, and pieces were found in the started dough, if the majority are creeping animals, is impure, If the majority are frogs, it is pure.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the strong presumption for Rabbi Yochanan that they burn the terumah on it? As we learned: Dough in the house, and vermin and frogs are found there, and pieces are found in the dough. If most are vermin - it is impure. If most are frogs - it is pure.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים אֵין בָּהֶם דַּעַת לִישָּׁאֵל, וַעֲשָׂאוּם חֲכָמִים כְּמָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶם דַּעַת לִישָּׁאֵל: תִּינוֹק, וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: Two things do not have the capacity to be questioned, the Sages deemed them as things that have the capacity to be questioned a child and an additional
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: Two things that do not have understanding for the people of Israel, yet the sages made them as if they have understanding for the people of Israel: a child, and another.

hebrew_text: תִּינוֹק – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת מַאי הִיא? עִיסָּה בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וְתַרְנְגוֹלִים וּמַשְׁקִים טְמֵאִים שָׁם, וְנִמְצְאוּ
human_translation: a child that which we said And what is the additional started dough inside the house, and chickens and impure liquids there, and there were found
llm_translation: Child - this that we said. And another what is it? Dough in the house, and roosters and liquids impure there, and they were found

hebrew_text: נִקּוּרִים נִקּוּרִים בָּעִיסָּה – תּוֹלִין, לֹא אוֹכְלִין וְלֹא שׂוֹרְפִין.
human_translation: small holes in the dough held in suspension; it is neither eaten nor burned,
llm_translation: Punctures, punctures in dough - hanging, not eaten and not burned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּמַשְׁקִים לְבָנִים, אֲבָל בְּמַשְׁקִים אֲדוּמִּים – אִם אִיתָא דִּנְקִיר מִידָּע יְדִיעַ. וְדִילְמָא בְּלַעְתִּינְהוּ עִיסָּה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: They taught only in white liquid, but in red, liquid, if it is so that they had pecked, it would be known Perhaps dough absorbed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: They only taught this regarding white drinks, but regarding red drinks - if it is found that they are harmful, it is immediately known. And perhaps they are absorbed in the dough?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דָּבָר זֶה שָׁמַע בְּרִיבִּי, וּפֵירוּשׁוֹ לֹא שָׁמַע: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּמַשְׁקִים צְלוּלִים, שֶׁבָּבוּאָה שֶׁל תִּינוֹק נִיכָּר בָּהֶ[ן], אֲבָל מַשְׁקִים עֲכוּרִים – לֹא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The Distinguished, heard this matter, but he did not hear its interpretation, They taught only in of clear liquid, that in which the reflection [ bavua ] of a child is recognizable But murky liquid, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: This matter I heard in my dispute, but its explanation I did not hear: They only stated this regarding clear beverages, for the stomach of an infant is recognized in them, but cloudy beverages - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יִתְיַיחֵד אָדָם עִם שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, אֲבָל אִשָּׁה אַחַת מִתְיַיחֶדֶת עִם שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף אִישׁ אֶחָד מִתְיַיחֵד עִם שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בִּזְמַן שֶׁאִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ, וְיָשֵׁן עִמָּהֶם בְּפוּנְדְּקִי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאִשְׁתּוֹ מְשַׁמַּרְתּוֹ. מִתְיַיחֵד אָדָם עִם אִמּוֹ וְעִם בִּתּוֹ וְיָשֵׁן עִמָּהֶם בְּקֵירוּב בָּשָׂר. וְאִם הִגְדִּילוּ – זוֹ יְשֵׁנָה בִּכְסוּתָהּ וְזֶה יָשֵׁן בִּכְסוּתוֹ.
human_translation: A man may not be secluded with two women but one woman may be secluded with two men. Rabbi Shimon says: Even one man may be secluded with two women when his wife is with him, and sleep in inn because his wife guards him a man may be secluded with his mother, and with his daughter, and sleep alongside them with bodily contact And when they, have grown up, this one sleeps in her garment and that one sleeps in his garment,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man should not seclude himself with two women, but one woman may seclude herself with two men. Rabbi Shimon says: Even one man may seclude himself with two women when his wife is with him, and he sleeps with them in a pantry, because his wife watches over him. A man may seclude himself with his mother and his daughter, and sleep with them in physical closeness. And if they grew up – this one sleeps with her covering and that one sleeps with his covering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? תְּנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ: הוֹאִיל וְנָשִׁים דַּעְתָּן קַלּוֹת עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: What is the reason The school of Eliyahu taught: Since women are of light mind
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, what is the reason? It was taught in the school of Elijah: Since women, their minds are light upon them." English translation: "Gemara, what is the reason? It was taught in the school of Elijah: Since women, their minds are light upon them."

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: רֶמֶז לְיִחוּד מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יְסִיתְךָ אָחִיךָ בֶן אִמֶּךָ״.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: From where an allusion from the Torah to seclusion? As it is stated “If your brother, the son of your mother, entices you”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: "A hint for the uniqueness from the Torah - from where? - as it is said: 'If your brother, the son of your mother, entices you.'"

hebrew_text: וְכִי בֶּן אֵם מֵסִית, בֶּן אָב אֵינוֹ מֵסִית? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: בֵּן מִתְיַיחֵד עִם אִמּוֹ, וְאָסוּר לְהִתְיַיחֵד עִם כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: But is it the son of a mother entices? Doesn’t the son of a father entice? Rather, to say to you: A son may be secluded with his mother. And it is prohibited to be secluded with those with whom relations are forbidden by the Torah.
llm_translation: "And if a son of the mother seduces, a son of the father does not seduce? Rather to say to you: a son who is intimate with his mother, and it is forbidden to be intimate with all the forbidden relationships in the Torah."

hebrew_text: פְּשָׁטֵיהּ דִּקְרָא בְּמַאי כְּתִיב? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בֶּן אָב, דְּסָנֵי לֵיהּ וְעָיֵיץ לֵיהּ עֵצוֹת רָעוֹת, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בֶּן אֵם, דְּלָא סָנֵי לֵיהּ – אֵימָא צָיְיתִי לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
