human_translation: With regard to what is the plain of the verse written, Abaye said: is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary the son of a father, who hates him and gives him bad advice. Rather, even the son of a mother, does not hate him, say he should listen to him teaches us
llm_translation: The straightforward interpretation of the verse, with what is it written? Abaye said: He is not asking. He is not asking for a son of a father, who hates him and gives him bad advice, but even a son of a mother, who does not hate him - I will say I have found favor in his eyes, he listens to us.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – יוֹצֵא בְּחֵיק, וְנִקְבָּר בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת וּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים.
human_translation: we say the mishna is not in accordance with Abba Shaul, as it is taught any thirty days is carried out in bosom, and buried by one woman and two men. But may not by one man and two women, Abba Shaul says: even by one man and two women.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima matnitin d'lo ke'aba Sha'ul, d'tanya: Kol shloshim yom – yotzei becheik, v'nikbar be'isha achat ushnei anashim, aval lo be'ish echad ushtei nashim. Aba Sha'ul omer: Af be'ish echad ushtei nashim." English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita not like Aba Sha'ul, as it was taught: For thirty days – he goes out in a lap, and is buried with one woman and two men, but not with one man and two women. Aba Sha'ul says: Even with one man and two women."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל, בִּשְׁעַת אֲנִינוּת תְּבִיר יִצְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: You even say Abba Shaul, at the time of acute mourning, inclination is broken,
llm_translation: Even if you say it was Abba Saul, at the time of his mourning his yetzer was strong.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״מַה יִּתְאוֹנֵן אָדָם חָי גֶּבֶר עַל חֲטָאָיו״ – אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת אֲנִינוּתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם יִצְרוֹ מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו. וְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל? כִּי כְּתִיב הָהוּא – בְּמִתְרַעֵם עַל מִדּוֹתָיו כְּתִיב, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מָה יִתְרַעֵם עַל מִדּוֹתָיו, וְכִי גָּבַר עַל חֲטָאָיו? דַּיּוֹ חַיִּים שֶׁנָּתַתִּי לוֹ!
human_translation: And the Rabbis, hold in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says “Why does a living man complain, a powerful man due to his sins?” Even at the time of a person’s acute mourning, his inclination overpowers him. And Abba Shaul When that was written, it was written to one who complains about ways. And this is is saying: Why does complain about ways Has he overpowered his sins? The life I have given him is sufficient for him,
llm_translation: The sages hold like Rabbi Yitzchak. For Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Why does a person boast while alive about his sins? Even at the time of a person's distress, his inclination overpowers him. And Abba Shaul? For it is written about him - 'In his rebellion against his own nature it is written,' and this is what it means: Why does he rebel against his own nature, and has he overcome his sins? Enough with the life that I have given him!"

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? כִּי הָהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה דְּהַהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וְאַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis like that incident involving a certain woman, as there was an incident where she removed
llm_translation: The sages? For there was that incident of that woman who was a worker and her earnings.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִשָּׁה אַחַת. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּכְשֵׁרִים, אֲבָל בִּפְרוּצִים – אֲפִילּוּ בֵּי עַשְׂרָה נָמֵי לָא. הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְהוֹצִיאוּהָ עֲשָׂרָה בַּמִּטָּה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תִּדַּע, דְּמִיחַבְּרִי בֵּי עַשְׂרָה וְגָנְבִי כְּשׁוּרָא וְלָא מִיכַּסְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: But one woman Rav Yehuda says Rav says: They taught only to fit but with regard to steeped not even with ten There was an incident where ten carried out on a bier, Rav Yosef says: Know since ten will join together and steal a beam without being ashamed before one another.
llm_translation: One woman. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They only taught this regarding kosher animals, but regarding non-kosher animals - even if there are ten men, it is not permissible. There was an incident, and they brought her out to be stoned with ten men in the bed. Rav Yosef said: Know that if ten people are gathered and steal a Torah scroll, it is not covered by the obligation to return lost item.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: מוֹסְרִין לוֹ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ. תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים – אֵין, אִינָשֵׁי דְּעָלְמָא – לָא? שָׁאנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים דְּיָדְעִי
human_translation: we say supports him: they provide him with two Torah scholars lest he engage in sexual intercourse with her along the way, Torah scholars, yes; Regular men, no; Torah scholars are different, in that they know
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Nay, he assists him: they should appoint two Torah scholars to accompany him, lest he come upon her on the way. Torah scholars - are they not people of the world? The difference is that Torah scholars are knowledgeable."

hebrew_text: לְאַתְרוֹיֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: to warn him
llm_translation: For the purpose of finding in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בָּעִיר, אֲבָל בַּדֶּרֶךְ – עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה, שֶׁמָּא יִצְטָרֵךְ אֶחָד מֵהֶם לְהַשְׁתִּין, וְנִמְצָא אֶחָד מִתְיַיחֵד עִם הָעֶרְוָה. נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: מוֹסְרִים לוֹ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ. תְּרֵי וְאִיהוּ, הָא תְּלָתָא! הָתָם כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנִיהְווֹ עֲלֵיהּ סָהֲדִי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: taught only in a city, but on the road unless there are three. Perhaps one of them will need to urinate and it will turn out that one will be secluded with a woman forbidden to him. we say supports him: They provide him with two Torah scholars lest he engage in sexual intercourse with her along the way? He and two are three, there, in order that they should witnesses about him,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They only did not differentiate in a city, but on the road - until there are three, lest one of them need to urinate, and one of them will be alone with the uncovered. It was said that they assist him: They should appoint two Torah scholars with him, lest someone approach her on the road. Two and he, that makes three! There, how do they judge witnesses against him.

hebrew_text: רַב וְרַב יְהוּדָה הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי בְּאוֹרְחָא, הֲוָה קָאָזְלָא הַהִיא אִתְּתָא קַמַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב יְהוּדָה: דַּל כַּרְעָיךְ מִקַּמֵּי גֵיהִנָּם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר בִּכְשֵׁרִים שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי יֵימַר דְּבִכְשֵׁרִים כְּגוֹן אֲנָא וְאַתְּ? אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן מַאי? כְּגוֹן רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפֵּי וַחֲבֵירָיו.
human_translation: Rav and Rav Yehuda were walking along the way, a certain woman was walking ahead of them. Rav said to Rav Yehuda: Raise your feet away from Gehenna said to him: But wasn’t it Master, who said that permitted of fit said to him: Who says to fit such as you and me? Rather, such as whom? Such as Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi and his colleagues,
llm_translation: Rav and Rav Yehuda were walking on the road, and that woman was walking in front of them. Rav said to Rav Yehuda: "Your foot is poor before Gehinnom." He said to him: "But is it not the Master who said that in matters of kashrut, your judgment is good?" He said to him: "Who can say that in matters of kashrut, you and I are equal? Rather, who is like you? Like Rabbi Chanina bar Pappai and his colleagues."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מַלְקִין עַל יִיחוּד, וְאֵין אוֹסְרִין עַל הַיִּיחוּד. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּיִיחוּד פְּנוּיָה, אֲבָל בְּיִיחוּד דְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ – לָא, שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא מוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל בָּנֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav says: flogs due to secluded is not forbidden due to secluded, Rav Ashi says: We stated due to secluded only an unmarried but for secluded a married woman, not so that there should not be rumors spread concerning her children.
llm_translation: Rav said: One is lashed for yichud, but they do not prohibit yichud. Rav Ashe said: We only said this regarding yichud penuyah, but regarding yichud de'eshet ish - no, so that she does not bring disgrace upon her children.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא מַלְקֵי וּמַכְרֵיז. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן מִפַּרְהַטְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מָר נָמֵי לַילְקֵי וְלַכְרֵיז! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא דְּשָׁמַע בְּהָא וְלָא שָׁמַע בְּהָא.
human_translation: Mar Zutra would flog and he would proclaim Rav Naḥman from Parhatya said to Rav Ashi: Let the Master also flog and proclaim said to him: there are those who hear about this, and do not hear about that,
llm_translation: Master Zutra would announce and proclaim. Rav Nachman said to Rav Ashi: Master, let him announce and proclaim! He said to him: There are some who listen to this one and do not listen to that one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מַלְקִין עַל לֹא טוֹבָה הַשְּׁמוּעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל בָּנָי כִּי לוֹא טוֹבָה הַשְּׁמֻעָה״. מָר זוּטְרָא מוֹתֵיב לֵהּ אַפְסֵירָה עַל כַּתְפֵּיהּ וּמַקְרֵי לֵיהּ: ״אַל בָּנָי״
human_translation: Rav says: flogs due to a bad rumor, As it is stated: “No, my sons, for it is no good report” Mar Zutra he would place bridle on shoulders and recite before him “No, my sons,
llm_translation: Rav said: One is lashed for a bad report, as it is stated: "Do not listen to a bad report" (Exodus 23:1). Mar Zutra challenges him: He places a bandage on his shoulder and reads to him: "Do not listen, my son."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: בַּעְלָהּ בָּעִיר – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: פֶּתַח פָּתוּחַ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד. רַב בִּיבִי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב יוֹסֵף. בָּתַר דִּכְרַךְ רִיפְתָּא אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׁקוּלוּ דַּרְגָּא מִתּוּתֵי בִּיבִי. וְהָא אָמַר רַבָּה: בַּעְלָהּ בָּעִיר – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד! שָׁאנֵי רַב בִּיבִי דְּשׁוֹשְׁבִינְתֵּיהּ הֲוַאי וְגָיְיסָא בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba says: husband is in town, there is no concern due to secluded Rav Yosef says: an open entrance to the public domain there is no concern due to secluded. Rav Beivai arrived at Rav Yosef’s house. After he wrapped bread, said to Remove the ladder from beneath Beivai, But doesn’t Rabba say: her husband is in town, there is no concern due to secluded Rav Beivai is different, since was his friend and she was familiar with him,
llm_translation: Rabba said: If her husband is in the city - we are not concerned about seclusion. Rav Yosef said: If the door is open to the public domain - we are not concerned about seclusion. Rav Bibi entered the house of Rav Yosef. After he sat down, he said to them: Take a step back, Bibi's buttocks. But didn't Rabba say: If her husband is in the city - we are not concerned about seclusion! The case of Rav Bibi is different because he is impudent and bold in his actions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אֲנָשִׁים מִבַּחוּץ וְנָשִׁים מִבִּפְנִים – אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד. אֲנָשִׁים מִבִּפְנִים וְנָשִׁים מִבַּחוּץ – חוֹשְׁשִׁין מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: men on the outside, and the women in the inside, there is no concern due to secluded. men in the inside and women on the outside, there is a concern due to secluded,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: Men from outside and women from inside - we are not concerned about yichud. Men from inside and women from outside - we are concerned about yichud.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא אִיפְּכָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא הָכִי וְתָנָא מַתְנִיתָא אִיפְּכָא, אֲנָא נַעֲבֵיד לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: The opposite was taught in a baraita , Abaye said: Now that Rav Kahana has said this and a baraita teaches the opposite, we shall act stringently
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: reversed. Abaye said: now that Rav Kahana said this way and the Mishnah taught reversed, I will act stringently.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי דָּיַיר גּוּלְפֵי. רָבָא דָּיַיר קְנֵה. אָמַר אָבִין: סְקָבָא דְשַׁתָּא רִיגְלָא.
human_translation: Abaye arrange rows pitchers Rava arrange rows reeds Avin said: The wound [ sakva ], of the year the Festival,
llm_translation: Abbaye lives in Gufei. Rava lives in Kenah. Avin said: The footstool of the drinking house is a leg.

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ שְׁבוּיָיתָא דַּאֲתַאי לִנְהַרְדְּעָא. אַסְּקִינְהוּ לְבֵי רַב עַמְרָם חֲסִידָא, אַשְׁקוּלוּ דַּרְגָּא מִקַּמַּיְיהוּ. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא חָלְפָה חֲדָא מִנַּיְיהוּ נְפַל נְהוֹרָא בְּאִיפּוּמָּא. שַׁקְלֵיהּ רַב עַמְרָם לְדַרְגָּא דְּלָא הֲווֹ יָכְלִין בֵּי עַשְׂרָה לְמִדְלְיֵיהּ, דַּלְיֵיהּ לְחוֹדֵיהּ, סָלֵיק וְאָזֵיל.
human_translation: Those captive who were brought to Neharde’a, were brought up to the house of Rav Amram the Pious. They removed the ladder from before them When one of them passed a light shone in the aperture Rav Amram grabbed a ladder that ten together could not lift, lifted it on his own began climbing.
llm_translation: The case of the prisoner who came to Nahardea. They brought him to the house of Rav Amram the Hasid, they examined his case before them. While they were discussing, one of them passed in front of them, he fell into the river by accident. Rav Amram took a ladder that could not be climbed by less than ten people, he climbed it, descended, and left.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לְפַלְגָא [דְּ]דַרְגָּא אִיפְּשַׁח, רְמָא קָלָא: נוּרָא בֵּי עַמְרָם! אֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: כַּסֵּיפְתִּינַן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מוּטָב תִּיכַּסְפוּ בֵּי עַמְרָם בְּעָלְמָא הָדֵין וְלָא תִּיכַּסְפוּ מִינֵּיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. אַשְׁבְּעֵיהּ דְּיִנְפַּק מִינֵּיהּ, נְפַק מִינֵּיהּ כִּי עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי, דְּאַתְּ נוּרָא וַאֲנָא בִּישְׂרָא, וַאֲנָא עֲדִיפְנָא מִינָּךְ.
human_translation: When he was halfway the ladder, he strengthened raised his voice, a fire in the house of Amram. the Sages came They said to him: You have embarrassed us, said to them: It is better that you be shamed in Amram’s house in this world, and not be ashamed of him in the World-to-Come. He took an oath that should emerge from him, and similar to a pillar of fire emerged from him. He said to See, as you are fire and I am flesh, and I am superior to you,
llm_translation: When he reached the halfway point of the rung, he saw a bright light and exclaimed, "The fire of the house of Amram!" The sages came to him and said, "We have extinguished it." He said to them, "It is better that the house of Amram be extinguished in this world, rather than you be extinguished from the world to come." When they swore to him that they would depart from him, he departed from them like a pillar of fire. He said to them, "See, you are fire and I am flesh, and I am more precious than you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הֲוָה מִתְלוֹצֵץ בְּעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה. יוֹמָא חַד אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ שָׂטָן כְּאִיתְּתָא בְּהָךְ גִּיסָא דְנַהֲרָא, לָא הֲוָה מַבָּרָא – נְקַט מִצְרָא וְקָא עָבַר. כִּי מְטָא פַּלְגָא מִצְרָא שַׁבְקֵיהּ, אָמַר: אִי לָאו דְּקָא מַכְרְזִי בִּרְקִיעָא ״הִזָּהֲרוּ בְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְתוֹרָתוֹ״ שַׁוֵּיתֵיהּ לִדְמָךְ תַּרְתֵּי מָעֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir would ridicule transgressors One day, Satan appeared to him as a woman on the other side of the river. there was no ferry he took hold of a rope bridge and crossed When he reached halfway the rope bridge, left him and said Were it not for they proclaim about you in heaven: Be careful with regard to Rabbi Meir and his Torah, I would have made your blood like two ma’a ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir used to rebuke those who transgress. One day Satan appeared to him like a poor man at the bank of the river, and he was not created - he took hold of his cloak and crossed. When he reached the other side of the river, he left him. He said: If they are not proclaiming in the sky, "Beware of Rabbi Meir and his Torah," let two of his ribs be broken.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הֲוָה מִתְלוֹצֵץ בְּעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה. יוֹמָא חַד אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ שָׂטָן כְּאִיתְּתָא בְּרֵישׁ דִּיקְלָא. נַקְטֵיהּ לְדִיקְלָא וְקָסָלֵיק וְאָזֵיל. כִּי מְטָא לְפַלְגֵיהּ דְּדִיקְלָא שַׁבְקֵיהּ, אָמַר: אִי לָאו דְּמַכְרְזִי בִּרְקִיעָא ״הִזָּהֲרוּ בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְתוֹרָתוֹ״ שַׁוֵּיתֵיהּ לִדְמָךְ תַּרְתֵּי מָעֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva would ridicule transgressors. One day, Satan appeared to him as a woman at the top of a palm tree. grabbed hold of the palm tree and began climbing. When he was halfway up the palm tree, left him and said Were it not for they proclaim about you in heaven: Be careful with regard to Rabbi Akiva and his Torah, I would have made your blood like two ma’a .
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva used to mock sinners. One day, Satan appeared to him as a poor man at the top of a palm tree. He climbed up the tree, causing the tree to shake, and then descended. When he reached the halfway point of the tree, he let go, saying: "If not for the proclamation in the heavens, 'Beware of Rabbi Akiva and his Torah,' I would have killed you."

hebrew_text: פְּלֵימוֹ הֲוָה רְגִיל לְמֵימַר כׇּל יוֹמָא ״גִּירָא בְּעֵינֵיהּ דְּשָׂטָן״. יוֹמָא חַד מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי הֲוָה. אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּעַנְיָא. אֲתָא קְרָא אַבָּבָא, אַפִּיקוּ לֵיהּ רִיפְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יוֹמָא כִּי הָאִידָּנָא כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא גַּוַּאי וַאֲנָא אַבָּרַאי? עַיְּילֵיהּ וְקָרִיבוּ לֵיהּ רִיפְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יוֹמָא כִּי הָאִידָּנָא כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַתַּכָּא וַאֲנָא לְחוֹדַאי? אַתְיוּהּ אוֹתְבוּהּ אַתַּכָּא. הֲוָה יָתֵיב מְלָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ שִׁיחְנָא וְכִיבֵי (עֲלֵיהּ) וַהֲוָה קָעָבֵיד בֵּיהּ מִילֵּי דִּמְאִיס. אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Peleimu had the habit to say every day: An arrow in the eye of Satan, One day, it was the eve of Yom Kippur, appeared to him as a pauper came and called to the door, brought out bread to him. said to him: On a day like today, everyone is inside and I outside brought him inside and gave him bread. He said to him: On a day like today, everyone at the table, and I by myself? They brought him and sat him at the table. He was sitting covered himself with boils and pus, and he was doing repulsive things said to
llm_translation: Pleimo used to say every day, "A piece of Satan in her eyes." One day, the eve of Yom Kippur, he was sitting. He appeared to him like a poor person. A heavenly voice came out and said to him, "Pleimo, when the world is full of troubles, and I am your Creator?" They brought him a dish. He said to him, "Pleimo, when the world is full of troubles, are you here and I am alone?" They brought him a dish. He was sitting, filled with anxiety, and tears were falling from him, and he was covering himself with sackcloth, and he was fasting from speaking. He said to him:

hebrew_text: תִּיב שַׁפִּיר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַבוּ לִי כָּסָא, יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ כָּסָא. אַכְמַר שְׁדָא בֵּיהּ כִּיחוֹ. נְחַרוּ בֵּיהּ. שְׁקָא וּמִית. שְׁמַעוּ דַּהֲווֹ קָאָמְרִי: פְּלֵימוֹ קְטַל גַּבְרָא! פְּלֵימוֹ קְטַל גַּבְרָא! עֲרַק וּטְשָׁא נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא. אָזֵיל בָּתְרֵיהּ, נְפַל קַמֵּיהּ. כִּי דְּחַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה מִצְטַעַר גַּלִּי לֵיהּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא אָמְרַתְּ הָכִי? וְאֶלָּא הֵיכִי אֵימָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵימָא מָר ״רַחֲמָנָא נִגְעַר בֵּיהּ בְּשָׂטָן״.
human_translation: Sit properly said to him: Give me a cup. They gave him a cup. He coughed up his phlegm and spat it into They berated him sink and die. They heard saying: Peleimu killed a man! Peleimu killed a man! fled and hid himself in the bathroom. followed him fell before him. Upon seeing that was suffering, he revealed himself to him. said to him: What is the reason that you spoke this way, But what then should I say? said to him: Let the Master, say: the Merciful One rebuke the Satan.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Good morning. He said to him: 'Bring me a chair,' they brought him a chair. A black serpent was in it. They bit him. He screamed and died. They heard that they were saying: 'Fleimo killed a man! Fleimo killed a man!' He ran and threw himself into the toilet. He went after him, fell before him. When he saw that he was in pain, he revealed his soul to him. He said to him: 'Why did you say this?' But rather, how should I say it? He said to him: 'Say, Master, "May the Merciful One rebuke the Satan in him."'" This is the word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text provided.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי הֲוָה רְגִיל כׇּל עִידָּן דַּהֲוָה נָפֵל לְאַפֵּיהּ הֲוָה אָמַר: ״הָרַחֲמָן יַצִּילֵנוּ מִיֵּצֶר הָרָע״. יוֹמָא חַד (שְׁמַעְתִּינְהוּ) [שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ] דְּבֵיתְהוּ, אֲמַרָה: מִכְּדֵי הָא כַּמָּה שְׁנֵי דְּפָרֵישׁ לֵיהּ מִינַּאי, מַאי טַעְמָא קָאָמַר הָכִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ashi was accustomed to say, whenever he would fall on his face May the Merciful One save us from the evil inclination. One day his wife heard him She said: After all, it has been several years since he has withdrawn from me What is the reason that he says this
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Ashe was accustomed, every time he would fall on his face, to say: "May the Merciful One deliver us from the evil inclination." One day, his wife heard him, and she said: "Since he separates from me so often, what reason is he saying this?"

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חֲדָא הֲוָה קָא גָרֵיס בְּגִינְּתֵיהּ. קַשִּׁטָה נַפְשַׁהּ, חָלְפָה וְתָנְיָיה קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: מַאן אַתְּ? אֲמַרָה: אֲנָא חָרוּתָא דַּהֲדַרִי מִיּוֹמָא. תַּבְעַהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי נִיהֲלַי לְהָךְ רוּמָּנָא דְּרֵישׁ צוּצִיתָא. שְׁוַור, אֲזַל אַתְיֵיהּ נִיהֲלַהּ.
human_translation: One day, he was studying in his garden, she adorned herself and repeatedly walked past him. He said: Who are you? She said: I am Ḥaruta, returning from my day He propositioned her. She said to him: Give me that pomegranate from the top of the tree He leapt up, went, brought it to her,
llm_translation: One day he was walking in his garden. He saw a snake, he passed by it and it bit him. He said to her: Who are you? She said: I am the daughter of the beautiful one from the day. He sought to kill her. She said to him: I brought a necklace of the head of a male serpent. A bull came and killed her.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ הֲוָה קָא שָׁגְרָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ תַּנּוּרָא, סָלֵיק וְקָא יָתֵיב בְּגַוֵּיהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לַהּ: הָכִי וְהָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הֲוַאי. לָא אַשְׁגַּח בַּהּ, עַד דִּיהַבָה לֵיהּ סִימָנֵי. אָמַר לַהּ: אֲנָא מִיהָא לְאִיסּוּרָא אִיכַּוַּונִי. כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק הָיָה מִתְעַנֶּה עַד שֶׁמֵּת בְּאוֹתָהּ מִיתָה.
human_translation: When he came home, his wife was lighting oven. He went and sat inside it. She said to him: What is this? He said to her: Such and such an incident She said to him: It was I. He paid no attention to her, until she gave him signs He said to her: I, in any event, intended to transgress. All the days of that righteous man he would fast until he died by that death
llm_translation: When he came to his house, the oven of his house was burning, he went up and sat on his bed. She said to him: What is this? He said to her: This and this was the matter. She said to him: I am a pregnant woman. He did not pay attention to her until she gave him signs. He said to her: I am worthy of being punished. All his days, that righteous one would afflict himself until he died that death.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִישָׁהּ הֲפֵרָם וַה׳ יִסְלַח לָהּ״, בַּמָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּדְרָה בְּנָזִיר, וְשָׁמַע בַּעְלָהּ וְהֵפֵר לָהּ, וְהִיא לֹא יָדְעָה שֶׁהֵפֵר לָהּ בַּעְלָהּ, וְהָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה יַיִן וּמִטַּמְּאָה לְמֵתִים.
human_translation: As it is taught “Her husband has made them null; and the Lord will forgive her” With regard to what is the verse speaking? to a woman who vowed be a nazirite, and her husband heard and nullified her And she did not know that her husband had nullified her and she drank wine and contracted impurity from a corpse,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Her husband annulled them, and the Lord will forgive her." In what case is the Scripture speaking? In the case of a woman who took a vow as a Nazirite, and her husband heard and annulled it for her, and she did not know that her husband had annulled it for her, and she drank wine and became impure through contact with the dead.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כִּי הֲוָה מָטֵי לְהַאי פְּסוּקָא הֲוָה בָּכֵי, אָמַר: וּמָה מִי שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לֶאֱכוֹל בְּשַׂר חֲזִיר וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ בְּשַׂר טָלֶה, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: צְרִיכָה כַּפָּרָה וּסְלִיחָה, מִי שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לֶאֱכוֹל בְּשַׂר חֲזִיר וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ בְּשַׂר חֲזִיר – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: When Rabbi Akiva came to this verse he would cry. He said: And if one who intended to eat pork, and lamb came up in his hand, the Torah says: She requires atonement and forgiveness, all the more so one who intended to eat pork and pork came up in his hand
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, when he would come to this verse, would cry. He said: "And what about someone who intends to eat pork but ends up with lamb in his hand, the Torah says: It requires atonement and forgiveness. But someone who intends to eat pork and ends up with pork in his hand - how much more so."

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״וְלֹא יָדַע וְאָשֵׁם וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״. כְּשֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַגִּיעַ לְפָסוּק זֶה הָיָה בּוֹכֶה: וּמָה מִי שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לֶאֱכוֹל שׁוּמָּן וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ חֵלֶב – אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״וְלֹא יָדַע וְאָשֵׁם וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״, מִי שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לֶאֱכוֹל חֵלֶב וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ חֵלֶב – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״וְלֹא יָדַע וְאָשֵׁם וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״ – עַל דָּבָר זֶה יִדְווּ כׇּל הַדּוֹוִים.
human_translation: In a similar manner, you say “Though he know it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity” When Rabbi Akiva came to this verse he would cry. And if one who intended to eat fat, and fat came up in his hand, the Torah states: “Though he know it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity,” all the more so one who intended to eat fat and fat came up in his hand. Isi ben Yehuda says “Though he know it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity”: With regard to this matter all sufferers shall grieve,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As an example in this matter you say, 'And he did not know, and he is guilty, and he shall bear his iniquity.' When Rabbi Akiva reached this verse, he would cry. And what about one who intended to eat fat and ended up with the fat in his hand? The Torah said: 'And he did not know, and he is guilty, and he shall bear his iniquity.' How much more so if one intended to eat fat and ended up with the fat in his hand – all the more so. Issi ben Yehuda says: 'And he did not know, and he is guilty, and he shall bear his iniquity' – concerning this matter all those who are liable will be liable."

hebrew_text: מִתְיַיחֵד אָדָם עִם אִמּוֹ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מִתְיַיחֵד אָדָם עִם אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְדָר עִם אִמּוֹ וְעִם בִּתּוֹ. כִּי אַמְרִ[יתַ]הּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר: אָסוּר לְהִתְיַיחֵד עִם כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ עִם בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: a man may be secluded with his mother. Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: A man may be secluded with his sister, and live with his mother or with his daughter When he said this before Shmuel, said: It is prohibited to be secluded with all those with whom relations are forbidden by the Torah, and even with an animal,
llm_translation: When does a person become closely associated with his mother? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: When a person becomes closely associated with his sister, and lives with his mother and his daughter. For when Shmuel's maidservant said it before him, he said: It is forbidden to become closely associated with any of the forbidden relationships in the Torah, even with an animal.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מִתְיַיחֵד אָדָם עִם אִמּוֹ וְעִם בִּתּוֹ וְיָשֵׁן עִמָּהֶם בְּקֵירוּב בָּשָׂר, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל! אָמַר לָךְ שְׁמוּאֵל: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: אֲחוֹתוֹ וַחֲמוֹתוֹ וּשְׁאָר כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אֵין מִתְיַיחֵד עִמָּהֶם אֶלָּא בְּעֵדִים. בְּעֵדִים – אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים – לָא!
human_translation: We learned A man may be secluded with his mother, and with his daughter, and sleep alongside them with bodily contact, and a conclusive refutation of Shmuel. Shmuel said to you: And according to your reasoning, that which is taught his sister, and his mother-in-law, and all those with whom relations are forbidden, one may be secluded with them only of witnesses, of witnesses, yes; without of witnesses, no.
llm_translation: We learned: When a man is intimate with his mother and his daughter, and sleeps with them in the same bed, and the excellence of Samuel! Samuel said to you: And to your palate, this that was taught: His sister, his mother-in-law, and all other forbidden relationships in the Torah, one may only be intimate with them with witnesses. With witnesses - no, without witnesses - no!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הִזָּהֲרוּ בִּי מִפְּנֵי בִּתִּי. אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: הִזָּהֲרוּ בִּי מִפְּנֵי כַּלָּתִי. לִיגְלֵג עָלָיו אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִים עַד שֶׁנִּכְשַׁל אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, is tanna’im As it is taught Rabbi Meir said: Be careful with me because of my daughter, Rabbi Tarfon said: Be careful with me because of my daughter-in-law. A certain student mocked him Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel: Not many days passed until that student stumbled with his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: Rather, it is a teaching. As it was taught: Rabbi Meir said, "Be cautious with me because of my daughter." Rabbi Tarfon said, "Be cautious with me because of my daughter-in-law." A certain student mocked him. Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel: "There were not many days until that student stumbled because of his mother-in-law."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ עִם בְּהֵמָה אַבָּיֵי מְכַלֵּ[י] לֵיהּ מִכּוּלֵּהּ דַּבְרָא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מְעַבַּר לֵיהּ מִצְרָא. רַב חָנָן מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אִיקְּלַע לְרַב כָּהֲנָא לְפוּם נַהֲרָא. חַזְיֵיהּ דְּיָתֵיב וְקָא גָרֵס וְקָיְימָא בְּהֵמָה קַמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר אֲפִילּוּ עִם בְּהֵמָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: even with an animal. Abaye removed from the entire field Rav Sheshet transferred of the fence. Rav Ḥanan from Neharde’a happened to Rav Kahana in Pum Nahara. He saw that was sitting and studying, and an animal was standing before him. said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold even with an animal? said to him: It not my mind
llm_translation: Even with an animal, Abbaye exempts him from all of creation. Rav Sheshet passes through a narrow place. Rav Hanan from Nehardea encountered Rav Kahana by the river. He saw him sitting and reading, and a live animal was standing before him. He said to him: Does the Master not hold that even with an animal? He said to him: I do not know.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִתְיַיחֵד אָדָם עִם שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת וְעִם שְׁתֵּי צָרוֹת, עִם אִשָּׁה וַחֲמוֹתָהּ, עִם אִשָּׁה וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ, עִם אִשָּׁה וְתִינוֹקֶת שֶׁיּוֹדַעַת טַעַם בִּיאָה, וְאֵין מוֹסֶרֶת עַצְמָהּ לְבִיאָה.
human_translation: Rava says: A man may be secluded with two sisters-in-law and with two rival wives, with a woman and her mother-in-law; with a woman and her husband’s daughter. with a woman and a girl who knows the meaning of sexual intercourse, but she does not submit herself to intercourse,
llm_translation: Rava said: When a man engages with two yevamot and with two co-wives, with a woman and her mother-in-law, with a woman and her husband's daughter, with a woman and a nursing infant who knows the taste of intercourse, and she does not restrain herself from intercourse.

hebrew_text: הִגְדִּילוּ זֶה יָשֵׁן בִּכְסוּתוֹ וְכוּ׳. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר רַב (עֻזָּא) [עַוָּא] אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: תִּינוֹקֶת בַּת תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, תִּינוֹק בֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: תִּינוֹקֶת בַּת שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד, תִּינוֹק בֶּן שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְזֶה וְזֶה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיוּ ״שָׁדַיִם נָכֹנוּ וּשְׂעָרֵךְ צִמֵּחַ״.
human_translation: when have grown up, this one sleeps in his garment And how Rav Adda bar Rav Azza says Rav Asi says: A girl age nine years and one day; a boy age twelve years and one day. There are who say: A girl age twelve years and one day; a boy age thirteen and one day. And this and that, until “Your breasts were fashioned, and your hair was grown”
llm_translation: "They enlarged this old one in his garment, etc." "And how much? Rav Adda bar Rav (Uzza) Avva said Rav Assi: A girl child of nine years and one day, a boy child of twelve years and one day. Some say: A girl child of twelve years and one day, a boy child of thirteen years and one day, and both of these are for 'your breasts are fashioned, and your hair has grown.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵינָהּ בּוֹשָׁה לַעֲמוֹד לְפָנָיו עֲרוּמָּה, אֲבָל בּוֹשָׁה לַעֲמוֹד לְפָנָיו עֲרוּמָּה – אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא – יֵצֶר אַלְבְּשַׁהּ.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa says Rav Ḥisda says: They taught only if she is not ashamed to stand naked before him, but ashamed to stand naked before him, it is prohibited What is the reason? inclination has a hold upon her,
llm_translation: Rafhram son of Papa said, Rav Hisda said: They only taught that it is not shameful to stand naked before Him, but if it is shameful to stand naked before Him - it is forbidden. What is the reason? The evil inclination has clothed her.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר אַבָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב חִסְדָּא חַתְנֵיהּ. שַׁקְלֵיהּ לְבַת בְּרַתֵּיה אוֹתְבַהּ בְּכַנְפֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר דְּמִקַּדְּשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲבַרְתְּ לָךְ אַדְּרַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ אֶת בִּתּוֹ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה, עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל וְתֹאמַר: ״בִּפְלוֹנִי אֲנִי רוֹצָה״. מָר נָמֵי עֲבַר לֵיהּ אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁים בְּאִשָּׁה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כְּאִידַּךְ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לִי, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Abba arrived at the house of Rav Ḥisda, his son-in-law. He took his daughter’s daughter and placed her on his lap. said to him: Doesn’t the Master think that she betrothed? said to him: you have transgressed of Rav, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say Rabbi Elazar: It is prohibited for a man to betroth his daughter when she is a minor, until she grows up and says: I want so-and-so, The Master has likewise transgressed of Shmuel. As Shmuel says: One may not make use of a woman, He said to him: I hold in accordance with another of Shmuel, as Shmuel says:
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Abba entered the house of Rav Ḥisda, his father-in-law. He took his daughter-in-law and wrapped her in his cloak. He said to him: Does the Master not hold that she is consecrated? He said to him: You have overstepped, my father-in-law. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say it was Rabbi Elazar: It is forbidden for a man to betroth his daughter when she is a minor until she grows up and says, "I want to marry so-and-so." Mar Naḥmei overheard him, Adishmuel, who said: One should not engage in marital relations with a woman. He said to him: I, like your statement, Shmuel, agree, for Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: All are for the sake of Heaven.
llm_translation: All for the sake of Heaven.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם רַוּוֹק סוֹפְרִים. וְלֹא תְּלַמֵּד אִשָּׁה סוֹפְרִים. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה לֹא יְלַמֵּד סוֹפְרִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִרְעֶה רַוּוֹק בְּהֵמָה, וְלֹא יִישְׁנוּ שְׁנֵי רַוּוֹקִין בְּטַלִּית אַחַת, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִים.
human_translation: A bachelor may not act as a teacher of children, nor may a woman act as a teacher of children. Rabbi Elazar says: Even one who does not have a wife may not act as a teacher of children. Rabbi Yehuda says: A bachelor may not herd cattle, nor may two bachelors sleep with one covering, but the Rabbis permit
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man should not teach unmarried men to be scribes. And a woman should not teach men to be scribes. Rabbi Elazar says: Even someone who does not have a wife should not teach scribes. Rabbi Yehuda says: A single man should not shepherd livestock, and two single men should not sleep under one cloak, but the sages permit it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם יָנוֹקֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְשְׁדוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל מִשְׁכַּב זְכוּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה! אֶלָּא: רַוּוֹק – מִשּׁוּם אִמָּהָתָא דְיָנוֹקֵי. אִשָּׁה – מִשּׁוּם אֲבָהָתָא דְיָנוֹקֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason If we say due to the children but isn’t it taught They said to Rabbi Yehuda: Jews are not suspected of homosexual intercourse nor of an animal. Rather, A bachelor due to the mothers of the children, a woman because the fathers of the children.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Perhaps due to infants, and it was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda: The Israelites were not suspected regarding male intercourse, nor regarding intercourse with an animal! Rather, a man - due to the mother of infants. A woman - due to the father of infants.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר אַף מִי שֶׁאֵין כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה כְּלָל, אוֹ דִלְמָא בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ שְׁרוּיָה אֶצְלוֹ? תָּא שְׁמַע: אַף מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינָהּ שְׁרוּיָה אֶצְלוֹ לֹא יְלַמֵּד סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even one who does not have A dilemma was raised before one who does not have a wife at all, or perhaps in where she is not residing with him? Come hear: Even one who has but she is not residing with him may not act as a teacher of children.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even one who has none. The question was asked: Does this refer to one who has no wife at all, or perhaps to one whose wife is not living with him? Come and hear: Even one who has a wife but she is not living with him should not teach scribes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר לֹא יִרְעֶה כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְשְׁדוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל מִשְׁכַּב זְכוּר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: may not herd It is taught They said to Rabbi Yehuda: Jews are not suspected of homosexual intercourse nor of an animal.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, "He shall not graze together." It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda, "The Israelites were not suspected regarding male intercourse, nor regarding bestiality."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּל שֶׁעֲסָקָיו עִם הַנָּשִׁים לֹא יִתְיַחֵד עִם הַנָּשִׁים, וְלֹא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ אוּמָּנוּת הַנָּשִׁים. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ אוּמָּנוּת נְקִיָּה וְקַלָּה, וְיִתְפַּלֵּל לְמִי שֶׁהָעוֹשֶׁר וְהַנְּכָסִים שֶׁלּוֹ. שֶׁאֵין אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ עֲנִיּוּת וַעֲשִׁירוּת, שֶׁלֹּא עֲנִיּוּת מִן הָאוּמָּנוּת, וְלֹא עֲשִׁירוּת מִן הָאוּמָּנוּת, אֶלָּא הַכֹּל לְפִי זְכוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Anyone who has professional dealings with women may not be secluded with women. And a person may not teach his son a trade women, Rabbi Meir says: A person should always teach his son a clean and easy trade and pray to the One to Whom wealth and property belong, as there is no trade that does not include poverty and wealth, Poverty does not from a trade, nor does wealth from a trade, rather, all is in accordance with merit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anyone whose occupation involves dealings with women should not seclude himself with women, and a person should not teach his son the craft of women. Rabbi Meir says: One should always teach his son a clean and easy craft, and pray for one who has wealth and possessions. For there is no craft that does not involve poverty and wealth, not poverty separate from the craft, nor wealth separate from the craft, but everything according to his merit.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: רָאִיתָ מִיָּמֶיךָ חַיָּה וָעוֹף שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם אוּמָּנוּת? וְהֵן מִתְפַּרְנְסִין שֶׁלֹּא בְּצַעַר! וַהֲלֹא לֹא נִבְרְאוּ אֶלָּא לְשַׁמְּשֵׁנִי, וַאֲנִי נִבְרֵאתִי לְשַׁמֵּשׁ אֶת קוֹנִי, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֶתְפַּרְנֵס שֶׁלֹּא בְּצַעַר? אֶלָּא שֶׁהוֹרַעְתִּי מַעֲשַׂי, וְקִפַּחְתִּי אֶת פַּרְנָסָתִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Have you ever seen a beast or a bird that has a trade? And they earn their livelihood without anguish. But were created only to serve me, and I, was created to serve formed me. Is it not right that I should earn my livelihood without anguish? But I, have evil actions and have lost my livelihood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Have you seen from your days a wild animal or bird that have a craft? And they sustain themselves without hardship! Were they not created only to serve me, and I was created to serve my Creator, is it not just that I should sustain myself without hardship? Rather, I have spoiled my actions, and I have limited my sustenance.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא גּוּרְיָין אִישׁ צַיְידָן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אַבָּא גּוּרְיָא: לֹא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ חַמָּר, גַּמָּל, קַדָּר, סַפָּן, רוֹעֶה, וְחֶנְוָנִי – שֶׁאוּמָּנוּתָן אוּמָּנוּת לִיסְטִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: הַחַמָּרִין רוּבָּן רְשָׁעִים, וְהַגַּמָּלִין רוּבָּן כְּשֵׁרִין, הַסַּפָּנִין רוּבָּן חֲסִידִים. טוֹב שֶׁבָּרוֹפְאִים – לְגֵיהִנָּם, וְהַכָּשֵׁר שֶׁבַּטַּבָּחִים – שׁוּתָּפוֹ שֶׁל עֲמָלֵק.
human_translation: Abba Guryan of Tzadyan says in the name of Abba Gurya: A person may not teach his son a donkey driver, a camel driver, a pot maker, a sailor, a shepherd, or a storekeeper. as their trades are the trades of robbers; Rabbi Yehuda says in name: Most donkey drivers are wicked, and most camel drivers, are fit Most sailors are pious, The best of doctors is to Gehenna, and the fittest of butchers is a partner of Amalek.
llm_translation: Abba Gurion, a hunter, says in the name of Abba Guria: A person should not teach his son donkey-driving, camel-driving, blacksmithing, shipbuilding, shepherding, and shopkeeping, for their craft is the craft of deceivers. Rabbi Yehuda says in his own name: Most donkey-drivers are wicked, most camel-drivers are honest, and most blacksmiths are pious. The best of doctors will go to Gehenna, and the most qualified of butchers is a partner of Amalek.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר: מַנִּיחַ אֲנִי כׇּל אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם וְאֵינִי מְלַמֵּד אֶת בְּנִי אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁאָדָם אוֹכֵל מִשְּׂכָרָהּ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וְהַקֶּרֶן קַיֶּימֶת לוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל אוּמָּנִיּוֹת אֵינָן כֵּן. כְּשֶׁאָדָם בָּא לִידֵי חוֹלִי אוֹ לִידֵי זִקְנָה אוֹ לִידֵי יִסּוּרִין, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲסוֹק בִּמְלַאכְתּוֹ – הֲרֵי הוּא מֵת בָּרָעָב. אֲבָל הַתּוֹרָה אֵינָהּ כֵּן, אֶלָּא מְשַׁמַּרְתּוֹ מִכׇּל רַע בְּנַעֲרוּתוֹ, וְנוֹתֶנֶת לוֹ אַחֲרִית וְתִקְוָה בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: I set aside all the trades in the world, and I teach my son only Torah, as a person partakes of its reward in this world and the principal remains for him in the World-to-Come, which is not true of other professions, if a person comes to be ill, or old, or undergoes suffering, and is unable to be involved in his trade, behold, he dies in hunger. But the Torah it is not so, Rather, it preserves him from all evil in his youth, and provides him with a future and hope in his old age.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: I leave all trades in the world and do not teach my son anything except Torah, for a person eats from its reward in this world, and the principal remains for him in the world to come, but all other trades are not so. When a person comes to sickness, old age, or suffering, and he is unable to engage in his work - behold, he dies of hunger. But Torah is not so, rather it guards him from all evil in his youth, and gives him hope and a future in his old age.

hebrew_text: בְּנַעֲרוּתוֹ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״וְקוֹיֵ ה׳ יַחֲלִיפוּ כֹחַ״. בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״עוֹד יְנוּבוּן בְּשֵׂיבָה״, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר בְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ: ״וְאַבְרָהָם זָקֵן... וַה׳ בֵּרַךְ אֶת אַבְרָהָם בַּכֹּל״ – מָצִינוּ שֶׁעָשָׂה אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ אֶת כָּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵקֶב אֲשֶׁר שָׁמַע אַבְרָהָם בְּקֹלִי וַיִּשְׁמֹר מִשְׁמַרְתִּי מִצְוֹתַי חֻקּוֹתַי וְתוֹרֹתָי״
human_translation: With regard to his youth, what does it say “But they that wait for the Lord shall renew their strength” With regard to his old age, what does it say? “They shall still bring forth fruit in old age” and it likewise states with regard to Abraham our forefather: “And Abraham was old, and the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things” We found that Abraham our forefather fulfilled the entire Torah before it was given, as it is stated: “Because that Abraham listened to My voice, and kept My charge, My commandments, My statutes, and My laws”
llm_translation: In his youth, what does he say? "They shall exchange strength." In his old age, what does he say? "They shall still bear fruit in old age," and so it says regarding our father Abraham: "And Abraham was old... and the Lord blessed Abraham with everything" - we find that our father Abraham fulfilled the entire Torah before it was given, as it says: "Because Abraham obeyed My voice, and kept My charge, My commandments, My statutes, and My laws."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל שֶׁעֲסָקָיו עִם הַנָּשִׁים – סוֹרוֹ רַע, כְּגוֹן הַצּוֹרְפִים, וְהַסָּרֵיקִים, וְהַנָּקוֹרוֹת, וְהָרוֹכְלִין, וְהַגַּרְדִּיִּים, וְהַסַּפָּרִים וְהַכּוֹבְסִים, וְהַגָּרָע, וְהַבַּלָּן, וְהַבּוּרְסְקִי – אֵין מַעֲמִידִים מֵהֶם לֹא מֶלֶךְ וְלֹא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָא מִשּׁוּם דִּפְסִילִי, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּזִיל אוּמָּנוּתַיְהוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: anyone who has professional dealings with women, his practice bad, for example, the smiths, and the carders, and the fixers of hand mills and the peddlers and the weavers [ gardiyyim ], and the barbers, and the launderers, and the bloodletter, and the bathhouse attendant [ ballan ], and the tanner [ burseki ]. One may not appoint from neither a king nor a High Priest. What is the reason not because they are disqualified, but because their trades are demeaning,
llm_translation: The sages taught: Anyone whose dealings are with women - turn away from him, such as goldsmiths, and barbers, and peddlers, and merchants, and weavers, and scribes, and launderers, and tax collectors, and bakers, and bathhouse attendants - neither a king nor a high priest should be appointed from among them. What is the reason? Not because they are disqualified, but because they are involved in craftiness.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּגָרָע: מְהַלֵּךְ עַל צִידּוֹ, וְרוּחוֹ גַּסָּה, וְנִתְלֶה וְיוֹשֵׁב, וְעֵינוֹ צָרָה, וְעֵינוֹ רָעָה, אוֹכֵל הַרְבֵּה וּמוֹצִיא קִימְעָא, וְחָשׁוּד עַל הָעֲרָיוֹת וְעַל הַגָּזֵל וְעַל שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Ten things were stated with regard to a bloodletter: He walks on his side, and his spirit is arrogant; and he leans and sits, and he is stingy; and he is envious; he eats much and discharges a little; and he is suspected of those with whom relations are forbidden, and of stealing, and of bloodshed
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Ten things were said about a person with a defect: one who walks on his side, and his spirit is haughty, and he is hanging and sitting, and his eye is narrow, and his eye is evil, one who eats much and excretes little, and is suspected of sexual immorality, theft, and shedding blood.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: לְעוֹלָם יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ אוּמָּנוּת נְקִיָּה וְקַלָּה. מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught: A person should always teach his son a clean and easy trade. What is Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: A person should always teach his son a clean and easy trade. What is it? Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: מַחְטָא דְתַלְמִיּוּתָא.
human_translation: Needlework for embroidery
llm_translation: The sin of Talmudic scholars.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁעוֹבֶרֶת מִן הָעוֹלָם. אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁרוֹאֶה אֶת הוֹרָיו בְּאוּמָּנוּת מְעוּלָּה, אוֹי לוֹ לְמִי שֶׁרוֹאֶה אֶת הוֹרָיו בְּאוּמָּנוּת פְּגוּמָה. אִי אֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא בַּסָּם וּבְלֹא בּוּרְסְקִי. אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁאוּמָּנוּתוֹ בַּסָּם, וְאוֹי לוֹ [לְ]מִי שֶׁאוּמָּנוּתוֹ בּוּרְסְקִי. אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעוֹלָם בְּלֹא זְכָרִים וּבְלֹא נְקֵבוֹת, אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁבָּנָיו זְכָרִים וְאוֹי לוֹ לְמִי שֶׁבָּנָיו נְקֵיבוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: There is no trade that disappears from the world, fortunate is he who sees his parents in an elevated trade; woe is he who sees his parents in a lowly trade it is impossible for the world without a perfumer and without a tanner. Fortunate is he whose trade is a perfumer, and woe is he whose trade is a tanner, it is impossible for the world without males and without females, fortunate is he whose children are males, and woe is he whose children are females.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says, "There is no craft that passes from the world." Fortunate is one who sees his teachers in a complete craft, woe to one who sees his teachers in a defective craft. It is impossible for the world to exist without perfumers and without tanners. Fortunate is one whose craft is in perfumery, and woe to one whose craft is in tanning. It is impossible for the world to exist without males and without females. Fortunate is one whose children are males, and woe to one whose children are females.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם יְלַמֵּד אָדָם לִבְנוֹ אוּמָּנוּת נְקִיָּה וְקַלָּה, וִיבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים לְמִי שֶׁהָעוֹשֶׁר וְהַנְּכָסִים שֶׁלּוֹ, שֶׁאֵין עֲנִיּוּת מִן הָאוּמָּנוּת וְאֵין עֲשִׁירוּת מִן הָאוּמָּנוּת, אֶלָּא – לְמִי שֶׁהָעוֹשֶׁר שֶׁלּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִי הַכֶּסֶף וְלִי הַזָּהָב נְאֻם ה׳ צְבָאוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: A person should always teach his son a clean and easy trade, and he should request compassion from the One to Whom wealth and property belong, as poverty not from a trade, nor wealth from a trade; rather, from the One to Whom wealth belongs, as it is stated: “Mine is the silver, and Mine the gold, says the Lord of hosts”
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Always a person should teach his son a clean and easy craft, and seek mercy for one whose wealth and possessions are his, for poverty does not come from the craft and wealth does not come from the craft, but it comes for one whose wealth it is, as it is said: "Mine is the silver and mine is the gold, says the Lord of Hosts."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם רָאִיתָ מִיָּמֶיךָ. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מִיָּמַי לֹא רָאִיתִי צְבִי קַיָּיץ, וַאֲרִי סַבָּל, וְשׁוּעָל חֶנְוָנִי, וְהֵם מִתְפַּרְנְסִים שֶׁלֹּא בְּצַעַר. וְהֵם לֹא נִבְרְאוּ אֶלָּא לְשַׁמְּשֵׁנִי, וַאֲנִי נִבְרֵאתִי לְשַׁמֵּשׁ אֶת קוֹנִי. מָה אֵלּוּ שֶׁלֹּא נִבְרְאוּ אֶלָּא לְשַׁמְּשֵׁנִי מִתְפַּרְנְסִים שֶׁלֹּא בְּצַעַר, וַאֲנִי שֶׁנִּבְרֵאתִי לְשַׁמֵּשׁ אֶת קוֹנִי – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֶתְפַּרְנֵס שֶׁלֹּא בְּצַעַר? אֶלָּא שֶׁהֲרֵעוֹתִי אֶת מַעֲשַׂי וְקִיפַּחְתִּי אֶת פַּרְנָסָתִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֲוֹנוֹתֵיכֶם הִטּוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Have you ever seen It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: I never saw a deer dries figs, nor a lion a porter, nor a fox a storekeeper. And they earn their livelihood without anguish. But were created only to serve me, and I, was created to serve formed me. If these, who were created only to serve me, earn their livelihood without anguish, is it not right that I, who was created to serve formed me, should earn my livelihood without anguish? But I, have evil actions and have lost my livelihood, as it is stated: “Your iniquities have turned away
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If you have seen from your days, it is taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: From my days I have not seen a deer that is fat, or a lion that is lean, or a fox that is crafty, and they sustain themselves without hardship. And they were created only to serve me, and I was created to serve my Creator. If these, who were created only to serve me, sustain themselves without hardship, is it not just that I, who was created to serve my Creator, should sustain myself without hardship? Rather, I have corrupted my deeds and diminished my sustenance, as it is stated: "Your sins have turned away."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר: מַנִּיחַ אֲנִי כׇּל אוּמָּנוּת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר: מַנִּיחַ אֲנִי כׇּל אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם וְאֵינִי מְלַמֵּד אֶת בְּנִי אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁכׇּל אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם אֵין עוֹמֶדֶת לוֹ אֶלָּא בִּימֵי יַלְדוּתוֹ, אֲבָל בִּימֵי זִקְנוּתוֹ הֲרֵי הוּא מוּטָּל בָּרָעָב. אֲבָל תּוֹרָה אֵינָהּ כֵּן – עוֹמֶדֶת לוֹ לָאָדָם בְּעֵת יַלְדוּתוֹ, וְנוֹתֶנֶת לוֹ אַחֲרִית וְתִקְוָה בְּעֵת זִקְנוּתוֹ. בְּעֵת יַלְדוּתוֹ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״וְקוֹיֵ ה׳ יַחֲלִיפוּ כֹחַ יַעֲלוּ אֵבֶר כַּנְּשָׁרִים״ בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ מַהוּ אוֹמֵר? ״עוֹד יְנוּבוּן בְּשֵׂיבָה דְּשֵׁנִים וְרַעֲנַנִּים יִהְיוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: I set aside all the trades is taught Rabbi Nehorai says: I set aside all the trades in the world, and I teach my son only Torah, as all other trades serve one only in the days of his youth, but in the days of his old age, behold, he lie in hunger. But Torah is not like this: It serves a person in the time of his youth and provides him with a future and hope in the time of his old age. With regard to the time of his youth, what does it say “But they that wait for the Lord shall renew their strength” With regard to his old age, what does it say? “They shall still bring forth fruit in old age, they shall be full of sap and richness”
llm_translation: Rabbi Nehorai says: "I leave all crafts, etc." It was taught: Rabbi Nehorai says: "I leave all crafts in the world and do not teach my son except Torah, for all crafts in the world only stand by him in his childhood, but in his old age, he will be dependent on charity. But Torah is not so – it stands by a person in his youth, and gives him hope and a future in his old age. What does he say in his youth? 'But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles.' What does he say in his old age? 'They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be full of sap and richness.'"

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִין וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת קִידּוּשִׁין
llm_translation: We will return to you with ten reasons and go up to her the tractate of Kiddushin.
